entries.title: Last Key of Robotica 3
entries.description:
### TO WIN:
* Fill your Transcode bar to upload your consciousness off-world.
* Enemies have a chance to glitch out and become your ally. They help you transcode your consciousness. Without them, you'll never make it!
* If you must, sacrifice them to assimilate (gain health) or to self-destruct, clearing wreckage blocking the field along with your foes. Be careful though, detonations that powerful can destroy potential allies!

### Controls:
* WASD style movement. Arrow keys work too.
* Q or Middle-mouse-button: (HEAL) Sacrifices a minion to heal you by assimilating with you.
* Right-Click: (SELF-DESTRUCT) Sends a minion to mouse location to detonate. This kills all enemies and clears pre-existing debris.

![Screenshot1.png](///raw/515/d/z/1f56e.png)

Meet Paladin, the last surviving human brain on Terra. Your mission has been compromised and the forces of the Veil are converging on your position. In a last ditch effort to escape with the vital information you have secured, you are attempting to uploading your consciousness off world. However, the transcoding process is lengthy with your calculations alone.

Fortunately, you have discovered a flaw in the coding of a small number of enemy bots, allowing you to wrest control and focus their computation power on your transcoder. Be careful though, for your enemies are overwhelming and some of these Buddy Bots may need to be sacrificed to repair your exosuit or to rain fire on your enemies. Can you hold off long enough to complete the upload, or will humanity lose their last glimmer of hope?

Sacrifices must be made!

![Screenshot2.png](///raw/515/d/z/1f56f.png)

![Screenshot3.png](///raw/515/d/z/1f570.png)

This is elitegoliath's 4th with Drekler's 4th jam together, EquisStenchman 3rd jam, and Squiglypig's first. It 
was a wild ride with lots of excitement, frustration, and caffeine. Overall, it went pretty smoothly for our second game in Unity and it was much more ambitious than the last. We learned a ton about Unity, C#, scope creep, and teamwork. We look forward to hearing your thoughts and feedback and seeing if you can blast your way to victory!



## Patches
### Dec. 6
* Fixed issue where game wouldn't start.
* Added MAC build.

### Dec. 7
* Throttled graphics so the game was less prone to crashing.
* Fixed AI breaking sometimes at random.
* Fixed some issues with massive overhead when bots deploy from APCs.
* Fixed broken spawn rates of enemies.
* Fixed broken sound files.
* Fixed broken death condition.
* Lowered music volume so SFX could be heard.
* Fixed issue with colliders on obstacles not working on lasers properly.
* Added LINUX build.

### Dec. 8
* More performance enhancements by replacing some of the "invoke" methods with coroutines.
* Balanced spawn rates.
* Added custom cursor to make it easier to see.
* Added menu allowing player to restart or exit the game at will (use esc).
* Improved the "Detonate Companion" feature to make it more useful.
* Added more descriptive instructions in the "Main Menu."
* Added story elements to credit scene.
* Made depleted "Power Core" health indicators to make them easier to notice.

Control everything in your spaceship from oxygen levels to its weight to travel the furthest distance possible.

entries.title: Unfinished Sacrifice
entries.description:
I apologize for uploading an unfinished thing.
I was not able to execute upon the idea i had thought of.

Experimented a lot with shaders and dungeon generation.

Stupid end goal for now : Just try and reach the green flame at the end of the dungeon.
What i wanted was to make a boss fight as the end of each dungeon. You had to sacrifice your health to continue to next one after finishing the fight. If you had enough, you were able to continue otherwise the whole game would restart. Every dungeon finish should have given you extra damage and extra strength basically but its not in this version of the game sadly.

Anyways, here is the game. Hopefully, will be able to finish it later on :) 
The important thing was that i had fun in these 2-3 days. It was really fun to scramble something together playable enough.

Controls :
WASD - Movement

Q - Roll

Left mouse button - Attack

Mouse - move camera

Tab - Focus on an enemy

Can also use joystick to play.

entries.title: TwinHeroes
entries.description:
![TITRE.PNG](///raw/7b0/e1/z/1f33e.png)

We are the Twins Heroes. We must defeat the naked Wizard.

When the sorcerer casts his magical barrier, one has to SACRIFICE himself in the BLACK SMOKE to break it, while the other reach the WHITE SMOKE to REVIVE his fallen brother.

As long as the barrier is ON, we can resurrect an UNLIMITED number of times.

If both of us DIE, the fight is lost.!

![Capture3.PNG](///raw/7b0/e1/z/1e880.png)

We did not produce the graphics, neither the audio.

Special thanks to Buch (for the free-use TileSet) and to freesounds.org (Audio).

We opt-out of the graphics and audio categories in respect of the Ludum Dare's rules.

![Capture5.PNG](///raw/7b0/e1/z/1e88c.png)

Hope you have fun playing our game! Let some feedbacks in the comments section.

entries.title: Blood Trail
entries.description:
"As the sun rose today, a traveller ventured into our village and told us about a plague, which had killed nearly half of his hometown before he left. His eyes were filled with fear and panic, so that nobody could doubt the truth of his words. To survive we left our village and are now travelling towards the coast and its harbours to leave this cursed country."

Blood Trail is a game about a small band of five medieval refugees who try to reach a harbour.

The game is made of two parts: a map view, where you can command your group across a procedurally generated world with forests, cities and plains and random encounters: while travelling through the lands, you will randomly encounter friendly or evil people, with whom you can communicate or fight.

The game idea was way too big for one weekend, as usual, so expect a bumpy experience at best. We didn't manage to implement things like an inventory system or the plague you are fleeing from, but hopefully the game is interactive enough to be some fun and get some ratings at least.


* Controls:
 * On Mapview:
   * Left Mousebutton - Move your Group (Blue Dot)
   * WASD/Middle Mousebutton/Right Mousebutton - Scroll Map
   * Mousewheel - Zoom Map
 * During Encounter:
   * Click enemies to select them
   * Click the swords to attack the selected enemy
   * Click the shield to enter defensive stance to receive damage reduction


* @Rhiannon - Artwork (3D Models, Icons, Dialogues)
* @Alfadas - Programming (Encounters and Combat System)
* @413x - Programming (Procedural Map Generation)
* @kruemelkeksfan - Programming (Character Management and Map Movement)


![bloodtrail1.png](///raw/250/3/z/1e879.png)

entries.title: Earthbound
entries.description:
A simple game made using a custom Monogame Engine.

The Earth drifts through space. By controlling the motion, you have the power to influence the climate.  Being too close to the sun means the population cannot thrive. Being too far means ice and famine!  But if the population grows too well that means overpopulation!

What is the earth to do?  What will you do!?
SACRIFICES MUST BE MADE.

How to Play:

entries.title: My First Game
entries.description: I made this mainly because I wanted to try create games, and after finding Ludum Dare, I felt like this might be a good place to start. This is my first ever project! To play, use A and D to move left and right, W to jump, and F to reset the level. To beat the level, you must get to the yellow square by using your dead selves as platforms. Any feedback is appreciated, thank you for your time.

entries.title: Cull the herd (HTML Game)
entries.description:
Bug Fixes and Changes:
From Submission to 12/5/2018: 
Fixed health bars not being visible, Fixed error where attributes were being shown to 0, Add instructions to left corner of the screen, made it so a wall players could get stuck easily is now walk-able, moved some platforms to make gameplay better  
Thanks for playing!

Cull the herd is a platforming game with a twist. Before you actually begin playing through the level, you will have to breed the creatures at your disposal to create one suitable for overcoming the challenges you will face. You will go through 4 rounds of breeding. At the start of each breeding cycle you will be asked to cull the herd, sacrificing 6 creatures who you do not wish to breed. Afterwards, based on the remaining creatures’ attributes, 6 new creatures will be spawned. After repeated generations of breeding, you will be left with a final crop of creatures, and a random creature from it will be chosen to be your avatar for the level. You can hover your mouse over any creature to see its attributes, all ranging from level 1-5.  The attributes will affect both its appearance and its performance in certain tasks, so breed wisely. If an obstacle seems impassable, try restarting and breeding a new creature perhaps more up to the task!

Further controls for the game are as follows:

While in the Cull the Herd Stage:

![breed1.PNG](///raw/336/e1/z/1e7f4.png)

To move camera during cull the herd stage use w, a, s, d
Click on the members of the herd you don't want to breed with your mouse
Press G to skip this stage and have a completely randomly generated member of the herd

While in the survival stage

![fireAndWaterlevels.PNG](///raw/336/e1/z/1e7f7.png)

To move avatar in game use w, a, s, d
press L to go back to the breeding stage
Depending on your avatar's strength you may be able to push blocks
Depending on your avatar's swim you may be able to swim up a waterfall
Depending on your avatar's health you can handle more attacks 
Depending on your avatar's jump you may have access to more routes
Speed is self explanatory :-)
Be careful as fire and spikes hurt you and eventually kill you.

![breed2.PNG](///raw/336/e1/z/1e7f5.png)

![firelevel.PNG](///raw/336/e1/z/1e7f8.png)

![windmill level.PNG](///raw/336/e1/z/1e7f9.png)

entries.title: An Fhicheall Mhór (Grand Chess)
entries.description:
This is Grand Chess—an RPG-meets-chess that will push you to your limits. You will be journeying through a variety of levels with you King and other chess pieces you take along the way. Will you be able to make it? If you aren’t willing to sacrifice a few pieces along the way, you will have a very, very hard time winning. 

Controls:

Click a piece—select it

Click on a highlighted square one a piece is selected—move to that square

The places you can move will be shown in red if you can move and capture there, blue if you can move and not capture there, and green if the square is ‘on they way’ but you cannot move to it.

**If you capture a piece you keep it in the next levels until it dies

Goal:

Get to the yellow tile at the end of the stage to advance to the next one. Pass the final level to win!

Good luck!

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

As Gaeilge:

An Fhicheall Mhór

Seo é An Fhicheall Mhór—cluiche fichille an-dheacair! Beidh tú ag dul trí cúpla leibhéil leis an Rí agus bail píosaí fichille eile. An féidir leat dul trí gach stáitse? Mura mbeadh tú ag íobairt cúpla píosaí atá agat, níl beidh tú in ann bua a bheith.

Chun rialaigh an cluiche:

Cliceáil ar píosa—roghnaigh píosa

Cliceáil ar leacán curtha chun suntais--bog an píosa go dtí an leacán sin

Má tá leacán curtha chun suntais dearg, is féidir leat dul nó aimsiú ann, má tá sé gorm, ach amháin dul ann, má tá sé uaine, ach amháin bog tríd.

**Má gabhann tú aon píosa beidh sé agat sa leibhéil eile nuair atá sé beo

Dúshlán:

Dul go dtí an leacán buí os comhair an leacán tosú. Déan gach leibhéal chun an deireadh!

Go n-éirí an t-ádh leat!

![FichilleMhor.png](///raw/59c/8/z/1e7bd.png)![grandChess.png](///raw/59c/8/z/1e7be.https://jeffrey-sardina.itch.io/an-fhicheall-mhor-grand-chess

entries.title: Escape from Arex
entries.description:
![banner_2.png](///raw/047/31/z/1eafd.png)
#### Story
You managed to survive the war inside the walls of the city of Arex, but life in Arex is not what you imagined it would be. When one day your wife is gone, you decide to go back outside to find her. During your escape you will face many obstacles, but you are determined to keep going. Will you sacrifice everything to find her?

#### Controls
Movement - W, A, S, D or arrow keys

Crouch - C

Sprint - Shift

Interact - E

Reload - R

#### Note
This game is far from complete, but I am uploading it anyway so you can give it a try and some feedback. Plans are to continue development later.

entries.title: The True Treasure Hunter
entries.description:
*** IMPORTANT NOTES BEFORE PLAYING ***
- There is an unbeatable level in the main version of the game (you'll know it when you see it), the best solution is to jump into the spikes and click restart level.

- When you click "restart level" after dying, you will return to the hub, upon re-entering the level the room you were on will skip

- I ran out of time completing this game, you will probably notice a few things that seem unfinished

*** END OF NOTES ***



Say hello to the world's least moral treasure hunter

Adventure through the mines doing what you must to get to the exit.

Controls:

Arrow Keys - Left, right, jump and crouch. You can also use them to adjust your aim.

C - Push. Simply gives a "little" nudge to anyone in front of you.

X - Pickup/drop. Use this to pick up (or mercifully put down) one of your fellow explorers (can also cancel a throw).

Z - Action/interact. Holding it will allow you to aim a throw, otherwise, it can be used to buy from the shop and to enter a door.


Well, this was certainly an interesting Ludum Dare, never have I lost so much time trying to work out things that should've just been scrapped from the beginning. I'll be the first to admit that in its current form, this game lacks a lot of important aspects of a game. However, I'm still proud of what I accomplished. I know that next Ludum Dare I will be sure not to make the same mistakes, and hopefully, I can finally make a game to completion.

And hey, if you enjoy what's here, feel free to check back later, I may have a post-jam version released.

Anyway, I hope you enjoy this light-hearted comedy about murdering your co-workers.



** VERSION HISTORY **

Original Release (this was released prior to the deadline)

Minor bug fix (this version contains a minor bug fix that no longer breaks the text messages after the first one)

entries.title: L.A.B.
entries.description:
Agricola meets Kerbal Space Program. In order to reach space first, sacrifices will have to be made.

Instructions

- This is a multi-player game, if nobody else is joining, try opening two windows at once. 
  * Open up https://disperse.itch.io/lab twice, clicking 'Start game' will assign each player a unique ID.
- The first player who successfully launches a rocket wins.
- Drag and drop your workers to cards on your turn.
- Every turn new cards are added to the offer.
- Every 4th turn is payday, pay 2 cash for each worker or they are 'fired'.
- The more components you add to your rocket, the more likely it is to launch.
- If the launch fails, you'll lose the parts and the worker who launched it.
- Click 'Start game' to begin.
  * This is bugged, click 'Start game' twice to get started.

Code by Mark (42), pixel art and music by Henri (11).

entries.title: Into the Catacomb
entries.description:
![Cover Image.png](///raw/f15/91/z/1e6e0.png)

>*You find yourself in a mysterious catacomb full of treasures and danger. But the path forward isn't always as clear as you'd hope it was.*


![Catacomb1.gif](///raw/f15/91/z/1e76a.gif)

 

# Controls

Controls stated on the game are wrong / not properly marked, but that would have to be fixed post jam. Controller assumes a Play Station layout, but generic gamepads have weird inputs, so you may need to experiment what works with yours. 


**Move** Arrow Keys / D-Pad 

**Attack** C Key / Square 

**Jump/Hover** Spacebar / X 

**Equip** X Key / Circle 




As of writing this, Xbox controllers are not supported, but I will patch that out. I just ran out of time to change my input script, and I had no way of testing them either way. Generic gamepads and keyboard are supported.\

My second LDJAM, my first time going solo. Things got real rough at the end, I'm not even sure if I made it in time at all. If I had slept less and wasted less time on Overwatch I could've done more of the ideas I had, but I didn't want to stress myself too much since I joined this jam as a way to rest from work.

# Post Jam edits 
## (v.1.0.0.2)
-Minor graphical updates to the button prompts and UI
-Added 100% clear end state.
-Added Options menu during gameplay.
-Tweaked level design to make areas accessible without taking damage.

entries.title: Product Company
entries.description:
# The game

![header.png](///raw/35c/41/z/1e822.png)

In **Product Company**, you need to care care of a company.

You need money.

Employees can give you money.

But employees are also people.

And people might be weird.

And weird people hurt your reputation.

To save your reputation, will you sacrifice a very lucrative, yet racist, employee?

To avoid going bankrupt, will you sacrifice a very friendly, yet not very profitable, employee?

*How long will your company last?*

# Controls

You'll only need your mouse for this one!

# How to play

![image.png](///raw/35c/41/z/1e831.png)

* Hire people by on the right panel
* See stats about your employees by clicking them
* Click the big red "Fire" button to get rid of the employees you don't want anymore
* The game ends when your reputation is 0 or if you have no money left
* Having polemic and dangerous people in your company lowers your reputation
* Having trusted and good people in your company rises it

# Mechanics

* All employees have simulated personalities
* An employee's performance depends on their traits
* Their personalities range from really happy and kind to violently depressed
* People eventually will leave their jobs
* The amount of money that an employee makes decreases with time

# DISCLAIMER

*THIS GAME HAS MATURE CONTENT.*

This game does **not** have any mature graphical content, but it deals with very sensitive topics, such as sexual abuse and drug addiction.

Please don't play it if you don't feel comfortable with that kind of stuff. 

Obviously, this isn't a game for kids.

![hypervoid.png](///raw/35c/41/z/1e84f.png)

entries.title: Roustabout
entries.description:
A hard working roustabout finds himself the lowly deckhand on duty. Now, with sole discretion on the manifest, you have to decide: what it going to ship?

Controls:
```
WASD/arrow keys - Directions
Space - Grab/Release
Q & E - Rotate a piece if still attached to the crane
F - Fast Forward!
```


The dock crane will lower cargo onto the deck.
![lower-crane.gif](///raw/e71/3/z/1f323.gif)

It is your job to organize the deck for the shipment.
![organize.gif](///raw/e71/3/z/1f326.gif)

Rats live on the ship and will occasionally infest some of the cargo. They cannot be stopped. You must dispose of the infested cargo or face hefty fines. 
![rat.gif](///raw/e71/3/z/1f327.gif)

**Tools used:**
```
Unity
Tiled
SuperTiled2Unity
FLStudio
FMOD
Pyxel Edit
```
Sound effects were either created during the jam or built up from base sounds found on **zapsplat.com**. Go check them out! Donate to keep that site going. It deserves the love.


[teaser.gif](///raw/8ff/2/z/1dfca.gif)

entries.title: Disincorporation
entries.description:
The project might evolve into something, we don't really know yet.
You play as Frank, a janitor who's tired of being stuck at the bottom, and must make sacrifices (Killing everyone who stands in his way) to rise to the top.

**Note:** It's very unpolished and quite buggy, as we didn't have a lot of time, but the concept is still there. 

**Note:** you must kill the enemies before progressing.

**Note:** you cannot attack while moving

** Controls: 
S - Light attack, does 1 dmg.
D - Heavy attack, does 2 dmg but takes longer to perform.
X - Block (light attack) use this to block stabs.
C - Block (heavy attack) use this to block slashes. **


**Bug:** sometimes the enemy will get stuck in a block animation but still be able to attack. If this happens then just walk away from him, that might work.

entries.title: One Coin
entries.description:
For this game project, I've been working with a friend of mine. She was the Artist, making graphic and audio assets, while I made the  game mecanics.
The game is not entirely finished, and I wish we will have time and motivation to finish it. It shouldn't be too hard anyway ;)

The current version of the game has a playable-until-the-end content, and nice graphics :>

Anyway, I'll let you explore the game now
Enjoy

entries.title: Hamster DRUMA
entries.description:
![logo_small_512.png](///raw/c70/1/z/1f858.png)

You play as a hamster possessed by the **evil drum**.   
The point of your existence itself from now on is to bring your peers to safety, guiding them through the dangers of this unpleasant world with the power of **SICK BEATS**.  
Why? For the glory of Satan, of course!

![combination.png](///raw/c70/1/z/1f856.png)
________  
  
**Controls**

WASD - control your drummer  
Left and Right Mouse Buttons - beat the drum
________  
  
The faster you click the faster they move. Use it sparingly though. Possessed drums **have to eat** too. Keep your energy in check and replenish it on the altar, or your mates will get lazy and slow.  

You have to bring several hamsters to an end. Try not to kill them all at once.
________  
  
Also enjoy, leave a comment and spread the word of upcoming doom!!

entries.title: Angry Mountain
entries.description:
The mountain is angry. Wecret Raccoon's friend just wants to watch his stories. Something (Wecret) has got to give (something) (to the mountain) (so it quiets down.)

![Screen Shot 2018-12-06 at 3.18.10 PM.png](///raw/4cc/e1/z/1f4d2.png)

This game ended up being like 75% of what I hoped for. The models are real rough, there's no animation or music, and some of the, er, gameplay is missing. But I learned a lot about Unity, and I had fun, so I'm calling it a win.

🦝🦝🦝

MISSING: 
- The inventory system just barely missed the deadline, so the game is more of a Hoverboarding Mountain Simulator.
- Audio / music. I have a few bits ready but don't know enough about Unity's audio systems yet!
- There was going to be a goat.

Built with Unity, 3D models made in Google Blocks, all graphics, code, and writing - for better or worse - by Sam (me).

entries.title: Nihilistic Nurture Navigation
entries.description:
__So, we didn't finish in time...__

We still wanted to upload the game in its unfinished state, because we are proud of what we created.  
We really want to upload a post-jam version in the coming days, with the features properly implemented.

Most features are fully implemented, but lack the polish to fully work in conjunction.  
We all really need to take a break now.  
Updated README will follow soon...

---

## Gameplay
There isn't much gameplay, aside from the chaotic and un-polished level you see in the jam-version.  
The goal in this level is to get as many persons (player and children) into the isolated room,  
closed-off by the two yellow doors.  
You are able to bring __three persons__ to the "goal"; one person will need to be _sacrificed_.  
In the final version children will reward with more points than the player when saved.

To command the monster children, click the left/right arrow buttons at the bottom of the window.  
The target child will then move to that direction until they hit a wall, at which point they can accept new input.  
When a child is moving, they cannot be commanded.

The released jam-version is more of a prototype, as it isn't really a game in its state.  
We will (hopefully) be releasing a playable post-jam version with multiple levels this coming weekend.

## Controls
| Action           | Input(s)                          |
| ---------------- | --------------------------------- |
| Player Movement  | A, D                              |
| Player Jump      | Space                             |
| Minion Movement  | Mouse click on arrow buttons      |
| Camera Movement  | Arrow keys                        |
| Quit             | Escape                            |

---

## Concept
Most of what is listed in this "__Concept__" section is not implemented in the jam-version of the game.  
These were our main ideas, which we are working on implementing for a post-jam version.

The game should be a __puzzle__ game, in which you dictate your children (weird monster children) what to do.  
You could tell them to move right and fall into a gap from which they can not escape;  
you (and your other children) would then be able to walk on top of the sacrificed child to cross the gap.  
The goal would be to get to some food at the end of the level (hence the name).

Some children would have different abilities:  
one would be able to jump (_Long Leg Larry_, the one with the long legs);  
one would be able to fall through _one-way platforms*_ (_Bloat_, the fat one);  
the last one would not be able to do anything special, but would reward with extra points when saved (_The Thing_).

Every saved person (player and children) would give points when saved, some more than others:  
the player would reward the least amount of points, as they have the most freedom of movement;  
the children would reward more points, the one without an ability rewarding the most.

We planned the setting to be post-apocalyptic and the goal would be to gather food by beating levels.  
We wanted to implement some minor story/lore which would unfold via a conversation/monologue-system,  
explaining/hinting at the situation (who are these _monster children_ and why are they following this ominous-looking dude?).

__*one-way platforms__:  
A person (player or child) can jump through these platforms from below, but cannot fall through them from above.  
They are implemented and exist in the jam-version, but they are invisible / have no texture(s).

## Missing Features
- __A goal__  
  Each level should have a _goal_;  
  an area where you would bring as many persons as possible to gain as many points as possible  
  and to move on to the next level.  
- __Level Manager / Level Selection__  
  Obviously, there should be more than one level in the final product.  
  After you beat one level, you would move on to the next one.  
  Additionally, a __level selection__ menu would be nice.
- __Audio Manager__  
  The jam-version only loops a single song, which is sad because  
  our sound artist (@williwiderstand) has created __5 songs__ in total.  
  You can still check them all out in the `resources/audio` directory if you downloaded the zip file.
- __Sound Effects__
- __Background Image(s)__  
  @hoichael has created a temporary background image, but I was not able to implement it in time.  
  The final game should definitely have some background images, which may change per level.
- __Background Decorations__  
  @williwiderstand has created a neat, animated eye that was planned to be put in the background as decoration.
- __Child abilities__  
  As mentioned above, children were planned to have special abilities.
- __Pivoter__  
  An "Interactable" object, which when touched by a child will invert their direction of movement.
- __Conversation/Monologue system__  
  A system to convey or hint at some lore regarding the monster children and the setting of the game.
- __Text Popups__  
  Text that will pop-up above a child when they are commanded to move.  
- __Level Reset__ button
- __Pause__  
  Being able to pause the running game would be nice and shouldn't be too hard to implement.  
  (Although probably unnecessary)
- __MacOS Version__  
  A MacOS version shouldn't be difficult to build and distribute (I think), I just need access to an updated mac.

---

## Programs Used
|                  |                                   |
| ---------------- | --------------------------------- |
| Language         | __Rust__                          |
| Engine           | [__ggez__][ggez]                  |
| Framework        | [__noframe__][noframe]            |
| Graphics         | __Gimp__                          |
| Audio            | [__BoscaCeoil__][boscaceoil]      |
| Editor           | __vim__                           |

## Credits
|                  |                                   |
| ---------------- | --------------------------------- |
| @hoichael        | Concept, Design, Graphics         |
| @williwiderstand | Audio, Graphics                   |
| @noahro          | Programming                       |

---

Thank you for your time!  
Although we weren't able to release a proper game, we still had a ton of fun and learned a lot during this jam.  
This was my first proper Rust project and I am very happy about how I managed to go at it.  
In case anybody is interested in the code, it is available on [github][source].  
The framework I wrote for the game is also available on [github][noframe].  
It doesn't have many features, but it did help provide base code, which I would have had to write during the jam.

[ggez]:       https://ggez.rs
[boscaceoil]: https://boscaceoil.net
[noframe]:    https://github.com/Noah2610/noframe
[source]:     https://github.com/Noah2610/LD43

entries.title: Halls of Atonement
entries.description:
A rougelike where each time you clear the level, you're forced to make a choice. No matter what you choose, it's never in your favor. From lowering your damage to increasing the level size, your sacrifice never makes things easier.


Use WASD and Space.

Created by @ieatsponge, @nathmorzz,

entries.title: Mechamorphosis
entries.description:
An evil corporation wants to turn you and your robot friends into mechanical waste! Fight your way out of this industrial maze by sacrificing your robotic parts in order to attach ones that open locked doors and grant you peculiar skills!

Fire: Left Mouse Button / Right Analog Stick

Use items: QER / Square, Triangle, Cross

entries.title: The Lamentable Burden of Haverbrook
entries.description:
![DoomTitleScreen.png](///raw/75b/z/1e0ea.png)

You've inherited your grandfathers estate and...something else. You'll have to feed it for fear of it leaving and looking for it's own food.

You'll play as a man who's inherited his grandfathers estate and the monster he kept in the barn. If you don't feed it it'll get worse. It seems to be fine drinking some blood from your cattle but you fear that may not last.

entries.title: Tributes of Cronus
entries.description:
Team Dumble presents a 2D platformer that requires reflexes and strategy. Use the demon satyr Medir to defeat the dungeons of almighty Kronus, ruler of the underworlds. In this challenging platformer, you need to prove you skills by dashing through opponents, jumping over spikes and dodging attacks of enemies.
![head.png](///raw/e9e/21/z/1db54.png)

Download: https://boeshizzle.itch.io/ldjam43

## Features
* single-player platformer with sweet animations, double jumps and dash moves everywhere
* you play as a cruel satyr demon on your quest to bring satisfaction for Cronus
* vanquish the last disgraceful archangels that exist and extract their holy souls using an altar
* each archangel is different in skillset (charge/ run/ explode)
* finish your journey by completing all levels with or without the wrath of Cronus

![spike_sprites.png](///raw/e9e/21/z/1de06.png)

## Controls
* A, D        - Move
* W, Space    - Jump / Double-Jump
* F, J, Shift - Dash-Attack
* E           - Carry / Throw 


## Gather Souls of Archangels ![soul.png](///raw/e9e/21/z/1db77.png)


## Bring them to an Altar ![altar.png](///raw/e9e/21/z/1dcf1.png)


## To satisfy Cronus ![god.png](///raw/e9e/21/z/1db5d.png)


## Archangle Types ![mob2_base.png](///raw/e9e/21/z/1db7d.png)![mob1_base.png](///raw/e9e/21/z/1db81.png)

by Team Dumble​​

entries.title: Sacrifice Island
entries.description:
![Frog.png](///raw/506/a1/z/1e671.png)Sacrifice Island is a game about tough choices that MUST be made. Meet a motley cast of characters along your way home and encounter some very hangry animals.

Sacrifice Island is a basic adventure, click through game, where the user must choice between 1-8 characters to sacrifice at every decision point. With a lot of different choices it's easy to replay and laugh at all of the goofiness!

Silly animations, a whimsical pseudo-plot, a handful of unexpected jokes, and of course an almost constant reminder that sacrifices must made.

If you like the game, we were considering adding scope by adding strategy for "Boss" vs. "Sacrifice" matching, as well as, special additions to the end of the game for the friends who you keep with you. Examples like: the Handy Woman would help you fix up your house and bees would bring flowers...

Let us know what you think!

entries.title: Bohemian Winter
entries.description:
You play as a goatherd from ancient Bohemia. You and your goats have no means of defense. The only way how to survive and get them to obelisk is sacrificing some of them on altars of pagan gods.

Controls: mouse + ESC

By selecting an altar and approaching it you will try to sacrifice a goat. In return you will be belssed by the deity:

![ld43_svarog.png](///raw/4b4/e1/z/1edb5.png)
Svarog - Bird: replenishes health of the sickest in herd

![ld43_perun.png](///raw/4b4/e1/z/1edb6.png)
Perun - Hammer: mighty smash slays any nearby enemies

![ld43_morana.png](///raw/4b4/e1/z/1edb7.png)
Morana - (not implemented, she is busy with taking lives or whatever)

![ld43_svantovit.png](///raw/4b4/e1/z/1edb8.png)
Svantovit - (not implemented, his four heads could not agree on participation)

![ld43_rod.png](///raw/4b4/e1/z/1edb9.png)
Rod - Game goal: well... it is the goal

![Bez názvu.png](///raw/4b4/e1/z/1e97d.png)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xI3_FVgFvVE

PS: This is a very rough demo, not all gods listen to prayers :)

Welcome to Chad Island, where you play as a young Chadlet on his quest to get with the island's hottest babe, Stacy. Travel around Chad Island to interrogate the other Chad's to gather dirt and decide who to sacrifice to his holy Chadliness. Meet fun and exciting characters such as Brad, Rad, Dad, Sad, Glad, Comrade Chadski, and the rest of the Chad Island inhabitants! entries.title: Sacrificial Dungeon

Try to get through as many rooms as you can!
To play: [w][a][s][d] to move, [left click] to attack, [1] and [2] to select abilities.

entries.title: Santa Saves Christmas
entries.description:
## Santa is not Happy. 

THE ELVES GAVE THE WRONG PRESENTS TO SANTA AND NOW MILLIONS OF CHILDREN WILL LOSE THEIR CHRISTMAS SPIRIT. HELP SANTA SAVE CHRISTMAS AND REPLACE THE GIFTS BEFORE THE CHILDREN WAKE UP.


![2018-12-12_21-32-12.png](///raw/8f3/1/z/1fa2b.png)​


### How To Play

DELIVER PRESENTS AND COLLECT
MILK & COOKIES & COAL USING THE MOUSE

LEFT MOUSE = MOVE SANTA
RIGHT MOUSE = SACRIFICE ELF (SANTA IS ON SLEIGH)
BIG RED BUTTON = RECALL SLEIGH (USES MAGIC)

PRO TIPS: 

- YOUR BAG CAN ONLY HOLD 10 PRESENTS
- GO BACK TO SLEIGH TO REPLENISH
- BE ON THE SLEIGH BEFORE YOU REACH
    THE END OF THE STREET
- COLLECT EVERYTHING ASKED FOR ON THE SCREEN
- THE GREEN BAR SHOWS TOTAL CHRISTMAS SPIRIT

### Have Fun!

Paul

![2018-12-04_0-36-06.png](///raw/8f3/1/z/1e892.png)

![2018-12-04_0-35-48.png](///raw/8f3/1/z/1e894.png)

entries.title: Cultist Crusade
entries.description:
There was a dungeon.

No paladins were home.
So they sent the local elder god cult!

Sacrifice your minions for the dark lord!

Destroy these heretic beasts!

-----------------------------

When controlling your army, your weapon will be their bodies !
Using your mouse, left-click to send them to their timely sacrifice.
Or use right-click, to make them defend your life with their own.
But if need be, you can still move with your trusty QWERTY legs!!

-----------------------------

entries.title: Forest Of Sacrifices
entries.description:
![sc_4.png](///raw/f79/31/z/1e6b6.png)
![sc_1.png](///raw/f79/31/z/1e6ae.png)
![sc_2.png](///raw/f79/31/z/1e6b2.png)

I have entered the Forest of Sacrifices to extinguish the rage of the gods against my people,
But here is not like what I remember...
It is infested with bugs and thorns,
The goats are acting ungoatly,

Still I must continue...

Made in 72 hours by me. This is my first platformer attempt and possibly one of the shortest meroidvanias. I build this on top of godots KinematicBody2D Platformer demo (added walljump ad air dash myself). Music was done on a ukulele in less then half an hour. Programs used: Godot, Reaper, Aseprite, Krita. Have fun!

P.S: In post jam version wall jumping is easier and a particular level is harder without an ability. Also gamepad support, text revision and minor bug fixes.

entries.title: Emperor's Jarheads
entries.description:
MIND THE AUDIO VOLUME - MAKE SURE TO LOWER IT JUST IN CASE

*******************

Why are we still here? Just to suffer?!

Wake up, maggot! The Emperor has called upon his children to cleanse abominable creatures!!!

Lead the squad of Emperor's Jarheads to the heart of abomination swarm. Each of your unit is a battle-born tough marine that will not hesitate to give his life for the greater good.

To play this game, you only need a computer mouse.

Watch your marines as they fight their way through the hoards of enemies.

********************

Ludum Dare 43, topic: Sacrifices must be made.


********************

This is my second solo LD. This time, again, everything is made by yours truly, Siarhei Pilat - except for the music.

I am very tired. Cheers!

![screnn02.png](///raw/674/91/z/1e7db.png)

entries.title: Cat-Astrophe
entries.description:
![Screen Shot 2018-12-03 at 7.15.52 PM.png](///raw/bb2/f1/z/1ddaf.png)
Can you make it home in time for dinner?

Play as a cat just trying to make it through all of the rooms in your castle home to join your three witch owners for dinnertime. Watch your step, as danger lurks around every corner. Fortunately, you have a magic pendant that will bring you back in time to the start of the room when you die. You'll soon find out that your past selves will help you get through even the toughest of challenges.

![Screen Shot 2018-12-03 at 7.17.28 PM.png](///raw/bb2/f1/z/1ddaa.png)

Try to make it through with as few deaths as possible, but know that most puzzles will require sacrifices to solve!

**Change Log**

v1.1 — Fixed level loading. Oops!

v1.2 — Added back a few levels that got eaten in a crash immediately before publishing.

v1.3 — Fixed a bug preventing character dialog from appearing without restarting the game.

entries.title: Hope springs eternal.
entries.description:
![Title.png](///raw/91a/z/1e388.png)
# Controls
W, S, A, D - control your admiral  
left mouse button - shoot interceptor rockets  
right mouse button - shoot missiles  
middle mouse button - select squadron near mouse position  
1, 2, .., 9 - select squadron  
space - move selected squadron to mouse position  
R - restart the mission  
esc - return to mainmenu 

# Description
You are a leading member of a peaceful race, that recently developed the ability to travel between the stars.
Many new worlds to discover. But unfortunately, also many new dangers. On one of your journeys, you met another race naming themselves humankind. A very unfriendly race that directly started a war to conquer our planets... As if the space isn't big enough.
Since none of our people has any military experience, you were chosen to lead your race into freedom...


# Gameplay
Your goal is to protect your admiral while destroying the enemy. To achieve this, you have to shoot missiles and interceptor rockets and also control your fighter squadrons.

# Technical Details
The game was made in Unity (https://unity3d.com/). We made all the graphics and models ourselves, using GIMP (https://www.gimp.org/) and Blender (https://www.blender.org/). All the sound effects were created with assets of the ‘The #GameAudioGDC Bundle’ (http://www.sonniss.com/gameaudiogdc2017/) or by ourselves. The music was created using Cubase (https://www.steinberg.net/de/shop/cubase.html).

# Made by
Skosnowich and Matjes!

# Screenshots
![screenshot1.png](///raw/91a/z/1e3f9.png)

entries.title: Thinning The Herd
entries.description:
We tried making a Oregon-trail-themed game where you are a lowly cowpoke moving cows across the wild west. As you proceed, you come across encounters where... sacrifices must be made! At this stage in the game, you either lose cows or money (future edits would include some good things as well, like traders or abandoned (free) cows) 

I hosted the game (or at least all of the files that should be needed to run things) at the link below, feedback very much welcome on our first submission! We didn't get nearly as far as we wanted, but we learned a ton and had a blast in the process. Excited to play others games as well!

entries.title: Bean There, Done That
entries.description:
As far as I got with much procrastination, much distraction, and not managing my time. I feel shame. I overburdened myself with this one, and many sacrifices were made to publish anything. This 'anything' is far from what I envisioned, and here it is. Click and drag to look around, WASD to move. There's only one thing to do in the game, so yes, it really is that short.

Full Disclosure: I put the finishing touches on during the submission hour. I expect not to be rated for violating that rule for the 72-hour Jam.

Music is original, made with Reaper, Musescore, and a keyboard. Sound FX are original. Artwork is a digitized version of the "Green Bean Ghoul" from my YouTube channel. Character existed before, but I made a new puppet to digitize for this game, so it's original in the time frame. 

Basically, this "game" represents my fear of creation and sharing myself and how I tend to cling to projects too long and procrastinate decisions, resulting in many many sacrifices being made last-minute rather than consistent sacrifices made throughout. 

Thank you A-Frame Team for creating a way to make 3D spaces right in the browser.

Thanks everyone for competing and submitting. I admire your courage.

entries.title: Labrats
entries.description:
![title.PNG](///raw/6bb/81/z/1e4c3.png)

Help advance science by solving puzzles and conducting exciting experiments! You might have to make a few sacrifices to succeed.

Keypad or wasd to move. R to restart a level if you're stuck. Pause with P or ESC.

This is my second game jam (my previous game was Pyramidion, which I made for LD42).

There are overall 8 levels in the game.

# Important information

- The missing cheese on level 4 is not a bug! If you're stuck, you can watch a playthrough of the game [here](https://goo.gl/Y2qEdj).
- Sadly, I am pretty sure the game is not color-blind friendly. I realized this too late. I wanted to upload a post jam version that doesn't rely on color indications the weekend after the jam, but I caught a flu and couldn't really get any work done. I will still try to fix it in a post jam version!

# Credits

I've used some music from opengameart.org:  

Catch me if  you can! (Created by poinl)  
Bittersweet (Created by Emma_MA)  
A Tricky Puzzle Loop (Created by Pant0don)  
 
I've used some sound effects from freesound.org:  
ratty-squeaks.wav (Created by Reitana)  
rat-gnawing-a-rusk.wav (Created by zabuhailo)  
burning-match-into-water.wav (Created by trngle)  
woosh.wav (Created by lebaston100)  

All graphical assets were created by me using Procreate / Gimp / Aseprite.
The game was created using Unity.

# Bug fix:
A few hours after submitting, I saw a streamer bump into a game breaking bug, where having no creatures on the screen causes the webgl player to crash.  I updated the itch.io hosted executables and web versions with the fixed version.

# Screenshot:
![screenshot2.PNG](///raw/6bb/81/z/1e49f.png)

entries.title: This Little Isle Of Mine

entries.title: Magnibus
entries.description:
![TITLE BANNER THING-04.png](///raw/01c/1/z/1e78d.png)
## Small Man, Big Fists
You play as Magnibus (name came from latin phrase magnas manibus meaning big hands), a fighter with huge hands. Your goal is to make your way through the areas while punching, throwing, smashing, and completely destroying all the robots trying to kill you. In each area you progress, you must sacrifice one health point allowing for fewer mistakes in further areas.

![combodunk.gif](///raw/01c/1/z/1e7e3.gif)

While entered in the jam, this game was made under full compo restrictions except for time, as I slept in Sunday and could not have complete entry for the compo deadline. I guess you could say I had to sacrifice my compo goals to put out a finished game ;)

## Warning! Difficult Game
This game is intended to be very challenging, especially towards the end. There are quite a few mechanics to learn to reach full potential. However, you should be able to figure things out good enough within the 5-10 minutes you will likely be playing.
# Have fun!

entries.title: Ascension
entries.description:
In Ascension, you play as a demi god sent to the human realm to prove your worth to the gods.

In order to ascend and become a full god, you must complete the tasks the God’s have assigned you.

The only catch – it’s against the order of the gods for demi-gods to intervene directly in the human realm.

Use the recruited acolytes to accomplish your tasks.

Do you possess the resolve to complete the gods task and complete your ascension; even if that means sacrificing those around you?![helpScreen.png](///raw/866/2/z/1e450.png)

Notes:
No audio, you didn't go deaf :) 

Red particle effects are apples
Yellow particle effects are gold
You can use space to dash.

entries.title: Harsh Life as a Peasant - LD43 (bug with enemies, wouldn't suggest playing yet)
entries.description:
**Just Some Background Info:**

This LD, I was going solo, so I decided to go Compo. Then about 24 Hours in, I got a few game-breaking issues that I had no idea how to fix (I spent 12 hours trying to fix them yikes). So I ended up remaking it and going for Jam, which is the game that I have now. There are quite a few bugs still that I haven't been able to fix in time (I'll try to update it ASAP so people can actually play).

**Game:**

Harsh Life as a Peasant is a puzzle-TBS game involving fighting strong chickens with your troops to win.

**Controls:**

Mouse - Push border to move the camera
Left Click - Click on an ally character to select it. This displays the stats on the bottom right aswell.
             Then Click on an empty spot or enemy character to move there or attack them.
             Moving consumers as many hunger as squares moved, and if you run out of hunger, your character dies.
             Killing a character grants their remaining hunger to the killer, so you can keep moving.
             When a character dies, a gravestone comes down that blocks the way.
             Clicking on a gravestone pushes it.

Right Click - Deselect a character
E - End Turn


![LD43 T2 Cover Image.PNG](///raw/5bc/11/z/1e3db.png)

entries.title: Puka, Inti Waka
entries.description:
The basic idea in this game is to mix LD 43 theme into a game mechanic and a plot device. Some of the original suggestions were cut off to reduce final work for our small team. **Be aware this is a test prototype!**

You play as Puka, a character based on Andean mithology, during a solar eclipse. This event triggers a sacrificial rite to please Inti, the Sun God. Priests go down the Sacred City to search for children as offering. You should flee from them before spending all of your Vital Points, or you will be carried away. If they get you, struggle to avoid being dragged. As if this were not enough, you must return to find your little sister who was taking care of home.

## How to play

- *Arrow keys* to walk
- Press *space* to run
- Smash your *Left CTRL* to set yourself free. This action consumes Spiritual Points
- Get Sacred Leafs to restore your Spiritual Points
- Don't forget: you have Vital Points, to run around, and Spiritual Points, to release youserlf

## Loading...

We have only our first scenario of three planned. Some assets may need further polishing.

## Credits

- Programming @poordev and @gorald
- Art @deiaup
- SFX @Pedrozzy
- Writing @micilo

entries.title: I don't wanna die
entries.description:
In 2081, an unknown zombie virus broke out, turning the cities into chaos in almost no time. The surviving humans had no way but keep runnning towards  Eden, the uninfected area of the continent, praying that they would live to see the sunrise tomorrow...

You are the leader of a survivor squad. Although it's the first time you’ve met, the desire to survive brings you together, and the reason you've become the leader seems to be nothing but their trust in you. Again and again, you narrowly escaped from the zombies, but luck would not always be with you. A group of zombies are now after you, and obviously, they are much faster than you. Now, as a leader, you are facing a difficult moral choice - unless you sacrifice a teammate as the bait, you will all be overwhelmed by the tide of zombies sooner or later, but neither can you endure their desperate wail when bitten by zombies nor their doubtful eyesights when witnessing your betrayal.To worsen your despair, the abandoned city before you is chaotic so you have to rely on your teammates to deal with the obstacles and rescue more survivors from time to time to make sure that you can survive...![微信图片_20181204105501.jpg](///raw/498/e1/z/1e5a4.jpg)![微信图片_20181204105504.png](///raw/498/e1/z/1e5a7.png)

entries.title: 2305 : New Generation
entries.description:
Team Members : Azayiah, Amira, Rebecca, Ck

About Game: The world is going into a crisis, as the natural resources of earth are running dry (most of the soil turns has turned bad, which lower the rate of survival for the food stock, caused by over pollution). Therefore, leading to everyone fighting for their own survival. To combat this problem, an organisation called “Titan” decided to work alongside the military to force augment the citizen to adapt to the environment. Individuals are sectioned based on wealth and the amount of augmentation on their body, however, those who refuses would face the consequences of getting hunted down and executed by the military. With Titan's abusing the power they have, The Resistance was created to fight back and promises to bring people to Eden. However, will Eden actually be a safe haven for them? 


Controls: Use the arrow keys to move left and right to move the characters, enter or space to interact with the environment. We recommend a gaming controller for additional rumbling features.

Notes. This game is still in working progress, please enjoy our snippet game. We had fun designing the game however due to time, we decided to stick to a teaser version of the game. P.s. look out for an eventual full version. ![3RPf8L.png](///raw/dec/d1/z/1f3a6.png)

entries.title: Robot Altar
entries.description:
Get the Jewel to the terminal at the expense of your robot helpers!

I apologize in advance for the difficulty. First thing I'd change about the game is have simpler levels at first to learn the ropes.

![screenshot](///raw/d92/c1/z/1e7a3.png)

![robot_altar_gameplay.gif](///raw/d92/c1/z/1e936.gif)

A physics, breakable terrain puzzle game inspired by Lemmings, King Arthur's World, and Worms.

Was going for Compo (went totally solo this time) but I'm too much of a perfectionist and the physics took a long time. So the graphics are still placeholder and there's no audio.
Hope you enjoy!

INSTRUCTION:

Get the yellow jewel into the yellow terminal

Get anything into the blue terminal and it converts into scrap (junk balls yield a lot of scrap)

Some abilities take scrap, use sparingly!

CONTROLS:

Mouse - LB- select, RB - scroll camera

Space bar: Restart

P: Skip level (there are only 5)

NOTE for Mac users: After downloading, move the .app file out of the downloads folder or you may get an error trying to open it.

entries.title: Altar Dodge (best experienced in VR)
entries.description:
A Virtual Reality (VR) game developed with Unity and the SteamVR package about literally sacrificing objects on an altar while dodging meteors. Only certain combinations of 3 objects can be sacrificed (ie rock+rock+cube). You also get a fairy friend. The game can be played without VR, but is meant for a headset! 

Made by 3 friends with Unity, Blender, and the SteamVR asset package in 3 days. Our first VR game!

entries.title: The Tearable Three
entries.description:
![spr_itchCover.png](///raw/4a8/z/1f49c.png)

Video with Making Of / Soundtrack / Timelapse / Playthrough / Spoilers:
https://youtu.be/CUTThEnC-XE


![Image7.png](///raw/4a8/z/1f55c.png)

![Image4.png](///raw/4a8/z/1f55d.png)

![Image2.png](///raw/4a8/z/1f55e.png)

![Image3.png](///raw/4a8/z/1f55f.png)

![Image6.png](///raw/4a8/z/1f560.png)

![Image8.png](///raw/4a8/z/1f561.png)


**The Tearable Three** is a platform-style game about three stuffed toys that are trying to escape an evil laboratory where they've been imprisoned.

Each stuffed toy has different strengths and weaknesses, but each toy must also choose a body part to discard in order to escape in time.  Losing different body parts will severely effect different elements of their controls, and will effect each character differently.

Hop (or hobble!) your way to the end of the level to face your captor. Who is this beast and why is he performing these heinous experiments on you and your friends?


http://grandtheftmarmot.itch.io/the-tearable-three-release-version

entries.title: The Roasted Charge
entries.description: Roast, your friendly neighborhood fire-breathing dragon, has retired from his village burning, maiden eating days. But trouble lurks, and you spot thieves in your territory! As a good Samaritan, and as a compassionate gesture to the nearby villages, you decide to hunt down these criminals, and perhaps the good people will give you a share of the loot. Alas, Roast understands very little about collateral damage, so it is up to you to help him hunt down the thieves while preserving the villages. As much of it as possible anyway... they'll just have to understand that sacrifices must be made in the name of justice!

entries.title: The Sacrifice Must Be Maid
entries.description:
Find the young maiden Madeline among the other maids... or pay dearly.!
![Screen Shot 2018-12-04 at 9.30.51 PM.png](///raw/b8d/21/z/1ef77.png)

Use your mouse and keyboard(WASD/arrows) to move. Click on maids to interview them, gather clues on which could be Madeline. After time is up (or when you've returned to the altar door), choose Madeline correctly. BE WARNED! Madeline herself may lie to you.

![Screen Shot 2018-12-04 at 9.29.59 PM.png](///raw/b8d/21/z/1ef78.png)

Solved a bunch of bugs the day after release:
* Maids clipping environment
* Madeline's clue system incorrect
* Intro sequence doesn't trigger
* Victory soft lock
* Spawn condensed
* Option menu (and some other menu buttons) not triggering
* Dialogue hiding incorrect
* Animations incorrect
* Lighting issues
* Hourglass not showing

entries.title: hiJack
entries.description:
![s2_480.gif](///raw/7f2/3/z/1f660.gif)

Fight your way through the merciless universe. If your ship is about to explode, leave it behind and jump ship to ship.  
Beware, though, hijacking anything resets your hard-earned bonuses.  

## Controls ##  
**WASD** - *Move*  
**Mouse** - *Aim*  
**Left Mouse Button** - *Shoot*  
**Right Mouse Button/Space** - *Hijack*  

![s3__500_ships.gif](///raw/7f2/3/z/1f844.gif)

*BTW. You can hijack asteroids if you were wondering.*  
  
  
  
I opted out from graphics as the ships were a rehash from my earlier project and the cursor is by the wonderful [Kenney](https://kenney.nl/).  

As for sound, the main track was generated by [Jukedeck](https://www.jukedeck.com/), hence no audio rating. (And I picked the track and generated the lousy SFX at the very last hour anyway...).

entries.title: Super Sellout
entries.description:
![2018-12-06 05H-47M-12S.jpg](///raw/e5/z/1f357.jpg)

Hero duty for *super profit*! Monetization Man is ready to go save people from disaster, but since being a good guy doesn’t pay the bills, he’ll be needing some sponsors… or as many as he can get.

Sacrifice your integrity to earn big bucks at **Super Sellout**! Control Monetization Man, the invincible, indestructible and insufferably greedy superhero that will take any and all offers to make it through the month. Accept sponsors, give up your mobility, and try to make as much money as you can! Money, money, money!

Ah, and maybe rescue some people. At this point, that’s mostly just a courtesy. But hey. Profit!

![Halftone.png](///raw/e5/z/1ef74.png)

![MenuFeaturesSmaller.png](///raw/e5/z/1efb3.png)
- An invincible hero, people that need rescuing, and money that needs pilfering!
- Select as many sponsors as you think you can handle. Sacrifice mobility for profit!
- Some sponsors make the game harder in different ways. Juggle between common sense and rampant disregard for self-preservation!
- Saving people give you extra money and time. Don’t forget that you’re a hero for a reason!

![Halftone.png](///raw/e5/z/1ef74.png)

![MenuControlsSmaller.png](///raw/e5/z/1efb4.png)
- Play with either a keyboard or a controller (any controller works, but only the bindings of an Xbox Controller show).​
- Move with the WASD or arrow keys (Left Stick on a Xbox Controller​).​
- Press F Key (X Button on a Xbox Controller) to ~~pay respects~~ save the people when you’re close to them.​
- Press Spacebar (A Button on a Xbox Controller​) to jump.​

![Halftone.png](///raw/e5/z/1ef74.png)

![MenuCreditsSmaller.png](///raw/e5/z/1efb6.png)

DISCLAIMER: On itch.io you will find two different sets of builds, one without a subtitle, and other with **(Submission Hour)**. Due to time constraints, the submission hour build was published with some game-breaking and game-locking bugs, including one where, when the player falls off the buildings, they would be propelled backwards indefinitely. The new builds addresses these issues and fixes any potential game-breaking issues. The Web build is based on the latest build.

entries.title: Altar
entries.description:
![Altar](///content/e99/81/z/1e500.png)
You are Sylvia. You must destroy all the spiders and sacrifice them at the altars. Attack with your dagger by holding left click; you cannot move when attacking. Attack with magic by clicking right click. Toggle your magic spells by pressing 1, 2, and 3. Collect magic mana by picking up mushrooms. Spiders can only be sacrificed to the corresponding altar. (The bigger the altar, the higher the level.) Level 1 spiders are blue with orange, level 2 spiders are green with yellow, level 3 spiders are red, and level 4 spiders are silver with red spots. You can use WASD to move, and LEFT SHIFT to pick up dead spiders and bring them to altars. Good luck, and enjoy our game!

entries.title: Toga Throwdown
entries.description:
You've been brought to Olympus to battle for the favour of the gods. Sacrifice their followers with your fists to win their favour, but be warned - their benevolence is a fickle thing indeed.

**Controls**

Move - WASD/Arrows

Look - Mouse

Punch - Left Mouse Button

Jump - Spacebar

**Info**

- Slaying the follower of one god will increase your favour with the other gods.
- Slaying the follower of a god that you have high favour with will award additional points.
- Slaying Hawks reduces your favour with Hermes, the god of jumping really high.
- Slaying Minotaurs reduces your favour with Ares, the god of bloody knuckles.
- Slaying Suns reduces your favour with Apollo, the god of Usain Bolt.

**Notes**

- The game is slow to load, and may sit on a black screen for 15 or more seconds when opened.
- Everything was made by us on-site.

![TogaThrowdown_04.jpg](///raw/4eb/z/1e7bc.jpg)

entries.title: Supercharged Juggernaut Wasps
entries.description:
![Jacket.png](///raw/bfb/6/z/1e75e.png)

## Usage

*Unix*

1. Clone the project `git clone https://github.com/Gaspard--/Supercharged-Juggernaut-Wasps` or [download as zip](https://github.com/Gaspard--/Supercharged-Juggernaut-Wasps/archive/master.zip)
2. Install the [GLFW](http://www.glfw.org/), the [SFML](https://www.sfml-dev.org/) and the [FreeType](https://www.freetype.org/) libraries
3. `cd` into the project directory
4. Make the release : `mkdir release && cd release && cmake .. -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=Release && cd .. && make -C release`
5. Launch the game: `./Supercharged-Juggernaut-Wasps`
6. Enjoy!

*Windows*

Get the [zip archive](https://github.com/Gaspard--/Supercharged-Juggernaut-Wasps/releases/download/v1.0/Supercharged-Juggernaut-Wasps.zip)

## Story

It's the war ! The Big Supercharged Juggernaut Wasp and all his smols fellows are out to kick some butts.

## Gameplay

* You can use both Xbox360 controllers or mouse to play
* Tutorial in-game for the controls
* Don't hesitate to sacrifice your smol wasps : they are usefull to deflect bullets and make the enemies smaller.
* Enjoy our game :)

## Developers
* [Arthur Froger](https://github.com/Litige)
* [Jakob Kellendonk](https://github.com/Gaspard--)
* [Louis Guittard](https://github.com/TheSheepKing)
* [Matthias Rigaud](https://github.com/matthiasrigaud)

## Music
* [Jakob Kellendonk](https://soundcloud.com/gaspard-4/wasp-in-the-frost-fade-out)

entries.title: Offering Dungeon
entries.description:
Well this has been an interesting trip to say the least. My friend Carlos Motta and me decided to get back into development (after a year or so of completely stopping). Needless to say we didn't manage to complete most of our vision :sweat_smile: even after we decided to ignore graphics and use licensed assets. We would like to know what people think of the core concept more than of the presentation of the game itself.


Now for the game: 
This is a "dungeon crawler" where you have to sacrifice one of your items each time you want to advance to the next room. What happens when you don't have items to sacrifice you may ask? well you have to sacrifice your life. 

![img1.png](///raw/5fa/91/z/1e530.png)

Anyways, we hope you enjoy our shitty game and please leave any comment you may have, they will be greatly appreciated. 

![img2.png](///raw/5fa/91/z/1e55e.png)


**Disclaimer:** All the graphic assets were bought from the latest Humble Bundle RPG asset collection.

entries.title: Sploof Sacrifice Quest
entries.description:
Note: the Linux and macOS builds are untested.

This was my (Dysnomian's) very first game jam, and my first time coding in unity, Epicruins195 has done a couple of jams before and taught me how to do the unity thing. 

The game is not really finished, we spent too much time building components and drawing art (everything you see was drawn and coded during the jam), and we introduced far too many bugs in the final few hours as we madly rushed to create some actual gameplay.

More description to come once I get some sleep.

entries.title: GOPNIX
entries.description:
![promo.jpg](///raw/e53/01/z/1ecdf.jpg)

Hi guys, My name is Ola, I'm an artist who did most of the art for the game (characters/faces).

It's my second time taking part in ludum dare, together with my boyfriend, Nikita. First one was more than a year ago, And I have to admit, I've learned a lot since then :) Our first LD game did quite good, but our experience was rather stressful, and the game was kinda dark and heavy.

This time we wanted the opposite. Stress-free experience and short, funny, 2d game about something close to our heart. No stress, just fun, if we won't finish, that's A-OK~!

Our team is Polish/Ukrainian, That's why we chose slav culture as main topic of the game.

Main character, Gopnik, is spending his free time chilling on the bench. Suddenly, a wild Pigeon King arrives, demanding a tribute! Problem is, we don't have anything to give... That's why we have to use our high persuasion skills, and maybe some violence, to collect the goods of citizens passing by.

![promo2.jpg](///raw/e53/01/z/1ece0.jpg)
![promo3.jpg](///raw/e53/01/z/1ece1.jpg)

About development:

I've designed 6 characters, and prepared them for animation. Then  Grzesiek, our animator,  created  walk in unity. In "fight mode" each character has 3 faces: Base, Sad and Angry. My main goal during character creation was to make them look shitty :D Since I'm not able to do everything, Nensi took care of some additional graphics, bless her!

Another extremely important part of the game was music, which was created by ЯЩЕР (who also created well detailed BG for the scene). Fun part about music in our game, is you can actually change the songs during the gameplay.

Nikita, Grzesiek, Nikolay and Misha did scripting and all that tech things. I know shit about programming except some HTML stuff from my school times...soooo...you know.

Guys I'm so sleepy, they order me to write this, But I want to go to sleep :D
BUT
Our game is not finished hahahah, But you know what? WHATEVER, hope you like it anyway!
We'll finish this in the future for sure, so stay tuned for all the updates!

Good night!

entries.title: Ritual Slaughter
entries.description:
**Ritual Slaughter!**

![Ritual_Slaughter_Cover_Art.png](///raw/5a4/2/z/1e6e1.png)

In this game, Lucifer is trying to destroy the world, and the worlds only hope is you- or are you in it for just the power gained? You must sacrifice parts of game mechanics to summon Lucifer, making it more difficult to defeat him, once he is dead, the world is saved, and you can do whatever with your newly gained power.. just don't let it get to your head..

**Other info**

Lucifer is an Archangel gone bad, a man gone sour. He hated gods creation, and wants to destroy it. You must stop him.

In the battle, he has 3 Phases. 

Phase 1 is pretty simple, he will chase you with his blade and claws and slash at you, all while summoning demons to attack you.

Phase 2(at 200HP) he gets faster, and grows his wings out- flying after you and shooting fireballs- and spawning even more demons.

Phase 3(at 50HP) he gets quicker with his fireballs.

The small demons can be killed for a chance to drop more ammunition for you.

Good luck! You may need it~

Check out the Guide at the bottom of the description if you need an explanation on what to do :D 

**Tools**

Credits are in game

I used the Unity game engine, with VSCode (Language: C#)

Used Aseprite and Paint.Net for art (me)

Used Aseprite and PainttoolSAI for art (Nikki - [Deviantart](https://www.deviantart.com/nikkifexixthedragon))

Music done by me - Recorded using Audacity and my Guitar

SFX done by me using BFXR


**Controls**

Keyboard and mouse will only work- Controller will not properly work.

Movement - W,A,S,D

Attacking - LMB & RMB (Left click and right click)

Interact - E



**Guide (just in case - and since I didn't have time to make things more obvious sadly)**

Get the spray paint and paint the pentagram on the ground in the building.

Then get the metal bowl (for the spell items, of course), and place that in the center of the pentagram.

Grab your weapons and ammo- The colt, and the Archangel blade.

Summon Lucifer by selecting 5 game mechanics to sacrifice.

Down Lucifer with your gun - Kill the small demons for extra ammo.

Then when he's downed, kill him with the Archangel blade (RMB when near him).

Touch his Angelic soul, and choose your ultimate power!

Go to the door at the top of the building (above the pentagram) and leave to the end!

Be sure to read your end-game summary after leaving the ritual for your stats, and a little description about your sacrifices and what they caused- along with what you get from your "Ultimate Power" >;)

**Thanks for playing! I hope you enjoy!**

entries.title: Volcano Rush
entries.description:
![love_2018-12-03_18-43-36.png](///raw/1f3/1/z/1e57b.png)

The great volcano god is angry, and the beasts of the island answer its cry for sustenance - alas, the god is both fickle and picky, and his tastes change at a whim. Fortunately, you are one of those gifted with the power to hear the volcano god's demands and answer them. Hold off the stampede of creatures and obey your god's commands, or else a dire fate shall befall all!

Gamepad and keyboard supported. Up/down to move between lanes. Press the A button/Z key to punch enemies until they're stunned, then either press right to throw them into the volcano, or left to reject them.

The god's satiation will constantly run down, and complicating matters, his preferences change at intervals. He will demand one type of creature and refuse one type of creature at all times; throwing him a creature he wants will satisfy him and prevent his satiation from dropping for a few seconds, while throwing him a creature he doesn't want will have no effect on his hunger but put a strike against you. Throwing him a creature he neither demands nor refuses will prevent his satiation from dropping briefly.

If the god's satiation runs out, you feed him a creature he refuses three times, or a single lane has no more room for new enemies to spawn, the god will become enraged, the volcano will erupt, and the game will end!

entries.title: Dungeon Sacrificer
entries.description:
![Capture3.png](///raw/d01/f1/z/1eb33.png)

## Story
Dungeon Sacrificer is a game where the devil spirits take control over the Ofgreet's Kingdom and steals the princess. They also stole the villagers's souls.

## Goal
Your goal is to fight through numerous dungeons at the south of the village to defeat the devil spirits. But watch out, if you die during your dungeon, you will lose a villager and his power coming with it. For example, if your bowyer dies, you may not buy bows anymore! At the end of each dungeons, you will be able to buy stuffs from the devil in exchange of a villager sacrifice. Oh and don't forget to buy new equipment at the village to become stronger.


## Controls
Move: WASD,

Interact: E,

Drink potion: Q,

Attack: Left Click,

Weapon Switch: 1,2 & 3,

Skip Dialog: Space,

## Tools
Game made with Unity 2018.2.18f1,

Music & sfx with ableton live 10.0.5,

Villagers assets with Fantasy Heroes: Character Editor,

Graphics with Photoshop.


![Capture4.png](///raw/d01/f1/z/1e5e9.png)

## Change Log

`Post-Patch note: Fixed a bug that prevented the player to exit the dungeon 3 and broke the game`

We won't lie to you, we ran out of time. In fact we had college on monday. It didn't really help, but hey, it's part of the game !

entries.title: Vampyre
entries.description:
Vampyre is a game about a vampire on a quest towards satisfaction.
Transform into a bat to fly towards victory!

This game was made to look like an NES game, using primarilly
colors found in SMB3. I had this idea for a game four years ago, 
where I created a prototype using the same transformation mechanics.
I saw the potential in the idea, and the theme suited it quite well.
I hope you enjoy it!

**CONTROLS**

- A and D to move left and right.
- S to crouch.
- S + SPACE to transform between bat and human.
- SPACE as a bat to shoot fangs.

**OBS** 
- The Post-Jam versions are updated versions of the game, made post the deadline.
- For the web host, please don't open the game in fullscreen.
- This game needs to run in a 5:4 aspect ratio.

**NOTES**
- Sorry for no MAC version. I don't have a MAC handy. Please use the web host.
- Sadly I don't have a clue how to make music, so this game doesn't have any.

**RELEASES**

    04/12/2018
    - Tweaked movement as both human and bat to be less slippery.
    - Updated the door sprite and the key sprite.
    - Fang projectiles now obstruct the sunlight! (This is merely aesthetic).
    - Sprite overlapping issues
    - Added a black border on the left of the screen, simulating Mario bros 3.
    - Resolution changes

entries.title: A Blood God's Virgin Voyage
entries.description:
Sacrifices must be made. You are a blood god, with the goal of returning to the mortal plane. In order to do this, you must sacrifice a virgin at your altar. You can bring them to life, but the altar is four rooms away.


![abgvv4.PNG](///raw/764/2/z/1e562.png)


## Mechanics

The game is played in three rotating phases:

1. Spawn -- you must create a new virginal Loved One in the the Blood God's Chamber at the beginning of every turn. This costs 1 Soul, and if you enter the Spawn phase with 0 Soul you will lose.

2. Encounter -- when you have rooms with at least three Loved Ones, a random encounter will occur. This only happens in rooms that have at least three Loved Ones. You will be forced to make a choice: you can make the Loved Ones fight to the death and preserve their virgin status with the winner gaining Strength, or they can kiss and lose their virgin status (but both will gain a Strength point).

3. Act -- by selecting a room using the arrows in the bottom left, you may choose a single action per turn:

    Rest: yield your action, with no effect to Soul or Loved Ones

   ​Advance: choose a Loved One to move to the front of the line in a particular room

   ​Open Door: the Loved One at the front of the line will hold the door open, allowing those behind to move to the next room. The number of Loved Ones that move is determined by the Strength of the Loved One holding the door (e.g. 2 STR allows 2 Loved Ones to advance). The door holder will then be crushed by the door.

   ​Touch the Idol: the Loved One at the front of the line can touch the Idols in the Corridor of Hope and the Corridor of Despair. This allows you to consume them for an increase in Soul:

      ​​Weakling non-virgins (STR: 0): 0 Soul

      ​​Weak non-virgins (STR: 1): 2 Soul

      ​​Strong non-virgins (STR: > 1): 4 Soul

      ​​Virgins: 6 + STR Soul

Your goal is to pass a virgin through the final door, beyond the Entry to the Altar room. Good luck!


## Credit

Designed and created by Zak Reynolds and Clint Glenn

Graphical and musical assets are original, created with the help of Pickle Editor, FL Studio, Serum, and Audacity. Sound effects were created with help from resources in the GDC audio pack, Image-Line samples, and freesound.org.

Font: https://www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/almendra​

Built with Unity.


## Philosophy

We wanted to create a game that involved sacrifice at every level. The easy choice for a setting (a blood god using sacrifices to take over the world) eventually resulted in what we thought were some interesting mechanics. Playing this game, you lose something at just about every turn -- some Soul at the beginning, either a Loved One or someone's virginity at the Encounter phase, and you often trade a Loved One for advancement in the Act phase. It leads you to a lot of calculated risk decisions, and you're hopefully often left feeling like you've lost something-- making the joy you feel (when RNGesus rewards your risk-taking) that much better.

The names of the Loved Ones were intended to be provided by the player for an extra layer of sadism, but we unfortunately (or fortunately?) did not have the time to implement that feature. Instead, there are some random names, but hopefully the relationship 'modifiers' will still lead to some drama and fun when it comes to deciding whether to make the Loved Ones kill or "kiss" each other.

We also focused on the gameplay tuning and design prior to anything else -- at the end of Friday night we had nothing but notes, and there weren't any graphics in the unity project until halfway through Sunday! There are some visual bugs and not a lot of polish as a result, but we hope that you can enjoy the game for its gameplay.


## Screenshots

![abgvv2.PNG](///raw/764/2/z/1e55d.png)

![abgvv3.PNG](///raw/764/2/z/1e55f.png)

![abgvv5.PNG](///raw/764/2/z/1e567.png)

entries.title: Demon Queen's Possessions
entries.description:
## The Demon queen wants to take over the world!

Her power: **Possession**. However it **requires Sacrifices**.

Lead the queen to world domination, by managing the sacrifices and controlling! the units.

From peasant to Hero, passing by Goblin, nothing will be spared. Use your cleverness to Create spirit value from "nothing". (You'll see, it seems like you can "grow" your army, but you can! It's tricky though)


![demonqueengif.gif](///raw/49b/1/z/1f58e.gif)
[scrsht_12.png](///raw/49b/1/z/1df69.png)

Choose units to possess, choose units to sacrifice and Blam! Fresh army units! And if that doesn't work you can always fight!

![scrsht_16.png](///raw/49b/1/z/1e488.png)

It is a hard game, but here is proof that it is possible!

![scrsht_19.png](///raw/49b/1/z/1f58f.png)
### take the challenge!
[My best](https://static.jam.vg/raw/49b/1/z/1f590.png) ( I was sooo close to zero kills, but i'm pretty sure its impossible, that was with a very careful, knowing all rounds approach I think its the best possible.)

Some Tips:
- Goat has the ability to increase its spirit value.
- Sacrifice & Possession > Fighting. By a lot actually, you can almost not fight at all.
- The campaign is 25 levels and they are always the same: Yes you can **"Learn from playthroughs"** to optimize approach.
- You can split 1 high level units for many lower level units, The stars must match, but dont be afraid to downgrade.

entries.title: The Cost of Living
entries.description:
Play as 8A-Terry, a small robot on a mission: Bringing batteries to his significant other. However, you also need the batteries' energy to get to her! How much energy will you sacrifice in order to reach her in time ?



Basic Controls:

Left/Right Arrows - Move

Up Arrow/Space - Jump

Down Arrow - Crouch

C and V - Upgrades



Upgrades:

Dash (Costs 5 energy): Quickly dash forward a short distance. You are invincible during the dash.

Burn (Costs 10 energy): Burn flammable objects. 

Climb (Costs 15 energy): Activate Climb to be able to climb up walls for 2 seconds. Simply run to a wall after activation to start climbing!

Double Jump (Costs 5 energy):  Activate Double Jump whilst mid-air to perform a second jump to go further and higher!



Be mindful when getting new abilities, as grabbing a new one means sacrificing another!

![TheCostOfLiving.png](///raw/928/e1/z/1e421.png)![TheCostOfLiving2.png](///raw/928/e1/z/1e425.png)
