Attempt to weather living as a transient on the city streets. You must do what is right for yourself and for your companion if you are to survive. Manage your Hunger, Thirst, and Sleep Deprivation across you and your companion.

entries.title: Box Explorer
entries.description:
## I’m a member of Team JMCJ, and this is our Ludum Dare Jam 43 entry!

![title_screen.jpg](///raw/b61/c/z/1e249.jpg)

Box Explorer is an infinite adventure/exploration game. In the game, you are trying to trip switches that are hidden around the map. Once all of them are tripped, the portal to the next level is opened. However, there are enemies who have other ideas. Use the power-ups scattered around the map and advancing to the next level to gain levels and become stronger. However, the enemies become stronger too. See how far you can get before you die!

**How did we apply the theme?** All bullets shot will bounce off the walls a couple of times, so you have to make sure that your aim is good. Therefore, shooting a bullet has the potential to be a sacrifice (of your health). Also, all power-ups scattered around the map have both positive and negative attributes, so you have to make a choice and see if that power-up is worth its trade-offs. (Also, we sacrificed all the graphics our graphics guy made because of reasons (sorry David))

### Guide

![2018-12-03 22_29_44-Window.png](///raw/b61/c/z/1e749.png)

This is you, the player. The green shows you the front of your character, or where you will shoot from. Use **WASD** to move and **Left-Click** to shoot. Use the mouse to aim.

![2018-12-03 22_31_53-Window.png](///raw/b61/c/z/1e74a.png)

This is an enemy. They aren't your friend. They will always move towards you and periodically shoot bullets at you. So try to kill them with your bullets.

Around the room, there will be 4 black boxes right on the edge of the screen. These are hallways to adjacent rooms. Moving onto them transitions you to the next room.

![2018-12-03 22_49_29-Window.png](///raw/b61/c/z/1e74c.png)

However, these black boxes that are in the middle of the rooms are the switches! Run into it to turn it green, meaning you have tripped it. The number of remaining switches is on your HUD

![2018-12-03 22_55_53-Window.png](///raw/b61/c/z/1e756.png)

Any other randomly colored boxes are Power-ups! The color shows the level of powerup (gray, light-green, blue, purple). Run up to it to see what it would do to your player. If you want the powerup, simply press **Space** and you will obtain the powerup.

![2018-12-03 23_05_49-Window.png](///raw/b61/c/z/1e77f.png)

When you trip all the switches, the big red box in the starting room turns green. This is your portal to the next level. Running up to it will advance the level. When you do, you will get 3 HP and +1 to a random stat. However, all the enemies stats raise too. So watch out!

The game goes on forever! See how far you can get!

![Untitled.png](///raw/b61/c/z/1e311.png)

**Box Explorer requires Java 8 or later.** If you use OpenJDK, make sure you also have OpenJFX installed.

This is our second ever Ludum Dare game. We were able to use a lot of the knowledge we acquired from the last one (along with some of the code) in order to help us make a better game. While the graphics probably don't look as good as our last game, we feel like the game overall is better (from a code standpoint at least). Hopefully this trend continues and whenever you see us next, it'll be an even better game.

While we could've used things like Unity or GameMaker to help speed along the process of making the game, 75% of our team are current Computer Science students who enjoy the grind of problem-solving and writing a lot of code. At the end of the day, we care more about the experience of working on a big-ish project than how amazing the game plays out. So, at the end of the day, we are happy with the outcome. And we're sharing it with you in case you want to try it out. Treat it like a Proof of Concept game. Because that's basically what it is.

Enjoy!

### Credits
* Parker: Development
* Trevor: Development and Math
* Jack: Development and Static
* David: Graphics that we didn't end up using (sorry) and Audio

### We have published a version that contains code written after the Jam ended. It fixes a minor screen size issue, but otherwise remains the same to the LD version. Test whichever version your heart says is the correct version to test for rating.

### Look out for some timelapse and Gource videos in the near future!

entries.title: Be Near My Little Ones
entries.description:
![screen03.jpg](///raw/629/2/z/1efcf.jpg)

This is a game about the things responsible for those noises you hear in the woods.. it's also a game about the ones who know what to do about them.

Be Near is an eerie stealth game where the answers to a peoples' problems lie in relics and altars. Your goal is to sneak around the woods and find relics on the forest floor to bring back to each altar while avoiding what lurks there.. or just close your eyes. Three relics and three altars are located throughout the woods, each represented by a different symbol.  

 - PC Controls -

Sprint - Hold Shift

Interact - F

Sneak - Hold Space

Close Your Eyes - Hold Q

Look - Mouse Position

Move - WASD

Pause - Escape

entries.title: Screw them
entries.description:
Update:
We made a Post-Jam Version with some Improvements(Post-Processing effects and UI labes for all actions)
https://rac-games.itch.io/screw-them-post-jam-version

In the final hour we had issues with our sound effects.  After some hours of sleep, these issues have been resolved and you can now play Screw Them with all the MOOs you need.

Sound Version: https://rac-games.itch.io/screw-them-version-with-sounds

Screw them is a "Hack an Slay game where you play a robot who´s planet is invaded by evil cows. 

This team is an open university gamejam group. Nobody in the team is a fullfletched developer, artist or anything relevant to game design. This year we had a lot of new interested students in our team. They started programming in this gamejam and learned alot.
  

COMMENT BY THE DEVELOPERS:

Because of our time limit and some problems, we didn’t manage to create a Storyline. There are two Redeyebulls in the west and in the north- east and in the south are Cow-Hydras. You have to kill all the cows to save your planet. To get bigger and Stronger u have to disassemble your friends.
The textures of our game are all self-drawn, apart from the ground textures. 
 

CONTROLS:

left mouse:                klick to move

right mouse:               whirlwind attack

Shift + left mous:         straight shoot

E:                         disassemble your friends 


HOW IT WENT:

Our final idea was a hack and slay game. Fastly we drifted in to a crazy and funny game where cows with lightsabers want to kill you and control your planet. All in all it was a smoth proces but in the end we focused on not so necessary parts of the game. We had a lot of Soundtracks and three fully animated Bosses. When the time run out we had a problem with the NavMesh. So we had to cut some parts out of the game. 


![intro.gif.gif](///raw/dd5/2/z/1e73d.gif)
![disabel1.gif](///raw/dd5/2/z/1ebe1.gif)
![gameplay1.gif](///raw/dd5/2/z/1ebe2.gif)


Have fun! We are happy about every comment and rating.

Post-Jam Version:
- better movement
- you cann kill all bosses
- the east area is now walkable

entries.title: ForgeKnight
entries.description:
![logo-thumbnail.png](///raw/a67/8/z/1e660.png)

## **Description**
Your kingdom is being invaded by a herd of Orcs and is it up to your trusty Knight and his team of an Archer and a Mage to put an end to this madness.

![ForgeKnight_ScreenShot1.png](///raw/a67/8/z/1f2f5.png)

ForgeKnight borrows elements from RPG, Tower Defense, and Clicker as waves of enemies comes towards your party and your party automatically attacks them while you manager your EXP (experience points) to level them up to be strong enough to defeat them.

## **How to play**
Manage your EXP to level up your party in order to survive 10 waves of enemies.

![ForgeKnight_ScreenShot2.png](///raw/a67/8/z/1f2f6.png)

## **Theme Implementation**
- You must sacrifice a percentage of your EXP to revive your party
- You may choose to sacrifice some EXP to increase the total EXP defeated enemies give you

![ForgeKnight_ScreenShot3.png](///raw/a67/8/z/1f2f7.png)

## **Controls**
- **Everything**:  Mouse Click
- **Quit**: ESC (PC only)


## **Team**
- **Designer/Programmer**: Nelson
- **UI Designer**: Michael

This time around my usual team was not able to participate in the jam with my graphic artist only having time to provide the UI graphics. Because of this, I opted to borrow assets from our previous entries as well as use freely available resources for sprites, animations, and music.

All the game code was done during the jam.


## **Resources**
- https://craftpix.net/
- https://www.gameart2d.com/
- https://ragewortt.itch.io/fantasy-heroes-character-sprites
- https://opengameart.org/content/fantasy-ui-elements-by-ravenmore
- https://answers.unity.com/questions/1074261/make-a-sprite-blink-white-when-hit.html


## **Disclaimer**
The game idea was preconceived before the jam and I updated it to match the theme but all the work to put the game together and code it was done during the jam. 

## **Developer Notes**
The WebGL was crashing at first because I did not notice the large size all the images I was using were. It took me a while but once I understood the issue it was easy to fix. Both the WebGL and the PC version have been updated to use the smaller scaled images to reduce the memory they use and avoid memory allocation and crashing bugs.

## ***Known issues**
Also, I did not spend too much time balancing the game an there is a possibility that if you are clicking too fast and you die, you may hit the restart button by mistake. I'm sorry about that but the game is short :)

## **Final Thoughts**
Though this is not my first game jam, it was the first time I competed semi-alone and had to wear multiple hats as designer and programmer working with genres I'm not too familiar with.

The experience was fun and I learned a lot about design and I feel like I leveled up in my Unity programming which is always a plus! :)

entries.title: Horny Demons
entries.description:
NSFW/18+

Survive the day to day grind while sacrificing your prisoners to the horned ones. 

**About**

Horny Demons is a deck building game in which you must gather resources in order to summon demons and gain their power. Keep up appearances as a normal, productive member of society until you can summon the horniest of the horny. There's also a cameo of the succubus from our [main game​](https://www.patreon.com/teaminfernus) as one of the greater demons​.

**How to Play**

You start each turn with a new hand of five cards. Click and drag up to three cards each turn to the pentagram to play them. You lose 1 Food plus 1 Food per Prisoner each turn, so make sure to stock up. You lose when you run out of Food. When you gather enough resources, you can summon demons by offering the supple bodies of your prisoners as tribute. Collect powerful cards from the demons as you work your way up the demonic food chain, from lesser to greater to Satan herself. 

**Content Warning**

This is a game about a cult that takes prisoners and sacrifices them to demons. Do not base your real life relationships on a video game sex cult. 

**Screenshots**

![Screenshot (25).png](///raw/12b/e/z/1e9cb.png)

![Screenshot (26).png](///raw/12b/e/z/1e9cc.png)

![Screenshot (28).png](///raw/12b/e/z/1e9d3.png)

entries.title: Sheepy
entries.description:
Lore: 
The shepherd has broken his leg on a rock out on his days work his sheep will sacrifice themselves to help him get home, Guide the sheep into the holes to allow the shepherd who cant jump because of his injury to pass over.     
                                                                                                                                  
Features:                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                          
Done:                                                                                                                              
Sheep Physics- Picking Up And Dropping,                                                                                       
shepherd Player - Movement and Camera,                                                                                        
Levels 1-4,                                                                                                                     
Basic Audio,                                                                                                                  
Graphics,                                                                                                                      
Menu,                                                                                                                            
                                                                                                                                   
UnDone:                                                                                                                        
Sheep Free Movement - (Sheep wander and follow you),                                                                         
More and Original Audio,                                                                                                      
More Levels,                                                                                                                  
More Uses for the Sheep - (Other than just filling in holes,                                                                      
Bug Fixing/Testing,                                                                                                                
Polish - (Ran out of time for this so a lot of unused assets etc are still in the files),                                        
                                                                                                                             
Description:                                                                                                                  
Sheepy is a fun, hypercasual game in which the shepherd must drag and place his sheep into holes to fill them in                order to reach the flag. Play through multiple levels of varying difficulty and with stunning graphics as you                learn how to control the sheep.                                                                                                           
Remember, you can never have enough sheep!                                                                                    
                                                                                                                             
THEME:                                                                                                                       
It relates to the theme "Sacrifices must be made" as the shepherd's sheep must be put into holes. In turn, the                         shepherd is leaving his sheep behind to progress in the level                                                                  
                                                                                                                                
SOFTWARE USED:                                                                                                                 
Engine - Unity,                                                                                                              
Graphics - MagicaVoxel,                                                                                                       
Sounds- Youtube (Hope to Rework with Own Sounds in Future),                                                                      
                                                                                                                           
CONTROLS (In Game as well)                                                                                                     
Movement - WASD,                                                                                                                  
Picking Up Sheep - Click with Mouse Then Drag Well Holding Left Mouse Button,                                                    
Dropping Sheep - Release Left Mouse Button,                                                                                   
Level Select - Press Button 1,2,3,4 depending on what level you wish to play,                                               
Instructions - Press I,                                                                                                     
Menu to Level Select - Press E,                                                              
Jump - There is None ;)                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                          
                                                                                                                        
Any Issues or Bugs just post down below as all help is appreciated :)                                                      
We hope to continue improving this game in the future as we only spent 15-24                                             
hours on it and there is a lot to add and a lot of bugs to fix                                                           
                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                             
Thanks for taking the time to look at Our game :)

entries.title: The Fallen Prince
entries.description:
![MainMenu.png](///raw/973/6/z/1e57f.png)

#### **The Fallen Prince**

## Story
You were once the prince your father's kingdom. 
You were once loved by all. 
You were once the, soon to be, heir.

Relations with your family were always of the highest priority. Everyone liked you. The elegant prince who excelled at swordsmanship and magic. Little did they know that you had an affinity for dark magic at birth. Curious as you've always been, you delved deeper into the source of your Dark Power in search for the origin. It made you stronger and you learned of powers of which only a necromancer could dream of, yet unlike most users of dark magic, you had no intention of using your power for evil purposes.

That is until the king went on a hunting trip. Bandits swarmed the royal hunting party, yet they were overwhelmed by the sheer amount of hostiles. You, as the prince, tried your best to save your father and brother, alas your normal powers were not up to the task. As you unlocked the powers of dark magic within, the bandits got obliterated seconds thereafter. Stunned by the whole ordeal the people who saw the outburst of violent magic did not know how to react and as soon as the hunting party returned to the capital rumors began to spread. Within a day you got put on a trial for dabbling in dark magic. Even your family did not know how to react as practicing dark magic is one of the most frowned upon acts one can commit. You were soon to be exiled. Banned from your own home and country. Mad, confused and spiteful you begin your new quest for survival.

Why did it have to be this way, you only tried to save what was dear to you. Why does it matter that you used dark magic when you used it for a purpose that is good and clear?

After years of hardships, training and searching for an answer, you came to the conclusion that the root cause of this problem is the Kingdom itself. The people, the ruling class, everyone... is responsible for this outcome. You paid them with your loyalty, now it is time for them to pay you back. 

## Controls
- **Arrow Keys** | Walk & Jump
- **Z** | Attack (can combo three times for more damage and knockback)
- **X** | Sacrifice a minion for health
- **ESC/P** | (Un)Pause the game

- You win when all of the enemies are killed.
- You lose when your character dies.

## Features
- 2D Platforming
- Hack'n'slash action
- Sacrifice your kingdom's population to fuel your army
- Sacrifice your army to fuel yourself
- An army of minions

## About the Jam
Solo Entry... 
This LD was a lot of fun for me as I had a (personally) good concept to start with... YET I threw my first idea away completely after 20 hours of work. So I started over and created this game. I feel proud of this game, art-wise especially, even though it is clunky at times and really short... sorry for that. The concept was way too big though, but I think I managed to get the most important features for it to be playable in, I guess.
Have fun playing it and I'm looking forward to feedback :) 

## The Future
I really liked working on this project and therefore I will keep on working on this project after Ludum Dare. It will gain a lot more features than it has. Most of them are already in a rough testing phase.
- More and varied enemies.
  - Archers, Pike-men, Knight (mounted and unmounted), different types of villagers, priests who resurrect the dead back to life, and so on.
- Boss Battles
  - Show the mighty figureheads of the Kingdom that throne is yours alone. Fight against fierce bosses and maybe even your own family.
- Upgrades
  - Your army might need to become a little stronger before you march on the Kingdom's Citadel. Upgrade their armor, weapons, skills and mutate them. 
  - Upgrade your character and gain more skills while upgrading existing ones.
- Different landscapes
- The Complete Story (as it has been written, but I had no time or space to implement all of it yet)
- Better Combat
  - I mean, it is kinda clunky at times, so it could use an upgrade.
- AI Commands
  - Make sure that your army is doing what it needs to do 
- **And anything else you guys, the players, want to see in the game

## Media
![Tutorial 1.png](///raw/973/6/z/1e661.png)
**more to come soon, need some sleep first**

entries.title: Ghostly Getaway
entries.description:
You've been caught...

Your wife...
Your kids...
Your freedom...

They all have been taken away from you.

You can take 'em back...
...but it may require a sacrifice.

![SCS1.png](///raw/989/d/z/1e791.png)

**Ghostly Getaway** is a puzzle game where you have to sacrifice your own body to escape from the prison. It’s made by **Mors**, **Renhoek**, **Darkonius Mavakar**, **Cruise Elroy**, **Sooshy**, and **Catonator** for Ludum Dare 43!

You can move **Poncho** using the arrow keys, and use the A key for interactions.

This game has a save function, you can continue later from where you dropped off.

![SCS2.png](///raw/989/d/z/1e792.png)

**Changelog:**

**1.0.3:** Fixed an issue with the intro music, I can't believe we missed that.

**1.0.2:** Fixed some level design oversights, fixed issues related to blocks on ice, fixed an issue that prevented deleting save files.

**1.0.1:** Fixed some unsolvable puzzles, added the Windows port.

**1.0.0:** Initial release.

entries.title: Super Smashed Bros
entries.description:
![Untitled.png](///raw/3ea/2/z/1e5e7.png)

Uh-Oh. Looks like you've gone and pissed off the gods again. This time they've thrown you into an eternal game of Super Smash Bros, but something seems a bit off...


Take control of Tony and Vinny, two drunk Bronx natives doomed to forever duel in this battle of super smashed brothers. They're so drunk, they're required to forget seven moves and/or stocks (lives).

# Controls

**WASD:** Movement

**Arrow Keys:** Attack in that direction

 

In the game lobby, perform your sacrifices and try out the controls before starting the game!

 

 


**NOTE** This game is entirely online multiplayer. If no one is online grab some friends! Be gentle on the server though. Server is US based so ping will be bad to other parts of the world.

entries.title: The Needs of the Many
entries.description:
In "The Needs of the Many", you must keep a small group of survivors alive as long as possible. Keeping with the theme of Ludum Dare 43, sometimes sacrifices must be made of survivors to keep the rest alive. When your life is on the line, are you above cannibalism or burning your friend for warmth?

This was my fifth Ludum Dare, and it never stops being both incredibly fun and frustrating the entire way through. I didn't have nearly as much time to work on the project as I would have liked as finals week is coming up, but with what little I had, i'm happy with the result. Please enjoy "The Needs of the Many"!

Controls:
- Click on the Fire to access the fuel options
- Click on the Food Cooler to access the food options
- Click on the Cabin Door to send your survivors out on a scavenging mission.

entries.title: Insertsoul
entries.description:
![InsertSoulBig.png](///raw/1a7/21/z/1e273.png)
A puzzle adventure game about express sacrifices and time manipulation.

You need to collect 100 souls in less than 10 minutes.

The game guides you through all the different mechanics involved.

Hope you like it!

## Controls
* Left/right arrow keys: Move.
* Up arrow key: Interact.
* X: Fire (or use equipped item).
* R: Start/Stop recording your actions (when unlocked).
* P: Start/Stop playing your recorded actions (when unlocked).
* 1-9: Change the playing speed of your recorded actions.
* F10: Open the menu (hint: you can also record and play your interactions with the menu).

entries.title: Dungeon of Dangerous Magic
entries.description:
Travel deep into the dungeon, finding weapons and magic along the way...
The spells are useful, and often necessary, but don't get carried away! They drain your maximum HP.

See controls on GameJolt page.

entries.title: The Moth Shepherd
entries.description:
![title.jpg](///raw/1bb/02/z/1f06a.jpg)

The ancient Darkness threatens to envelop the world, extinguishing all light and putting all the moths into a sleep without waking. To overcome the Darkness and bring forth the Light, the lonely Shepherd sets out to reach the Great Tree. He will create a new future for his people at any cost necessary, even if the price is his own life.

- Guide the Shepherd through the gloomy locations of this side-scrolling platformer.
- Keep track of your matchstick torch, don’t let the Darkness overcome you!
- Your moth companions are willing to sacrifice themselves to keep your torch going, make it count!
- Enjoy the game

![image_2018-12-05_13-24-57.png](///raw/1bb/02/z/1f131.png)

![image_2018-12-05_13-28-07.png](///raw/1bb/02/z/1f132.png)

entries.title: I MUST BELONG
entries.description:
How to Play - 

A and D for movement 

Space for shoot

Left mouse click for buttons.


The Story

Once upon a time there was a world called “Marziphon”. One day a metheoride crushed the ground, and cursed all Marziphonians. Because of the curse, their nightmares became portals for magical creatures, ”Magicis Cadem” they called it. Magical Massacres.
A Hundered years later, another event occured in Marziphon. A Mage called “Onnm” found a way to unlift this curse. The solution was a spell which he called “banisment of nightmares”, with the spell, nobody would ever see any nightmares, but there was a problem, most needed ingredeent for the spell was human blood. He  gathered as many villagers as he can and found the city of Intyham, with it, Onnm can gather blood and sacrifice some for all. After he casted the spell, Marziphon’s ground shattered and formed lots of rifts which are full of deamonic powers. He banished nightmares but called something more horrific. At the last sequance of banishment spell, a flying Demon appeared on the sky, he took Onnm and disappeared.

After the disappearence of Onnm, the folk of Intyham re-forged Onnm’s staff and shaped as solid magical stones. Then they build a huge rapmart which defended all Intyham from the demon itself.

​

https://youtu.be/9AevVcWmUxI

entries.title: De-Railed
entries.description:
![banner.png](///raw/583/3/z/1e7e9.png)
De-Railed is a narative-driven 2D platformer in which you play an engineer of a train gathering wayward souls to the last bastion of humanity in a postapocalyptic America. With a limited number of supplies, you can't take everything with you. Sacrifices must be made.

DE RAILED is from 3/4ths of the team that brought you ATLANTIS (LD38), Off The Hook (LD41), and DETRITUS (LD42). We're excited to return again for our fourth completed game!

entries.title: Sacrifice
entries.description:
A text-based game where you have to make a sacrifice.

In order to run the game you must be able to run python scripts.

entries.title: Effigy
entries.description:
![effbanner.jpg](///raw/0d6/3/z/1e503.jpg)

Sacrifices must be made...and then burnt! Arrange bales of hay into the specified effigy shape, then set them on fire as tribute to whatever deity you desire.

But watch out, some hasty individuals are attempting to set your effigy alight before it is complete! Whichever deity you're sacrificing to, you can bet they only accept complete sacrifices. Make sure to put out any unwanted fires using your bucket of water!


** Includes Online Multiplayer! **

Make sure if you see others online you challenge them to an effigy building contest! Be sure to set their effigy on fire before it is complete to nullify their sacrifice!

*You should receive a notification even in single player that someone has challenged you*

** Controls **

** WASD **: Character Movement

** Mouse **: Character Facing

**E** (Contextual): Pickup & Put down Bales of Hay.  Refresh Water Charges at the Well.

** Left Click **: Light a bale of hay on fire.

** Right Click **: Use water to put out fire.

** Mouse Wheel **: Zoom

** Notes: **

-You can pick up more than 1 bale of straw.

-Overlapping bales are acceptable as long as your effigy shape is covered.

-Our water pickup sound isn't working but you can see your water charges in top left of UI

entries.title: Subject 43
entries.description:
Hello, User.

You have 43 subjects available.

Each new subject will adapt to the dangers faced by the previous dead subject by developing skills to surpass the challenges that the previous one failed to.

entries.title: CUTE ROBOTS
entries.description:
A short RTS-style game made in PICO-8, where your goal is to make robots to defeat a big alien monster.

The catch? You have to kill small, cute robots to do it!

CONTROLS:

Arrow Keys

Z to confirm/open menu

X to close menu

HOW TO PLAY:

Open the menu and navigate to robots to select them. After selecting them, hit “send” to send them to go gather resources. Eventually they will return but unable to work any more.

Tips:
-You need to make a total of 6 Big Robots to win.
-Sometimes, robots will stop moving while gathering resources. If this happens, you'll have to kill them. (I'd like to pretend this is a feature but it's just a glitch i didnt have time to fix, oops)

![CUTEROBOTS3.png](///raw/12a/d1/z/1e4d2.png)
![CUTEROBOTS2.png](///raw/12a/d1/z/1e4da.png)

Enjoy!!

All assets made by Aren T

entries.title: Deity Hook-Up (Not A Romance)
entries.description:
You are a witchling and there are very important exams ahead of you.

Will you be able to convince a Deity to help you out?

First-person visual novel where **each choice matters**.

* **Concept**, **Writing**: mehtoh & ynneblack
* **Code**, **Art**, **Design**: ynneblack
* **Sound effects**: Freesound.org (detailed credits in game's "About"!)
* **Time**: +- 24 h 50 min
* **Software**: Ren'Py (code), Notepad++ (code), Photoshop (art + design), SketchUp (perspective)

![game_screenshot3.jpg](///raw/8f0/e1/z/1ef35.jpg)

This is my first LD challenge + first game ever! It was really challenging and most of it was trial-and-error, but I hope it's playable and maybe even a little bit fun. I would be really glad for any feedback to learn from this experience as much as I can. I did imagine it scalable (making the game longer) from the very start, so I'm hoping to make an expanded version later, but first I would like to make sure the version for LD works as intended!

![game_screenshot2.jpg](///raw/8f0/e1/z/1ef36.jpg)

2018/12/05: I added an "Extra" screen to show unlocked endings. For anyone interested, they are in an updated version of the game (*different* download file with "_extra" at the end). The only difference from the jam file is the "Extra" screen, though!

entries.title: Silent Whisper
entries.description:
A narrative game revolving around four soldiers, and their journey back home.

Through various points in the game, you'll be faced with tough decisions. Who to save, who to let die. When to run, when to fight. Ultimately, you'll need to sacrifice some lives if you're going to accomplish your mission.

There are two distinct endings, and multiple ways to die along the way. Most actions will cost you time; something you'll need plenty of if you want to stay ahead of the enemy nation Ulmach's front lines.

Every decision has an impact. Not all outcomes are seen. Such are the realities of war.

![ld43_1.jpg](///raw/91/z/1e18a.jpg)

### Controls
A mouse with a scroll wheel is highly recommended.

If, for some reason, your mouse lacks such fantastical features, you can grab the little black mark on the right of a text box to scroll manually.

## How to play/game notes
For the most part it should be self-explanatory. However, your tank requires **supplies** to run, so if you run out, you'll find yourself stranded.

For short periods this may appear OK, but hostile forces are chasing you. If you sit around too long, they *will* catch up, and it won't end well for you.

### Technology and tools
Written in Haxe, using Heaps.

### Credits
- Code / Story: FireSlash
- Art: Kiririn51
- Music: Juneji

Additionally, a few UI sfx were used from [artisticdude](https://opengameart.org/users/artisticdude)

entries.title: The Mist
entries.description:
![SOTS_Menu.png](///raw/f74/c/z/1d7b2.png)

World has come to an end. The Mist swallowed nearly the %90 of the population. No one knows exactly what happened.
You're the leader of the last known surviving humans and they have needs that needs your attention to survive.

- Small Bug #1 where safari does not play sound!

## How To Play 

There are 4 resources that you have to manage. If one of them is depleted you basically get exiled from your community.

- Day is divided into 2 turns. Day & Night. 
- Each turn you can order one of your followers to do one task.
- Manage resources and try to survive as long as you can. 

## Resources

* Food - Keeps your people alive. 
* Water - Water is used to send your followers into missions for your community.
* Faith - Higher Faith allows your followers consume less resources. 
* Order - Higher Order allows your followers gather more resources on missions.

Each day you pay upkeep of resources for each followers. And also each follower has a unique resource skill that produces more of the indicated resource.

![SOTS_Story.png](///raw/f74/c/z/1d73b.png)

## Tips & Tricks

- You can access details of your followers via details tab.

### Things that we wished to integrate but left for further iterations.

- Dynamic Special Events (Famine / Leaf of Faith Choices etc. )
- UI Elements that clears out the resource management.
- Campaign Mode
- Follower Morale
- Active Game World (Different scenes for events etc.)
- Proper Balancing

![SOTS_Gameplay.png](///raw/f74/c/z/1d7b8.png)

### pianoiamproman played our soundtrack!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dTbNhOhnQho

### ÜNOG - Üniversiteli Oyun Geliştiricleri Topluluğu

We are a growing community based in Turkey with over 600 people in the gaming industry.
This is our second Ludum Dare that we hosted and hoping to get wider and international.

entries.title: Absalom And The Golden Mullet
entries.description:
Your Absalom. And you've always dreamed of growing out a killer mullet, only problem is your a robot. So, yeah. Guess he's going to have to hack his way into The Mullet and steal one...!

The concept of the game is to open up areas by connecting Power Nodes together in a line. Each area has different power requirements to open them and each Power Node adds a certain amount of power to the chain. The longer the Chain the more power you have. Your player character also has 4 Power Nodes that you can connect to for an extra power boost. Beware though, if you use a Power Node from your character to open a door it will be destroyed. So sacrifice them wisely.

![2018-12-09.png](///raw/ad8/1/z/1f7c5.png)

Music used is: Arros - Find Yourself
All sound effects from freesound.org.

EDIT: 
Windows version is much lighter and easier to see things than the HTML version. The lights didn't build correctly for the Web it would seem.

entries.title: Santaur's Elf Cola
entries.description:
https://youtu.be/xgE-H36rAc4

![giphy2.gif](///raw/637/z/1efcd.gif)

Strategy/Simulation/Goofy Elf Slaughter

## Controls:
```     
Trap Selection = Keys 1 thru 7     
Trap Placement = Mouse Click     
Story Progression = Arrow Keys or Mouse Click & Drag     
Start/Restart = Spacebar         
```

## Gameplay:
```     
Use a bit of Christmas Spirit in your tank to buy more traps and earn more spirit. 
Try to sacrifice more elves than you let escape helping Santaur save Christmas.      
```

          
#### 🎁 The toys were wrapped. The list was checked twice. 🎅 Santaur’s sleigh was polished and ready to go. But there was one major problem… Christmas Spirit was at an all-time low. Without enough Christmas Spirit, Santaur’s reindeer won’t fly! 🦌 With Christmas just around the corner, panic ensued. In the mayhem, an elf fell from his ladder...

entries.title: Resist and Persist
entries.description:
Resist and Persist is a game about holding onto planets, but also knowing when to give them up. With aliens attacking your planets, and with civilians trying to escape, you’re not going to be able to hold on to everything you’ve got. But having no planets is better than having them captured. So sometimes, you have to turn the guns on your own, and sacrifice all you’ve fought for.

Instructions:
Aliens have come to destroy your planets! Your civilians need to evacuate, and they're putting their trust in you to buy them time. How long can you hold off the invaders to let your citizens escape?

Controls: WASD or the arrow keys to move your ship.

Left Click to fire your guns and destroy the aliens!

Right click on planets to sacrifice them (blow them up) to prevent aliens from taking them over! Note: Planets can only be sacrificed when their shields are completely reduced.

Objective:
To try to get the highest score possible! Points can be gained by:
-Destroying Aliens
-Surviving Waves
-Evacuating Civilians
Civilians can only be evacuated between enemy waves.

You can lose points by: 
-Having a Planet Invaded
-Losing Turrets

Types of Aliens:
Speeders: These tiny cruisers are fast and furious, but their shields are very weak. Don’t let their blasters tear you apart!

Carriers: Big ships with lots of shields. They spawn speeders and fire big bullets that tear your planets apart.

Bombers: Small, slow ships with big guns. They will target your turrets, so be careful! (Image of bomber)

Landers: These slow ships neutralize your planets when they lose their shields. Don’t let them capture your worlds or face a massive point reduction.

Turrets: Like your turrets, but bad. Also you can’t destroy them. Enough said.

That's about all there is to it-- remember, don't let the aliens get ahold of any of your planets.

Good luck!
![$2.png](///raw/ab7/d/z/1e710.png)![$3.png](///raw/ab7/d/z/1e711.png)![$7.png](///raw/ab7/d/z/1e713.png)![$4.png](///raw/ab7/d/z/1e714.png)![$5.png](///raw/ab7/d/z/1e715.png)![$6.png](///raw/ab7/d/z/1e716.png)![coverImage2.png](///raw/ab7/d/z/1e71e.png)

NOTE: For the best gameplay experience, play with headphones. Also, avoid the web build if possible. :)

entries.title: Arkham 2043
entries.description:
![5.png](///raw/7aa/z/1f016.png)

Something is wrong with this city. The foul disease that grips these streets has always been here, but tonight this nameless evil threatens to consume all.

In the year 2043, lead a team of investigators across the city of Arkham, Massachusetts. Uncover foul plots, bring light to the shadows of back alleys, and unveil the mask of this long-storied city.

Combat is turn-based. Each investigator has multiple abilities they can use to defend themselves from the creatures of the night. Select abilities for each investigator, and click attack to resolve all the enemy and investigator actions.

Each ability uses energy tokens. Each turn, 6 energy tokens are pulled from a box that can be used for those abilities. The box contains tokens determined by your investigator's stats.

entries.title: Tale of Nowheria
entries.description:
# Overview:
The land of Nowheria got filled with fear because of the dangerous deity's angery. You have to make a sacrifice of its favourite type of food - sweets. Explore the world, collect sweets, find secrets, avoid obstacles and save Nowheria!

This game was created entirely from scratch and only by me (it was meant to be compo entry, but it got more ambitious than i thought). I hope you will like the music , because i always put weight on this aspect of my games :)


# Tips:
- There is deity's angery meter on the right. When it is filled, things go dangerous
- With special items, you are able to access new places
- Sometimes walls hide secret rooms. Look for strange walls and check them.
- If you collect not enough sweets, the deity will kill you (collect at least 50% (out of 500-600 or sth like that) )
- Dont get frustrated, I guarantee you, that you will be better with every attempt, and finally you will manage to find all the sweets

# Controls:
Arrows - move

Z - interact

# Made using:
GMS
FLS
Aseprite

Good luck, and have fun!



![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/947/31/z/1e536.png)![Screenshot_3.png](///raw/947/31/z/1e539.png)![Screenshot_4.png](///raw/947/31/z/1e53a.png)

entries.title: Temple-based Sacrifice
entries.description:
![thumb_cropped.png](///raw/133/z/1f84f.png)

# Temple-based Sacrifice #

TBS is a Turn-Based Strategy inspired by Advance Wars. Gods of the ancient days have awoken to a future of confused religions and high-tech mechanical beasts and they demand sacrifices! Lead four unique factions in skirmishes across 5 (6-ish) different maps, conquer land, sea and air. Sacrifice your units to unlock unique bonuses granted by the gods.

(This same description is on the [game page](http://ludum.thenet.sk/ld43/), where it looks nicer.)

## Keyboard controls ##

 - **WSAD** or **Arrow keys** – Move camera. 
 - **QE** – Rotate camera. 
 - **Tab** – Toggle HP bars on all units. 
 - **M** – Toggle music. 
 - **N** – Toggle sound effects. 
 - **Space** – End turn.

## Gameplay ##

The gameplay is turn-based, each player having 60 seconds to complete their turn. Each unit can be commanded to **move** in its movement range by **clicking it**, then **clicking on another tile**. Movement over certain types of tiles is more difficult for some units.

After moving a unit, it may be commanded **to take an action** – attacking an enemy unit or razing/capturing a building. Possible actions are **highlighted over their respective targets** and are **activated by clicking**.

In addition to units, players also control **buldings**, some of which **allow production of units or sacrifice of units** to gain divine favour. These are activated by **clicking the building**, then **clicking one of the options in the bottom-left of the screen**.

**The objective of the game is to capture the enemy Temple-Tron!**

## Unit types ##

There are 17 different types of units in the game, each with their own stats and abilities.

| Unit | Cycles (Cost) | HP (Health) | MOV (Movement) | ATK (Attack) | RNG (Range) | DEF (Defense) | VIS (Vision) | STL (Stealth) | Tier | Special |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| **Ground** |
| Wolf | 4 | 2 | 3 | 3 | 1 | 0 | 3 | 0 | 0 | Captures |
| Monkey | 4 | 1 | 2 | 0 | 0 | 2 | 1 | 0 | 1 | Repair, MountainHillAffinity, Captures, MaxCount: 2 |
| Spider | 4 | 2 | 4 | 1 | 1 | 0 | 3 | 1 | 1 | DesertAffinity, Captures |
| BombardierAnt | 6 | 3 | 2 | 2 | 4 | 0 | 1 | 0 | 2 | Siege |
| Chamois | 6 | 4 | 4 | 1 | 1 | 0 | 2 | 0 | 2 | Charge, MountainHillAffinity |
| Bull | 10 | 6 | 3 | 2 | 1 | 1 | 2 | 0 | 3 | Charge |
| Hog | 9 | 10 | 3 | 0 | 1 | 0 | 2 | 0 | 4 | WeakStart, HealthAttack, MaxCount: 1 |
| **Flying** |
| Bat | 5 | 2 | 8 | 0 | 0 | 0 | 4 | 0 | 0 | MaxCount: 1 |
| Bumblebee | 4 | 1 | 5 | 6 | 1 | 0 | 1 | 0 | 2 | Kamikaze, Siege |
| Mosquito | 5 | 2 | 3 | 3 | 1 | 0 | 3 | 1 | 2 | – |
| Eagle | 10 | 5 | 5 | 3 | 1 | 1 | 4 | 0 | 4 | – |
| **Water** |
| Octopus | 6 | 4 | 3 | 4 | 1 | 0 | 3 | 1 | 1 | – |
| Squid | 10 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 4 | 2 | 1 | 0 | 2 | Siege, MaxCount: 2 |
| Swordfish | 9 | 4 | 6 | 0 | 1 | 1 | 2 | 1 | 3 | Charge, MaxCount: 1 |
| **Amphibian** |
| Frog | 2 | 1 | 1 | 0 | 0 | 3 | 1 | 0 | 1 | – |
| Snake | 5 | 3 | 3 | 2 | 1 | 0 | 3 | 0 | 2 | Captures |
| Medusa | 15 | 4 | 3 | 1 | 2 | 2 | 3 | 0 | 4 | MedusaGaze, MaxCount: 1 |

## Unit abilities ##

 - **Captures** – Unit may raze enemy buildings, capture neutral buildings, and capture neutral units. 
 - **Charge** – Unit's ATK is increased by the distance it has moved from its starting position. 
 - **DesertAffinity** – No penalty for movement over desert tiles. 
 - **HealthAttack** – Unit's ATK is increased by its current HP. 
 - **Kamikaze** – Unit dies after attacking. 
 - **MaxCount**: X – Production buildings cannot build the unit if the player already owns X or more. 
 - **MedusaGaze** – Any attacked unit instantly turns into a neutral unit. 
 - **MountainHillAffinity** – No penalty for movement over mountain or hill tiles. 
 - **Repair** – Unit may restore 2 HP on a friendly unit on a neihbouring tile. 
 - **Siege** – Unit cannot attack if it has moved during the turn. Unit cannot counter-strike. 
 - **WeakStart** – Unit is produced with 1 HP. (It must be repaired to gain full HP.)

## Building types ##

There are 7 different types of buildings in the game.

| Building | Turns to capture (from neutral) | Turns to raze (from enemy into neutral) | Passive | Produces |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Temple-Tron | – | 2 | Grants +3 CYC per turn to owner. Capture the Temple-Tron to win! | Produces ground units. |
| Factoreon | 2 | 1 | – | Produces ground units. |
| Dock | 3 | 2 | – | Produces water and amphibian units. |
| Eyrie | 2 | 1 | – | Produces flying units. |
| Forge | 3 | 2 | Grants +1 production tier to owner. | – |
| Fortress | 2 | 1 | +1 ATK, DEF, and VIS to friendly units on the same tile | – |
| Shrine | 3 | 2 | Grants +3 CYC per turn to owner. | – |

entries.title: Hare Will Be Blood
entries.description:
**BUG IN GAME IS CAUSING EVERYTHING TO DRAIN FASTER. WILL RE-UPLOAD ONCE RESOLVED**

WASD - movement  / E - interact with items

Left click portrait to change characters

Space/Left Click to shoot

Certain items can only be interacted with certain characters. Try to figure out who does what and attempt to survive until spring!

Health - Red (Lose all of this and your character dies)
 Stamina - Green (No energy prevents most item interactions)
Hunger - Blue  (Go hungry and start starving to death)
Better Description and Instructions to follow (i.e. in game).

entries.title: Omnibar
entries.description:
For this jam as in all jams, I was wildy over-ambitious, deciding to write a game from the ground up and do so in <64kb. However this time, I succeeded. Omnibar is a first person shooter in 54k. Your health, xp, and ammo are all the same magnificent bar, so be careful!

Note: this thing takes a beast to run because optimization was not my priority. Minimum graphics card a GTX 970m, but it plays better on a 980/1070+ The big download (still only 677kb!) runs slightly better, but the 54k one is there too. Have fun!

Mechanic:

Kill the Gaboods expanding into existence in the atrium with your plasma cannon and slug gun. Your health, ammo, and xp bar are one and the same - the Omnibar. Take a fast and loose fighting approach, playing for the bar packs on the lower floor, or line up your shots and conserve your bar. Get 25 kills (fill your kill meter) to win!

Controls:

1 for slug gun - fires arcing projectiles

2 for plasma cannon - fires a short beam that continuously deals damage

WASD move

space jump

M1 to shoot

C recenter (in case you glitch out or something)

F7 for spectator mode (new enemies won't spawn- fly around and enjoy the graphics)

![instruction5.png](///raw/be6/01/z/1e81b.png)

audio by Adam Lastowka (Rachmanin0xff)

everything else by Benjamin Welsh (DubThink)

started with this project: https://github.com/DubThink/moonsync

entries.title: Santa Clause: Troll Hunter
entries.description:
A pack of trolls are hell bent on stopping Santa Clause from delivering presents this Christmas. As Santa, you must fight through the horde and make your way to the rooftops to deliver the presents safely. Throw snowballs at the trolls to knock them out. Get caught, and you will have to sacrifice some of your presents to the troll before he'll release you. Sacrifice too many presents, and there won't be enough to give to every kid on your list. You'll have a few extra presents in case you need them, but they are limited. See if you can finish your route with a perfect delivery record!

Use "A" and "D" to move. "Spacebar" to jump. "Left Mouse" to throw snowballs. "Esc" to quit.

Some Notes About the Game: All graphics and sound assets were downloaded from the Unity Asset Store, so I opted out of these categories. Also, the original plan for the "sacrifice" theme was this: When a troll caught you, he would demand that you sacrifice some presents before he would let you go free. If you chose not to sacrifice the presents, you'd lose health. If you lost all health, it was game over. Unfortunately I ran out of time to implement this correctly so the trolls just steal your presents and run away.

entries.title: Pursuit
entries.description:
Life is tough! Wouldn't it be nicer if we could manage all its complexities by just moving a cute blob around? :large_blue_circle: :smiley: 

Now you can!

![screenshot.png](///raw/58a/e1/z/1e32c.png)

Pursuit looks super abstract, but is inspired by the tough job of managing our lives. You've got to balance spending time with people, apart from people, and pursuing goals. You can see how different relationship dynamics play out. Sometimes you need a fellow introvert to give you some space, other times having an extrovert seek you out is just what you need. :purple_heart:

And all of this is represented almost entirely through funky shaders! (Aside from text, this game contains only primitives with no textures. Also it looks a lot better in motion :wink:)

Download link is to a zip file on Dropbox, so just hit Download in the upper right to nab it all.

Hope you enjoy! :purple_heart: 

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Created by Tyler "Shalune" Main (my first Ludum Dare)
(contact info: www.shalune.com , @usuallyshalune )

Tools used:
Unity
http://turtle.audio/

entries.title: Ten Thousand Hopes
entries.description:
You are in command of a rocket, launched just before a large meteor strikes Earth making it uninhabitable. Your ship, crew, and cargo are the only hope for humanity's survival. The meteor's threat was discovered less than a year ago, and your ship is underdeveloped and under-equipped for the journey. Along the way you can expect new challenges to present themselves, and it is only through your leadership that you and your crew can hope to survive. The path will be arduous and require many sacrifices, only to deliver a small hope of the survival of the species.

![screenshot-1.PNG](///raw/f12/3/z/1e4ed.png)

entries.title: Zombo
entries.description:
![HighresScreenshot00001.png](///raw/3a3/1/z/1e839.png)

See how long you can survive on this zombie filled island. You get score by recruiting teammates and surviving the nights.
For every teammate you have, you lose more food, every bullet counts, and there are only 5 vehicles with gas. Good luck. Oh and don't swim or shoot Kev the box (specifically 5 times). I would've had a bit more things but the all famous deadline appeared.


Controls:
WASD - Movement
Space - Jump
E - Interact

entries.title: ...For More Time On The Clock
entries.description:
It's an arcade FPS!

Kill opponents, and aim for the highest score possible before the time runs out!

* Kill enemies to score points, and pick up the items they drop to increase your multiplier!
* Return to one of the green pads with a multiplier greater than 1.0x to restore your health and extend your time, but be warned! Doing so reduces your multiplier back to 1.0x!

Controls:

* WASD - Move
* Left Mouse - Long Range Attack
* Right Mouse - Short Range Attack
* Space - Jump (and space again in the air to double-jump)
* Left Shift + Movement Keys - Teleport
* ESC - Quit Game

entries.title: Fridge Raider
entries.description:
You are a caring fridge that tries to keep its food alive, but day after day an evil student comes and feeds himself by your precious food. Convince him that he can't cook before the end-of-term party to keep him from raiding you.
You have ten days!

## Tips:
- **Goal:** Drain the students health.
- Combine salty and sweet ingredients to create bad taste. Otherwise it's good taste.
- **Bad taste** deals one damage.
- **Good taste** regenerates one health **and** puts the eaten ingredients in your shopping cart for later supply.
- **Hunger:** The amount of food that will be consumed next time
- **Supply:** The amount of food that you will receive out of the shopping cart next time
- If the shopping cart is empty you will get random food
- Effects are applied when eaten.

![FridgeRaiderScreenshot1.png](///raw/dda/c/z/1e4cc.png)

entries.title: Sacrifices Must Be Made To My Game...
entries.description:
Lone wolf Jam. Used Mixamo's auto rigger and Animations but the rest was made by me with Aseprite, Magica Voxel, Unity, and Visual Studio Community.

Was going for a Spy vs Spy type game but over scoped for my dev time. Now its a player vs player race for the key and to find the exit.

Player 1 controls:  W,    S,    A,     D and           E to open doors and check furniture.
Player 2 controls: Up, Down, Left, Right and Right Shift to open doors and check furniture.![Items.PNG](///raw/fd1/2/z/1e4ad.png)![PVP.PNG](///raw/fd1/2/z/1e4b2.png)![Pickup.PNG](///raw/fd1/2/z/1e4b6.png)

Traps did not make it into Jam Version.

entries.title: OpFern Class
entries.description:
![10c7e.png](///raw/693/2/z/1e7d2.png)
![screen1.png](///raw/693/2/z/1e76d.png)
![screen2.png](///raw/693/2/z/1e7d4.png)


Gameplay: OpFern Class is a fast paced, arcade style shoot-em-up set in the distant future. This game was created in three days using Game Maker Studio 2.

Plot:
We are the members of the air-to-space specialist group known as the "OpFern Class". Our mission is to track and locate the alien mother ship known as the Dreadnought. Using our new warp drive technology, our mission objective should be easier to accomplish. Even though I knew everyone wouldn't make it, I didn't think it would be like this.

Post patch notes:
Just some minor bug fixes. Credits actually roll now without the game crashing. No improvements other than that. 

Controls (Keyboard/Controller):
Fly Ship: Arrow Keys/D-pad
Fire Weapon: Z Key/X(PlayStation) & A(Xbox)
Change Pilot: C Key/Square(PlayStation & X(Xbox)

Ghosts in the Toast: Avery Ruth (Programmer/Pixel Art), Mary Fellner (Traditional Artist), Michael Gaskins (Guitarist/Pixel Art) and Tyler Byers (Producer/Composer)

entries.title: Bone Zone
entries.description:
A Towerfall inspired 4 player couch play action combat game for you to enjoy. Play as a Aztec Wizard-Shaman-Maniac with powers oozing from the curse mask they wear. However, each time they attack, the mask steals a part of their soul. 


Remember! Each attack reduces your characters abilities. So Don't just spam attack. you might regret it. 


Sadly, we are missing a few things that we did not have time to add to the game. Most importantly SOMETHING TELLING THE PLAYER THE CONTROLS. We apologize.


CONTROLS!!!- Designed for 4 players on 1 keyboard! 

Red - Left: Q, Jump: S, Right: Z, Shoot: Left Ctrl   [Left Hand]

Blue - Left: F, Jump: T, Right: H, Shoot: Space      [Left Hand]

Green - Left: L, Jump: P, Right: ', Shoot: Right Ctrl [Left Hand]

White- Left: Left Arrow, Jump: Up Arrow, Right: Right Arrow, Shoot: 0 Keypad    [Right Hand]


KNOWN BUGS:
- Sorry we didn't get round to implementing the winning screen (that says who won)
- It was supposed to be best of three, but it's instead EXACTLY three rounds



The Team (Havn't mastered the 'add member' functionality yet): jigglesworth, EuphoricNirvana, Psycotik2002 and JaPong


WAS IT ALL FROM SCRATCH??
* I used a framework that I've been working on to do a bit of the code. Mostly events and timers
* The rest was made in the last three days give or take a unity plugin

entries.title: Chaos Shelter
entries.description:
The end is nigh. Very few humans are left on earth after the zombie apocalypse, one of the few remaining groups is in your shelter.

Command A Group Of Survivors in their daily tasks

entries.title: Berrytales - Fracture Flight
entries.description:
![Title_0003_BG.png](///raw/bba/01/z/1e61c.png)

## Story

Someone stole the magical fork that held the world together. Now it is shattered and demonic creatures are roaming the apocalypitic landscape. Escape at all costs from this hellish nightmare that some fool brought over the planet.


## What to do

Poke the Eyeballs! Save everyone! Don't let your dragon starve!
Try to reach The End!*

*Disclaimer: The End is an end condition that you'll propably not see because this game is so very unfinished. Should you fight through though, be prepared for a totally radical dummy screen full of placeholder graphics!
(fixed in Updated Version, the game is totally beatable now!)


## Controls

Arrow Keys / XBOX-Stick - move 

Spacebar / Enter / A-Button - action

Escape / B-Button - pause

**There are instructions in-game!**

![Help_0001_Menue.png](///raw/bba/01/z/1e60f.png)

*See?*

**We like to apologize for the missing key feature of boosts based on your dudes. Somehow, the code does not work as intended. But well, that's Ludum Dare, eh?** (fixed in Updated Version)



This Ludum Dare, [Beebo Studios](https://ldjam.com/users/beebo-studios/games) sadly weren't in one place. However!  [bastilo](https://ldjam.com/users/bastilo) entered on his own while [Tekses](https://ldjam.com/users/tekses) and [Purrseus](https://ldjam.com/users/purrseus) have teamed up to try themselves at their very own **first** game - this one. In typical Ludum Dare fashion they even totally ran out of time. Like, totally.

## Changelog:

**Updated Version:**
- fixed the bug of dudes not giving boni
- massive rebalancing
- adjusted animation handling, so characters don't wobble around their goal anymore; the hook now can't get lost
- taking the front position now lets you look ahead
- the new (provisional) game over screen shows how far you made it
- game over condition made clearer by being two-step
- animation for the ship being hit by enemies
- fixed the bug of not being able to close the help screen by pressing Spacebar/Enter

**Goals for Version 1.0:**
- add missing animations, implement unused graphics
- make a prettier end screen
- individual sound effects for the dudes
- new and more varied music
- boss fight

Thank you for reading this far! You are a very special person to us :kissing_heart:

Have a fish! 🐟


**Credits**

Tido - lead programmer and voice talent

Christian - art director (For more cuteness see [his Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/christian.nrd/))

## IMPORTANT NOTE

The Updated Version represents our vision for this Ludum Dare. **If you base your rating off the Updated Version, please consider that your OVERALL and FUN experience will propably be vastly different from our original LD Version. For the sake of fairness, please refrain from rating in that case, at least in those categories.**

Of course, you can still download, play and rate the LD Version. If you do, please consider the following:
Due to **balancing issues with fall speed** we advise to **directly** move to the left station of the ship and **poke** the dragon until you are at the top! 
Don't be afraid to hurt this guy! His pain is your gain.


**Have fun playing!**

entries.title: Cube Rapture
entries.description:

This is a top-down point and click game where the objective is to consume cities faster than your opponent. 

This was an assignment for a class, and is the first game jam that we have participated in. The link contains a zip file that has the .exe inside it.

entries.title: Downgradius

entries.title: Date With A Devil
entries.description:
![cover.PNG](///raw/e4b/02/z/1e0b0.png)

Date With The Devil is a light 1-4 player party game where four contestants compete to see which one of them will be chosen as a sacrifice to the great demon Goatstradamus, in Sacrifices Must Be Made, a variety game show featuring Q&A sections interspersed with minigames!

Controlled via controller, or with the following keyboard controls:

Player 1: Arrow keys to move, Z to select, X to cancel.  Enter to start.

Player 2: WASD to move, C to select, V to cancel.

Player 3: Numpad 5,1,2,3 to move, B to select, N to cancel

Player 4:  IJKL to move, M to select, "," to cancel.

We do not recommend playing with a keyboard for more than 1-2 players, unless each player is given a separate keyboard.

Change Log:
12/4 @ 4:30PM EST:  Fixed a bug which would cause the Leylines minigame to indefinitely hang if certain combinations of characters were chosen.
​
![characters.png](///raw/e4b/02/z/1e448.png)

![Capture.PNG](///raw/e4b/02/z/1e31a.png)

![Capture.PNG](///raw/e4b/02/z/1e2ea.png)

entries.title: A Sworded Tale
entries.description:
![screen2.PNG](///raw/86a/1/z/1e5e4.png)

After uncovering an ancient evil and it's protector, they both escape their eternal imprisonment. Upon inspection of the wreckage of the stone prison. You find a Sword.

"Your presence has allowed my brother and I to escape. My brother is corrupted and needs to be stopped at all costs. I imprisoned him before along with myself acting as a guardian just in case he ever escaped again. My Centuries of slumber have left me weakened, I need to feed in order to maintain my strength. I sense my brother's presence, we must head to the volcano, inside is a temple where he will prepare the ritual to destroy the world as you know it! Quicly we haven't much time!"

Upon touching the sword, you begin to bleed but heal imediately.

"I have granted you blood magic, using this powerful technique, you can fight your way to my brother. Be careful however, as blood magic is both powerful and dangerous, Using it recklessly may cause your demise!"

You take the sword, and head off through the city.

![screen4.PNG](///raw/86a/1/z/1e5e8.png)

# Controls

## Keyboard:

Arrow Keys: Movement

Space - Action

Left Alt - Cancel

Z/X: Zoom In/Out

C/V: Zoom In/Out

## Gamepad:

Left Analog Stick: Movement

Right Analog Stick: Camera Zoom and Rotate

A/Cross - Action

B/Circle - Cancel

# Snowdrama's Suggestion: Use A Controller

![Capture.PNG](///raw/86a/1/z/1e5ea.png)

entries.title: Bright Cube
entries.description: Placeholder

entries.title: Devil Cult Party
entries.description:
![Screen1.gif](///raw/9b1/3/z/1e4ca.gif)

Manage a spooky demon death-cult.

**Bring about the doom of mankind, and watch out for competitors!**

Human sacrifices, studying the occult, selling merch, bringing back the dead and transforming cultists into demonic abominations is all part of the business. **Get to work, the world won't end itself!**

Game made by @FrancisCoulombe, with music by @askiisoft and @cboyardee .

![Screen2.gif](///raw/9b1/3/z/1e4d5.gif)

ARROW: move
X: jump
C: use item/examine
C+down: pick up or put down
C+up: build

**Tips and Trix:**

-Your role in the game is of manager; you cannot use the various constructions yourself, other than sacrificing cultists to the altar with the knife. You also cannot fight monsters yourself. All of this must be done by your followers.

-You can micromanage followers by picking them up and putting them back down where you need something done, however.

-The final challenge of the game is to build the dark portal and summon Satan, which costs a lot of time and resources, and has disastrous consequences.



**I think figuring out the details of how most of the game works by yourself is the most fun, but here are a bunch of extra tricks to look over if you have a hard time getting started:**


**Ressources:**

-Your 3 resources are Cash, Piety and Ambiance.

-Cash is needed for all constructions and is generated over time by your cultists, and by merch booths. You also get some gold whenever you kill monsters infesting your temple grounds.

-Piety is needed for some of the more occult constructions and to use dark magic, and is slowly generated by having cultists sit in pews or chairs to pray.

-Ambiance is not exactly a resource, it's more like a rating of how spooky your temple is. High ambiance brings more followers over time, makes them part with their money faster and increases the effectiveness of many of your constructions.

![Screen3.gif](///raw/9b1/3/z/1e4d7.gif)


**Constructions:**

-Build a library (and later an alchemy lab) to research new constructions.

-Different constructions are available to build at different areas of your temple (outside, inside, and in the central sanctuary)

-Most constructions you build affect the ambiance of your cult. Some buildings add to ambiance (statues, lit braziers, altars...) and others reduce it (folding chairs, merch booths, catering table)

-Constructions placed outside the walls of your central building have a lessened impact (be it negative or positive) on your ambiance, and constructions placed within the central room have doubled ambiance impact.


**Cultists:**

-Devoted cultists are the backbone of your operation, and they do everything. They construct buildings, operate them, fight monsters and even produce cash.

-Cultists regenerate health over time, but reanimated corpses do not, you will just need to reanimate them again at the Wicked Idol if they collapse.

-You can direct them to clear debris obstructing the path deeper into your temple grounds, and seal monster-spawning objects like rat nests.

-Cultists need food and drink! Build a kiosk somewhere or they will eventually stop working, leave your temple, or even die.

-Cultists gain experience through many tasks. Higher-level cultists perform better, and are stronger in combat.

-Sacrificing cultists to the altar using the bloody knife fills it with blood, which readies it to be worshiped by other 
cultists and generate piety. You can also capture the soul of cultists into Soul Stone buildings, which can also be worshiped for piety.

Good luck, and have fun!

entries.title: Eye of the Master
entries.description:
To be filled out when I'm not dying.

Art by ChibiMa https://www.maryanneguy.com/​
Music by Up_Steven http://facebook.com/underpolaris​

Sacrifice benefits to gain power as you try to become a full fledged wizard.

Arrow keys/wasd to move, space to dodge, left click to shoot magic, right click to recharge magic, E to pick up a scroll.

The idea was large, and the rest of the implementation + proper bug testing/fixing will come at a later time.

entries.title: Dance Dance SACRIFICES
entries.description:
# Welcome, welcome !
![shaman_perdu.png](///raw/acc/8/z/1e74e.png)
...to our second LDJam entry (and first for our graphic designer Lola)! With one new talent in the team we took the opposite approach from LDJam42. No abstract black-white-grey game this time, we have a colorful and vibrant entry for you all! We used Lua and LÖVE2D as well as Audacity and Photoshop.

We hope you will all be entertained, for it's time to make sacrifices!

![Capture d’écran_2018-12-04_04-28-22.png](///raw/acc/8/z/1e741.png)

## The Game

Your gods demand sacrifices! Not one, not two... but as many as you can make in a week! Using the ancestral ritual of the Great Hand-Free Sacrifice, you shall dance their bidding til they are satisfied. Don't make the mistake to disappoint them even a single day.


![Capture d’écran_2018-12-04_05-09-38.png](///raw/acc/8/z/1e78f.png)

## Controls

Use the Arrow Keys to perform the ritual "No Hands" dance and sacrifice men, women, pets and chickens to appease the divine wrath. Don't make a wrong step or you'll have to start from the beginning! Make enough sacrifices each day to avoid punishment.

entries.title: The Old Ones - Sacrifices Must Be Made
entries.description:
![Pic1.png](///raw/468/f1/z/1e456.png)

**Known Bugs**
- Visibility shows the wrong value (shows float value instead of percent) *sometimes*
- Can click next day on lose screen
- Can not change cult name after you win or lose a game

entries.title: Send In The Interns
entries.description:
![Interns_Map1.png](///raw/299/9/z/1e3f1.png)
When you're a world famous archaeologist, hunting down treasure is the name of the game. Sometimes, however, it's just not worth the risk of death. So, what's a professor to do? Send in the interns, of course! The plan is send in some interns to scout out the place. You may have to sacrifice a few of them to figure out the safest paths. Then, send in more interns to grab the treasure. Meanwhile, you get all the credit. And the treasure, of course.

You will choose from among three temples and send wave after wave of your own interns towards the treasure. If your interns meet with an accident, just click the "Run!" button to whistle up some more. If your interns stop to catch their breath, hit the same button to make them start running again. If you find your interns repeatedly falling into traps, remember to look around for switches to click. Those spikes don't look nearly as scary with a bridge covering them! Also, be alert! There may be other things to click down in the depths of the dungeons.

**Credits**
- Jodi Slade - Art/Sound/Music
- John Thrasher - Code
- Micha Faw - Code

entries.title: Gore Chore
entries.description:
![Demon_front.jpg](///raw/fac/e1/z/1e24f.jpg)

A Single Player Co-Op Game – Sacrifices must be made to free the Dark Lord! Take control over a demon and his servant and help them to fulfill their quest of mass destruction.
Feed the demon by sacrificing animals with the priest. Powered with blood he will guard off the revengeful spirits that attack the priest from the shadow realm. Can you take control of two evil beings in two different realms, at the same time? And even more important – Can you collect enough blood to open the gates of H E L L?

![Q5HnDW.png](///raw/d85/c/z/1f17e.png)

Controls – Press WASD to move the priest. Press SPACE to pick up friendy animals, or kill enemy priests. Use your Cursor to move the Demon. Press the left mouse Button to attack. When you find a rare animal you gain a special attack that you can use with the right mouse button. ESC opens the menu to change graphics/sound settings.

![demonfront.gif](///raw/fac/e1/z/1e632.gif)

Jam Log – Although we are happy how the game turned out there are still some parts missing! In the end, we had to simplify the goal of the game. There should have been 5 artifacts to collect to win the game, but unfortunately, we have to stick with an enemy count mechanic to end the game for know. So all you need to collect so far is the blood for the ring in the center of the map. Also, we would have liked to have a couple more hours to tweak the spawns and mechanics of the enemies, to make a more satisfying difficulty curve in the game. And then there are some UI ideas (options etc) we couldn't finish on time. 

![titel Ludum.jpg](///raw/fac/e1/z/1e27d.jpg)

What we've done until now: https://jamjamteam.itch.io/
Our first LD Game(LD40): https://jamjamteam.itch.io/drugrun

Tools we use:

Engine: Game Maker Studio2

Music & Sound: Ableton 9 Live

Animation: Spine

Art & Graphic Design: Photoshop

entries.title: Diortem
entries.description:
![screen_shot_2.jpg](///raw/841/z/1e2b3.jpg)
A Metroidvania with a twist--you start with all the upgrades. Now put them back!
![screen_shot_7.jpg](///raw/841/z/1e2b8.jpg)
The space station has been taken over by a rogue AI hivemind. You must find and override the four terminals that have been taken over to escape the station alive. However, claiming each terminal will cost you one of your abilities that you use to fight and explore. Will you give up double jump, your grapple line, a charge attack, or your beloved shotgun?

Paths may become closed to you as you progress. Diortem is a Metroidvania in reverse!

entries.title: To the Last Drop
entries.description:
Usually the militia is more than a match for the occasional orkish raid. As the towns blood mage your contribution tends to be limited to patching up any wounded (at a heavy discount, of course). This time is different. Everyone who can wield a pitchfork is being urged to fight. A gigantic army headed by a fearsome (and massive) leader is approaching. There is no way the militia is up to the task, and, alas, your spells and effects are too weak to tip the balance.

Unless... you were to crack open your book of Forbidden Magic. Powered by more than pricked fingers and vials of sheep's blood, these spells may just be the tool required to save us. Well, most of us. The townsfolk will understand as, if any of us are to see the dawn...

How many sacrifices must be made?

![unknown2.jpg](///raw/191/z/1e3ff.jpg)

![unknown4.jpg](///raw/191/z/1e422.jpg)

### Technical details

Built with [SpringRTS](https://springrts.com). A modern desktop PC supporting OpenGL 3.x+ is required to run the game. Linux users should install libsdl2.

Changelog
- Fix Linux release
- [Fix spell sounds](https://github.com/SpringCabal/LD43/commit/5fc876ebe3d74022ceb64b7f667bc9a7dad205fa)


# Controls
Cast spells by **draining life from nearby allies**.
- Hold Left Mouse: move
- Hold Right Mouse: attack
- 1 Transfusion: Heal yourself
- 2 Heartburn: Cast a fireball
- 3 Adrenaline: Increase the speed of yourself and nearby allies
- 4 Migraine: Disable enemies
- 5 Dialysis: Throw away your enemies

All spells require **nearby allies** to be used as source.

entries.title: Space Captain Leslie in ... Disasteroids!!
entries.description:
# Space Captain Leslie in... Disasteroids!!   
Help Space Captain Leslie take down the mighty Space Criminal in this action packed.. uh, I guess twin stick shooter.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=H97FkCsc5sM 

## Controls
Use either WASDQE or the mouse to move, space or click to shoot. Combine the two in any way you like. Destroy the bad guy's space ships all while avoiding them, as well as asteroids. 
 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=b5MNylXLwbM

## Theme 
The theme tie-in is a little abstract, but Your guys run out of bullets and have to sacrifice themselves to carry on...
![space captin 4.png](///raw/6d3/8/z/1e8a9.png)
![space Captain 2.png](///raw/6d3/8/z/1e3d9.png)

## Quick Fix Notes
* Fixed a bug that caused the ammo counter to display 1 more bullet than you had. (12/4, 12:35am)
* Fixed (12/4, 1:50AM)
   * Big Bad Bug that failed to stop sounds when restarting a match (really sorry)
   * A bug that would fail to flag the player as victorious if captain leslie was already talking... whoops.
* Fixed (12/5, 10:35AM) 
   * Fixed hitboxes on asteroids - they were too big and square, causing some bogus hits.
   * Added Asteroid hit protection to prevent you from getting absolutely merc'd by hitting a medium and having the two small ones spawn directly on top of you. You now have about a second to get away from there.
   * Fixed the enemy's off-screen firing guardrail - they were only supposed to fire while completely visible, but I did my math wrong. Also, their shot timer will no longer tick unless they are fully visible, too. This will reduce the amount of peek-a-boo pot-shot the second they return to the screen.
   * When respawning (and spawning in for the first time), the amount of enemies left is displayed in the center of the screen. previously, the only hint you had was Leslie telling you "we're halfway there!" and that was only if another piece of dialog was not already playing lol.
* Fixed (12/5, 8:05PM)
   * Fixed the game landing directly into the gameplay and skipping the main menu and intro cinematic............................................. RIP humor score ;_;
* Fixed (12/6, 1:51PM) 
   * Patched the volume of the audio in the main cutscene! I didn't know it was too loud, sorry for anyone I spooked lmao

entries.title: Return to Kreswick
entries.description:
This is mine and Leandro Santos's submission for the Lundum Dare 43 Game Jame on ending on the 4th December 2018 @ 2am. We are both Final Year Computer Science (Games) Students at The University of Brighton.

The theme of the game is "Sacrifices must be made". You play as a wizard who is returning to his home village, only to find out that the village is under attack by a horde of monsters. You must make your way through the various passageways in order to make your way to the village, choosing either to fight and protect the villagers (Gaining the power of the Light - Reducing Enemy Rage, and thus Enemy Health), or avoid fighting and stock up on power to increase your damage. There are shrines and Minx cats located around the map which can prove addition stat modifiers if found.

![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/85c/f1/z/1df5a.png)
![Screenshot_3.png](///raw/85c/f1/z/1df5f.png)
![Screenshot_4.png](///raw/85c/f1/z/1df63.png)

CONTROLS: WASD - Move; E - Interact; Mouse1 - Shoot (hold); Alt+F4 - Exit Game

BUGS: Sadly many bugs have come into the came upon building. Whilst most things work in the Unity Editor, they do not in the build. Known bugs:

- Enemies not spawning (NullReference)
- Enemies fall over soon after colliding with player 
- Player can flip/shift camera view, thus creating a misalignment between player view and player model direction.
- UI element for shrine pickup sometimes not hiding
- Under certain stress, the player can fall off the map
