The village you are from is overpopulated. As a consequence, the Chieftain has decided to sacrifice part of the population to the mighty Golem that lives in a nearby dungeon.

How to play the game: Each level has a key in a golden chest. Find it to open the door to the next level, but take care, the Golem doesn't like you being in his home and will try to stop you. You either have to be fast or sneaky, play the way you want.

Controls:

Movement: WASD

Toggle Sneaking: Shift

Interact: E

Change log:

- Fixed depth of field getting more intense with higher resolutions

- Tweaked AI starting positions

entries.title: F.O.U.R.
entries.description:
![logo-shadow-500-3.png](///raw/4c/z/1e964.png)

What do you do when murders start piling up and you know who the culprit is but there never seems to be enough evidence to hold up in court? You just might orchestrate for yourself to be the next victim and make absolutely sure that no details go missing this time...

![2-smol.png](///raw/4c/z/1e969.png)

Take a walk around this small island town. Talk to people and look around. Find out what you need for your plan to succeed. Then carry it out.

*There is no map in the game but if you get really disoriented I have put one in the comments!*

---

## Credits 👒

* Ava Skoog

The game uses the font [Caviar Dreams](https://www.dafont.com/caviar-dreams.font) by Lauren Thompson.

---

## Controllers 🎮

Keyboard only.

* **[walk]** arrows / WASD / ZQSD
* **[browse]** arrows / WASD / ZQSD
* **[action]** enter / space
* **[cancel]** escape / alt / alt gr

---

## Coverage 👀

* [Minimalistic methods [part 2]](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/f-o-u-r/f-o-u-r-minimalistic-methods-part-2)

---

## Fixes 🛠

* There was an item that was possible to pick up multiple times
* Could talk through walls (due to `activeSelf` instead of `activeInHierarchy`)
* Updated a text for colourblind accessibility

---

## Links 🔗

entries.title: The Compleat Angler
entries.description:
![screenshot1.PNG](///raw/fa9/z/1ec2a.png)

*December 4: fixed the fullscreen problem and a bug not allowing to play the game past the starting area, the game is now fully playable. There are maybe still lots of bugs, but the LD rules don't allow me to fix those.*

You have 3 days to fish as much as you can. At the end of every day, return to the dock and sell your fish. Try to get $250 by the end of the run.

Beware: if you're carrying too much, you move slower and sink faster.

If you get into trouble and your boat is damaged, you can throw out some fish to lessen the weight and prevent sinking. Dropping weight also allows you to move faster.

We weren't able to work the full 72 hours, but plan to complete the game in the following days. We'll post an updated version here and on itch.io.

**Features:**
- Pixel art.
- Fish as much as you can in 3 days.
- Drop fish to lose weight to move faster and avoid sinking.

**Incomplete or missing:**

- Balance: the game is too easy right now, the damage, sinking speed, amount and patterns and speeds of enemies needs to be adjusted.
- More graphics: we have many unused assets that we had no time to put into the game, and we also wanted to make some more doodads for the environment.
- More sounds effects and music: we had very little time to implement sound.
- Pre/post game story segments: the original idea was to have some panels showing why the cat wanted to go fishing, and also different panels for the ending, changing according to how much fish the player got to sell.

**Authors:**
- Graphics, sound: Ingrid Peñailillo
- Programming: Jesús González

entries.title: Cortes vs. The Aztecs
entries.description:
![Cover.jpg](///raw/9bd/d1/z/1e50e.jpg)

This was my first game jam. I've wanted to do one for a while but wasn't free during many of the previous events.
I finally have some time off and decided to give this one a go.

Based on the theme of "Sacrifices must be made", I decided that the player would play as Hernan Cortes (a blue cube with a fancy hat) fending off hordes of Aztecs (red, green, and purple cubes) seeking to sacrifice themselves to the Gods (who I didn't have time to implement). The idea being this was their last ditch effort to defeat Cortes.

I had a lot of fun making this game and I got further than I thought I would, I also realised I need to tame my feature creep...

Sadly I didn't have time to make any music, or sound, or a main menu, or a tutorial, or a bunch of other stuff... But there's some mechanics!

Definitely going to carry on with this project after the voting, but now I think I'll hibernate for the week.

Controls:

- WASD to move
- Mouse to aim
- P to restart
- Alt+F4 exits

entries.title: FTD : Fixin' to Die
entries.description:
As a surgeon in a tiny field hospital you must decide whether you have the resources to help each wounded soldier that comes into your tent, or whether they must be sacrificed, for the good of the many.

It's Overcooked meets Surgeon Simulator! 

And in this war, you're either dead... or fixin' to die.

![goodspeling.gif](///raw/b09/z/1e689.gif)

## How to Play :video_game:

- Pick up patients, put them on beds and operate!
- In-game tutorial for the rest.

![screenshot_2018-12-04_01-25-18.png](///raw/b09/z/1ce5d.png)

### Controls

The game was primarily designed for controllers but if you want to use a keyboard -
- **Movement** Arrows/WASD
- **Action (A)** Space/E

### Tips

- Move fast, the longer patients are out of bed, the worse their condition gets!
- Save your blood packs for the more difficult battles towards the end of the game!
- Play to the end, try for a perfect score of saving all patients!

## Credits :love_letter:

entries.title: Faster Than Wind
entries.description:
## What's going on
You, a Captain of pirate ship, are on your way home with a mountain of treasure. But, when you loaded the treasure onto your ship, you forgot to check the food storage.

Now you must find a way to get back home even if it means going through dangerous waters or making your own crew walk the plank... And all while the food lasts.

But fear not, cause if you organize your crew right, not even the tallest waves will stand in your way. May you have a safe journey.

## How to play
There are only few posts to which pirates can be assigned on the ship. Each post has its max capacity, which determines how many pirates can be there at the same time. The posts, together with their max capacity are marked with red on the image below.
![Ship tutorial.png](///raw/416/e1/z/1f50b.png)

You will need to find optimal placement of the pirates in order to beat the game.

Make sure that your crew can see where the ship can go, and that you pick your preferred path before end of each turn.
![PathTutorial.PNG](///raw/416/e1/z/1f513.png)

Drag and drop pirates around, and have fun.

To end the turn, and see its effect click on the button in the lower right corner.
![TurnEndTutorial.PNG](///raw/416/e1/z/1f515.png)

P.S. You should probably also pay attention to the pirate and ship stats.

## Say Hello
Hi all, we are team Pst_Plauge and this is the first game we made together. Most of us have zero or very little experience with Unity so this proved to be quite a challenge but we tried to make everything from scratch and see how far we can go. The game we present to you is very much unfinished and a lot of features we wanted are left unimplemented, but nonetheless we hope that you will enjoy it!

May we Jam again,
Team Pst_Plauge

## Credits
Credits for the font used: https://www.fontspace.com/joannavu

entries.title: Killage People
entries.description:
# Killage People
![chrome_2018-12-04_13-25-58.png](///raw/76d/e1/z/1ea92.png)

You are a captain and the leader of a Tropical Island, and your villagers have decided that life on the island is not good enough for them, so sacrifices must be made! (not from our side of course)

Travel across an ocean and find people that your villagers can sacrifice for the greater good or greater boats!
But don't forget to feed your villagers as well! only a well-fed villager is a good villager.


## Gameplay 

Point and Click to where you want the boat to go 

Click and hold works as well ! 
![drifting.gif](///raw/76d/e1/z/1f16c.gif)

Collect Villagers from other Islands  
![people .gif](///raw/76d/e1/z/1f170.gif)

Go fishing to feed the Villagers
![fishing.gif](///raw/76d/e1/z/1f16e.gif)

Return the goods to your Island! 
![Returned goods.gif](///raw/76d/e1/z/1f172.gif)


The game works as an asynchronous multiplayer. All of the people who connect are stored the ocean,  so it is highly possible to see your friends islands as well!    


## Tools
Game Engine: Unity

Code: Visual Studio

Art: Maya, Photoshop, Substance Painter

https://youtu.be/-a5TsEqfLz0

entries.title: Aztec Sacrifice
entries.description:
Aztec Sacrifice is a game where you take the role of an Aztec Shaman, tasked with pleasing the Gods and protecting your village. Expand your village, protect it from the night's terrors and offer your fellow villagers as sacrifices to keep the Gods happy and receive rewards like: cool magic powers and Gods not killing you!

*Blood for the Aztec Gods!*

entries.title: Timestep
entries.description:
Timestep is a top-down puzzle-ish adventure game where every action you make sacrifices time. You'll need to figure out the fastest way to collect all 3 keys if you want to make it out alive.

I drew all the sprites for this game myself. I went for a cartoon-ish "rough" style (I.E. the outline of the island pokes out a bit in the corners and things like that).

This game was made in 3 days during Ludum Dare 43. This idea was way too complicated for the time limit, and I had to cut a bunch of ideas to make it work in practice, but I had a lot of fun with this one. Hope you enjoy playing it as much as I did making it! :D
![Screenshot1.png](///raw/ece/e1/z/1e36d.png)![Screenshot2.png](///raw/ece/e1/z/1e372.png)![Screenshot3.png](///raw/ece/e1/z/1e3c6.png)![Screenshot4.png](///raw/ece/e1/z/1e376.png).

POST-JAM UPDATES (Version 1.1 and 1.2 Patch Notes):
-Fixed collision issues in the forest area (reduced tree density)

-Lowered volume of the sound that plays upon failing.

-Added Mac build (Note: this is untested, so if you run into any issues launching the Mac build please let me know)

-The spacebar now swings the axe just like left-click, this should make playing with a trackpad easier.

-Added some text files and stuff, especially with the Mac version.

entries.title: Golem
entries.description:
Golem is a programming puzzle game, where the player programs a golem to solve puzzles and fight against other golems.

![screenshot_cut.png](///raw/58a/z/1ed64.png)

Since I'm starting my bachelor project this week, I couldn't justify working on an entirely new concept for this Ludum Dare. Instead, with Golem 2, I started reworking an older project of mine, which will also be my bachelor project.
The game isn't finished but I will keep on uploading newer versions of it (while keeping the original submission ofc).

So to clarify: Golem was developed from scratch during the Ludum Dare weekend, but I made up the concept before. Also, I used some art assets from the previous golem prototype.

Feedback for my updated version is highly appreciated as I will continue working on it the upcoming months!

Bonus challenge: Find a solution to program your golem in a way that clears all levels!

--- UPDATES ---

18/12/04 - added game objective and level progression

18/12/05 - added "clear board" button, rotation symbols doesn't rotate, some bugfixing

entries.title: Claude Van Clamme Presents: Lambs to the Slaughter  Temple of Gods Edition
entries.description:
In a world, dominated by the ever present entertainer extraordinaire Claude Van Clamme, the old gods grow restless, for far too long the gods have been unsatisfied and sacrifices to them have reached an all time low mostly due to the human race being mesmerised by Claude Van Clamme’s tantalising shell on their television screens and the gods disapprove of the trials and tribulations and low entertainment level of the Claude Van Clamme’s latest Game Show - “Lies, and the Lying Liars who tell them”.

Your job as a newly hired high-priest in the temple of gods is to sort through the decks of humans and ensure each god is well and truly satisfied

![shot1.png](///raw/869/2/z/1deb3.png) 
Instructions:

Welcome to Sacrifice Ltd!
Tomorrow is your first day, you will be in charge of choosing who to sacrifice to the gods.

The four gods you will attempt to satisfy are:
Sir Pent (Green): He loves strong people
SkeleDeer (Yellow): He wants your gold
Triangulon(Pink): He'll tell you a who to kill - in letter form
King Octo(Purple): He likes smart people
Our eschatologists tell us it would be bad if they're not happy!

To select a target for sacrifice pick up a card corresponding to a person and stamp it with the corresponding stamp corresponding to the god.
Be careful the next generation of a house will take after the surviving members of that house.

The people will get angry if you kill them,
if they belong to a house that house may attempt assassination - but they'll tell you beforehand.
You can bribe the houses with our handy bribe board, this is also where you buy guards.

You get money from donations from houses, the happier they are with you the more they'll give you.
The Daily Sacrifice will give you all the information you need about the wills of the gods and the houses.

![shot2.png](///raw/869/2/z/1deb6.png)

 ![Team.png](///raw/869/2/z/1deba.png)

Team Credits: 

Woj 'Was Here' Rak- Blender man, Programmer.

David 'Mid Range' Mason  - Art, His Idea.

Robert 'Buckets' Mason - Programmer.

David '' Mason - 2d art, Easter egg, actually his idea, gets 4 things.

Carpster - Flavour text, the name.

Thanks to  Anchovy for use of Triangulon.

entries.title: Dungeon Escape 3D
entries.description:
**Dungeon Escape 3D is a game about ... escaping from a dungeon!**

Surprised?

_You got imprisoned by orcs and are now trapped!_
Find the green-glowing shrine and teleport out of the dungeon.

But there are orcs that will kill you on sight.
You can not fight nor kill them, so you have to hide in dark spots, and do not get near them at all!
![Orcs2.jpg](///raw/cbb/91/z/1ee1e.jpg)

There are also some other shrines you can discover in the dungeon. They may help you escape, when you sacrifice something to them.
![Shrine1.jpg](///raw/cbb/91/z/1ee1f.jpg)

### Features:
* Dungeon to explore
* Stealth-mechanic (hiding in in dark)
* Shrines to make sacrifices and eventually escape

### Controls:
* W, S, A, D to move.
* Mouse to look around.
* E to interact with shrines.

Everything was created by me during the jam, exept for the orc mesh, which my friend Nightwatch created.

#### Tools used:
* Godot 3.0.6 as game engine
* Blender for modeling and texturing (texture baking)
* Krita for texturing
* Gimp for creating roughness- and normalmaps
* Piskel for creating the leveldesign

#### About the leveldesign:
The game creates the level based on a pixelated texture.
Each pixel of the texture stands for a 1m*1m square in the game.
And the pixelcolor determines which level-prefab(lava, orc, shrine, etc.) is created at it's position.
So this is the level you play in the game (upscaled):
![Map.png](///raw/cbb/91/z/1ee12.png)
Because it is pretty easy to print such a texture, this level was created in the last 30minutes of the jam lol.
The next update will definitely be able to load custom maps...

#### Known problems:
* The ai of the orcs is somewhat unpolished. (they always turn 90 degrees at once and may even see you in the shadows)
* Orcs walk over lava like they don't care.
* May have bad performance on lower spec pcs.
* No sounds :( (i may add some in a future update)

#### About future updates:
The next update(in a week or so) will include:
* Improved orc behaviour and stealth mechanics
* Adjusted walking speed and the ability to sprint
* Ability to load custom maps


Please report any critical issues.

Thank you for reading,

Zelberor

![Orcs3.jpg](///raw/cbb/91/z/1ee21.jpg)

entries.title: Ho Ho Hold Up
entries.description:
![hohohohoho.gif](///raw/db5/8/z/1e278.gif)

![hehehehe.gif](///raw/db5/8/z/1e287.gif)

# Story:

Whelp. It turns out the north pole isn't as wholesome as you might think! The elves don't even make the toys at all! It's all done by machines! The problem is the machines have a bloodlust and will only run on the magic properties of Elf Guts(tm).


In Ho Ho Hold Up, you play as Santa as you collect 250 Elf Guts in order to save Christmas!


# Instructions:
Collect elves into your storage and throw them into the ELF CRUSHER 3000!


# Controls:

WASD – Movement

Shift – Run

J – Suck Up Elves

K – Throw Elves


# HINT:
Green elves are worth 1 Elf Gut, Blue are worth 2, Red 4 and Yellow 8!

entries.title: Fighting Souls
entries.description:
- **Fighting Souls** is a turn based battle game made my Raffe and JustMars. You fight against creatures, and at the end you will face a final boss. You can switch between **4 characters**, and use different spells, powers and other epic things, to try and beat monsters and finally the game.

- You need to sacrifice characters, to be able to make it to the end. 

- **RED** attack buttons deal more damage than **GREEN** attack buttons, but you can only use the **RED** ones once per battle.

- There are two **INSTAKILL** powers in the game. You will figure those out when playing.. 
Your powers reset after every battle. 

- The game is spiced with lots of **humorous** powers, voice acting and animations. 

- We were in a lot of hurry in the end balancing and doing the most important stuff, so we didn't have time to make any detailed textures or models. Still we think the mechanics and characters turned out fine.



![Scrrenshot.png](///raw/6fd/b/z/1ec10.png)

**Controls:**
- **Move**: A & D, or arrow keys
- ** Move camera:** Mouse while holding right or middle click
- **Zoom:** Scroll wheel
- **Change character:** Number keys (1-4) or clicking on icons (only in battle)
- **Attacks:** X & Z (only in battle) or clicking on the attack buttons

![Screnshgotot.png](///raw/6fd/b/z/1ec1b.png)

**Changes in version 1.01:**
- Fixed Agent's icon not showing up
- Added icon for the executable
- Reduced file size

https://twitter.com/RaffeTheRandom

https://twitter.com/JustMars5

entries.title: Chopping Block
entries.description:
Welcome to Chopping Block! The point of this game is to create a dish that follows certain rules established in each level. You must "chop"  the ingredients that don't fit with the rules. You have a certain number of chops, all of which must be used, and not every level has a single solution. Let's get chopping!!

**CLARIFICATION:**

We realize that some things were not explained in-game very well:
- The rules established in each level carry over to all other levels; they are cumulative
- If you click on the "?" box at any point, you will be given a list of all the rules

It also seems that there is a bug where the buttons get a bit finicky at certain resolutions, so we greatly apologize for this inconvenience.

We thank you for all the feedback we've received so far! It really helps us know what we need to improve on! 

Thank you!

**END OF CLARIFICATION**

Level-designer/Playtester:
Kaisor Meridian
@kaisor-meridian

Artist:
John Armstrong
@speakertone

Programmer:
Val Kite
@thevalofman

entries.title: Dinner with a hot chick
entries.description:
![ld43_screenshot1.png](///raw/794/1/z/1d610.png)

You are on a mission to bring food to the king. First, you must reach the castle. Then try to reach the king.

There are 3 different characters to choose from: Sam Ooray, Big Orm Bold'r and the hot chick. Each have their own skills and weaknesses.

Go through the levels by sacrificing yourself to overcome obstacles. The different characters each contribute in a different way. Most obstacles can be overcome in multiple ways, so don't worry about getting stuck.

**Instructions:**

For the keyboard:
- Use the arrows keys to move
- Press [space] to jump
- Press [x] to sacrifice yourself
- Press [z] to clear the level

For the controller:
- Use the left stick to move
- Press (A) to jump
- Press (X) to sacrifice yourself
- Press (B) to clear the level

![ld43_screenshot2.png](///raw/794/1/z/1d611.png)

**Created by:**
- Arne Bezuijen (Effects & shaders)
- Bas Dado (Programming)
- Olivier Hokke (Music, voices & sound effects)
- Antony Löbker (Programming)
- Niels Nijholt (Music)
- Nathan van Ofwegen (Music)
- Simon Tiemersma (Level design & modeling)
- Berend Wouda (Programming)

**Assets from:**

PolygonAdventure, PolygonDungeon, PolygonNature, PolygonSamurai, RPG Character Mecanim Animation Pack

**Notes:**

Try to finish with as few sacrifices as possible!

**Updates:**

We've updated the WebGL version to be in line with the stand-alone version (the WebGL version was outdated because it was built much earlier). While we were at, we also took the opportunity to fix a few game breakers. We also added a Linux build.

![ld43_screenshot3.png](///raw/794/1/z/1d614.png)

entries.title: Sacrificial Sam
entries.description:
You've found a map, and as a treasure hunter and all around ~~good~~ guy, you decided to see where it will take you. In this brand new game from the minds that brought you a wiggling dragon and a jello filled dungeon, you'll play as Sam the treasure hunter extraordinaire on his biggest quest yet! On the way you'll..

## Meet New Friends ![Friends.png](///raw/16/z/1f339.png)

## Solve Puzzles ![Puzzles.png](///raw/16/z/1f33a.png)

## Find Artifacts ![GoodEnding.png](///raw/16/z/1f33c.png)

## and Perform Satanic Rituals ![Rituals.png](///raw/16/z/1f33d.png)

Remember: If it's treasure you are after, then **sacrifices must be made**.

-------------------------------

Use **Arrow Keys** to move, pickup items, and interact with the world around you. The **Shift Key** will cycle through the characters you have unlocked.

### Tips and Tricks
- There are **four levels** to beat, each introducing new mechanics. Try to figure out what the character you unlock does, and use that to solve the rest of the dungeon.
- Altars will need **one or two** things sacrificed to them before they will activate. Once activated they will summon an item/block and/or open a door.
- **Coins** are used in **sacrificial rituals**, and **keys** can open **locked doors**.
- There are also **floor buttons** that will toggle **doors of it's corisponding color** (if any are **held down**), and **levers** that do the same.
- When you unlock a new characters (there are **four characters** total) you can use the left or right **shift key** to control them.
- There are **three secret items** hidden in the game, if you find them you can get the **"good" ending**.

### Version History
**Dec. 3, 2018** :: *v1.0.0*
- Jam Release

**Dec. 6, 2018** :: *v1.0.1*
- Fixed a bug where some doors would not close

entries.title: Seadogs Adrift in a Dog Eat Dog Ocean
entries.description:
**The game is rather incomplete, broken, unbalanced, and untested in terms of gameplay, but has some interesting art made using Tilt Brush in VR, and imported into Unity. I did enjoy a full night of sleep each of the three nights though, practiced healthy game dev, and had fun making the artwork.**

![Unity_2018-12-03_16-32-53.jpg](///raw/7d8/z/1e34f.jpg)

![Honeycam 2018-12-03 16-36-19.gif](///raw/7d8/z/1e3a5.gif)

![Unity_2018-12-03_16-03-11.png](///raw/7d8/z/1e312.png)

![Unity_2018-12-01_18-27-04.png](///raw/7d8/z/1e31e.png)

![Unity_2018-12-03_16-32-07.png](///raw/7d8/z/1e33a.png)

![Honeycam 2018-12-03 16-49-41.gif](///raw/7d8/z/1e4df.gif)

![Unity_2018-12-03_16-17-00.jpg](///raw/7d8/z/1e5d5.jpg)

Your ship was smashed to pieces by the storm. Now, adrift on a makeshift raft of debris, you must get your crew to land. Rations are dwindling, the weather is freezing, and treachery is afoot. Who or what will you sacrifice to make it to land alive?

**Instructions:**

**Camera controls:** Drag with right mouse button to rotate camera. Scrollwheel up and down to zoom in/out.

**Select a dog and give it commands:**
- Huddle: huddle in the center of the raft to regain warmth and stamina
- Paddle: paddle the raft towards land, uses stamina and increases hunger, but keeps you warm
- Salvage/Fish: a very slim chance of finding food, but better than nothing, or is it?
- Eat: feed this dog a ration, increases loyalty and fills belly
- Sacrifice: (NOT WORKING) kill one of the crew to feed the crew (adds rations, decreases loyalty)
- Walk Plank: (NOT WORKING) force the dog to jump into the water to reduce weight on the raft

(I didn't get the chance to add the animations for each of the actions, though the dogs are rigged.)
Keep the dogs out of the freezing cold water, which will drain their warmth rapidly and may kill them. The dog dies when warmth, belly, or stamina reach 0%.

The raft is also carrying gold (I didn't have time to make the treasure chest), which is heavy and is weighing the raft down. You can dump some gold to lighten the load, but this increases the chance of mutiny (not working).

entries.title: Mary had a sacrificial lamb
entries.description:
You are Mary, God of Thunder. 

Keep your little lambs alive with a gentle Zap nearby, to keep them away from the lurking wolf behind the bush. But beware, zap too close and you will sacrifice a lamb. It might just be necessary if you have to get the flock to hustle, though. Think of the herd, sacrifice the individual.

NO INSTALLATION REQUIRED -- WEB GAME!

Also works on a mobile device in landscape mode. 

Tools:

Built with Crafty.js and Krita.

entries.title: Spells and slimes
entries.description:
You are a wizard.

You have to type one word 
(singular and not conjugated) 
on your keyboard to cast a spell and kill the maximum of slimes.
But you have to find them by yourself !!
Each time you kill a slim, you have to sacrifice one letter from the spells you used. If you use this letter in another spell it will hurt you a little. So you'd better find some synonyms or related words to your fire or water spells !
![CharacterSprite2.gif](///raw/c2b/2/z/1eab8.gif)

![screen.png](///raw/c2b/2/z/1e3bf.png)

https://twitter.com/EvainJrmy

entries.title: Apothecary
entries.description:
Apothecary. You have some patients and some herbs. Figure out what works for what symptom, and try not to kill anyone.

Books: click on them to open them, click a page to turn the page, and click outside the book to close it.

Patient files: click on one to open it, click herbs to prescribe them (you can add as many of each as you like), and click the file again to close it.

Click finished when you’re done prescribing herbs and see how you did. Then you can close that book and have another go with herb uses you discovered updated in the herb book.

Update 1: one of the team members noticed a rather large bug when playing it due to a missing folder of files in the build. Included that, recommitted it, and updated the links.

Update 2: swapped the GitLab and Google Drive links for itch.io links. Also provided description of how to play the game above.

entries.title: Sacriflag
entries.description:
# Sacriflag

![sacriflag.gif](///raw/741/8/z/1e367.gif)

Sacriflag is a puzzle game. You need to reach the flag in each level.

At the beginning of each level, you have some points to assign. Here are the three stats:

- Stamina : Required to move, 1 point for normal tiles, 2 points for full forest tiles
- Strength : Required to cut trees using an axe (2 points), or pushing a rock (1 point)
- Wisdom : The amount of points you will earn when doing an action (moving, cutting a tree, or pushing a rock)

You can sacrifice two points to re-assign all remaining points. This is how you will have high scores (assign your wisdom wisefully!).
If you don't like scoring, you can try to collect the gem in each level ;)

# Team

Making this game was really fun !
I would like to thank the people who I worked with:

- [A_Do](https://twitter.com/Adorikill) : Pixel Art
- [Le Art](https://twitter.com/LeArtRemix) : Music & SFX
- Hadri : Code
- Lucas & Djulo : Level Design & Testing
- [yopox (me)](https://twitter.com/elyopox) : Code

# Controls

## Level selection

- SPACE: Choose level
- ARROWS: Select level

## Puzzles

### Game focused

- ARROWS: Move, push, or cut
- TAB: Focus the stats
- S: Sacrifice and focus the stats
- ECHAP: Toggle Game Over

### Stats focused

- UP, DOWN: Select stat
- RIGHT: Assign one point
- S: Sacrifice
- TAB: Focus the game

entries.title: Goats and Gods
entries.description:
Find goats, goad goblins, give to gods

Controls:
Move with WASD
Aim with mouse pointer
Attack with left click
Block by holding right click


Objective:
Collect goats to offer as a sacrifice to an unknown god. Watch out for the spinning centaurs

Known issue: Glitching into the wall... Try holding the shield up and rotating...

Team of four put this together. All feedback is welcome!

entries.title: Cross the Hell
entries.description:
Hello everyone! This time I decided create 2D game. Game is about father which chases evil necromancer who kidnapped his son to the HELL! Necromancer by his inattention lost the MAGIC DAGGER which allows to his user cross multidimensional worlds and our hero took this dagger. But... this is a evil item. If you wanna use it, you have to drain your life energy directly from your HEART. This is a magic thing so you will not die immediatelly but slowly in the painful pain... Your son is waiting...


:D

It's strange that my brain is still able to write such things after not sleeping for +50 hours.

Anyway... The "son" will wait a little longer because I created only 3 levels and I don't finished level with "boss fight". But I will try finish it in the few days (if I will have time) and after that I leave here a link to this "update". I wanted created some levels with "puzzle" mechanics too. Maybe I will add it too.

Goodnight & goodluck. I will probably wake up in the next week :D.


![CtH.png](///raw/f44/41/z/1e8d8.png)


## Controls:
A - left

D - right

SPACE - jump

ENTER / RMB - change the dimension


## Walkthrough
If you don't know how to pass the **level 3** and you wanna throw monitor through the window you can watch this short video:
https://youtu.be/POKSeWa-43w


## Bug fixes:
1. Sometimes character doesn't jump.

entries.title: RAT LABS
entries.description:
![Runner_2018-12-04_13-11-04.png](///raw/9f4/z/1e1d1.png)![Runner_2018-12-04_13-12-22.png](///raw/9f4/z/1e1d7.png)![Runner_2018-12-04_13-14-15.png](///raw/9f4/z/1e1dc.png)

Whey! Once again its more of a proof of concept than a game, although I'm really happy with this one still. Science must be done, and rats must be sacrificed (they are lab rats after all), follow the research tree (its short) to unlock most of the machines we managed to implement.

Work towards the end goal of creating an albino rat with nothing but the powers of science and sacrifice on your side.

# IMPORTANT KEYS

**TAB - Toggle Mouse lock**

**B - Build Mode**

## **Q and R - Rotate**

**X - Delete or Conveyor Belt Removal Tool**

# **T - View the Tech/Progression/Story tree, This is necessary**

## *You navigate the menu with the up and down arrows, enter, and backspace



You can select buildings and items with left click to see more about them, **When you have a building selected you can delete it with X or Delete**

entries.title: Abbey Massacre
entries.description:
In the dark bowels of the House of the Lord stands the Altar of Satan. The priest, who, obviously, has a bipolar disorder or is not the best priest, to begin with, worships the Lord of Hell. He must make bloody sacrifices to his master. And by lucky coincidence, all these sacrifices are in the church right now. Of course. Now our “hero” needs to find a way to get to his victims.
    
### Controls:
  
WASD to move  
Shift to run (if not carrying the body)  
Z to highlight kill targets  
1-2-3-4 for selecting dialogue options  
E/F when prompted for contextual actions  
  
### Basic rules:  
Kill targets and drag their bodies to an altar to make a sacrifice;   
Avoid being caught or bodies being detected.  
*Hint: some targets can be lured into your room via dialogues*  
  
### Crew and tools:  
  
**Programming**  
Unity + C# - @sempiternal (me, a person to blame behind having to cut down on so many features)  
  
**Graphics**  
3DMax + Maya + Layout - DaniilMaly (@daniilmaly) and Kate (@kateb) 
  
**Audio**  
FLStudio + Arcade by Output - @sempiternal  
  
![sacrifices.png](///raw/1af/c/z/1e2f9.png)  
  
![sacrifices2.png](///raw/1af/c/z/1e2fa.png)  
  
![sacrifices3.png](///raw/1af/c/z/1e2fb.png)

entries.title: The Floor is Water
entries.description:
You are a god. You control the rain. Those pesky humans are running amok, littering your perfect landscape with ugly hovels. So, it's time to get biblical on the world and flood it.

Scroll with WASD/arrow keys, click and hold with mouse to make it rain.

People will reproduce on their own (via mitosis!) and ~~will~~ were supposed to drown in water.

## Development Background

Well, we created an interesting tech demo at least, but, once again, we've had to make our own sacrifices regarding our original vision for a god game.

Unfortunately, we couldn't offer you a proper game with rules and objectives this time around, but we at least hope you can enjoy this beautiful ray-casted sandbox.

![ld43_b.png](///raw/34a/z/1e497.png)

![ld43.png](///raw/34a/z/1e493.png)

Our original intent was to have the people offer you sacrifices in order to sustain your power, although we had trouble at the concept phase, and ran into over-designing some aspects, but we learnt a few things along the way at least.

entries.title: The Sunday Massacre
entries.description:

Play as Father Bryer as he gets sent on his most harrowing task yet: He must vanquish the demons that have invaded his church. It has become somewhat of a yearly tradition now as the citizens of Mount Laurrier Township eagerly await their judgment.

With your new found power, set out to do your yearly Demon cleanse. Summon a holy sword to smite your foes, but be careful, with a sword so large and unwieldy you may accidentally take out more then you intend to.

Use WASD to move around, shift to enter Demon search mode, and space bar/left mouse button to attack.

**Programmer:** @ziamor

**Art/Audio:** @jakeuro

**Tools used:**

-Unity

-Aseprite

-FL Studio

-Moog Mother 32

This game is designed for 2 to 4 players only. However we have posted the "singleplayer" version too in order to test you all game mechanics. In singleplayer version, connecting with only one pad will result in starting a game with 4 player version of the map. **This version can be found using itch.io link supplied in downloads links**



**MULTIPLE PAD FIX**
Unity doesn’t always know what to do with gamepads, so there can be issues with pad connections.
If you are playing our game and **your gamepads are acting fuzzy, Try this:**

1.Unplug all xbox controllers that you may have

2.Open the game again.

3.Then start plugging in / connecting controllers one by one

The prison is littered with weird mechanisms that ensure that not all of them will get out alive. You must sacrifice some to save the others. Can you help them make their escape?

entries.title: BLOODDEER SEASON
entries.description:
IT IS THE BLOODDEER SEASON

THEY DEMAND FRESH SOULS

HELP THEM FEED AND THE CHIMNEY
WILL BECOME A WARM ESCAPE

![Screen Shot 2018-12-04 at 02.34.30.png](///raw/6b0/1/z/1e5b6.png)

Controls: Arrow keys (+ Space in menus, and ESC to quit)

----------------------------------------

I restarted after 1.5 days of the Jam, so it was pretty rushed in the end, but I was happy with the result. 

The gameplay ended up pretty close to my first Ludum Dare (#35, entry at http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-35/?action=preview&uid=90062 ) as well as my 7DRL entry ( https://itch.io/jam/7drl-challenge-2018/rate/230931 ), but the Sacrifice part was a nice twist.

How far you've made it is saved in between sessions so you can return to the latest level you got to.

Do let me know if you manage to get to the End screen - especially the last level is pretty hard!

entries.title: BeetShield
entries.description:
![gif.gif](///raw/5af/81/z/1e383.gif)

**Controls:**

 - WASD - move active bee
 - Shift - switch focus to previous bee
 - Space - switch focus to next bee
 - P - pause/unpause game

It is the year 21XX. Most of Earth's ecosystems have been destroyed. Most plants and animals are gone.

However, one lone swarm of bees is holding out against the harsh post-collapse environment and the alien insects that are now attempting to gain control over their territory and wipe them out for good.

To protect their hive they'll need to be ready to put their own lives on the line.

Try to keep the hive parts from being destroyed by moving the bees and blocking projectiles with their bodies.

They aren't invincible though! There are ways of regenerating troops:

 - After the end of a wave, all living bees will have their health restored fully
 - When a hive part is destroyed, a new bee will hatch from the ruins

Watch out for green, explosive shot-lobbing foes! Their projectiles will blow up all hive parts and bees in a large area, killing off the spawn of the former instantly. Try to block these shots as they come down.

entries.title: Unicorn Rescue
entries.description:
Goal: Rescue the unicorn eggs by "sacrificing" rare treasures to the slime monsters!

**Screenshots:**

![LDJAM43-Unicorn-Rescue-Outside.png](///raw/a4e/01/z/1e370.png)

![LDJAM43-Unicorn-Rescue-Castle.png](///raw/a4e/01/z/1e384.png)

![LDJAM43-Unicorn-Rescue-Dungeon.png](///raw/a4e/01/z/1e38c.png)

**How to play:**

- Use the arrow keys to move around
- Press the enter or space key to pick up treasures or interact with monsters

**Development notes:**

This was built using Godot Engine, which I decided to start looking at less than a week before Ludum Dare #43 started. I enjoyed working with it a lot, and was surprised at how much I was able to accomplish with the engine even while being completely new to it. All graphics were made over the course of the weekend using Inkscape for the vector drawings, and Blender to model the unicorns and then render them as tiny 2D sprites.

**Other background:**

Since I was planning to use an engine I was unfamiliar with, I entered this jam with the plan of making something simple that my daughters (ages 4 and 7) would be able to play and enjoy -- they've been slightly obsessed with unicorns (which they say hatch from eggs), and also slime, so that became the subject matter for my submission. Hopefully it can provide a few minutes of entertainment for adults as well :)

Your home planet was destroyed and you barely escaped.  You’ve gathered a small fleet of survivors as you make your way to Orion, where a new home awaits.  Navigate a universe of dangerous pirates and difficult decisions, sacrificing everything as you journey along… The Orion Trail.

Good prophets are so hard to find.
I, Wana-Haya'yu, the magnificent corporate volcano god, want to hire YOU!
Yes, you, the prophet for hire, will be tested.
How many followers can you gather? How many will you joyously integrate into my Sacred Lava™?

entries.title: Breeze Wanderer
entries.description:
![medium-cover.png](///raw/574/a1/z/1ebce.png)

# About the game
**Breeze Wanderer** is a minimalist **puzzle game**, where you have to **guide one or more balloons** towards the **finish points**.

![medium-ss.png](///raw/574/a1/z/1ebcf.png)

# How to play
- The **goal** of the game is to **push the balloons** towards the **finish points**.
- To **push the balloons**, left click on the **fans**.

# Made with
- **Java** - the programming language used
- **[libGDX](https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/index.html)** - the game framework used
- **[Box2D](https://box2d.org/)** - 2D physics library

# Credits
- **[Looperman](https://www.looperman.com/)** for **[music](https://www.looperman.com/loops/detail/95790/hq-poisoned-heart-piano-loop-by-nbeats26-free-50bpm-ambient-piano-loop)**
- **[freesound](https://freesound.org/)** for **sound effects**

entries.title: Learn to be a self stopper!
entries.description:
A game about AI driving, it's your goal to teach the most bleeding edge car to have the least amount of bleeding edges, ideally.

Spacebar to go through the menus, and W, A, and D to direct the car to the ideal outcome. I barely had any time left so there's no reset button, you'll just have to reopen the game, sorry about that.

entries.title: SpaceCrafter
entries.description:
Spacecraft shooting and crafting game. You get new components for your ship, you need to keep fancy guns of your enemy undestroyed but still defeat him. Risk or safety? Sacrifice to make.

Other than that, just enjoy customizing your own space ship and fight with a variety of weapons from laser beam torch to tracking missile.

Some screenshots and clips: 

![n5short.gif](///raw/a10/3/z/1effc.gif)


![n2.gif](///raw/a10/3/z/1effd.gif)


![n1.gif](///raw/a10/3/z/1effe.gif)

![Snipaste_2018-12-04_21-25-20.png](///raw/a10/3/z/1efff.png)


A 10 min full gameplay:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QobisFeoMy4

Post jam update: just add a skybox and a terrain.

![snapping.gif](///raw/a10/3/z/1e662.gif)

![battle-short.gif](///raw/a10/3/z/1e3a9.gif)

Controls: 

Ship Edit mode: Mouse R - CamOrbit; Mouse Wheel - Zoom; Mouse L - Select; R - Rotate Component; T - Swtich snapping point
Battle mode: WASD - Move & Rotate; QZ - Tilt; EC - Vertical Pan; (CamOrbit is the same)

(Press G to generate free ship component to customize! don't tell anyone)

Program by shrekshao

entries.title: Oblation
entries.description:
Play as a woman who has made a deal with a Demon and now must make human sacrifices to this Demon.

Search through the village houses to find your target and bring them to the altar.

entries.title: Work, Play, or Sleep?
entries.description:
Work, Play, or Sleep is a game about trying to find the balance of life. Keep your family member's stats (food, happiness, strength, and sleep) at decent levels.

Use your mouse to navigate. Click on items from Sal's shop, and then onto a family member to purchase it.

Once you believe your family is happy and healthy, select what you'd like each family member to do that day, and then press "Begin Day".

![mygame4.png](///raw/d45/d/z/1e3a7.png)

Thanks for playing. :)

(Aware of a bug that sometimes causes the camera to not switch to showing the daily tasks after you press Begin Day, as well as the fact that the game isn't very balanced at the moment.)

entries.title: Oath of Balance
entries.description:
Fulfil your oath as a Paladin to both the Gods of Life and Death! At the same time!

![screen1.png](///raw/44f/z/1e61a.png)

This is a First-Person voxel-style wave based hack and slash.

WASD - movement
Left Click - Attack (Keep held for second attack)
Hold Right click - Raise shield

You will be assaulted by an onslaught of demonic creatures! Cut them to pieces in the name of your deities! Will you show favouritism? Kill an enemy near the Altar of the God of Life (the yellow altar) as a sacrifice and receive a blessing in the form of a healing boost. Sacrifice an enemy for the God of Death, however, and you will be given the energy for a special third attack, a high-damage spinning slash!

Survive six rounds, and you will face off with the Soulreaper himself...

Then you win, we kept it short and sweet, hopefully. Thank you for playing!

![screen2.png](///raw/44f/z/1e61d.png)

(Whilst the SFX have been made by us, the music is made by Kevil McLeod, hence we cannot be rated in audio)

A top down shooter inspired by Hotline Miami and Blade Runner. To upgrade and become more powerful you must sacrifice your humanity!

entries.title: Sacrifices must be made to the Dragon!

entries.title: Business Run
entries.description:
In Business Run, you are that hypocritical old-fashioned boss that only cares about sales. Earn cash by jumping over sales peaks and survive by unfairly firing your employees when you face a huge drop.

INSTRUCTIONS

W = Jump (-50 $ each jump)

Click on bullets: hire employees (-200$ each employee). You will encounter many sales drops. You can overcome the small ones, but you won't be able to jump over huge drops! The only way to surpass them is by having employees hired so you can (automatically) fire them.

Beware of the red deadline of death! You will lose if it catches you.

Made for the LDJAM 43 in more or less 15 hours

entries.title: Save the Yel's!
entries.description:
![Cover image](///content/b3/z/1e7ca.png)
  
**___**  
  
For once, I had an idea in time. Nothing original at all (a very bad clone of the must-have Lemmings), but I wished that, for once, I could make a better game than my previous entries for many (too many) previous LD's. But my old ennemies still are there. Collisions not working, strange and unexpected behaviors, silly bugs… Well, the time I saved while finding an idea way sooner than usual, was lost way speeder than usual. And I ended hurrying until the very last minute, as usual. But, hey, this is LD, it's fun. But, sometimes, I wonder if I will have all the fun, at least… Once? Next time, I hope. :smile:  
  
So, the game. Some Yel's will go out from the trap(s) - in blue - and want to find the exit - in white. You have some limited tasks/abilities that you can give to them, in order to prevent them from an awfull dead. The stopper stay in the way, forcing the other Yel's to go back. The shoveler dig the next obstacle in front of him. The driller dig right below him until he falls. The miner too, but he dig in diagonal. The jumper and the climber have the abilities, respectively, of falling from heights without crashing like an egg, and climbing (I'm afraid that this one is pretty buggy, and horribly slow) - those two are permanent, and can be combined. The builder will make stairs, until he runs out of steps (8), or he's blocked. The kamikaze will act as a stopper, until the 5 seconds are down, then he die in a little explosion. Stoppers can be removed by making them blow, or if someone dig under them. You can slow down or speed up the Yel's out frequency by using the buttons up-left. If you are stuck, you can blow up everyone by clicking the button up-right (only if all the Yel's are out). You need to save at least a certain number of Yel's every level, but I forgot to show how much (however, when it's good, the "saved" count is green). There is only four levels, and it's yet a miracle, giving the late moment I started the level design. (try to) Enjoy, and thank you for testing my ~~buggy~~ game. :laughing:   
  
*Note : after publication and due to comments, I added some buttons on the main page to access the levels already done (it was meant, but I forgot in the final hurry -_-; )*

entries.title: Feasts must be made!
entries.description:
![start.png](///raw/edd/2/z/1e391.png)  ![pr.png](///raw/edd/2/z/1e3b9.png)


In __Feasts must be made!__ you are the captain of a boat being held captive by Bacchus, he heard you criticize parties and wants to punish you. He did not imprison you so that you could harvest fruits to make offerings and feed him. Until then, he will keep your crew members imprisoned in small cages. You have to feed Bacchus with fruits before he gets mad at you and punishes you and your captive team. 


As a certain someone would say: "Logic clearly dictates that the needs of the many outweigh the needs of the few". So, if you have no other choice, you can sacrifice one of your crew members to feed him a lot at once. Take care, though! Each time you sacrifice someone, there is one less fruit spawn available and your lowered morale makes you run slower.  

### TL;DR : Pick up fruits (with E) and drop them on the altar at the bottom right (with e) to feed bacchus before the end of the countdown. If you're short on time don't have enough fruits dropped on the altar, you can sacrifice someone by standing on his cage and pressing e. ###


Thanks to Baboulinet & Maz for being great guinea pigs! :)  

*[French speakers passing by, please take a look at a little something I wrote for the game](https://www.facebook.com/notes/caffeinated-psychics/ludum-dare-43/1221124601370882).*


Controls | Function
---------|---------
WASD & the Arrows | Move your character  
 E | Pick up fruits, sacrifice someone, drop fruits on the altar  
H | Display the help in game  
M | Mute music  
Page Up / Down | Raise / Lower volume  
R | Restart the level


PS : There seems to be a problem with resolutions, please play in 1280*720 or if you're playing on the web build, please avoid maximizing the game window. Sorry.

entries.title: Miguel's Birthday present

My Project for the LudomJam, 

All the Programming Part has been done by me, meanwhile the art is made by Lucia Paganini(she doesn't possess a Ludom Dare Account), My partner in this GameJam.

entries.title: CHARON
entries.description:
A game made in Ren'Py for Ludum Dare 43, with writing by Robin (twitter @/kissesfingers) and art and programming by fletch arrow (twitter @/fletcharrow_). Think of it like a 'guess who' game, but a bit more intense.

An interplanetary flight suffers a critical power failure with six passengers' lives supported while in stasis. 
One VIP must survive. 
With limited information due to technical difficulties, a new 'automatic life assessment system' presents stored information about the passengers and must terminate those who can no longer be supported, one by one.

As the program, you must decide who survives.

![regarding.png](///raw/03c/02/z/1e3ac.png)

entries.title: Fire and Atlas
entries.description:
### Fire and Atlas

Burn and replace your inaccurate maps in order to find the treasure on each screen.

Each map contains an X, marking the location of the treasure... supposedly. Before you dig, be sure to compare your map to the current screen and make sure nothing is amiss.


### Controls
- **Arrow keys:** Move
- **Z:** Dig
- **X:** View Atlas
- Bump into objects to interact with them

---

### Screenshots

![SCREENS.png](///raw/887/e1/z/1e314.png)

---

### Bugfix log
- Fixed a bug where the "correct map" for one of the screens (starting screen) was inaccurate.
- Fixed a bug where the "correct map" for one of the screens (2 to the left of start) was inaccurate.



### Some things I'd like to do for a post-jam version

- Lower the requirement for completing the game to 15 treasures, since getting all 24 can take some time.
- Open chests and get a non-functional item, just for fun.
- Make it so Z has to be held down in order to dig to guard against accidental button presses.
- More polished ending.
- Overworld music.

entries.title: Watch Your Step
entries.description: This game fits the LD43 theme ("sacrifices must be made") only loosely at best (if only I had more time...). The game does not require you to kill the player to advance.

entries.title: Zoombies!
entries.description:
Zoombies! is a zombie-themed game about keeping your friends alive. It's fairly bare-bones, but it is _technically_ finished.
**Controls:** arrow keys to move, left mouse to shoot.
Thanks for playing!!
[Zoombies.png](///raw/7ca/d1/z/1e40e.png)

entries.title: King's Wrath
entries.description:
![screenshot01.png](///raw/521/2/z/1dff9.png)

![screenshot02.png](///raw/521/2/z/1e000.png)

![screenshot03.png](///raw/521/2/z/1e007.png)

As a tyrannical king, you must defend your realm from invasion by raising a massive army. Attack the villages to keep them in line, but don't kill so many that they can't keep sending food for your growing army. When you attack a village, prisoners will be dragged to the castle to be sacrificed, keeping the village too scared to fight back. If the villages rise up against you or the invading army defeats your army, you lose.

Controls:
- Click on a village to attack

Credits:
- svntax: Programming
- ChiralPixels: Art
- bug: Music

UPDATE: The game was unbeatable due to some debug values being used for some variables. This has been changed now.

UPDATE 2: There is now an experimental web version of the game. If there is an issue with the web version (such as no audio playing), try the desktop version instead.

entries.title: The Pursuit of Profit
entries.description:
**ATTENTION:** If you experience flickering, please **try using Firefox.**

**Postmortem:** https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/the-pursuit-of-profit/postmortem-the-pursuit-of-profit

## Intro

You have invented a marvelous machine which converts human lives directly into cold, hard cash. There's just one problem: once it starts, it won't stop! How much profit can you extract before your creation (and your conscience) catches up with you?

![title_screen.png](///raw/455/f1/z/1ee06.png)

![screenshot.png](///raw/455/f1/z/1e3a1.png)

## Keyboard Controls

* **Run:** Left and Right arrows
* **Jump:** Up arrow
* **Throw:** Space

## Changelog

* [2 hours after jam end] Fixed button on title screen not being clickable. (This had a documented workaround of pressing space instead of clicking.)

entries.title: Sacrificial Forest Friends
entries.description:
![LD43_screenshot.png](///raw/4f4/4/z/1e64f.png)

You've joined a cult that is trying to summon demons, but sacrifices must be made. Aim spells at forest creatures to gather souls. With enough luck, maybe you'll summon something great!

To cast spells use the space bar, left and right mouse buttons. The color coordinated bars at the bottom indicate how long of a cool down is left. Once the bar vanishes, that spell can be cast again.

This is my first solo LD. Any constructive feedback is appreciated!


Many thanks to @Burgee for feedback and advice!

entries.title: Escape Pod
entries.description:
Story

The process for picking a ship captain has always been purely political, and as such the captain of this ship is an incompetent buffoon. Your job, whether you like it or not, is to help the captain escape his ship at whatever costs necessary. Simply click on a crew member to make them run, and click them again to make them stop - but look out for the space bear traps!

Controls

Click on crew members to start or stop them

Click/drag or WASD or arrow keys to pan camera

Scroll to zoom

R to reset a level

Esc to pause

entries.title: Scapegoat
entries.description:
![ld43.png](///raw/18/z/1f35c.png)
![screen2.jpg](///raw/28/z/1e369.jpg)
![unknown.png](///raw/28/z/1e374.png)
![image3.jpg](///raw/28/z/1e38a.jpg)

## Description

Scapegoat is a first-person Legend of Zelda-style puzzle game about a man on a quest to save the world by sacrificing a goat to appease the angry gods.

Edit: Major bug has been fixed where you couldn't get past first lever in first level.

Edit 2: Added a main menu crediting everyone who worked on this.

Edit 3: Added a "Post LD" version where the puzzles are a bit more forgiving and carrot trees grow back.  **Streamers should use the "Post LD" version because the original version uses Exclusive Fullscreen instead of Fullscreen Windowed mode**

Edit 4: Add experimental Linux version for people with penguin-shaped computers.

## Input Controls

Movement: WASD *Don't forget SHIFT to sprint!*

Interact (pick up/put down goat): E

Throw Carrot: Q

Whistle: F

Jump: Space (disabled when carrying goat)

Crouch: C

entries.title: DBK - A Band Story
entries.description:
### The legendary band DBK
Everyone have heard their songs but few know the band's beginnings. Follow DBK in every step of the way to fame, including all the sacrifices they had to make.
___
## Gameplay

DBK is a puzzle game with some twist. You need to help each member get to the rehearsal, picking up their instrument and the money they need first. Each member can interact with the objects of its color.
![1.PNG](///raw/a70/8/z/1f721.png)
![2.PNG](///raw/a70/8/z/1f722.png)

## Controls

- Move characters with **WASD**.
- Change characters with **Space** or using the numpad (1-3).
- Rotate the camera dragging with your mouse.
- Interact with objects walking to them.

## Music

I love making dynamic soundtracks, I have done it for every Ludum Dare I've made. this game is not exception, try to notice how the music changes as you play.

### Notes

Sadly, the game only have 7 out of my planned 15 levels. But is fully playable and fun to do so. I might add more levels to it, if you check the source code you could see levels are represented by a json file, so it's quite easy to add more.

entries.title: Sacrificio Inc.
entries.description:
![Compo-animations-16-9.gif](///raw/124/e/z/1e724.gif)

## SACRIFICIO Inc. is actively seeking for a sacrifice technician. 

**Skills required :** 
You are able to fix and maintain an offering machine. The conveyor belts which compose it are a bit disordered. Your job is to put them back in place and send the future sacrificed straight to the death pit to satiate the blood thirst of the gods.

Be careful ! One misstep and your offering will take to his heels !

**Remuneration :** 
To be discussed. But if the crops are bad, it’s on you...

____________
![2018-12-05-03-22-51e.gif](///raw/124/e/z/1ef85.gif)
____________
### 📝 Quick recap on what will change in a future version :
- More levels with **different grid sizes**
- More tiles with **new mechanics**
- The timer will change to a **move counter**
- Losing will not restart the whole room
- **Mouse controls** will be totally reworked
- Cloud feedbacks for the blocks when they move (and **more feedbacks** in general)

### 🔧 Fixes :
- Press "**F**" to toggle fullscreen on / off
- Tutorial will only play once per launch now
- New game icon

### 🍻 Our friendly team

* 🎨 **Emilie Defernez** (Frigolite) :  Character design, animations, motion design, main beer supplier

____________

![qr-mobile-2.png](///raw/124/e/z/1ef87.png)

__________

**Thanks everyone for your interest and feedbacks !**

entries.title: Reap what you sow
entries.description:
![gameplay.gif](///raw/fbc/1/z/1e6ea.gif)

Try to harvest enough crops to survive the winter! You have 15 days to grow as many crops as you can. Don't forget to sacrifice crops to appease the gods to gain their favor!

entries.title: Body Language
entries.description:
The Crash Site Investigation Team was assembled in 2008 and charged with the task of conducting investigations involving fatalities, serious injuries, or crashes of a complex nature requiring their expertise.  It is comprised of agents who have had specialized training in aeronautical accident investigations and interactions with the public.  
You are one such agent.
Interrogate the survivors of a plane crash to learn what really happened.  Pay close attention to their body language.  Can you find the truth amidst the lies?

entries.title: Sneaky Cannibal
entries.description:
Controls:
Arrow keys -> move
Space -> interact


Navigate throughout houses, trying to find the next unlucky sacrifice to feed your hunger


Note, view "Original ideas" (on itch.io) to see original game idea, (scrapped due to team member dropout)

entries.title: Renegade Fire!
entries.description:
# Intro:
The fires have gone renegade! Once our greatest ally, the element itself has turned against us, with conflagrations now a part of daily life. Can your intrepid squad of firefighters possibly keep up?!

# Instructions:
This is a unit micromanagement game about running around and putting out fires to save various towns. 
- Put out all fires to beat the level
- Click firefighter to select
- Right click on a tile to move firefighter
- Move a firefighter to a tile that is on fire to put it out You have to right click the tile, not the building)
- Once a tile has been put out, it will stay out for a short time
- A and D keys to rotate camera around map

# Postmortem
The original plan was for the firefighters to persist between levels with bonuses granted based on which buildings were saved. That way, you'd have to pick which buildings to save and which to sacrifice. We also wanted you to sometimes have to sacrifice some of your guys to to win, for an extra layer of themeness. Of course, for that to matter we needed levels, and for that a level editor (note: we did not actually really probably need a level editor), so we ran out of time. We might work on it a bit more and add in some of the depth we never got around to.

# Credits
- Design/Programming - Logan Stolmaker, Davide Spiert, Mark Pressler
- Art/Effects - Davide Spiert
- Level Design - Mark Pressler 


# Tools
- Unity 2018
- Gimp
- Krita
- Photoshop Cloud

entries.title: Esus
entries.description:
![tło.png](///raw/efa/d1/z/1e2f1.png)
Our first LD ends successfully. We developed our first game ever... and we did it in under 3 days.
You people who did it as well - you are INSANE!!!!! (not even going to mention compo freaks as I shouldn't speak directly to gods).

Game is playable, yet unfortunately we didn't menage to polish it well.
Unfinished things:
- Mechanics (70% implemented)
- Balance - at this point gets a big 'XD' but you can still finish it in various ways
- SFX unimplemented
- Music is looped only
- VO subtitles - Vo might be hard to understand without subs, but you can try ;)
- Interaction - mostly RIP - that’s the big one as we tried to make narrative game
- Animation (60% implemented)

We'd love to hear your feedback as main idea and mood we wanted to share are there :)
(Also - there are 5 different endings)

Game is (well... will be) based on meta - sacrifice your gameplay attributes along with the story. 

- Movement - WSAD
- Attack - space
- Interaction - E (in the future)
- Choose attribute to sacrifice - Mouse

Click play - wait for music to load - enjoy
I think it's worth finishing - do you?

entries.title: Wrath Of The Gods
entries.description:
![cover image.png](///raw/75e/z/1e603.png)

It's just another day for the village shaman. Help the villagers make sacrifices before you incur the Wrath Of The Gods!

[**Ritual Companion Guide download**](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1awZTYYJgGSrTiw5Tk3ung1-wDNYZVVvh/view?usp=sharing)

### Prepare the Sacrifices
- Listen to villager requests
- Boil ingredients to match the ink color with their prayer type
- Grab a sacrifice (doll, bird, cat, or even goat!)
- Draw their god's symbol
- Return the object and pray the gods will be please

### Shaman Hut Features:

- **Bowl**: Holds all your ingredients at once!
- **Fire**: Boil ingredients to concoct a new ink!
- **Fountain**: Need a new color? Wash the old one away!

### Controls:
- Click and hold to lift objects. Release to drop the object on the table or villager.
- Release the pen on the bowl liquid to change its color. Then click a sacrifice to draw
- Draw symbols by click and holding
- Esc: Menu (useful if the book gets knocked away...)

**Rated M** for animal sacrifices

Created by **MessinaBrothers**
  - AfroAnt - programming
  - Evil_As_Shiz - graphics/audio

With special thanks to twitch chat! (coughterryrileycough)

[Post-LD Version](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dHFc5qn7uXH9S3mtIhSyHjFjw35_SlgA/view?usp=sharing) (Do not use for rating!)

![post-ld.png](///raw/75e/z/1f711.png)

- Graphics: new color palette, villagers now sport various '80s-inspired apparel
- Controls: hover over the bowl to change pen color, objects in bowl easier to take out
- Villagers: enter through door, stay until given a sacrifice, satisfy 10 to win the game
- Ritual Book: less words, fixed phantom first and last pages
- Resolution: changed from 640x514 :sob: to 1280x960

entries.title: Gaze into the Abyss
entries.description: This is a game designed to be just as accessible to the blind as the sighted. Use stereo sound to navigate the abyss and collect the magic crystals and save humanity. ![GazeIntoTheAbyss.png](///raw/fa6/3/z/1e42f.png)

entries.title: Cargo Sacrifice
entries.description: A game I made for LD43. You must sacrifice cargo to get across the ocean while in a storm. Your fuel goes down but the less cargo you have the higher your chances of getting across. The more cargo you have the more money you gain.

entries.title: Sacriformation
entries.description:
![mockup.png](///raw/dfd/02/z/1e68c.png)
###### not a real screenshot

A collaboration between [Giginss](https://ldjam.com/users/giginns) and [Terracottafrog](https://ldjam.com/users/terracottafrog)

Sacrifice your abilities to gain ever more powerful ones in __Sacriformation__, a platformer where you traverse massive landscapes in search of demonic altars.

__Sacriformation__ features:

* Huge worlds
* Demonic themes
* Buggy physics
* Gravity Shifting
* Getting stuck in walls
* Rendering bugs!

protip dont do gamejams in unity without practice everybody

# Instructions:

WASD. Shift to sprint / teleport.

Find altars to sacrifice then augment your abilities. If an altar doesn't work yet try another one. Try to get to the final altar.

entries.title: Triumph Tribute
entries.description:
![imagemLDJAM.png](///raw/4c2/c/z/1e2c9.png) 

Hello LudumDare, for the 4th time our team is participating of this incredible event, I hope you'll have a good time playing our game. This game was made by members of Coffee Machine Studio, Fanatee and others.

### **About the Game:**

In a distant realm, 5 heroes were walking in a dense forest, looking forward to their next adventure together. Everything was fine until something very strange happens... 

Play to find out, and help our heroes to survive while facing a very dark secret.

### **Commands:**
> 
- **Movement** - AWSD
- **Open Chests** - Mouse right button
- **Minigames** - Mouse left button
> 

### **TIPS:**
> 
- Try to avoid the enemies you don't WANT to battle... (life for life, remember!)
- The mini-games are: Barbarian: Hit the center with left click,
- The mini-games are: Cleric: use mouse left and right click to position the stone at the center,
- The mini-games are: Mage: hold mouse left click and release when you are on the darker blue area,
- The mini-games are: Ranger: Wait for the aim to be at the center and left click,
- The mini-games are: Paladin: defend all axes by moving the mouse up and down.
- Explore the map!
> 

### **TEAM INFOS:**

Programmers(LINKEDIN):

Guilherme de Souza: https://www.linkedin.com/in/guilherme-de-souza-silva/

Gustavo de Souza: https://www.linkedin.com/in/gustavo-de-souza-silva/

Luiz Guilherme Pelegrini: https://www.linkedin.com/in/luiz-pelegrini/

Artists:
Bruno: https://www.artstation.com/brunopavodeoliveira

Thiago: https://www.artstation.com/thiagolopes​

Victor: https://www.artstation.com/vti

William Carvalho: https://www.instagram.com/oaken.art

Coffee Machine Studio: 
Page: https://www.facebook.com/coffeemachinestudio/

Enjoy!

### PATCH NOTES
```
1.5 - Fixed inventory bug (it was being shown during combat and not displaying the dead characters)
1.4 - Fixed health bar bug and minor adjustments.
1.3 - Fixed reset game bug, fixed English texts and minor adjustments.
1.2 - Fixed Paladin bug.
1.1 - Fixed HTML5 Sounds, fixed game texts.
1.0 - Game Launch
```

entries.title: Underhome
entries.description:
There's a hole in your stomach that only socks can satisfy! The Hoomans have discarded their stinky treasures around the house - collect as many as you can, but don't get caught!

Created by Luke King (twitter @/Owlmeat) & Marianne Cassidy (twitter @/marnyarn), with original music by Elie Abraham. This was our first Ludum Dare and our first time working together, we're pretty proud of what me were able to achieve!

entries.title: He-Who-Is-Beyond-The-Sun
entries.description:
Extend your power from within your Prison... peer through the veil to see who and what you can terrorize, corrupt or plain up murder. 
He-Who-Is-Beyond-The-Sun SHALL NOT BE CONTAINED!

entries.title: Colors of Your World
entries.description:
![colors-of-your-world.png](///raw/b57/z/1e780.png)

[Cocoa Moss](https://cocoamoss.com/) presents **Colors of Your World**, a platformer about the colors of life.

- A short platforming adventure.
- Sacrifices must be made to progress.
- What will become of your world?

**Post-jam version (v0.11): https://cocoamoss.com/colors-of-your-world/colors-of-your-world.html**

**Compo version (v0.02): https://ddrkirby.com/games/colors-of-your-world/compo-version/colors-of-your-world-compo.html**

Challenge mode, time attack mode, soundtrack download, post-mortem, and more coming soon!

Changelog:

```
v0.11
- Fixed obstacles in screen 2-8, which was completely broken
- Made screens 2-3, 2-4, and 2-8 slightly easier to avoid ramping up difficulty too quickly
- Made most of world 3 more difficult to increase challenge, especially the last screen
- Climbing now "snaps" onto the top of platforms earlier, to avoid awkward mid-air cling look

v0.10
- Added 3 brand new screens to world 3
- Completely reworked screen 3-5 (previously the last screen of world 3)
- Tweaked world 1 and world 2 screens slightly
- You can now drop from climbing without walljumping by holding down while pressing jump
- Dashing into a wall while holding towards the wall now interrupts the dash to climb immediately
- Dashing while climbing or letting go from climbing now always dashes away from the wall
- Tweaked the camera focus region for several screens, so you can more easily see what's ahead
- Camera now "settles" more quickly when reaching its focus point
- Very slightly increased the grace window for jumping after running off of a platform
- Starfish in world 2 now rotate according to their paths instead of all spinning the same direction
  forever
- Improved performance by disabling offscreen objects
- Maked the initial positions of timed obstacles consistent
- Added proper gamepad support (for xbox controllers, A = jump, X = dash)
- Properly center player position during cutscenes
- Fixed some minor graphical issues (cleaned up some sprites, added missing tiles for screen
  transitions)
- Water and moving platforms no longer move the player during respawn

v0.02
- Fix delayed audio initialization bug (esp. in Chrome browsers)
- Add short Cocoa Moss intro scene
- Fixed some misaligned and missing background graphics
- Filled in some missing background tiles

v0.01
```

entries.title: Extra Virgin Lava Boil
entries.description:
![Cover.png](///raw/f90/8/z/1e691.png)
>>**The volcano is about to erupt!** Legend has it, the volcano can be calmed through the sacrifice of virgins found in the ancient village at the base of the volcano.

>>The virgins have been feuding with the local chickens, so maybe recruiting some chickens from the (?) barrels will help your cause? Be careful though! Not all the chickens want to be disturbed.


**Post submission hour update:** Fixed a bug where no audio would play. Original upload and fixed version are both available on itch.io.

**Instructions**
Grab the virgins with `Space`, and bring them to the top of the volcano while dodging fireballs. Once you reach the very edge of the volcano opening, throw them in with `Space` to calm the volcano.
The barrels will either spawn a chicken, which can be used to absorb 1 hit by a fireball, or the barrel will stun you for a short period.

**Controls:**
- `WASD` or `Arrows` - Move
- `Space` - Pick up/throw virgins, open (?) barrels

**Tools Used:**
- Unity
- Visual Studio 2017 Community w/ Resharper
- Gimp 2.0
- Audacity

**Credits:**
- https://www.dafont.com/modern-sans.font
- https://www.dafont.com/flat-earth-scribe.font
- http://tones.wolfram.com/generate

**Known Issues**
- It's supposed to be portrait mode, which doesn't look great with the default resolutions the unity player provides
- You can get caught on the seams between houses
- The chickens will get caught on the houses
- You can walk off the "side" of the volcano up at the top
- Barrels can spawn in houses
- It's really not obvious how to play

entries.title: King Of The Building
entries.description:
**We just finished our first Jam!**
![night.PNG](///raw/2f0/8/z/1e191.png)
We present you our iteration of the theme "Sacrifices must be made".

Did you know the world's tallest building is [Burj Khalifa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burj_Khalifa)
Well no longer!

![animation_flipped.gif](///raw/2f0/8/z/1e1ef.gif)
![animation_not_flipped.gif](///raw/2f0/8/z/1e1b9.gif)

![run_compressed.gif](///raw/2f0/8/z/1e1ca.gif)

You have been selected among many others to a race to the top of the new world's tallest building (_**in construction**_)
There can only be one winner and you may use any means to get to the top.

![win_compressed.gif](///raw/2f0/8/z/1e1a8.gif)


In addition, there is a rapid moving laser, scanning the building from the bottom to the top.
It eliminates everyone that goes underneath it.

When scanning someone, the laser takes some time to process the individual.

entries.title: Gold Digger
entries.description:
![2018-12-04_03h48_28.png](///raw/458/c/z/1e4fb.png)

# Sacrifices are not always the ones we expect.

What should you sacrifice? Gold? Your Uncle's respect? Your workers well being? The choice is yours!

# GOAL
## Maximize your final score! 

Genre:
Strategy / Idle game / Clicker

Controls:
Mouse Only

Setting :
Uncle John has a mining company. It’s still at the start of the business, but everything seems to be going well. He has three happy employees and has $30 in reserves. After one year of hard work, that means he is looking forward to go on a holiday. Because he has trust in you and seeks a potential successor in the family, he would like you to keep an eye on the business while he is on a trip to the nicest beaches in Jamaica. During this period of two weeks, he has given you all the rights to do anything you can to keep the company running.

Shop :
- Pickaxe - Improves working speed. Equipping your workers with the proper tools is extremely important for their efficiency and self-esteem.
- Helmet - Mandatory protection equipment for diggers.
- Coffee - Improves working efficiency, but your workers will start taking breaks when they feel like it.
- Stimpack - Dramatically improves working efficiency. Drugs are bad.

Workers :
- Red Worker - Costs 2 coins at the end of the day, 4 when you hire him. Severely underpaying people is very bad.
- Orange Worker - Costs 5 coins at the end of the day, 10 when you hire him. Underpaying people is bad.
- Blue Worker - Costs 10 coins at the end of the day, 20 when you hire him.
- Green Worker - Costs 20 coins at the end of the day, 40 when you hire him.

I will implement a leaderboard in a post-jam version, but in the meantime you can post your score in the comments if you want to share it.

entries.title: Golden Lord
entries.description:
![Golden Lord](///content/2df/2/z/1e286.png)
  
Ludum Dare 43
-------------
**Theme:** Sacrifices Must Be Made

**Team:** [Adam Higerd](https://ldjam.com/users/coda-highland)

Golden Lord
===========
**Praise the Golden Lord!**

Your people have lived on an island rich in gold and silver for generations, and they love you greatly. But now, monsters are invading the island! You have stepped down from heaven to protect your worshipers from the invaders, but your divine power depends on the sacrifices of precious metal that your people offer up to your altar.

[Play on the web (HTML5)](http://greenmaw.com/ld43/)

Controls
--------
* Move: Arrow Keys
* Attack: Space
* Pause: Escape

There are touchscreen controls but they're not very good. I might fix the issues as a "port" for mobile devices post-jam.

![screenshot](///raw/2df/2/z/1e296.png)

Author's Notes
--------------
I'd always intended to go back to [my first jam game](http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-36/?action=preview&uid=89952) to try to improve on it after the initial weekend, but I never really took the time to do it. But as I was brainstorming for ideas for this theme, I realized I could adapt the ideas of that game and use them for this jam, so this is a reimagining of Bobble Battle, built from the ground up from all-new code and graphics.

This is the first time I've taken it upon myself to create all of the assets for a game jam by myself. Before I started working on the graphics Saturday morning I didn't even know I had any skill in creating sprites from scratch.

While I did create the sound effects, I took them from a library of assets that I created in the past, so they aren't eligible for scoring in the jam.

The underlying HTML5 game development toolkit is also of my own construction. I didn't build it during the jam, but it doesn't provide anything that you wouldn't get from Unity3D, GameMaker: Studio, or any other development environment. All of the game logic, AI, physics, controls, and interface were built during the jam. I'll be releasing the tools open-source for other developers to use once I've finished filling in some missing pieces.

entries.title: Requiem
entries.description:
For many ages, the realms coexisted peacefully.
Mankind and Spirits cooperated to balance the world, and keep the cicle of life running.
But some humans were no longer interested in keeping the balance.
Greed and power has gone over their heads.
They enslaved and killed other men. Build castles and destroyed the nature.
Those actions broke the balance, and unleashed the rage of the spirits.
Comes the day, Judgement will wipe existence out of the earth.
Unless...
A powerful mage, willing to sacrifice everything, can stop it.


Made by Bruno Klipel, Guilherme Vogt, Luis Felipe Pereira, Milton Gustavo e William Soares

The request of Macron are in french, they mean 
- j'exige un sacrifice :  I demand sacrifices
- sacrifiez moi votre repos :  sacrifice your sleep for me
- je veux de l'amour :  I want love
- je veux des animaux en sacrifice :  I want sacrificed animals
- donnez moi quelque chose de sucré :  give me something sweet
- sacrifiez votre enfance :  give me your youth
- sacrifiez votre santé :  make sacrifices of your health
- je vais prendre beaucoup de votre temps :  I am going to take a lot of your time
- vous avez 5 balles :  Do you have 5 €
- je veux des pensées complexes, soyez disruptifs :  I want complex thought, think disruptiv

entries.title: Boom II; A game about nothing.
entries.description:
There is nothing yet everything in this game. After all, everything is not there and always there. Maybe you'll learn something in this game. Or maybe not, after all, there is only nothing.

I thought it would be funny to make a game where the sacrifice was the game itself. 

I'm only 12, and love to program, so originally had created a game with a few friends. However, one of them had not done there part, so I had no story nor art, thus giving me no game. So I had nothing to show for my several days of programming. So the night before submissions I started programming another game. The only problem; there was not enough time. There and then the idea had come to me, so I decided to still make at least some game. So that next day, I had started my THIRD game in 72 hours. This gave me 5 hours to do homework, program, and make art. However, you are probably playing this game right now, so clearly I succeded. Have fun!
