entries.title: Hungry Hungry Dragon
entries.description:
![ingame1.jpg](///raw/e5d/51/z/1e2d0.jpg)

Welcome to Hungry Hungry Dragons! A high score chaser where you play as a little dragon navigating a dangerous dungeon in search of loot to take back to your treasure hoard. Grow larger as you collect coins, gems, and other valuable items to increase your score multiplier in order to gain even more points in your pursuit of a high score. Be Careful though, should you run into any obstacle or wall, you’ll end your run. Your score multiplier is based on your Dragon length, thus you must reach full size to add a score multiplier effect, and before you see gems and better items appear beyond the classic coins. If you run into yourself at any time, you will sacrifice your body at the point of impact causing you to lose your score multiplier and have to build it back up, but you will be able to continue your high scoring run. When you die, you will be offered the opportunity to sacrifice some of your collected loot, in the form of your best items, the things you have worked so hard for and the things you treasure the most, to continue your run. To achieve your highest score, decisions will be presented, and sacrifices must be made.

Hungry Hungry Dragons uses hand drawn pixel art. Moving forward with the game, we plan on expanding out the roster of Dragons to showcase many more Dragon looks and styles created by our artists. These Dragons can be collected by hatching eggs acquired in game using the coins collected. At certain intervals throughout the game, the Dragons can actually grow and mature into large adult Dragons. 

Dungeon rooms in Hungry Hungry Dragons are procedurally generated offering different runs every playthrough. Pre-designed rooms will also be created to offer a more challenging experience, with some of these rooms even offering up puzzle like conditions to escape to the next room. 

In Hungry Hungry Dragons, the Dragon with the largest treasure hoard is the best. You’ll be able to compete against fellow Dragons and show off your highest scoring treasure hoard complete with all the special and rare items you’ve found along the way. 

We hope you enjoy this small demo of Hungry Hungry Dragons as there is so much we have lined up for the complete full version.

You owe a lot of money to a shady space pirate. Pay him back by destroying other ships and stealing their money.
You have 3 minutes to pay off your current payment, if you haven't collected enough money by then, you need to SACRIFICE your ship components to get the money you need. Those can also be lost in combat and also gained when left intact after you destroy an enemy. If you lose a component you can buy a bad emergency component to keep going. The game is lacking a lot of content, especially because there aren't enough different components, but I had a lot of fun so I might continue the project.

Bug Reports are appreciated I had literally no time to test the finished version.

W to accelerate

A/D to turn

SPACE to shoot

R to turn brakes on/off (If brakes are off you keep flying forever)

ESC to Pause

entries.title: Torontifornia!
entries.description:
**About Me** :raising_hand:

This is my second Ludum Dare and my first time making a 2D game. I decided on a 3D one for [LD42](https://nrdesign.xyz/portfolio#ludumDare) which took up a lot of time, so I was excited to start this journey for LD43! Everything is from scratch, but the base art was made by a friend watching the stream (more than just programmer art <3). Sounds were all from my own very mouth, programming was unique (with a few statements here and there found on StackOverflow :P), and I ended with lots of time to spare! Enough about me though, let's get on with the game!

**Torontifornia** :maple_leaf:

Welcome to Torontifornia! You are the last remaining general of the USofC (United States of Canada) and you've been kicked out of your capital city, Torontifornia, by rebels. Fight! Win! But if you need better troops, you might have to sacrifice some of your own. Oh, and also, watch that morality bar!
Anyway, that's all in the instructions in the game. Here are some screenshots!

entries.title: Fight of glory
entries.description:

Do you dare to take the fight of glory?

entries.title: Detritus Walks
entries.description:
![formGifSmall.gif](///raw/186/1/z/1df9b.gif)
You play as Rick Jones, until-recently-ex-cop and the loose cannon of the force. The chief has a new assignment for you, take out the king pin of the greatest mob the city has ever seen. Nobody could do this job, not even you. But that doesn't mean you aren't going to try, even if you have to sacrifice everything.

Pull trash into yourself to generate your body, and throw it around to solve physics puzzles. Sacrifice your limbs to reach places you otherwise couldn't.

**Made by:**

Andrew Persic - Code

Andrew Wilson - Code, level design, visual design

Ango Zhu - Music, visual design

**Rating notes:**

Typewriter sound, so please just rate us on our music soundwise.
All the images were ripped off google images, hence why we've opted out of graphics. We did make the background ourself though, so if you have any comments on that just leave it down below.

entries.title: vodka swigging pirates
entries.description:
![vodka_swigging_pirates.png](///raw/263/8/z/1e0f7.png)

This is a (kinda) bullet hell game about communist pirates.

Someone must make a sacrifice in order to create a communist utopia, and who better than the bourgeois scum. Board their ships and steal their goods to give back to the workers!

There are four characters to choose from, each with their own unique level. They each have different weapons and speeds.

Time yourself playing this, and see how quickly you can complete all four levels.

The four characters are, in the order that they appear in the select screen: Riflov, Captin, Bearovich, and Speedski.

Sadly it is only available by Windows download, and the game is a bit short, but it should provide some entertainment nonetheless.

Originally there was a lot more planned, but that's how every Ludum Dare goes.

![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/263/8/z/1e22e.png)

![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/263/8/z/1e233.png)

entries.title: Cowmando
entries.description:
Cowmando
--------

Hey guys. This is our first Ludum Dare commit as team. This was really funny like always. 

Team:
C64Gamer (Twitter: @c64gamer)

MrUnicornator ( Twitter: @manuelrauber )

Coding, Graphics, Sound and Idea by C64Gamer & MrUnicornator

Game:
In „Cowmando“ you are playing cow farmer Tobi. To run your farm successfully, you need to collect milk from the cows and Fill up the cow Milk storage. Unfortunately there is a toxic cow fart virus going around which stops the cows producing milk. The Virus is contagious and incurable so all your cows could get Farting machines. To stop the virus from spreading, you need to sacrifice the ill cow by plugging their butt. Butt Be aware: Plugging can lead to explosions save the others by dragging them away from the ill cow

All levels are having a difficulty and are random generated on every game start.

Controls:
- W,A,S,D.............Movement
- Space...............Collect Milk and Plug ill cows
- E...................Rope to move cows (Multiple cow selection possible
- R...................Release all ropes

Game Dev Tool used:
- Unity 3d
- Qubicle
- Photoshop
- Jetbrains Rider
- FruityLoop

Have fun playing our game :-)

![gamescreen_02.png](///raw/9c4/z/1e2e4.png)

entries.title: Santa on Skis
entries.description:
![Screen01.png](///raw/251/z/1e6f4.png)

Santa's reindeers are tired of having to deliver millions of presents each year. He just can't persuade them to change their minds, so Santa is left on his own this year. Does this mean there's no chance presents will be delivered?

Well, no, but sacrifices must be made. The only way Santa can deliver the presents on time is if he uses his magical skis. But the skis have a mind of their own and aren't exactly easy to control.

But if Santa wants to avoid millions of unhappy children, he doesn't have a choice -- he must use the skis, even if that means destroying some snowmen and christmas trees along the way. Hopefully he'll deliver enough presents so that people can forgive him for the damage he causes.

## Controls:
**Arrow Keys**

(Left and Right to steer, Up to accelerate, Down to brake)

## Note:
The map in this game is **procedurally generated**. If it places you in a narrow space you can't get out of, just press **R** to return to the title screen and generate a new map.

## HOW TO PLAY
Sacrifice your loyal minions to help clear a safe passage for The King. Take control of any chess piece by clicking on it. Use Escape to release the piece and select another. Use Arrows or WASD to move pieces around the board.

HINTS: The sides of the chess board become accessible as you unlock levels. Higher value chess pieces appear in the game as you continue leveling up. There are 7 total levels in the game.

Gain points by moving the King across the board. Remaining pieces award points as follows...

* Pawns: 100 pts
* Knights: 300 pts
* Bishops: 300 pts
* Rooks: 500 pts
* Queen: 900 pts
* King: 2,000 pts

entries.title: STAR JUNK
entries.description:
# 🔧 Tools and info

Here's my game. Made in 3 Days using Construct 2, Photoshop CS5, FL Studio 5, Cinema4D and Bfxr.

# 🌠 Rules

Your spaceship can shoot trash and crystals. (shoot with A, switch ammo with B)
You also need to find new trash and crystals to progress.
Enemies, asteroids and trashbags contain trash and crystals:


- 🚀 enemy ship: 3 trash
- 🌚 asteroid:   1 crystal
- 🌌 trashbag:   2 trash


So you have to sacrifice ammo. If you're out of ammo, you can sacrifice one of your lives to ram a trashbag or asteroid.
Enemy ships can't be collided with, so that you have cool dogfights. 

# 🌠 Goal:

Find the starbase. There are 3 sectors to explore, each sector has a starbase 🛸, where you can buy passage to the next sector (5 crystals), buy 1UPs and convert from trash to crystals and reverse. 

![STORE large.png](///raw/6e9/2/z/1ed90.png)
![gameplay large.png](///raw/6e9/2/z/1ed91.png)

Have fun.

# 🐞 BUGFIXES

v1.1
- fixed a display bug that caused the ammo indicator to show the wrong type of ammo selected
- added a check when calibrating keyboard keys, so that you can't use the same key for both actions

entries.title: A Dark Forest
entries.description:
You are mage. You specialize in potions. One day, while making a very important delivery, you get lost in the forest. Once night comes, an unknown entity begins chasing you. You may have to use your potions to outrun it, or leave them behind. 
Use WASD to move the character.

entries.title: Night of the Clawrm
entries.description:
![Screen Shot 2018-12-04 at 8.08.49 AM.png](///raw/b46/z/1ec61.png)


After discovering a strange cave on the edge of town you see a clawed arm reach out and beckon for you to bring it food, but all it will eat is people. 

Madness grips you, you find a club in your hand, the townspeople will hate you if they find out what you are up to... The only solution is to kill them all.


Night of the Clawrm is a stealth-ish game where you must kill people and drag their bodies to a cave or face the wrath of the Clawrm.


WASD or arrows to move, space or 'e' to interact (kill or drag), esc or 'p' to pause/resume

entries.title: Hexago
entries.description:
Welcome to Hexago, a new puzzle game created for Ludum Dare 43. Swap tiles around on a set of ever more difficult boards as you try and reach the highest possible score on each. But be careful! Making an ambitious swap can never come free, and you may have to sacrifice tiles along the way to a high score. 


Play the game using your mouse, simply select a tile and then another to swap it with. Each different color of hex has a different method of generating points, and the arrangement of hexes determines your final number of points. 



![hexes.PNG](///raw/4f5/z/1d3b0.png)


Let us know any thoughts you have, or any new tile types that you can think of, or what your high score is on different levels! 




### Tools

* Unity 2018
* Blender
* VisualStudio

[Sound effects source](https://www.zapsplat.com/license-type/standard-license/)

[Background music source](https://www.bensound.com/royalty-free-music/track/deep-blue)



Made as a team by members of the CSU Game Developers Association in 70ish hours (we were aiming for the compo time, but it is the weekend before finals) and with no pre-made scripts or assets (other then sound, but lets not talk about that). 

* Miles (Programming, Unity)
* David (Programming)
* Jonathan (Programming)
* Dylan (Art)

EDIT: Added web build. The main menu background doesn't seem to work on the web, so I would still recommend downloading it if you want a more interesting menu. The game still plays correctly, with the exception of some slightly odd scaling.

entries.title: Catrifices
entries.description:
## Edit 2
Removed my name for privacy. Username is still there, though! :thumbsup: 

### Edit 1
Just found a cheat-sheet for how to use this mysterious "Markdown" for Ludum Dare text formatting. This page now looks *way* better. Here it is for if anybody else was a bit lost: https://guides.github.com/pdfs/markdown-cheatsheet-online.pdf


### Me
This is my game made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 43.

It's basically my first game ever :D

Theme: Sacrifices must be made


### Story
One day, they came... 

Not for our resources,

not for our planet, 

but for our cats.

You must save as many cats as possible before you are overrun.

Along the way, there may be casualties. But, hey. Sometimes, **Catrifices must be made.**



### How to play
Walk with "WASD" or the arrow keys

Stand on a Cat and don't move to pick it up

Stand in the "Drop Off" area to drop off a load of Cats

Drop off 3 or more Cats in one load to get a Cat Bomb (Not a real cat :P

Touch an item to pick it up

Left click the mouse to throw a Cat Bomb

Right click the mouse to throw a Catrifice (You monster.

Try not to touch the aliens!

Hey! Did you actually read this far? Thanks for that! :D
I hope you enjoy my game!


### Credits
* Game and resources created by MrPiedPiper.

* Base template of Title Screen music by StinkyKitty.

* Play screen music by StinkyKitty.


### Software used
* Affinity Designer
* Unity
* Audacity
* Bosca Ceoil


### Screenshots
(Because you needed this header to realize these were screenshots)

![Screenshot (114).png](///raw/816/21/z/1faaa.png)

![Screenshot (107).png](///raw/816/21/z/1e109.png)

![Screenshot (108).png](///raw/816/21/z/1e10e.png)


### Some things I'm planning on changing
Alot of this stuff is thanks to you guys in the comments. Thanks a ton!
* Overall pace should be faster.
* Player should be faster.
* Player's horizontal movement should be faster.
* A title on the main menu would be nice :P
* The drop-off is not obvious from first spawning. Camera pan or spawning there would help.
* Enemy spawners were meant not to fit in (aliens), and I succeeded. Which makes it confusing. Oops.
* In-game instructions and maybe a "First time playing? Watch this!"
* Changing the end screen text for certain amounts saved (e.g. "You saved 0. Nice job?")
* Regaining health via 4 in 1 trip?
* Sprint with regaining per delivered cat?
* Actual score
* Camera zoom and effects per amount of health
* More feedback for actions. (Explosions, pick up, throw, hurt, ect.)
* Make the Catrifice more enticing by boosting it's power (In some way)

entries.title: People/Power
entries.description:
Our entry is about feeding people to a giant robot to generate electricity.  It's a light puzzle game, similar in style to 90's classic Lemmings, but mainly it's a stupid physics toy for flinging people around.  All gameplay, art and music was created by us over the weekend.  

TIPS:  It's all controlled with the mouse, and basic help is found in-game if you need it.  But if you get stuck then just use fans to blow the little people to their doom. Boxing Gloves are fun, but not that practical!

entries.title: A Machine Of Balance
entries.description:
A small industry.
A machine.

The first few upgrades come with little cost, but to replace them requires those upgrades to be disposed of. Not everyone agrees with that.

![unknown2.png](///raw/037/z/1e9e2.png)

How to play!
open the BALANCE tab on the top of your screen to open a selection of cards

cards appear in the grey storage rectangle, scroll to move through the upgrade cards (bronze<gold<diamond)

move an upgrade card to the right green box to upgrade the machine, the stats of each card appears while hovering over it

you can only have 6 upgrade slots, sacrifice an upgrade card to the red box on the far right where the cards detrimental properties will emerge

open the resources tab on the top of the screen to make sure your industry is in check, new cards are researched by scientists

you can upgrade your garage to a lab, as well as add machines by moving appropriate cards to the far left rectangle in the BALANCE tab 

Once you have obtained the three diamond cards as well as the laboratory and three machines consider your self triumphant!

![unknown.png](///raw/037/z/1e9da.png)
![unknown3.png](///raw/037/z/1e9e3.png)

entries.title: Slimeling
entries.description:
In this game you'll be playing the role of a slime father looking for hist lost slime son. Get out of your test tube and go look for your child as you bounce through stages filled with puzzling and deadly hazards. 

Use carefully all of your slimy skills, such as shrinking or growing in size and bouncing off walls and ceilings. 

Good luck using your pro-gaming skills trying to discover the commands... or just read them listed down below:
- WASD: movement
- Space: jump (from every surface, you're a slime after all)
- Click/Ctrl: drop a part of your gelatinous body and instantly lose weight. Don't worry, you can pick them up again or look for spare slime on test tubes.
- R: restart the stage.

Made in 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 43

entries.title: Train Of Fire
entries.description:
Get the train moving, but at what cost?

Made for LDJam#43, with the theme 'Sacrifices Must Be Made'.

(Includes a very buggy level editor.)

Move the train all the way to the left, press left or right (or 'A' and 'D') to make it go.
It will need fuel though, so better burn those valuables in the crates.
To burn fuel, light up crates and boxes. Once they're all the way gone, it gets added to the meter top-right.
To see what you've burned, keep an eye on the messages in the lower part of the screen.

Troubleshooting:

 - Too slow? Press space or enter to turn off the special effects. NOTE: This was added while building the Windows version, after the Jam! Wether this makes the Windows version 'Post-Jam' or counts as a bugfix is up to you to decide.
 - Stuck? Press 'R' to restart. 
 
![screenie_43.png](///raw/9b/z/1e3e5.png)

Level Editor:

Even more buggy than the game itself! :-)

 - Press '[' (right-bracket) to unlock debug functionality.
 - Press 'L' to switch between level and editing.
 - Press 'R' reload the level. Warning! If you haven't saved, this will undo all your work!
 - Use the mouse to place objects, joints (non-visible helper objects) are selected by default.
 - Press '1' to select Joint-placement. Click to place.
 - Press '0' to switch between creation and deletion. You only delete (or place) the thing you've got selected.
 - Floors, planks and 'slabs' can be selected by pressing '2' through '4' respectively. Click on 2 already placed joints to select them.
 - Crates and 'stones' can be selected by pressing '5' and '6' respectively. Click to place.
 - Press '7' to select the train. Click replaces the position. Can't be erased.
 - Press '8' to select lanterns. Click to place.
 - Press '9' to switch between snap-to-grid and freeform (not recommended).
 - Press '-' (minus) to select the exit. Click replaces the position. Can't be erased.
 - Press space or enter to _overwrite_ the level. Warning! This can't be undone!

Beware! Deleting objects that are attached to joints before deleting the joints can cause a crash!

Other Notes:

Not really happy with this one (especially since it took me 3 days), but we'll see what it does. Curious as to what you all think! :-)

entries.title: He Has Hostages
entries.description:
![Logo PROTOTYPE.png](///raw/197/3/z/1dd75.png)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6AsS_iV-h9o

# Description
Dutch Bassidy, a 5-star criminal with a record longer than his life, is finally challenging his winning streak with the biggest heist of his life. His hands were full of luscious green, shovelling it into his sack when suddenly he heard an alarm go off. 

He's never heard an alarm go off. But that won't stop him.

Dutch now must face the flood of armed policemen entering the building alone... or is he alone? Use hostages to carefully block lethal projectiles, and pull some of that good ol' Dutch magic once again.

This one's gonna make the books for sure. Whether you are dead or alive.

# Gameplay

![money_sack.png](///raw/197/3/z/1e101.png)
Collect as much money as you can!

![baddie.png](///raw/197/3/z/1e11c.png)
Avoid the *"baddies"*

![Character Unlock Safe.png](///raw/197/3/z/1e0a8.png)
Don't forget to grab safes to unlock more hostages! Collect them all!


![hhh.png](///raw/197/3/z/1dd8a.png)

# Theme
With the theme 'Sacrifices must be made,' we went with the idea of sacrificing hostages in the effort to rob a bank. The unfortunate collectables in the game can be thrown at *baddies* to protect yourself.


# How to Play
You can move around the screen with WASD using the mouse to look around.

If you click and drag your mouse, when you release, you will throw a hostage to be your body shield.

Collect as much money as you can and get to the exit!

![How to.png](///raw/197/3/z/1def5.png)

## Credits
![creators.png](///raw/197/3/z/1dfcc.png)
- **Art, Spritework, and Voice Acting** - Mortifix
- **Audio & Music** - Literal_Filth
- **Programming & Game Design** - Joseph Manley

entries.title: Rude Bear Responsibility
entries.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IIVvxvZh8i0

![rboutside.png](///raw/41b/z/1ef61.png)

=== STORY ===

Your mortal nemesis, The Wizard, has finally decided to make friends with you. All you have to do is take care of his son for the day while he attends his special convention, Wizcon™.

Unfortunately you live in a neighbourhood of satanists, so it's not easy to look after a child when everyone wants a porcine sacrifice.

Good luck!


=== Controls ===

Click to move. You can hold to move around. You can go south into the garden too.
Move near a certain special item to push it in front of another thing.


=== Hints ===

Did you read the controls? You can go into the garden in the south, and you can also push pizza around m8. Also try getting the "True ending" after the """last guy""" if you want.

== What’s a Rude Bear? ==

This is the 17th Rude Bear game in the RB core series, the 18th Ludum Dare extended universe Rude Bear game, and the 20th extended universe Rude Bear game. It was made for Ludum Dare 43’s jam, under the theme “Sacrifices must be made”. It’s a game about restraint.


                                 === CREDITS ===

           @AlexRoseGames - Code, Design, Animation, sound design/SFX, rapping
                           @BitsAndCrafts - Dope ass Art

SPILL THE BLOOD 

FORGE THE BULLETS

SLAY THE DEMONS

...

entries.title: Sacrificial Wool
entries.description:
Is your PC powerful enough to save the village?

Play as the **sacrificial lamb** in Ultra High Definition Graphics and **reach the altar** before your PC spontaneously combusts.

Boasting a smooth 2000 fps limit, heavenly orchestral movements and RTX on, this game has it all.*

**terms subject to hyperbole*

## Sacrifice the lamb, save the world.

Controls
-------------
* __WASD - Movement__
* __Space Bar - Advances text__
* __Toggle Settings - Advances game__
* __Escape - Quit Game__
* __R key - Reset Level__

entries.title: Solida Amationis

You're late for a first date! Get going...before it falls apart.

entries.title: Space Goat: Coast to Coast
entries.description:
CONTROLS: Just use your mouse and click

Build a spaceship and fly through space!

Beware though, you have to sacrifice parts of your ship to survive.

Save kittens, snails, chickens, and babies?

Remember kids,

In Space Goat Sacrifices You

Team: Stevie, Brenden, Nic, Casey, Abigail

CONTROLS: Just use your mouse and click

entries.title: Goblin Quest
entries.description:
## Do Quest! Slay Goblins! Save The Town! And Die Doing It!

Only my second game jam with Unity. This one focused on content and having a complete game that's actually somewhat fun.

Gameplay was inspired by Reigns, with a  simple swipe left / right flavor. Everybody I was going to work with got sick, so the UI isn't nearly as pretty as it would have been with actual front end people. Which is to say, it's pretty ugly.

I think I've got all the dead ends out of the game, so please let me know if you find any.

And no, I have not actually watched or read Goblin Slayer.

entries.title: Colony #43
entries.description:
The deep space colony migration #43 have run into issues on the journey.

Hostile space craft, alien spores and not enough fuel are some of the issues you will have to work through.

Sacrifices must be made otherwise no one will arrive at the destination alive.

2D Pixel Art Retro styled.

Requires Java.

Mouse Input.

![screenie_01.png](///raw/659/z/1e1da.png)

entries.title: Requite
entries.description:
Requite.
Use sword to damage enemies, you can explode to cover an area for a while, you will respawn shortly.

Keyboard controls: 
```
WASD - Move 
Mouse - Aim sword 
Shift - Dash 
Space - Explode 
```
Controller controls:
```
Left stick - Move 
Right stick - Aim sword 
Left bumper - Dash 
A - Explode 
```
​

entries.title: Pirates may Cry
entries.description:
In this game the player will play the role of a corsair who pilots a pirate ship. As the captain of the ship, you have to manage the resources by sacrificing important elements such as rum, wood, food or even the crew itself in order to reach the port with as much booty as possible:


Welcome pirate, you're about to embark on the biggest story you've ever had.
You come from a long line of famous pirates and you should sound your name in the
7 seas
The task of a good captain is not only: drink a lot of rum, shout to the sea and shoot your
cannons to seagulls. You must control the happiness of your crew, equip your boat
with the best guns, equip it with the toughest wood you can see, fill your reserves
of the most luxurious food you have and keep the rum under lock and key.

The pirate community trusts you. This is your moment of glory and do not forget that an ARR
It can save yaarrrrr life.

Signed: King of the pirates.

![04-12-2018 0-32-59.jpg](///raw/f35/f1/z/1d7a6.jpg)

![04-12-2018 0-33-51.jpg](///raw/f35/f1/z/1d7a9.jpg)

You can play it in english or spanish language!

entries.title: Impatient Patients
entries.description:
In this game, you are a doctor at a hospital. Everyone has an important surgery that needs to be done, and you need to decide which one is more important than the others. In surgery, you have to complete the right procedure. If you kill a patient in surgery, you lose 3 lives, if a patient dies in the waiting room, you lose 2 lives, if you successfully treat a patient, you gain a life. You have 20 lives to lose before you are fired. Your score is how many patients you successfully treat total. Good Luck Doc!

**Controls:**

Move: WASD or Arrow Keys

Interact: Space

End Interact: Enter

Grab Surgery Tool: Click

Grab Organ: Drag with Tweezer

Cut: Drag with Scalpel

![Pic.png](///raw/b82/d/z/1e5b8.png)
![Screen Shot 2018-12-01 at 6.05.52 PM.png](///raw/b82/d/z/1e4ff.png)

entries.title: Slime Patrol
entries.description:
Fight your way against 5 levels of slimes in this action packed game. Make your way to the wormhole at the end of each level, but to get through any of these portals you must sacrifice one crucial component of your ship.

WASD - Move
Mouse1 - Fire Lasers
Mouse2- Fire Missiles
Space - Warp

R- Restart
Escape - Quit Game

There is a bug where you can remove the same ability twice. Please try not to use this, though you can if you really don't want to get rid of an ability. Thank you.

entries.description:
![LogoLarge.png](///raw/b1b/91/z/1ecb0.png)

CROM. CROM doesn't think much.

entries.title: One Humble Caravan
entries.description:
![Unity_2018-12-04_04-11-30.png](///raw/392/z/1e5ff.png)

Manage a caravan through frozen plains and face challenges along the way.

How to play:
Click on a traveler to see their needs
Food/Whiskey can be found in the cart, give them to your hungry and freezing friends. Try to survive as long as you can!

Music is "When in the West" by Blue Dot Sessions
http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Blue_Dot_Sessions/Landsman_Duets/When_in_the_West

BUGFIXES:
Fixed a game crashing bug with one event

entries.title: Sacrificial Cards
entries.description:
![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/cac/4/z/1ed1f.gif)

![normalstuff.PNG](///raw/cac/4/z/1e4f7.png)
Choose a card, then protect the beacon and survive!

How does it work? 
**You will be presented with three random cards at the beginning of every wave.** 
**Strategize your picking so that you are able to win the harder waves.**  

Control:
- W,A,S,D to move
- Hold Left Mouse to fire gun
- R to reload
- Click arrow on the right to see stat

entries.title: Warp-Star Warzone
entries.description:
A one level RTS game. Was supposed to be for the Compo, but it turned out to be harder than I thought.
Warp-Star's unique mechanic is that your units gain resources by killing enemy units. However, you have to sacrifice your unit in order to transfer the resources to your own stockpile. If the unit dies, you lose the resources.

- There is no sound or unit health display. This was due to time constraints, and I apologise.
- This isn't balanced and might be very easy, or completely unbeatable. Again, the is due to time constraints.

entries.title: Quetzalcoatl
entries.description:
Quetzalcoatl is a multiplayer party game designed to be played locally with up to four players. Compete against each other to sacrifice more prisoners than your competitors and gain the praise of the mighty Quetzalcoatl by executing superior platforming and mashing skills.


Controls:
Supports Keyboard and/or gamepad support for more than one player.
Keyboard -- WASD to move, JKL to act. J to Jump. K to Pickup and Throw. L to Sacrifice. ARROW to move, X to jump. C to Pickup and Throw. Z to Sacrifice
Gamepad -- Joystick/DPAD to move, Bottom button to jump. Left button to Pickup and throw. Right button to sacrifice.


Shift/Select for Fullscreen

How To Play:
Find the prisoner, take him to the altar. Mash the sacrifice button as fast as possible to execute him swiftly.

***ATTENTION*** This game is designed to be played with friends, you can play with CPUs, but I strong recommend only starting with 1 CPU. If you are cool, unlike me, and have more than 1 friend, I would suggest trying to play 2v2 teams. (CPUs currently do not play well with others).

Follow me on Twitter: @GentooGames

![IMB_XiNoZa.GIF](///raw/ff6/z/1efed.gif)
![IMB_Vu0CBF.GIF](///raw/ff6/z/1f2e3.gif)

entries.title: HAL9001 S1mul4t0r
entries.description:
# General
In the "HAL9001 S1mul4t0r" you assume the role of an indifferent AI. Your job is a pilot a human-filled space vessel in a multi-year flight to colonize a new planet. It will not be easy, and obviously not every one will survive.

The original game has a few bugs and broken features, I will post a repaired version sometime in the future. There is still a lot of planned content that I just never had time to implement. I look forward to great feedback though!

# Current Features
- Advanced mechanics
- Ability to assign unused civilians to profession.
- Ability to advance time 1 month
- Ability to self terminate
- Hidden easter egg

# Future Updates
Future installments may or may not include the following.
- Ability to terminate crew members
- Ability to ban/encourage reproduction
- Enhanced Audio
- Enhanced UI
- Random Encounter Pop-ups
- Randomly generated quests
- Ship animations when advancing
- Win messaging

# Images
None yet!

# How To Play
Either download and run your systems version, or start the HTML version. Once started select "New Game" from the main menu.

entries.title: Assault on The Sacrificial Humans
entries.description:
![Screenshot from 2018-12-03 19-10-51.png](///raw/3f2/z/1e103.png)

**-**
Build towers and sacrifice humans to defend your base against invaders!


**How to Play**

_(Instructions at beginning of game)_

To stop enemies from reaching and damaging your base, you'll need to build turrets from the panel on the right. More turrets will be unlocked as you progress through the waves.

If any enemy is red/appears to be quickly growing & shrinking, this is an advanced enemy which cannot be killed by turrets. You'll need to sacrifice a human to kill him: Do this by clicking a human from the top panel then clicking the enemy.

You can used WASD or arrow keys to scroll the camera view and get around the map.

​
**Credits**

Written from scratch by me in 72 hours.

I used these assets:
Sounds/Music:
https://opengameart.org/content/fly-swatter-squish-sound
https://opengameart.org/content/3-pop-sounds
https://opengameart.org/content/cavern
Art:
https://opengameart.org/content/roguedb32-plus-add-on-tiles

entries.title: Let's Join a Kitty Cult!
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/ea0/4/z/1f31d.png)

Become a cat! **Join a cult!**

...

Even better, start your own! Stuff it full of humans! Sacrifice them! _Then play with yarn!_

![join.png](///raw/ea0/4/z/1f2e0.png)

In "**Let's Join a Kitty Cult**," you play as a cat, try to seduce humans into your cult by rubbing up against them and playing with them...

![bless.png](///raw/ea0/4/z/1f2e4.png)

![yarn.png](///raw/ea0/4/z/1f2e2.png)

Then you **SACRIFICE THEM TO YOUR DARK KITTY ELDER GOD!**

![sacrifice.png](///raw/ea0/4/z/1f2e1.png)


But other cats have their own patron deities, and are possessive of their own humans. You may have to fight them for rights. Or, you can strike at their dark heart... that is, enter their litter boxes and **DESECRATE THEM! KILL ALL OTHER FALSE GODS!**

![shoggcat.png](///raw/ea0/4/z/1f2e5.png)

Ahem.

Should you manage you successfully help your god ascend... your cult will live on forever, in future reincarnations! 

That is: Your cult information, including its members, will be uploaded. If you play and win again, using the same cult name, cult members will be appended to. Keep playing! Grow your cult as large as possible!

_(Apologies, still working on a webpage to display all the different cults and their members. Upload functionality does work, however)_

---

**Standard WASD movement**

**Left-click to execute your ferocious pounce attack**

**Move into things and press the E keyboard button to interact with them**

_**WARNING: Contains blood and depiction of human sacrifice - may not be suitable for children.** Er... well, probably anyone._

---

**CODE:** Myself

**ART:** Myself, Eugene Conniff, David Edmondson

**AUDIO:** Myself, David Edmondson

**MUSIC:** Sourced online _(credit coming)_

entries.title: Sacrificial Love
entries.description:
![screenshot.PNG](///raw/468/4/z/1e11a.png)

My **first** Ever Ludum Dare Game! I hope you enjoy playing it!

# Story

You’re stranded with your little baby in a world filled with zombies, luckily zombies only come at night. How long can you survive? can you beat the highest scores?

# Instructions

Don’t lose your stamina. You can replenish it by *sleeping* in your little brown bed.

Don’t let the baby’s cries get too high. Walk up to the baby's crib and comfort it.

Zombies come during **Night time** only, so make sure to make the most use of **Day time** to comfort baby and gain stamina.

Kill Zombies, get points and once you have enough there is a strange orange machine on top of the house, when its light turns green make sure to check it out.

![gif3.gif](///raw/468/4/z/1f2c6.gif)

# Full Controls

**WASD** to move

**SPACE** to Jump

**LMB** to Fire

**E** to Interact

**HOLD E** to comfort baby when you're next to it

![screenshot4.PNG](///raw/468/4/z/1e124.png)

entries.title: Sky Fortress
entries.description:
Sky Fortress is a First Perso Arena Shooter where you must kill your enemies as many times as possible before the countdown ends to win the match.
![main menu.png](///raw/056/d1/z/1d7b3.png)

The game revolves around 4 types of weapons, each with their own abilities and bonuses, and can be upgraded into more powerful variants bringing their own strategy and ways to play the game. Experiment with them and see what each weapon does!

![game.png](///raw/056/d1/z/1d7d7.png)



WARNING : The game might run at a low fps for some people. I build multiple times my game and tested each version to see where it went wrong, but I couldn't find a solution to this problem. Sorry for the inconvenience, if any.

WARNING N°2 : Unfortunately, only a Windows version of the game is available. The Mac version needs some debug and testing before being reuploaded. Sorry for the inconvenience once again.

entries.title: The Pink Slip
entries.description:
Updates:

12/4/2018 
  * I added a WebGL version on itch.io. It should be playable with Firefox. Not sure about Chrome.

12/6/2018 
  * I released an updated version with instructions on how to move on to the next level. (The original submitted 
    LD43 Jam version is available at itch.io as well)
  * For the WebGL version, after you reached the ending, the game will restart to the title screen.
  * I added numbers to the pink slips so when you change slips it will say "Pink Slip # 1 or # 2" instead of just
    "Pink Slip"
  * These are current hot fixes for now but I'll try to fix the textbox and other minor bugs soon.

Your boss wants you to fire people by giving out pink slips to employees in the company. Their sacrifices must be made for the sake of the company but most importantly, for the sake of your boss.

There are only 8 levels in the game and it should take at least 10 minutes to complete.

For now, you have to use both pink slips for each level. You can't fire only one person for each level, you will have to fire two. I'll try to make a better/different version of this system in the near future.

The UI and the text box is a bit buggy and weird but hopefully everything is alright. =)

I recommend playing this game in a 16:9 aspect ratio.

Controls:

You’ll need the mouse to click on profiles and switch through pink slips. You’ll need a keyboard to type in the numbers.

![gameplay1.gif](///raw/544/f1/z/1e289.gif)

![gameplay2.gif](///raw/544/f1/z/1e28c.gif)

![gameplay3.gif](///raw/544/f1/z/1e291.gif)

entries.title: My Ludum Dare 43
entries.description:
This game is a story of what went down for me in these last 3 days.
Not a very original idea, but I'd decided that I would submit something no matter what it was. 

It was satisfying to hack something together without caring for code re-usability etc. A shame I wasn't able to make use of 68 hours of the jam!

I really should have put this into the Unfinished category.

entries.title: Spagchute
entries.description:
You're a single spaghetti falling in a bottomless pit.
Don't hit the knives!



Music : Werner Burat

Programming : Thomas Gauthier-Caron

Idea and host : Tristan Renaud

entries.title: Missing Parts
entries.description:
*Missing Parts* is a point-and-click adventure, in which you play a little robot in a big factory.
Your job is to maintain and fix the big machine.

![MissingParts_1.png](///raw/1da/21/z/1d95f.png)

![MissingParts_2.png](///raw/1da/21/z/1d96b.png)

**Why?**

Because that's your Job!

The boss is putting a lot of trust in your capabilities. Better not disappoint them...



**Features:**

- Self-explaining gameplay: Don't waste your precious time on tutorials!
- **Handmade sounds & soundtrack**: Use your ears for recreation while you work!
- Cuteness!!!
- Puzzles: Who doesn't love them?
- **Hand-drawn everything**: Use your coffee break to rest your eyes on a beautifully crafted environment!
- Supportive messages from your boss: They really trust you!
- Feel-good: Nothing is more satisfying than coming home after a hard day's work!
- Union-free-zone: Who needs these lazy scumbags anyways?
- Work-game-balance: Feel like you're actually doing something!
- No pay-to-win: You are already selling your labour!

![MissingParts_3.png](///raw/1da/21/z/1da34.png)


**Problems:**
There are a few problems. Depending on the browser you use you may not hear the robot speak, have no sound at all or (only happened in one case so far with Microsoft Edge) see no cursor. If any of these happen to you please consider using another browser. In the timeframe of this jam there was nothing we could do against these issues.

entries.title: Last Train Home
entries.description:
A randomly generated text adventure sort of thing with some Oregon Trail style mechanics.

In game tutorial should cover everything!

Character sprites: Damien Flores

Everything else: Tyler Smith

Post jam changes: Added a quit button.

![ss1.png](///raw/02b/1/z/1e00c.png)

entries.title: Health N Shoot
entries.description:
![Cover.png](///raw/527/f1/z/1e14e.png)

![Screen01.png](///raw/527/f1/z/1e1ae.png)

My first jam.

A simple arcade shooter in which you have to sacrifice health for abilities.

You can charge your shot, dash and slow time, all taking away some of your regenerating health.

Controls:
Move = Arrows
Shoot = C or Space
Dash = X
Toggle Time Control = X

Some things to know:
This is my first submission. As I only had enough free time for part of the jam I had to use my time sparingly, so please judge fairly. ;)

[SMALL Change Log]
Some of the last minute work I did to the damage balancing caused every shot to be a one-hit kill.
That has been fixed and uploaded.

entries.title: Tim's Christmas Nightmare
entries.description:
![foritch - Copy3.png](///raw/4ca/91/z/1d991.png)

Tim wakes up in a unfamiliar world, which is full of horrors and danger. Will he find a safe way to home?

entries.title: ImminENT Danger
entries.description:
![GameCover.PNG](///raw/0e7/01/z/1ddc0.png)

## Description

ImminENT Danger is a arena battle where the forest attacks!



Sacrifice light to save your life! Survive as long as you can...

You can attack the ents with your axes, but beware! If you get hit even once, you'll die!

Sacrifice one of your torches to clear the nearby Ents, at the cost of the available light!



**Developers**: Nick Cadieux, AJ Jones

**Music**: AJ Jones

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
## Controls

* Movement - WASD
* Aim - Mouse
* Throw Axe - Left Click
* Torch Attack - Right Click
* Mute Music - M
* Restart Game - R
* Quit Game - Esc

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Chest.png](///raw/0e7/01/z/1de5b.png)

![Attack.png](///raw/0e7/01/z/1de2d.png)

![Attack2.png](///raw/0e7/01/z/1de2f.png)

![Death.png](///raw/0e7/01/z/1de32.png)

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Change Log

Thanks everyone for the great comments and feedback!! I have taken your comments into consideration and made the following changes:

* Torch hit boxes have been doubled to feel more impactful.
* Number of torches to start have been reduced to 5, this promotes exploration to find chests for more torches.
* Torch lighting reduction per use has been increased, this makes the sacrifice of torches a harder decision than before.
* Fixed a issue where player would sometimes semi-die... unable to move but not AXEterminated.. unAXEptable

*Optimized Terrain loading to prevent slowdown later in game.

entries.title: Protect Him
entries.description:
Protect him at all costs, even if that means some sacrifice.

I had to cut a lot of corners for this. The graphics are unpolished and there are only five levels, but I hope the mechanic is interesting enough. Please give any and all feedback, I don't expect to win or anything but I want to get valuable feedback, so I can come back next time.

entries.title: Sacrifice Moshpit
entries.description:
Your son is sick, so what else to do than kill the doctor and go on a rampage with your telekinetic powers and a knife.

Made for Ludum Dare over a weekend

Controls: E - Ready weapon
O - Throw weapon/body (Also available while weapon/body is in midair)
A,D - Horizontal movement
F - Pick up
Left mouse button - Stab
Spacebar - Jump

Got it to a playable state last second. This is my first LD submission, sadly worked alone, but I am definitely coming again. I hope somebody has some sort of fun with this. :)

entries.title: Landing Party
entries.description:
As the captain of your ship nothing is more important than your personal safety. Use your red-shirted underlings to ensure your successful return!

Team:
https://github.com/WalterCReel3
https://github.com/pipewriter
https://github.com/mbabernathy
https://github.com/Epitrochoid

Background tiles were packaged assets.

entries.title: Zombies and Sacrifices
entries.description: A game about sacrificing your team members to save your skin from the zombies! This is supposed to be a creepy but also funny game.![Screenshot (16).png](///raw/26e/e1/z/1e16a.png)

entries.title: Floor It !
entries.description:
# Floor It !

A lonely hero, lawless cowboys, killing machines, ... Embark on a synthwave journey to Los Angeles alongside our mysterious driver and his robots companions ... but beware to not be sacrified !
In this world, "Neon" is scarce, and your old trustworthy neon powered car won't move on it's own ! Better hope to not be the one scraped away in order to start the engine !

![boss.gif](///raw/53d/11/z/1e48d.gif)

## Gameplay

The gameplay is a rotation between a Shoot'Em Up phase, a gestion phase, and a textual phase where you have decisions to take. The core of the game is composed of 5 levels, and in order to start one level you have to spend one currency named "Neon". 


![eventScreen.png](///raw/53d/11/z/1e492.png)

## The Neon

The Neon is the one and only currency in the game. There is 2 ways to obtain Neon : either with the textual events, or by scraping your car/your robots. That's where the notion of sacrifice comes up. Sometimes, if you're not lucky enough, you'll HAVE to give up on one of your travel mate (that means losing their damages and skill). Then again, Neon is more than just the currency you need to start a level, it is also the currency you need to repair your car (that means regaining your hp !).

![managementScreen.png](///raw/53d/11/z/1e495.png)

## How to play

Here are the keys you need to know :
- WASD or ZQSD to move your car (during the Shoot'Em Up phases)
- Space to slow your car
- Simply click on the buttons during the textual phases to choose what you want to do
- **/!\** Don't forget to put all your robots in your car before starting the level ! **/!\**
- In the menu phases, you can click on the portrait of a robot to get detailled information on him !

## The team

- **Aymeric Le Moal** : Code (Shoot'Em Up and event part)
- **Tom Suchel** : Code
- **Olivier Millochau** : Code, Art (Menu and character management)
- **Samuel Souville-Chassaing** : Art, Sound

entries.title: Potty Panic
entries.description:
The King Toilet Demon has decided he has had enough of living in the sewers. With the help of his Toilet Paper army, he has decided that he is coming to the surface and YOU are his first target. It's up to you to send him back to his porcelain throne down under. Unfortunately for you, the only way to fend them off is to sacrifice everything in your house to clog the very pipes from whence they will be coming. Are you a dirty enough dude to take down the King Toilet Demon yourself? Or will you be the first victim to the Sewer Toilet Uprising?

![TitleScreen.PNG](///raw/fbe/e1/z/1e430.png)

![screen1.png](///raw/fbe/e1/z/1e433.png)

![screen2.png](///raw/fbe/e1/z/1e434.png)

This game was our first ever game jam and we are very excited with how it came out. We learned so much in the past 72 hours and we look forward for more!

Controls:
- Move: LEFT/RIGHT/A/D
- Pick Up: J/Z
- Throw: K/X
- Jump: SPACE
- Stairs: UP
- Exit: ESCAPE

Objectives:
- Throw as much of your furniture into your toilets as you can to clog them.
- Don't get hit too many times by the Toilet Paper army.
- If you encounter the King Toilet Demon, defeat him and send him back home.

Credits:
- Programming & Music by Ryan Brenner
- Animation & Graphics by Johara Dutton

entries.title: Frank's Forbidden Food Factory in a Faraway Fantasy Farm
entries.description:
# [:cow2: PLAY GAME 👨‍🌾](https://jmswrnr.itch.io/ffffiafff)

[![CoverImage.png](///raw/2fe/81/z/1ee2e.png)](https://jmswrnr.itch.io/ffffiafff)

# TLDR How To Play:
- Remember the recipes
- Pickup ingredients matching a recipe and sacrifice them
- **+1 score** for each correct ingredient following a recipe
- **-4 score** for each extra wrong ingredient
- **8 Levels** of recipes - unlock a new level every 20 score
- ** YOU DIE** if you don't sacrifice correct ingredients following a recipe or your score goes below 0
- [What are you waiting for? **PLAY NOW**](https://jmswrnr.itch.io/ffffiafff)

# Recipes

There are 32 total recipes in the game. There are 4 countries with 8 popular dishes each: UK, Japan, USA, Brazil.

[![Recipes.png](///raw/2fe/81/z/1ee03.png)](https://twitter.com/jmswrnr/status/1069835019223556096)

# About

Unfortunately, I could only spend about half the time I wanted to on the jam, So please forgive the lack of UI feedback and audio.

Post-jam bug fixes, (no features/content added)
- I accidentally left in debug code which really broke the game *(Fixed by removing 1 line of code)*
  - Round not ending when you placed final ingredients
  - Game would not pause when book is open
  - Player could still move with book open, possible game-over
  - Player level disabled, which unlocks all 32 recipes
- Sacrificing items would delete previously sacrificed items causing inevitable game-over. *(Fixed by merging array instead of replacing)*
- Ingredients Icons not renderings properly in book *(Horizontal layout group disabled on prefab)*

entries.title: Off the Rails 2
entries.description:
Skate around town to collect arcade tokens! Collect enough and you win! Just because!

## Controls

### Controller

* Move - Left Stick
* Camera - Right Stick
* Zoom - Shoulder Triggers
* Jump - A
* Dab (while grinding) - X
* Release Mouse - Start

### Keyboard / Mouse

* Move - WASD / Arrows
* Camera - Mouse
* Zoom - MWheel
* Jump - Space / KP_0
* Dab (while grinding) - LShift / RShift
* Release Mouse - Esc
* F6 - Low res ("potato mode") toggle. Helpful for laptops.

## Notes

* We re-used our player model from our failed LD40 game, that is the only reused asset.
* We were going to have a better ending / win condition but time restraints. The ending was supposed to be that you "sacrifice" your arcade tokens to gain access to the credits area. Instead we just disabled the timer and let you freeplay.
* We had plans to add multiple grinding and air tricks but due to time, the only trick is dabbing while grinding.

## Credits

* Colby Klein - Art, Programming
* Landon Manning - Programming, SFX
* Jackson Drummond - Music

## Changelog

* v1.01 - Added Potato Graphics mode to F6.
* v1.02 - Fixed a very bad performance bug. How did this run?

entries.title: Wrath of the Gods
entries.description:
![Intro Page.PNG](///raw/a3/z/1e11e.png)

**THE WEB BUILD PREVIOUSLY AVAILABLE, HAS BEEN REMOVED - WE BELIEVE THIS IS FOR THE BEST AS THE PERFORMANCE ISSUES HARM THE EXPERIENCE. PLEASE DOWNLOAD AND PLAY!**

BugFixes Applied Post Jam: 

- Win Condition corrected so the game is ACTUALLY winnable.
- Scoreboard hookup to hosted service was broken, fixed.

Welcome to Wrath of the Gods - a game set in the glorious world of....Appeasement Island. Where Gods are appeased. Or they should be!

Humanity has existed on the Island for many years without issue....until now. The locals have desecrated the Altar to the Gods and they are furious. You must find a way to appease the gods or face certain death and destruction.

Sacrifice at the Altars to receive temporary powers to aid your journey, and dont  let the Aztecs catch you!

So that is your task. Gain followed, sacrifice to the Gods, gain their forgiveness and restore peace once more on Appeasement Island. Remember, if things get crazy......you can always just give up.

CONTROLS:

- WASD to Control the Character
- E to activate objects
- F to request a follower
- SPACE to Jump.
- Hold SHIFT to Run.
- T to Toggle Sounds
- ESC to Exit To Menu

**For Clarity:**

**Green Person Icon: Number of Followers Gained**

**Red Person Icon: Number of Followers Died**

**Orange Person Icon: Number of Followers currently Following You.**

entries.title: Noroi
entries.description:
## :japanese_castle: Description

Hack and slash next to a Japanese pagoda, where you can play the entire game with but one hand (the right one 笑).

You control the character's movement by left-clicking with the mouse pointer. Same is used for attacking enemies. Once a wave of enemies has been defeated, you are presented with a choice between keeping your current weapon, or trying your luck and getting a new weapon. Weapons can level up, so sacrificing your current weapon can result in a temporary, or permanent, setback. Either way, _sacrifices must be made_ to grow ever more powerful, to gain the necessary equipment to defeat the 6 waves of invading enemies.

![1df84.png](///raw/d50/2/z/1f22a.png)

## :shinto_shrine: Background
This is our first 3D game where we've had movable characters and an environment, and WOW! Working with 3D and 3D-animation sure ain't no joke! Whether we talk about the modelling, UV-mapping, texturing, rigging, and smacking the animation on top of it all AND make it all work in the game engine. Respect for graphic artists! We had plans on adding some enemy types and even a boss, but due to some rigging problems we completed only one character, which doubled up as both the playable Samurai character and the Terracotta enemies (Chinese, we know, but desperate times require desperate measures!).

FUN FACT: Did you know that the Japanese used to lacquer pretty much everything that was worth lacquering? During the warring states period they manufactured a stupendous amount of guns and armour, and they were frequently lacquered so that they would not rust. Henry Ford, allegedly inspired by Japanese technique of lacquering what-ever-have-you, decided to solve his problem of automobiles rusting by lacquering them.

![2018-12-05-211024_1883x1184_scrot.png](///raw/d50/2/z/1f228.png)

## :japanese_goblin: Known issues

* Collision bugs. There are parts of the surrounding mountain that don't properly prevent the character to move through. Some collision shapes are too big and some too small.
* Finicky clicking. The part that registers clicks/movement is a bit small, and a bit bugged in the engine. It is possible to drag the mouse to move around, but if you stop dragging, it won't follow the mouse cursor. Clicking on the player sprite or other objects can fail to properly register as a movement.

## :bento: Tips

* The goal is to get in as many hits while taking as few as possible. Don't let more than one enemy hit you at a time. Try to hit them without they hitting back.
* The weapons have a tier, which is displayed in front of the level in square brackets. The tiers are Basic, Common, Magic, Rare, and Legendary. The higher the tier, the more stats and higher damage numbers it can roll.
* Lines which question marks in the weapon choice screen show that the sword has a stat. The stat can be beneficial, or it can be nothing. Multiple stats of the same type are merged together once revealed.

## :dolls: Credits & Tools

* Programming: Albert Diserholt
* Graphics: Sunisa Diserholt & worai col
* Sound & music: worai col
* Assisted with some graphic assets: Pierre Althinsson & Jimmy Olofsson


* Game engine: [Godot 3.0.6](https://godotengine.org/) + GDScript
* 3D stuff: Autodesk 3ds Max, Autodesk Maya, 3D Coat, and Substance Painter.
* 2D art: Adobe Photoshop, and Krita
* Sound & music: Reason
* Animations: [Mixamo](https://www.mixamo.com/)

![1df7b.png](///raw/d50/2/z/1f225.png)

entries.title: Champion of Survival
entries.description:
A 2.5-D survival-type game created for the Ludum Dare 43 jam. Since this is the first time I've done a real game jam it's probably a little rough around the edges, but hey, it sorta works. Everything was created in 72 hours except the Unity engine and its default post-processing effects. The biggest sacrifice in order to fit the time limit was the ability to come up with a good title.

The game itself is quite short, consisting of 7 stages of (hopefully) increasing chaos and difficulty, and features a combined 3-D and pixel art style. Each stage the maximum weight you're allowed to carry decreases, so you may have to sacrifice items as the game goes on. Eventually, there are magic attacks which don't weight a lot, but instead drain your health! I haven't tested it enough to know how hard it really is, but it is possible to beat. I think.

Created primarily with Unity 2018.2.8, Blender 2.79, Krita 4, Audacity, and Visual Studio. Everything that you see was made specifically for this jam with the exception of the fonts, which I made for another project a few years ago.

![screen2.png](///raw/604/f1/z/1e29d.png)
![screen3.png](///raw/604/f1/z/1e2aa.png)
![screen4.png](///raw/604/f1/z/1e2ad.png)

entries.title: Sealed
entries.description:
Here is our teams game, for our first Ludum Dare we thought we were met with the theme; Sacrifices must be made. 

![Sealed Screenshot2.png](///raw/808/d1/z/1ee92.png)

After a Brief discussion we arrived at our basic Idea: The player must fight his way through a dungeon in order to destroy the boss creatures within. however in order to defeat the boss creatures the player must sacrifice a part of his vitality (or in other words, his max health) in order to seal away the bosses powers so that he can kill them. 

However due to unforeseen circumstances we were unable to implement every aspect of the game. Including the main sealing aspect of the boss fight. however the main basic features of our game were implemented and a playable demo of our game is available. We encountered major issues with certain aspects of the games development as we were not used to using the Unity engine. however, we do feel that the game we have produced is somewhat fun to play, if somewhat short. and we feel like we have learned a lot from this experience and can improve upon this game and any other games we produce in the future because of this experience.

Controls:

WASD or Arrow Keys to move the player
left click to shoot


Made in Unity 2018. distributed via Itch.io with a WebGL build.

entries.title: Vincent's Sacrifice
entries.description:
**Jam version is now live - thanks for patience**
*Those who played it early are invited to try again, as the version we put up here was an early build as we had version management issues when we were trying to submit! Thank you*

**Mouse aim version available** - a lot of people complained the retro controls made it too tough, so in hope that more people get to access the content we put together, we've made a new build which uses keyboard and mouse controls. *Both* versions are still available on the download page on itch.io.
 
## CONTROLS
### Mouse Aim Version
- W, A, S, D (or arrow keys) - *Movement*  
- Left-Click - *Attack*  
- Space - *Interact, Hold to Drag / Push Objects*  
- Left-Shift (or right click) - *Dash* 

### Keyboard only version
- W, A, S, D (or arrow keys) - Movement  
- J - Attack  
- K - Interact  
- L - Dash  
- Space - Drag / Push Objects 

# The Game
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=btvw3ZD4gEw

You play Vincent, a rabbit who’s poorly son has just died. When burying his son, Lucifer appears and offers Vincent a way to bring his son back to life. 

![ss_intro2.png](///raw/ecb/c/z/1eed2.png)

Vincent is taken to Lucifers dungeon, and told he must prove how much he wants his son back through fighting his way through the dungeon. 

![ss_intro3.png](///raw/ecb/c/z/1eed3.png)

During this trial, Vincent can gain help from Lucifer: reviving yourself when dead, helping you clear / solve a dungeon room, providing you with improved character stats. 

![ss_sacrifice3.png](///raw/ecb/c/z/1eed4.png)

However, all of these come at a cost: losing character stats, making immoral decisions, making the end boss fight more difficult. 

![ss_sacrifice2.png](///raw/ecb/c/z/1eed7.png)

![ss_death2.png](///raw/ecb/c/z/1eed9.png)

Vincent must make it to Lucifer at the end of the dungeon, in order to bring back his little baby rabbit son. 

# How To Play
Clear the rooms of the dungeon until you face your final test. Monster rooms need all monsters cleared before you can move on to the next room. Gauntlet rooms require you to simply get to the end of the room and avoid all the traps. Puzzle rooms require switches to be activated in order to open the exit door. Sacrifice rooms require you to make a moral decision before you can progress to the next room.

When you die, you can be resurrected. You will have sacrifice your stats when doing so (Max HP, Attack, Defence, Attack Speed, Move Speed). If you help Lucifer, he will reward you by improving your stats - though your decisions will impact your final test at the end of the dungeon. 


# F.A.Q
**The game is too hard!**
It is difficult, but you can be revived as often as you like other than on the final boss.

**The aiming is too difficult**
Yes, it is. We wanted an old school approach, but in hindsight it will frustrate more people than we'd like.

**There's a bug with... **
Please let us know with as much detail as possible <3 thank you!

Aztec Queen 'Eztli' is visited by a strange wizard who informs her that a demon is present in her palace.

entries.title: Steampirates of Bermuda
entries.description:
![Screenshot2.png](///raw/ecf/c/z/1f27e.png)

Arr matey! It's time for you to gather your crew, board the Coalheart, and set sail for the rich trade routes of the Bermuda Triangle. Find those laden merchants by the sound of their chanties, then give them a taste of your thermal ray or your broadside cannons. Send them to the depth, and be sure to get their loot on board before it too sinks. Once your hold is as full as can be, head back to your home port to cash in your prize.

But be careful. There's something dark in these waters. And it has a taste for blackhearted pirate souls. Like a shark, it will follow the smell of your blood through the water, getting ever hungrier and faster. But you're no frightened landlubber. And besides, there's an old sea dog's trick: The one thing these eldritch horrors like chasing more than your pirate ship are dark souls offered to it in sacrifice. So find yourself some "volunteers" amongst your crew members and have them walk the plank. Of course, whomever your sacrifice won't be doing his job no more, so your ship's performance will suffer in some way. But the Coalheart can get by on a skeleton crew if need be. And on the bright side, dead man don't get their cut from the loot.

------

Well, I finished the game, just barely. It doesn't nearly have all the features I wanted to implement (like decent Merchant AI that fights back, lookout-crewmembers that show you indicators to merchant ships, or even a start menu), but I hope you'll have some fun playing it nonetheless.

The game was made by me, Bificommander, in Unity. It uses some standard Unity assets, and a collection of free sound effects.

Press Esc for a list of controls. The game ends when you die or when you return to the green homebase that you start at. Note that for the final score, the amount of loot you collected and remaining HP are counted, but the number of crew members you sacrificed is not. Can you make it to the Dread Pirate rating?

Post-jam update: I put in an hour or two of extra work to polish the game up slightly. It now has the in-game UI that I removed because it wasn't done, has some changes to the map that prevent you or the merchants from getting stuck so easily, plus some minor interface tweaks. It is definitely the game experience I recommend, but if you want to be strict with your rating, the original is what I finished by the Jam deadline.

entries.title: 10Up Origins
entries.description:
This newest entry in the beloved and long running 10Up series explains the origins of the mysterious liquid that became the number one drink in the world, due to its almost magic like properties.

After the initial discovery by the professor the first attempts at mass producing 10Up are made. You are tasked with running this first factory and overseeing its workers. But the process is difficult to execute, so your inexperienced workers will produce cheap substitutes at first. Financial loss is imminent, but there is always the option of cutting pauses in order to increase factory output while sacrificing your workers' health. And at some point in their lives your employees working power will decrease again, making it less and less 'unfortunate' should they expire due to overworking. How far are you willing to go in pursuit of the greater good, i.e. world domination fueled by 10Up (which means 100 drinks produced without going bankrupt)?

![screenshot.png](///raw/ca5/z/1cfaa.png)

Made by Ingo Jakobs and Christian Reuter, contains sprites and code fragments created by Martin and Robert Konrad.



### Changelog

2018-12-05
- fixed game-freeze after cleaning multiple workplaces
- typo fixed in worker names


### Known Bugs

- **Game Crash/Freeze (Fixed!):** 
Cleaning a workplace while an other Worker is still being recycled (fades out in inventory) causes a game crash. To avoid, please wait until the last dead worker is totally gone, bevor cleaning up the next workplace.


### How to play

- add new workplaces to hire more workers, but beware your expenses
- to view worker stats deselect current action with right klick

entries.title: The Affliction
entries.description:
The Affliction is a top-down action adventure game based around magic and alchemy. You must travel to the center of the nearby forest to discover the source of an illness that has been taking the lives of all of the residents of your village.
You can make potions, scrolls, and runes by using the essences of the forest along with your own blood. Be careful, as messing around with alchemy can be fatal.

https://youtu.be/JESDsIvtE-U

entries.title: Sacrifish (Local multi-player)
entries.description:
The black hole at the bottom of the ocean is hungry! And she has very specific wishes too. Bring her the correct types and amounts of sacrificial plankton before your opponent does and before she changes her appetite. Beware of the other fish though; they can (and will!) steal the plankton they like off of you. You can also use their kleptomaniacal tendencies to your advantage whenever you have accidentally collected too much plankton of some kind. Either play for a fixed amount of time or race your opponent to the first to get a certain number of points!


## How to play
Player1 uses the WASD/ZQSD keys to move around, while Player2 may use the arrow keys.
Collect **exactly** the combination of plankton that the great almighty black hole requests. You can see what each player collected on the sides.

You can get rid of an excess of plankton of a color by touching the black fish of that color.

To deliver the innocent plankters to the great almighty black hole, simply bump into her. You will then score points and the black hole will request a new meal of plankton. In normal and hard mode, the black also changes what she wants if the timer is up. Good luck!

------

Please, tell us what you think of our little game. We appreciate comments! 




![scrshot.png](///raw/4a0/2/z/1e7a4.png)

entries.title: Praise The Snek
entries.description:
![screen1.png](///raw/9ce/91/z/1dfeb.png) 


In the ancient village of Snecohtitlán you can either be a worshipper of **Achtla**, goddess of the **sun and fire**, or a cultist of **Ezqui**, god of **thunder and storms**, deities known as the two faces of **the Mighty Snek**.

**Bring offerings** to your deity to protect the village from their wrath.

Each deity will ask for 3 offerings at a time (fruit, gold, hens and NEWBORNS!), pick them carefully and bring them to your temple's altar. Remember: bringing something unrequested to your altar will make the deity very sad.

The **wrath** of any god will affect the whole village: beware of Achtla's fire walls (they will ostruct your path) and Ezqui's electric fields (they'll destroy your offering if you step on them).

When your deity's **satisfaction bar** reaches zero, the other cult prevails and you lose.


We hope you enjoy the game and praise the Snek :)


**Changelog [12/05]**
- Fixed the control screen where the pickup/blood sacrifice commands for keyboard were inverted (oops)

As High Priest , your task is to interpret this message, and ultimately to decide who should be sacrificed. You must depend on your advisors, DEXTRA and SINISTRA. But be careful, revolution is at the gates.

entries.title: Triag'd
entries.description:
![Screenshot01.png](///raw/65d/z/1e010.png)

The local hospital has been  under a tremendous amount of financial stress and is only able to hire a limited amount of doctors to look after patients. Assign doctors to patients in order to improve their chances of survival. There aren't enough doctors to go around, so choose wisely. Sacrifices must be made.



# Instructions

Click a doctor sticky note under the "Available Doctors" section and then click a patient card to assign the doctor to that patient. Multiple doctors can be assigned to a single patient.

To unassign doctors, click the doctor on the patient card. Doctor's can only be assigned/unassigned one at a time.

The more doctors a patient has, the higher chance that they will survive.

Patients that survive make donations to the hospital. Use these donations to upgrade the hospital and hire more doctors. These upgrades will boost the survivability of patients for future rounds.

# ​Note​

Linux and Mac builds are untested.

entries.title: The Forgotten Four
entries.description:
![ForgottenFourBanner.png](///raw/0f8/2/z/1e0a2.png)

Delve deep into the Temple of the Blood God as a group of heroes known only as The Forgotten Four. Willing to give anything to save their people from a cursed plague, they will fight the Blood Gods minions, and make great sacrifices for the greater good in this turn based combat game inspired by Darkest Dungeon.

- - -

## Credits

Artwork by Amy Cotton

Programming by Finn Truman

Game Design by Matt Heinrich

- - -

## Known Issues

The Barbarian's Mighty Cleave and the Ranger's Barbed Barrage can sometimes not hit as many enemies as the ability is meant to.

The Temple Guardians have wide hitboxes, which can overlap with another enemy's. So when you click on the latter you might click the Temple Guardian instead.

The Blood Nightmare and Plagued Bloodhorror's sprites cover up the green targetting ring that appears when choosing an ability that needs to select a target. Rest assured, your ranged and spirit abilities can hit them!

Some spirit cooldown abilities do not go on to cooldown.

The final boss has some incorrect behaviour. It tries to use some abilities early and can make melee attacks from too far away.

Damage indicators sometimes overlap. This is most prevalent at the start of a combatant's turn that has multiple status effects applied to them.

Very rare game crash caused by a draw event. Requires a restart. This might have been fixed, but since we do not know what conditions the bug operates under, we can only speculate.

Please let us know if you encounter any more issues!

entries.title: Suzanne Awakens
entries.description:
## Explore the different levels, triumph over your enemies and reach the Forest’s heart in this **action game**.

![Suzanne Awakens 1.png](///raw/bef/c/z/1f4dd.png)

After each level, test your skill by **sacrificing your equipment**. Sword, cloak or even boots : what will you choose?

*It was 15 years ago, when the darkness fell upon the Kingdom of Numelion, that Suzanne proved her courage by slaying the creature’s vicious heart. And this is how this loyal protector of Her Majesty became a legend.*

### **Suzanne awaits you!**

![Suzanne Awakens 2.png](///raw/bef/c/z/1f4de.png)

Compatible with a controller :video_game:

**Credits:**

Programming - Loïc Escales @super-louwaque

Art - Loïc Le Mouël @louis-lechauve

Game design - Hugo Jacquet @sunzed

Translation - Marlène Goumy @Eldiwis

*A La La Band & Co. Production*

entries.title: Expedite
entries.description:
Welcome to Expedite, our submission for Ludum Dare 43.

In this game, you are a slime traversing the world. But to get to the end, you must sacrifice your fellow slimes as platforms and boosts.

### Controls

To play this game, use A and D to move side to side. Use W to jump.

![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/6ce/e1/z/1df32.png)



Use your mouse to move the cursor, and left click to shoot slimes.

If you shoot down while jumping, you get a boost midair.

If you would like to remove all slimes, just right click.

The menu is janky: hit enter to select, and Up and Down arrow keys to select options.

### More game info
You only get a limited amount of slimes per level, so be wary!

### Team

Music and menu code: @Dementation

Majority of code: @Boathd

Art and assets: @Bananananer-Joe

### Software used

Music: https://onlinesequencer.net/

Art: Aseprite

Game Engine: Gamemaker Studio 2

Sound Effects: https://www.bfxr.net/

We've hosted this game on Google Drive. The link above autodownloads a .zip file containing the game executable.

bamb is a card game where you sacrifice cards to eliminate enemy cards.

[![bamb-screen.png](///raw/b5e/5/z/1dfad.png)](https://fasterthanlime.itch.io/bamb)

  * A gentle and comprehensive tutorial

entries.title: Blood Altar
entries.description:
![Ludum_Dare_43_Blood_Altar.gif](///raw/9f2/z/1e79d.gif)
![Ludum_Dare_43_Blood_Altar-2.gif](///raw/9f2/z/1e79e.gif)

### \*\* We now added a post-jam version. we had more levels designed but ran out of time including them. so now you can play those too. \*\*
Please don't rate based on the post-jam version, it's only there to show the potential of the game.

## Notes
We managed to get almost all the mechanics, art, sounds, animations in. but we run out of time when building the actual levels, so sadly there is only one simple level and it doesn't even have all the implemented level elements.
Part of the challenge is supposed to be surviving several levels without running out of characters, and obviously this cannot be shown with one level. we already had the other levels designed. so we will upload a link to an unofficial version with the levels added later on, which will not be part of the actual LD jam submission.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9MUl-cVsmkY

## Plot
The god of blood needs sustenance! But who doesn't love dinner with a show? Complete his challenge and be rewarded with your sacrifice to him! Use the legions of sacrifices you have brought with you to navigate the platforming puzzles set in place by the god, even use their bodies to make a bridge for yourself if need be, but don't dispatch too many, or you'll have nothing left to sacrifice! And don't die yourself or you'll have no one to complete the ritual.

## Gameplay
You are a shaman with the ability to summon forth your villagers, you start the game with a limited amount of villagers types, your shaman must NOT DIE! the rest are expendable. just summon new ones to replace them.
You need to bring as many villagers to the the door to the next level before the shaman passes to the next level. anyone left behind on a level will die!
Use shift to switch between characters.
You can only have 1 type of villager summoned at one time. summon a new one near your shaman using the summon buttons.

## Villagers
![shaman-small.png](///raw/9f2/z/1e74d.png)
Shaman: 
You main unit, you must get him to the end of the level. He's the only one who can pick-up keys and unlock doors.

![warrior.png](///raw/9f2/z/1e734.png)
Warrior:
More sturdy, fights enemies. (we didn't have time to add enemies, oops...)

![ahuixotl-walk-2.png](///raw/9f2/z/1e752.png)
Ahuixotl:
Can fix broken mechanisms (Ctrl key), can be used as a spring to jump higher.

![fodder.png](///raw/9f2/z/1e753.png)
Fodder:
This guy is the most expendable, let him die on traps so your
other villagers may pass safely.

## Controls:
Arrow Keys: to move left and right and climb ladder.

Space: to jump.

Shift: to switch characters.

Ctrl: (with Ahuixotl) To fix broken elements

E Key: to use levers after they are fixed.

Mouse-click: remove a dead body if it blocks your way.

1 key, 2 key, 3 key: (in the post-jam version) loads level 1, 2, or 3 accordingly.
