entries.title: Car Destruction Racer XIV
entries.description:
![logoo.png](///raw/2cd/d1/z/1db17.png)

# Instructions

Jerry always wanted to be a racer.

Today, he finally is going to achieve his dream.

Unfortunately for him, he has absolutely no idea how to properly race a car. So to make up for that, he will sacrifice parts of his car by throwing them at opponents, while making his car lighter, but less stable.

Use the buttons displayed on the screen to throw parts, mouse to aim, and the WASD keys to drive.

![GIF3.gif](///raw/2cd/d1/z/1de54.gif)

# Credits

[**James**](https://james9270.itch.io/) - Coding (hell knows how he codes so fast, my theory is that he's an alien with a microchip in his brain)

[**Noogai**](https://noogai223.itch.io/) - Spriting and Texturing

[**Astrodex**](https://soundcloud.com/vicenta-erickson) - Music

**lau** - Music + Trailer

[**ugng**](https://ugng.itch.io/) - Sound Effects

[**Rjwest**](https://rjwest07.itch.io/) - Voice Acting

[**Karis**](https://reverievagabond.itch.io/) - He came up with both the name of the team and the name of the game, so thanks for that (jk karis is awesome)

[**Red**](https://unplugred.itch.io/) - Modeling

Good people who helped with testing: **Tirsod**, **ILikeBreadTooMuch**, **rd_NickF**, **CaffeineMeme**.

Thanks!!

![GIF2.gif](///raw/2cd/d1/z/1de60.gif)

# Soundtrack

Get the soundtrack here: 

https://soundcloud.com/vicenta-erickson/sets/car-destruction-racer-xiv-ost

# How To Install

Extract the zip to a folder, then double-click "Car Destruction Racer XIV.exe".

![unknown.png](///raw/2cd/d1/z/1de6f.png)

# a few notes

I have no idea how we managed to do all of that in time but hoooolly shit [was it intense](https://imgur.com/wQLMro7.png).

Due to the large team size finding an idea was quite easy.

We managed to finish the core of the game in about the halfway point of the jam, and because James was coding the code, I could continue to refine the graphics again and again.

Overall I think we far surpassed our expectations, and our abilities and I think that's amazing.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jazxOs4PkqY

entries.title: Let Me Eat You!
entries.description:
![LMEY_.png](///raw/b68/c/z/1f7ab.png)

You are to help the Eatmes to reach the providential Alwaysfedland.
You need a mouse to play.

(Multiple Eatmes may have been injured or died horribly during this development, but officially I deny everything.)

-o-0-o-

Solo jam submission using Unreal Engine 4, and part of my own marketplace package "God-Like Controls".

-o-0-o-

Bugs corrected since the end of LD43 submission:

* The floor was missing, so Eatmes couldn't move (Thanks to the Del key and the 3am submission deadline ;) ) 
* The starting camera angle didn't allow to see the objective "Alwaysfedland"
* The camera was following the Eatme leader and it was very hard to perceive motion, I unchecked "Follow selected actor" in the God-like controls marketplace package that I used
* The Eatme leader was hardly identifiable so I enabled the outline for the selected actor
* The audio for a not-hungry Eatme was too high pitched, I diminished the pitch in the sound cue
* There was some collision bugs between Eatmes, I corrected some of them, some still remains. I can't deactivate collision between Eatmes without coding a proper flocking AI, which I didn't have time for during the Jam and would be therefore an additional feature.
* One UI panel for one ending didn't display properly (the one in case of "Win"), it contains the "quit" button.

Thank you to all that provided with constructive feedback!

entries.title: Give me your Friend !
entries.description:
__GAME PITCH :__
You control a strong creature followed by 4 adorable minions :kissing_cat: *(they all have special abilities, can you find them :grin: ? )*.
The Creature can launch their minions away (press Z/B, select minion with [A-E]/[LB-RB] and launch with Z/B). You can then control them seperatly to solve the room's puzzle and unlock the door.

------
Can they all make it through the end of the 4 rooms ?
---
IMPORTANT :
YES, THE MAIN CHARACTER IS RIPPED OFF Crash Bandicoot (Well, technically it's redrawn so we are allowed :smirk: )
And there's a huge bug in the first version, we corrected it the next day post-LD. I left both links for curious people but __I strongly advise you to play the latest version to avoid bugs__

------

So this is more like a prototype.
We didn't have the time to implement all the graphics and sounds (so it looks really ugly).

---
HOW TO PLAY (Keyboard / Xbox)
---

Arrows / Left Stick = Move
---
Space / A = Jump
---
Z / B = Special Ability
---
[A+E] / [LB+RB] = Change minion selected or Change character controlled
---
Enter / Start = Go back to player (as minion) - Call back minions (as player)
---


Changelog : 

v1.1 (Post-LD) Corrected a bug with the buttons in level 3 and 4. Adjusted level design a little bit on level 3.

entries.title: HSMC Arena
entries.description:
IMPORTANT NOTE
==============

* Select your keyboard in Options menu before playing for the first time

* If you prefer to  play on a Windows build, you can find it at the bottom of the itch.io page


STORY
=====

In the year 2050, after being locked up by the gods for millennia, the titans are back on the surface of Earth !
Descendant of a great gladiator lineage, your mission is to repel the minotaurs sent by the titans to conquer Olympus!
To help you in this task, the gods have granted you their powers. However, the use of such power is not without risk! Every time you call upon the power of the gods, you will sacrifice part of your abilities.
Survive as long as possible by pushing back as many minotaurs as possible.


DISPLACEMENTS
================

* Move your character with the __WASD/ZQSD keys__ on your keyboard
* Orient him with the mouse

CAPACITIES
==========

* Pull with the __left mouse__ click
* Hand to hand blow with the __right mouse__ click


POWERS
======

* _Hermes' power:_ Teleportation (__SPACE key__) -> move to the place targeted by the mouse.
    * Sacrifice: You sacrifice part of your travel speed.


* _Poseidon power:_ Shock wave (__F key__) -> you push all enemies around you.
    * Sacrifice: You sacrifice part of your attack speed to hand-to-hand combat.


* _Athena's power:_ Shield (__R key__) -> you are temporarily protected from minautore attacks.
    * Sacrifice: You sacrifice part of your maximum life.


* _Artemis power:_ Burst (__E key__) -> you send a burst of projectiles.
    * Sacrifice: You sacrifice part of your attack speed at a distance.


* _Hephaestus power:_ Explosion (__tab key __) -> you throw an explosive projectile at the place targeted by the mouse.
   * Sacrifice: You sacrifice part of your damage. 


SACRIFICE
=========

The blue gauge around the power indicates the percentage of capacity sacrificed



CREDITS
=======

Video game made for Ludum Dare 43 by the Team Centrale !

__Coding :__

* Guillaume
* Vivien

__Design and Graphisms:__

* Alexis
* Alexandre
* Antoine

__Sounds and Music:__

* Laurent

Thanks for playing !
Don't hesitate to leave a feedback !

BUG FIXES
=========

-Fixed a bug that prevented the player to go in the options menu

-Fixed a bug that prevented playing with qwerty keyboard on some browers

-Fixed a bug that prevented the shield animation from playing

entries.title: AkimBear
entries.description:
Grizzle is on a journey back to a home remembered from long ago. There's memories of the lab, the others, but nothing about what happened there. Maybe it's time those memories were brought back.

Grizzle is on a journey back home. This is a bear with only one goal... but luckily there's two guns along for the ride.

## Trailer

https://youtu.be/avRx-U6SNHk

## Controls

### Controller: beary highly recommended!

Left stick: left gun aiming

Right stick: right gun aiming

Left bumper: left gun shooting

Right bumper: right gun shooting

### Keyboard: if you don't have a controller, we apologize profusely

Please let us know if you finish the game without a controller so we can be suitably impressed!

#### Left gun
Q: rotate left gun CCW

W: left gun shooting

E: rotate left gun CW

#### Right gun
I: rotate right gun CCW

O: right gun shooting

P: rotate right gun CW

## Design Notes

We wanted our player to have to make a sacrifice when choosing to shoot, but we also wanted there to be a lot of shooting. In order to balance these goals, we decided that shooting with either gun should stop your forward motion so it would be a sacrifice and then there would be no disincentive not to fire the second gun at the same time. Therefore, shooting still results in an important player choice between advancing towards the goal (fighting the timer) or fighting the despicable wildlife aiming to steal your honeyed health points while maximizing shooting when the player chooses to stop.

Our "feel" is highly influenced by [this talk](https://bit.ly/2FHhE4Y) from [Vlambeer](https://www.vlambeer.com/)'s Jan Willem Nijman and we would be amiss not to give it credit. We should also mention that [this section](https://forums.tigsource.com/index.php?topic=40539.20) of Kingdom's TIGsource thread was super helpful for implementing the water reflection (ignore what he says about rendering to a Render Texture being a Pro feature; it's not anymore).

## About

This is the fourth jam game from TeamHumanSimulator. All assets (sprites, sounds, music, etc.) were made by us during the jam and we did all the programming ourselves. We hope you enjoy the game and welcome any feedback you may have!

entries.title: ulis43
entries.description:
![cover.png](///raw/28d/f1/z/1ee4c.png)

Something went horribly wrong with your crew's spaceship.

Now you need to survive by allocating crew members to resource production facilities.

Some facilities need specific resources to produce other resources.

Crew consumes resources to survive.

Should the less productive of the lot be allowed to chew on your precious resources?


|WATER PLANT|OXYGEN PLANT|FARMING PLANT|ELECTRICAL PLANT|HQ / MACHINE ROOM|TRAPDOOR|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|![WATER_PLANT.png](///raw/28d/f1/z/1ee2f.png)|![OXYGEN_PLANT.png](///raw/28d/f1/z/1ee30.png)|![FARMING_PLANT.png](///raw/28d/f1/z/1ee31.png)|![ELECTRICAL_PLANT.png](///raw/28d/f1/z/1ee32.png)|![HQ.png](///raw/28d/f1/z/1ee36.png) ![MACHINE_ROOM.png](///raw/28d/f1/z/1ee35.png)|![TRAPDOOR.png](///raw/28d/f1/z/1ee37.png)|
|Consumes Electricity / Produces Water|Consumes Electricity and Water / Produces Oxygen|Consumes Electricity and Water / Produces Food|Produces Electricity|Consumes ressources|Flush staff to space|

Every crew member has a particular set of skills more or less usefull for certain rooms, a good captain should learn and know how to work his crew!

entries.title: Harvest Defense
entries.description:
When a big juicy seedling sits in the middle of the green grass, it's juts natural that bugs will come after it! Now only the vital forces of those mysterious mushrooms can save it...

![screencap_1543890075.png](///raw/cb3/9/z/1e27c.png)

# Mechanics

The game is a tower defense in which the towers grow and can be harvested for resources that can be then used to grow new towers.

To add a new tower, click on an empy spot and click the button corresponding to the tower you wish to add.

To harvest a tower, click on it and then on the "looping arrows" icon under it. Check if it's fully grown yet, and how much resource it'll actually yield before!

# Towers

- **Shroom Tower**: the basic tower, slow and not very strong... but you have to start with something!
- **Rapidberry Bush**: rapid firing, but slow to grow.
- **Shrieker**: able to attack all enemies in its range of attack, it takes a while but can be worth it!
- **Crimson Cranium**: damages anything in its vicinity, continuously. It also yields a lot of resources, if you have the time to wait for it to grow!

# Running the Game

The ZIP files provided contain self-contained executable files that should run in your OS of choice without downloading LÖVE2D.

If you prefer, though, download LÖVE2D (version 11) and run the .love package provided as *source*.

entries.title: Pyme's Genocide
entries.description:
![icono_juego.png](///raw/f73/31/z/1e17c.png)
![sdds.png](///raw/f73/31/z/1dd54.png)

## ABOUT THE GAME

You are Pyme, a space adventurer looking for new adventures, but due some problems in your trip the spaceship was damaged and crashed into a undiscovered planet full of misterious creatures. You will find that you can use your special Hoover named Baku to absorb and throw those creatures to your advantadges, you will use them as you please and they will still love you, some of them will be sacrificed for a better good, but they don't mind, they are always happy!!!

You will have to find the four pieces in order to repair your spaceship and go off the planet, or you can always stay with all the cute monsters that habit that world and discover new places!

## CONTROLS [Mouse+Keyboard / Controller]

entries.title: Blobkin Blaster VR!
entries.description:
![blobkinblasterlogo1.jpg](///raw/26c/d1/z/1dfd2.jpg)


**Blobkin Blaster VR** is a quick breed-em and shoot-em up VR Game. You must defend your blue Villagers from monsters that swoop in from space portals. The catch is your gun is powered by your Villager's life-blood! In order to defend them, you'll have to sacrifice them!

## This is a Virtual Reality (Oculus Rift, Vive) seated experience.

**How to**

Grab your gun with one hand, grab a blue Villager with your other, then stick them with your gun's needle end (the bottom of the hilt) to suck your Villager's life!

Shoot Monsters that portal in to protect your village. The Monsters will drop food when shot, grab the food and a villager and smash them together to make a fatter (cube) villager. Once you have two Cube Villagers, rub them together to make new Villagers!

The game ends when you lose all your Villagers

**Controls**
Hold down Grip buttons to pickup
Trigger to shoot on whichever hand is holding the gun


**Authors**
Theory Studios is a small collective of animators and developers working in AR and character animation. We work virtually, so everyone lives around North America. Folks on the Ludum Dare team were:

* Andrew DiDomenico - Animator

* Ben McDougal - Texture Artist

* Chris Folea - Lead Game Developer & Creative Director <- this man crunched 72 hours :O

* Costas Frost - Particle Artist

* Daniel Manoiu - Sound & Music

* David Andrade - Taskmaster/Producing

* Iliana Ortiz - Rigging Artist

* Jill Blue - Voices, Arborist, Backgrounds

* Kate Sims - Scripts, Backgrounds

* Katie Patenaude - Social Sharer

* Marc Gordon - Modeler, Texturer

* Michael Richardson - Portaller

* Tatianna Quigley - Character Artist, Graphic Designer


**Comments**
We primarily tested on Oculus Rift, and while it works with Vive, we didn't playtest it much. Not sure if it work on Windows Mixed Reality (we don't own one to playtest).

There are a few bugs (shooting a Monster while a Villager is in mid-air will leave them stuck, doh!)

Used additional Sound Effects  from Digital Juice (splatter) - However the Music and Voices are our own
Used additional particle effects from RTFX Generator (the poof when Monsters die)


**Video**

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CI8vgpZq-P4

When you are next to a customer who wants donuts, press Spacebar -- once for each donut. When the customer is satisfied the yellow dot will turn green.

We didn't get one of the core features implemented in time. The plan was to have a police car who would follow you around, pull you over which of course would slow you down. entries.title: A Faithful Village
entries.description:
# Pitch

![big_town.png](///raw/303/f/z/1dfa2.png)

Tired of having to do sacrifices to please the gods in most games this year? In Faithful Village, You are a __god__, and like all gods, You crave *faith*. You turned Your all-seeing gaze to this peaceful village whose inhabitants are a bit stupid, yet You feel they can accomplish great things given the right __guidance__.

Your goal is to turn this village into a __thriving__ civilization whose kingdom reaches as far as the eye can see. You can order __buildings__ being constructed to provide for Your people’s needs and bring __speed__ to the most *faithful* ones. But beware that You remain __feared__, or Your influence will vanish…

# Controls

## Gameplay
- Left click to select/place building
- Right click to unselect/cancel
- R to restart

## Camera
- WASD/Mouse to move around
- AE to rotate around
- Mouse wheel to zoom

# More about the game...

## The townsfolk

There are 5 different types of **workers**, whose efficiency will grow over time. *Farmers* harvest and tend crops, while *Loggers* chop down trees for timber. *Builders* do Your construction work, and *Breeders* make sure the town stays populated and lively. Last, but definitely not least, *Priests* will motivate the townsfolk to provide for their god! However, they do sometimes overestimate their understanding of Your will, and may require unneeded **sacrifices**. Make sure You are prepared for it!

![sacrifice.png](///raw/303/f/z/1dfa9.png)

## The town

There are 5 types of **buildings**. *Houses* shelter Your people during the night, and *Warehouses* hold their resources. *Fields* provide food to feed Your growing empire, and *Roads* helps its expansion. Finally, *Temples* increases the population's faith and serves as places of **worship**.

## Faith

**Faith** is Your primary resource whose You should never run out of. Sadly, Your people are not immune to **doubt** and may stop believing in Your all-mightiness. You can make them remember Your mercy by building a *Temple*, or showing them Your strength by unleashing a vengeful **meteor** on their puny village.

![meteor.png](///raw/303/f/z/1dfb0.png)

# Bonus

A lovely morning in Faithful Village™
![morning.png](///raw/344/d/z/1e002.png)
(Play the game and you'll understand why!)

entries.title: Dead Weight
entries.description:
![picture3.PNG](///raw/d9d/z/1e0b5.png)![picture1.png](///raw/d9d/z/1e0b1.png)![picture2.png](///raw/d9d/z/1e0b2.png)

Dead Weight is a game where your goal is to find the ladder to advance to the next room.

Use arrow key or WASD to control your monster.

Locked doors can be opened by stepping on the corresponding pressure plate or dropping one of your limbs on top.

Eyeballs can also be place to provide you with stationary vision, however cannot activate pressure plates.

Careful, if you have your limbs detached you will loose blood and if you run out its game over.

Q retracts all your limbs and eyeballs back to your monster, if a limb passes over a pressure plate on the way to your monster it will activate it.

Once you have all your limbs re-attached you will begin healing.

Use R to restart level.


Developed by: Matt, Jacob, Alan, Jon, Dan, Kirubel, Bryan and Peter.

Art and Music by: Will

entries.title: Holly Jolly Trolly
entries.description:
The trolley problem is a thought experiment in ethics. The general form of the problem is this:

You see a runaway trolley moving toward five tied-up (or otherwise incapacitated) people lying on the tracks. You are standing next to a lever that controls a switch. If you pull the lever, the trolley will be redirected onto a side track and the five people on the main track will be saved. However, there is a single person lying on the side track. You have two options:

Do nothing and allow the trolley to kill the five people on the main track.
Pull the lever, diverting the trolley onto the side track where it will kill one person.
Which is the more ethical option?

en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trolley_problem

This a take on the classic Trolly Problem, but you are in the driver's seat instead! Use the arrow keys to go left or right... choose wisely because... sacrifices must be made!!

CONTROLS
Left and Right Arrow Keys

entries.title: Space Battle Zero
entries.description:
![Unity 2018-12-03 20-40-02-00.png](///raw/01b/91/z/1e607.png)

.

# About
 
Space Battle Zero is a strategy combat game that pits two orbiting battleships against one another in a beautiful barrage ballet. With limited energy at your disposal - and limited windows to strike your opponent - you must carefully balance your spacecraft's offensive and defensive capabilities. Will you sacrifice your shields for an all-out assault, or will you have to divert energy from your super weapon at the last second to fend off an attack? Maybe you can even trade your orbital high ground for faster energy gains? Choose carefully, but beware. Even the best laid plans can blow up in your face like a missile out of the black!
 
.

# How to play

If you've ever played FTL, you already know the basics:


![laser_crop00b.png](///raw/01b/91/z/1f600.png)

This is your energy. You start with 3 points, and earn 2 more for every orbit you survive.

.

![laser_crop01.png](///raw/01b/91/z/1f601.png)

Click on a system (like laser) to assign an energy point to it. It will take a few seconds to power up.

*You can also click on already-assigned points to remove and redistribute them.*

![laser_crop02.png](///raw/01b/91/z/1f602.png)

Assign another point to speed up charging time.

*Adding more energy doesn't always speed up charging. Adding a third point to laser, for example, will make it more powerful instead of faster to charge.*

![laser_crop03.png](///raw/01b/91/z/1f603.png)

A system is ready to fire when **A)** it's fully charged, and **B)** the enemy is within range. A + B = C, as in **C**lick that fire button!

*Some systems, like shields and sensors, engage automatically.*

![laser_crop04.png](///raw/01b/91/z/1f604.png)

Bam, you've just fired your first laser! Keep it up and space will be littered with the shattered hulls of your enemies in no time.

.

# Hints

- Music too loud? Click X (top left) to Pause and adjust volume to your preference
- Press 1, 2, or 3 on the keyboard to change cameras
- Sensors extend the range of your missiles
- Pulse detonates nearby enemy missiles
 
![Unity 2018-12-03 20-38-39-69.png](///raw/01b/91/z/1e342.png)

If you encounter any issues with the WebGL version or simply want the best-looking experience available, please download the PC or Mac build (linked below):

entries.title: Ropasquib
entries.description:
![title.JPG](///raw/3e2/11/z/1e0b8.jpg)

Can you beat the mayan god ROPASQUIB in an epic duel playing the rarely known traditional mayan god game "ROck PAper Scissors QUill Bucket"? If you loose though, you will be sacrificed to the gods - as it is tradition. Sorry...

![gameplay.JPG](///raw/3e2/11/z/1e119.jpg)

I wanted to bring in some strategic thinking into the classical rock-paper-scissors game. I added two more items/options: quill and bucket.

![diagramm.png](///raw/3e2/11/z/1e595.png)

Every turn you use up the items like ressources - so every turn your options are reduced as they are for your enemy. To bring back all options you can sacrifice a bit of your health by clicking on it. 

I hope the game is explaining enough to be playable, because I had no time to build in some hints. Hopefully that adds to the experience. 
Looking forward to your feedback! :)

Updates:
There is two versions of the game: 1) The oficial compo release. If I will do some bugfixing, I will publishe here: http://ropasquib.mausundspaten.de
 2) Updates after release version. All other future updates - that includes for example new sounds, grafics, features and general polishing - will be published on this link: http://daidalos.mausundspaten.de

entries.title: Cake Hunters
entries.description:
Birthday, big cake, family. Sounds beautiful, isn't it? But what can go wrong?    
**TONS of CHERNOBYL insects from dirty dishes, that's what can happen!**  
Can you protect a birthday party and family's cake from insects and keep good relationships with your family members? 

Destroy all insects,  protect your cake and relationships! Good luck.

![Screenshot (1097).png](///raw/6ca/c/z/1edd8.png)
![Screenshot (1107).png](///raw/6ca/c/z/1edda.png)
- - - 
    
**Controls:**      
Left Mouse Button - attack insects or activate/deactivate family members   
    
   
**Mechanic:**     
The main goal is to survive insects invasion by killing all of them and protect the cake.   
The cake has some health, but it cannot stand attacks for very long, so do your best and try to keep insects away from it!    
To attack insects - hover the mouse over them and press LMB (click).   
Every single hit - 1 click.     
       
- - -
   
**Enemies:**   
Ant has 1 health, so one click will destroy it.  
Fly has 2 health, 2 clicks required.  
The cockroach has 3 health, logical to assume 3 clicks required to kill it.   
Centipede... Well, let's keep it in secret :wink: But prepare yourself to click a lot if you want him to die!   
    
**Family members: **  
Each family member can help you with killing insects, you just need to activate a member by clicking on him/her.   
They have their own zones where they deal a damage.    
But be aware, with time your family members will lose their mood, so be ready to deactivate them in time (by clicking on them again).    
So, you need to balance their help and their mood if you want them to be happy at the end of the game.    
They have 3 stages: happy, okay and sad. Don't let them be sad :(  
Family members are good helpers, but don't expect them to do all the dirty job for yourself!  
    

- - -

**Credits: **   
   
Serhii Todosan (@serhii) - game design   
Vlad Melnyk (@zaqq) - music, sfx  [ https://soundcloud.com/zaqq ]   
Vitalii Zavoloka (@bbaf) - programming  [ https://twitter.com/_0bb ]

entries.title: Volcano Island
entries.description:
Last minute submission!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=juBJeSxormI

## You have to feed Lord Volcano or face the consequences...

Art & Programming by Martin A. Asteasuain (me)

Music by Kevin MacLeod (https://incompetech.com/music/)

All the sounds are from www.freesounds.org​


## How to play

This is basically a memory game like Simon.

The Volcano will ask for one guy in particular and you'll have to find it in the crowd.

Then he will ask for another... but remembering the previous one. So you'll have to find two.

Then three and counting... and if you make a mistake in the sequence, prepare to face the rage of the Volcano!

## Warning: The web version only works on Firefox

entries.title: Baker's Island
entries.description:
Baker's Island is a platforming action game.

The player is equipped with a knife which is useless in combat as all enemies are made of jelly. Instead, the knife must be used to cut slices off of the motherloafs, living loaves of bread, to spawn breadchildren, sentient slices of bread that have multiple uses including soaking up jelly enemies, executing multiple jumps in the air, and even consumption for refilling health. The goal of the player is to reach the end and interact with the godloaf.

entries.title: Sachristmas !
entries.description:
# Sachristmas !

![sachristmas_1.gif](///raw/216/z/1dfab.gif)

## Game

Each year, during chrismas night, Santa claus travels the world to give children what they wished. But it is not an easy job and sometimes Santa can't fulfil everybody's wishes. Making sacrifices while trying to bring joy to most is at the heart of Santa's job.

## Gameplay

You have two minutes to collect presents and put them in the houses of the village.
You can only carry one present at a time and once you dropped it off, you can not retrieve it.
Read carefully what the children wrote on their letters.
Good luck !

## Tools
Made using TIC-80 and PSLIB.

entries.title: Book of Crab
entries.description:
## Short Description
“Book of Crab” is a stealth game where you have to gather animals and sacrifice them in a specific order to perform a demonic ritual, so you can make your wish come true with the help of the devil. You have to dodge the alerted villagers so they don't hinder you in performing your ritual.

![pentagram.png](///raw/921/31/z/1e1b8.png)


## Gameplay
You want to perform the ritual described in your demonic book to make your wish come true. So you have to gather everything listed inside the book and sacrifice it in the right order to successfully perform the ritual.

Controls:

![explanation.png](///raw/921/31/z/1e14a.png)



## Technical Details
+ The game was made in Unity
+ All sounds and graphics were made by ourselves


![necro.png](///raw/921/31/z/1e29c.png)


## What we would have added or changed if there was more time
+ Fetch Quests
+ House Interiors
+ Advanced sacrifical tasks
+ Minimap
+ …


![Death.png](///raw/921/31/z/1e12b.png)



Sacrifice your time to play our game.

entries.title: Ronin Sacrifice: The Tale of the Last Rabbit
entries.description:
With his magical sword, the ronin rabbit is on his journey to save the last mate of his kind. Together they shall breed and repopulate the Rabbit kingdom, that is, if you are able to help him. As long as rabbit holds his magical sword, he cannot really die for his soul carries on. Use this to your advantage when navigating through the world of evil foxes that took your last female away!

## ABOUT

This game is an attempt to make an action puzzle platformer. Use arrow keys or WASD to move with up/W key to jump and down/S key to walk slower, use your sword pressing space key. Also try using your sword when holding key down, it will probably help you a lot sooner or later.

Hope you will have fun! You can post your numbers in the comments, we're very interested in your best walkthroughs (and the worst as well :) ). 

![scr02.gif](///raw/59a/31/z/1eecf.gif)

## CHALLENGE - a beer with devs competition!
**Hey, we decided that we open up a competition - so far none of our players seemed to reach the lowest possible number of rabbit sacrifices. So we decided to offer a prize - a beer with developers** (if you're in reasonable distance from or directly from Czech Republic, else we have to negotiate something instead) **- to anyone who can finish the whole game in one run sacrificing the least amount of rabbits of all the players (including the dev team)! Leave an endgame screenshot with your best numbers in the comment!**

![scr01.png](///raw/59a/31/z/1e737.png)

:fire: Play solo or couch coop up to four players! :fox: 
Has online highscore also!

Help your old mysterious grandfather sort through his basement of relics and put together all those puzzle he hasn't had time to piece together yet! You better hurry though because time is running out, and you may have to sacrifice something valuable to keep going.

We had a lot of fun and put in tons of hours. Hope you will enjoy our game and give us feedback! :) The last day I put in 22 hours straight :)

Player 2: WASD + C, V, B

Fullscreen: Alt-Enter

But they are not tested, please try them and let me know if they work, or if you are getting any errors. Please don't rate down if the game isn't working on these builds, let us know and we will get it fixed so you can rate it correctly. We do extra work for these builds so please be nice! :)

entries.title: Garry's Sacrifice
entries.description:
Garry's Sacrifice is a tower defense game where you have just one enemy called Garry. Garry is a caveman who woke one morning believing he was the actual child of Satan and all he wants to do in life is to follow the path to his fathers home ... Hell.

Your objective is to make Garry see reason and bombard him with positive energy (by constructing Positivity Towers and loading them with energy orbs).

Around the map you may notice different type of animals moving around. You have to sacrifice those animals in order to gain resources to build structures. There are 4 types of animals and each animal gives different resources when killed:
![Animals2.PNG](///raw/da3/z/1f913.png)
There are four basic resources:
![Resources.PNG](///raw/da3/z/1f90f.png)

There are seven different types of structures:

### Bolders: 
![BolderButtonR.png](///raw/da3/z/1f908.png)
Can be placed on Garry's path in order to slow him down. Garry will gain a bit of strength every time he kills a bolder so use bolders carefully.
### Cooked Plate: 
![PlateButtonR.png](///raw/da3/z/1f909.png)
Garry doesn't enjoy raw animal flesh. But he is known to love some barbecued slices of meat. Used it the same way as bolders by placing them on Garry's path.
### Bone Catapults: 
![CatapultButtonR.png](///raw/da3/z/1f90a.png)
Along with Positivity Towers, catapults are the other type of "throwable" structure. Place them on the ground on an empty tile and feed it some flesh from your inventory in order to load it. Catapults have a cooldown after throwing flesh at Garry. If Garry's health goes to zero he must stop to rest before he continues. Loading catapults with meat bolders costs 1 flesh.
### Bone Remover: 
![BoneRemoverButtonR.png](///raw/da3/z/1f90b.png)
Allows you to create bones from animals
### Baseball Bat: 
![BaseballBatChamberButtonR.png](///raw/da3/z/1f90c.png)
Used to beat an animal to death. Not very efficient at gathering flesh or bones but very good for collecting animal tears.
### Barbecue grill: 
![GrillButtonR.png](///raw/da3/z/1f90d.png)
Used to make delicious barbecued slices of meat for Garry to eat.
### Positivity Tower: 
![HappyTowerButtonR.png](///raw/da3/z/1f90e.png)
Works the same way as catapults, but instead of throwing meat at Garry's face, it launches positivity orbs. If Garry reaches a "positivity" value of 100 before he sacrifices himself on the pit of hell you win the game. Loading towers with positivity orbs costs 1 tear.


NOTE: In order to play you need an internet connection! Game fetches other players maps from a a MySQL database.

## Basic Controls:

"A" "W" "S" "D" moves the camera.
"Escape" to access the menu.

## Map Maker Instructions:

The map maker allows you to generate maps with a limited size of 15. You can draw 5 different type of terrains, place 4 different types of animals and 5 different types of decorative objects (sry didn't have time to add more than 5 :P).

Use left click to add object and right click to remove it. If you hold left mouse button you cal also draw the terrain and Garry's path.


When you save a map you are asked for 3 values: 

### Map name: 
The map name is unique so you can't create a map with the name of a map that already exists.
### Creator: 
This is you! Type whatever you like to identify yourself with :P
### Password: 
When you create a map you provide a password for that map. That password is necessary so only the creator of a map can delete that map from the database (I can also delete maps with a special password so don't worry :P).

## Actual Game Instructions:

-> When the game starts there is a countdown of 30 seconds so you can prepare yourself before Garry starts his journey to the Pit of Hell.

-> On the left side of the map you have a panel with a health slider(red) and a positivity slider (yellow). Bellow those sliders there is a number that represents Garry's strength. Garry's strength represents the damage per second he does to Bolders and Plates of barbecue.

-> On the top right side you can see your resources.

-> On the bottom you can see the 7 structures you can construct (as described above).

#### -> Use left mouse  click to attack an animal and right mouse  click to grab him. Grabbing animals is required in order to use some structures like the Bone Remover or the Baseball Bat. If you are grabbing an animal and press the right mouse click you drop that animal.

## Objective:

Prevent Garry from sacrificing himself to Satan on the Pit of Hell


## Tools:

->> Unity,

->> Blender

->> PHP (for recording Maps)

->> paint.NET


## Screenshoots:

![Screenshoot1.png](///raw/da3/z/1f51a.png)

![Screenshoot2.png](///raw/da3/z/1f51b.png)

![Screenshoot3.png](///raw/da3/z/1f51d.png)

![Screenshoot4.png](///raw/da3/z/1f51e.png)

entries.description:
![Gif4Resized.gif](///raw/e4c/02/z/1ec6d.gif)

entries.title: Destructor 32 GMS
entries.description:
![logo.png](///raw/871/3/z/1ea47.png)

![1.jpg](///raw/871/3/z/1ea4f.jpg)
In Destructor 32 GMS it's your responsibility to wipe out a well known terrorist organistion by bombing there hideout. Unfortunately this hidout is in somewhere in the middle of a well populated area. But sometimes sacrifices must be made to make the world a better place.

**How to Play**
- Connect to ANY relay antenna by truning the HORIZONTAL/VERTICAL Dial until you can hear a clear signal with NO BACKGROUND NOISE and the signal indicator is full. Press the LOCK Button.

- Rotate the relay antenna with HORIZONTAL dial until you your can hear the TARGET SIGNAL. This signal is on the note on the monitor. You are looking for a morse code coresponding with the code on the note. When you have found the signal press LOCK again. Sometimes to signals can overlap eachother making it hard to tell them apart. If this happends you will have to guess where the signal is.

- You should now see a circle on the MAPSCREEN, your target is somewhere in the colored part of the circle. Repeat the steps above until you have a few circles overlaping each other.

- To fire the missile at the taget position, flip the white switch. You should now see a circle around the crosshair. Position the crosshair on the guessed target location and set the blast raduis with the RADUIS dail. You want to keep the raduis as small as possible to avoid unnecessary casualties. Flip the ARM MISSILE switch and press FIRE to launch the missile. Good Luck

Keep in mind you are on a time limit. If the timer hits 00:00 the target will escape. 

**Controls:**
  - Use scrollwheel to turn dial.
  - Press buttons with mouse.

entries.title: Monstropolis by the Sea
entries.description:
Welcome to Monstropolis! We have fun in the sun, a thriving night-life, and, occasionally, colossal migratory mega-beasts from the abyssal depths!

The population has been evacuated to behind the massive, protective shield wall.
Earn money from the bank to buy and upgrades expendable troops to throw at the advancing beasts to try to keep them at bay for as long as possible - if a monster breaches the walls, the city will be lost!

Made by Two Tims for Ludum Dare 43!

entries.title: Sacrifice Society
entries.description:
Your village has the ability to sacrifice its villagers to the gods. By doing this **all villagers benefit of the experience of the sacrificed villager.** Sacrificing strong warriors keeps your society strong and healthy. This is the only way to defeat the Demon Lords, which are permanently threatening the village.

**Avoid loosing experienced villagers in fights against the demons!** By sacrificing them all of the society can benefit! And the sacrificed villagers will live on in the experience they pass to the other people. And once again new villagers will see the light of the day.

**We made all assets by  ourselves.**
We used the **Unity Engine** as game engine and our small **recording studio** to create the music and the sound effects. We also used **Paint.net** to create the sprites. 

**Click here to play the game in the browser:** https://sirmichel.itch.io/sacrifice-society

![Screen3.png](///raw/659/e1/z/1d9cb.png)

![Screen6.png](///raw/659/e1/z/1d9d0.png)

![Screen1.png](///raw/659/e1/z/1d9da.png)

Controls:
- Use WASD or the Arrow Keys to control the camera in the village scene
- Click a villager to sacrifice (sword icon) or control him (sword icon)
- Use WASD or the Arrow Keys to control your villager and use the mouse to aim and shoot
- Follow the Demon Detector to find the Boss Room and kill the Boss

Post LD Updates:
- Fixed wrong music playing bug
- Enabled sound menu in the top right

entries.title: The Hero Code is Here!
entries.description:
Hi their adventurer, will you stay and listen to my story? It is an inspiring tale and also a sad one, but thanks to the people and EastArea team it was preserved for future generations. This tale is called The Hero Code, yes the same code that heroes of our days still hold so dear. In ancient times, a group of heroes traversed the deepest of the dungeons to slay the horrible Goose Hydra and free the world from its grasp! But on their way, they needed to present a sacrifice, horrible at that but the one that Hero Code value the most. So take a seat and hear my words, this tale starts from this words…
![3.jpg](///raw/48a/f1/z/1df2d.jpg)
And now some words from old boring us, not from the handsome storyteller from before. Hello and welcome to our take on Sacrifices must be made Theme of this Ludum Dere. We hope you will like it and of course, all kind of feedback is appreciated!
![1.jpg](///raw/48a/f1/z/1dcb5.jpg)
Because we used 3rd party assets for graphics and sounds we withdraw from participating in Graphics and Audio categories
For Visual components, you see on the screen big thanks to 0x72 here is the link to his dungeon Tileset and wonderful characters with animations! (https://0x72.itch.io/dungeontileset-ii)
Also for every sound in a game was downloaded from freesound.org kudos to all the authors on that platform as well.
![2.jpg](///raw/48a/f1/z/1df39.jpg)
Our team (EastArea) hold in its ranks such people as
Dzmitry Pukhouski – Producer
Dzmitry Kozlov – Main Programmer (real magician here)
Pavel Zhecko – Programmer (second real magician)
Sergey Lisitskiy – Game Designer (and epic at that)
Olga Veraksich – Lead artist (without her wonders all of this would look like two dots fighting each other)
And of course, Good Luck to everyone participating! 
About the controls use your mouse to perform actions and WASD keys to move and 1 2 3 keys to change formation (also spare some time to look and what game is saying to you).

entries.title: Unnecessary Evil
entries.description:
![banniere.png](///raw/361/f/z/1df22.png)

**Sacrifice your friends to move forwards!**

Glark, Steve, Bonny-chan, Noruto et Hodur were fighting against the evil Lord Druksor. But suddently, they wake up in a strange and ominous place... If they want to resume their fight against evil, they must get of here, and quick! But Glark, the leader of the team, may have to take drastic actions to once again see the light of day...

Alternate control between five characters in this puzzle-platformer. Choose wich character to sacrifice to overcome the obstacles in your way!

![Capture d’écran 2018-12-04 à 02.48.32.png](///raw/361/f/z/1df04.png)

**Rules**

In each level, guide the characters towards the exit. Some can die on the way, but as long as the leader (Glark) reaches the exit, you can access the next level. But be careful, if you decide to go to the next level, any character who didn't enter the exit will be left behind.

![Capture d’écran 2018-12-04 à 02.51.20.png](///raw/361/f/z/1df2c.png)

**Controls**

Move - A and D  or  Q and D

Jump - W  or  Z

Step down - S

Change character - SPACE

Enter exit - E

Go to next level - ENTER

Restart level - R

Reset game - T

entries.title: Save da people!
entries.description:
Your objective: Save da people!

This Jam's theme was Sacrifices must be made.

So our initial idea was creating a game where you could only save a certain number of people, but not everyone. That's how a building in flames came to mind. 

The intention was to creat a balance between each kind of person, so e.g. rescuing an elders would take more time but account for more points. Due to time constraints this feature was not so well explored though. Another idea was showing the death toll at the end, together with a list and description of the people you were not able to save, to reinforce the idea of sacrifice. Ideally we wanted to be able to calculate the optimum outcome of rescuing and, if the player achieve this outcome, he would win the game. This was somehow done but not as precise as we would like.

Overall the game still needs a lot of adjustments, but it looks not so bad for a two day challenge!

Link to play:
https://www.lexaloffle.com/bbs/cart_info.php?cid=hoherahofi-0


Preview:
![5.gif](///raw/7f3/02/z/1dee8.gif)

entries.title: Sacrafices_LD43
entries.description:
### A game about sacrificing your Cult members!

#### Find, knockout , and drag your cult members to the alter before the cult leader catches you!

##### Controller supported



### HOW TO PLAY

1. Download the game! : Link provided below

2. Run the game from the windowsnoeditor folder

3. Find cult members

4. Use F key to knockout cult members! (A for controller)

5. Then use E key to drag them to the alter to be sacrificed! (B key for controller)

![1.PNG](///raw/782/91/z/1ec20.png)


##### Once you have sacrificed 5 of your fellow cult members you win!


##### Don't get caught by the red hood/cult leader or its game over

![2.PNG](///raw/782/91/z/1ec2b.png)

The cult leader will stop following you if you break line of sight, or get too far away from him.


### Enjoy playing!

##### There is no win or loose screen, you just get thrown back to the main menu :scream: 


#### Notes!

I did not have as much time as i planned for with this project over the weekend. :sweat_smile: 

Working alone this time as well!

But the game is still somewhat playable. 
I had so much more planned for this project... I may carry on development of the game, not sure yet

entries.title: RastaRush
entries.description:
Protect your beautiful jahpanese fe-maple plants!
A horde of cops wants to take them as evidence, for evident reasons.


But you don't want them to take pleasure in your jahpanese fe-maple. After all, it's yours!
Though you would happily share, the cops always take all they can, leaving nothing to you. 
And a man should reap what he sows, you firmly believe. 

![rasta2.png](///raw/6e6/01/z/1eac4.png)


So, in order to save some of your fe-maple plants, you will have to sacrifice others!
Ignite them with a flamethrower, and use the leafblower to blow the smoke towards the cops. 
For some reason, they will become hungry. Possibly, because the smell reminds them of maple syrup, but we dont't know
for sure- this is a mystery, even to our programmers. It just happens. 

![rasta5.png](///raw/6e6/01/z/1eac5.png)


When a jahpanese fe-maple field is fully grown, time has come for harvesting. You have good uses for the plant,
and also, it sells for some good money. 
But wait! As you have found out, mature plants will make our cops extra super hungry. So you decide: harvest 
quickly for maximum profit, or save some of your ripe plants for bad times. 


No matter how you decide: Don't let those greedy guys reach your house. 
Use time and resources wisely to bring in as much harvest as you can.
Remember: Sacrifices must be made!

PS: Only you can prevent wildfires! 


Music composed by Hong Linh Thai and [Koucha123](https://soundcloud.com/koucha123).

entries.title: Ritual Sacrifice
entries.description:
Hey everyone!! This was my first attempt at a ludum dare and man am I sleepy!

Originally I intended there to be a temple building game that required ritual sacrifice to prevent pestilence and poisoned drinking water but the scope was a little too big and I was unprepared for various bugs and python coding along the way. Still I had fun making it, maybe someone will enjoy what little I got done.![RitualSacrifice.png](///raw/a8c/02/z/1df80.png)

update: I really struggled to publish this game with blenders game publishing addon, people keep getting an empty blender scene instead of the actual scene, i tried testing it on a friends laptop and rebuilt the package but not dice. So here is a video and there is a .blend file on the download link that can be run using the version from upbge.org . Sorry to have inconvienienced everyone, this experience taught me not to trust a publishing toolchain without thoroughly testing it well before any game james.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GnORg_UGgcI

entries.title: Ranch of the Gods
entries.description:
![Screenshot 2018-12-04 at 02.22.11.png](///raw/81c/d1/z/1dd10.png)

### Story
The gods are furious and demand tribute! Appease the gods by sacrificing animals from your ranch! But gods are greedy, and will always want you to bring more offerings to them, will you be able to sustain their demands? Show them your loyalty and earn divine favor!

Don’t you dare disappoint them, their anger is legendary!

### Gameplay

Go to the temples and see what sacrifices the gods desire from lowly peasants. Fulfill your obligations and bring them animals from your ranch.

If a god’s happiness drops too low, they’ll get angry and hinder your progress! However, if you earn enough favor, they’ll bless you with divine boons!

Animals reproduce as long as they have a mate to reproduce with, so make sure not to sacrifice the last two of a kind, or fear the gods’ wrath!

### Controls

- Movement : WASD
- Lift / Drop : E
- Sacrifice animal : E next to an altar (the god need to want the animal)

![Screenshot 2018-12-04 at 02.19.12.png](///raw/81c/d1/z/1dd19.png)

### Changelog
- Fix the double-cow bug

entries.title: ISHI - Eternal Companion
entries.description:
You can also play it on https://maruki.itch.io/ishi

**Update**: I found the issue with the endings in my code and fixed them (I had messed up the conditions)! Let me know if the issues persist.

**Yet another update**: I just fixed the last image that was still a draft (the hand).

**Note**: There is a spirit ending! You have to find out where to click! :D Also, there are two kinda secret endings if you play around with balancing the constitution.

ISHI is a bite-size existential pet simulator. Given its meditative constitution, if you've been struggling with intrusive thoughts or anything depressive recently, I don't recommend playing it.

My intention was to offer some relief for these kinds of feelings and thoughts through the interaction of a "pet" (I guess pretty much everyone will have to deal with them sooner or later), but my writing may not be the best for many people. So be warned.

If you do play ISHI, I hope you can enjoy it with tranquility.
Peace.

entries.title: How much are you willing to sacrifice?
entries.description:
This is John. Being John is hard. John is part of an experiment. He doesn't really enjoy being part of the experiment, but that is what being John is all about. Being willing to sacrifice. John sometimes thinks about spending more time with his family. John doesn't have a family, but he would like to spend time with one. Instead he is spending time on expeiments. It's okay.

John is part of a new experiment. The goal is to examine the importance of audio and visuals in videogames and to see what happens when you remove either or both. As usual, John is willing to sacrifice everything.

Developers note:
This game is really hard. Like really hard.
The game consist of 7 levels. Every time you finish the level, you have to choose between sacrificing part of your vision or hearing. The goal is to win the game while being completely blind and deaf.

The game is made by Anders Poulsen, Jeppe Emil Lindskov, Mads Riddersholm, Mikkel Isak Anttila & Rasmus Thorup.
All code, art, sound, music and other assets are made by us, except for the character controller which is made by Martin Fasterholdt. Thanks for letting us use it Martin.

We hope you enjoy the game and please provide any kind of feedback! Thanks.


![Screenshot_01.jpeg](///raw/8f0/f1/z/1dee2.jpg)![Screenshot_02.jpeg](///raw/8f0/f1/z/1deed.jpg)

entries.title: Soul Eater
entries.description:
![Game2.PNG](///raw/2f0/f1/z/1dec7.png)

**Description**

Sacrifice fragments of your soul for magical power to survive against the vengeful souls that haunt the island.

**Instructions**
- Move with W,A,S,D
- Fire projectiles with left click
- Blink a fixed distance with right click
- Activate a shield with R
- Heal with F

**Information**

I spent a great deal of time learning pixel art and attempting to get better at it, this game definitely helped but I'm far from getting the desired skill level I want with pixel art. However, I still believe I improved nonetheless and am happy with my results. 

The game was made with the Unity game engine using C# scripts for functionality.

entries.title: Fishy Rescue
entries.description:
In year 20XX, the Earth was conquered by alien fish that stole all human weaponry. Most humans are now trapped in their cities protected by force field domes. But many are still in the wild looking for rescue. You must use your zeppelin to rescue as many people as you can and bring them to the cities! But since you don't have many weapons, you may have to use some people as projectile... Good luck!

## Controls
*Those are also explained in-game, so you can ignore this.*

- Move your zeppelin with **WASD or arrow keys**.
- Approach humans to rescue them. The zeppelin becomes heavier with more people aboard.
- Press the **left mouse button** sacrifice a human by throwing them at obstacles/enemies. Aim with the **mouse**.
- You can throw people at cities to get a monetary reward. Cities are also are checkpoints.
- If you're ever stuck, press **R** to restart (from the start or the latest checkpoint).
- Press **Space** to pause the game and buy upgrades (or instant repairs) with your money.

## Screenshots

![Shot1.png](///raw/cbf/91/z/1d62f.png)

![Shot2.png](///raw/cbf/91/z/1d630.png)

## Changelog

**1.0.1 (12/09/2018):**
- Fixed a bug where negative scores wouldn't become high-scores
- Fixed a bug where pausing would freeze the transition screen

**1.0.2 (12/09/2018):**
- Fixed a problem with the water distortion

## Credits

- [UnitySpriteShaders by Todd Rivers](https://github.com/traggett/UnitySpriteShaders).
- Font ["BitPotion" by Joeb Rogers](https://joebrogers.itch.io/bitpotion).
- Sound ["3 Heal Spells" by DoKashiteru](https://opengameart.org/content/3-heal-spells).
- Sounds from [Universal Sound FX](https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/audio/sound-fx/universal-sound-fx-17256).
- Sounds from the [Sonniss.com GDC Game Audio Bundles](https://sonniss.com/gameaudiogdc18/).
- Music from [Ultimate Game Music Collection](https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/audio/music/orchestral/ultimate-game-music-collection-37351).

entries.title: Miserable Morene and the Raiders of the Gold Blum
entries.description:
![mm_ld43_001.jpg](///raw/75c/2/z/1de5c.jpg)![mm_ld43_002.jpg](///raw/75c/2/z/1de61.jpg)![mm_ld43_003.jpg](///raw/75c/2/z/1de63.jpg)

Hello fellow Ludum Dare-ians!

It has been a couple LD-Jams since I took part, or even programmed a game for that matter; never mind having some finished that I could upload at the end of it. For my first time every I partnered with some friends from work to undertake in the Jam side of things instead of the compo; and that was the best choice that I've made.

So we present to you Miserable Morene and the Raiders of the Gold Blum, between balancing working during the jam and watching my kids, me and my colleagues decided to keep it simple, and I think we managed to finish a pretty cohesive little game.

Thank you for checking out our page; I hope you take the time to download the game, try it out, and leave some votes and / or feedback!

Hope you had yourselves great Ludum Dare as well!
- Damon 'Izunah' Verreault

entries.title: NOPE
entries.description:
[![NOPE logo](///raw/2e1/z/1e1b4.png)](https://graal.itch.io/nope)

## Web : https://graal.itch.io/nope (10-20 minutes to play)

This is a game about [NOPE]. You must find the [NOPE] out of [NOPE] and successfully escape from [NOPE]. Your task is to save as many people as possible, and [NOPE] them to the exit alive. 


    NOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOP
    ENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENO
    PENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPEN

**DATA LOG OPEN - - -**

This game is controlled by [NOPE]. Use its left button to select group or individual people, and right button to [NOPE] them to move. Make it to the exit, wait until all survivors are in the green zone and press exit button to end level. All survivors outside the green zone will be [NOPE].
You can press R to restart the current [NOPE]. Game will automatically restart if there are nope survivors left.

[![LD43.gif](///raw/2e1/z/1e8af.gif)](https://graal.itch.io/nope)

Some mechanics are better to figure out yourself, but if you are stuck, refer to the section below

**ADVANCED DATA CLEARANCE PROVIDED - - -**

Approach wall terminals to [NOPE] with them. Security pads must have alive human standing on them to provide clearance. Doors can be [NOPENED] this way and mechanisms enabled.

Noise is the key mechanic in [NOPE]. You will make noise when moving and that will attract some unwanted [NOEP]. Human noises are very attractive to [NOPE], especially loud screams and claps. You can use it arbitrarily to your advantage to lure [NPOE] to other map areas and keep your group safe.
Human noises can be masked somewhat by sources of constant loud humming (such as fan vents or Christopher Walken). 

At the start of the level you will have a chance to rest and take a look over the area. Use it to plan your way through the [NOPE]. Just remember that sometimes individuals must give their [NOPE] to save the rest of the group.

    ENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENO
    PENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPEN
    OPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPENOPE

![screen_01.png](///raw/2e1/z/1e8b1.png)

#### [NOPES]:
- [Phaser JS](https://phaser.io)
- [Audiotool](https://www.audiotool.com)
- [Audacity](https://www.audacityteam.org)
- [ShoeBox](https://renderhjs.net/shoebox/)

entries.title: Switched ON
entries.description:
![Switched ON.png](///raw/218/2/z/1d993.png)
## Overview
SWITCHED ON is a Top-down arcade game. Your mission is to escape the factory, with nothing but your energy to sacrifice your way out. 

## Theme Implementation 

* Sacrifice your energy to power things around you to make your way out.

* Sacrifice your movement for vision and vice-versa 

## Features:-
 
* 2 fully playable levels.
* Featuring abilities.
* Cutscenes and more…

## Developers Note:

We are a team of 3, and this was our first LD together. We worked over discord and did our best to pull off a playable game. As being a jam product, do expect a few bugs or errors. We are aware of certain flaws in the game and are currently working and updating it.  

You are recommended to play the game with music.

Thank you for playing our game, all the best :)

entries.title: An unPharo-seeable Future
entries.description:
Hey all, this is our first gamejam, and first game ever made for some of us.
We unfortunately didn't finish the story or get to implement everything we visioned.
The game may be a bit buggy, and is quite hard. Send a screenshot if you can beat it, because we cant ;)

Game:

Story of a pharaoh who performs a dark ritual, in his death to ascend to godhood.
The player is a young man affected by this ritual, and in his grief makes a pact with the god Osiris who is disgusted by the perversion which gains him access to the otherworld and a tremendous power ( A magic Ankh ). He uses this power to hunt the soul of the pharaoh and banish it before it can achieve godhood.

An egyptian themed dungeon crawler with five descending levels of afterlife that the player goes through fighting spirits.
Can you fight your way through and defeat the Pharaoh!
![darkpower1.PNG](///raw/42c/c/z/1ee56.png)
![ulti.PNG](///raw/42c/c/z/1ee57.png)
![boss.PNG](///raw/42c/c/z/1ee59.png)



How To Play:
![HTP.png](///raw/42c/c/z/1ee5c.png)
Note, the ultimate has a maximum of nine uses per level, if you use all nine you will die. It will also give you a decreased movement speed for a couple of seconds after use (it is not a bug).

Note:
You can skip the introduction by pressing ESCAPE.

entries.title: Monsters & Portals
entries.description:
You have been banished to a world filled with monsters, ruled by a hungry Demon lord. You have to hunt monsters and offer them as sacrifice to the demon to escape the world. Use portals spread throughout the world to offer your sacrifices faster. If things are going tough, consider sacrificing yourself with other monsters! Enjoy!

**Controls**:

 - Left/Right: Movement
 - Up/Z: Jump
 - Down/S: Pick up/Drop items
 - X: Attack
 - C: Dash

**How to Play**:

Kill monsters and take the item they drop and put it on the Altar. Make sure the item stays on the Altar until the Demon Lord consumes it.​ Also, don't stay on the Altar after dropping the item - else the demon might harm you - unless you want to sacrifice yourself! :)

**Tip**:

Instead of taking items back to the altar by yourself, just throw them into portals spread throughout the level. All portals lead to the altar!

![LD43Screenshot.PNG](///raw/dbe/e1/z/1dfd9.png)

![LD43Screenshot2.PNG](///raw/dbe/e1/z/1ec05.png)

entries.title: Blob Time
entries.description:
**Play the game (web) here:** http://ameliawinstead.com/samples/LD43/
![blobTime.jpg](///raw/69d/9/z/1e4b1.jpg)
Ah, the blob life. Sliding around, sliming it up. It's hard to beat being a nice mushy blob. And I'm pretty great at being a big ol' blob, if I do say so myself.

Although, there are times when being a blob can get tricky. It's heartbreaking, having to leave some of my slime behind, when every bit of slime is part of who I am. It's my identity, my true self. And once slime is gone, you can't get it back, it's gone forever. Just like those star-shaped cookies I loaned Jimmy. It's part of how the world works, part of growing up. But it's alright, because sometimes sacrifices must be made to get what you want.

entries.title: GameDev Sacrifices
entries.description:
![header](///raw/f17/1/z/1db7f.png)

## About

So many things to do, so little time...

What are you willing to sacrifice to make a game?

And what will your sacrifices bring you?

![enemy](///raw/f17/1/z/1d641.gif)

## Goal
Defeat four stages of game development disguised as monsters:
1. Education
2. Pre-production
3. Active development
4. Marketing and release

Try your best to stay on target and make a good game, while not forgetting to take care about your physical and mental health. Because remember: *it's not game development that harms you but you yourself*.

![hero](///raw/f17/1/z/1d64e.gif)

## Controls:

```
 - Mouse/touch
 - Buttons on the screen.
 - Click on the actions on the bottom of the screen to sacrifice them and 
   spend freed time on making a game
 - Be careful choosing what you are willing to sacrifice, 
   as with some decisions you wont be able to keep working on your game
```

## Team:

- [@​Xorboo](https://twitter.com/Xorboo) - Kirill Korepanov
- [@​nec_neca](https://twitter.com/nec_neca) - nEc neca
- [@​GerodruS](https://twitter.com/GerodruS) - Viktor Smirnov
- [@​NikolsaNNN](https://twitter.com/NikolsaNNN) - Nikolay Samborsky
- [@​Mazokpixels](https://twitter.com/Mazokpixels) - Evgeniy Yudin

https://youtu.be/TVtXho_rm4U

## Used Engine and tools
* [PixiJS v4](http://www.pixijs.com/)
* [pixi-timer](https://www.npmjs.com/package/pixi-timer)

## Used Software
* VS Code
* Adobe animator 2017
* Flash cs3
* Adobe Photoshop
* Pro Tools 12
* Cubase AI Elemets 9
* Soundly 2.0
* TexturePacker
* Streamlabs OBS

## Notes
* Playtime ~5min
* Only two enemies are implemented (out of 4 planned)
* Game might bug out if you minimize the tab (due to poorly coded animation sequences, sorry :3)
* We are not experienced in JS and have used PixiJS for the first time and this jam was a nice opportunity to try it out. Even though it is not recommended to use unknown tools on the jam, I (_Xorboo_) think that on the contrary - this is the best way to learn something new, even though the game won't be as good as it could be
* GitHub repo needs some cleanup and a readme first

## Post LudumDare update
Post-LD [version](https://gerodrus.github.io/LD43/) (first url) contains some minor bugfixes and a bunch of UI improvements, which should help the player to understand the rules of the game and impact of his decisions on sacrifices.

A 3D interactive fiction - you play Max a 'Fleshslave' who must explore the cyberpunk slums of NarcoTown1 looking for victims for your master Nosferatu! Engage with the residents of the slums as you look for unwilling victims for the walking undead! 

Made with Unreal Engine using original character designs made with Fuse and assets packs Cyberpunk Alley and Soul City.

## 64 Bit  Windows (tested) 32Bit Windows (Untested)

entries.title: Cult Fever
entries.description:
![cover-2.jpg](///raw/0f4/f1/z/1e19c.jpg)
# How to play

Do you have G'roov? Test your skills in this rhythm game and help the cultists transcend their unholy flesh.

**A** for the yellow lane

**S** for the blue lane

**K** for the green lane

**L** for the red lane.

Press Enter (Return on Mac) to pause the game and Shift Enter (Shift Return on Mac) to resume.

![cultfever01.jpg](///raw/0f4/f1/z/1e533.jpg)

## The Ritual

In an insane ritual fest, cultists throw themselves off a cliff for the glory and satisfaction of the ol' mighty G'roov. Through an epic sound, they go out in style doing acrobatic stunts to the rhythm of the maestro's baton.
Cultists will emerge from the left of the screen and will run towards the edge of the cliff in search of glory! If you jump too soon, you'll fall flat on your face and if you jump too late your stunt won't be up lord G'roovs unnatural taste.
## Points

Points are awarded on how close you press the proper keys on each note. Wicked and Great earn you combo points and help maintain your multiplier. On a Louzy jump you'll still be awarded points, but the multiplier meter will reset and you'll make the illustrious G'roov unsatisfied with your efforts.

## Our Team ##

We area small dev team from Brasil and this is our first Ludum Dare participation. The studio where we all work at, Mito Games, has its roots in educational games, so the thrill to participate in an all out challenge with fellow devs from all over the world was too sweet to pass by.

During this period most of us tackled tasks we usually wouldn't need to think about and it has enriched our team with new abilities and refulled our love for creating games.

It has been three nights of little sleep, but it was all worthwhile. We hope you enjoy our rendition on the theme of Ludum Dare 43 "Sacrifices Must Be Made".

entries.title: Gunning out of Energy
entries.description:
![5qTFUg0.png](///raw/870/f1/z/1ea7e.png)

Gunning Out Of Energy is a top-down shooter where you take the role of Rob and make your way trough a deadly factory of violent and bloody robots (well... maybe not so bloody since they're made of steel)

Shoot all the robots you want, but remember, shootin aswell as buying upgrades at the store costs power! Run out of it and you're dead. 

So what will you do? Will you buy that upgrade with your precious energy, or you'll leave it there and play safe? I don't know the answer! And neither do you, so go ahead, play it and figure it out yourself! 

WASD to move
E to interact
Left Click to shoot
R to restart

Some doors don't have buttons! You can just walk and open them. 

Made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 43

Patched on the 4th:
-Fixed UI
-Fixed Drops
-Fixed some health bugs

Coding: Alexander, Vinter                                                                                                  
Art: Ants Aare                                                                                                               
Music and Sound Effects: Vinter                                                                                              
Game Design: Alexander, Ants Aare, Vinter                                                                                    

Made with: Unity3D 
01-04/12/2018

entries.title: Chicken Smash
entries.description:
​Chicken Smash is a smash Bros like type of game, where you have to throw your eggs at your opponent to make him fall into the fog. There, lurks a fox that will not move away unless he eats one of the chicken.  Sacrifices have to be made, and even though you  and your partner are fellow chicken, only one can live.  😱

Sacrifice your eggs and your partner to stay alive ! 

Instructions :
The goal of the game is to push away your opponent into the fog, and not let him come up before the fox eats him.
🔹Reload eggs by running around
🔹Maintaining the Shoot button will make your egg be faster and stronger
🔹Two types of eggs are available, Red eggs are fast and go almost in a straight line, while blue ones are shot in an arc and are slower, but are much stronger.
🔹Double jumping will shoot an egg downwards
🔹Turn away after running a couple meters, to activate a dodge that will protect you from bullets for 1sec.

(Controls and Instructions can also be found in the main menu of the game)
![chickensmash_illu1.jpg](///raw/b2f/z/1dea0.jpg)![chickensmash_illu2.jpg](///raw/b2f/z/1deef.jpg)![chickensmash_illu3.jpg](///raw/b2f/z/1defc.png)

entries.title: Donors
entries.description:
A board game in which the goal is to reach the center with all the vital organs (brain, heart, lungs, kidneys and liver) that you gain on the way through luck and skill.

List of boxes and their actions:Game preparation:
Place the player figures on the game board onto the large rectangular area.

Aim of the game:
The player's goal is to get onto the black field in the middle of the board with all the vital organs. There are five vital organs: brain, heart, lungs, kidney and liver.

Game progress:
Players go one by one and each round the player can choose from two options:
Throw a six-cube dice and move a given number of check boxes in a clockwise direction.
The player can trade three spleens for any vital organ.


Special boxes on the board triggers action.


We want to thank teachers Filip Dufka and Ondra Klus for helping us with rules,game mechanics and a translation

entries.title: Arden's Artisan Artefacts
entries.description:
![title_creepy.jpg](///raw/84/z/1d978.jpg)

![aaa.png](///raw/84/z/1daf9.png)

**Sure, sacrifices must be made… but who has the time to actually *make* them?**

*You're the new owner of "Arden's Artisan Artefacts", which offers a convenient solution: handmade, sustainable sacrifice sculptures for all occasions! Today's modern cultists don't need to produce offerings themselves – they can stop by at Arden's Workshop and pick up a built-to-order sculpture exactly according to their wishes!*

Click on items to pick them up or drop them. Drag or use your scroll wheel to rotate them. You can stick items to the base object on your workbench, and get new items from the clutter box in the bottom right. But make sure to keep an eye on your inventory!

Made with [LÖVE](https://love2d.org). To run the Linux and macOS versions, install LÖVE 11.2.

Thanks to rohieb for beta-testing! The music is “Industrial Ferret” by Kevin MacLeod. The [brick texture](https://www.freepik.com/free-vector/red-brick-wall-background_766985.htm#term=brick&page=1&position=1) and the [wooden texture](https://www.freepik.com/free-photo/wooden-textured-background_2768392.htm#term=wood&page=1&position=4) were created by Freepik.

:camera_with_flash: **The post-jam version contains a sharing feature, which you can use to post screenshots of your creations on the [ArtisanArtefact](https://twitter.com/ArtisanArtefact) Twitter account. That's the only difference. For both the post-jam and the jam versions, feel free to take screenshots of your favorite artefacts and post them in the comments below!**

entries.title: Condom Please
entries.description:
![47386403_535521963582784_1543735851773591552_n.jpg](///raw/691/2/z/1e927.jpg)

## Overview
The story of a low class family that keeps growing. Your childs need to be fed... and the bills to be paid.

You may need to take tough choices and send some of them to work, or not to feed them to keep some of them from dying... Hard sacrifices that need to be made for the good of the familly.

Oh, and the childs could disobey sometimes. Do not hesitate to slap them to remind them who's in charge !

Horrible you say? Real we say...

## Gameplay
### Wallet with a hole
Pay your bills and food.

### House Management
Ask your children to complete some tasks at home and take showers. Keep the room clean to improve their morale.

And do not forget to send them to pee... Or they will decide to somehow fullfill their need.

### Missions
The best way to get money (your low-level wannabe-artist paintings only get you 2$). Classical childhood jobs (prostitution, factories, etc.)

## Controls
WASD Controls,
Left Click for a good slap,
Right Click to interact.

Made by Retmia, Lukuluk, BadPaul34 & Apoal.

## "What would a game jam be without rush and time running out..."
Things we were planning to add into the game, but we did not have time to do these:
- In-game tutorial
- Better endings and game story
- Animated islands
- Better and more user friedly UI ("earning coin" -animations, highlighted bridges, better infoboxes, etc.)
- The game also has some bugs but we did not have time to fix those :)

entries.title: Life Is Hard
entries.description:
Life is hard is a typing game. To start the game type what you see :)
Also important! Some people encounter problems with the browser version. Their input is not received how they expect. The downloadable version doesnt seem to have this problem!

Becoming the best artist is your dream! Its not? Well in this game it is! You will become the best artist no matter the cost!!!

You can: Draw, Eat, Sleep and Train. To do that type the word. 

- When drawing you have to draw what you see. Each correct word makes your combo go higher. The higher your combo the more points you get. And the faster your motivation goes up constantly.
- When eating you have to choose between 2 words. The short word will stay on screen so pick carefully! 
- When sleeping you want to stay asleep, because the longer you sleep the more effectiv it is. But each word you see must be typed correctly and before it vanishes! Otherwise you will wake up
- Training is done in sets. Finishing a set will give you health. But it costs you energy and makes you hungry.

![ice_screenshot_20181204-031109.png](///raw/1b1/d/z/1e1c5.png)

entries.title: Wallace
entries.description:
(I didn't know how to name my game so I just named it Wallace.)


This is a puzzle game about a worm named Wallace who just wants to live through another day and not get inside some mole rat's belly.


To get through the enemy to the next area you have to sacrifice part of your wormish body to distract mole rats blocking the way, fortunately, you don't die from losing a bit of your flesh.


CONTROLS:

WASD and some buttons at the top for restart and some hints.


ENVIRONMENT:

Exit - a hole in the border that you must reach.

Mole rats - enemies that guard exit or pathway, they will chase you after you come close and eat you if you stop.

Worm tunnels - allow you to move from one end to another. If a mole rat catches you while you are inside - you will be split into two parts with the same control. If you become one block, you are killed.

Apples - give you two body segments.

![gif1.gif](///raw/d92/3/z/1e90f.gif)


![gif2.gif](///raw/d92/3/z/1e910.gif)

Never tried turn-basedish puzzle games and the code turned out messy so expect some bugs. 

UPD: After some post-upload testing I've found a bunch of bugs, some are gamebreaking and I don't have much time right now to fix them, so all I can do is advice you not to stress-test it.

entries.title: Back at Valborgne Manor
entries.description:
![MainMenu_Title_Pixel.png](///raw/075/2/z/1cf25.png)

# Scenario :

I am Bernard de Bruay. At my father’s death, I inherited a book filled with strange writings depicting the whole history of my cursed family one year at a time, one sentence per year. But I quickly noticed that while every boy's birth was noted, every girl's one was avoided, replaced by a odd writing “Back at Valborgne”. Studying the clues disseminated in the strange manuscripts, I obtained another book. Dark, filled with strangely tangled writings, the Necrophitescon yield its secrets to me. I learned about spells, invocations, sacrifices and demons.
I directly headed to Saint-André-de-Valborgne to discover mysteries surrounding the Valborgne manor. The village was in mourning, yet another girl went missing. Using my spells, I noticed that the manor was deliberately shutting the water system irrigating the village and reroute the nearby clay quarry. 
I just arrived at Valborgne manor. I need to find out what happened to the missing girls and to know what murky water my family dove into.

Story Telling : https://docs.google.com/document/d/1beDKEdVkc5uVRvBHhNbKnIug4EIUpvSEMHtouF0YOeY


# Description :

Back to Valborgne Mansion is an undercover game where you need to find as many clues as possible and use your skills achieve one's ends
Use your skills sparingly, if you use them too much you will die.

![Img1.png](///raw/075/2/z/1de00.png)
![Img2.png](///raw/075/2/z/1de03.png)
![Img3.png](///raw/075/2/z/1de52.png)


# Staff - La plancha

- Agloo
- Ben Backen
- Greet
- Maximilien
- Raiponz
- Zessirb

# How to play :

WASD : forward - left - right - rear
Left mouse button : Skills 1
Right mouse button : Skill 2
Mouse direction : to aim


# Crédits musics : 

Myuu : soundcloud.com/myuu
- Myuu - Creepy Clown Symphony 
- Myuu - Play with Me 

Tristan Lohengrin : soundcloud.com/tristanlohengrin
- Tristan Lohengrin - Time of solitude 

            
Game created with  147 commit using Collab

# Install instructions
Click to itch.io link,
And Play !

# HOTFIX 1
    -Removed camera shaking due to a bug
    -Fixed some guard rotations
    -Reduced player hitbox
    -Turned guards who were looking at a wall
    -Removed astar path finding debug messages

entries.title: Silvercliff Killings
entries.description:
**Silvercliff Killings** is a **single-player Mafia/Werewolf-like** where you try to figure out the suspects behind a series of killings happening in a middle-of-nowhere town. **Gather clues** from citizens, figure out **who’s telling the truth** and who’s not, and select **who should be sacrificed every night**.  

If you’re right - maybe you’ll live another day. If you’re wrong - you’ll lose townsfolks’ trust. The game ends if you can get rid of all the perpetrators - or if there’s more of them.


![image_0000002.png](///raw/ac4/d/z/1de9c.png)


*“This was supposed to be a beautiful weekend. Beach, drinks and sunbathing all day long. Instead, you’ve been called for yet another job. Small town in the middle of nowhere, mountain roads blocked by snow. And a dead body.*

*“Maybe some time ago this would make you feel something. The town’s nothing special: everybody knows everybody. Nobody is a suspect. Local police can’t do a thing. You’re glad that HQ covers your ass - at least the locals shouldn’t be a problem.”*


![image_0000004.png](///raw/ac4/d/z/1dea6.png)


**Developed for Ludum Dare 43 by:** Luke Spierewka, Kamila Rusiecka, Weronika Grabowska, Maciej Gortat

Fonts: Daniel, GelPen, Cardenio Modern (dafont.com)
Music by Kevin Macleod (incompetech.com)
