entries.title: Winter Is Coming
entries.description:
This game was intended to be a compo entry but it needed more polish.

# The rules are as follow

You has to survive for the longest winter you have never seen.
Each turn is split into "Morning", "Noon" and "Evening":
"Morning" is the upkeep step where you choose between 2 events (mostly with a negative impact).
"Noon" is the throwing dice step that decides the amount of *Dice Points* (*dp*) you have today. *dp* are used by drag'n dropping villagers portraits on your village place of interests.
"Evening" is the application of effect step. Unless specified, all effect triggered during this turn are resolved now. After which your villagers eat some food before going to sleep. If they don't have food, they get hungry and can starve to death.

# Misc

- 0 villager = defeat
- survive 15 days = victory
- Some events are resolve on multiple turns (like "Forest Fire" which repeats 3 times)

# Buildings
- Lake: +1 meal
- Woods: +1 wood
- Mine: +1 stone
- House: +1 dice to throw next turn (_in game, it says "debuff dice maluses" but this was not implemented yet_)
- Watch Tower: +1 defence point (used to save a villager if an event says "-1 villager")

I hope you like the idea. I am currently making the game better with more graphisms, sounds, and most importantly I'm working on balancing gameplay and adding new kinds of effect (other than "add 1 wood" and "loose 1 stone").

Feel free to comment ! Any feedbacks are welcome :)

entries.title: Meta Magic
entries.description:
![Game Jam Title (11).png](///raw/0d5/f1/z/1ef81.png)
Cast spells using mana, but you won't always have enough. You also, have the ability to cast spells using... 
Y O U R S E L F.

Spells:

Fireball (using D key)
Kill enemies, and time it right to kill multiple in one blast. Killing enemies will also grant you mana so that you can continue to cast spells.

Shield (using W key)
This blocks the movement of enemies, giving you the time to escape sticky situations.

Freeze (using R key)
Blast a spike of frost which will freeze all enemies for 3 seconds, allowing you to slow down the mobs of enemies coming your way.

Teleport (using A key)
As in the name, instantly travel to your cursor to avoid attacks, get away from enemies, prepare for the perfect shot, and so on.

Force (using S key)
If you are being surrounded use this ability to blast all enemies around you back, and stun them for a quick second.

If you don't have enough mana to cast a spell however, a variety of effects may occur. Either your speed or vision is sacrificed to cast a spell, but it only gets worse over time and eventually you will begin losing health when you cast spells.

entries.description:

Note that you should play this at a 16:9 aspect ratio (like 1920x1080 or 1280x720), otherwise parts of the screen may become obscured.

[A few issues were fixed after the jam.](https://github.com/Chaosed0/LD43/commit/ea8e828e68ff40a2dad31931f3f8d780c91f2420)

---


## Controls:

 - **Left Click** - Select mech. Only one mech can be selected at a time!
 - **Right Click** - Move
 - **A** - Select Dash Punch
 - **S** - Select Beam (Boa), Use Shield (Wolf)
 - **E** - Select Eat (Husk, can only be used on nearby dead bodies)
 - **Left click** - Use selected ability
 - Units will automatically attack when in range of an enemy.

You must finish off downed enemies (yellow health bar) with a dash punch.

Eat is (unintentionally) difficult to use, your mech must be very close to a dead enemy.

entries.title: I Am Bird
entries.description:
![spr_logo_0.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1db37.png)

**I Am Bird** is a fast-paced top-down shooter game where you play as a flock of seed-shooting birds seeking bloody vengeance upon your enemies, sacrificing them to satiate your hunger for destruction!

Upgrade to better types of birds as you progress through the game; sacrificing members of your own flock (or just flatly letting them die off) will speed this up. You can use tokens found during gameplay to purchase upgrades, boosting each of your run-throughs!


=================


**Types of birds**

![birdGraphics_0.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1ed4b.png)
The Finch: A basic bird with single-seed autofire. This is your first bird!


![birdGraphics_1.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1ed4c.png)
The Nuthatch: A stronger bird with slower fire.


![birdGraphics_2.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1ed4d.png)
The Sparrow: A bird who shoots a spread of seeds!


![birdGraphics_3.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1ed4e.png)
The Woodpecker: A bird who shoots quick volleys of seeds.


![birdGraphics_4.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1ed4f.png)
The Cardinal: The strongest bird, shooting spreads of seeds with power and speed!


=================


**Your enemies**

- Pigeon: A standard enemy bird who shoots straight forward seeds.
- Crow: Comes close and flies away shooting a volley of seeds!
- Flying Squirrel: Shoots exploding acorns!
- Drone: Darts around, shooting volleys of... real bullets?!


=================



![birdGraphics_5.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1ed50.png)

Use the WASD keys to control your flock and the spacebar to shoot. The large bar in the top left corner indicates your hitpoints. The small bar below this is your upgrade bar. Killing enemies increases this bar a little, and the deaths of flock members makes it increase a lot.

Killed enemies have a chance of dropping these items:

- **Token** - Use these at the shop in the main menu to buy upgrades.
- **Health** - These restore 10% of your main bird's hitpoints.
- **New Bird** - This pickup will add a new bird to your flock. Any level bird up to your current level will join your flock and fight alongside you. You can tell if a member of your flock is about to die by it flashing red.

Press escape to pause your game.


=================


**Screenshots**

![ScreenShot1.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1ef3a.png)

![ScreenShot2.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1ef3b.png)

![ScreenShot3.png](///raw/59e/e/z/1ef3c.png)


=================


**Version History**

There were a couple tiny bugs I found during post-submission testing I needed to iron out. Full lists of changes for every version will be posted here.

Version 1.0.0:

- Original, unmodified 72-hour release

Version 1.0.1:

- Fixed an issue where the high score was being reset after every game
- There is now a spawn cap on drones; 4 at Woodpecker level, and 6 at Cardinal level
- Made progression at Sparrow level take a little bit longer
- Made Sparrow sound effects *slightly* less obnoxious
- Drone kills now award more points
- A 1500 point bonus is now awarded when the upgrade bar is filled at Cardinal level

entries.title: Bokeh
entries.description:
Update!!!!!
I have finished this game and posted a Post Jam version. Complete with a full quota of weapons instructions in the practice mode and 1 player mode. Controls have been updated too. Please play and rate the jam version for all of its flaws and if there is enough there to grab your interest please play the finished version. I would love feedback on it. I am very pleased with it. It is as much a musical instrument as it is a shooter. 

To fire requires you to sacrifice hp, it is possible to shoot yourself to death. You can pick some of the hp up again or collect it from your opponent. Don't worry about it too much, if you are close enough to it the hp will find you. All white Bokeh are hp. 

Enjoy 

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WARNING THIS IS THE ONLY PLACE YOU WILL GET INSTRUCTIONS. I ran out of time to get the instructions done.

Untested and incomplete. There is so much still to do but this was the best I could do and I am satisfied I grafted.

![Screenshot (3).png](///raw/68e/c/z/1e9c6.png)

You are going to need a friend. I ran out of time to get the AI working. I got 99 problems but an AI isn't one.

Bokah is a fight to the death made of pure light. Based on my Bokah. (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bokeh) I am incredibly short sighted and the only upside is the pure beauty of lights at night. It is an explosion of colour and pattern. I tried my best to draw it and the game is made entirely of this image. I rekon I got it about 90% accurate. This particular Bokeh is the LED on my power supply which I could study at leasure. Its a pretty vauge thing to try to replicate. I will look at getting variety and movement into a post jam version.

Player 1 controls:
Arrows and "m" to fire

Player 2 controls:
wasd and "r" to fire

![Screenshot (4).png](///raw/68e/c/z/1e9ca.png)

Shoot each other to death

Don't go too far from the Rainbow column centre or you will loose life over time.

Fire to engage your default stance (Your character will turn red)

Once you have your stance equipped, your weapon time line will start to move (Regular Bokeh at the side of screen with a moving white Bokeh). Use the rhythm to fire a weapon. Full and half beats count.

If you miss the beat you will lose 12HP and your stance will turn off. (just the center white Bokeh of your character will be visible).

Change stances by hitting the alternative colours

Each stance has different properties

Every time you fire you sacrifice 12HP

The HP 'powers' your weapon. The HP attached to the projectile drops off at a steady rate. Be quick and you can pick it back up (white Bokeh trails). You can collect your enemies HP too! Any HP still attached acts as a damage multiplier when it hits your opponent and as a bonus you get that HP back.

![Screenshot (5).png](///raw/68e/c/z/1e9c8.png)

Find your rhythm, work out your combinations and annihilate the light. Be careful not to be too trigger happy. Sacrifices will be made.

For all of its faults I am happy with this submission. My first Ludum on a PC, first using a current Unity, first using c#. I got to be creative with Quartz Composer too and look forward to animating an authentic Bokeh or two. I learned a lot and I am definitly much more relaxed about the idea of using c# now as I have been a Unity Script boy up until now.

I had so much I wanted to do but this is as far as I got. Enjoy

Note - Menu screen and audio fixed post jam. 4.12.18

entries.title: Dark Villagers
entries.description:
![page_01.png](///raw/4d3/f/z/1ea49.png)
Welcome to our project page. In this game you are going to run a village, where followers of evil cult live. They are peaceful people, who usually develop their village, pray for dark forces and glorify Satan.

But when peasants attack the village, sectarians have no choise but to offer each other's lives for sacrifice on a sacred altar for summoning the grim hellspawn up for help.

The game's economy offers several main resources: gold (recruit nomads), food (necessary for hiring new sectarians), wood (building material) and bricks (also building material). Dark Church, which is available from the beginning, lets gathering some gold during exact time (you can see income as green numbers from time to time). 

But your main resource is people. Nevertheless, you must sacrifise them to defence of your village. Therefore, you can turn travellers into your faith at village's reception. For this, click on any nomad, then if you have enough resources, it turns in red robe and starts to believe in... whatever...

In the beginning of game session you have 5 sectarians, Dark Church and an altar. Besides, there are building fields on a playing area. By selecting a field you can chose a building, which you want to set up: hut, windmill, sawmill and quarry. Huts generates gold, windmills produce food, sawmills give you wood, quarry generates bricks. If task's icon in building menu is grey, it means you do not have enough resources for building.

After setting up a building you can appoint there up to 5 sectarians. Running processes from inside increases building's effectivity. Sectarians could be forced to go back outside, for this, select a building and click on sectarians' images in a pop-up interface. 

Peasants from a neighbour village will come soon. They will attack sectarians and destroy their houses one by one. Therefore, for defence you must appeal to the altar. You can order sectarians to go there, then you sacrifice their lives. The more blood is spilled, the stronger creature is summoned. Notice, different kinds of demons conquer different kinds of christians with different level of success.

With every wave of attack your enemies have better chances to win: the amount of their warriors increases, also knights and even inquisitors replace peasants.

Here's the game twitter in case of updates — https://twitter.com/DarkVillagers

Here's gameplay video.
https://youtu.be/vGe6gjNfMhI

## The gods are hungry. *Feed them!*

- Sacrifice more items at the altar than your opponent.
- Throw items at your rival if you see no other way.
- After the timer ends the gods will weigh your gifts.
- Beware! The unworthy will pay with his limbs!


Hello everybody. We are Lukas, Fabian and Sebastian combined in a small team of three.
We had great pleasure creating our two player hotseat multiplayer game *Montezuma's Revenge*. Even if none of us got much sleep the past days.
We hope you enjoy!


**Grab a friend and try out yourself. Are you worthy?**


#### Workload

- Lukas (theforceluke): 3D Art, Particle Effects, Shading, Level Design, Level Building, Sound
- Fabian (PowerAnze): Character Design, Character Animationen, Cutscenes, 2D Pixel Art
- Sebastian (BlackLambert): Programming

entries.title: Macrimber Semfice
entries.description:
Macrimber Senfice is a game about sacrifices.

Sometimes in life, you have to be willing to take one for the team, and to give a little part of yourself to go forward.

Well we took this idea.. literally.

In this game, you control a character who can throw parts of himself whenever he wants or feels like it.

This guy can literally throws anything attached to his body... except his belly because that would be cruel, it's so soft!

But be careful, the less Body Parts you have attached to your maginificient belly, the more blood you loose, and even if our hero is incredibly strong, he will eventually run out of blood and die.

Fortunaltely, there are candles here and there to help out hero. They each have their own magical effect, but no spoiler here, you will have to discover them by yourself.

Here are the basic controls : 

- Y, U, I, O, P to throw a BodyPart (Choose wisely!)
- Arrow Keys to move
- Mouse to aim your BodyParts Throws.

Also, we did our best to offer some sounds and music (Hope you will find them entertaining at the very least!)

Any feedback is greatly appreciated !

Have fun :)

Betamorfosis & Vasilievski

entries.title: PeonCraft - Sacrificed
entries.description:
![peoncraft_cover.png](///raw/f1c/e1/z/1d7f3.png)
## Ludum Dare 43 - "Sacrifices must be made" Game Jam entry

In older **strategy games**, basic workers/peons are cheap to spawn... and **early in a match** they are the only method of exploration of the opponent's base. Do you ever wondered **how these scout peons feel**?

Well in this game jam entry you can try!

In the game you are an **insignificant peon**, receiving orders from your lord commander. Your are sent on a **scout mission** and your objective is to investigate the next enemy outpost. **At all cost.**

![ss_3_small.png](///raw/f1c/e1/z/1d850.png)

However watchtowers and barracks are not that easily conquered...

What sacrifice are you willing to make **for the greater good?**

![ss_4b_small.png](///raw/f1c/e1/z/1d853.png)

## How to play
1. Scout enemy territory
2. Find opponent buildings
3. Reach the enemy base
4. Meanwhile be the sacrifice for the greater good

## Important note
When you reach a yet undiscovered **enemy building, it kills you. This is not a bug!** Please imagine that arrows are shot to your avatar. We did not have the time to finish this animation part of the game. :,D

## Controls
- Use mouse to look around
- [W][A][S][D] movement
- Hold [Shift] to run
- [Space] to jump
- [Q] to complain
- [E] to confirm commands

Use headphones for a better experience.

### Have fun! :)

![ss_8_small.png](///raw/f1c/e1/z/1d87b.png)

### Follow us on Twitter:

[Kornel Meszaros](https://twitter.com/kornel_meszaros)

[Tamas Szucs](https://twitter.com/tomfurrier)

entries.title: The Sun Scene
entries.description:
![Capture2.PNG](///raw/83c/z/1f07a.png)

Our Sun is about to go supernova, and it's up to the lost souls of birds to stop it. It will keep expending with time, command the birds to sacrifice themselves and revert the supernova.

*Note: The Sun Scene has been developed not as a game, but as an __interactive experience__. We figured that after all the sacrifice and murder of this LD's theme you would enjoy some chill. This "game" has no goals, no win or lose condition (we wanted to put at least a lose condition but we ran out of time lol), your only interaction is through singing and calling to sacrifice.

Controls:
- Sing: Q, W, E
- Call to sacrifice: SPACE BAR

Singing will rally souls of lost birds, calling them to sacrifice will decrease the sun size. Non of your actions will cause any more consequences than their own sounds and visuals.

Hope you enjoy the experience.  
  
_About the code: Our entry has been coded entirely with React, CSS and HTML5._  
_About the vibes: All audio has been made with a Korg Volca Keys connected to a Zoom MS-70CDR._  
_About the looks: All the images and animations have been done with Adobe Flash for the sprite sheets we used Stitches._

entries.title: Bummed OUT!
entries.description:
## The year is 1997.

## Following World War 3, the inhabitants of America struggled with sickness, death and a smashed economy. 

## Theft, violence and starvation were at an all time high. The rich sought to correct this by barricading themselves in their ivory towers and making it illegal to be poor.

## The prison system collapsed under the weight of so many residents. The violent, the people with no hope, the poor, flooded back onto the streets. The rich called them hobos, because that's what they were. Hobos.

## Nearly starving to death themselves, the ruling class devised a plan.

## Using the top scientists in the country to build the World's largest Meat Grinder, the rich set about rounding up all the hobos to grind up for food. Thinking this would seem barbaric, they decided to turn it into a spectator sport and allow a hobo selected via lottery the opportunity to move up to the ivory towers.

## Armed with a portal gun, the contestant would battle through hordes of hobos, teleporting them over the World's largest Meat Grinder for the entertainment of the masses. If you could live long enough, all of your dreams of not being a hobo would come true. If not, then you were just food.

## Congratulations. 

## You just won the lottery.



### The future is back! I hope you love arcade games about dystopian worlds in the late 90's, because this this what you're getting in my game. Welcome to Bummed OUT! A twin stick shooter where you have to teleport hobos above the World's largest Meat Grinder in order to feed the starving rich folk. Prepare to rethink the concept of "the greater good" and see if you can find the hidden ending. 


![melee.JPG](///raw/a39/e/z/1ef1b.jpg)

### Run from melee hobos! 


![ranged.JPG](///raw/a39/e/z/1ef1d.jpg)

### Avoid Molotov cocktail throwing hobos!


![cart.JPG](///raw/a39/e/z/1ef21.jpg) 

### Dodge hobos with shopping carts carrying bombs! 


## Are your actions just a sacrifice that needs to be made for the greater good? Good Luck out there you hobo!


### WASD to move and hold the arrow keys in the direction you want to shoot. Spacebar is the start button. Enjoy!


### Fixed a bug that caused the game to soft lock when hit by a shopping cart hobo at a certain time.

entries.title: SamuraiDo
entries.description:
Midori was living with his wife in peacefull village in Edo period. However an evil samurai captured Midori's wife and some other vilagers. Armed with his sword he ventures onto quest to regain his lost love. 

There are 3 paths in game total as of this moment. 

The game is short platformer that is tribute to one of my favourite cultures and it's warriors. It is also reminescent of romantic tragedy tropes prevalent in medieval culture of Europe.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Etherium
entries.description:
![Etherium_2018-12-04_03-15-27.png](///raw/aae/1/z/1de2c.png)

![Etherium_2018-12-04_03-15-49.png](///raw/aae/1/z/1de30.png)

![Etherium_2018-12-04_03-16-04.png](///raw/aae/1/z/1de37.png)

![Etherium_2018-12-04_03-21-14.png](///raw/aae/1/z/1de3a.png)

![Etherium_2018-12-04_03-27-01.png](///raw/aae/1/z/1de40.png)

### Genre: 

Arena/Platformer

### Description:

**Professor Bambo**, the great scientist, was able to find the 5th dimension, and to pick out a new type of energy from there - he called it **etherium**. Of course, our hero could not stop himself from studying the unknown. And so, he discovered that etherium could behave like a normal physical object, or like an electricity, in some sort of way, and every device powered with this mysterious energy was working far better than before!

But nothing went unseen for the dimension itself, and it decided to destroy our professor.

In order to banish the intruders, our pacifistic (and weaponless) professor **will have to sacrifice every single ability he manages to duplicate** from them.

You are the one, who's gonna help Bambo destroy waves of etherium-possessed enemies using his new etherium shield technology, and you are the one, who will lead the world to technological progress!

P. S. Funnily enough, the only thing that was in common between Etherium and Super Crate Box originally was the overall sub-genre, but the more we delved into the intricate problems of creating an arena battler within harsh time constraints, the more solutions similar to those from SCB emerged: no time to implement real AI? Let's make those enemies cycle through the level; Want more variety and challenge? Add "berserk" monster versions. Etc. Good thing the main twist of copying single-use abilities of the enemies stayed intact, haha.



### Controls:  

* Left/Right – Moving left/right
* Up or Space – Jumping
* Z – Use shield
* X – Use attacking ability
* Escape – Pausing (in-game)

### Credits - Team **TAG**:

* Tay Elenberg (@tay-elenberg) - Art, Animation 
* Anglain (@anglain) - Game Design, Sound Design 
* Gil4 (@gil4) - Programming, Game Design

entries.title: Cellsouls
entries.description:
# About
Cell souls is a platformer made by one programmer, one artist and one musician. Unfortunately we sort of let the theme slip past us. Oh well, it’s just one voting category right? It was originally going to be a metroidvania game but I’m not sure how much it resembles one. Anyway… hit that download, make sure to read the little note thingy though. When you’ve got your download going feel free to read our personal notes on the game.

# Download
Note: if it crashes, please send me the log file it will give you and what OS you are using. The JAR should work on all platforms (fat chance), you’ll need Java 1.8+ though.
https://drive.google.com/open?id=1oJ2zM7LNES-rUGzX9-07d6JP2adnrf2N 

# Full credits
* Llew Vallis - programming, level design, game design
* Hatokasai - art/animation, game design
* Shota - sound track

# Llew Vallis’s note
This game’s code is about as stable as an upside-down freight train balancing on a unicycle. This is mostly because the game was built on a game engine I wrote from scratch about a year ago. I certainly had to take a hammer to the engine in order coerce it into running the game. My favorite feature of the engine has to be the log file it will send you when it crashes - please send me that log *when* it crashes, by the way. That said, I am fairly happy with what we ended up with programming wise, all things considered. Unfortunately we didn’t incorporate the theme - it sort of just slipped past us which is most certainly going to hurt our ratings.

# Hatokasai’s note
I started this jam on little sleep, and I ended the jam with even less. The animations in the game weren’t finished, which you can blame on my lack of experience. The weeks leading up to the jam included trying to clabber a team together, and working on some base sprites so the jam would be easier to complete (Which didn’t help as much as I thought, seeing that I didn’t complete all the animations.) We ended up with a programmer, a musician and a system admin, as well as me doing the art for the project.

I really hope that you enjoy the game! 
The sacrifice is your time playing this game ;)

entries.title: Trojka
entries.description:
![test_render.jpg](///raw/d3d/1/z/1f92a.jpg)
On the way to Omsk there are many dangers: bumpy road, wolves and low-hanging branches.

Repair your trojka by dragging a person onto the damaged part, then press the indicated button repeatedly to repair.
Multiple persons can repair at once to increase repairspeed.

If the wolves get too close to the trojka, sacrifice a person by dragging up and away from the trojka.  
Can you get to Omsk in time? 

Press Enter to start the game from the main screen!

entries.title: Golden ticket to heaven
entries.description:
![Snímek obrazovky (6).png](///raw/37d/21/z/1f794.png)
# Game description
Beautiful and relaxing game, that is Golden ticket to heaven. You play as innocent red air balloon. You're flying throught the city a just picking up different valuable items. But you shloudn't get too greedy, because otherwise you have to sacrifise your fortune to stay alive.
___
# Gameplay
So game is basicaly about avoiding obstacles and picking up shinny items like gold and money. But the balloon will get heavy after while so sometimes you need to throw your thing away. Only thing you have to do is actually get to the end of level, but with some extensions the colleting could be really important feature.

## Gameplay features
- "jumping"
- collecting items
- gaining weight
- dropping items

## Controls
- Space: jump
- R: restart level
- click on item in inventory: drop item
___
# Development
In a fact this isn't game what I originaly worked on for this LD. But I just couldn't make it work and I realise it quite late. So this game was real challenge for me as I had only about half a day for the whole game.

The idea came instantly so I really didn't struggle with this thing. As an art style I use my favourite "I don't have any god damn time for graphics - art" and actually I quite like it. I even diceded to make my own sound track and sounds so that was quite fun too. And then programming was pretty easy in comparison with previous project.
___
# Final words
Game is still more demo for concept, because I really didn't have so much time. But overall I can say that I'm happy with the result in comparison with my two previos LD games.
___

![Snímek obrazovky (7).png](///raw/37d/21/z/1f795.png)

![Snímek obrazovky (9).png](///raw/37d/21/z/1f796.png)

entries.title: Our Shared Agony
entries.description:
Our Shared Agony is the first game jam for us, the SUNY Canton Game Design Club. While the project didn't pan out to be the epic dungeon crawler we aspired to create in such short time. A lot of work, mild frustration (not really mild lul); and a lot of experience.

entries.title: Creatures of the Night
entries.description:
The holy knights are attacking! Your only chance against them as the local necromancer is to raise an unholy army from the dead... healthy villagers seem to be out and about... hopefully they don't mind a few sacrifices...

### Controls
- Left and right arrow keys to move
- Z to attack (only effects villagers)
- X to send a skeleton to attack

### How To Play
- You are the necromancer on the left side of the screen
- Villagers (orange shirt sprites) and holy knights will spawn randomly on the right side of the screen
- Use the "Z" key to deploy a dark necromancer close-range attack which will turn villagers into undead skeletons (knights will not be affected)
- Skeletons will follow you around
- Use the "X" key to send out any skeletons you have following you
- Skeletons will kill any holy knights they run into
- Holy knights attack using holy blasts, dodge those, they will kill skeletons too
- Don't worry if you run into a knight, they can only harm you with holy blasts

![creatures.PNG](///raw/5e6/f/z/1ddd7.png)

### Credits
- @gizmolo: everything

This game was built entirely with [TypeScript](https://www.typescriptlang.org/). I used a custom game framework I wrote in the language you can find here [GitHub](https://github.com/jjwall/boardhouseTS). [PixiJS](http://www.pixijs.com/) is used for the rendering layer and [Aseprite](https://www.aseprite.org/) was used to create all the assets.

entries.title: Until there were none
entries.description:
_"You know, those wild mages... they are often more dangerous to their close ones rather than their enemies. But we don't have much choice now, do we?"_ 

![Until_01.png](///raw/1b5/2/z/1de20.png)

**Story:** Greetings, Sorcerer! Our village has once again come under attack from the terrible barbarians and their even-more-terrible monsters. This time they have gotten past our defenses and are heading to destroy our houses. You are our only hope.

But unfortunately, your powers are a bit... wild. If used too much you yourself could go crazy and destroy some houses. So be careful. Because a moment might strike where you'll have to sacrifice some people to save others...

***

> * Survive the enemy's relentless assault!  
> * Upgrade your spells and unlock new effects! 
> * Keep your power in check lest it consumes you!
> * Protect your village... as long as it stands.
> * **[Download for Windows](https://rubr.itch.io/until-there-were-none)**

***

**Controls:** [A] and [D] to move, [SPACE] to jump (you can also double jump), [LEFT CLICK] to shoot, [RIGHT CLICK] and [S] to use spells. Each spell rises you **wildness** meter: try to keep it low unless you want to destroy a house with your own hands!

You are not in danger, but the villagers are. Be brave! Survive through **9 waves of enemies**, unlocking extra spells and upgrades as you go, and keep as many houses intact as possible!

***

![Until_02.png](///raw/1b5/2/z/1dd49.png)

Code, gamedesign: rubr. Art: [Shess](https://twitter.com/yenneash). Music: [Theodote](https://twitter.com/bogdanr5000).

entries.title: Threadpoint
entries.description:
UPDATE!!!
An exploit was discovered shortly before submission. I submitted V2, which fixes this exploit. The two versions are otherwise identical.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------​

Threadpoint - The fastest game ever made (to our knowledge)

Trailer: https://youtu.be/OM1dOyHZ-uM

You are nothing but a sacrificial lamb, sent to the slaughter by the E V I L aliens...

- Race though alien tunnels at breakneck speed
- Sacrifice integral Attachments to survive by squeezing your ship through Threadpoints
- Avoid the delicate humans trapped in highly advanced pickle jars
- Hitting the Human Obstacles will dismantle an attachment of your craft, or worse, kill you!
- Reach 100,000 score and unlock random mode!
- Keyboard supported
- Controller (Xbox or PS4) supported

How far will you get?
How long will you survive?
You will go up in flames eventually. We guarantee you that. (That, or you will have a seizure...)

Attachments and effects (stackable):
- Wing (+25% threading ability)
- Engine (+25% maneuverability)
- EMP (+25% EMP recharge rate)
- Generator (+25% Shield recharge rate)
- Radar (Enables pre-emptive awareness of Threadpoint spokes)

entries.title: Diminution
entries.description:
This is a small prototype done over Ludum Dare 43 weekend.

You are trying to get data through a computer. You must conserve your resources while you try to get to the portal on each level. Try to get as much data through as possible.

Passing over a colored tile will deplete that corresponding resource. If you pass over a purple tile, both resources will be depleted. Data is consumed with each movement as well.

The game ends when you lose all of one resource (blue and red bars), or all of your data (green bar), or reach the final data portal.

Careful though, the board updates with each move! The logic for the board updates follows Conway's Game of Life. You can interact with the Game of Life simulation by either left or right clicking to place a blue or red tile on the board respectively. One tile placement can have a huge impact on the board.

There is no end screen so hitting Esc closes the game.



Controls:

WASD or Arrow Keys to move

Left Click: Place a Blue Tile
Right Click: Place a Red Tile
Esc to close

![Diminution0.png](///raw/b9e/e1/z/1ddc3.png)
![Diminution1.png](///raw/b9e/e1/z/1ddcb.png)
![Diminution2.png](///raw/b9e/e1/z/1ddd3.png)

entries.title: A Town of Questionable Morals
entries.description:
A Town of Questionable Morals by Casey Hardman
---

![ld43_screenshot_4.png](///raw/c9a/e1/z/1ee23.png)


**Gameplay footage:**


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JBg8BpZT-5Y


**MOVEMENT**

**A and D** or **left and right arrow keys** to move.

**Space to jump.**  Hold the key while going up to get a little higher; tap it for a short hop.

**K or C** to perform a dash in the direction you're moving (you can dash up, left, right, down, diagonally - just hold the corresponding WASD or arrow keys!)

**MAKE BABIES**

Stand near the door of a house with a lady outside it and press S or the down arrow key to enter.  You will call the lady in with you and make sweet love to her.  You'll exit the house first, and she will emerge shortly after with a baby in-hand (you have incredibly potent sperm).

**Press J or X** when standing near a lady with a baby to take the baby.  Press J or X again with a baby in-hand to fling the baby.

**SAC BABIES**

Fling babies into the beams of light over any 3 altars in the village to sacrifice them.

The bar on the bottom of the screen runs out over time, and refills whenever you sac a baby.  If it runs out completely, your god will smite you for insufficient sacrifices.  Nail ladies faster!

**SPECTERS**

However, *the babies are vengeful*.  The more babies you sacrifice, the more they haunt you.  **Specters of sac'd babies will begin to show up** and throw magic at you, and **it only gets worse the more babies you sac.**

You get 5 health.  Whenever you take damage or leave a house, you get a second of invulnerability to recover.

**OBJECTIVE**

Try to sac as many babies as you can before dying, whether by specters or judgment from on high!


![ld43_screenshot_1.png](///raw/c9a/e1/z/1ee24.png)

![ld43_screenshot_2.png](///raw/c9a/e1/z/1ee25.png)

![ld43_screenshot_3.png](///raw/c9a/e1/z/1ee26.png)

---

**Tips:**

- Dashing (K or C) is super useful and has a very low cooldown.  Use it!

- You can dash in any direction, even straight up when you're on the ground, or straight down when midair.

- Ducking into a house is a good way to protect yourself in a hitch.

- Ladies can't smash with a baby in their arms.  Try to clear babies out of their arms quickly.  There's always an altar nearby!

- Likewise, you can't smash with a baby in your arms.  Don't be afraid to ditch a baby if you need some quick cover, even if you aren't near an altar (it's okay if they hit the ground, just pick them back up later).

- Judgment comes sooner and sooner as you sac babies.

- Move around the whole village; spread the love.  Falling fireballs can be a real problem if you stick in one place too long.


My current high score is 42 babies.  Post yours in the comments!


Enjoy!


---

*Created with Unity3D, Paint.NET for art, and Bfxr for sound effects.*

---

EDIT: Mac and Linux builds should be available now.  All platforms are the same link; use the button that looks like 3 dots by the "Download" button to change platform if necessary.

entries.title: Robo Dungeon
entries.description:
You're trapped in a mechanical dungeon. Your fuel is low, but manageable. You have boosters. And you can move. All you have to do is find your way out. Every jump will cost you energy, but you are not deterred. Everything seems great until you reach the door. Unfortunately, the only way out of this dungeon to pass through the gates. But each gate has a toll: one, new, fully working, robotic, body part. Every part you lose has consequences. But you're a tough bot. You'll make it out with at least one part, right?

This is our first Ludum Dare and so we are very happy that we managed to complete something in the time limit.

* It was created in Unity
* Art was made in Paint.net and Krita
* Sound effects were made in BMXR (a branch of the well known SFXR)
* Music was made in FL Studio

entries.title: EVIL Ship
entries.description:
**The Game**

In this game a boat must be operated. Your ship consists of several blocks in which you can build freely. Each block is responsible for the production of a certain resource. You must give human  sacrifices to maintain the production. 

During your journey evil gods make your business worse, appearing in divine interferences. During the interferences, gods may require some raw materials from you. 

Your goal is to maintain the balance within the ship and reach the finish line.

You can download the game from here: https://ikturi.itch.io/evil-ship


**About the gameplay**

Five blocks can be built in the game, each block produces a different type of resource. To operate a room you need to sacrifice people, the Room block is an exception to this rule. Sacrifice fills resource production to 100% within the block. A status bar shows in the blocks how productive the current block is. Every second, the productivity of the block is reduced, so it has to be filled with people. Various events occur during the game, resulting in increased consumption of certain resource. The upper panel shows the status of consumption/production. The indicator turns to red if the consumption of certain resource more than the production. 
The exclamation mark shows that the consumption of raw resource a particular block is more than your production.
At this point, you need to build additional blocks or fill the existing ones with people to have the right production.


https://youtu.be/TD9z5l8r6cY

entries.title: Bob the Reaper
entries.description:
Bob was an ordinary Zorg farmer until the great god Retskirt came along and cursed him for no reason! Bob must become the new Grim Reaper, an all powerful being of death made to forever feed Retskirt his Zorg meals. Unfortunately for Bob, being a Reaper is not easy. Due to a lack of endurance, transforming into a Reaper saps his precious lifeblood. Fortunately for Bob,  Grim Reapers can kill animals for health.

Unfortunately for Bob, the only animals around are his precious Zorgs. which are already in short demand because of Retskirt's dietary needs. So you must join Bob and his trusty grappling hook on a mission to feed the biggest head in the universe his daily meals!

entries.title: loaned tut glasses tut wife
entries.description:
![cover_image.PNG](///raw/459/1/z/1dd88.png)

Anyhoo.. The wife misplaced her glasses, right? The dread of missing her beloved carol singing washed over her. She was hysterical! So I says: Enough! We 'ave near-enough the same prescription woman! Take my glasses 'ere. And, be on yah way! I was glad to see the back of 'er, But stuck for what to do, I can see bugger-all without my glasses! We are both big readers, me and the wifey. And at least she 'adn't taken the reading glasses an 'all. So. I ran a 'ot bath. And I read me 'arry potter a while. Hey now, Quit your whining. You asked me for the story, and I'm tellin' it!

So. I wake up hours later, to the sound of amarillo from me phone, the wife on the line. Singin' their carols at me over the phone they were! Bahh 'umbug I said! She forgot 'er house keys - she slept on em, she said - so she went round her fellow carol singer Barbera`s 'ouse and they 'ad been watching the 'allmark channel til the AM. She wants me to pick 'er up. The lights were out and all, so I forgot all about - that I didn't 'ave me glasses - so I say "Sure!", and I 'ang it up sharpish.

Now Im wonderin 'ow am I gunna drive if I don't 'ave me glasses. and the chill in the air. Like Jack Frost was just round the corner. And dont ask me why but the windows are all wide open! 

Then I see in the night a silhouette of my beloved wife, waving and yelling something about the phone call wasn't 'er and she didn't go round Barbera's and they 'adnt watched 'allmark and It was all a pack of lies!

I got me nightgown on, as the chills were downright shockin'! But, when I look back down out the window, the wife wos nowhere to be seen! I swear there was something odd about that night, like a dream or one o' them 'allucinations that scrooge 'ad that night before christmas.

And here I am, wondering, did you read this text up to now? Were you expecting something else like some simple instructions like WASD and mouse to look, click to pull doors, and E to switch lights, and F to take and use keys? Well I'm not letting you off so easy this time! If you cant sit down and read my short story for 2 minutes, You don't DESERVE this game!

Okay okay, I was only messing around! Having a little fun. And, anyway, I *DID* just give you the controls. *AND* basically all the objectives in this game.

SO.

Its up to you now.

-----

shrapx aka [shrapx](www.twitter.com/shrapxx), [shrapx](www.twitch.tv/shrapx): Art, Sound, Coding and the writing here.
>1st 3D Game! 1st Unity Game! 1st Team Collab!

Chris aka [basiclaser](www.​twitter.com/basiclaser​), [basiclaser](https://basiclaser.itch.io/), [stockdronefootage](www.twitch.tv/stockdronefootage), [system-art.io](www.system-art.io): Ideas and Coding.

entries.title: Pyrrhus
entries.description:
To find your lost son you will have to make sacrifices. But at what cost ? 


![Pyrrhus_LD43_1.jpg](///raw/205/e1/z/1db9c.jpg)


Hey everyone ! 

First participation for some of us and it was fun. We are a small group, a [sound designer](https://ldjam.com/users/jeunegen), a programmer and a game designer, working together and for the first time on Unity. 

We choose the easy way with the graphics because none of us are very good at drawing. So we Opt-outs in Graphics. 


##The Game:

You can get power, bonus and weapon but you will sacrifice your speed, your jump, you hit points or your vision. 

There is 4 power up you can get. 

- Speed but you have to sacrifice some of your jump height. 
- Vision but you have to sacrifice the colors and the light (in game).
- Melee Attack but you have to sacrifice Hitpoints.
- Ranged Attack but you have to sacrifice some of your speed.




##Controls:

WASD to Move 
Space to Jump
Mouse Button 1 & 2 to Attack







![Pyrrhus_LD43_2.jpg](///raw/205/e1/z/1dc13.jpg)

![Pyrrhus_LD43_5.jpg](///raw/205/e1/z/1db8b.jpg)

Thank you for your interest !

entries.title: LD43 Journey
entries.description:
**Here is our first game for our first Ludum Dare :)**

**LD-43 Journey**

*After an emergency landing on an asteroid in the heart of a radioactive space storm, you have repair your ship (the LD-43, colonial transport), and run away from this disaster to complete your mission : deliver colons in cryostasis.*

*But beware ! **You don't have much oxygen** and the **asteroid integrity is week**. You need **crystals**, that could be find inside of this big rock, to **repair your ship**. But digging into may speed-up the asteroid degradation.*

*You can sacrifice members of your crew to keep more oxygen. Upgrade your, only, space suite and try to repair your ship to take your chance on running away through the storm.*

*The more your ship is repaired, the more chances you have to get away from the storm !*

**Controls : **

- **"Space"** to use your rocket to move.
- **"E"** to enter the ship when close to the top door
- **"Escape"** to bring the pause menu and get back to main menu if you're lost in space :p

**A sacrifice must be made :**
The game is build on 3 axes : 
- You will need better tools, but for that you'll have to sacrifice your sight (big equippement hiding part of your eyesight)
![game2.PNG](///raw/415/d1/z/1f098.png)
- You need crystals that are part of the asteroid integrity and the asteroid is protecting you from the storm. So you sacrifice your shelter to get mor crystals
![game1.PNG](///raw/415/d1/z/1f099.png)
- You have few oxygen, you may have to sacrifice one of your team member to breath longer
![Capture.PNG](///raw/415/d1/z/1dbde.png)


**Other secondary axes : **
Crew members have two habilities; one outside of the ship, one when they're left in the ship, but not both. So you'll have to sacrifice habilities dépending on the situation, as each member is usefull in special cases.

Will you survive ?
![fin.png](///raw/415/d1/z/1f09b.png) 

**Update 05/12/2018 :**
- Few minor fixes
- Few balancing

**Good luck !**

Team : @wegpast, @arktas, @lut1n

Music : https://soundcloud.com/eric-skiff

entries.title: Lintalho
entries.description:
A survival local co-op game.

![New Project (7).png](///raw/8f8/8/z/1dd5d.png)

Trapped in this cold cave of despair and isolation, you absolutely must escape. For should you fail, the behemoth that patiently awaits you will drag your soul into the depths of despair for all eternity!

Grace to the gods, for you feel like you can jump really high, maybe even twice… Can you utilise your deductive reasoning and acrobatic prowess to escape from death itself?

Sacrifice everything for freedom, or die trying.

_**Your choice.**_

# Controls
![Instructions.png](///raw/8f8/8/z/1d8d9.png)

# Tips
- Hold the jump button to jump higher
- You can **double jump**
- Click on your skills to sacrifice them
- The game might be _impossible_ to finish without certain skills!

### Developer comments
- The game have so much potential. However, time constraint doesn't allow for better puzzles. _-Vija02_
- Sacrifice what? _-Meng_
- We sacrifice our life for you _-Zxinferno_
- Wheres japanese shaman girl _-soundpulse_

**Good luck, have fun!**

entries.title: CyberMayan
entries.description:
___
**TAB** key to access **inventory**.

**Click** to **interact**.

**Space** key to **pause** game.
___

>“Life slashes its way between the streets full of trash, drugs and prostitution in Uman (Neomexico). Under the bright neons, cybermaya bands like yours defend their culture and keep their enemies at bay thanks to a mixture of strategic intelligence, physical strength and technology management. However, the decimated forces of your clan succumb to the attacks of the Horizon corporation, which pretends to take over your neighborhoods and enslave your people to work in their offices. Only you, as part of a new generation of Warriors, can stand up to Horizon’s aggression.”


>“According to the rite, your initiation requires overcoming ten trials in the Temple of Chac Bolay. As soon as you cross the threshold, you discover a dark and oppressive environment in which the natural laws of life and death are suspended, and only governs the will of this living God of the underworld. Chac Bolay values ​​the SACRIFICE, and will honor with reincarnation anyone who loses all trace of life or sanity in their training. The belongings of the applicant will also be respected if he advances until the test room in which he was defeated. The entrance door disappears behind you. Now the only possible way out is upfront.”
___


|    Music 	    |   3D Design	    |  Programming 	|
|:--:	        |:---:	            |:---:	        |
|[Barri Kl0z](https://ldjam.com/users/kl0z)	    |   [Dany Sánchez](https://ldjam.com/users/danyvk)    |   [Canijo](https://ldjam.com/users/canijo)	    |
|[Lucas Le Slo](https://ldjam.com/users/le-slo)	|   	            |   [Ángel Lareo](https://ldjam.com/users/alareo)	|

___

## **Post Ludum Fixes**

Monday responsabilities + final sprint led to practically untested build, some basic fixes needed to be made!
( We *recommend* use post-ludum build, fixes were fast, but we just didnt have the time! )

- Black screen could be seen-through in borders ( *ups..* )
- Trap<->Sound logic a bit fucked up ( *I swear that*  "```else```" *was in place!* )
- Death sounds are now played when they should
- Some lighting bugs that fixed re-opening the editor (that was opened for 2 days in a row... ^^)
- Stil are some major lighting differences between editor & build, will we ever find out why?

Our major problem is still player health / sanity feedback ( we think ), too much things we wanted to try but didnt know how to do ( *so many things we learned in the process* :smile: )

entries.title: A Way Home
entries.description:
![LD43Logo.png](///raw/477/2/z/1ddcc.png)

Pilot your fleet home through the system without taking heavy loses from asteroids. Sacrifice ships by leaving them behind. They avoid getting killed but they'll never make it home. 

- WASD / Arrow to Rotate fleet
- Click to remove fleet section
- Drag to adjust view!

It's risk/reward gameplay. Can you rotate your ships such that the asteroids go through the gaps (and score lots of points in the process) or do you take the hit and dismiss ships immediately but reducing scoring potential in future rounds?

Made (almost) solo during the evenings. Art assets from a friend. Music from a previous release.

![FleetWarpSm.gif](///raw/477/2/z/1e375.gif)

entries.title: MARATAKA
entries.description:
# Description

![ps1.png](///raw/70e/2/z/1ee98.png)

You lived a happy life on an island in the middle of an ocean, but one day everything has changed. One of the eldest gods MARATAKA woke up after thousands of years and what he saw, was the village of godless people. You are the only one that can stop the God from wiping whole life from entire island. It won't be easy, but you already know that to survive, sacrifices must be made!


There are 5 possible endings of the game. Unfortunatly we didn't mannage to add cutscenes for them 😢 
Share the ones that you've discovered in comments. Good luck! 😃

entries.title: Plushie Piler

entries.title: Minotaur Mania
entries.description:
![minotaurmania.png](///raw/9cc/b/z/1dd58.png)

### Minotaur Mania!

Bastard of man and bull, you’ve been exiled to a remote labyrinth in Crete. 
A freak, a menace, an outcast. 

Your appearance may seem bestial, but your heart 

...is human.

The Gods have shown mercy, giving you the chance to reclaim your humanity by consuming the sacrifices and heroes tossed before you. 

But even more, the chance to reign over the very people that made you an outcast...

### How To Play

*Keys*

* Arrow keys - Move yourself toward those sacrificed to your labyrinth.
* Z - Swing your giant frickin' axe at 'em.

NOTE: A and B are Z and X on the keyboard!

*Goal*

* Consume all the sacrifices sent into your labyrinth before they escape!

## Credits:

*Mustache aka Yung Crisis aka Bazooka Jo* - Mustache possession, sacrifice generation code

entries.title: Game Poker
entries.description:
It's a game jam entry about creating a game jam entry! How meta can it gets?!

Time is limited! How can you create an awesome game? Well, some part has gotta go, right? 

Drag what you want to do next upwards. Use your time wisely.

entries.title: Small God
entries.description:
Made using Compo rules, I need the extra time so it is entered into the Jam.
![Picture2.png](///raw/531/z/1d4cb.png)

As a small god out in the desert, you must use your limited power to make the people believe in you. When they do, they will start to worship you, and make sacrifices in your honor. 

It can be best to let a number of people build up before starting to use powers, to make them more worth the cost of using the power. Also the belief map mode is the main one you will want to use.

There isn't really any goal, other than to try and get the largest number of followers you can. Interesting to see how many followers people can get, I havn't properly been able to test the game for a long time.

Controls:
- 1/2/3/4/5 -> select power
- q -> Show the normal map mode
- w -> Show the wealth map mode, red mean poor, green mean rich
- e -> Show the belief map mode, yellow means non believer, blue means believer
- '-' -> Decrease time warp speed
- '+' -> Increase time warp speed
- Space -> Set time warp to the slowest speed
- a/d or left/right arrow -> Move camera
- Right click -> cancel current god power
- Hold middle mouse button -> move camera
- Left click -> Use god power

Powers:
- Smite -> Kill a single person, 
![Picture3.png](///raw/531/z/1d4fa.png)
- Bless -> Provide a blessing to some people, they will much more strongly believe in you after
![Picture4.png](///raw/531/z/1d4fb.png)
- Gift -> Give wealth to a single person
![Picture5.png](///raw/531/z/1d4fe.png)
- Fireball -> Kill a number of people in an area, anyone who sees will be truly fearful of you
![Picture6.png](///raw/531/z/1d500.png)
- Earthquake - > Destroy the buildings in the area
![Picture7.png](///raw/531/z/1d501.png)

Buildings:
- Shack -> Lets a small number of poor people live there
![Picture8.png](///raw/531/z/1d55b.png)
- House -> Lets a number of slightly wealthy people live there
![Picture12.png](///raw/531/z/1d55d.png)
- Ritual Circle -> lets poor people make sacrifices
![Picture9.png](///raw/531/z/1d55e.png)
- Temple -> lets slightly wealth people make sacrifices
![Picture11.png](///raw/531/z/1d55f.png)
- Small Pyramid -> lets rich people make sacrifices
![Picture10.png](///raw/531/z/1d561.png)
- Large Pyramid -> lets very rich people make sacrifices
![Picture13.png](///raw/531/z/1d562.png)

![Picture1.png](///raw/531/z/1d1a9.png)

Made using:
- Unity 2018.2.1f1
- Visual Studio
- Photoshop
- BeepBox

# Story
```
::: TRANSMISSION BEGINS :::
Those careless scientists have caused us problems once again!
The lab is now a dangerous ruin but we're paying you good money to clean it up but you best hurry up!
The higher ups are considering the nuclear option.
Destroy the sources of these monsters then get home and get paid.
...
By the way we have taken the liberty of fitting you with some experimental mods

When activated they should greatly enhance your abilities. 
We don't want to waste a chance to collect some good field data,

Good luck.
```

entries.title: Oh my Cultist
entries.description:
![4.png](///raw/b9d/1/z/1e042.png)

![1.png](///raw/b9d/1/z/1e07b.png)

HOW TO PLAY

Each turn you'll be presented with 3 cards.

Each card has a STRENGTH that determines how much BLOOD you gain if you sacrifice (slide to the dagger).

The strength also determines how much BLOOD it costs to SUMMON the card (slide to the arcane symbol)

The objective of the game is to have as much MAGIC POINTS as possible when the deck is over.

MAGIC POINTS:

Each card is worth MAGIC POINTS equal to it's strength when you summon it.

Each different TYPE of card is worth 1 point after the first type.

Each different CARD NAME of the same TYPE is worth 1 point after the first one.

![2.png](///raw/b9d/1/z/1e0ba.png)

![3.png](///raw/b9d/1/z/1e0d5.png)

Credits for songs:
"Spellbound" and "Waltz of Treachery" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

entries.title: SYNTHRAY
entries.description:
![title bannerdf.gif](///raw/deb/a/z/1cbbf.gif)

Play the game in HTML5 here: [itch.io](https://esbenkc.itch.io/synthray).
### DISCLAIMER
There is a known bug where enemy spawn rate persists between sessions. This is of course not a real bug but just a feature of meta progression!
## SYNTHRAY
SYNTHRAY is an arcade game with a retro aesthetic where you create your RAYTAR weapon before you engage in the onslaught of enemies. When creating your beam gun, you choose modifications that enhance an offensive ability while sacrificing a defensive ability.
## Instructions
Before starting each arcade _synthrun_, you add modules to your _RAYTAR_ beam gun. Here, the possible module additions display their effect on your stats in the _synthrun_ with a tooltip when the mouse is hovering upon them.
Inside the game, you utilize the beam gun through the following controls:
- Point in the direction you want to shoot with the mouse
- Shoot with the left mouse button
- Run with WASD and arrow buttons

![ezgif.com-optimize (2).gif](///raw/deb/a/z/1dc12.gif)

## Credits
The game is developed by [@bo_nyby](https://twitter.com/bo_nyby) and [@esbenkc](https://twitter.com/esbenkc).
- [FunkyHippo on itch.io](https://funkyhippo.itch.io)
- [EsbenKC on itch.io](https://esbenkc.itch.io)
- Music is [Street Dancing](http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Timecrawler_82/Osaka_Lights/Street_Dancing) from the album [Osaka Nights](https://freemusicarchive.org/music/Timecrawler_82/Osaka_Lights/) by [TimeCrawler82](https://timecrawler82.wixsite.com/home).

## How to play
The game runs in HTML5 on [itch.io](https://esbenkc.itch.io/synthray).
# Thanks for playing!
![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/deb/a/z/1dbfe.gif)

entries.title: Cessabit
entries.description:
**_INSTRUCTIONS INSIDE_**

![Overview.png](///raw/d77/21/z/1ea74.png)

*“If you’re going to try, go all the way. Otherwise, don’t even start. This could mean losing girlfriends, wives, relatives and maybe even your mind. It could mean not eating for three or four days. It could mean freezing on a park bench. It could mean jail. It could mean derision. It could mean mockery–isolation. Isolation is the gift. All the others are a test of your endurance, of how much you really want to do it. And, you’ll do it, despite rejection and the worst odds. And it will be better than anything else you can imagine. If you’re going to try, go all the way. There is no other feeling like that. You will be alone with the gods, and the nights will flame with fire. You will ride life straight to perfect laughter. It’s the only good fight there is.”*

**_― Charles Bukowski, Factotum_**

![Stargate7_lightExtra.gif](///raw/d77/21/z/1eb3a.gif)

Feel free to follow me at https://twitter.com/ved_adultlink for gamedev-related stuff :)

entries.title: Cut Your Game
entries.description:
![headerthin.png](///raw/7f9/b1/z/1d625.png)

You are working for a publisher who has just been hit hard by recession, you now need to cut down all your in development games to meet the new reduced budgets.

entries.title: Dilemma
entries.description: Hi there, here is a dilemma you might (or more likely, might not) encounter in your daily life. There are several people tied on the one end of the rail and, on the other end, a train is ready to go. The train is unstoppable because of some magical power and running on the rail leading to the most victims. Are you, with the power to change the direction of the train, going to change the destiny of the others in order to achieve the maximum welfare in the society or leave without doing anything because of the sense of guilty. As creators of the game are welfarists, we hope less people die in this dilemma and believe that sacrifices must be made for the common good.Sounds like a classic moral dilemma in philosophy? But wild things happen in our world.![487ac646bde97a21.jpg](///raw/17a/a1/z/1e5ef.jpg)![-5efc2c5d70b7d03f.jpg](///raw/17a/a1/z/1e5f7.jpg)![-411e2129ecee2e2e.jpg](///raw/17a/a1/z/1e605.jpg)

entries.title: Documentia
entries.description:
![Bannière.png](///raw/9bb/6/z/1d9f1.png)

Imagine a world living inside your computer files... So fragile and pure that any contact from the outside could wreck it beyond recognition... 

A game where you play inside your documents folder.

Discover what's happening to the world of Documentia and try to preserve it. Or destroy it entirely...

But remember : everything that you do, everything that you delete will have an impact.

The game features 5 endings and can vary wildly with every run. Feel free to tell us what ending you got in the comments but please keep the spoilers to a minimum.

Trigger warnings : death, grief and guilt.
Epilepsy warning : light screen jittering

Created by : 

Lucas de Pinho : Art, Story

https://www.artstation.com/lucas_depinho

Pandanym : Code, Story

https://twitter.com/Pandanym

Cory.C : Music, Sounds

https://soundcloud.com/cory-cas

entries.title: Captain's Dilemma
entries.description:
You're a spaceship captain who has to choose the best itinerary to go home...but at what cost?

This old-school shoot'em up is my first solo game. The idea was to sacrifice assets (sounds, sprites, UI...) while shooting at ennemies, making the game more and more difficult. I used sprites made by Master484 (they are in the public domain).

Controls : 
Arrow keys to move,
Spacebar to shoot

Note: shooting consumes energy.

The game should be played in fullscreen (otherwise you won't see everything).

Known bugs : some explosions won't disappear. 

I used Unity, Visual Studio, Photoshop CC 2018 and Audacity.

entries.title: Lobot-403
entries.description:
You are in control of a well-armed robot, on a mission to destroy all of those nasty cleaner bots!

![title.png](///raw/ed6/31/z/1d9cf.png)

![ingame.png](///raw/ed6/31/z/1d9c1.png)

![defeat.png](///raw/ed6/31/z/1d9c2.png)

* WASD keys control the robot
* Space shoots, you got unlimited bullets
* 'Q' and 'E' sacrifice a minigun to restore robot health

--

Whew, I made it! :sweat_smile: In time and even got something finished too. There's a game loop, victory/defeat condition, simple mechanics, physics and collisions, some graphics, and even some (poor) sounds. The idea was based on the theme, although I didn't have much time to realize it in the end. The robot can lose one or two of it's add-on miniguns. Currently, it only restores some health, but the original idea was make a larger level where the player has to control the robot deeper into ever-narrowing corridors and the only way to proceed would have been to ditch guns and other equipment to fit there.

--

The game was made using Godot running on a Linux. I did all the arts and coding myself. Graphics were primarily created with Inkscape as vector graphics and then exported into png. Some graphics (like the background) were done with Gimp. The graphic texts were made with a super-easy online tool, as there was no time anymore to make them by hand. Yet they're probably the best graphics in the game :stuck_out_tongue: Sounds were hastily done with SFXR. There's no music, although I would've loved to create something. Probably would have used LMMS for that.

--

Overall, it was very nice to work on the game, and learned little bit more again about Godot. Also had a ton of fun at a local ldjam gathering we had here, laughing together at all those weird bugs people had with their games :laughing: I didn't have any great expectations for the game itself, just wanted to participate and try to make something finished this time.

entries.title: Underwater Urgency
entries.description:
This is a short, simple point/click
escape game I made about a
theoretical situation in an underwater
hotel. The entrance explodes, and
you have to decide whether to wait
for it to be fixed, or escape the hard
way.

If part of your thought bubble moves
out of screen, you can use the arrows
or WASD to move it. If it goes out of 
sight, get it back in mind with the R key.

entries.title: Disorder
entries.description:
## Are you ready to brave the darkest side of your mind in your bestseller-writing quest? 

Plenty of bleak ideas can be found in the normal world. However, if you want to ascend to the literary masters' pantheon, you’ll have to explore the dark world and find inspiration there. But beware - your sanity won’t last long, and nothing except madness awaits those who dawdle here.

Explore the normal and the dark worlds, find ideas, publish books, and hope to earn enough money to pay your psychiatrist in this double-sided, steampunk runner.

## How much sanity would you sacrifice for fame?

**PS**: Don’t forget to post the list of books you’ve managed to publish :-)

**PS2**: Controls for PC(WebGL) version:
* W/Up to jump
* D/Right or A/Left to dash
* Spacebar to switch over to the dark world and get back

entries.title: The Path of Sacrifices
entries.description:
Hey folks,

so this “real life” interfered again my plans to make a nice weekend of pure ludum dare development - again. But nevertheless i participate anyways…

This is "The Path of Sacrifices". It is the first time since my childhood i used the RPG maker to make a game, but i think it was worth it :smile:

**You are Prof. Sheldon**, a symbologist and historian. **Help your King** on a journey to retrieve the **"Path of Sacrifices"** and discover the hidden lair of the **"Ancient Brotherhood"**.

Sadly i did not finish the whole story. I just had not enough time. But you will get in about 10 minutes a really good intention what the story is about and how the Sacrifices will interfere with the gameplay. I had to use the light version of RPG Maker VX Ace, so i was quite limited - but not my creativity :smile: This LD the challenge for was to tell a decent story with humor and puzzle solving. The puzzles should not be too hard to solve and the player should not feel lost.

**Controls** Move - Arrow Keys, Interact - Enter

I hope you enjoy it and leave me feedback, i will do also returning the favor!

![Bedroom.png](///raw/81f/2/z/1dcc6.png)

![cover.png](///raw/81f/2/z/1dccc.png)

entries.title: Tough Hunt
entries.description:
![Desktop Screenshot 2018.12.04 - 02.27.04.04.png](///raw/ddc/11/z/1dd11.png)

# Story
Wake up in a village. You have to provide food for them or they won't be able to defend before the raiders. But you also need to eat and improve your skills.

Hunt down animals and gain loot. Bring it back before night and make a choice! Will you keep the obtained resources or sacrifice them so the village can survive the next day? The time is short and the needs high.

# Controls

E to interact

LMB to shoot

entries.title: God Pleaser
entries.description: Build a village while appeasing your vengeful god, make sure you display your fate with sacrifices or he might smite you! No food? Simple! just sacrifice some sheep, or maybe a few villagers to cut down on consumption. build farms to let your villagers get a steady food supply, maybe a few homes to generate even more villagers? Heck, why not also throw in a field to grow more grass for your sheep? Do you have a touch for the dramatic? Fear not! You can let your god smite your people instead of a sacrifice! Just keep an eye on your faith meter, or you might get a surprise smite!![Namnlös.png](///raw/96e/f1/z/1dcc8.png)![7.png](///raw/96e/f1/z/1dcd2.png)![4.png](///raw/96e/f1/z/1dcd4.png)

entries.title: One for Another - A tactical combat game
entries.description:
Hey and welcome to **One For Another** *a tactical combat game*.

![Warning.png](///raw/b01/3/z/1ec9b.png) 

In this game, you can experience the tactical depth of chess mixed with the sacrificing nature of chess put on a chess-like checkerboard :checkered_flag: You could also say this game is heavily inspired by **D&D**.

 Its Super Innovative! _Hmm, so juicy!_ Come around with your friends and enjoy sacrificing one for another.

## Story:
A demon savaged the lands and kidnapped a fairy's best friend.
A brave party of heroes took the quest on saving the world!

## Choose each round from playing one of the _non_-stereotype characters, like:
![Knight.png](///raw/b01/3/z/1ecce.png)

![Babarian.png](///raw/b01/3/z/1eccf.png)

### What we are proud of:

### Team:
 - **Muffty**: Code, Animations and Music
 - **Jeikobu**: Models
 - **Masterzenith**: Sprites, Sounds and great fun!

### For best experience:

# Here is an explanation of the UI.

entries.title: Fight Kult
entries.description:
![Fight Kult.png](///raw/1a5/91/z/1cb35.png)

4 mighty priests of devil's church are convened by Satan to accomplish the FIGHT KULT ritual.

In this practice priest are forced to pray and to butcher themselves in order to be the only one remaining.

To survive to this bloody mass, the summoners have to pray in order to be judged by Satan and to be rewarded for their faith.

With the Evil as judge the priests will prove their devotion to dark lord in slaughtering themselves.

But beware if all survive, a sacrifice must be made.


Fight Kult is a 4 local player game. You're alone, not a problem, an AI has been added.

Fight Kult is composed of 2 phases. The first one is the summon time. Quick time events to invoke evil's power and be granted of powerful weapons. Once the weapons acquired the fight begins with a small amount of time and life. If nobody has been sacrificed within 30 seconds a sacrifice must be made. A random player will be sacrificed.

Local coop only available with multiple controllers

**Summon time**

| Symbol | Controller | Keyboard |
|--------|------------|----------|
| Arrows |    D-Pad   |  A W S D |
| A      |      A     |     l    |
| B      |      B     |     p    |
| X      |      X     |     k    |
| Y      |      Y     |     o    |

**Fight time**

| Action   | Controller | Keyboard + Mouse |
|----------|------------|------------------|
| Movement | Left Stick |        A D       |
| Jump     |      A     |       Space      |
| Attack   |      X     |    Left Click    |
| Shield   |      Y     |    Right Click   |

**Game video**


https://youtu.be/IxWS_Mi1awM

**Tools**

Unity3D,
Visual Studio,
TextMeshPro,
Rewired,
Audacity,
MPC Essentials,
Gimp

# Introduction
This is a puzzle game, you need to form the right pattern of combinations of sacrificial offerings in order to **Sacrifice ALL !**

Select the right pattern of offering, and press the Big eye button will trigger an event that will help you to sacrifice.
Events will cost or gain Evil Points, which will allow you to use Magic skills.
Some magic skills require your Evil Points at a exactly number.
At the end, you will need to find out the right combinations of sacrifice.

entries.title: Drained
entries.description:
First person horror game where you must sacrifice your own blood in order to do literally anything.
Puke blood on doors to open or close them, puke blood on weak enemies to kill them.
Puke blood on the big bad guy to stun him.
But most importantly, power the altars with your blood to gain entrance to the sacrificial chamber.

Oh and as you sacrifice your blood, you also sacrifice the game resolution just like in real life!

Made for the Ludum Dare 43 Game Jam
Theme: Sacrifice must be made

Controls 
WASD and mouse to move.
Left mouse to spew blood. 
E to interact

entries.title: GodMode
entries.description:
# Goal
Get the highest Faith Per Second you can

But dont let your town(s) run out of control

# Controls

## Mobile
Drag to pan

Pinch to zoom

Tap to select tile


# Info

## Building
Houses will spawn neighbors after they have collected 1500 wood (about 30 seconds.)

Houses by default can only grow into grass tiles.

However if they collect 2500 Rock they can destroy a nearby forest and spawn a neighbor there.

If a house has 3 or more neighbors they'll be sustained by their neighbors (they just wont die naturally.)

## Faith
Houses standing alone will generate 150 Faith/Sec

For every neighbor a house has it's Faith/Sec will decrease by 50 Down to -150 Faith/Sec


## Sacrifice/Death
Houses will require 50 wood/Sec (to keep them alive.)

If a house runs out of wood it's life will start going down, but each only have 100 life (2 seconds after 0 wood.)

In order to stop you civilians from growing to close and faithless you can smite them by sacrificing their home.

To curb their growing to your needs you can also sacrifice the resources around them,

But beware every sacrifice will cost you.

Grass - 1000 faith

House - 5000 faith

Forest - 5000 faith

Rocks - 10000 faith

entries.title: Farewell Dear Cargo
entries.description:
![banner.jpg](///raw/c99/4/z/1de8d.jpg)

## HOW TO PLAY

Throw away things when the weight indicator is beeping.  
Reorganize and balance the weight of the plane when the tilt indicator beeps. 
Different goods have different values. Listen for sound hints to guess the content of each box.

## CONTROLS

>WASD: Move

>Spacebar: Jump

>Mouse: Look

>Left click: Pick up/put down

>Right click: Throw

>Esc: Pause


### ////////////////////////////////////////////

You're returning from an expedition to the jungle with your plane's hold packed and quite pleased with your plunder. Who could forsee that someone like you would run out of luck? 

The plane is plummeting, the engines are failing and your loot is slipping away. 

You'll have to get rid of some of your sweet spoils to save the remaining. Oh, right, and yourself too. 

But will you be able to tell apart the useless junk you've hoarded from the valuable goods in the heat of the moment? 

Remember: your reputation depends on your success!

### /////////////////////////////////////////////////////

## ABOUT

Made in 72 hours for the Ludum Dare 43.

###Art by:

Mikel Ojea Romano @mikelojea

Pablo Dapena @pablodap

###Programming by:

Ignacio Muñoz Márquez @gamedevnacho

@patriciohidalgo

Diego Manzano @dmanzano101

Special thanks to Juancho Abad for his shader.

entries.title: One Life One Tear
entries.description:
![Logo.png](///raw/129/z/1dcf8.png)

## GAME STORY:
You are responsible for managing a field hospital near a conflict zone. Resources are scarce and the available structure is limited. A new wave of wounded people arrives every day, there is no space to treat all of them. Read the medical charts and analyze the situation. Sacrifices must be made. The injured needs medkits to be treated. Medkit supplies will arrive some days. Make decisions to save as many people as possible.


## FEATURES:
* Manage a field hospital and save many lives you can
* Accept bribe or gifts to keep the work on
* Procedural NPC generation
* 13 unique NPCs
* 4 unique endings


## HOW TO PLAY:
* Use mouse to take actions 
* Select injuried people you want to care
* Click END DAY button when you are done
* Gameplay lenght: about 10 minutes


## ABOUT THE TEAM:
* Game Design and Story - Suâmi Abdalla-Santos
* Art Director - Philippe Alves Lepletier
* Programmer - Sérgio Alonso Jr.
* Music - Arlam Júnior
* All assets are original and were made within 72h during Ludum Dare 43

entries.title: Minotaur Maitre D
entries.description:
Sacrifices will be made, and as the Minotaur Maître D' it's your job to get them to the alter table without getting offered up yourself!

Use the arrow keys or a,w,s,d to move. Collect the blue triangle offerings and get them to the yellow alter. Once an offering is on the table the orange Minotaur will head to it. You can keep placing offerings on the table, but don't let the Minotaur catch you! Time is of the essence as the Minotaur will get faster the longer you take.

Each level will require more offerings to finish, and the Minotaur will be a little faster at the start.

![Minotaur_Maitre_D.PNG](///raw/3cc/e1/z/1dc83.png)

Created with Unity3d along with the A* Pathfinding Project (free edition)

entries.title: Death Metal Crowd Pusher
entries.description:
![submission_thumbnail_630x500.png](///raw/274/e1/z/1da88.png)

The band **DMCP** is trying to summon the **Lord of Metal**. As tribute to the *Most Brutal One*, they have to sacrifice the **Metalheads** at their concert by pushing them into the **Pit of Doom**. Help them succeed in their quest with some epic stage diving and brutal mosh pit action.

![dmcp1.png](///raw/274/e1/z/1e1e9.png)

# How to Play
* The goal of the game is to knock **Metalheads** into the **Pit of Doom** with **Stage Divers**.
* **Stage Divers** will move back and forth on the stage. When you're ready for them to dive, press *Space* or *Left Mouse*!
* Each type of **Metalhead** has a different behavior during their stage dive. Use this to your advantage!
* Every *666* points accumulated, the **Lord of Metal** will appear on stage and rock out. Points are doubled during this phase!
* Try and get as many points as you can before the timer ends! How high of a score can you get?

### Controls
* Space or Left Mouse Button - Stage Dive
* Escape - Quit Game

# Credits

## Programming
* Goss
* WizardOfOzzy

## Art
* sodaraptor

## Music
*  Danny Pellegrini

# Tools Used
* Developed in **Unity 2018**.
* **Butcher the Baker** Font by *Chequered Ink Ltd.*
* Fog effect code from *Unity Asset Store* by *Akilli Mum*

entries.title: Sacrifice for the wall
entries.description:
**Description:**

​This game is about a president trying to defend his country against mexicans. He's sacrificing himself to protect his country at all cost. He even invades Mexico just to make sure his country is safe. Help him by walking through the levels and defeating every enemy that walks your path. But beware that you damage yourself by jumping, which is a sacrifice you're willing to take to take down those pesky mexicans trying to take over your country. The good thing about taking them down is that you'll be so satisfied with what you've done, that you restore some of your HP.

**Controls:**

walking = wasd/arrows/left stick

Jumping = space/'A' Button (xbox)/'cross' button (ps)

Pause = Escape/Start
