entries.title: A Heightened Plight
entries.description:
**A Heightened Plight**

A Heightened Plight is a strategy survival game where you must sacrifice various useful items in order to reach the ground safely. The weight of your hot air balloon is as important as food and water.

![Screenshot.png](///raw/e4e/d1/z/1dc86.png)

**Features:**

* Twelve different items with unique uses, all of which can be released from the balloon to decrease weight.
* Five lovable family members, including a dog! Which ones will survive?
* Three different birds that interrupt gameplay in unique ways.

**Items:**

* Food, water, and gum! Gum is nutritious, right?
* A first aid kit and a fire extinguisher. Who knows when you might need them?
* A trash can. Gotta organize it somehow.
* A radio that gives you valuable information. Too bad it weighs a lot.
* A telephone that allows you to call for reinforcements. There are some items that you don't start with.
* There is a lot more to find! Play for yourself!

**Credits:**

* Programming, music, and sound design by AstroPenguin642.
* Art by CatnipOverdose.
* No prior code or art assets were used. No drag & drop was used. All sound samples were recorded by us within the time frame.

**Software Used:**

* GameMaker Studio 2 (engine and programming)
* Aseprite (pixel art)
* Paint.NET (promo art and logo)
* FL Studio 20 (music)
* Audacity (sound design)
* Github (source control)

entries.title: Murder Cow
entries.description: This game was made with html canvas, javascript, and a couple free resources we scrapped off the internet. The premise is simple. To win, you first must die. Many cows will be sacrificed for the greater good. Hope this game entertains you for a few minutes.

entries.title: Super Space Meltdown
entries.description:
You are an astronaut on the precipice of death, due to your failing space suit that endured the cataclysmic fallout of a collapsing star.

A long series of arduous and conspicuously placed platforms stand between you and your rocket of relative safety.

Your suit only has enough power for the oxygen module if you periodically jettison key components from your suit, such as the thrusters, the anti-gravity boots, or the HUD.

But in what order should you jettison these powerful tools?

That is up to you to decide.
Make the right choices, or face the cold vacuum of space for all eternity in:

Super Space Meltdown.


**************************************************************************************************************************

This is our first LD, we have learned a lot and hope you enjoy our game.

*Update: We realize we might like frustratingly annoying platformers too much, but thanks for trying our game and giving us your feedback and bug reports, we really appreciate any comments, and we are loving playing everyone's games.

entries.title: Pizza Royale
entries.description:
### Everybody loves pizza. But no one loves being ON a pizza. WELCOME TO: PIZZA ROYALE###

![itch asset.gif](///raw/6cd/d1/z/1db47.gif)

In Pizza Royale you and other toppings face the ultimate test, as the all-consuming pizza chef has returned to choose his next sacrifices.

Dodge the master’s hand and punch furious tomatoes, olives and even pineapple (eew) to stun them so they are easy loot for the greedy grasp. You can also punch the others off the table - the only thing that matters is that you are the last one to survive.

Do whatever it takes to be spared from the ancient fires of the pizza oven.


### Controls ###
WASD - Move

Left mouse button  - Punch


### Warning ###
May cause a moral dilemma next time you eat yummy pizza

entries.title: Omitl
entries.description:
# Omitl

Omitl is a fast paced action fighting game based on Aztec sacrifices. Defeat skeletons and build up to fight the evil eye of Tezcatlipoca.

![Cover.png](///raw/d5d/f/z/1dc6a.png)

## Instructions
- WASD to move
- Space to spawn in skeletons
- Click to attack

- Art - [Krita](https://krita.org/en/)
- Music - [Antti Luode](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B1t5awWiDLZhMXBmT0M5Mm1nRG8)

## Links

- [Ludum Dare](https://ldjam.com/games)

entries.title: Fallen Angel
entries.description:
#### Goal

Sacrifice people in the dungeon and reach the exit portal.

#### Rules

You can only survive for 5 seconds without a body.
You must kill the obsessed body to leave it(touch the spikes).
To go through the exit all the people must be dead(there is a counter in the top left corner).

#### Controls
Move - AD/arrow keys
Jump - Space

When you are in spirit form you can double jump.

##### Note

This is my first Ludum Dare entry, hope you like it!

You have 30 days until your party begins. Try to gain the most amount of followers within that time, just don't go overboard!

entries.title: Box Game
entries.description:
Hello this is Sevkron speaking. For this game we decided to stay in a small team and make a simple looking game, Box Game. It's a 2 player versus game, so I know not everyone will be able to play it as intended but it's worth a try. The game supports keyboard or controllers.

The goal is to be the first player to kill the other 2 twice. Thankfully there's 3 weapons you can do that with. But at the end of each round, each player must choose a weapon to sacrifice.

This is the first game I've programmed from A-Z and I'l quite proud of the result, there's a couple of bugs still in there but the main elements work. The music is also original.

NOTE : The controls for Player 2 on the keyboard uses the 0, 1 and 3 number keypads, NOT 1, 2, 3

It has been really fun Ludum Dare, see you soon !
![Capture.PNG](///raw/cce/c/z/1dc77.png)

entries.title: Newton's Last Resort
entries.description:
### Story
Your spaceship got stuck in a minefield and your engines are down! The only thing you have left is your crew and the on-board cannon. Using Newton's third law you can move the ship around by launching you crew members in the opposite direction. They all have personal teleporters, so they will come back eventually, but firing your crew outside in a mine field might not be the best idea. How many crew members will you launch outside and sacrifice in order to dodge the mines?

### Controls
- Use the mouse to aim.
- Hold down mouse to charge cannon.
- Release mouse to fire cannon.

### How To Play
- Don't get hit by mines, dodge them or use your crew as shields.
- Getting hit means you lose three crew members.
- Don't lose your entire crew, you won't have anything left to launch.
- The number of crew members left is in the top left.
- Survive as long as possible.
- Post your highscore below!

![screenshot.png](///raw/1ca/41/z/1dbb8.png)
### Credits
- @wiredoverload: code, game design, art, music
- @alchemic: sound fx, title screen

This game was created entirely through Typescript and use of the canvas.

entries.title: SmallCult
entries.description:
**PLEASE PLAY IN 1920*1080 Resolution. Thank you.** Small strategy game about days of a cult leader, who need to balance between 3 gods and people of the village. Make rough decisions, talk with gods, be good leader. But most importanly ... Do not forget to sacrifiece.![screen.PNG](///raw/6eb/91/z/1f06e.png)

** Goal **

Survive as long as you can

** How to play **

Every turn you get an event. You have several choices to make - you can ask one of your gods for help or do nothing. You choice will affect - population of your village, fear of dwellers, your relationships with gods and of course your money! Then you need to choose the size of offering and to which god it is going. It will allow you to remedy your relationships. Then the next event will come. 


![screen2.PNG](///raw/6eb/91/z/1f06f.png)

entries.title: Captain Betz (CBatFFftFFtFFFbC)
entries.description:
![playerst82.png](///raw/562/e1/z/1b6f2.png)

Just, I dont know anymore if anything is real....


Full Title : Captain Betz and the Furious Fight for the Freedom From the Fake Future Founded by Computers
Internet Connectivity Required!
Story : Captain Betz has had a good life. But one day, he found out that his whole life was a lie! He was
really inside a computer simulation the entire time! So, wanting to know how to escape, he started
to fight for his freedom in the hopes that he could return to the real world!

But the computer had other plans, and is now sending waves of microwave toasters to stop you.

If you beat the final boss you will be rewarded.


Gameplay:
You are equipped with a gun. Use it to destroy the toasters in the wave. After the wave is over, you may go
to the shop and SACRIFICE HP in order to upgrade yourself to defeat the toasters more effectively.

Controls:

W S A D - Movement

Left Click / Spacebar - Attack

E (After round completion) - HP shop (On the Top of the Map)

R - Restarts the Game

Download is on the website bottom right hand corner.
![sc1.png](///raw/562/e1/z/1e241.png)
![sc2.png](///raw/562/e1/z/1e246.png)

entries.title: Domino Sanctus Spiritus
entries.description:
![cover2.jpg](///content/757/2/z/1ef24.jpg)
Arrange the elements harmonically to achieve Enlightenment, but beware the tricks of the Devil.

Each ingredient card represents a pair of primary elements. You need to arrange the elements  to complete the magic circle. Same elements can be  merged together (yes, like domino), you will win if  the circle will be closed.
But one thing you did not expect: this ritual needed a sacrifice. And if you have nothing to offer, you may be sacrificed yourself. Demon will try to interfere your ritual and to break out the circle. He has his own deck of ingredients, and he will add them, making your ritual impossible to finish. If you run out of cards, demon will take you.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EtpzoB67cQo

This game is some kind of spin-off of our bigger tabletop project October Nights, so, many hand drawn images by @ambientchild are re-used. 
With heavy heart we opted out "Graphics" category.
Music by @askania_m
Ideas, Game Design, Programming by @shiitman and @gene_besserit
![Domino-Sanctus-Spiritus-05.12.jpg](///raw/757/2/z/1eefc.jpg)

entries.title: Last Platoon
entries.description:
![Last Platoon.png](///raw/66f/d1/z/1dc46.png)

You are a member of the famous 43rd Platoon on holiday on Upper Earth having the time of your life until the space president rushes into the spa and alarms your unit. The Space UN has been taken over and your team has to go on a suicide mission to retake it from the evil Doctor N.U.K.E. Bombe Esquire. Welcome to the Last Platoon.

Hi, this has been my first Ludum Dare and I must say that I had a blast doing this. I made everything from scratch in the Unity engine to see how far I would get and this is the result (in a playable state somehow). This is also meant as a learning process for me so don't hold back with the constructive feedback.

Controls are simple, straightforward and explained in-game.

A silly fighting game in which you sacrifice your weapon for a better one. You can customize your character because it is fun

~~(We did the jam chill, but the idea was that your weapon would have reactions to your input)~~

### 2 players required

Arrow key / ZQSD - Move

#### JoyStick

xbox X - Maintain and release to attack (change color)

xbox A - Jump (accept)

entries.title: Sven
entries.description:
This is the short story of Sven, a regular guy living in a regular town.

![screenshots.png](///raw/3c8/91/z/1daa3.png)

I originally intended to submit this game as compo entry, but it quickly became apparent that there was no way I would have been able to finish the game in 48 hours. Nonetheless, I had a blast learning new ways to do sprite animations! 

This game was created in Vanilla ES6 Javascript, and needs a relatively modern web browser to play.

I hope you enjoy the game!

Hint: Pace yourself

entries.title: Pre-Life
entries.description:
Depending on your upbringing, your life does not really start until college. But even then, it's just the stepping stone for real life. There are many mistakes and sacrifices that you make in college that you only fully understand much later in life. Pre-life is the opportunity to make those mistakes and scrifices all over again.

### Gameplay
Balance your daily activities.

Interact with other people.

Some interactions have time constraints. You may miss some.

Everyday you will lose -5 of all your stats. You will also lose $5 bucks.

Take control of your life.

### Controls
W, A, S, D - To move

J, Left Mouse Button - To interact

I - To open the inventory

### Credits
Cássio Eduardo - Programming, 3D Art

Harllon Filho - Music

Samanta Portes - Game Design

Mauricio Inacio - 2D Art

![Pre-Life 1.png](///raw/b2/z/1e7c6.png)
![Pre-Life 2.png](///raw/b2/z/1e7c8.png)

### Update 1 - Fixed a bug which broke some endings on multiple playthroughs without closing.

entries.title: Full House - An Arena Shooter
entries.description:
An old school Arena Shooter with a twist!

After each fast paced round the store opens for five seconds! Buy a card!
In this awesome multiplayer game you will have to sacrifice some of your beloved abilities to gain new ones! Buy more run speed with your jump height or trade your health for increased damage!

GAME PLAY VIDEO:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZX2JdpD06LE

Nade:
![game1.png](///raw/15e/8/z/1dbbb.png)

Controls:
  WASD         - move around!
  Mouse        - look around!
  Mouse Button - Shoot!
  1,2,3,4      - Switch Weapon!
  R            - Reload!
  Space        - Jump!

ps:
For online multiplayer open port 7777

entries.title: Bribe
entries.description:
# Story
You are a professional thief. You are no hero, but you have a specific super power – you can bribe policemen – but to do so you need to sacrifice a part of your loot.

Today you got unlucky and became surrounded. Can you escape to your safe-house (the "garage-like" building in the top right of the map) and keep a few coins for yourself?

# Controls
- Arrow keys: move
- Space: drop a coin
- Enter: restart

# Credits
Code, graphics: M-1

Music: cheeslo


(We started on Sunday afternoon so we had little time. Sorry for the lack of polish and the lack of proper "victory" screen.)

entries.title: Where's my Sacrifice!?
entries.description:
Everyday life as a cursed and imprisoned being is hard, you wake up and immediately start receiving orders from the eerie helper of your demonic overlord, you know, the one that captured and cursed you to this life, if you can call this life.

Everyday is the same, push levers and levers to satisfy the sacrificial needs of the overlord, and if you don't know, apparently sacrifices can be pretty specific, you need to follow the desires of the overlord precisly, punishment comes if you don't offer a sacrifice with the correct subject and right presentation...

And so, times goes on and you repeat your duties, or as that weird guy says...
"Come on! Sacrifices must be made!"



### Instructions:
![Captura de Tela (17).png](///raw/a3e/d1/z/1dba1.png)
### Controls:
Movement keys - 'W', 'A', 'S' and 'D'
Interaction Keys - 'Q' and 'E'

![Menu.png](///raw/a3e/d1/z/1db98.png)
![Captura de Tela (15).png](///raw/a3e/d1/z/1dba7.png)

[Hopstarter](https://www.deviantart.com/hopstarter)

remembertonamethis was made in Haxe + Flixel and exported to HTML5 so anyone can play in their browser!

If you have any questions or concerns email me @ staydynamic[at]gmail.com

Alexandre Bourque, Mathieu Frappier & Ludovick Gauthier ! <3

entries.title: Chiiip
entries.description:
DESCRIPTION 🐑

A sheep mosh pit!
Be aware of the danger! Sleeping sheep become wolf dinner. 
Sacrifices must be made in order to calm the hunger of the wolves, and you are the main target of the flock, so… rather them than you!

Survive the wolves attacks, and worse… the family’s message group!


HOW TO PLAY 🎮

Punch the other sheep, grab and toss them through the fence. Knocked down sheep are easier to manage.


CONTROLS ⛺

Movement - WASD or ⬆⬅⬇➡

Punch - Ctrl or Left click (mouse)

Grab/Toss - Alt or Right Click

entries.title: Cutting Corners
entries.description:
Cutting Corners is a sword-slashing action platformer that pushes you to cut down the glitchy parts out of the game. After all, if the game would be to be released in time, sacrifices need to be made.

Unfortunately, due to some planning issues, we did not get the game to the state that we wished, but fear not, the missing content alongside some level redesigns will be coming in shortly in a post-jam build.

Please do not forget to let us know what you think about our game! We really do value your feedback a lot :)

All the best!
Samurai Ducks

entries.title: Mindu's Hope
entries.description:
![minduhope_banner2.png](///raw/237/2/z/1dcae.png)

In a far land, a group of cute little creatures called Mindus were living a peaceful and joyful life. 

Suddenly, a huge earthquake came and destroyed almost all the land where the Mindus lived. Leaving them trapped with no hope to come back to the lives they once had.

Working together, they started to look for a way to exit this now forsaken land and go back to their peaceful lives. Sadly, not every Mindu can survive. To save this group of Mindus, some of them must be heroes and give their lives to help the rest of the group move on.

## Controls
- **Arrow keys/WASD**: Move the Mindus around
- **Mouse click**: Create a rope of Mindus when clicking a white platform, click again to dismiss it

## Objective

Your goal is to reach the place marked by the star using Mindus as ropes to reach places that at first look are unreacheable to this poor group of creatures.

## Known issues

If you're playing the HTML version and the Mindus don't move, try clicking once inside the game. If that doesn't work, please try playing on a different browser, or the Windows or macOS build of the game.

entries.title: Our Sacrifice
entries.description:
![Screenshot_4.jpg](///raw/57c/02/z/1dae6.jpg)

Hi, this is "Our Sacrifice" game. This game is made by me in less than 1 day and I tried to make this as fun as possible. As I'm new in game development scene, I don't know much about sound design and programming, so I left the sound aspect of the game out for this jam.

NOTE: THE GAME WILL OPEN IN WINDOWED MODE, IF YOU ARE NOT SEEING THE FULL GAME, KINDLY RESIZE THE WINDOW(look at the screenshot above).

You can follow my work here: https://github.com/kassassin599/

Update: Thanks all of you for playing, as I mentioned before I'm new in game development, so I tried making for the Mac and Linux, but it's taking some time, so, until then I have made WebGL. You can download from the link and open "idex.html" in Firefox(I don't understand why it isn't working with Chrome). Hope more people will play and rate the game. 

Update: Thanks for the patience, I have uploaded the game on itch.io, where you can play the game without downloading it(If that's not working, consider downloading it).

entries.title: Transmute Your Villagers TD
entries.description:
Welcome to Transmute Your Villagers TD !

In this tower defense you will use your own villagers as money to upgrade your towers in order to save the village.

#### How to play

Tower Defense part

![tuto_1.png](///raw/d24/31/z/1db30.png)


Village management part

#### Tools

entries.title: The Cult
entries.description:
## The cult requires sacrifices

You must provide those sacrifices.  As a cultist in the cult you **must** lead the others to the altar.

- Move - WASD / Gamepad (Xbox)
- Jump - Space / (A)
- Die? - CTRL / (Y)
- Remove nearby grave - ` (grave key) / (X)

"Wait does that say die? we have to die for this cult? I just wanted some free cool aid"

## Credits
- [Dude Generator](https://0x72.itch.io/pixeldudesmaker)
- [BXFR](https://www.bfxr.net/)
- [2d-extras (scriptable tiles)](https://github.com/Unity-Technologies/2d-extras/tree/master/Assets/Tilemap/Tiles/Rule%20Tile/Scripts)

## Hints, tips, and minor spoilers:
- Jumping at the base of a wall lets you spring higher.
- The graves you leave behind can be used as platforms.
- Gathering cultists is more important than having extra lives. Losing a life to gain a cultist is progress.
- Cultists also give you an extra life in addition to another hidden benefit..

## Shots
![LavaJump.gif](///raw/778/z/1e7a6.gif)

![shot1.png](///raw/9cb/z/1dcbc.png)

![shot4.png](///raw/9cb/z/1dcbe.png)

entries.title: DYRKAN
entries.description:
# The Crew:
This is the first time we band togheter to make a game, for some of us its their first game.
We decided to take it easy as the gamejam started in the middle of the night and we had some other things planned during the weekend / work on monday aswell.
 

### Zinarch
Ideas, Lore, Art and Programming all in one ;P

### BecoPeco
Giraffes i mean ART!

### ankan
Programming so much programming.... and Animating and SFX... if i die.. please remove my collider.

# The Game:
A game about an/several (depending on your luck/wit) aspiring demon worshipper/s trying to appease its master not knowing what will make their bond stronger.!


Each "round" you are presented two choices, depending on the traits your demon has the choice you make might be the last one this worshipper ever makes (in which you just generate a new one becouse we got lots of them... litterary..).

Traits are depicted as icons of the seven sins under the demons name on the top of your screen.

entries.title: Hellhole
entries.description:
"You control a village living under the shadow of a bloodthirsty god. Your aim is to lead them to a happy end. To do so, you will have to balance all the resources at your disposal, and give your village the holy strength that can banish such a foul creature. Be wary however, as the being will gain hunger, hunger that then becomes anger. You wouldn't want it to be angry now, would you?"

![premier_art-export.png](///raw/ce9/2/z/1da56.png)

- click on buildings to upgrade them when you have enough resources
- click on the bridge to sacrifice a villager walking on it
- manage the various resources and values affecting the village (viewed by hovering over the top left button)
- witness either your victory or your demise

entries.title: Pew! Pew!
entries.description:
![pew_pew_3.png](///raw/136/z/1e8b3.png)

**Story**

Most of the journey to planet Xylitol has been spent in uneventful hyper-sleep, but the last few parsecs are going to be rough. Your puny ship needs to survive wave after wave of Xylian armada ships, all while gathering Power-Ups and avoiding space debris. In order to escape some truly impossible situations, Sacrifices Must Be Made.

**Controls**

* Arrow Keys: Move
* Z: Fire
* X: Sacrifice a Power-Up

**Theme & LD Stuff**
* For the player: You will need to sacrifice your Power-Ups to beat the game.
* For me: I sacrificed all but 16 colors by using the PICO-8 fantasy computer. It's a pretty neat engine!
* I also forced myself to make my own music this time, as music is something I've never been good at.

**Tactics**
* Some things can only be destroyed via sacrifice
* More Power-Ups make you stronger, but slower (and also a bigger target)
* All enemies have fixed patterns; there's very little randomness in this game

**Help!**
* If you're stuck on Level 1: https://pastebin.com/raw/qZCbgAte
* If you're stuck on Level 2: https://pastebin.com/raw/vniJb7C7
* If you're stuck on Level 3: https://pastebin.com/raw/TymK4R05

**Bugs**
* Hit boxes are off a tiny bit in some cases
* The last boss sometimes freezes the game (unsure why)
* Fullscreen doesn't work on some systems

# About
A devil's minion simulator. The devil's minion is working in the temple where he has to perform the rituals on order to receive currency for his master. Different objects and sacrifices are used in rituals. The goal of the game is make the ritual right and earn as much gold, as Satan need.

# Help
* **Drag and drop** the icons in a Satan circle to add items to the ritual
* Open quest description by **clicking on clients**
* **Esc** - for close book or calendar
* **Esc** - for open pause menu (and switch to a fullscreen mode in Web)​
* Buy recipes in the books of rituals or guess them yourself​

**_To reclaim your freedom you must sacrifice those who want to sacrifice you_**

## The Game

**Goatrifice** is a game about a **goat sacrifice but played the other way around**. You, as the goat, must sacrifice the posers metal heads who tried to offer you as sacrifice.

While you avoid being **sacrificed** you can **dash** onto your enemies to kill them and let them be consumed by the cursed souls of hell. Each killing gives you **blood** and more blood attracts more enemies. This is a bloody game.

![scrn3.png](///raw/f74/21/z/1d9de.png)

@Arbosis,
@erick-dos-ramos,
@ja-viera,
@slagos

The game was made in Unity3D 2018.3 in 2 days and a few extra hours (we have to work on Mondays).

**The downloadable PC version of the game runs much better than the web version**. Please try that one to enjoy the full experience

entries.title: The Tribute
entries.description:
![splash-screen.jpg](///raw/92e/d1/z/1ea4b.jpg)
## Description  
You're the god and you're in control... to an extent.  
  
As the god, your power heavily depends on your followers' faith. And what's the best way to prove one's faith than by sacri- uh, I mean, tribute!  
  
It would've been much easier if you'd have thought it through in advance, wouldn't it? As if having your altars placed quite far from the villages wasn't enough of a nuisance, the people are starting to believe the natural phenomena happening around are deeds of the so-called "Elemental Gods"... and giving them a part of your tribute. How dare they!  
  
With enough faith you should be able to suppress the aforementioned phenomena for good, but getting there... You'll have to use your own elemental powers to keep your followers around long enough!  
  
## Controls  
- 1, 2, 3, 4 - choose Element
- Esc - Pause and help  
  
## Instructions
- Click Elements on field to destroy them:  
[Fire > Earth > Air > Water > Fire]
- Monoliths disappear when you try to hit them!
- Please check the Pause menu (Esc) for information about GUI elements and mechanics!

## Patch notes for 1.2.1 (LD Bugfix Edition)
- ​Fixed destruction animations cutting off 3-4 frames early
- Fixed game over screen's duration (2s ->4s)  
  
*As we aren't sure it's valid for LD, we're leaving the old version up as well. Feel free to check either!

## Credits
Coding and art by Neon Glass team  
Music by [Alex SHAGI](https://soundcloud.com/aleks-shagi)

entries.title: Fading Memories
entries.description:
Congrats, you made it to your 80th birthday!

Unfortunately your memories are fading. With each passing birthday, you must reorganize your memories to the best of your abilities and attempt to fit them into your deteriorating brain. You won't be able to get them to fit together perfectly, but you can try to keep as many as you can out of the fading regions of your brain.

- Mouse to click and drag memories
- Spacebar to rotate memories (when dragging them) and continue

![fadingmemories.png](///raw/160/d/z/1db8f.png)

![brain.gif](///raw/160/d/z/1e87a.gif)

entries.title: Oh Mayan God
entries.description:
# Intro
We are back !

This time we swapped our previous 2D artist, who couldn't make it, for 2 new members.

We were also joined by our musician/dev friend who took care of all the music.


# Quick description
Brace yourselves, for the end of the world is nigh.
The Bat God Camazotz has summoned the Great Eclipse.
If it reaches totality, it will be all over.

Fortunately, all hope is not lost.

Q'uq'umatz, the Feathered Serpent God can help.
Help Hunahpu sacrifice enough citizens for Q'uq'umatz to prevent the deadly eclipse.
But hurry up, time is ticking.

# Controls
Use A and D to move left and right, Space to jump.

Press E to pickup an offering and E again next to the altar to sacrifice it.

You can only pickup one offering at a time so choose your path wisely.

You need to sacrifice every citizens and chickens to win the game.

Sacrifing buys you some time (humans more than chickens).

# Update !
We uploaded a new version of the game !

The link to the new itch.io page can be found below.

Feel free to play the patched version for a better/easier experience of the game.

# Changelog
## v1.1
- Bugfix : Fix a bug preventing offering pickup even though the your character is aligned with the offering.
- Bugfix : Fix the hitbox to prevent dying when turning next to spikes
- Bugfix : Fix a bug preventing jumping right after touching the ground
- Bugfix : Fix the volume slider not saving on the options menu and resetting to full audio
- Bugfix : Fix a bug allowing you to move during the intro text if you restarted the game
- Bugfix : Fix a softlock in the far left temple leaving you unable to jump out of a hole
- Bugfix : Fix a bug allowing you to move after victory by displaying and hiding the pause menu
- Enhancement : Better jumps ! You can now control the height of your jumps based on the time you keep the jump button pressed.
- Enhancement : Better spikes ! We changed slightly the graphics of the spikes, it should be more visible now !
- Enhancement : Better performance overall, mostly due to dark clouds particles
- Enhancement : More volume adjustments possible ! You can now freely adjust the sounds, music and fx volumes independently
- Enhancement : The "options" menu is now accessible in-game 

# Credits
## Programming
- Youhou
- Reno
- Metalfox
- Maksime

## Art
- Droom
- Mesian

## Music & Sounds
- Dioxymore
- Maksime

## Special Thanks
- Acelys Services Numeriques

In this game, each player represents a Lord attempting to reach the Capital City of the Empire in order to take over the Emperor throne. This is a Platformer 2D that tells the story of Wilfred: a sad father that makes everything possible to save his son's life. Even gives up things that nobody has the courage to.

entries.title: Organic Harvest
entries.description:
> Do you have a missing brain? Have you ever felt like you have one excess
> kidney? Whatever your problem is, Dr. Dr. Ludwig and his team will gladly take
> care of you and your organs. Just lay down on that conveyor belt over there and
> wake up a different person*!
>
> \* Terms and conditions apply

![promo001.png](///raw/11a/z/1d5a9.png)

The new advertising campaign is gaining traction and the waiting room is
already full of people, Mr Ludwig! Now your part of the work begins: you have
to see that every organ finds it's right place and that the patients leave the
operating room as healthy as possible.

## How to play

![promo004.png](///raw/11a/z/1d5b2.png)

Patients will enter the OR on one of several conveyor belts. You will have to
cut them open and do some organ transplants. To open up a patient, you will
have to cut along a marked line on their body in order to not damage any organs.
To transplant the organ itself, just drag it over to its new spot and connect
the blood vessels. Be careful to connect arteries to arteries and veins to veins!

![promo003.png](///raw/11a/z/1d5ab.png)

There's also the possibility of - ahem - 'acquiring' and 'disposing' of organs
through other means.

Once you are done with a patient, a press of the green button will send them to
the recovery room and bring in the next patient. Coincidentally, there is also
an incinerator below (the hospital was built over a steel mill), but I don't
see how you could use it.

![promo002.png](///raw/11a/z/1d5b5.png)

## How to start
In the main menu press one of the green buttons to start the game. If you click on the scalpel there will be a tutorial.

![promo000.png](///raw/11a/z/1d5b8.png)

## Leader board
Can you beat the high score? There is an online leader board to compete with other jamers!

## Credits
Design, Code, Audio by Matteo Signer and Benjamin Schmid with assistance by Philipp Wallimann.

**Use the desktop version! The web version does not have any particles and is quite buggy.**

entries.title: The Dilemmnist
entries.description:
![TheDilemmnist.gif](///raw/ae8/a/z/1dad4.gif)

## The Game:
Are you familiar with the Trolley Problem? What a dilemma! That's why we called in an expert. (You __are__ an expert, right?) There are many things to keep in mind when making a decision, so don't rush. But don't be indecisive! After all, sacrifices must be made.  
__Warning:__ The sound for this game is very loud!

## Controls:  
* Use your mouse for clicking buttons and to hover over people on the track.
* Hovering over someone will give you more information about them. (There is a known scaling problem with these colliders. For best results hover near the top left of the character sprites.)
* Saving certain people will cause conflicts that can only be resolved by saving other particular people. Most of the resolution "recipes" are pretty intuitive.  
* The red guy on the title screen is a button.

## Credits:
* Music by [Purple Planet](https://www.purple-planet.com/).

## Last Minute Notes from Me:  
* This was developed on a Macintosh and I did not have access to a Windows machine to test the binary. I apologize if it doesn't work!!!

entries.title: Sacrifices must be made
entries.description:
Your main goal is to use the most power weapon in the to kill your enemies: cold, hard, CASH. Unfortunately, you only have a finite amount of it, so recruit some "investors" along the way and kill those damn blobs!

**Controls**:

Movement: Arrow Keys (You can dash up or down by double tapping the up or down key)

Shoot: **HOLD** Space Bar (there is a currently bug if you just press the key it might not shoot)

**Goal**: Your objective is find NPCs in need of help inside the many building available (you can enter buildings). The NPCs following you represent your health, lose all of them and its game over. Since you have a limited amount of ammo, they will also replenish some over time. Try to defeat all the blobs.

Notes:
- Weird visual bugs when interacting with the buildings (I'll try to fix it):

entries.title: Cultist's Quest
entries.description:
## Description

  Many years ago, the Dark Lord Balthazar was imprisoned in an alternate dimension by the great mage Yendor. The magic used was contained within an amulet that has been lost in antiquity - until now.

  You are a practicing blood mage who draws power from Balthazar through the performance of human sacrifice. Your greatest desire is to free your master from his prison. You have discovered the location of the Amulet of Yendor and now descend into the depths of Balthazar's fortress where the amulet has remained since its use to imprison him. You have collected some sacrifices to take into the pit with you. Recover it and return to release your Great Master from his prison.

  Maybe he will be eternally grateful...

## Notes

  The game is what you would typically expect from a rogue-like. However, due to the time limit, there is only one spell and no additional weapons or armor. You will get hungry and need food and potions are randomized each playthrough, so keep track!

  Unfortunately, we did not have enough time to add sound effects.

## Theme

  As usual, we hated the theme when it was first announced, but we quickly came up with the idea for this game. The game is full of sacrifices, and we had to make many to create it!

  First, inventory space is limited, and you cannot drop anything! So, choose carefully what you pick up. Second, while you are not limited on how many sacrifices you can have with you, you will harm them if you step on them, so, again, choose wisely. Finally, you have the obvious use of sacrifices at altars to add mana.

## Areas of responsibility

**James:** All coding

**Anthony:** Graphics

**Cameron:** Graphics and Music

## Tools Used

Unity 2018.2.3f1 (I was having a lot of issues with the most recent version for some reason)

GIMP

Bosca Ceoil

## WebGL

  We usually provide a WebGL version of our entry. However, this time around, we have not yet as it would require some refactoring since we use multi-threading to generate the levels and that cannot be done with a WebGL build. We may provide one after submission if we can find the time.

## Thanks for playing and rating!

  We hope you enjoy our entry to our sixth consecutive Ludum Dare as much as we enjoyed making it, and we look forward to LD44 (after a well deserved break, of course.)

entries.title: Offering
entries.description:
![Stumpy.gif](///raw/eaf/6/z/1d780.gif)

## Help Stumpy finish his journey through the Ancient Forest.

### Offering is a puzzle platformer made by Aleksandra Rydza (Idea, Art) and Tomasz Rydza (Code, Sound).

#### Game was made in Unity and was possible thanks to new awesome Tilemap feature. 

#### Sprites were made in Aseprite, music and sound effects in Audacity.

#### Music sample is by user Synx from looperman.com.

#### Obligatory "not enough time" rant:

I was planning on making 5 levels, but were able to fit only 3. Last 2 levels were supposed to add new mechanics, so that would probably take another week of debugging with the code I wrote...

I wish I had more time to make music and sound effects, but I'm happy with result, especially because I learned how to use Audacity 10 hours ago...
I wanted to add scrolling background with parallax effect, maybe next time...


Nontheless I'm very happy with the result. Game looks great, code looks solid (as in: no bugs. Of course it's a mess), and there's even sound - you can't take that for granted!


Are you still reading this? I should go to sleep. I'm soo hungry. 

### Be sure to leave a comment so that we can play your game.

## Have a great day!

# Cheers!

entries.title: Incaya
entries.description:
You're the god of a South American Tribe fighting against another tribe.
You can sacrifice your units to get special abilities.

# Gameplay
Assign your units to the crops to get food. With 100 food you can spawn a new unit by clicking the house in your village.

Assign a unit to the Sacrifice Altar to get one of the 3 different abilites. Meteor and Fire hurt enemies, Giant gives your unit a damage boost.

Attack the enemy faction's units, or destroy them with your powers!

- left mouse button: select unit, spawn unit
- right mouse button: give an order (move, attack, farm or sacrifice)

Guide a group of survivors through a deadly maze as part of a cruel experiment. Along the way you will have to make tough choices on who gets to go on and who gets sacrificed for the greater good.

entries.title: Cheela
entries.description:
I wanted to make a game based on evolution and sacrificing the weak to make a superrace, spartan style ;) I ended up making something RTS-like game because this way you can control and kill off a lot of characters which is needed to have enough generations to 'evolve'. I ended up making the bare minimum but I'm still proud of implementing everything like selecting multiple units from scratch. Hope you have fun.

CONTROLS: 
- drag left/ right mouse: select single or multiple units
- click left mouse: move to location
- click right mouse: move to location but if enemy is in range attack
- if a unit is attacked it will automatically fight back
-'R' to reset during game ( because the genes are random, bad luck can give you a very bad starting position)

GOAL: 
- the 'pits' in the left bottom and top right corner can  be used to kill off units but you can't fall into the oponents pit
- the numbers on top of the units represent their attack power
- the longer a unit lives the more its 'genes' will affect the next spawned unit's attack power
- the number inside the pit represents the 'average attack power of the gene pool': simply said the higher this number the more chance of the next unit having a high attack

More explicitly: the 'average attack power, is determined by multiplying each units attack power by the time it is living and adding these together and dividing by the total time lived. Also a number of dead units are still taken into account, with the time they had lived. So in a formula av=sum(A_i*t_i)/sum(t_i) with A_i and t_i the attack power and time alive of unit i. 
The next spawning unit is determined as a combination of two units plus some mutation chance. The longer a unit has lived the more chances it had to 'mate' and the more chance it will have to be a 'parent' of the newly spawned unit. 



WIN: 
- be genetically superior, the average attack power of your gene pool should be 25 higher than the enemy's gene pool
- have at least five living units

Please give me some much needed feedback ! Harsh > dishonest ;)

entries.title: Birds in Space
entries.description:
![Cover.png](///raw/94d/71/z/1f00d.png)
# Welcome to Birds in Space!

You are Zaalu, and your goal is to avoid the ever encroaching Black Hole! Fly through space toward the Warp Gate, stopping along the way to gather Space-Seeds. You can turn in these seeds at various Bird Stations to upgrade your stats.

*Hint: Upgrading your boost also increases your base speed.* 

With this Ludum Dare submission, we wanted to emphasize player input and controls while navigating 3D space. We hope that you are able to have fun just flying around and messing with our unique yet basic control system.

### Programming: James Tusha (http://www.twitter.com/PopDaddyGames)

### SFX & Music: Joshua Damian (http://www.twitter.com/AtmcType

### Art & Models: Anthony Tusha 

Note: The bird currently implemented in this build is an asset purchased from the Unity Asset Store- we were not able to complete the rigging process for our own bird during the jam. We will be adding our bird at a later date. The background (space stars) is also an asset from the same artist on the asset store. 

Nightsound Games Low Poly Bird: https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/characters/animals/low-poly-bird-114438

Nightsound Games Space Skies: https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/2d/textures-materials/sky/spaceskies-free-80503

http://www.twitter.com/NightsoundGames

- Game Engine: Unity3D
- Models: Blender
- Art: Photoshop
- Music: Garageband
- SFX: Garageband
- Code: Visual Studio Code

[Backstory]: If you follow us on Twitter, you may notice that we actually started this project earlier in the week. We put about 7 hours of development time into the core concepts prior to the jam (not knowing what the theme would be) because all three of us had work and real life events we had to partake in over the course of the jam. James did about 50 hours of programming, Anthony about 30 hours of modeling, and Josha bout 20 hours of audio / music 'for this jam'. While we wanted to participate wholly in the jam experience, we simply could not afford the time this particular weekend. We still had a blast, and hope you enjoy what we were able to come up with!

** _ P.S. You can enter a "Cheats" menu by holding "Q" and "W" at the same time. Have fun! :) _ **

entries.title: SACRIFICE
entries.description:
![MenuScreen.PNG](///raw/255/31/z/1daaa.png)

COMMANDS :

- WASD / ZQSD to move
- Left and Right clic to fire
- E to merge the 2 elements in your hand

You, as an elemental humanoid, must kill the oppressive gigantic earth golem to protect the DeathWorld.

Our Hero can control 3 different elements : Fire / Ice / Electricity.
Each hand can stand 1 element, which makes combo possible.
To take an element in your left : hit 1, 2 or 3 on your keyboard to select it from your spell bar then left click to put it in left hand.
To take an element in your right hand : hit 1, 2 or 3 on your keyboard to select it from your spell bar then right click to put it in right hand.
When you got an element in each hand, you can merge it to make a combo spell.

COMBOS:
- Fire + Fire = Attak Speed buff.
- Ice + Ice = Icebloc to protect yourself.
- Electricity + Electricity = Transfer.
- Fire + Ice = FlameThrower.
- Fire + Electricity = Fire Tornado
- Ice + Electricity = Antimatter Missile.

![Ingame2.PNG](///raw/255/31/z/1db39.png)


But, in order to defeat the monster, you'll need to regain mana from the DeathWorld.
Indeed, the golem is surely going to kill you, or you will come out of mana, so as a ghost you'll be able to harvest mana orbs from the DeathWorld.
Regaining your mana is a tought journey, because you'll have less and less time depending on your death count.
The spirits will let you in the other world only 30 seconds at first, and decrease the time left by 5 seconds at every deaths.
If you collect up to 10 orbs ( 100 mana ), you will come back to life to continue your fight.
If you don't collect enought mana in the remaining time, the spirits will keep you in the death world forever.

Thank you in advance for testing our game,

Reborn TEAM.

![InGame1.PNG](///raw/255/31/z/1db33.png)
![InGame3.PNG](///raw/255/31/z/1db3e.png)

Heazen : UI, Sound, Props modeling

Icekyu : Props modeling, fx

Valentin : Shader, Look Dev, fx



You play as a robot that can throw its own members to kill the enemies and control

The main goal is to stay alive. To do this, you can shoot on the ennemis to kill them. But you are throwing your members on and you won't have any member to fight if you only have your head left.

While you're a head, you can roll over a ennemi's corpse to appropriate the ennemy's body and gain new members to throw. And this is how you stay alive.

If you are staying too long while you're a head, you will die.

Press 0 to eject your head and lose your old bod, and you can go with your head find an other corpse to continue with.

Try to do the best score !!



Contorls Keyboard (no controller): 

- Up, down, left and right arrows to move

- 0 (zero on number pad) to eject your head

- Left click on tour mouse to shoot

PS : There's some bugs like if you eject your head right on a corpse, you don't get the corpse and you're still a head.

entries.title: The Pizza Lord
entries.description:
![pizza lord.png](///raw/2cf/z/1da22.png)

## Info

A stranger invites you to play a game. 

NOTE: No jumps scares in this game. We don't like those. :)

The controls can be changed but the default ones are:

WASD: Move around
Left-mouse button: Pick up (hold to grab objects and release to throw them)
Left-mouse button: Advance the text prompts/next etc.

## Development info

* This game was created in Unity. 
* The 3D models were created with Blender and textured using Substance Painter. 
* Other sprites were created using Photoshop.
* The animations were created using the UMotion asset. 
* All sounds were recorded at home using a Zoom H2
* The light settings are Baked indirect + GI using the Enlighten system. 
* All static objects such as the chairs/tables etc. have been light-baked.
* One reflection probe for the entire restaurant
* The roof lights has the white texture set to Emissive
* We're using Unity's post-processing stack v2
* The fire was created using Unity's particle system.

## Screenshots
![1.jpg](///raw/2cf/z/1ec67.jpg)
![4.jpg](///raw/2cf/z/1ec66.jpg)
![3.jpg](///raw/2cf/z/1ec68.jpg)

## Updates

**Update 1**: I had to move the game to a faster Azure storage type. The link has been updated.

**Update 2**: Fixed bug with lighting and a bug that caused the loading screen to freeze. Also added Linux build.

**Update 3**: One person reported download issues, added a set of mirror links located on itch.io.

**Update 4**: Had to change the file structure of the MacOS zip file because it was not possible to install the game with it.

**Update 5**: I had to change the extension on the MacOS file from .zip to .app.

**Update 6**: Wrong MacOS file structure again.

entries.title: Our first game, Hatty & Tom.
entries.description:
Hey everyone!

We're very proud to present you our first game, first LD, first Jam!

It's called Hatty & Tom, the theme was "Sacrifices must be made", and we decided to make a short story-driven 3D Sidescroller in which you start at the final boss, and have to make sacrifices along the way to get back to your hometown.
You're Tom, seeking adventures and glory with your living-hat-bunny friend, Hatty, who guides you through the Voxel-style world you're part of. The game has been made to be played with a controller but you can still play it with a keyboard, the binds are listed at the end of this text.

![unknown (2).png](///raw/5b7/d1/z/1da90.png)

This is the first time we're making a game and we're honestly very proud of it, it makes us happy considering the fact that we were a team of 3 which was very unexperienced in the game development domain.
Our team consisted of Dumbeldor (programmer), Emeffe (programmer), and Pokang (beginner artist)!
We all learnt how to use Unreal Engine on the run and we learnt a whole lot during this jam, working in a restricted environment really brings up the best out of a learning experience.
We didn't sleep a lot and we worked super hard to bring a decent game for you guys and for ourselves, and we're very satisfied with what we made, we hope you will enjoy it!
Everything happened super fast and we weren't seeing time passing by!


Now that I've shortly introduced our game and team I will enter in the more technical details for those interested.

To make this game, we've used these resources : 

	-Unreal Engine 4
	-MagicaVoxel (thank you ephtracy ily so much?)
	-Mixamo
	-Photoshop
	-Audacity
	-LMMS
	-GitHub

About the assets, every voxel asset has been made by Pokang on MagicaVoxel and he's super thankful for ephtracy who made such an intuitive and beautiful software to use.
We've chosen to use Mixamo for rigging and animations because it makes decent, fast and cool animations, that can be a little goofy sometimes, which we enjoy!
We've used Photoshop for a few UI assets, and all the sound effects have been recorded by Pokang and his scuffed mic with various objects around his apartment.
The super short music loop has been made by Pokang on LMMS, he's never really made music before so the track is very simple, we didn't want to have a near to silent world and we didn't want to use other's people assets!
All the rest has been made by our super cool programmers who have made an crazy job at learning UE4 along their path to enlightment and who learnt a whole lot of cool things during the development of the game.
We're impressed at how many things we've come to acheive during the 72 hours of the jam and these things include : 

	-A cool main menu
	-A lot of animations for characters
	-A fighting system
	-An equipment system with items you can drop when needed
	-A dialog system which brings a story we entirely wrote and imagined from scratch
	-Crouching, jumping, movement features
	-A platformer part
	-A healing system
	-A very short cinematic
	-A checkpoint system
	-Very mean enemies that attack you just for the sake of it
	-Credits!
	-An excessive theine consumption by the team

![Capture.PNG](///raw/5b7/d1/z/1ddec.png)

![unknown.png](///raw/5b7/d1/z/1d9f3.png)

Now to give a little background about where this all started, Dumbeldor and Emeffe are both students and friends in the same class, and Dumbeldor met Pokang during another project which is called Skyrim Together, a Skyrim mod that has the objective of bringing multiplayer and coop to Skyrim.

Feel free to tell us your honest opinion about our game, we'd love to hear it even if it's not positive!

We're looking forward to playing all of your awesome submissions guys, I've personally noted some of them that I REALLY want to play.

![unknown (1).png](///raw/5b7/d1/z/1da94.png)

Thank you Ludum Dare to give us this wonderful opportunity to train ourselves and create cool stuff, we enjoyed this event so much as a team.

entries.title: SacrificeSimulator2018
entries.description:
![IdleGif (1).gif](///raw/6e4/91/z/1bc33.gif)

You always wanted to do some evil rituals and find that deterministic finite state machines would be a great way to implement a game control?

Then that's just the game for you.
Sacrifice various ingredients in your rituals to maneuver yourself into the appropriate spell in the state machine of your ritual.
Kill the nasty angels with fireballs, the common peace ducks with lightning and the dispensable humans with red shirts with poison balls
Defend yourself against the particularly dangerous rolling rocks by summoning a shield.


Control:

- You move through your ritual (the state machine) by sacrificing the ingredients shown at the arrow.
- if you are in a state of the ritual you want to use press spacebar
- beware! if you try to use empty states, then you will get hurt (even if you try to summon a shield, even though there is already one)

entries.title: The Questiest Quest of the Intertwined Feast
entries.description:
![logo_ldjam.png](///raw/c2/z/1f140.png)

> *Behold, fellow human. Welcome to the very real tale of Unitox and the destiny of the Seldoon civilization..*


# About

**The Questiest Quest of the Intertwined Feast** is a rhythm game that sets the destiny of an entire civilization between your feet:

- Meet colorful, weird and angry characters during your journey,
- Be the best on the dancefloor,
- Make choices that will alter your gameplay and the life of billions of people,
- Have fun laughing at our silly puns!

*Since TQQOTIF (short for The Questiest Quest of the Intertwined Feast) is a rhythm game, playing with sound is really recommended !*

# Controls:
  
  * **W,S,A,D** or the arrow keys: *move* and *dance*
  * **Spacebar/Mouse click**: *dialogs* and *buttons*

# Known Bugs/Issues

  * Arrows can be a *little* off with the music (you may have to hit ~0.1 second sooner or later), depending of your browser and computer! Didn't have time to make a calibration phase!

# Team

* Programming: Stending (https://twitter.com/MatthieuWololo)
* Music & SFX: uj (https://twitter.com/uinelj)
* "Art": Stending and uj (really that's it)
* Lore and Design : us too

## Few words

Hello and thank you for your interest in TQQOTIF!
We worked really hard to provide a game that's fun to play, and has a nice balance.

We were only two and barely had any experience with pixel art (or art in general tbh), so it was kind of daunting to make all these props by hand. 
Happily the wonderful GIMP's option pixelize helped us at improving our art direction!

Don't hesitate to play the game and enjoy its soundtracks and unique art style!

Cheers, matt & uj

entries.title: Whole Hole
entries.description:
In this game you will continuously kill hordes of increasingly country enemies and civilians, breading hell with sacrifices as quickly as possible. You have decreasing progress bar, which you fill by throwing everything in hell hole. When you fully fill progress bar - you increase your level, by sacrificing half of your efficiency. After level up count of enemies will grow up and there will be more powerful knights coming to help!

You should stun your target by punch, if you want take him.
When you have someone in your hand, and press RMB - you just throw it. But if you press and hold RMB - you charge throw strength, and throw by releasing RMB button (throw strength is not limited).

WSAD - Movement
LMB - Punch.
RMB - Take object, or throw, if you hold something(charging throw by holding button)![Desktop_Screenshot_2018_12_04_-_03_21_51_71.png](///raw/5d8/9/z/1d9b0.png)

FIXES
- reduced size of mobs, so it is esaier to throw mobs in hole
- increased size of outter trigger (now you again can throw at camera and shoot it down!)
- more points for mobs, so you can level up faster

entries.title: BRIAN'S ELEGY
entries.description:
« Brian has begun the ascension of the Dark Lord tower. But no mortals are allowed there. If he really wishes to meet his maker, he shall give up on everything. »

This endless narrative semi-procedural platformer is my first ever solo game. I’m usually more of a game/narrative designer and took this game jam as an opportunity to see if I could script an entire game on my own. It's a hard game, I'm sorry if it puts you off, I'm really into challenging platformers (also, it needs a lot of balancing and better level design). 

For some reasons there's no sounds if you launch the game in Safari, rather use Google Chrome of Firefox. 

I used Unity, Visual Studio, Photoshop CC 2018 and GarageBand.

entries.title: Lambastard
entries.description: For some, there is no cost too great for the acquisition of knowledge, and no act too vile done for the furthering of a cause. Such was the case for private investigator Bert Lambert, who found himself surrounded by snow and birch trees corrupted by the presence of the primeval shrine. Though months of work had lead up to this moment, Lambert couldn't bring himself to paint the sealing glyphs onto the blood-soaked stone table. His thoughts flooded with voices, urging him to make an offering, promising a reward. Could this be the answer he had been seeking?![GIF3.gif](///raw/489/e1/z/1d81b.gif)

entries.title: Bla v Raa : Eternal God Battle Brothers
entries.description:
![BlavRaaBanner.png](///raw/0ab/2/z/1ec1f.png)
**Bla and Raa are God-brothers locked in Eternal God-battle.  Together they are known as Blavraa (or Raavbla)** 

_**(Actually it's a collaborative/competitive asynchronous multiplayer platformer with Hats)**_

- Choose a God and join the sacrificial flow!
- Build pathways to your Chosen God's Sacrifice Holes and Deposit thyself Within.
- Others may try to hinder your progress!
- _**Asynchronous Multiplayer:**_ Every player updates the world with each sacrifice, building platforms, launchers, walls, and coins.

##                    **Arrows : Move   |   Space : Jump   |   F : Sacrifice**

### - *Controller is now Supported*

**SACRIFICE : PRESS F to SACRIFICE**

Each sacrifice allows you to **CONSTRUCT** an Object;

- **Platforms (free)** : press DOWN to build a platform
- **Coin (free)** : press UP to build a Coin (and drop all coins)
- **Wall (1 coin)** : press LEFT or RIGHT to build a wall
- **Launcher (4 coins)** : press SPACE to build a launcher! (use arrows to set direction)
- **Destruct (free)** : press F to detonate and destroy an object!


- ## [BATTLE REPORT : Days 1 and 2](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/bla-v-raa-eternal-god-battle-brothers/blaavraa-battle-report-days-1-and-2)
- ## [BATTLE REPORT : Day 3](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/bla-v-raa-eternal-god-battle-brothers/raavblaa-battle-report-day-3)
- **[ECONOMY UPDATE LIVE](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/bla-v-raa-eternal-god-battle-brothers/raavblaa-online-economy-update-live)**
- ## [BATTLE REPORT : Day 4](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/bla-v-raa-eternal-god-battle-brothers/$136632)
- ## [BATTLE REPORT : Day 5-8](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/bla-v-raa-eternal-god-battle-brothers/battle-report-day-5-8)

![Screenshot 2018-12-04 15.21.02.png](///raw/0ab/2/z/1f072.png)
**OBJECTIVE :** Give power to your God in the eternal struggle of Raa Vs Bla by leaping into your chosen God's Sacrifice Holes

## The highest value Sacrifice Hole is 120,000+???, so far the highest achieved is RAA 13,457!


**Credits** : 
- Alex Yao @ragtagradical : Programming, Art, Design, Music, Sound
- https://jsonbin.io/ : json hosting

**Notes** : originally I was hoping to make this work in HTML5 and run in the browser, and for a while it was working fine, but suddenly it was not, and it was far too late.  So perhaps an update later.

entries.title: Sacrif's Ice
entries.description:
We were two members on the team, one with prior experience in gamedev, and one without.
We were off to a late start, due to hangovers and such, so we didn't actually start until Saturday night.
With all the bad excuses out of the way, here goes:

We decided to interpret the Theme with a bit of wordplay.

The premise is that you play as Sacrif, and your goal is to sell ice cream cones to make money.
You get orders from the Customers and based on that use the different ingredients in the stand to build the cone. When you're done you give it to the customer, and the next guy in line walks up. When all customers are gone, you can spend your hard earned money on new ingredients.


For those interested, the original idea was to have purchasable upgrades, such as a less-rusty (or not rusty at all) counter. The original ice booth, is actually a hot dog stand, with the writing "Joe's Sausages" on it, which you were then supposed to 'upgrade' by removing the old branding (And the hotdog on the roof). These "upgrades" was intended as motivation for saving up money, as well as the ability to upgrade your equipment. Upgrades could also increase the appeal of your ice cream stand, thus resulting in more customers. Factors like hygiene were also thought as factors, that could affect the amount of customers generated. Other than that, we would also have liked to have done some voice acting, but due to poor management of time, and the late start, we simply ran out of time, and didn't get around to it.

entries.title: dungeon and death
entries.description:
This is a Dungeon Crawler where you have to balance food and your companions

![asd.png](///raw/2ba/31/z/1d451.png)![l;kl;.png](///raw/2ba/31/z/1d453.png)![qasd.png](///raw/2ba/31/z/1d454.png)![sdasd.png](///raw/2ba/31/z/1d457.png)![unknown.png](///raw/2ba/31/z/1d459.png)

__How to play:__
- you have 3 companions a mage(blue), a healer(yellow) and a archer(green)
- these companions lose food over time but you will find chicken in the dungeon when you pick it up you can feed 1 of your companions 
- press 1 to feed the mage 2 for the healer and 3 for the archer
- when the food reaches 0 your companion dies
- the archer and mage deal ranged damage to enemies
- there are 2 types of enemies skeleton and warlock 
- the archer does more damage to the skeleton
- the mage does more damage to the warlock 
- the healer heals you 
- you walk with W and S and you turn with A and D
- you can hit enemies if they are close to you with control
- if you see purple smoke that is a teleport it will teleport you to the next location.

entries.title: SacPac Inc.
entries.description:
Don't you hate it when you need to make a sacrifice to the Dark Lord and there are no goat hearts at hand? Or when you're sacrificing a virgin and there's not a ritual knife in sight?
No need to worry anymore, because SacPac® is here!
SacPac® is a small package of sacrificial necessities delivered straight to your ritual location.
SacPac® can include anything from chicken bones to bonfires.
Order your custom SacPac® today through our configurator page!

![Screenshot_1.jpg](///raw/441/e1/z/1d264.jpg)

Play as the one and only worker at the SacPac® factory. Disassemble goats and assemble ritual knives with our patented Assembler and Disassembler machines.

![Screenshot_3.jpg](///raw/441/e1/z/1d266.jpg)

Boxes going by too fast? Throw your arms into the conveyor belt gears to slow down the process. "Sacrifices Must Be Made" is our SacPac® motto! You'll get robotic replacement arms anyway.

![Screenshot_4.jpg](///raw/441/e1/z/1d268.jpg)

entries.title: Demon Rabbit Solitaire
entries.description:
![demon-solitaire-2018-12-03-pm-03-11.png](///raw/ddb/1/z/1d7ca.png)

Memory puzzle meets card game meets a hungry demon rabbit. 🐰

To play:

Use the left mouse button for everything.

1) Match 2 cards on the board.
2) Play a card from your hand onto the board, and repeat.

If you can no longer match cards on the board, you'll have to sacrifice a life card. Once you're out of life cards, it's game over.

There's no quick way to restart the game currently. Sorry!

This game is a platform jumping game，and you need to call your partner to help you through the obstacles.
Companions are unlimited, that means you can easy to pass if you want，but that is your companion.

entries.title: Monarch`s Bully
entries.description:
A game about keeping the peace and diversity in a town in which people get far too upset about certain topics.

![cover.JPG](///raw/9fa/d1/z/1d9be.jpg)

The monarch recognises the importance of diversity within the opinions of her or his subjects. He or she fears that, should one opinion become dominant, a riot may occur, which may threaten the whole kingdom. It is also important to keep opinions diverse as to not allow a certain opinion to become too important. The citizens are constantly trying to influence each other during their daily lives, talking to anyone they meet, influencing anyone who can hear them.

But how does one go about keeping diversity. There seems to be no easy way. Apart from... if certain morals... and possibly the wellbeing of few individuals... are sacrificed for the greater good.

The monarch has chosen you to be the keeper of the peace and the balance of the kingdom. You will have to choose individuals to bully in to ceasing to spread their opinion to other people. A punch might help? But be careful, should others witness your bullying, they may take on the opinion of your target to oppose oppression.

![monarchsbully.gif](///raw/9fa/d1/z/1da05.gif)

WASD - Movement / Left Mouse Click for bulliying

This game contains a complex social simulation of the spreading of ideas among a populous. As such, it is very CPU intensive. Depending on your PC it may not run very well in your browser. Please consider playing the Desktop version instead (As soon as we upload it), should you have any troubles.

entries.title: Kill chickens for better art!
entries.description:
This entry is a bit different.  We decided to do something unusual, out of our comfort zone.  We did a non goal directed "toy" style game. You create art patterns by arranging objects according to certain rules.  You can't really win or lose.  If you manage to find space to place all the objects, the level finishes, and hopefully, you will have created something pretty as a side effect :-)

Click to place a set of objects.  Flicker indicates there is a collision with other objects.  After placement, the next set appears. The sets eventually repeat themselves.  Each level ends when number of moves reaches zero.  To break these rules, you need to sacrifice a chicken.  Sometimes, killing chickens makes better art!

As you might have surmised, we didn't really feel like following the theme.  So we added the chicken sacrifice as a joke! 

This is also Val's first try at electronic music.

Boris: game, graphics
Val: sound, music

entries.title: Wenk!
entries.description:
![wenk-banner-large.png](///raw/2b6/2/z/1d950.png)

Wenk! Is a really short game (1 minute if you know what you are doing) about a penguin exploring a dungeon and rethinking his life choices while sacrificing things he needs to survive.

And here you might think, but what is this "wenk" i just read about, and here is your [answer](https://www.reddit.com/r/adventuretime/comments/23yan5/how_do_you_spell_the_noise_that_gunter_makes/).

- Download links (all builds): https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1yr-t-pMfxMumgbk9VGryHKWe7lqp_i4L?usp=sharing!
- Source code: https://github.com/cbellino/ludum-dare-43 (some of the code is really bad and should not be considered best practice, at all!)

## Controls

- *WASD (or ZQSD)*: Move
- *Arrows*: Shoot
- *Escape*: Back to menu
- *Return*: Wenk!

## About us

This is the first time we did a game jam together and this was quite fun. 

-   Colin Bellino bellino.colin@gmail.com: programming, art, design
-   Romain Huc huc.romain@gmail.com: programming, art, design

Colin: This is the first time I "finished" a game in 3 days, so there's that. Also, wenk!

Romain: First jam ever x first time on Unity = So much FUN ! For a first time it was a good exercice, learning C# and making bad code :p Long Live Gunter !

## Screenshots

![ScreenCapture at Tue Dec 4 13:59:42 CET 2018.png](///raw/2b6/2/z/1eae6.png)
![ScreenCapture at Tue Dec 4 13:59:26 CET 2018.png](///raw/2b6/2/z/1eae7.png)

## Credits

This is a list of sounds, images and other assets we use in the project.
Please keep this list up-to-date so we can buy the assets we use and give credit where credit is due.

| Type  | Filename                      | Description    | Origin                                                                                    |
| ----- | ----------------------------- | -------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Music | rolemu\_-_Peek-Door_Quest.mp3 | Chiptune theme | http://freemusicarchive.org/music/Rolemusic/~/Peek-Door_Quest                             |
| Audio | Wenk1-5.mp3                   | Wenk sounds    | https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y-eaPuiOneE & https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4xsez64M9TQ |


## Tools used

- SFRX (sound effects generator): http://www.drpetter.se/project_sfxr.html
- Unity (game engine): https://unity3d.com/
- Aseprite (pixel art): https://www.aseprite.org/
- OBS (stream and recording, 2TB of recorded video :/): https://obsproject.com/

## Special thanks

- Gunter: http://adventuretime.wikia.com/wiki/Gunter

entries.title: HELL
entries.description:
Oooooookay. The game is about a little dude who has to fight his way through a ton of enemies. But the devil is a fair guy. He offers him new weapons every round. But. He has to scarafise some of his abilities for the next round. That's the price to pay.

**How to play?**

* Kill all enemies
* Choose what you want to sacrafise to the devil
* Get new guns
* Whatch your ammo, it is limited

The game is not even close to be finished at all :D I had only like two days for this, maybe 10 - 15 hours of work. So don't expect too much :D All of this was made by myself except for the background music (there was no time) so I put this out of the votings if this is possible. I wanted to implement way more perks and weapons to choose but again, there was no time :( But all in all I'm quiet happy how it turned out in the end. So I hope you enjoy playing! Thank you!

There is a bug where you can get the same weapons and perks to choose, but I will fix this in a post jam version :)

entries.title: Kaiju Attack
entries.description:
Kaiju Attack is a game where you must defend your city from monsters... By throwing buildings at them!  
Be careful though, as every step you take will kill hundreds of innocent civilians!
  
Hit the kaijus to earn points by grabbing buildings, aiming, and throwing them with your mouse. When you get hit, you get slowed and a portion of the city around you is destroyed. The game ends when enough of the city has been destroyed!

![background.png](///raw/dda/21/z/1d999.png)

**Controls:**
- **WASD**          - Move
- **MOUSE**         - Aim
- **LEFT MOUSE**    - Grab and Throw buildings in front of you

![ezgif.com-optimize(2).gif](///raw/b8b/41/z/1e91a.gif)

![ezgif.com-optimize(3).gif](///raw/b8b/41/z/1e929.gif)

entries.title: The Cost of Defence
entries.description:
![2.png](///raw/a5c/11/z/1da12.png)
The Cost of Defence is a tower defence game where you seek out to protect your home village. However, to upgrade towers you have to sacrifice your less powerful ones.

Placement works as such:

Fire towers -> Electric towers -> Ice towers -> Explosive towers.

To place a tower of a specific type make sure you have a tower of the previous type within its range and enough money.

Feel free to post your high scores  :smile: 

## Controls:
- 1 - 4: Switch Tower type
- Q or E: Switch to previous/ next tower type
- Left click: Place tower
- R (on end screen): Restart game
- Any other key (on end screen): Return to main menu

## Tools used
* [SFML](https://www.sfml-dev.org/)
* Visual Studio
* Vim
* Photoshop

If you enjoyed check us out on Twitter:
* Art: [Cameron](https://twitter.com/shubwub)
* Programming: [James](https://twitter.com/Bulmanator)
* Our Studio: [Ametentia](https://twitter.com/Ametentia)

entries.title: A Bird in Paradise
entries.description:
#### Have you ever dreamed of being a bird?... 
### Being able to fly free?...
## Now's your time to be...
# A Bird in Paradise! 🕊

### Features:
- Adhere to the almighty island gods trying to smite you and your fellow bird friends. *But how you may ask?*
- Fly close to unsuspecting prey to **pick them up!** (More speed gives more respect with the gods!)
- Dodge the wrath of the island god by doing **aerial acrobatics!**
- **SACRIFICE** the prey by dropping them in the island volcano! 🌋


### Controls
- Be free and fly with **your mouse**, just point it where you want the bird to fly! :airplane: 
- **Left Click** to drop your prey. They automatically get picked up when you fly into them. 🙆
- **R** to restart if you get smited by the gods...

### Credits
- Handuer: Programming and Design.
- Tobloef: Programming and Design.
- CptFinn: Graphics and Audio/Music.
- And a thanks to SimonTheCase for help with the sounds!.

# Thanks for playing our game! Feedback is appreciated! :two_hearts:

Pillar of Peril is an action game where you must climb the Pillar of Peril, to defeat the evil sorcerer at it's top.  You are armed with just your revolvers and have your trusty dog beside you. A short game about an annoying God and an even more annoying little human.​ You've fallen down a cave, and must try to esacpe. However, it's too dark. You must sacrifice random items at the light God's altar to get light, enabling further exploration of the cave.


Every item you sacrifice will have some reaction from the God- he might get annoyed and kill you. Or he may be super pleased with you. The game has 3 different endings.

entries.title: Jewel Wars
entries.description:
In Jewel Wars, you will have to fight against another player always trying to get him out of the arena. Your mechanical habilities and reactions will save yourself from falling out on each round. entries.title: Chicken Town
entries.description:
MAIN CONCEPT
Wolfs will want a food and you can accept to give one from your village to keep them busy but at the same time you can refuse them and they will attack the village shortly after your refuse

You can work your chickens in mines to gather gold each chicken will gather 1 gold per 3 second

When you have enough gold you can buy upgrades from the shop but these upgrades won't happen immediately you need to add chickens to the shop in order to actually craft these items each chicken will make crafting faster​​​​

If you think you are strong enough to take down wolves you can refuse them next time they come​

Note: For short experience crafting times reduced, needed golds are reduced, wolves bored for waiting time is removed.

This game is done around 48 hours no stored code used
Art in this game is not mine and it's mostly from game assets from itch.io
Only the chicken is mine


![4.png](///raw/f29/02/z/1e98c.png)
![7.png](///raw/f29/02/z/1e990.png)
![8.png](///raw/f29/02/z/1e992.png)


ANA TEMA

Kurtlar aç ve yemek istiyorlar onları kabul edip köyündeki bir tavuğu onlara verebilirsin bu onlar meşgul tutar ancak kurtları red de edebilirsin ancak bunun sonun sonucunda kısa bir süre sonra kurtlar bütün kasabaya saldıracaklar
Tavuklarını madenlere atayabilirsin atadığın tavuklar her 3 saniyede 1 altın üretirler

Yeterince altının olduğunda marketten güçlendirme satın alabilirsin ancak bu güçlendirmeler direk verilmiyor markete tavuk atayarak o güncellemeleri üretmen gerekiyor. Her yeni tavuk güçlendirme süresini kısaltacaktır

Yeterince güçlendiğini hissedittiğinde kurtlara hayır diyerek kasabanı gelen kurt saldırısına karşı korumayı deneyebilirisin.

Not. kısa deneme oyun zevki için eşya üretim süresi altın ihtiyacı düşürüldü , kurtların beklemekten sıkılma durumu kaldırıldı.a

entries.title: Kingdom Decisions
entries.description:
![scree3.jpg](///raw/989/1/z/1d81f.jpg)

You are a Kings child and your father just came back from a war with an old enemy. Your father crushed the enemy and gathered the whole kingdom of the enemy.

This land ist now yours.

Your father gifted the land to you with the condition, that you have to build your own kingdom within 5 years. Then he will visit your kingdom and check if you have achieved at least on of his given goals for a successful kingdom.

Every part of the land is filled with decisions. Often you have to decide which sacrifice you will do to gain the related benefits. Will you always have the luck to find the event you actually need?

If you suceed, your father will be proud and you have your own personal kingdom. But if you fail, you a disgrace to your family and your father will banish you from all of his land.

## Disclaimer:
- WebGL Version seems to be still buggy, we recommend to use the normal download versions!

![scree1.jpg](///raw/989/1/z/1d823.jpg)
![scree2.jpg](///raw/989/1/z/1d825.jpg)

## Controls: 
- Mouse - Control the game with your mouse
- ESCape - Closes all simple windows
- [You shouldn't use the Return or Space key to activate the next round]

## Helping Tips:
- Have always some ressources in your storage for events
- You can always try to repair a minus values. You loose when you have a negative value at the beginning of your round
- Check always your income of your kingdom. For that, click on your castle
- Scouts usually will find better events than citizens who are scouting 
- Always choose wisely, ignoring an event may also lead to your goal

## Achievable Goals:
- Reach at least 16 Realmpoints
- Save at least 1000 Gold Coins and 1500 Trading Goods
- Collect at least 1000 Lifequality
- Have at least 1000 Technology Points

## Known Bugs:
- Some Typos and Grammar issues
- Balancing Issues
- To Restart a game, you have to loose, win or close the whole game
- WebGL seems to be buggy, we recommend the normal download versions!

---

## Team:
**Christian**
- Twitter: https://twitter.com/key_user

**Christian**
- Twitter: https://twitter.com/DeathStorm1987

---
