entries.title: Not-So-Nicer-Dicer
entries.description:
![Level 8.PNG](///raw/848/3/z/1d8dd.png)![Level1.PNG](///raw/848/3/z/1d8de.png)![Level7.PNG](///raw/848/3/z/1d8df.png)


==================CONTROLS==================

A/D - Moving

SPACE - JUMP

SHIFT - CONTROLL OTHER PRISONER

STRG / LMB - SPAWN NEW PRISONER

H - RELOAD LEVEL (4)

==================ABOUT==================

Hello everyone,

in this years ludum dare I bring you a "puzzle-platformer" Not-So-Nicer-Dicer (1)!
You play as prisoners, trying to escape a "saw"-like setting while being watched over by a mysterious figure...(2)
Whether you sacrefice your fellow prisoners to use them as platforms or to block deadly spikes is up to you, but always keep in mind that there might be other ways aswell...

I really hope you are going to enjoy this game, since i reeeaaally put a lot of effort into this. (I did almost everything myself. Even generated the white background noise in Audacity :3 If it wasn't for the time issues i had this would have been a compo entry ^^)


As always, i'd appretiate a lot of feedback :)
I even allow annonymous comments if you want to say something negative :P

==================IMPORTANT=====================

THE GAME ONLY ONLY RUNS IN 1024x768!!! (3)    
DO !NOT! CHANGE THE RESOLUTION OR          
TRY TO RUN THE GAME IN FULLSCREEN! PLEASE! 

==================NOTES=====================

(1) That was my brothers idea and is a reference to the "Nicer Dicer" Kitchen utensil.

(2) That's why there is almost no sound...and totally not because i have no idea of sound design...kappa.

(3) A. I'm an idiot B. Using beta tools during a competition is extremly stupid ^^

(4) Only reload when you're stuck! Your deaths are still counted! (Also remember that there is a 10sec cooldown untill the next scene loads if there are still other prisoners alive)

entries.title: Zoe and the Polypantheon
entries.description:
Zoe's waited her whole life for this exact day: a field trip across the seas to the newly excavated Temple of the Polypantheon, where there's a shrine for seemingly every god in existence (and Zoe is a sucker for gods).

But when Zoe accidentally-maybe-on-purpose gets locked in the temple overnight, strange things start happening. Things that shouldn't glow begin to glow, and ancient beings stir. Zoe must figure out how to appease the gods ... at least until the electricity comes back on.

We humbly recommend that you please humbly play in the humble fullscreen mode.

POINT-AND-CLICK INSTRUCTIONS:
Click on items in the world to pick them up or interact. Double click an item in your inventory to examine it. Some items can be combined; click on one inventory item and then the other inventory item to combine them. Select an item in your inventory, then click on an object in the world to interact with it. 


All art, writing, and audio was produced in 72 hours for this point-and-click adventure game. 

Please leave comments so we can rate your game in return!

Finally, a complete walkthrough, divided into sections to minimize spoilers, can be found here: https://www.instagram.com/p/BrWYXBulNpY/

entries.title: Test Subject Infinity
entries.description:
# Preface

This is our first **playable** entry for Ludum Dare. That's right, *we're noobs*.
That being said, there's a lot we wanted to do, but couldn't in time. Let's not get into that now. We'll write a nice post-mortem to summarize it all.

There is one thing I feel I need to explain is how the game works, seeing as one of our plans that fell through was to develop an intro cutscene for some backstory, and a tutorial level.

![screenshot.png](///raw/09d/11/z/1e8b8.png)

### Backstory

You are the test subject of a scientific experiment. Mad scientists are working on perfecting resurrection, and they succeed! You can now resurrect upon death, leaving your body where it was.

Alarms in the laboratory go off and all the mad scientists escape, leaving you behind. You must now find a way to escape the laboratory! **Hint**: sometimes you must sacrifice yourself, to get ahead.

### Controls

* **A** - Move left
* **D** - Move right
* **Space** - Jump
* **Click** - Clear ragdoll (click on ragdoll to clear)

### Gameplay

Your lives are limited per level. Get from the resurrection tank, to the doors, by solving each puzzle.
The LD submission of this game features 5 levels, however we hope to add more in the future (in a separate build, to preserve what we were able to get done in 72 hours), as well as graphics, sound, mechanics, and overall tweaks.

entries.title: I swear it was worth it !
entries.description:
We're a team of tech and art students in our first Game Jam

The goal was to create a game in which you control a player who see a mundane disaster happening, like someone losing his wallet, and who runs to prevent it. Ironically while trying to prevent this disaster, he destroys and kills everything in his way.

The game is functional but we were too ambitious for our first Game Jam and we didn't implement a lot of things. Therefore the theme is not very obvious in the final game

entries.title: Slime Sensei

Dr. Mike Slime is a passionate teacher at Slime Limo academy.

One day, an explosion in the laboratory causes a huge fire, waterslimes come inmediately to put out the fire, but the chemicals make it dificult to stop it, and students are still inside the 3 story building!

Luckily, Mike Slime will put his life at risk to save his pupils... but it's up to you to make sure Mike takes the best decisions possible during his rescue, after all, time is running, and every student left inside will die burned into molten jelly.

entries.title: Chicken sexer
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/bd3/3/z/1d91f.png)

Yup, that's a real job that people have and this is a game about that job.

A job where males are sacrificed because they are useless.

Put the female chicks in the pink bin on the right and dump the non-egg laying useless chicks in blue bin on the left. 

I'm afraid you'll need to plug in a gamepad to partake in the wonderful world of chick sexing.

Controls:

Left and right stick: Control the robot's arm

Right trigger: Closes the robot's claw

D-pad and A button to navigate the menu.

Long time player, first time participant of Ludum Dare.

![chickgif.gif](///raw/bd3/3/z/1d922.gif)

An addendum:
The controls on the robot arm are set exactly to the angle of the game pad sticks. 

A gameplay tip is that you have to be careful and smooth with your motion. Make big smooth circle with the game pad sticks and you'll be able to move the chicks within the claw or with the arm itself. 

Think of it like the claw machine at the arcade, if you whip that thing back and forth you aren't picking up any chicks.

entries.title: Beyond
entries.description:
![title_card.png](///raw/879/z/1d74a.png)

##  😱 What if we could go beyond death? ### 
##  😱 Why is the universe so silent? ### 
##  😱 Will we ever populate other planets? ### 

Join Detective Pendguest's journey and experience **Beyond** - best with your headphones on. :smirk:

---

![3.gif](///raw/879/z/1d720.gif)
![2.gif](///raw/879/z/1d70b.gif)
![1.gif](///raw/879/z/1d701.gif)

---

## 🖱 How to Play
* Point-and-Click Mechanic
* Headphones are recommended
* Be sure not to button-mash, since this might skip important messages or trigger bugs

---

## ⚠ WARNING, the game contains:
- Horror **unsuitable for children**
- And a short flickering screen

---

## 🎼 Complete Soundtrack

Experience the game again in an audio-visual way.

https://youtu.be/YV7OEH0_mrs

---

## 🕐 Timelapse

3 days of game development compressed to 5 minutes.

https://youtu.be/jnuAvPw1-Aw

---

## 🆘 Problems?
- If nothings happens when you try to run it, make sure you have a [Java Runtime Environment (JRE) x64](http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jre8-downloads-2133155.html) installed. For Windows use the **jre-8u191-windows-x64.exe** file.
- If you only hear sound but don't see anything, please try to run the windowed version of the game.
- Please use Firefox for the HTML version - Chrome has troubles with sound and music as it seems.

---
## 🕹 Legacy of my other horror games
* [Disembodied](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/disembodied/) (Ludum Dare 42)
* [nO mooRe](http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-37/?action=preview&uid=118598) (Ludum Dare 37)
---

entries.title: The Curse of the Conquistador
entries.description:
In this little adventure game, there is one way to move forward : **Sacrifice your own abilities**. Crawl through a dungeon infested by monsters, unlock doors, avoid traps, and escape death. There is nothing but one rule to remember :

> *What you cherish the most might change in a few steps…*

![shoot2.png](///raw/bc3/41/z/1d8b3.png)

______________________________________________________________________________________________

#### Controls :


**WASD(EN)ZQSD(FR)** - Move
(SELECT LANGUAGE AT THE TITLE SCREEN)

**Left click** - Shoot

**Rigth click** - Interact

**K** - Sacrifice

**ESCAPE** - QUIT GAME

______________________________________________________________________________________________


*The Curse of the Conquistador* was made in 72 hours during the 43rd Ludum Dare.


#### Tools :

Game engine : Game Maker Studio 1.4

Graphics :    Paint.NET

Sounds:       LMMS 1.1.3
              Audacity 2.3.0



#### Staff :

Game design, level design : [Ryomayonnaise](https://ryomayonnaise.itch.io/)

Programming, graphism : [ROBOWARRIOR1982](https://robowarrior.itch.io/)

Music/Sound : [Myrrhe](https://myrrhe.itch.io/)

Patch note:
4-12-2018 : Camera Bug in HTML5 version corrected, english is now default language.

entries.title: Festivus
entries.description:
## Description

Once every seven years a pair of heroes is sent to the shrine of the gods.  Over the seven days of the Festivus the heroes must please the gods with sacrafice.  However there are many gods and little time and you must meet each demand or suffer beneath their wrath.  Keep the gods happy and maybe your village will survive the next seven years.

## Info

- The game is complete, but is lacking depth to the content.  The sacrafices needed do not change day to day, only their number increases.
- There is no single player mode, but the second player can safely stay in the shrine
- Unfortunately the boon of each god provides no benefit
- Fortunately the gods do not punish you when angry

## Controls

#### Player One
```
Movement:     w,a,s,d
Attack:       f
Interact:     g
Change Info:  r
```

#### Player Two
```
Movement:     i,j,k,l
Attack:       ; (semi-colon)
Interact:     ' (quote)
Change Info:  p
```

entries.title: Amulet of Qayin
entries.description:
Amulet of Qayin is a top down action adventure, heavily inspired by the Legend of Zelda Series. The protagonist is on a quest to rescue a princess that was sealed away in a dungeon full of monsters. Besides his staff, he also makes use of a unique power. Sacrificing the unconscious monsters into essence and materializing it as amulets that allows the bearer to use the powers of the former owner. But only one such amulet can be used at any given time.

![AmuletofQayinGameplay.gif](///raw/680/51/z/1d647.gif)

How to play:

Traverse the dungeon, solve puzzles, slay monsters and make your way to the cell, where the princess is held captive. Use the amulet powers to aid your quest.

Keyboard Controls

X - Attack/Confirm Menu choices

Z/Y - Turn to Amulet

A - Sprint (if the right Amulet is equipped)

Credits:

Programming: [@Maytch​](https://twitter.com/Maytch)

Pixelart: [@Zugai89​](https://twitter.com/Zugai89)

Music and Sounds: [@davekingcool​](https://twitter.com/davekingcool)

*Fixed softlock bug preventing player from being locked in a room, moving enemy from room 13 to room 12.

Koucha123 (https://soundcloud.com/koucha123): Music

Technology:  Unity, Krita, Gimp, Ableton Live, Audacity

entries.title: Apatanat: the benefit of all.
entries.description:

## Full doodle style hardcore quest!

**Our hero is trying to sacrifice himself for the salvation of mankind, but no one understands him!**

Once a hundred years comes the time of a bloody harvest. APATANAT. The Dark God at the time absorbs millions of souls to satisfy his eternal hunger. The only alternative way to relieve his hunger is to sacrifice one life. Think about what is more important: your life or many human souls? 😈

This game for logic and exploration of places)

entries.title: Starving Island
entries.description:
![Captura.PNG](///raw/f0b/31/z/1d8c0.png)

It is said that lemmings commit mass suicides when hard times come, in order to balance their population and food supplies.

In Starving Island, you play as a lemming that doesn't want to die, so you have to move around the island trying not to get pushed out by the others. 

Food is running out and the population is growing, so press SPACE to release the other lemmings and don't let them to eat all your food. But be careful, or they will push you to a fatal destiny.

Have fun!

entries.title: Armorican Defenders
entries.description:
Akim, the blacksmith's son, has come to get you. 
Enemies are at your doorsteps. 
As tribal chief, you must take in charge the management of your defenses.

However, the druids warn you, your enemies are not human and 
if you want the gods to help you, **sacrifices must be made**.

### General Information

This game with [Godot Engine](https://godotengine.org/).
You can found our sources on [Github](https://github.com/ludum-rlyeh/LD43).

All our assets are under license CC BY-SA

(We also use some free assets, but we'll make credits later, time to sleep ^^')

### Defend your village
![Village.png](///raw/d52/c/z/1f27d.png)


### Sacrifice your beloved people

You can --- and must--- sacrifice your villagers to use overpowered people.
Will you whoose to save them ... by killing them, or will you try to be
a loving god, and trust them ? 

![Meteor.png](///raw/d52/c/z/1f26e.png)
![storm.png](///raw/d52/c/z/1f27c.png)


### Controls

  -  Left click : add tower
  -  Right click : unselect tower menu
  -  Left click on village : summon spells
  -  Keys 1 and 2 : zoom and unzoom (be careful with axe eugene)
  -  Arrows : move camera

entries.title: ld43sj
entries.description:
A horrible miscalculation has left you short on fuel unable to reach your destination. Sacrifice boxes of gear out the back of your space ship to lighten your load and conserve fuel. Can you work fast enough to save the ship and your life? 

W S A D to move.

SPACE to grab boxes while standing in front of them.
SPACE to release boxes you don't want to drag anymore. 

R will reset the level.
ESC will EXIT the application.

The aim is to move as many boxes out of the ship as you can before you run out of fuel. If you last the time limit you made it to your destination. 

(Currently there are a few annoying bugs where you may get stuck in the level and unable to move. I will try and patch that out tomorrow. For now just reset the level if it happens.)

the game will be updated post jam, if necessary.

entries.title: The Smuggler
entries.description:
A text-based narrative game. You are a smuggler and you have to transport people on your boat to the "other side".
Along the way, you have to make some sacrifices.

entries.title: Var'alith
entries.description:
![Var'Ilith_2018-12-03_21-08-49.png](///raw/566/41/z/1d8a8.png)

![Var'Ilith_2018-12-03_21-09-09.png](///raw/566/41/z/1d8b1.png)

Var’alith



You tried to fool a demon, you lost. They want five living human as a sacrifice, without that, your soul alone will be enough.
You will have to manipulate the people that you meet, give them what they want without making any mistake, otherwise you will not be able to offer them as sacrifices.

Will you make the right choices to win the game ?

entries.title: Yahtzle!
entries.description:
This is our first game as a team.

It is made with Unity : playable in your browser with your mouse.

Gameplay and graphic elements are original, we have found music and sound effects on the web.

We were expecting a 10 minutes long game.

As we are short in time, the game could not be balanced. You're welcome to give us your feedback!

![Welcome.png](///raw/be2/f1/z/1d828.png)

It is a dice game in a mayan ambiance with music.
![YahtzleCity.png](///raw/be2/f1/z/1d82d.png)

You need to target and chose wisely the dice combinations to get ressources and improve your city. Sacrifices must be made to change the dice and nudge the wheel of fate.
![ThunderDice.png](///raw/be2/f1/z/1d831.png)

![Sacrifices.png](///raw/be2/f1/z/1d833.png)

OAOAAAAAR !

like a jaguar




## HOW TO START PLAYING
- Click "New year" : you will throw dice according to the buildings in your town (at first you have 1 farm: 1 yellow dice)
- Select a dice and click Transform to get resources (a 3 yellow dice gives 3 corn)
- or Select a dice and trigger a combination on the town map (a 6 yellow dice can give you a workshop. Building A workshop will give you a brown dice, a new farm a second yellow dice and so on...)

- You can also choose to sacrifice some of your resources to change the dice. These are the 6 sacrifices at the bottom. You must have enough resources to please the gods.


- When all your dice are discarded, click New Year



## HOW TO WIN

You must build the palace and perform final ceremony before 20 turns

Gather resources and combine different sacrifices to get the dice that allow you to progress


## Comments and feedbacks

Please don't hesitate to be direct in your comments and to point the weaknesses. Having other developpers / gamers feedback is a big part of jam interest.
We value your point of view, and will take it in a constructive way, we promise ;)

Thx

entries.title: Slicrifice
entries.description:
Hello This is my first time participating in Ludum Dare.

You control a slime which loses some of its tissue with every movement.

But the smaller you are , the higher you jump.

Controls: arrow keys

Please play in firefox, does not work in google chrome.

entries.title: Castle
entries.description:
![Title.png](///raw/9c8/f1/z/1d76a.png)

Ok so, please be indvulgent this is our first Ludum.

Here it is, Castle is a game that we create as 2.
Basically,Castle is a game where you play as a King that need to protect his empire.
Day by day, some guys will come at your castle and ask for a request. It's up to you to accept (with 'y') or refuse (with 'n').
Among these people is the commander of your armies, a peasant, your adviser, the lieutenant of the enemy empire and an allied queen.
Conserning the enemy lieutenant, when he comes for a request, you can declare him war (by pressing 'w'), be sure to win.

For the ways to lose, it will always be necessary to have at least 30 farmers as well as to have money. And if the enemy lieutenant comes when his army is much more powerful than yours, he will declare war on you and defeat you.
But you can also triumph, declaring war with a sufficient better army.

By the way, this game was developed in CSFML.

Here the link to dowload it : https://boneshiver.itch.io/castle
And one more thing, i'm a little newbie and I didn't succeed to convert it into a window executable files, so it is available only for linux user :/

entries.title: Wicked Kinders
entries.description:
**_Merry Christmas!_**
![MainMenu.PNG](///raw/1d1/91/z/1d864.png)
**Wicked Kinders** is a puzzle game. You play as Knecht Ruprecht, the (german) assistant of Santa Claus. Your are responsiblefor the punishment of the bad kids. For that you are in an orphanage and have to knock those kids out with your rod and then burning them to make a sacrifice to Santa.

**Controls**

* WASD              -> for moving around
* Left mouse button -> hit with rod
* E                 -> multiple use (pick up/ deploy / light chimney)
* R                 -> read mission
* F11               -> fullscreenmode

**Notes**

Please don't take our game too serious! It's a totally crazy attempt to do something out of that theme.

**Change Log**

* 1.00
 * initial release (COMPO VERSION to rate)

![Letter.PNG](///raw/1d1/91/z/1d86f.png)

entries.title: Follow Me
entries.description:
![followMe4.gif](///raw/7a3/2/z/1f530.gif)

In **Follow Me** your goal is to lead your people to safety. 

The path, however is not an easy one. Some of you will have to sacrifice their life to let the others continue their journey.


When the path is hard you can sacrifice your character to turn it into a platform.


Try to reach the end with the most survivors.


![Screenshot (154).png](///raw/7a3/2/z/1d85f.png)


## Controls

- Movement: arrow keys
- Sacrifice: spacebar
- Remove latest platform: C

Please feel free to post your score here or on itch.io.

**UPDATE**

After hearing some feedback I decided to fix a couple of game-breaking bugs. You can decide if you prefer to try the original jam version or the fixed one. Both are available for download (the WebGL version is the updated one).

Fixes:

- Survivors sometimes dying on spikes even if the player passed through unscathed.
- Losing control of the player after sacrifice in certain circumstances.
- Annoying camera snap when dying/sacrificing while the first following survivor was still moving

*Code, Art and Audio by Fabio Marocchi*

entries.title: The Laser Sacrificer
entries.description:
Finally, our game is DONE!!!
​This game was made in 48 hours by two guys for the Ludum Dare Game Jam 43.

In this game, you have to sacrifice yourself to reach the end.​ By killing yourself, you block the laser beams and progress towards the finish line​.

wishing you a good game, good end of the day​!!

entries.title: Demi Quest
entries.description:
Demi Quest is a (nonfiction) narrative game inspired by Depression Quest. 

![pythonw_Qb1upSMQlK.jpg](///raw/7fd/z/1dde1.jpg)

It illustrates the difficulties of demisexuals to lead meaningful relationships that grow up to the level required for them to become physically intimate; together with the frustrations of allosexuals ("normal sexuals") that require or expect physical intimacy to build more emotional attachment in the first place. 

How to Play
---------
Object of the game is to achieve a mutual, consensual relationship that is both emotionally and physically rewarding. 

You can sacrifice some of your physical or emotional integrity in order to save your relationship in this game. This can go terribly wrong but sometimes buys you the time you need. 

You may also sacrifice a friendship or two for the sake of love if you are metal enough. 

If you don't like your character, restart the game. They are randomly generated. 

![pythonw_cRZluj8gFN.jpg](///raw/7fd/z/1ddf7.jpg)

This is the first game we made with Ren'Py. Originally we commenced development at the Identity Game Jam (which coincided with Ludum Dare Saturday), using Ink, which proved too fiddly in terms of logic and flow control.

Content Warning
------------
* situations of problematic consent
* abstract sexual themes in text

Known issues
--------
The game doesn't manage to establish a stable core loop. That means you can experience some situations, but probably will encounter bugs or contradicting signals. Well. That's actually a feature...

Graphics and Music
----------
As the graphics are based on stock images and worked over with style transfer filters, we opt out of the graphics rating. The music is from a licensed Music library.

entries.title: Catrifice
entries.description:
Welcome to our game :smile_cat: You have to sacrifice your own limbs to go through sacred Cat Ghost Portal and reach your final destination!
Make wild jumps, cut and regenerate your legs and arms.

In this game we tried to implement fun jumping physics with blades and a little bit of puzzle!

If only we have a time to beef up our game with levels and additional puzzle elements. But we hope you enjoy it :)

Feel free to comment, we are very hungry for a feedback.

![Screenshot 2018-12-04 at 13.49.31.png](///raw/61f/e1/z/1e8aa.png)

entries.title: Broken Knight
entries.description:
In a financially broken kingdom, an unemployed knight needs to reach the castle to get a job, but in the path there's some taxes that need to be paid.

CONTROLS: Mouse 1 -Attack, Mouse 2 - Defense, Space - Jump

AUTHORS NOTE: unfortunately we could not be able to animate, polish and add music to this, so we are very sorry for this broken game, but we hope you can enjoy it anyway :)

You can find us on Twiiter: @mikabrytu @surreali

entries.title: Sacrificial Movements
entries.description:
This game was made during Ludum Dare 43. As my first Ludum Dare Game jam and being a 14 year old I have used all my knowledge of c# and using unity and put it into this game. In this game there are ways to control enemies either avoiding them or to be able to kill them. For example, you have to press "p" to activate one of the enemies(you will learn about it in the tutorial) but because of this you sacrifice being able to move. Each enemy has a specific button that needs to be pressed to activate it and in doing so this disables one of the core mechanics of the game.!![43 1.JPG](///raw/0c6/21/z/1d85d.jpg)
[43 2.JPG](///raw/0c6/21/z/1d858.jpg)![43 3.JPG](///raw/0c6/21/z/1d859.jpg)

Added an updated version of the game and now has no music.

Your goal is to get to the final node in the system and escape.

entries.title: REQUIESCAT IN PACE (RIP)
entries.description:
![Requiescat in Pace     copy.png](///raw/1e8/e1/z/1d904.png)

"REQUIESCAT IN PACE" Is a little graphic adventure-point and click, old-school styled, with some hints of mistery and puzzles. 

"You have the old family album your mother gave you long time ago...you are here to remember...again...but this time is different...isn't it?"

We were inspired by some games of our childhood, the theme is represented through the story and even some of the gameplay mechanics, also the game was made in GAMEMAKER STUDIO 2. 
It has been our first Ludum Dare and our first project together. 
I (pelicanodepico-Álvaro Maldonado) haven't been developing games for too long so it has been and amazing challenge, I've learned more code in this days than in the past months!

In the other hand my partner (Enrique Silvela) has been developing games in the past, but this time he was in charge of the art style, we wanted to recreate that feeling of classic point and click adventures!

It has been a journey and We hadn't the amount of hours of sleep that we could wanted :smile: :smile: but after all We had a great time and we learned a lot!

We hope you enjoy our game for some minutes at least! Feel free to make some critics! We would love to improve and that's only possible through your thoughts!

![ezgif.com-video-to-gif.gif](///raw/1e8/e1/z/1d8e5.gif)

entries.title: Skill Sacrifice
entries.description:
# SKILL SACRIFICE
### The gods have chosen you to proof yourself worthy their time. However to remain their attention you have to sacrifice your most basic skills!

![screen1.PNG](///raw/683/e1/z/1d77a.png)  

![screen2.PNG](///raw/683/e1/z/1d77c.png)  

![SKILL_SACRIFICE_MAIN SCREEN.png](///raw/683/e1/z/1d77f.png)  


## How to play
Every stage there is a amount of zombies that do spawn. Kill every zombie and then jump down the hole on the left to proceed with the game. After completing a stage you can sacrifice a base state, which will weaken that respective category. Weakening a category 5 times will grand you a special move, and downgrading it 10 times (which is max) will give you a respective super power!

### Categories:

> Movementspeed -> Dash (Shift) -> Superdash (Rightclick + Shift)  
> Health -> Revive -> Super rage mode on death  
> Vision -> Always see zombiesouls -> Become invisible for a few seconds (STRG)  
> Damage -> Fireball (E) -> Stun and damage every zombie (Rightclick + E)  
> Attackspeed -> Pierce through enemys -> Become a rapidfire turret for a few seconds (ALT)  

### Keybindings:

> Aim with your mouse  
> W+A+S+D to move  
> Space to jump  
> Respective keys for the abilities (Shown above) 

## Disclaimer:

Make sure to play in FullHD (1920 / 1080) or something close to 16:9 otherwise the UI won't get scaled properly, because who needs dynamic UIs?  
Also we have compiled a Linux Version but not tested it at all (my Arch died once again :sob: ), so that one might work fine, or not at all ...  
For the best experience download the game, otherwise you can also play it in your webbrowser.  

# BUT NOT THE MOST IMPORTANT THING! HAVE FUN PLAYING OUR GAME, I HOPE YOU ENJOY IT AS MUCH AS WE DID DEVELOPING IT!  
Greetings from Germany / Munich!

entries.title: Sacrifice LUL
entries.description:
It's a balance of Love and Fear. Help them too much and their love will increase. Sacrifice too many and their fear will increase. If you have too much love, demons will come and fix that. If you have too much fear, you will be deemed unworthy to lead! Good Luck PRESS ENTER TO VIEW THE CONTROLS AND PLEASE LEAVE COMMENTS TO HELP ME FIGURE OUT HOW TO MAKE IT BETTER. THANKS

![SacLuL Controls.PNG](///raw/b5c/11/z/1e89d.png)

![Sac Demon Close Up.PNG](///raw/b5c/11/z/1e8ad.png)

![Stock pile and farmers.PNG](///raw/b5c/11/z/1e8b4.png)

- W,A,S,D to move
- Hold right mouse button to rotate

Using powers:
Power buttons on hotbar or press the following
- 1 : trees 
- 2 : rocks
- 3 : farms

- click to chop trees/pickaxe rocks/tend to farm
- shift + click to place new objects

Not using Powers:
- press 'F' to clear powers and go to city interaction mode
- click on grey plebs to claim their potential (level up special plebs)
- click on normal plebs to sacrifice them
- click on objects to destroy 

(pleb == people / citizens)

entries.title: Ante of the Gods
entries.description:
![anteOfTheGodsGame.PNG](///raw/562/21/z/1d844.png)

A pantheon of gods depends upon its worshipers for power, and each deity seeks to claim all that power for themselves. Their battles are waged through bidding their own power -- in other words, sacrificing their worshipers! With each successful bid, gain more worshipers and subdue your opposing deities.

This game only requires a mouse to play

entries.title: Gene Sacrifice
entries.description:
Text game where your decisions matter but also you relay on luck (a lot).
You are playing as a organism fighting for your survival. Cross with other species to change your dna in order to survive through the AEONS. Sacrifice your weak genes in order to survive.Actualy if you think about it, you will probably end the  existance of hundreds of new scecies. 

The game is based on the Polyhybrid Crossing prosses (real life genetic process). Although the process is being simulated accurately, there are some unrealistic elements of the game.

I hope you enjoy playing that game as much as I enjoyed making it.

Sleepy but Happy Shapkofil

entries.title: Ready to Anything
entries.description:
What makes a hero is his stuff, right? Well, know that you ARE equipped, and WELL EQUIPPED! In fact, you are ready. Ready to anything!!

In this game, you'll have to progress in a dungeon filled with monsters (and maybe one day also with traps). But be warned: you'll have to make sacrifices in order to continue your progression.

It is not finished, as we didn't have enough time to do all we wanted, but we hope you'll have some fun testing what we've done, as we had a lot of fun doing it! ^^

entries.description:
Game made in 10h. 
Sacrifice the rest of the hours to take care of my baby.
Hope you enjoy the idea of the game.
Sorry for the bugs 

The idea is that you need to sacrifice your lives to save the civilians. You can also sacrifice civilians to kill enemies and save more civilians. you can grab them by pressing E

entries.title: Bloodmancer
entries.description:
In this game, you control the Bloodmancer - an evil mage that seeks four crystals of nature. These crystals combined empower their owner beyond imagination!

![rogue_1.JPG](///raw/491/f1/z/1dc42.jpg)

Controls:

Move left -> [Left arrow], [A] 

Move right -> [Right arrow], [D]

Jump -> [Spacebar]

Use skill 1 -> [1] (under F1)

Use skill 2 -> [2] (under F2)

Leave body -> [K]

Use -> [F]

HiThis is my first time participating in such event, also my first time working on 2D game in Unity3D (damn you OnTriggerEnter2D!) 

The theme of LD43 is "Sacrifices must be made" - I've had some ideas, like - you sacrifice time spent with family/loved ones for work/drinking/watching videos etc. But I didn't know how to transform that idea into game.. So the game I created in the end is kinda darker.. With more blood and death. Yet maybe it's less depressing that the "time sacrifice" game.



The game is kinda gory.. so if you are not into that, don't play it. 



I haven't had too much time to create this game (for sure not 72 hours :(), this was my first jam, my preparations were sh1tty at best (my fault!) and I have used assets (graphics, music, sounds) made by others. 

I will add links to 3rd party work soon! (When I get some sleep) !

entries.title: Happy Fun Death Cult
entries.description:
Happy Fun Death Cult is a resource management game that holds true to the theme "Sacrifices must be made".

-----

Controls:

WASD + ScrollWheel for the camera

Left click to interact with minions.

-----

How to play:

Keep your minions happy and your power high. Send minions to the break room to improve their happiness and send them to the throne room to praise the power gods. You can also upgrade your minions in the dedicated room. When push comes to shove, perform sacrifices on your minions in order to maintain the power supply.

-----

Upgrades:

Speed: self-explanatory

Voice: increases power gain when praising in throne room

Drain: Increases power gain from sacrifices, and decreases happiness penalty

entries.title: Fight For Your Light
entries.description:
![Overall3.PNG](///raw/68c/a1/z/1d617.png)

---

# FIGHT FOR YOUR LIGHT

You are the last defender of your realm of **light**. Even if your masters left the world a long time ago, you're still defending this last light core. You hear echoes in the distance... The abyss is coming to take away the last glimpse of light.

You have a single resource, your **light**. It's your **power**, your **health**, everything. The three generators in this world will supply you with some light at the end of each assault from the abyss. You must keep them working. The **core at the center of the world** will be useful to **sacrifice some of your light**. Here you can **repair / upgrade** the generators. You can also **forge new runes** used to cast powerful spells. Or you can **sacrifice your powerful spells to retrieve some light**, *in case you're running low...*

## CONTROLS - IMPORTANT, PLEASE READ -

You're a powerfull automatic **rune caster**. You move by **hovering** over the ground **(ZQSD / WASD)**, you have a **boost with Left Shift**, you can **jump with Spacebar**, you can **lock yourself in the air with Left CTRL**,  **Left Click to use your left rune**, **Right Click to use your right rune** (*you can activate both runes by pressing Left Click and Right Click at the same time*).

## IMPORTANT NOTICE

The camera sensibility in game might be too high for some people, don't hesitate to lower your mouse sensibility in your computer parameters if you prefer low sensibility. Sorry for the inconvenience ! Next ludum dare we'll be sure to add a sensibility parameter in our game !

## COMBAT

You have a **rotating wheel of four runes**. Each time you use a rune, the wheel turns by 90 degrees. Choose wisely how you place your spells on the wheel, as it will **greatly change your ability to fight**.
While locked in the air, you will have a greater accuracy, and your runes will cast faster. However, the enemies will be much more accurate towards you.

---

**Developer** - **FX Artist** - **Sound Designer** : *Thomas Lebrun* (Raivk)

**3D Artist** : *Léa Pequignot* (Silveria)

#### Together we're **Teagher Studio** : [Teagher Studio](https://twitter.com/teagher)

---

We would like to say thanks to [Game-Icons](https://game-icons.net) for their wonderful icons, and [Guillermo Angel](https://twitter.com/ved_adultlink) for his great resources to learn shaders !

---

## V1.1 - QUICK FIX

- Fix the annoying camera jitter when turning fast
- Fix the camera movement smoothing being way too high (forgot a comma... the smoothing was set to 01 seconds instead of 0.1...)

---

entries.title: Price of Power
entries.description:
Please enjoy Price of Power.

This is a kind of a digital boardgame... not really a digital version of a boardgame, but it would still play like a boardgame.

Your goal is to destroy enemy... box. While not letting it destroy yours.

To do this you have to play cards. The price of playing a card it in the top-right.

Once on the table you can activate Card ability (middle section). Which has a cost as well (middle-left). The effect of the ability would be either dealing damage to enemy cards or box (arrowhead) or heal your cards/box.

If you attack enemy card the color of your attacking ability must match the color of cards health (top-left).

If enemy card shows its hearth as a shield - this is a defender. Any attacks of this colot must hit one of the defenders.

Attacks of any color can be used to target enemy box.

To play cards or use abilities you need to spend mana, which is earned by sacrificing your cards to the fiery pit on the left. The amount of mana gained is listed at the bottom of the card. But be cautious - all unused mana will burn your health.

At the beginning of each turn you are dealt enough cards to have 6 in your hand.

Enemy cards don't use mana. Instead they activate on timers. At the bottom left you can see number of tuns befor the card acts again.

If any details are hard to see - Right-click on a card (yours or enemy) to look closed. (Though please don't move mouse while you expecting).

All this might sound a bit convoluted, but I just guess this is how boardgames are.

And speacking of sounds - there are none. Sorry. I know this would have added so much to the feel of the game, but I am still not good with them.

Have fun!

PS: If you are unlucky with cards the game might be brutal. But it is beatable.

entries.title: Sacrifice Simulation: GOAT FARM
entries.description:
![titlegif.gif](///raw/87b/02/z/1d809.gif)

Introducing the Totally Realistic Goat Sacrifice Simulator with graphics so real, it'll blow your mind...  
SACRIFICE SIMULATOR: GOAT FARM!  

You have a lovely goat farm on a peaceful island paradise.  Or is it?  The Volcano on your island has become 
active and you have to sacrifice your goats to keep the volcano from erupting! Oh no!
Click and drag your goats to the volcano quick enough before the volcano erupts. 
Can you keep the volcano gods happy?

Press ESC to restart the game.

![screenshot.png](///raw/87b/02/z/1d7d1.png)

## Team:

Follow us on Twitter and Twitch. We both regularly stream our game development, come say hi! <3

### LillyByte - Programming

* [Twitter LillyByteGames](https://www.twitter.com/LillyByteGames)
* [Twitch.tv/LillyByte](https://www.twitch.tv/lillybyte)

### Phanxgames - Artwork
* [Twitter phanxgames](https://www.twitter.com/phanxgames)
* [Twitch.tv/Phanxgames](https://www.twitch.tv/phanxgames)


## Notes:

* The game was made with Godot!
* The game is unbalanced and unfinished, we ran out of time!
* We do hope you enjoy it anyway, it was a lot of fun to create, and it is pretty fun despite we only got a few mechanics working!

entries.title: Action Tanks - The battle for Althea
entries.description:
![2018-12-04 Battle.gif](///raw/a44/a/z/1d7fd.gif)

# Once upon a time
There was a beautiful planet, Althea, a developing industrial planet, sort of like earth. The inhabitants didn't pay attention to climate change although they saw the effects of it everyday. The people were not willing to change their lifestyles and the planet was dying. Their scientists found a solution and decided to pump the waste and dangerous substances from the atmosphere deep into the rock bed of the planet. 

Years passed and all was fine until earthquakes started to rattle the world more and more. The waste in the ground had reacted with the rock bed causing it to dissolve and the planets crust crumbled into the sea. Only a few  plateaus remains of the once beautiful planet. 

## How to play
Go through the portal on each stage to complete the mission.
Use the WASD keys to steer your tank. Aim and fire with mouse button. I recommend that you play this game in full screen mode. **Beware**, bullets bounce!

entries.title: Bunker 32
entries.description:
## Ludum Dare 43

## Bunker 32

### Type
Was aiming for comp but the time was not enough so jam it is :v: 

### General idea:
Top down fast shooter, ala nuclear throne, binding of isaac etc.

### Art:
Pixel art made by myself

### Sound fx & music:
Simple bit sound created by myself

### World story:
A long time ago, in a technical advanced age, mankind is on the brink of destruction.
All nations have launched their entire disposal of nuclear missiles and are about to decimate the planet, leaving it uninhabitable.
In a desperate attempt to save mankind the "IWC" have launched a passenger ship containing the most important people to explore and settle on the neighbouring planet, "P-02".
Planet "P-02" has since long been terraformed to suit mankind, but is not yet ready.

### Player story:
The player in our story is a decorated marine, but after a missfortunate interstellar combat mission is degraded to guard one of the most advanced nuclear bunkers "Bunker 32".
The player has been fighting his entire life, tired of it. Cant see any other solutions and decides to take things into his own hands.. Blowing up the passenger ship and instead sending a dna sample to "P-02"

### Game mechanics:
-Run'N'gun
-Weapons
--Pistol
--Rifle (Didnt make it)
--Shotgun (Didnt make it)
-Enemies
--Soldier
--Boss
-4 Levels
--You go deeper into the bunker to reach the final Level
--Stairs are gates to traverse levels

![scr1.png](///raw/47c/e1/z/1d7cc.png)![scr2.png](///raw/47c/e1/z/1d7cd.png)

### How to play:
WASD to move
Left mousebutton to shoot

entries.title: Ring of Sacrifice
entries.description:
Ring of Sacrifice is a bullet hell game about surviving the cold and hostile wasteland. Your objective is to simply not die for 10 minutes. Plan your item usage wisely, deciding whether to use, throw, burn, or save items is critical to your survival.

**Controls**
* W/A/S/D: Move
* Left Click: Use Item  (Heal/Melee Attack/Shoot)
* Right Click: Throw Item  (Throw at fire to fuel it)
* 1-5: Equip Item
* ESC: Pause Game

**Notes**
* The melee attack makes you dash toward the enemy closest to your cursor, so long as they are within melee range.
* Throw attacks stun longer than melee attacks. Ranged attacks do not stun.
* Every item has throw damage, except for the bandage. Throw damage on melee weapons is weaker than it's melee damage. Throw damage is equal on guns. The kunai is an exception, being a melee weapon with higher throw damage than melee damage.
* Throwing items stuns longer than melee attacks, but the stun duration is also dependent on each item. The bandage despite not doing damage, stuns for as long as the stick and the rock.
* Machine enemies spawn every minute, on the minute. They have much more health than any other enemy, and drop the strongest weapons. (minus the gnome.)
* Speaking of the gnome, it adds the most fuel to the fire, and can destroy machines in 1 throw.
* Pills and rocks do not add fuel to the fire.

**Hard Mode**
* You move slower.
* Items have less durability.
* The fire dies faster.
* Both the cold and enemies deal more damage
* Enemy projectiles travel faster and further.
* Enemies fire more frequently and have more health.
* You get to feel better about yourself.

Music: https://www.purple-planet.com

https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/238914176066650114/519292965659869184/ld43.gif

entries.title: Breach Squad
entries.description:
![1 2018-12-04 07-44-12-23.png](///raw/c56/1/z/1d83a.png)


=============================
#Breach Squad

A turn-based tactical game about forced house demolishing,
a violent action to take down buildings whose resident refused to move out in time.

NOTE
Due to time limit, I couldn't provide too much tutorial infomation inside the game, so please read below.

=============================
#How to play

Left mouse btn to select and issue command to units.
Right mouse btn to quit/cancel any selection state.
Drag to rotate the camera, mouse wheel to zoom in/out.

When selecting move position, click on the unit itself to stay.
When selecting attack target, click on the unit itself to rest, instead of performing any attack action.

The goal of each level is to destroy ALL the buildings that belongs to enemy.
You will lose if you lose all your units.

=============================
#Combat Guide

Units has different battle classes, they have bonus against one another, like Rock-Paper-Sissor

BRUTE UNIT (Thug/Riot)  >>>  MEDIA UNIT(Gov, / Journalist)  >>> LAW UNIT(Police/Lawyer) >>>> BRUTE UNIT
WORKER UNIT can only attack BUILDING

The number on unit indicate the  HP  and strength of that unit, meaning that a unit at lower HP will attack less efficiently.

Some terrain provide defensive buff or debuff for units standing on it. 

=============================
#Background

The game concerns about the intense social conflict occurring in China,
where the eager real estate developers could not wait to get rid of the old residents of the land.
They conspired with local authorities and even hired thugs to drive the people out of their homes.

Lawyers and journalists volunteered to help. But they were suppressed as well.

In the cities, the powerless and the poor people were the sarcrifice of the fast urbanization and economical development.
In this game, player was the enforcer of such dirty jobs, a link in the chain of greater grey business.

More on this topic:
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forced_evictions_in_China

=============================
#Team

I (Guoboism) am the only team member

Music and sound are found on sites like opengameart.
Voxel model and 2D stuff are created during the game jam.

![1 2018-12-04 07-42-59-56.png](///raw/c56/1/z/1d832.png)

![1 2018-12-04 07-43-50-24.png](///raw/c56/1/z/1d839.png)

![1 2018-12-04 07-43-23-79.png](///raw/c56/1/z/1d849.png)

![1 2018-12-04 07-43-18-04.png](///raw/c56/1/z/1d84b.png)

![1 2018-12-04 07-43-38-27.png](///raw/c56/1/z/1d84e.png)

entries.title: Sacrizism
entries.description:
Welcome to the realm of the Demon King! He demands his annual sacrifices...

A demonic twin-stick-shooter with lots of randomized madness. The game is quite difficult. Choose your battles wisely at the start and don't give up too fast at the end, practice makes perfect :)

All platform versions are available on itch.io: **https://erkberg.itch.io/sacrizism**  
Source is available on GitHub: https://github.com/Erkberg/Sacrizism

![gif.gif](///raw/5d/z/1f286.gif)

**~ Controls ~**  
Gamepad highly recommended! (keyboards may have problems with simultaneous inputs, also: aiming)  
Left stick / WASD / ZQSD to move  
Right stick / Arrows to shoot

**~ Team ~**  
Erik "Erkberg" Schulze - Code, music  
Danny "guckstift" Raufeisen - Art, sounds

**~ Timelapse ~**  
https://youtu.be/CMPANrsl10E

**~ Mini post-mortem ~** (more detailed write-up coming soon)  
- worked on other idea until saturday evening  
- turned out to be not so much fun working on this, so I switched and joined forces with guckstift  
- was a lot of fun then to work on this game as a team  
- technical problems at the end (audio imports not working)
- satisfied with how the game turned out  
- three days jam is much more exhausting than two days :)  

**~ Post-jam version ~** (coming soon)  
I'm planning to do a little post-jam version of the game to include some improvements for which there was not enough time during the jam, including:  
- mouse support for aiming and shooting  
- improved narrative through different endings  (pacifist, choice before boss fight to give up powers, full "sacribar")  
- improved balancing  
- minor graphical improvements like bloodstains and idle animations  
- code cleanup / refactoring / documentation (who am I kidding? :D)

If you run into any problems (performance, bugs etc.) please let me know! Otherwise have fun with the game, I'm looking forward to your feedback and playing your creations.

Full disclosure: I made some bugfixes for the game after the deadline ended. Just fixes though, no improvements / additions or anything, so I think it's within the rules. You can check out the changes by comparing the first two releases on GitHub.

entries.title: Friends OR Food
entries.description:
This is a fast paced top-down, dungeon-crawler, bullet-hell.

In your adventure, you are accompanied by your friends.  You need food to survive, but there is not enough food for everyone. Sacrifices must be made.

Controls: Use WASD to move, mouse to aim and LMB to shoot.

KeyPoints:

-> You control the hero character and your party consists of a sidekick gunman, three civilians and a medic. Your party will follow you wherever you go.

-> It is game over if the hunger meter goes full or if the hero is dead.

-> You cannot pick health vials if the medic is dead.

-> The effect of health and food pickups gets divided by the characters. So “Sacrifices must be made”.

P.S. This was my first ever LD Game Jam. The game didn't turn out as I had originally thought but I am glad I could finish it in time.

Special thanks to opengameart.org users Michele Bucelli  and bevouliin.com for the graphics.

​
EVAC is a sci-fi strategy game made by Gear Light Games during Ludum Dare 43.
You take control of Earths final battle ship as you race to the safety of Titus trying to save as many colonies from an unstoppable alien armada. 
Be careful with your choices, each colony has different assets that may help you save more colonist so you must decide who to save and who to leave behind.

entries.title: Strain of the Gods
entries.description:
![idol.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1e8e6.png)

Many years ago, a race of ancient deities arose from a deep slumber. In their hunger for wealth and power they caused the demise of mankind. At the brink of a complete extinction, only a small village escaped the eyes of the gods, until now.
Baring the legacy of mankind, it is up to you to aid the small mountain town of Javalonia to please the celestial beings while slowly increasing its population. How long will you last before you too perish?


*** For those who do not want to read the entire manual *** : This game is a resource gathering game in the shape of a very minimalistic RTS. The gods will ask you for resources, if you can't comply they will kill your villagers until you sacrifice one to them instead.

## Manual

___

#### CONTROLS
___



Key | Action
--- | --- 
F1 | Show controls overlay
Left Click| Select a single unit, confirm position to move to  
Right Click & Drag | Select multiple units
Tab | Toggle minimap
Arrow Keys| Move camera
Left CTRL + UP/DOWN keys| Follow a villager

___

#### The World

___

Right click on a villager to select him/her. Alternatively you can left click and drag (see image). Then proceed doing the same on a target and select an action. Note that not everything can be farmed, as the Gods do not want you to mess with live trees. 

 |  |  |  |  |  | 
--- | --- | --- | --- | ---
![tree.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1d8b5.png) | wood  | ![berries.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1d8f5.png) | food | ![water.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1d8c8.png)| water 
![rock.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1d8c3.png) | stone | ![wheat.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1d8ed.png)| food | 


___

#### Villager actions

___

A villager can do multiple things. They have to, the fate of mankind depends on it !!!! To aid you in keeping track of your villagers, you can hold down *** CTRL and the up or down arrow keys ***. This will make the camera follow an individual villager in its endeavour! You can also toggle a minimap using the *** TAB *** key

___

##### Sacrifice

___

You can sacrifice a villager , should the gods demand so. Or if you are unable to fulfill one of their wishes. By right clicking a villager and selecting sacrifice, the character will find its path back to the altar at the village square.
Villagers are really your most precious resource however, so be careful ! 

                             _Making a sacrifice_
![sacrifice-small.gif](///raw/12b/31/z/1d995.gif)


___

##### Harvest

___


You can manually specify a resource that should be harvested by a villager. Select one or multiple villagers, then right click your target and select "Harvest". Obtaining food is harder than it seems. Berries can be quite rare and the only other option is to tend to the farmland near the village. You can use water to let the crops grow, which can then be harvested for food ! Right click the farmland and water it.

                             _Harvesting a tree_
![action_smaller.gif](///raw/12b/31/z/1d873.gif)

___

##### Scavenge

___

When you are in sudden need of a certain resource, you don't always have the time to manage every target for a villager manually. By selecting "Scavenge" you can set a resource type and let the AI handle the gathering for you ! Easy peasy !

___

##### Rest

___

Villagers are also a resource and you will run out if the divine demands keep coming. In order to reproduce, at least *** 2 villagers *** need to be resting in the same house. You can do this by selecting villagers, right clicking a house and selecting rest. If you have ***  at least 50 of each resource *** , there is a chance the villagers will reproduce !

                             _Resting and reproducing_
![drag_select_smaller.gif](///raw/12b/31/z/1d949.gif)


___

##### Notifications
___

A villager will let you know what it is up to by means of a text bubble. 


Object| Type 
--- | --- 
![StatusIcons_Animation 1_00.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f465.png) | found what I was looking for | ![StatusIcons_Animation 1_06.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f46b.png) | confused, did you interrupt me?     
![StatusIcons_Animation 1_01.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f466.png) | brought something to the village |  ![StatusIcons_Animation 1_07.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f46c.png) | looking for wood
![StatusIcons_Animation 1_02.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f467.png) | can't reach what you want me to | ![StatusIcons_Animation 1_08.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f46d.png) | looking for food  
![StatusIcons_Animation 1_03.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f468.png) | there is no resource nearby | ![StatusIcons_Animation 1_09.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f46e.png) | looking for water 
![StatusIcons_Animation 1_04.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f469.png) | thinking about what I need to do | ![StatusIcons_Animation 1_10.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f46f.png) | looking for gold
![StatusIcons_Animation 1_05.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1f46a.png) | sick, something went wrong | 

___

#### Events

___

##### Rewards

___

![idol.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1d952.png)

The Gods will bestow you with fortune or will demand sacrifices to be made. In the former, an idol will spawn on the map. Have one of your villagers obtain it before time runs out and you will be rewarded with a random resource ! 

___

##### Punishments 

___

You are a toy. The Gods will put you in place with plagues and disaster. You can bribe them by following their demands, by clicking the appropriate button in the HUD (if you have the resources). Be sure to do so before the pentagon timer runs out, the consequences might be severe...

![hud.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1d98f.png)

Plague| Flood | Earthquake
--- | --- | ---
![flies_smaller.gif](///raw/12b/31/z/1d9ef.gif) | ![flood-resize.gif](///raw/12b/31/z/1d9f4.gif) | ![quake-smaller.gif](///raw/12b/31/z/1da01.gif)

___


## Special Features

___

### Procedural Audio

___

The audio for this game is procedural. It is generated on the spot and to prove that, there is a function in the options window that can swap between the generated music and piano music on the fly !

___

### Automated resource gathering state machine

___

I've spent almost a full day on this and it still is not working as well as I want it to. It is surprisingly difficult to instruct an AI to be confused at times !

___

### Pixel art

___

All pixel art was created by me using only 3 gray tones from the Arne64's preset in Pyxel Edit !

___

## Used Software 

___

* Audacity
* Pxyel Edit
* Unity2018.2.15f1 and Visual Studio 2017
* sfbgames.com/chiptone/

___

## Developer's note

___
![drjavasaurus.png](///raw/12b/31/z/1da91.png)


I have been doing game development as a hobby for the last two years now. I am not a "project finisher", but I am an avid prototyper. I wanted to take the challenge and put as much in this game as I could, using a slice of my skills to deliver the best I could in 2 days. I had tremendous fun writing an overly complex game with simple gameplay mechanics. In a way, I created a chainsaw to carve a chicken, breaking the code more than I fixed it. Resource gathering AI and procedural music in 2 days, with loads of side challenges (drag select, delegate events, ... )

Thank you for reading this page, that in itself is appreciation! 

Thank you for the Ludum Dare community. Every issue is a blast ! And I would also like to thank the Twitch community for the fun streams, even early in the morning. Mic-less mind you, as I did not want to wake my son with my crazyness. Yet you guys stuck by my side and cheered me on ! 

Also thanks for the streams that motivated me and helped me finish the project with laughs and enjoyment.

*** https://www.twitch.tv/honestdangames ***

*** https://www.twitch.tv/rocknightstudios ***

*** https://www.twitch.tv/akouo_studios ***

*** https://www.twitch.tv/instafluff ***

*** https://www.twitch.tv/wobblytrout ***

*** https://www.twitch.tv/krassenstein ***


Untill next edition, you can find me at *** _https://www.twitch.tv/DrJavaSaurus_ *** !

___

                            Thank you for your time and effort playing the game. Happy gaming and happy holidays !


___
___

You are a space pirate who successfully infiltrated a space station. Try to escape with as much loot as you can, before the stationary defenses stop your adventure!

entries.title: Rip Apart
entries.description:
In Rip Apart it is your task to get to your destination at the end of each stage to find your peace. On the way to your finish you have to solve various puzzles and overcome dangerous obstacles by sacrificing various parts of your zombie body.

## How to Play
To get to the end of the level you have to use your body parts wisely. Every part can be used just once and has a different kind of skillset you can make use of:
- **1 Head**: Throw in flat gaps you cant enter (Key 5 and then Q)
- **1 Arm**: Throw as a spear to climb walls (Key 2 and then Q)
- **2 Legs**: Dig a hole (Key 3 or 4 then W,W) or leverage stones (Key 3 or 4 then Q)
- **1 Eye**: Throw in small gaps (Key 6 then Q)

![zombietutorial.png](///raw/636/e1/z/1d6e7.png)

Sacrificing parts of your body also makes you smaller which allows you to enter parts of a stage you can't reach as a whole zombie. You can press buttons with any part that can reach the designated button.


## Screenshots
![screen1.png](///raw/636/e1/z/1d726.png)
Just managed to solve a puzzle with a stone

![screen.png](///raw/636/e1/z/1d722.png)
Using head to manage the next obstacle

![screen2.png](///raw/636/e1/z/1d724.png)
About to win the final stage

## Insight
This game was built in Unity2D. It is coded in C# by using Visual Studio. The Graphics are made in Gimp from scratch. 

## Theme
When thinking about "Sacrifices Must Be Made" we thought about sacrifices oneself has to do and not about sacrificing someone else. We built the game around funny mechanics to make this dark sounding theme more joyful.

### Status
The game has currently two stages, which have to be completed in the same run. Every implemented mechanic has some use case. It's developed in a way, to which new mechanics and stages can be added easily in the future.

### Credits
Everything that belongs to the category "Audio" is free-to-use Data, credit goes to: 
- FreqMan: https://freesound.org/people/FreqMan/sounds/25847/
- soundmary: https://freesound.org/people/soundmary/sounds/117628/
- Robinhood76: https://freesound.org/people/Robinhood76/sounds/187632/
- Replix: https://freesound.org/people/Replix/sounds/173126/
- Music: https://www.purple-planet.com Electro Zombie
- chripei: https://freesound.org/people/chripei/sounds/165491/
- sjnewton: https://freesound.org/people/sjnewton/sounds/256566/

entries.title: Monastico:  LD43 entry
entries.description:
Scroll down for game rules if you are in a hurry.

# Background

This was created with the compo restrictions except I took too long to complete it.  I decided to learn a new framework during the compo, which I know is an awful idea, and of course I paid the price by spending most of Saturday futilely working on math and basic camera functionality.

On the plus side, now I have experience with PIXI.js.  I implemented a very basic board/card game framework and put in some basic game rules.

As uploaded, this is a tiny proof of concept of a board/card game idea.  The general concept is of a board game where you may have various strategic paths and options, but periodically rather than only other players blocking you, you are forced to sacrifice an element of the game.

# Opinions Wanted

Since this is such a limited prototype, high ratings are neither expected nor my goal.  However, I would greatly appreciate if you have any feedback on whether an expanded version of this concept might interest you at all, whether in digital or physical form.  If I do more experimentation on the concept, I may also update the art and put a version up on Tabletop Simulator for playtesting.

In general, my ideas for a full version of the game could include concepts such as:

* More players (e.g. 4)
* More stats/resources (e.g. alms, wheat, bread, food, candles, ink, manuscripts, robes, medicine)
* More strategic options (e.g. cards that can be drawn / purchased / drafted)
* More replay value (e.g. different cards / goals / buildings selected each game)
* More interactions (e.g. trading alms for holiness)
* More locations and actions inside the monastery (e.g. carpentry, masonry, gardening, tailoring, cleaning, eating, praying, reading/writing, teaching, performing music, nursing)
* Options outside the monastery (e.g. begging, preaching, visiting, selling, fishing)
* Jobs that could be earned based on stats/resources or affect gameplay (e.g. abbot, prior, lector, cantor)
* More sacrifice options (e.g. sacrificing an entire card, or giving up a stat like reputation entirely, or restricting movement in some other way such as if the garden was more of a universal path between buildings)

You're also welcome to speak up if you think it's a terrible idea!  It helps either way.  :)

# Game Rules

Monastico is a board/card game for 2 players.  You can also click "Start AI" at any time to let a bot play as your opponent.  It should work on mobile phones, except for zooming. 

Each player is a monk performing various tasks in a monastery.  Currently, the monastery only contains a library, kitchen, dormitory, garden, and chapel.  As the seasons change, you must sacrifice even more worldly tasks in order to be more monk-like.

A randomly selected player takes their turn first.  All players start with 5 HP.

On your turn, you must either move to a new building or lose 1 holiness to pass your turn and be idle.  You cannot pass if you have 0 holiness.  Movement is either clockwise or counterclockwise, and if the next building is completely full, you can skip over it.  When you land on a building space, you perform its action.

After every 5 turns, which means 2 for 1 player and 3 for the other, the season will change.  To start the new season, each player must choose something to sacrifice.  For the first season change, either clockwise or counterclockwise movement must be sacrificed.  For the next two season changes, building spaces must be sacrificed.

If you move to a building space that you sacrificed, the effect does not occur, and you can move again on the same turn.

After 20 turns, which means 4 seasons, the game ends.  The player with the most HP + learning + holiness + reputation wins.  Otherwise, there is a tie.

entries.title: Story Simulator
entries.description:
Haven’t you always been wondering how your life could change if you would set different priorities?
You would have to sacrifice your time for different tasks but it could have a huge impact… For the better or for the worse. The only way to find out is by playing our “Life Simulator”. You can see behind the curtain of a somewhat different life and get a brief overview of all the possibilities you’ve got. If that’s not enough for you there are endless ways to personalize your experience by creating your own stories and visualize them with your own drawings. Discover today how puppies do their time management.

## How To Play

Send your villagers to different quests/missions to rescue other villagers that will help you or to hunt boars to feed your village. 
Be prudent, some villagers can be captured or killed, so if you send too little of them the mission could fail.
When they come back they'll be more hungry so keep a good look on your food reserves or they will starve and fight between themselves.
If that happens you can feed them or send the bard to calm them. You will get another one each time you completed 3 quests.

entries.title: City Building Similuator
entries.description:
City Building Similuator

The Goal is to Advance to level 3 with as many sets of four colors as possible (one of each). Each human will have a different color assigned to them.

By building blue schools, you can increase the speed of advancement. Gold Mines will increase your gold production rate.

The population will increase over time and people need more food, causing your hunger bar (green) to decrease more rapidly. If your hunger bar drops to zero, three random citizens will be eaten.

You can build green houses to prevent that. Or... you can sacrifice your citizens for food.


Which citizen is most valuable to you, make your choice.

entries.title: Humanscape
entries.description:
Hey folks,

This is our game about the escape of Humanity from the alien aggressors in the vast depths of space.

![Cover.png](///raw/e18/z/1edd2.png)

## Preambula

The Earth and majority of the human race were destroyed. The remnants had to fly away.

You are the artificial intelligence T0RS10 that takes care of people slumbering in the spaceship that flies towards the Source - the planet of humanity's ancestors.

Thanks to cryo-capsules, everyone's safe and won't age too fast during the flight.

However, there are hazards that you need people's help to deal with. 

The ones that will be woken up will never get back to their cryogenic sleep.

Choose wisely and use your limited resources to protect humanity as good as you can!

![8_optimized3.gif](///raw/e18/z/1d718.gif)

## Controls

**In global overview:**
Click on people and fighters to take over, scroll around to see what's going on

**As Human: **

WASD/Arrows to move around

Space to enter either Cannon Turret or Fighter control

Escape to return to global view (leaving human to just stay in place)

**As Turret:**

Use mouse to scroll around

Hold right mouse button to fire

Q to quit turret control and return to human mode

Escape to return to global view (and enable turret to fire automatically)

**As Fighter**:

WASD/Arrows - accelerate forwards/backwards and rotate in place (asteroids-like)

Space to shoot forward

Q to quit fighter control and return to human mode (if you are above landing spot)

Escape to return to global view (and enable fighter to move around and fire automatically)

![Screen 2.jpg](///raw/e18/z/1d6ee.jpg)

## Authors

**Nebulate.me studio:**

Kutase - *Programming & Design*

Firellon - *Art & Programming*

David Orr - all the music (check out his site here: http://davidorr.net/services/free-stock-audio/) 

Bfxr - sound effects https://www.bfxr.net/ 

![Screen 1.jpg](///raw/e18/z/1d6da.jpg)

Don't forget to breathe from time to time though, no one is safe from burnouts.

entries.title: Alpaca's Redemption
entries.description:
![alpaca_3.png](///raw/d4d/f/z/1d4dd.png)

The Mighty Alpaca warrior fought well during the war, but also caused great suffering. It's time for **redemption!**

Alpaca can **jump**, **dash**, **climb**, **swing** and even **change gravity**, but all of this abilities must be **offered one by one as a sacrifice** to the Alpaca Gods in the Alpos Tower.

Clear a level, **chose which ability you want to sacrifice** to the gods and keep going. **No matter which abilities you sacrifice, you will always be able to clear the next level**... with some dexterity!

![alpaca_2.png](///raw/d4d/f/z/1d4e0.png)

** Best played with a joystick! ** (Most controllers are supported) Be sure to try all the abilities in the training room!

Get to the end of the game to reveal the thrilling ending! **Will alpaca achieve its sought-after redemption?** ;)

![alpaca_4.png](///raw/d4d/f/z/1d58d.png)

** In which order did you sacrifice your abilities? ** Please let us know what you thought of the game! :smile: 

**Alpaca's Redemption** is a Ludum Dare 43 game made by ** a 2 person team ** Javier Peña (Programming) & David Jaumandreu (Game Design, Graphics). Featuring royalty-free music by Kevin MacLeod.

Available on **HTML5, Win & Mac**. Please download it for **better joystick compatibility**.

With each sacrifice he comes closer to his goal, closer to his dream, closer to his faith. And after all it will be worth it... - or will it?

Your main objective is to last 5 minutes while keeping your storage low, make sacrifices and delete files. If you delete files such as the antivirus you are immune to threats. entries.title: Dare to Risk
entries.description:
Dare to Risk is a 3D strategy turn-based Risk-like game, where you fight a bot for whoever destroys all the other's units.
There is a 5x5 map of different random tiles, each having bonuses to either reinforcement power, or a different starting level to start getting reinforcements. Each of your tiles can send units north, east, south or west. You can't leave a tile with 0 units on it once you conquered it. You can conquer an enemy tile if you send at least the number of enemy units + 1 there that way "sacrificing" the same number of units as the enemy and leaving one last standing unit on the conquered tile. A turn is when either the player or the enemy ends his actions, so keep that in mind.

entries.title: Journey through the Abyss
entries.description:
Journey trough the Abyss is top-down shooter in which you will try to reach the Underworld with your soul. However as you go further, you will be required to make sacrifices in order to progress. You will have to weaken your soul to make it capable of traversing further into the abyss. Are you going to do so by decreasing your vitality, or perhaps speed? The choice is up to you.

![screenshot1.png](///raw/d35/61/z/1d72f.png)

Abyss is not a safe place and you will encounter many lost souls represented by different gems. They will try to hunt you down and you need to fight them off and survive for certain amount of time. There are 4 enemy types, agressive red pentagon which will try to quickly approach you and fire burst of 3 shots, exploding orange diamond which will try to collide with you and explode dealing 2 points of damage, slow purple square which will try to keep distance from you and fire homing projectiles and finally big purple triangle which will wander aimlessly and fire 3 homing projectiles every so often. In order to win you need to survive 3 rounds.

![screenshot2.png](///raw/d35/61/z/1d733.png)

I had barerly any time during this Ludum Dare so the game is very simple and lacking a lot of special effects and mechanics that I wanted to add in. While this was my least stressful Ludum Dare, it was also my least enjoyable one. However I'm still glad that I managed to make game in the given time frame and while I'm not completely satisfied with the result I decided to post it anyway, to not "break the streak". Please leave your opinion in the comments below if you get chance to play my game!

![screenshot3.png](///raw/d35/61/z/1d738.png)

entries.title: Vikrifice
entries.description:
# Game link: https://lucidus.itch.io/vikrifice

![COVER (1).png](///raw/886/e1/z/1ee71.png)

### Why the viking is in tropics?!
These are the early adventures of the vikings. They were sacrificing the most dangerous beasts like pigs, goats and others to their gods. And these very gods were choosing the next place to sacrifice. This time, our brave viking with helmet on his eyes needed to go far far away to make the sacrifice. The animals which he needed were hidden by the enemies in caves! And from these caves only one thing could get them out: THE MEOW OF A KITTEN!

### From our team
We did it! It is our first LD Jam! In 72 hours we created 5 levels where you can completly immerse in real viking world. The whole truth about they real hunting is shown in this very game! After the game you will know how vikings were using kittens to hunt the most dangerous beasts!
You can be sure that you will need to sacrifice a lot to pass these levels! 

You'll find there the most endangered species like pigs, goats, sheeps and MORE!

And did you know that in the end there are **TWO endings?!** Which one you choose?! 

(hint: choose the right one) 

(hint 2: there is no right one! hahaha!)

P.S. The game uses saves so you can come back and play further!

Btw we made a **poll** to find out what happened to you on 5. level if you managed to play that long! It would be awesome for us to know the answer of this question. The poll is here: [link](https://www.strawpoll.me/16978464)

Everything inside this game is created within 72 hours, including idea, mechanics, art, music, sound effects, levels and code!

We hope you'll love it as much as we do. ;)


### Controls
We think the **controls** are intuitive but we'll write it here:

- **Move**: **A/D** or **Arrow Keys!**

- **Jump**: **Space!**

- **Double jump**: Press space and than second time when you need it!

- **Pick up** / **put down** pigs and other very endangered species: **E!**

- **Sacrifice**: **Q!** (Only near the altar and don't sacrifice the kitten you bully!)

- **Have fun**: **Just play!** :P

- Hearts = your life (the level will be restarted if you lose all of them)

- Skulls = collectables


Are you stuck? Are you lost? No worries! Here are maps for the levels: [link](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/vikrifice/are-you-stuck-or-lost-here-are-maps-for-our-levels)

### Some gameplay gifs

#### Meet our animals which volunteered to be sacrificed!
![walkWithAnimals3.gif](///raw/886/e1/z/1eea2.gif)

#### Meet our hunting friend! The ancient technique to lure the animals!
![huntTheGoat.gif](///raw/886/e1/z/1eecc.gif)

#### We present the Vikrifice Easter Egg! Level 5: The SKULL ISALND!
![Level5.gif](///raw/886/e1/z/1f4f1.gif)

### Walkthrough

#### Level 1 walkthrough:
https://youtu.be/qG1KEh2-dsM

#### Level 2 walkthrough:
https://youtu.be/HKDDIEQbMv0

**Change log**
We needed to update the game in two places:
- there was a typo in the game over information, it was scaled down in the big screen and had wrong color which was almost unreadable
- in Level 2 we got rid of one spikes which we found behind flowers. That was causing sudden death of the Player because of the wrong collison there :/

entries.title: aberth: simple text based choose your own adventure
entries.description:
![Choose GIF.gif](///raw/d93/c/z/1d70f.gif)
For this Ludum Dare we tried something different.  We tried to make a choose your own adventure game using Google Forms (we really wanted to make a game out of something that doesn't make games... could that count as a sacrifice?).  We didn't get the images done, and images on half of the game didn't feel right, so we aren't including them.  All you do is read and choose.  No controls to understand.  Read and choose.  Make sure to hit next once you have made your decision.

https://goo.gl/forms/37MSPfAoecI4bbYY2


==============================

I teach Game Design to students at a Continuation High School in Central Coast California.  Every year we do two game jams as a team.  Me + 12-14 students enter my room Friday and don't leave until Sunday when we have a game to publish.  They are usually not very good, but we have accomplished something.  This is one of those games.

If you want to see the other game that was completed, check out:
https://fuzzmonkey.itch.io/are-you-proud

Either way, remember this is a beginning class.

entries.title: Fist of Wrath
entries.description:
# Game is 100% made on Manjaro Linux

Pesky humans forgot how to properly obey to their only patron! They can't understand that **sacrifices must be made**. It's time to teach them the old ways.

![tutor.png](///raw/80e/2/z/1f4ad.png)This game gave me a very good nostalgia and I think I played it a bit longer than I should've.

Concept itself is nothing innovative, but it is executed very well. Polishing is great, I also really like shop that gives you progression between play sessions.

I don't know any technical background of the game so I don't know if it is possible, but I think that the game would fit mobiles very well.

Overall, great job, keep it up.
(As I didn't have time to include tutoral in the game, I have to do it here)

You control fist of angry god and your goal is to destroy all non-believers before they kill you with their ignorance (and cannons).
** Screenshots were made in enhanced post-LD version, graphics in LD version is a bit simpler. **
![screen1.png](///raw/80e/2/z/1f4ae.png)
Humanity inevitably grows and expands, your goal is to stop them.
![screen3.png](///raw/80e/2/z/1f4af.png)This game gave me a very good nostalgia and I think I played it a bit longer than I should've.

Concept itself is nothing innovative, but it is executed very well. Polishing is great, I also really like shop that gives you progression between play sessions.

I don't know any technical background of the game so I don't know if it is possible, but I think that the game would fit mobiles very well.

Overall, great job, keep it up.
![screen4.png](///raw/80e/2/z/1f4b0.png)
Currently game includes 6 small levels.

I've started this project at 03.12, skipping one day of jam. However, that didn't stop me from finishing my game (but it stopped me from polishing it).
![screen5.png](///raw/80e/2/z/1f4b1.png)
Resources used:
- https://opengameart.org/content/village-buildings (CC0)
- https://opengameart.org/content/pixel-dungeon-iso-tileset (CC0)
- Sounds were generated using SFXR

# Warning
Note that there is post Ludum Dare version (enhanced one) with in-game tutorial (first screenshot in post) and some better graphic assets from my friend. There are no gameplay changes, only visual ones - new background, trees, clouds, flowers, etc.
LD Version:
![ld.jpg](///raw/80e/2/z/1f6b7.jpg)
Post LD Version
