entries.title: Space Hopper
entries.description:
Synopsis


Space Hopper is a little physics-based 2D platformer, in which you must slingshot your astronaut across the terrain of an alien world, trying to reach a teleporter in order to return to their ship. But think carefully before you do anything!  Your two most important resources, fuel and oxygen, are limited! Take too long and you'll suffocate, but jump too often and you may find yourself stranded. Fortunately for you, this planet seems to have these little orbs of energy, that give you a little bit more oxygen  in your reserves, so it's not all doom and gloom!

Your scoring for each level is based on how much time you have remaining until you run out of oxygen by the time you land inside the teleporter. So, do you sacrifice a few extra jumps to give yourself a faster route to the teleporter, or do you take the safer route you know will have you clear the level, but at the cost of a better score. The choice is yours to make!

![Screen01.PNG](///raw/39e/d/z/1d6c0.png)


![Screen02.PNG](///raw/39e/d/z/1d6c4.png)


How To Play


In order to fling your astronaut around the level, simply click anywhere on the astronaut's body, and drag the mouse outwards from there. The further you drag, the more power the shot will have. When you release the mouse, the astronaut will shoot off in the opposite direction you dragged in, like a cosmic slingshot!

https://imgur.com/a/a5xjU8o

That's all you need to know, but you make want to know that you can quickly restart any level by pressing R, and you can also return to the level select screen from any level by pressing L.

Credits

Art & Animation: Ayo Norman-Williams

Scripting, Sound, & Implementation: Thomas Robson

Music & Game Concept: Dalvia Dhillon

entries.title: The Eternal Cold
entries.description:
## IMPORTANT NOTE
Please read the how to play section before playing, as this game is fairly complicated and there is no ingame tutorial or help section.

## The Game
The world has been hit by a flash freeze, and in an attempt to avoid crazy looters and mobs you fled to the country. Patrolling the icy wastes you come across a camp of people, and due to your natural charisma, you soon become the leader. Take charge in this life or death situation, utilising special individuals skills in order to survive. But you'll have to sacrifice others in order for the whole colony to survive, who will you pick? Will this freeze ever end, and if it does will you and your colonists be there to see it?

This is our 5th entry into Ludum Dare, and we may have been a bit over ambitious with the scope of the game and what we wanted to achieve. What we have now is a great base to build off, and to make an actual game from, but we hope you enjoy what we managed to make in the 3 days! Things like the build menu and scavenging we would of built more on if we had the time, however this is definitely something we want to work on more in the future so things like that will be hopefully be built up then. It would be greatly appreciated if you commented about bugs you found so we can improve them in the future!

## How to play (VERY IMPORTANT)
![Screen 1.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d57d.png)
This is the general camp overview. On here you will find the happiness of the camp on the left, the food, water and total people in the camp, as well as the current day number along the bottom. The next day button in the bottom right to progress the day, the actions button on the right hand side of the screen, and the quit button in the top right. As well as this information, you can hover your cursor over the firepit in order to see how many days of fire you have left. Finally for this screen, you can click on any colonist or specialist to find out more about them.

![Colonist.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d58e.png)
This is a colonist who can be assigned to do simple tasks like gathering resources and scavenging for food.

![Specialist.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d590.png)
This is a specialist who has a unique ability, which can be found out by clicking on them. All specialists look the same, whereas colonists have different coloured shirts usually. You can also only have a max number of specialists, which unlike the colonist max number cannot be changed, meaning you have to balance their abilities and sacrifice those you don't want to the cold. If you let a specialist go you will never see them again!

![Specialist Window.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d59e.png)
Example of a specialist window.

![ActionsMenu.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d5a5.png)
If you click the arrow on the right hand side of the main page, you will be took to this, the actions menu. From here you can assign colonists to do a variety of tasks, including gathering resources, getting firewood to keep the fire alive, relaxing to increase happiness and so on. If you use the top tabs to navigate this menu, as well as the colony tab, you have the scavenge tab where you can assign colonists to a party to send out to try and find supplies. The more colonists you assign the higher chance you have of succeeding, however interesting events may occur. Finally, the build tab is where you can select tents to be build to increase the max amount of colonists you are allowed in the camp.
# Left click to select the build and right click to place! Notice: After feedback it should be made obvious that scavenging is a lot better than hunting for food, hunting is for leftover colonists if you have already sent a scavenge.

![EventWindow.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d5d3.png)
The final thing to note is this, which is an event. Events can occur randomly at the beginning of the day, and you have to choose between different options to respond to the event. Each option will end up with a different outcome some better than others, and a 4th option is available if you have a suitable specialist to perform it.

## Screenshots:
![Screen 5.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d5fd.png)
![Screen 1.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d5ff.png)
![Screen2.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d600.png)
![Screen 3.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d602.png)
![Screen 4.png](///raw/318/5/z/1d604.png)

## Credit
- RokaJosh: Programming & UI Art
- Thomu: Art & Music
- momeG: The base for the colonists and specialists, can be found under links.

## Links
- Our Company Website: http://www.jagtekgames.co.uk/
- Our Company Twitter: https://twitter.com/JaGTeK_Games
- RokaJosh Twitter: https://twitter.com/RokaJosh
- Thomu Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/thomuofficial
- momeG's free to use micro human: https://mome-g.itch.io/micro-human

## Tools
- Unity 2018.2.18f
- Photoshop CC
- Piskel
- Ableton 9.5

## Change Log
- Had to fix 2 bugs regarding event probability and maximum working colonists.

entries.title: Demonstration Went Wrong !
entries.description:
That's it, the ludum is coming to an end !
The salty corporation is proud to show you its new game, an event simulator, or civil war if you prefer. The goal is to block as many people as possible, we can block civilians (non-integrated), bicycle or cars but civilians will not hesitate to crush you to pass.
So it will be necessary to be careful not to sacrifice too much man otherwise nobody will join your demonstration. But it will be necessary to pay attention, the police are there also to put you KO and stop your demonstration.

How to play? Here is the tutorial :

-You can select your units by dragging and dropping and then press "A" at the position where you want the units to go.
-The more your influence score goes up, the more supporters you will join. You have different types of unity that are 
 improvable with influences:

  - Classic character of the game
  - Yellow vest, stops the cars more easily. Obtainable by pressing the number "2" key on the numeric keypad
  - The jackets, resists more easily the policeman. Obtainable by pressing the number "3" key on the numeric keypad
  - Launcher, do more damage long distance. Obtainable by pressing the number "4" key on the numeric keypad
  - The telephone, brings back more influence. Obtainable by pressing the number "6" key on the numeric keypad
  - The breaker, do more damage at short distance. Obtainable by pressing the number "6" key on the numeric keypad
  - The breaker +, do more damage at short distance than the breaker. Obtainable by pressing the number "7" key on the 
    numeric keypad
  - The launcher +, do more damage at long distance than the launcher. Obtainable by pressing the number "8" key on the 
    numeric keypad
  - Shields, do more damage and are much more resistant than other units. Obtainable by pressing the "9" key on the 
    numeric keypad


This game was made by a team of 6 people:

-Assié Louis
-Boyaval Valentine
-Eudeline Quentin
-Lenain Lea
-Liebaert Valentin
-Rombouts Flavien

entries.title: Spacebrawl
entries.description:
## THE STORY 

Not so long ago, in  a galaxy that isn't so far away a smuggler lived. He stole a cargo from really wrong people. And now, to get away from the chase, he will have to sacrifice the most valuable thing he has - his spaceship.


## THE GAME 
Disassemble useless parts of the ship into matter to shoot enemy spaceships and restore gaps in hull of the spacecraft. Turrets have limited range! If you can't hit an enemy try another turret!


## CONTROLS 
Left mouse button - to disintegrate part of the ship in matter.

Right mouse button - to recover the destroyed part of the ship.

Press "E" on turret console to enter turret mode.

Space to jump

Fixed the bug with inverted controls in turret mode.

It's my fifth Ludum Dare, the third published game and the first one I worked on completely alone (@gaschrom-music-person (usually my partner) made the music though).

Have fun!

entries.title: Cowboys Are Busy
entries.description:
**I'm sorry, but this project is not finished yet. We use this post as a place holder, in case we don't have access to the LD site on the submission day.**

The project is WIP, but you *have* access to the prototype version.

## Features

- Local 2-player cooperative, play as cowboys, fighting against aliens who kidnapped people in the town.
- Use different abilities or powerful alien weapons, at some costs.
- Make sacrifices if necessary. But sometimes people only remember the one who save the world instead of those who make sacrifices trying to do the same. And by *sometimes*, I mean *in this game*.
- Enjoy my poor English skill in this game. It's true that I created an alien language in this game based on my English homework.

entries.title: Running Low
entries.description:
# Running Low
### Hydrochloric Studio
#### Daniel Grinshpon

The concept of the game is that you are a stranded robot with limited energy being attacked by rogue units. Your health and ammo share a single energy pool that you must conserve, but also use if you want to live. The idea is that in order to survive, you must sacrifice your health, but you have to be careful. If you run out of energy, you die. Good luck!

![RLC.png](///raw/70d/91/z/1d707.png)

Note: If you experience an issue where the window is sized improperly (i.e taking up more than your monitor), then right click on the game executable, select properties, then in the compatibility tab disable full screen optimizations and enable high dpi override scaling behavior. This is not an issue with the game, rather, it's that Windows 10 sucks and likes to configure windows in the worst way possible, particularly on high resolution screens.

##### Controls
- WASD -> control movement and menus
- Space or Enter -> select menu option
- Left Click -> shoot

entries.title: No Brakes on the Train of Life
entries.description:
You stumble upon a shocking spectacle: a train running at full speed on the rails, its brakes not working.  Not far ahead, a number of people tied down on the tracks.

You notice a switch lever close by so you run up to it to avert the tragedy, but you notice that on the side track there is one single person lying down shackled by ropes and unable to move.

Now that you've witnessed this scene, you cannot run away from the responsibility. Whatever you choose to do now, whether you decide to pull the lever or not, whether you stay and act or run away in cowardice, if somebody dies it will be because of your choice. In life not everything has a happy end, some sacrifices must be made.

Can you bear the burden?
The goal of the game is to, in each level, let the train go by with the least victims.

CONTROLS:
Arrows/WASD/Left stick: Move
E/F/Enter/Space/LMB/A button: Operate the lever

Code by prettysober (https://twitter.com/sfdstrandberg)
Art by SquareAnon (https://twitter.com/squareanon)
Music by Lobo Roco (Free Music Archive)
Sound effects by freesound.org

But that's exactly where you can shine as a loyal believer! Sacrifice everything you may find around you and help Zeus succeed! 

Attention: Like every good Boss, Hades gets more strength if he gets low on health! So be prepared for this!

This is my (Kromzem) 2nd Ludum Dare Jam Entry but it's the first entry I made with my wife (Manti) <3 We both were brave enough to try something new to us, so she was learning how to pixel and I was learning how to use Unity. But we can say: Our jam went pretty well and we are both proud of what we made. We hope you enjoy our game and leave a kind comment ;)

entries.title: Ludumiumings
entries.description:
![Screen Shot 2018-12-03 at 22.40.55.png](///raw/7d2/3/z/1d526.png)
Try pronounce the game title 10 times in a row!
![Screen Shot 2018-12-03 at 22.41.07.png](///raw/7d2/3/z/1d527.png)
Instructions
![Screen Shot 2018-12-03 at 22.41.37.png](///raw/7d2/3/z/1d529.png)
Screenshot from the game
![Screen Shot 2018-12-03 at 22.45.25.png](///raw/7d2/3/z/1d52d.png)
Another screenshot from the game

# How to play

Help the miners transport the Ludumium trough the cave. You might need to sacrifice some Ludumium or even a worker or two to succeed.

Use your mouse to play. Release miners with the three buttons. Each type have different speed and carries different amount of Ludumium. If you want to reach a high score you might want to plan the game a bit sending out the right combination of miners.

### How much high score did you get?

Post them in the comments :)


### Tools used:

- Unity 2018.3.0
- Aseprite
- Ableton Live
- Gimp

All graphics, music, audio and code was created during the Jam.
No external sources or AssetStore downloads was used.

## Credits

Programming - Nicklas Löf

Graphics - Mathias Lindfeldt

Intro Music - Nicklas Löf

Game Music - Mathias Lindfeldt

Audio effects - Mathias Lindfeldt




# Running the game

On Mac you have to hold down ctrl or shift when clicking the app-file to allow unsigned executable to execute.
On Windows you might get a Smartscreen notification. Click More info and the Run anyway button.

Oh and sorry about no quit key...  On Mac hit cmd+q to quit. On Windows alt+tab and right click to quit


# Links

Nicklas (Intro music) has an album released on Spotify and Apple music if you want to check it out:

[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/album/7L4PZBI0z48SWIU9J5Xym2?si=rLZ4XXm1QQ-MP45PZECBwQ)

[AppleMusic](https://exit.sc/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fitunes.apple.com%2Fse%2Falbum%2Ftraces-of-light%2Fid1245082917%3Fl%3Den)

entries.title: Sacrilicious
entries.description:
![LD43test_8Algvc4Lcs.jpg](///raw/a74/z/1d549.jpg)![LD43test_njwrqZlrfE.jpg](///raw/a74/z/1d54e.jpg)![LD43test_LutfPvpPoU.png](///raw/a74/z/1d554.png)![LD43test_0m5GIgugWm.png](///raw/a74/z/1d556.png)

​Another peaceful day draws to a close on the island.

As high priest, the tribespeople always gather at this time to listen to you deliver the word of the volcano god.

Often, these tales are ones of happiness, of helping those in need and filling your heart so full of love that no hate can enter it. Tales the tribespeople remember for generations.

But tonight, they'll remember you for a different reason.

--------

**A&D/Left&Right: Move** 

**Space: Pick up/throw**

--------

Made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 43 "Sacrifices Must be Made".

WebGL version has some timing issues with the music tracks, please download the binaries for the optimal experience!

Assets we used: 
- Unity open source post-processing stack
- Time of Day for the skybox

All other models, art, music and sound effects were created during the 72-hour Jam.

Thanks for playing!  


**The Team**  

[Carl Hughes](http://twitter.com/devilqube): 3D models, sound effects, additional code.  

[Shaun Reed](http://twitter.com/shaunjmr): Music, audio mastering 

[Gareth Williams](http://twitter.com/garethiw): Design, code, stress, panic, weak leadership

[Paul Yendley](http://twitter.com/gredgie): 2D art and animation

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NmUCp_2q0ho

entries.title: Bee Defence
entries.description:
Defend your beehive by sacrificing your bees!

  ---IMPORTANT---
For some reason, audio does not work on the browser version of the game. For the full experience, please download.

How To Play:
![tutorial.png](///raw/b86/e1/z/1f023.png)
Click on the beehive to turn honey into bees
Drag and shoot the bees to either kill the enemy bears or hit the flowers and make the bee into a honey-harvesting worker.

When you have enough honey you can upgrade your bees!
The sign with the flowers will make all your new harvesting bees produce 2 more honey; but be careful. This will sacrifice all your existing harvester bees, and make your bees more expensive in the future.
The sign with the sting will make your bees stronger. Again, this will make you sacrifice your entire bee-army.!

If you're up for a challenge, the current best recorded score is 53!

entries.title: Ethic in the machine
entries.description:
Somewhere in space drift peacefully the Space Station JARVIS THOMSON 12. With 1000 peoples inside, this Station's goal is to allow a human colony to develop and thrive in Space without any outside interferences.
 
All the station is monitored by his automated computer system. Every decision is taken by an AI. Well, almost every decision.

![ld43sc2.png](///raw/865/2/z/1d2cc.png)

You are the Ethic Referee, the Space Station one and only crew member allowed to take critical decisions. Whenever the automated system need to solve an ethical question, you are waken up from your articial sleep to make that decision.

![ld43sc3.png](///raw/865/2/z/1d2cd.png)

For the greater good of the Space Station, will you make the most ethical and humane decisions ? Or, is it even possible ?

entries.title: Long Live The King!
entries.description:
Long Live The King

​In  this unique little game, you control 8 individual grunts in 8 individual windows, who have but one goal - reach the basket that will raise their king to freedom. 

If but one of the grunts is not sacrificed towards the cause, the king cannot be set free to begin his path to the safety of the castle.

Each grunt can leave their own window and traverse the dangerous land between and enter another grunt's window - Adding an entirely new aspect to the term Puzzle Game.

![Titlescreen_LLTK.png](///raw/e02/81/z/1d58b.png)

In this game the Grunt's individual characteristics are as follows:

       - Builder (Builds a horizontal bridge used to traverse across gaps.)
       - Axe (Digs a diagonal path downwards.)
       - Climber (Once he collides with a wall he auto climbs until he reaches the top of the wall.)
       - Rocky (Punches a horizontal path through brown walls)
       - Digger (Digs a vertical hole into the ground to allow you to go from high to low levels quickly.)

And the king just sits on his lift and waits for the grunts to winch him to freedom.

This game also plays directly onto your desktop - So whatever your background image is your background for the game.


Controls: 
    'R' to restart,
    'Esc' to quit,
    'Mouse' Everything else

System Requirements:
    Minimum Screen Resolution of 720p (720 pixels height, 1280 pixels width).


Developer credits:
    Brandon Roberts, 
    Charlotte Roberts, 
    Paul Roberts, 



Music credits:
"Obliteration" Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

entries.title: Shmup'em all
entries.description:
Shmup'em all is a twink stick shooter game where you have to sacrifice one of your power at the end of a level.

In *Dungeons & Curses* you explore a vast array of procedurally generated dungeons and fight against deadly monsters while trying to find your way out. Hello,

Here is our little game we made for this Ludum Dare.
It's not much, we didn't have much time, but it's pretty funny to play.

The idea: 
You have to sacrifice yourself to finish the level. Each time you sacrifice yourself, a block will be placed at your death location.
This way you can build stairs to get over obstacles and gaps.

entries.title: The Feast
entries.description:
You play as a hellish abomination trying to feast on knights and mages in the name of hell. For every blast you sacrifice bit of health. 
The catch is, one blast costs more than one dead body can replenish. So try to play strategically!

Tips:
- You have to kill multiple enemies with one shot
- You can still kill mages through shields, but the blast would be destroyed. Try to kill them from top or bottom
- You are invincible during dash. That said, don't try to ram enemies.
- Once per game you can make a "Last Stand" shot at 0 health

Free stuff we used:

- Tiles, hero and enemies: https://0x72.itch.io/dungeontileset-ii Author — 0x72
- Projectile: https://dannypixel.itch.io/assetspack01-dannypixel Author — DannyPixel
- Shield and health potion: https://uilleaggodwin.itch.io/roguelike-dungeon-asset-bundle Author — UilleagGodwin
- OST https://soundcloud.com/dubmood/dubmood-chiptune

entries.title: Wolf Trouble
entries.description:
# Wolf Trouble
## A Survival Game

Hello everyone. After a brief absence, we (husband & wife) are back with our 4th Ludum Dare entry. We hope you enjoy our little game. Have fun :)

## About LD43
This time, we wanted to make a game according to the theme, but still have some freedom if we felt like it. I think the resulting game has a good connection to theme, as the sheep sacrifice / management mechanics are central to your success in the game.

The theme "Sacrifices must be made" translates to sacrificing / selling your sheep in order to survive in our game. And believe me, you *must* if you want to win :)      

## Instructions
Every night, increasing number of wolves attack your ranch and you must survive the game for 10 nights in order to win. You can kill the wolves, or sacrifice your sheep to them (walk up to your sheep, press F to pick up, press F again to throw). Wolves are easily distracted by sheep and run away after eating their share. However, one sheep can distract and feed up to 3 wolves. While shooting your gun, beware of the crosshair size as it denotes your shot accuracy. You can fire very quick at the cost of accuracy, or take your time and be accurate.

During the day, you can prepare for the night to come. You can buy stuff from the shop, or manage your sheep. Each of your sheep generate steady income every day, but you can decide to sell your sheep for an instant income, or prefer to breed them to increase your sheep for upcoming days. If you breed them, they won't generate income that day.

Manage your sheep, sacrifice them if you must, but survive at all costs.

## Notes

* We created everything ourselves if not explicitly stated.
* Blood effects are taken from Unity VFX pack.
* Icons are from flaticons.com (citation incoming)
* Sound effects are taken from various sources.
* Mac and Linux builds coming soon

entries.title: Ultimate Snackrifice
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/dcb/e1/z/1d767.png)

### 🍌 THE GAME 

Put your inventory management skills to the test in this fridge 'em up!

- Unpack your grocery bag into the fridge!
- Make use of every square of space!
- Be fast and don't let your food spoil!


### 🌭 HOW TO PLAY

In **Ultimate Snackrifice**, you must empty your grocery bag into the refrigerator. Make use of every square! Act fast and try not to let any food spoil.

Tap or click to grab an item from your grocery bag. Drag the item to the right and place it in the fridge. If there's no room, you can place it onto any of the valid square grids in the kitchen. Food spoils fast, so either make space for it quickly or dump it in the trash!

Once your fridge is full, close the door to submit your packing skills to our automated jury. You get points for each item successfully stowed away. Larger and fresher items score bigger! Fresh items give you points, with bonus points awarded for items of Perfect freshness! You lose points for discarded or spoiled items.

![screenshots.png](///raw/dcb/e1/z/1d7b9.png)

### 🍰 CREDITS

Programming by @cloakedninjas | Art by @treslapin | Music by @dorkulon

A bunch of grapes fought for as long as he could. Finally after a weary battle a bunch of grapes succumbed for he was nothing more than a stem. We would have loved to add multiplayer support, as this was our original vision, but as most people won't be able to play with others we decided to make single player our priority. Sadly there wasn't enough time for both.

![vlcsnap-2018-12-05-15h24m31s011.png](///raw/f58/z/1f133.png)

The long-awaited sequel to my last LD entry!

This was actually supposed to be a proper sorta <insert popular creature catching and battling games here> clone but I messed up day 1 and ended up not having enough time to implement more than the catching part, so, Catchey 2!

You catch things!

![vlcsnap-2018-12-05-15h25m05s048.png](///raw/f58/z/1f134.png)

Best played with Knuckles, but will work with any SteamVR compatible headset after you set bindings for it, the vive wands are already set.

You'll just need to set rotation buttons, Walking, Grabbing and "Arm Catch Cube" if you're not on Vive wands or Knuckles controllers.

![vlcsnap-2018-12-05-15h25m40s049.png](///raw/f58/z/1f136.png)

Default bindings are left touchpad/joystick controls locomotion, right touchpad does rotation (through DPAD option in the bindings), grip button does the "Arm Catch Cube" which activates/deactivates the catch cubes (needed for actually catching things) and grabbing is just trigger.

On knuckles Grabbing does nothing since it's powered by the skeleton API! :D 

Hope it's playable because I'm too tired to troubleshoot right now.

entries.title: Sleep Is For The Weak
entries.description:
You are a game developer who entered a game jam(ironic right?) and has 10 hours to finish the programming side of the game. Your enemy? Falling asleep before finishing your game. Sip on your cup of coffee to energize yourself and power through the night. You happen to have a faulty night lamp that turns off every so often, make sure you keep it on by any means necessary(hitting it). Having the lamp off will make you even more drowsy and make you fall asleep faster.

Directions:
Type the code blocks that come up on screen. Stay awake until the countdown goes off. The progress bar indicates how close you are to falling asleep. If the lamp turns on, the progress bar will move quicker so make sure you keep it on. If you are close to falling asleep drink coffee to help you stay awake longer. Note that if you turn your attention away from programming, you will have to type the block of code from the beginning. You need to complete enough code blocks to make a finished game, or else you'll make a buggy game or a incomplete game.

Controls:
Left Mouse Button- Toggle look at lamp, hit lamp
Right Mouse Button - Toggle look at coffee, drink coffee
Space Bar - Toggle keyboard

entries.title: Offret
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/0da/02/z/1d3f0.png)

«I studied philosophy, history of religion, aesthetics. And ended up putting myself in chains. Of my own free will.»

This game is my small and pathetic attempt of an homage to Andrey Tarkovsky’s genius; particularly his “Sacrifice”  masterpiece, which was the last movie Tarkovsky has managed to made in 1986 while he was gravely ill and was preparing himself to die and meet his creator. The movie "Sacrifice" ("Offret" is its original Swedish title) is about a man who finds himself on the edge of nuclear war, and he prays to God to stop it all, to save humanity, and promises to sacrifice all he loves in exchange - including his wife and his children. God hears his prayer, and the protagonist’s turn to fulfill his side of the bargain comes very soon after that.

In my game I’ve tried to capture the feeling of realizing that you have a direct connection with God and to translate Tarkovsky’s deep spiritual intelligence into video game narrative logic. You can use keyboard (z to jump, x to attack, shift to dash), though controller is heavily recommended for the full experience. But most importantly, some parts might feel weird and obscure to the people who haven’t watched the movie, so I cannot recommend enough times to mindfully watch it before playing the game. Even if you are not going to play the game, very few activities in the world are as wholesome and potentially life-changing then watching Tarkovsky’s "Offret" masterpiece and his other movies.

If you have kind words to say, please feel free to send them to valentinshatz@gmail.com. Peace.
​
![sacrifice-andrei-tarkovsky.jpg](///raw/0da/02/z/1d55a.jpg)

entries.title: Overslept
entries.description:
You are a junior angel in charge of making sheep from clouds for people to count and drift off to sleep.
If the sheep is made in time and meets the requirements, the person will count it and stay asleep.

In order to keep the residents in a mountain lodge sleeping well, sacrifices (**sheep!**) MUST be made.
People need to count sheep to fall asleep and they are COUNTING ON YOU to make those sheep!

![Screenshot_01.jpg](///raw/146/a/z/1d1b0.jpg)

## How to play:
1. Grab cloud cotton from the left.
2. Dye it on the bottom.
3. Put the ingredients in the oven on the top.
4. Deliver on the right.

Deliver as soon as possible!

### More tips
- Press W A S D or ARROW KEYS to move around.
- Hit SPACE BAR to interact.
- If a wanted sheep isn't delivered in time or an incorrect sheep is delivered, someone will wake up and turn on a light
- Sheep will bake in 5 seconds, but sheep will be burnt if left too long
- Deliver before the sheep is no longer wanted.
- Throw out whatever you don't want in the bin at the top left.


![Screenshot_02.jpg](///raw/146/a/z/1d1b2.jpg)

Did I mention it gets harder and harder real fast?

The game ends when the light turns on in all _five_ windows in the mountain lodge.

Hope you enjoy making 🐑 🐑 🐑 🐑 🐑

entries.title: Brink
entries.description:
_[Jump to download](https://bottersnike.itch.io/brink) (Mouse recommended)_

## How long can you survive at the _brink_ of death?

![brinkcover.png](///raw/d1e/6/z/1eaff.png)

> Alone on a landmass, you wake up next to a beach. Bleeding out. Without conventional medicine available, you turn to more.. questionable.. means of survival.

Brink is a survival game where anything you do comes with a cost: your life. As time progresses, the environment around you increases in hostility for no logical reason other than it makes gameplay more interesting :wink: 

The standard map is split up into multiple altitude-based sections such as the beaches, the mountain-tops and the underwater platforms. Due to map sizes, not all maps will contain all regions; restarting the game will regenerate a new map for you. _(Alternatively, activate the development console with the backtick key and restart the world with `gs.start()`)_

In-game help is available by pressing `h`. The two undocumented keys are the grave to toggle the development console and F11 to toggle fullscreen.

Note: Just because the game has tiles doesn't mean it's "minecraft-esque" as a load of people have said. In fact, Minecraft was used a whole lot of "not at all" in the design and dev.

Before I balanced a few things, I let 8th play around. Needless to say, things have since been balanced significantly.
![Li9FPH[1].png](///raw/1ad/e1/z/1c005.png)

And now for a mandatory screenshot because who doesn't love screenshots

![python_2018-12-02_15-24-26.png](///raw/1ad/e1/z/1baeb.png)

Yeah.. I think the other one captures actual gameplay a little better :stuck_out_tongue_closed_eyes: 

## Credits
* Lead: Bottersnike
* Programming: Bottersnike
* Concepts: Bottersnike
* Graphics: 8thKingdom
* Music: 8thKingdom, Hans Shi
* Play Testing: Botter, 8th, Botter's Classmates and Members of the ChiP Discord server

_If you're on \*nix, it's worth giving [the README](https://github.com/Bottersnike/Brink/blob/master/README.md) a once-over to make sure you have the python modules._

entries.title: Switching Personalities
entries.description:
**This release has been made 37 hours after the theme reveal.**

This is a platformer game where you have 7 personalities and each personalities have its own power. You are in the cloud kingdom and one day, you will know the hidden part of this kingdom: the god of this world want to eat personalities. In order to satisfy him, you will give im one of your personalities. 

We didn't have time to finish the game but the goal was to make the player learn all this mecanics and remove them from the player one by one so he should start learing deep tricks with one personality that could replace what he lost. In this version, you will only lose one personality and one is already disabled at the beginning.

CONTROLLER RECOMMANDED

Controls:
 - WASD (or joystick) - Move
 - Space - Jump
 - Shift (or Y) - Open the personality switch menu (navigate in it with your mouse or with the joystick, close it by releasing the key)
 - CTRL (or X) - Use your personality activable power (when it has one)
 - Enter (or B) - Read signs

entries.title: Elder Loop
entries.description:
![ecran_simple2 (1).png](///raw/ae3/d1/z/1d3e1.png)

In ‘Elder loop’ you play an older wizard named Demange. The goal of the game is to slain as much enemies as you can, each monster will increase one of the 4 main stats you have. You can’t go higher than 5 for a given stat. 
Each enemy you slain will give you some point for your score and some Sanity … More you kill more you will lose sanity, when the bar is full the monster will be harder to kill.
At any time when you have 5 of a given stat you will be able to **sacrifice** these to gain a bonus for your scoring.
When you have slain all the monsters in the dungeon the game will restart, you will keep all of your stats, points etc … The madness will never end !


If there is a bug (no monster for example), press F5, you'll keep your stats ;)

![screen.jpg](///raw/ae3/d1/z/1d3bc.jpg)

![Capture.PNG](///raw/ae3/d1/z/1d3c1.png)
This is Demange our bald wizard ! He is awesome, he can throw some magic shit ! He is pretty weak, and will probably die if he gets hit by anything but well … That's why he needs to absorb life source from other !


__________

But seriously ... it was our first Jam and we are proud of being able to deliver something.

Of course, it's wayyyyy different of what we were planning at first but we had a lot of fun making it.

Enjoy.

entries.title: Olympus is Falling
entries.description:
# Details
Its been awhile since I participated in a Ludum Dare, the last one was [LD34](http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-34/?action=preview&uid=29677)! I went solo this route, but went for the Jam to have an extra day. Initially I wanted to go with a Joe vs the Volcano route, but saw quite a few preliminary games going that way so changed it up and went a Greek mythology style. Spent a large portion of this relearning how to UV map a model, unwrap it, and then paint everything using Photoshop. I have some audio recording equipment but I didn't have time to do anything of my own, so the music and sound effects are from a freebie library that I had found, as such I disabled scoring for all audio.

# Game Idea
The idea is that Mount Olympus is under siege and that you must sacrifice falling objects from the gods to repower them, if any of the gods fall (altar timer runs out) you lose. I went with a simpler idea this year since its been awhile since I made anything.

# How to play
Run around using WASD, Cursors, or Left click with your mouse to move. Pick up items and drop them off at their matching altar. 

- Arrows -> Athena
- Lightning Bolts -> Zeus
- Swords -> Ares
- Tridents -> Poseidon

#### Tools used:
1. Unity 2018.18.f1
2. Photoshop CS5.1
3. Audacity
4. Maya 2017

entries.title: Learn to Die
entries.description:
![splashscreenCompressed.jpg](///raw/cba/f1/z/1bc4f.jpg)

# About this Game
Learn to Die is a game about sacrificing intelligent citizens to ensure your dictatorship.
Make the right choices and kill off citizens who are smart enough to see through your totalitarianism.
Beware, spotted kills have consequences...!

# Scenario and Goal
**_Note:_** *The following text can also be found in-game*

November 1962. The international commitee plans on conducting a unified test of intelligence in
every country of the world in 10 years. The in comparison smartest country will receive
unlimited funding on every project planned. You are leading a dictatorship and your interest
in citizen espionage is big - the only thing missing is funding for a secret surveillance
program...


# Tutorial
**_Note:_** *The following text can also be found in-game*

- Have the highest average intelligence (range 1 to 6) of all countries by November 1972.


- Upgrade buildings to speed up learning process of citizens and generate more money. Click on a building to display options and information.


- Every citizen is working at a work facility and studying at a school facility.


- Citizens with an intelligence of 5 or greater have a chance of seeing through your dicatorship and will try to emigrate(signalized by an exclamation mark over their head).


- Have a citizen killed for ☭200 by clicking on him. This ensures that the average intelligence of an other country won't rise.


- If the kill is spotted (by a nearby citizen), intelligence of all citizens is raised by +0.4 and you will get a penalty of ☭500.


- Click on the monument to view your current status.

# Screenshots
![2.png](///raw/cba/f1/z/1d388.png)

![1.png](///raw/cba/f1/z/1d38c.png)

![3.jpg](///raw/cba/f1/z/1d39b.jpg)

# Credits
- Programming - Pascal Wohlwender
- Visuals - Lewis Beauchamp
- Music and Audio - Nakarin Srijumrat (https://twitter.com/Nakarinn_)

entries.title: Sweet Tooth Scribbler
entries.description:
Let your scribbler have doughnuts and sacrifice its health for mood, or let it have broccoli and sacrifice its mood for health?

Either way, sacrifices must be made if your scribbler is going to scribble up and publish awesome classics about your legendary deeds to increase your reputation in the material world, since it ever only thinks positively of you if it is happy.

You don't have to feed your scribbler when the stomach bar is full. In fact you can't, but when you do feed, it'll either lose health or mood.

entries.title: Long life the king!
entries.description:
## About

THIS GAME IS PLAYABLE! :joy:

## Aim

Help your king to cross the level.

## Description

You must make sure that your king  goes through the level without falling into the traps that dot it. Do not hesitates to sacrifice yourself into the traps before your king falls into them!

## Controls

Use WASD to move and space to jump

## About the game

A 2D platform game where you control a character to sacrifice into traps to deactivate.

- You win by deactivating all the traps that can kill your king
- You lose when your king die.
- More than simply finishing the level, you can win with level stars
 - The less sacrifices you make, the more Yellow stars you get
 - If you finish the level before your king, you get a Purple star

## About the levels

This game is compound by three levels.

- The first level aims to help the player to discover game mechanics. This level is easy to finish with 3 Yellow stars but the Purple star is quite hard to get.
- The second level is a bit tricky, but you can easily get all the stars (maybe with some retries :wink:)
- The third level is much harder to finish (but still finishable with the Purple star, trust me, I made it) but it will not easy to get the 3 Yellow stars (trust me I tried a lot and did not get a single one). 


## What is NOT in the game

- Pretty graphics :cry:
- Cool audio
- Multiple player types to produce different effects on the traps (We think it would be very fun)
- More traps!
- More levels!

**HAVE FUN!**

entries.title: Oh Those Bloody Angels!
entries.description:

(WEBGL VERSION NOT PLAYTESTED AND PROBABLY FULL OF BUGS, PLEASE PLAY DOWNLOADED VERSION) (WEBGL VERSION HAS A BUG WHICH GIVES YOU INFINITE FOLLOWERS, DOWNLOADED VERSION DOESN'T, AGAIN PLEASE PLAY DOWNLOADED)

HEY THERE! YOU ARE A LEADER OF A SATANIC CULT THAT HAS MANY FOLLOWERS AND IS BEING ATTACKED BY ANGELS SENT BY GOD.

MECHANICS & CONTROLS:
WASD OR ARROW KEYS TO MOVE

LEFT MOUSE CLICK TO SHOOT BLOOD BALL WHICH KILLS ANGELS (WITH 1 OR 2 HITS) BUT TO SHOOT YOU HAVE TO SACRIFICE ONE OF YOUR FOLLOWERS, AT THE END OF THE ROUND (WHICH ENDS WHEN THE TIMER HITS ZERO OR WHEN YOU RUN OUT OF HEALTH) YOU WILL GAIN FOLLOWERS BASED ON HOW MANY ANGELS YOU KILLED. YOUR SHOTS PIERCE ONCE, SO TRY TO AIM TO HIT 2 ANGELS AT ONCE IN ORDER TO CONSERVE FOLLOWERS.

RIGHT MOUSE CLICK WILL SUMMON A PENTAGRAM (WHICH YOU CAN ONLY SUMMON 3 TIMES PER ROUND AND LASTS FOR 15 SECONDS). THIS PENTAGRAM DAMAGES ANGELS THAT STEP ON IT, SO IF YOU ARE RUNNING LOW ON FOLLOWERS, USE IT AND TRY TO TRICK ANGELS ONTO STEPPING ON IT.

THERE ARE 2 TYPES OF ANGELS:
1- FOLLOWS YOU AND TRIES TO MAKE
PHYSICAL CONTACT TO DAMAGE YOU.
2-SHOOTS BALLS OF HOLY WATER AT
YOU WHICH DAMAGE YOU.

GOOD... LUCK...

entries.title: Skill yourself
entries.description:
Skill Yourself is a platformer-like game. Events take place in an ancient Greece. You play as a bull who was supposed to be sacrificed to Zeus during annual ceremony but was so stubborn and eager to live that he turned into an anthropomorphic creature: half-bull half-human. Whatever higher power that turned him into this creature it
s also granted him magic to use it against bloodthirsty greeks. But with great power comes great responsibility as we know and this case isn't an exception. Although magic gives our hero power to demolish anyone who stands in his way it's a way too great power for someone who was an ordinary bull a few moments ago. Every magic spell provides a way to crush your foes but also represents a threat for out hero's life. So in order to survive and reach his ultimate goal — defeat Zeus to stop animal sacrifices — this half-man half-bull must be very cautious and aware of magical danger.

About a game:
Game was written on a Python with PyGame framework. Perhaps it was the greatest sacriface that was made during development process. Unfortunately, we haven't realized negative effects of the spells because we have ran out of time.

entries.title: How to ruin your life in 48 hours
entries.description:
HOW TO RUIN YOUR LIFE IN 48 HOURS! –You can try yourself as LD game developer 
48 hours, Only You and LD …. or NOT?

You have so many friends, relatives, daily tasks to do – you’re just a human being, and everything gets in the way of developing a game. So what will you sacrifice - your basic human needs or the game? 

Any action takes time and affects the end of the game development. Will you be a game developer, will you have a healthy relationship, or maybe ... find the time for everything?  

Eat, drink, sleep, answer calls and most importantly, do not forget about the game, because you have only 48 hours before the release.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VguELBhKyA0

**Controls**

- W/A/S/D – Movement
- E – Select Items
- Q – Select Phone
- Left Mouse Button – Click

entries.title: Bow-wow Before God
entries.description:
![Xn889KVBRO.gif](///raw/0af/e1/z/1d367.gif)
Welcome, Omnipawtent Overwoofer! You have been created for one purpose and one purpose only: to oversee to the needs of the Pupreme Being themself, DogGod! In order to do your job, you must manage the fast-paced demands of organizing 3 kinds of sacrifices and dealing with countless natural disasters (signified by a warning siren and a flashing "BLESS!!" button to let you stop the disaster by performing a Miracle), one at a time for each continent of Followers on planet Furth: Human Sacrifice, Animal Sacrifice, and Special Sacrifice! Each type of Sacrifice will give you the related type of Sacrifice Point, which you can redeem at the Sacrifice Shop. But keep in mind that with Special Sacrifice points, while you can buy your way to temporary mood boosts for DogGod and it'll keep your Followers happier, DogGod's stats will go down faster. If you permanently satisfy DogGod, you win! If any of their stats drop to 0, though, you're fired! Can you keep up, or will you be a disappointment to your adorable creator?

This was my very first game jam event & I'm proud of where I got even if I had a 15 hour delay from catching up on homework, and while I don't consider it "done" since there's a lot more polish I want to add, it's nothing a bit of post-jam ironing out can't fix after semester's over. I was going to keep polishing and finagling up until the submission deadline, but I am so physically exhausted that I was falling asleep while playtesting it, so I'm gonna go ahead and get this submitted now. Can't wait to go forth and play everyone's games later!

I do have a post-jam want list for it, that hopefully I can pursue:

-More music

-Fancier graphics/scripted animations

-A tutorial

-A proper menu/win/lose screens that don't end or quit the game abruptly

-Just y'know, more polish in general


Made with:

Coding: GameMaker Studio 2

Music: LMMS 1.1.3

entries.title: Feed those monsters!

## Help little creatures to feed monsters on their way out!

**Controls**: A, S, D, F - for different resources

**Goal**: Pass through all caves on their way out. Each cave contains a monster, who needs to be fed.

**TIP**: Pay attention to little creatures' talking and to environment! You can sacrifice a team mate when resources run out.

**Creatures are guessing! Take attention on environment! You need to guess what creature in the darkness as well based on environment! Sorry for not making it clear!**


Game contains highscores! Lets see who can save all team!

# Tools
- **Code**: In-house C++ engine
- **Music and SoundFX**: GarageBand and mic from mobile phone
- **Art**: iPad Pro for drawings and Photoshop

**IMPORTANT**: 
 - Install VS2015 redist if you do not have one: https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=52685
 - Your graphics card must support OpenGL 3.3 or higher

Have fun and **thanks for playing and rating** ^_^

entries.title: One Must Go

# Overview
Cabin in the woods has four survivors. You must choose one of them to go to work as a bait. Choose wisely!

# Download
You can download the game from itch.io: https://serialkamikaze.itch.io/one-must-go

# Challenges / lessons learned
Like always in the game jam, the time is the "enemy". Lots of features thought that I didn't have enough time to implement. Maybe finishing the game after the jam to have all the features.
There is no win or lose condition at the moment.

# Credits
Voxel models created by mysterious KS!

# Tools/Assets

- Used Unity 2018.
- Bolt for visual scripting
- TextMesh Pro for texts
- ProBuilder for cabin

entries.title: Blob
entries.description:
![screen2.png](///raw/8a5/z/1d165.png)

> "You are tasked with guarding a herd of blobs. Guide at least half of them to the nearest exit in order to proceed to the next level. Unfortunately, blobs are rather stubborn. Persuade the herd to move by squashing some of the blobs."

# Controls

- Click on a blue blob to sacrifice it and move nearby blobs
- Press S or click on a hunter to sacrifice all remaining blobs
- Press R to restart


# Goal

- Save as many blue blobs as possible by leading them into the vortex!

# Gameplay

- Sacrifice blue blobs to push the others around
- The red blob will hunt and kill blue blobs
- The yellow star vortex is the save zone, get as many blobs in as possible!
- Don't click the hunter by accident!

You are the manager of a company and have to make sure that you have good employees.
If the company generates enough profit, it will expand by building another floor.
One more thing, global warming is causing rising sea levels and you can not work under water.

![infoscreen.png](///raw/544/z/1d361.png)

### Controls

A/D - Move the player
W/S - Climb stairs
SPACE - Interact (hire/fire employee)

Call in a new employee by interacting with the phone booth. Place him by walking to a desk.
Walk around and talk to your workers. If they start to act strange they are not generating profit anymore, fire them by pressing SPACE.

![scinshot.png](///raw/544/z/1d364.png)

### Created for Ludum Dare 43 JAM by:

Alexander Ganslandt - Programming

Emil Hallin - Graphics

Erik Hallin - Design/Audio

Fredrik Hallin - Music

Fredrik Schön - Programming

Per Malmberg - Programming

Don't let them block your outstanding views of the beach! Sacrifice people living or planning to live in front of you by avoiding these buildings from rising too high.

![Capturar2.JPG](///raw/8d5/f1/z/1d3e7.jpg)
## Description
The purpose of this game is to think better about how we deal with animals and their lives.
260kg is the average weight a cow needs to go to slaughter.
The game is a top down in pixel.

## Team
- [Rodrigo Grego](https://www.facebook.com/rodrigo.grego.14855) - Game Design
- [Wilgnne Khawan](https://www.facebook.com/khawan.barbosa)- Dev
- [Gabriel Solon](https://www.facebook.com/gabriel.solon.71) - Dev 
- [Alexande Thomazelli](https://www.facebook.com/alexandre.machado.1042) - Art
- [Vitor Borges](https://www.facebook.com/vitor.borges.58152?ref=br_rs) - Art
- [Guilherme Teixeira](https://www.facebook.com/Guilty404) - Art
- [Guine Vahl](https://www.facebook.com/ilgner.vahl) - Music and SFX
- [Gabriel Jardim](https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=100005298076453) - Music and SFX
- [Adriel Telito](https://www.facebook.com/adriel.telito) - Music and SFX
- [Karina Yukari](https://www.facebook.com/karina.yukari) - Administration and HR

## [Xondaro](https://www.facebook.com/xondarogames)
We represent Xondaro, a brazilian dev focused on games with social criticism and less spoken matters. Our work demonstrate not what we imagine about things, but a reflex of what we see outside our window.


## How to play!
- Arrow keys to move

## Known bugs and issues
- When leaving the camera view the player dies
- Glitch while reloading the scene
- No clean way to exit the game, you have to use alt+F4

entries.title: Electrocuted
entries.description:
**Story:**

You are a robot in experiments designed to test whether a robot with AI can end challenging routes before it has run out of limited energy.

**The theme (Sacrifices must be made) within the game:**

Anything you do in the game (including walking) lowers the limited amount of energy you have, to finish the game you have to sacrifice energy to continue.





**Gameplay tutorial:**


**1.** Use the arrow keys to move (note that walking lowers the energy too).

**2.** To recharge the energy, you need to touch the charger.

The charger:
![Layer 1.png](///raw/393/41/z/1f1b8.png)

**3.** Note that the energy meter is located in the upper left corner of the screen.

![The_Energy_meter.png](///raw/393/41/z/1f1bd.png)

**4.** If you touch the laser, you will lose energy.

The lasers:
![The_lasers.png](///raw/393/41/z/1f1be.png)

**5.** If one of the shots of the machine gun will hit you you will lose energy.

The bullets:                              
![Bullet.png](///raw/393/41/z/1f1c1.png)  

The machine gun:
![spr_MG_1.png](///raw/393/41/z/1f1c4.png)

**6.** To go to the next level,just touch the teleporter at the end of the level.

The teleporter:
![Teleporter.png](///raw/393/41/z/1f1c8.png)

**7.** To accept options in the menus just press the ENTER or the 'Z' key, to scroll up and down use the UP and DOWN arrow keys.

**General goal:**

Reach the launcher at the end of each stage before you run out of energy.







**Problems:**

A little disclaimer - Even though we participated in the Jam (the 72 hours challenge) we couldn't work for 24 hours so the game did not come out as good as we wanted

*Graphic problems:*

The UI, it's terrible! - We couldn't make it to the UI part of the pixel art, yes,we were THAT slow in pixel art.

Programming problems:

**1.** No progress saving system, why?!?!? - There was a saving system but it was very problematic and we had to remove it.

**2.** Use the teleporter - If the player hasn't moved to the next level as soon as he touches the launcher then try to touch the center of the launcher to teleport to the next level.


We hope you enjoy our game, hopefully we'll see you there! :)


![Robot_blink.png](///raw/393/41/z/1f1b7.png)

entries.title: Gears
entries.description:
![ezgif-1-154d5f635fb7.gif](///raw/b7a/02/z/1d25e.gif)

![ezgif-1-752153d5ef84.gif](///raw/b7a/02/z/1d299.gif)

# A Minimal Puzzle-platformer

## Controls

### Keyboard Only (for qwerty)

* `Arrow Keys` : Move
* `Z` : Jump
* `X` : Drop And Jump
* `Space` : Change Camera
* `R`: Restart Level

### Controller (xbox)

* `Left Joystick` : Move
* `X` : Jump
* `A` : Drop And Jump
* `L1` : Change Camera
* `Start`: Restart Level

## version 1.01 (Dec, 5)

* Minor Bug fixes.
* Added Mac OS verions.
* Changed camera button to 'space' due to Conflict with Web browsers' key.

## If you're having hard time clearing certain stages

You can skip the stage by pressing `Keyboard 'c' + 'k'` or `Controller 'Back' + 'Start'` together.

entries.title: Shoddy Terminal
entries.description:
**Prequel of Smelly Corp. nobody ever asked for!!!**

Your job is simple: operate a terminal to create chemical mixtures and finish given jobs. While the facility is on fire. Using cheaply made terminal.

You see, every click of a button or every change of light takes the control closer and closer to it's destruction. Do you have a favorite button? It's gone now. You have to find another way of doing things.

Or not. You are given replacement indestructable buttons and lights. They are both very limited AND come with their disadvantage.

There is one more tool to your disposal: pliers. You can move a control unit to another place, replacing destroyed unit.

**Which controls do you fix? Which controls do you sacrifice? You have to choose. Quickly.**



Game contains a simple tutorial and every button/light has it's own info text accessible by using the "Help" button.

You control everything with a mouse button.



I wanted to create a game without a single canvas or image element or other nonsense. Just buttons and text fields.

There are more improvements to be made: more jobs, more buttons, more fun, better css, some music, random events (that's why the light was added), visual indicator of control group damage...

Still, I'm quite happy with the result.



**You can sacrifice food, cities, lives. But how about UI?**

entries.title: The union
entries.description:
The union is a game about a small empire in the middle of four bigger ones. The four empires fire, water, air and earth is in a constant battle. Something that hurts your empire, you decide to try and form a union between the five empires. However the fact that the empires dislike each other so bad makes it difficult to get one of their turst without risking your relationship with the other three. It becomes a game about balance and difficult decisions. When a bunch of goblins want to know who to attack you will have too choose between risking relationships with another empire by sending the goblins towards them or will you order them to steal from you sacrificing most of your empires money.

Thoughts on the result:
It is not great, there are way to few things that can happen and the game is way too easy. I feel like if I had just a couple more hours I could have made it so much better. I would have added more things, made it so that options disappear if the related empire have already united with yours and made it a bit more difficult. Maybe I’ll come back to this one day and polish it up so all feedback is appreciated! If you get inspired to make your own scenarios please let me know because my imagination definitely isn’t my strong side!

(I should have made something more focused on code, that’s basically all I know!)

While on a hunting trip, Björn's village was attacked by powerful monsters. Soon Björn realised that these monsters were so powerful that normal weapons could not harm these creatures. Only a weapon blessed by a god could kill them, and to get such a weapon he has to sacrifice something. As he only had his bow and some arrows with him, he has to sacrifice parts of his body.

entries.title: Slime Parade
entries.description:
![splash.png](///raw/085/31/z/1cf7f.png)


Slime Parade is a game about friendship, family and love. You are the Slime King, the ruler of the whole kingdom and your mission is: collect all the fruit you can 'cause you're hungry as hell!. But, the thing is, you can't do it alone, you'll need the help of your 5 little friends.

![slimes.gif](///raw/085/31/z/1ceab.gif)

Green and Purple will help you move left and right, 'cause you are so fat that you can't move by your own. Blue will help you jump! He is a special slime who can act like a mini-rocket! Red will shoot at all the targets for you, it's not a problem for him. Finally, Yellow can bark at things and activate them (YES, IT'S SLIME MAGIC), such as secret doors and teleports!

But... Beside all this 'family' thing, Slime King will get hungry. Fruits are not enough...

![promo.gif](///raw/085/31/z/1cf2b.gif)

Between levels you'll have to SACRIFICE one of your friends to feed the Slime King. But be careful, you'll lose its ability too. For example, if you choose to kill Blue, you won't be able to jump again. Never.

![promo_small.gif](///raw/085/31/z/1d575.gif)

(Sry for the gif, we couldn't do it any bigger :'c)

So embarc on this awesome adventure and gather all the fruits you can! We'd appreciate if you share with us your total score!

If you find any bug, please let us know, no one is perfect! ^^

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

To be honest this was by far one of our favorite GameJams. The theme was great to work with. We got laughs, lot of work and also coffee. It's been an honor doing 'Slime Parade' guys, We really hope you like it ^^

Crew:

Game Design and Community Manager: Ignacio Villalta - @Kilelock - https://nasiocanvas.weebly.com/

Pixelart and Tiles: Pablo León - @3dleon https://3dleonpablo.wixsite.com/portfolio

Characters and Animations: Jonás Aguilar - @spigaru - https://sketchfab.com/jonasaguilar

Programming and SFX: Alberto Navarro - @forameuss - https://twitter.com/forameuss

All Music by Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

entries.title: How to feed your dragon

Sacrifice princesses to keep your dragon happy!

To grow a real princess you will need a cake, a dress and a crown to be delivered directly into the Castle. Use coins from the royal treasury to produce wheat and fabric on the Farms, and gold bars in the Mines. Cakes are made from wheat in the Bakery (but sometimes these peasants cook a loaf instead). Crowns can be ordered from the Blacksmith (unfortunately, this lazy bastard may produce tools or bombs instead). We also have a top-notch atelier in the town, who can quickly sew perfect dress from a fabric.

Beware of the Y chromosome though! Sometimes you get a prince instead of princess, and that is not healthy food for your lovely pet! Kill him with cannon (you will need bombs, of course).

entries.title: castleton.
entries.description:
## Large Gamers Corporation Inc. LLC.,; Present's...

###### "7/10, GOTY 2019" - Kotaku, 12/3/18
###### "Fr*ick off, I'm Gaming!!" - Carl's Junior, Idiocracy, 2006
###### "The new Angery Birds" - John Bird

# It's gotta be **castleton.**

[The Sauce](https://imgur.com/a/RBYnFkY)

## BUILD

- Build your way to victory with up to ten (**10**) blocks. 
- Lose yourself in the jaw dropping spectacle of 128-bit color and construct your defenses with the most innovative control scheme this side of the Missississippi. 
- **The Minecraft Killer???**

## SHOOT

- Dynamic Rangefinder Technology (patent pending) uses **machine learning** on the **"block" chain** to build a powerful data visualization of, how far you are going to shoot. 
- The New IBM Watson???
- **The WASD killer????????????????**

## CONQUER

- Pulse-pounding SCORE™© Board Analysis determines which player has more points, all in real time.
- None of your games better have a scoreboard in it or your getting sued
- Heartbreaking story mode - YOUR CHOICES MATTER??? (**TWO** ENDINGS!!!) Collect them all!!

### RULES:

You start the game in build mode. Each time you click the Cube button, a cube will be dropped onto your platform. You only have 10 cubes to work with, so budget carefully! Press the Done button to transition to shooting mode, and trade shots with your AI opponent! Tie goes to the CPU.

### CONTROLS:

WASD to move the camera around your build platform and scroll to zoom in/out.
When in build mode, click and hold a block and use arrow keys (←↑↓→) to move it.
IJKL (think WASD) when in shooting mode to rotate your cannon.
Click and hold to charge up a shot - release to fire! Spacebar acts in the same way.!

entries.title: Memento Morty
entries.description:
Rick and Morty are going on another crazy adventure. Although.. It’s gonna be only Morty this time aaand .. the adventure looks more like a death trap. Literally. Because he’s gonna die there. A lot. And go back in time. To prove he’s strong (To get the hell out of there actually). And he’d need to step over himself this time. Literally. Over his own dead body. A lot of bodies. And the crazy monsters. Rick and Morty adventures forever. Only Morty this time. Dies to save himself. Morty adventures forever... Oh jeez..

https://youtu.be/grNdviXs0wc

Memento Morty is an action-puzzle game based on time travelling mechanic in Rick and Morty universe. You play as Morty trapped in a strange dimension where every time he dies he goes back in time to a certain point and should avoid his previous instances to prevent a time paradox. You should use Morty’s multiple copies to find the escape before the whole place blows up.

![shot_2.png](///raw/df7/02/z/1d202.png)
![shot_4.jpg](///raw/df7/02/z/1d208.jpg)

entries.title: Sacré Bleu
entries.description:
![2018-12-02 16_16_19-Unity 2018.2.18f1 Personal (64bit) - UploadImage.unity - ld43 - PC, Mac & Linux .png](///raw/a1a/2/z/1ba4e.png)

Your team of explorers discovered a mysterious dungeon. The magic in the dungeon only allows your explorers in one by one and forces them to sacrifice themselves after a limited amount of time.
Blinded by the promised treasures your team decides to take on the challenge. How many sacrifices will it take for your team to discover the most valuable treasure in history?

![grown tree.PNG](///raw/6bd/5/z/1d3eb.png)

All code, artwork and audio soundtrack are made by our team. The sound effects are open-source files downloaded from [soundbible](http://soundbible.com/tags-death.html). When you rate this game on audio, please consider only the soundtrack.

entries.title: Abortion Boy
entries.description:
![abortionBoyImageLD.jpg](///raw/dbd/31/z/1d239.jpg)


***Abortion boy*** lets you play a fetus that has been diagnosed with the Fortnite syndrome. Surgeons had declared they had to abort you, so you will have to escape their terrifying hand by finding an exit 3 levels in a row. Each level, the fetus will sacrifice a part of his body to be able to keep going, so get ready to play a rolling fetus head !

***

Controls : WASD / ZSQD (for french keyboards) for movement, mouse for camera.

"TAKE THE L" DANCE : F

***

Have fun and feel free to tell us what you think about our game !

***/!\
It is possible that you get out of the map due do some collisions issues, if that happens to you, just get back to the main menu and restart. We're not fixing this since the deadline is over!
/!\***


![BRAKDOWN_5.jpg](///raw/dbd/31/z/1ee09.jpg)


We did some posts where we talk about our processes making the game, make sure you check this out if you're interested!

[VFX Breakdown - How to make a waterfall](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/abortion-boy/vfx-breakdown-how-to-make-a-waterfall-particles-nodal-shaders) - Maxime CATEL

[Simple level procedural generation in a few hours](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43/abortion-boy/how-to-make-a-simple-procedural-level-generation-in-a-few-hours) - Robin SIX

***/!\ It is possible that, if you play on lower resolution, the controller moves too fast. /!\***

entries.title: Scrapyard
entries.description:
Scrapyard is a Top Side View Roguelike Shoot'em'up in which you control a robot in a abandoned Factory that has been sent there to clear the factory from defective remaining robots, there are five rooms to clear, our main character has to through all of them with only a shield that can sustain 3 hits, and a portion of his total energy, which only allows him to move, shoot or shield himself from projectiles at the same time, and also, whenever he uses a weapon in a room, said weapon will become unavailable in further rooms, this last two parts are our take on the sacrifice theme.
![MainMenuScrapyard.png](///raw/4cb/f1/z/1d05f.png)

entries.title: What We Hold In Our Hearts
entries.description:
You must escape! How many treasured items can you keep hold of when you run? Can you make it to the next safehouse alive?

Remember, that what we can't hold in our hands, we hold in our hearts. 

![diaryArtboard 1.png](///raw/0a5/2/z/1d21a.png)

### Screen Shots

![hearts1.png](///raw/0a5/2/z/1d21c.png)

![hearts3.png](///raw/0a5/2/z/1d21e.png)

### Controls

Select items with the number keys, then run!

Keep hitting "<" to move left, and ">" to move right (or arrow keys *bug fix*). The faster you move, the clumsier you get. Move too slow, however, and they catch you.

### Tools

[Unity](http://unity3d.com) again for the game engine, which crashed horribly on Saturday afternoon, but I recreated my game and pushed on until the end!

I was happy with getting to use some new Anima2D skills, and tried to apply my lessons from last LDJAM to get a more polished game this time.

### Audio Credits

* https://freesound.org/people/Benboncan/sounds/137874/
* https://freesound.org/people/Under7dude/sounds/163383/
* https://freesound.org/people/Jagadamba/sounds/258051/
* https://freesound.org/people/georra43/sounds/446375/
* https://freesound.org/people/vmgraw/sounds/257691/

### Post Ludum Dare Version

http://mgoadric.github.io/OurHearts/Update

entries.title: After Hours: A Reverse Metroidvania
entries.description:
![Promo_Title.png](///raw/c23/2/z/1d144.png)

The hero has defeated the beast! Now it's up to you, the game's janitor, to reset the game so that the next hero can start their journey.

Lowly janitor, behind the scenes of a metroid-like game. Now that the player is gone, you can use all the power-ups for yourself! You must, however, put all 4 back in the right order so you can get to the exit and start your work break.

- ** Choose carefully the order that you lose your power-ups! **
- ** Be your own hero! **
- ** Let the actors know that it's time for coffee! **

entries.title: Fast Sheepment
entries.description:
So, first LD jam for both of us.

We made a game about sheep that must run from Tiki-like Shaman who want's to sacrfice the sheep. Unfortunetly you can't run forever (or can you?) and the Shaman must get you to end the game, still you can beat your highest score :smile: 

Graphics is hand-scanner-gimp made, all items are hand drawn, then scanned, then cut out in gimp and imported to the project.
Animations are made using simple frame drawing in gimp.

We used LibGdx for java to make the game logic, it was pretty fun to work with.

Bellow are few screenshots from the game:

![1.PNG](///raw/883/d1/z/1d22e.png)

![3.PNG](///raw/883/d1/z/1d231.png)

![4.PNG](///raw/883/d1/z/1d232.png)

Thank you for playing and for wonderful Jam :slight_smile:

entries.title: PIVOT
entries.description:
The objective is to get the red shapes (furniture) through the hallway into the right place, cutting (sacrificing) parts off to fit it. You get scored based on how much of the thing you managed to preserve.

Controls
WASD to move, QE to rotate
Left click to cut the shape across the line
Right click to flip the cutting line horizontally

I only spent a few hours on this before dropping it :(

entries.title: Tiny Sky Planet
entries.description:
![screeny1.png](///raw/4ae/4/z/1d254.png)
A simple shoot and bang arcade game. Player plays as pilots dispatched to defend against an invasion on this cute tiny planet that is filled with water.

How many pilots do you have to sacrifice in order to fight off the invasion?!



Instructions
---
Use Arrow keys or WASD or XBOX controller D-pad to MOVE.
Spacebar or XBOX controller button A to SHOOT.

Best played fullscreen!



Technicals
---
- Made with Construct 3 game engine (https://www.construct.net/)
- Sprites made in Aseprite (https://www.aseprite.org/)
- Sound Fx made in Chiptone by SFB games (http://sfbgames.com/chiptone/)


![screeny2.png](///raw/4ae/4/z/1d255.png)

![screeny3.png](///raw/4ae/4/z/1d256.png)

entries.title: Dragon God Trail: The Card Game
entries.description:
![Screenshot from 2018-12-03 23-04-53.png](///raw/b18/91/z/1e8cc.png)

The dragon god has lost favor among your people. You must assemble a caravan and bring its idol to the volcano in the east.

However, the dragon god has one last scheme. It has filled the land with a dense fog, corrupted the volcano and its idol will blight the surroundings when it touches the ground.

You must travel the land and find the 3 artifacts: the Tailisman, Red Orb, and Golden Snake. Bring them to the volcano to cleanse it, then toss in the idol. Who will be the foolishly brave to accomplish this task?

Use the mouse to interact with the game interface and click on adjacent map destinations to travel there.

Best played on modern browsers.

entries.description:
Pirates Overboard is a little arcade game where you try to escape from a dangerous shark.

You can shoot him with your loaded canons or **sacrifice** some parts of your ship to save time...

Make the right choices : sacrifice your crew ? ... your black flag ? .. Your rum !!?

You'll be allowed to repair your boat with treasures found on islands.

More information about how to play on itch.io game page.

Have fun !

You play as a blood mage from a distant mountainous region. The king's guards are after you and you must survive until your allies arrive (3 minutes). However, every attack costs a part of your health, so be careful!

entries.title: ShamanProtector
entries.description:
​Monsters are attacking your village and it's up to you as village Shaman to keep everyone safe.

Cut wood to build towers. Upgrading Towers requires Soul and you will have to knockout one of your village folk (without the others seeing) and offer as sacrifice to the flaming altar before striking your staff on the tower to Upgrade
25 wood required to build a Tower... but only one poor soul is needed to upgrade a tower.

Controls:
- Arrow keys to move
- Z to strike, cut wood & upgrade towers
- Hold X to drag unconscious villagers

entries.title: Electric Kaiju
entries.description:
**********
![E2495C5B-9C26-4956-AF4B-B6E8F0E4D0E7.png](///raw/016/91/z/1ed9d.jpg)

**********

Once again, the goddam monsters descended on the colonized cities of the outer planets. Humans far from earth can't arrive by now, and you, as a monster domesticated by locals to protect the planet, are the city's only hope.

However, as a monster, you are huge, and in the battle, you may accidentally injure the surrounding human buildings.

The nature of monsters allows you to gain more power by destroying buildings and eating humans. You can also hit an enemy onto the buildings beside and cause more damage to them. While this can be a temporary sacrifice, with proper strategy, you can eliminate the enemy faster and reduce the overall damage to the building.

Sometimes in order to reduce damage to buildings, players will have to let enemies attack them on purpose.

![jietu.png](///raw/016/91/z/1f426.png)
Game Goals:

Players need to operate a monster to destroy the destruction of the city villain monster.
You can win the game by killing the villain monster while the hero is alive and the city is not completely destroyed.
The smaller the damage to the city, the higher the level score.

Players have to fight against 3 different types of enemies

Make full use of the advantages of the buildings to for the least number of casualties!

entries.title: Schadenfreude (ex. Cassandra Complex)
entries.description:
DESCRIPTION: You are a clown, the enjoyment of others is at the cost of your dignity (and not only that)

This is an interactive narrative with some gameplay. It ended up being more French than expected, but that was a nice surprise. We hope you will enjoy it.

Camera rotaion = right click

entries.description:
You play as "Mom" the rabbit. A rabbit on a mission. A mission that needs to be achieved, even if it means sacrificing EVERYTHING. Embark on an epic quest and learn to let go of the things you hold dear!

RABBIT HABIT

entries.title: Corn Field
entries.description:
Some kids are living alone and need help to grow corn and survive the winter! You can help: make the Corn God happy! He likes grown up blood!


This is our first game on a ludum dare, the first game of 4 of 5 group participants life, we appreciate any critiques that help us to get better, thanks for playing! ![menu.png](///raw/3a4/1/z/1ce11.png)

entries.title: The Great Fire
entries.description:
A strategy game based on The Fire of London.

Rules:
- Fire spreads to adjacent houses.
- To prevent fire from spreading further you must strategically destroy houses that surround the house which is on fire.
- You can use water to put out houses to slow down the spread of fire.
- In order to pass a level, a certain number of houses must remain.
- You can only destroy / put out a certain number of houses at a time.

Controls:
- Left click: Demolish house (house mustn't be on fire)
- Right click: Extinguish fire (uses water)




![TheGreatFireScreenShot01.png](///raw/c4b/81/z/1d0cc.png)![TheGreatFireScreenShot02.png](///raw/c4b/81/z/1d0cd.png)![TheGreatFireScreenShot03.png](///raw/c4b/81/z/1d0cf.png)![ScreenShot04.png](///raw/c4b/81/z/1d0d0.png)![TheGreatFireScreenShout05.png](///raw/c4b/81/z/1d0d1.png)![TheGreatFireScreenShot06.png](///raw/c4b/81/z/1d0d2.png)

entries.title: GLOP
entries.description:
A game about a slime that wants to destroy its enemies by destroying itself!

You attack enemies by using your slime ability, which you explode and expel slime bits. However, doing so will decrease your size and once you reach the smallest size, you won't be able to attack. Pick up slime that you used to be able to use your ability again!

Controls:

Movement - WASD / Arrow Keys
Slime Explosion - Spacebar (hold to charge)

There are a lot of gamebreaking bugs in the game as we didn't have much time to create it due to unforeseen circumstances. We're pretty happy, nonetheless! :)

![1.PNG](///raw/eeb/4/z/1ddd9.png)


![2.PNG](///raw/eeb/4/z/1dddb.png)


![3.PNG](///raw/eeb/4/z/1dde0.png)

entries.title: Lucky Number 13
entries.description:
# [Introduction]
> "In a laboratory of dark science, beneath the ground floor of a remote structure, a failed experiment known only as 'number 13' broke its shackles and set out for revenge."

![1.png](///raw/db1/6/z/1f11e.png)

## [What is "Lucky Number 13"?]
A top down action/puzzle shooter.

### [Theme]
One of the main mechanics that the game revolves around is the 3 elemental abilities that the player can acquire. These are used to defeat enemies and solve puzzles. The only way to obtain the [Ice], [Fire] and [Electricity] attacks is by hurting your character. For an example you need to stick your fingers into a power outlet (do not try at home) to get / recharge your electricity attack, but causes you to **lose health**. The second way we linked the game to the theme is through the story, but that we wont spoil here!


## [Controls]

- **[Arrow keys / [W] [A] [S] [D] -** Move character
- **[Left Click] -** Shoot / examine / trigger
- **[Escape] -** Pause Menu

## [Credits]
-	Belle Rahnasto  - **[Art]**   - @WindmillGames
-	Simon Rahnasto  - **[Code]**  - @WindmillGames
-	Eric Bernard    - **[Code]**  - @ebernerd
-	Daniel Docherty - **[Music]** - https://www.danieldocherty.net
-	Ben French      - **[Sound]**
-	Ashley Dove     - **[Voice]**
-	Dianna Conley   - **[Voice]**
-	Franki Garpeman - **[Voice]**
-	Lilly Schendel  - **[Voice]**
-	Aiko Amami      - **[Voice]**

More detailed credits can be found in game.

entries.title: Penance

Fight against time! Defeat enemies and use collect their blood to use as currency. Buy weapons and additional time so you can find and defeat the Demon Lord!

entries.title: Dungeon of Friendship
entries.description:
