entries.title: PixelEyes
entries.description:
Artyom has been living with the same eyes for way too many years and they are starting to fail, an upgrade is needed. Since he can't afford the last generation eyes he always dreamt of, so he will head to his last resort, Chernobyl's Black Market, where he buys a pair of eyes, apparently in perfect condition. But in the 2043's Russia things aren't that easy and mafias are still running. He bought a prototype of eyes stolen from one of the biggest eyes manufacturers company and now he is trapped in some of the calibration routines included inside the pair of eyes. Since they are a prototype some strange behaviours start showing and the resolution of his eyes start going mad.

Sacrifice your screen resolution to add pixels on objects in order to complete calibration chambers!
Your lasting resolution will affect your vision and also your score the last test!
Score as much points as you can and share it with us! Have fun!
Follow us on twitter for more updates https://twitter.com/pixeleyes43


![key.gif](///raw/eea/f1/z/1ce5e.gif)
![CardGif.gif](///raw/eea/f1/z/1d09c.gif)
![last.gif](///raw/eea/f1/z/1ce5c.gif)

Made by: Xavier Devesa, Marc Segarra, Miquel Postigo, Aniol Folch

entries.title: Alien Vs Gods
entries.description:
You are a follower of the old gods and they have tasked you to kill as many aliens as possible and collect their resources before too many manage to escape the field.

To accomplish this task the old gods are giving you defunct towers with faulty memory, random fire rates and bullets. So its up to you to figure out if your tower is up to the task or in need to be replaced by another defunct tower.

![ss+(2018-12-03+at+07.33.10).jpg](///raw/3be/1/z/1d01f.jpg)



This was our first Game Jam and first public made game together, it was a fun experience aswell we learn alot :smiley:, 
  We will try to be apart of alot more Jams down the line and we know audio is lacking aswell as few other elements but that will be come better next time!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                                       TEAM
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

**Programming:** Gosera

**Art and Modeling:** Daelumineax

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                                    TOOLS USED
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
**3D Studio Max**

**Photoshop CC 2019**

**Unity 2018.2.18f1**

**Visual Studio**

**BFXR & FLStudio**

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
                                               HOW TO PLAY AND GOAL
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

WASD/Arrow keys for moving the camera, holding down right click lets you rotate the camera,

You use the left mouse button to drag and drop the defunct towers on to the tower platforms, 
To replace a defunct tower with another defunct tower all you have to do is drag a new defunct tower on top of the old one.

The stockpile that holds your defunct towers can only have 8 of them and will use 100 resources to fill it up.
Each tower you place that is above level 1 will cost resources which is dependent on your level.

The Goal is for you to get as much resources as possible before your ultimate doom.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------




*We hade a random cases of the zip not giving people the UnityPlayer.dll and thats why we have included a link to a folder with both versions of the dll exists*

entries.title: Dies Auxilii
entries.description:
Your plane crashed and now this game is all about surviving until you get help.
Sometimes sacrifices have to be made.
Warning: This game is kinda dark.

![dies auxilii 1.PNG](///raw/8bf/21/z/1d1c5.png)

Controlls: 

Movement: A / D and Left / Right Arrows
Pickup Item: E
Use Item: 1 / 2 / 3

The game mechanic is very simple. You have to survive and try to keep people alive.



I actually planned a lot more content for the game, but I had almost no time this ludumdare and that's why I just finished the base game without animations, good sounds etc. I hope you can still enjoy it.

Good Luck :)

Known Bugs:

You have to press the Key a few times and move around a little bit. Why is unknown, yet.

entries.title: Sacrifices Made Here!
entries.description:
We made a 2 player single-screen game where you work in a shop that assembles sacrifices for your customers. Get their orders right and on time or face your bosses wrath! Restock your shelves when the Mole Man delivers a crate, and if you're feeling generous you can feed the gobbler.

Controls
Player 1: WASD + Left Shift to interact
Player 2: Arrows + Right Ctrl to interact

![splash.png](///raw/408/f1/z/1d0f9.png)

![cheatsheet3.png](///raw/408/f1/z/1f0b0.png)

Cheat sheet - after some sleep we realised how insanely hard this is without a bit of help...so here you go!

This is our first Ludum Dare, we are surprised we even got this far with newborn babies, toddlers and angry partners but it's done now! All art and music made by us. Despite the limited time we had a ton of fun, looking forward to next year to another sacrifice of our time and sleep. -Nick & Avon

entries.title: The_Jay-Game
entries.description:
A game made by myself during the LudumDare43 on Unity.

It's a scoring game where score is represented by gold.

During your turn you can move your character right or left and attack 1 monster. To end your turn, click the down arrow.

When you attack a monster, it will create death cards around it according to the indication on the monster's card. If a death card comes down on your character you die.

Every monster that pass the down line makes you loose life, depending on their power. A gold or healing card can be collected only if it comes down on your character.


Enjoy !!

[CaptureEcran.PNG](///raw/099/02/z/1d193.png)

entries.title: Sacrifices
entries.description:
Hello Priest,

Your god has bestowed you with the sacred task to control the population of the land. 
You must do this by killing the correct type of population. You loose the game if you die or if one of the population types goes extinct. In order to prevent extinction you must decrease the number of the natural enemies of the type that is about to go extinct. You can regain health by sacrificing corpses.

Foodchain order:
Chickens eat: Vegetables
Humans eat: Vegetables, Chickens, Cows and Wolves
Wolfs eat: Chickens, Cows and Humans
Cows eat Vegatables

O and watch out for the demons....




Use the following commands to control the population:

Camera rotation: A & D or Left & Right arrow key
Camera zoom: Mouse scrollwheel
Walk to position: Left mouse click on destination
Attack target: Right mouse click on target
Sacrifice: Left mouse click on corpse

This game was created by two people in under 3 days for ludum dare 43!

Run the game in full screen for the best experience.

Each round, find the goal is to find the altar and sacrifice 20 blood.  you can then choose one of three available upgrades, in total there are six upgrades:

entries.title: Point & Sin - Ludum Dare 43 edition
entries.description:
Embark on a quest to obtain the blood of a virgin.

Why do you need it?

For you to learn the answer, sacrifices must be made.

## General
- Genre: hack&slash rpg
- Platforms: Windows, Linux
- Want to have a chat with the developers? Join our [Discord server](https://discord.gg/D9Vtc9f)! 
- Want to see this game continued? Review it and share with your friends!

## MANUAL
Kill enemies to level up. With each new level, you gain sin points, which can be spent to make you stronger.

Enemies drop items. Equip items to get stronger.

Unlock brutal mode by defeating the boss and finding the vial of virgin blood. The boss is the top of the level, behind the lava waterfall.


## CONTROLS
- Right click - use active ability
- Left click - walk, pick up items
- Mouse wheel - switch active ability
- C - open character panel
- I - open inventory
- Esc - pause game


## Disclaimer
This game was started in Ludum Dare 42, so we've opted out of graphics and audio categories. 
What was added during Ludum Dare 43:
- Item system
- Brutal mode
- Bugfixes
- Improved controls
- Improved graphics
- New sfx

## Screenshots
![10_succubus fight.png](///raw/5a1/01/z/1d169.png)
![11_sexual harassment.png](///raw/5a1/01/z/1d16a.png)![12_menus.png](///raw/5a1/01/z/1d16c.png)![13_brutal mode.gif](///raw/5a1/01/z/1d16e.gif)

********************************************** 

Dear players:

Windows version is recommended to play the game. 

You need headphone or earphone to play the game. (To hear the sound from different positions.)

********************************************** 

# Screenshot:
![Screenshot1.png](///raw/73b/z/1f8c2.png)

This is my eleventh time to attend Ludum Dare. Hope that everyone will enjoy my game :) 

This is an action game. You woke up in a place you had never seen with a creature stood right by you. The creature told you that your soul was brought to limbo. It also took you to a place with many skulls and forced you to pass some trials in order to escape from limbo. Your ordeals are just the beginning...

# Game Goal:
- Escape to the exit with your hearing and memory.

# Control: 
 - Use **"W", "A", "S", "D"** to move around.

or

 - Use **"↑", "←", "↓", "→"** to move around.

# Used tools: 

### Game Engine
- Unity 

### Version Control

Most of the resources of models come from the online resource, but I use them to design the level in the game.

Most of the resources of audio come from online resources. 

Designed and made by **@Cliff-Lee-CL**.

entries.title: The Alpaca Sacrifice
entries.description:
Did you ever want to compete with your friends to know who could sacrifice the most alpacas for Satan in 5 minutes?
Well, maybe not... But **this game is still perfect for you!** (Actually, only if you own a computer under macOS, sorry)

Here are the rules for *The Alpaca Sacrifice*, a game made for *Ludum Dare 43*, in *under 72 hours* (about 24 hours of continuous work).
In the span of 5 minutes, you will have to discover the randomly generated map, find bushes where alpacas could have hidden, capture them and then carry them to a sacrifice temple, represented by a nice star inside a circle.

The controls are very simple: you **move using the arrow keys**, and **capture/release alpacas with the space bar** when you are in front of a bush/temple, respectively.

You can notice alpacas hidden in bushes because their head stick out.
Because I was alone making this game, I didn't really have time to create beautiful graphics, so **your t-shirt simply changes to a red color when you are carrying an alpaca**.
For the same reason, **sacrifice temples turn to red**, the color of the alpaca's blood, **when you sacrifice one**. You then have to wait a few dozen seconds for the temple to be available again.

There are **5 temples around the map**, so look for them and try to optimize your travels between them to get the best score!
To help you in this quest, "roads" are generated inside the forest, where no trees or bushes grow, and which will lead you to these 5 temples from the middle, where you start.

Here are a few screenshots of the game and my great gameplay:

![The main menu for the game.](///raw/c23/f1/z/1d0bb.png)

![A sacrifice temple after an alpaca was sacrificed. Two of them are hiding in bushes too.](///raw/c23/f1/z/1d0bd.png)

![A road leading to a temple, where an alpaca was also sacrificed. I'm carrying another alpaca, thus my t-shirt is red.](///raw/c23/f1/z/1d0bf.png)

Sorry for the bad resolution in the game, higher resolutions would have made the map generation time and screen changing delay even longer.
In general, please be forgiving, this is my first participation in a game jam, and also the first time I create a game entirely.
I also did it from scratch, rendering everything by myself, so the engine might not be very optimized (such as when you change screen).
Finally, I had school Monday and had homework this weekend, so the game could have been a lot better (by adding animations, an 8-bit music in the background, etc.) but I didn't want to take too much time on my regular work... But I might work on these upgrades later this week or this month to improve the gameplay and make it more fun as a game.

If you wish to help me further to make better games, on more platforms (I'm currently thinking of iOS and Linux, maybe Windows too), you can donate through PayPal here to pay me a pizza:
https://www.paypal.me/au2001

The source is available on GitHub on the link below (in the downloads section) if you wish to look through it.
Sorry for the lack of comments, time was more a priority than code readability.

entries.title: Paw Of Black

Grab dead body: Z

entries.title: MindMaze
Dark Shepherd
entries.description:
The townsguard have stormed the local church which they have accused of harbouring vampires and have begun attacking the innocent civilians inside. You happen to be a vampire who has decided to aid the weak defenseless civilians and church that has offered your misunderstood kind so much. They may be weak and defenseless, but the blood running through their veins may just be what saves them...

You must take out all of the townsguard before all of the civilians have been killed. You can sacrifice some of the life of a civilian to drink their blood and regain your own life in an effort to keep fighting and defending them.

**Controls**

    WASD to move.
    Left Mouse button to Attack.
    Right Mouse button to Drain Life (Civilians only).
    Spacebar to Dash the direction you are moving.
    Escape to Pause.

**Credits**

    Game made by Matthew Joy

    Sound effects were sourced from freesound.org
    Music is Graveyard Shift by Kevin MacLeod of incompetech.com

    Everything else was made by me.

**Screenshots**

entries.title: Suicidal Clones
entries.description:
Suicidal Clones, a game where you play as a clone who has to protect a person and his hat with his body. The good thing about clones is, they can "respawn" (actually a new one is created). So you should immediately rush back to the "Hatmaster" after dying.
This game has 5 levels of increasing difficulty (the last one is extra hard), there's a timer too, so you can track your time.

entries.title: The Fire Fades
entries.description:
What you need to know :

The player moves by pressing Z,Q,S,D.
Press mouse button left to strike.
Enemies can only be killed by throwing them in fire!
If you throw a torch and a weapon together, an new fire is created.
the enemies spawn in some sort of portal, you can deactivate them by putting them in the light of a fire(torch or status does not work).
The enemies wants to blow your Blue flame out, so when the light fades out, you lose. You win when every portals are deactivated.

We are waiting for feedbacks since it's our first game made during The Ludum Dare 43

Team :

- Graphics : Marina Letendre
- Management and sound design : Arnaud Royer
- Programming : Chalivat Quentin and Diringer Leo

entries.title: Rushed Trucking
entries.description:
![Screenshot_4.png](///raw/47b/z/1cfff.png)

# About the game

You are a small truck driver with tight deadlines for delivery. If you don't get to the destination in time, you will only get payed the value of the goods in your truck. You have to drive fast through the rough terrain if you wan't to make it  in time, and will end up having to sacrifice some of the goods in your truck.

## Goals of the game:

**-** Get to the destination before deadline

**-** Get to the destination with as much value as possible

**-** Upgrade your truck in a variety of ways.

#  

# Controls

**WASD:** Drive the truck

**R:** Restart mission

**Escape:** Takes you back to the menu
 
#  

# Credit

**IamStephano:** Programmer, 3D modeling & UI

**ThatRumme:** Level design, 3D modeling & UI

**Psykodamber:** Textures & sprites

#

entries.title: Model Trains Inc
entries.description:
![trolley_level.png](///raw/f82/z/1d138.png)
Keep the trains rolling. Avoid running over too many pedestrians. And make sure that no trains collide.

How long can you make it?

How to play:

Click on the signals to halt trains or let them pass through.

Click on the switches to redirect traffic.

Make trains reach stations to gain popularity and cash, but avoid killing too many or else they won't care if the train arrives or not. So there are three ways the game can end.

## About:
​Protect your sheeps from vicious wolves by shooting them with precious cabbage.
But be careful not to run over one of your fluffy friends when drifting with your tractor.

Game can be played by up to 4 players in splitscreen mode. 


## Controls:
Player 1:

WASD - drive

LShift - replace tractor

LCtrl - shoot cabbage



Player 2:

Return - replace tractor

RShift - shoot cabbage


Players 3 and 4 can be played with gamepads.

To make your God happy is necessary a lot of sacrifice... literally!

Stay tuned for what He desires and make your best sacrifice before others do, and be God's favorite.

### Instructions:

Your goal is to make as many sacrifices as possible. 

For this, collect the sacrifices and take to the altar. At the top of your screen you will see what your God wants.

Use the WASD keys to move, SHIFT to run and SPACE to jump.

Use the mouse to move the camera, left button to attack and right click to scroll

What are you waiting for? Go there and make your best sacrifice!

entries.title: Disassembly Line
entries.description:
Disassembly Line is a game about love, passion and sacrifice. You will control a bunch of freak robots trying to get away from the mother factory, but it’s not that simple.

This game will test your reaction and aim skills but especially, your ruthlesness.

Is your heart cold enough to throw your beloved minions into walls just so that others can survive?

![Gif.gif](///raw/e2a/e1/z/1d2e9.gif)

![SS1.png](///raw/e2a/e1/z/1d2ea.png)
![ss2.png](///raw/e2a/e1/z/1d2eb.png)


![gifo.gif](///raw/e2a/e1/z/1d301.gif)

## Controls
You only need your mouse, click and drag your robots like a slingshot.

## Rules
- Disassembly Line is an endless game. 
- Destroying the enemy robots or opening walls provides you with 100 gears. 
- Every 80 gears you get a new robot on refills. 
- Disassembly line gets faster over time.
- If you lose all your active robots at any time, it's game over. 

Twitter: 
https://twitter.com/DisassemblyL

You must protect your store from the shoppers who come on Black Friday to buy cheaper products, you will have some weapons that might help you, each one of those will be unlocked at the end of each round.

It won’t be that easy, you must defend your PS4 pile while at the same time you will have to defend the XBox and Switch ones which will provide resources. Will you be able to protect your store or will you let the shoppers destroy everything?

entries.title: Soulmart
entries.description:
_"Living on the cloud is not as good as might be seen. People always talk of some kind of "heaven" and how cool it is to live where the Gods live... Stupid people! And also, stupid gods! These arrogant snouts always loaf here and there, look down and make people suffer with no reason. Pure stupid people... I would like to help them, really, but I can't. Not with that few sacrificed souls..."_

![sm.png](///raw/ab9/z/1d0a4.png)

You are in charge of Soulmart: the place where the gods come for sacrificed souls (usually animal ones, but you can never be sure). Your task is to distribute desired souls to the gods the least harmful way. Gods are not the most patient creatures in the world, so keep an eye on a village below and try to prevent disasters huffy gods can create. Here's the list FYI:

![drought.png](///raw/ab9/z/1d080.png)
drought, the lack of water, results in a lack of food.
![famine.png](///raw/ab9/z/1d083.png)
famine, lack of food.
![grief.png](///raw/ab9/z/1d084.png)
grief, lack of happiness.
![plague.png](///raw/ab9/z/1d085.png)
plague, the result of a lack if hygiene. Or the god's will, of course.
![war.png](///raw/ab9/z/1d086.png)
war, lack of understanding.

Each of it can be conquered by:

![birthrate.png](///raw/ab9/z/1d088.png)
high birthrate.
![fun.png](///raw/ab9/z/1d08d.png)
fun and happiness (and enormous amount of a blind optimism).
![yield.png](///raw/ab9/z/1d091.png)
a great yield of vegetation.

Each god affects these parameters in some way (which seems to be pretty obvious if you're somewhat into mythology). Find the logic, ~~look in the source code~~ conquer the disasters and grow your population (1500 is the target).

Good luck and may you be promoted!

***

Credits:

* Dari Dubdanova -- the best artist ever, has her own personal look on perspective.
* @yngvarr -- programming, spins around when something is going wrong.
* Alexander Katsko -- programming, rebuilds the kernel in a blink of an eye. Doesn't blink.
* Ivan Sidorenko -- game design, knows something about spreadsheet processors.

Huge amount of thanks to GameDevNSK and Siberian Game Jam for hosting the wonderful local event in out city! It's so great to have such a friendly local community!

***

_I'm done. I have to catch some zzzzzzzzzzz..._

entries.title: Fly Lightly
entries.description:
## Synopsys

To escape a terrible war on the ground, **Timmy and his friends** decided to fly to a safe place situated **5000 meters** further away.

It won't be an easy task.

Timmy will have to **take care** of the crew to reach the ultimate goal !
Sadly, another totally innocent specie, **the others**, will try to get on your ship. 

**Sacrifices must be made.**

It's you, or them...

## Controls

- **Move :** *Left & Right arrows*

- **Jump :** *Space bar*

- **Action :** *E*

## Team

- **Developers :** *Jean-Christophe Joubier, Vincent Blot*

entries.title: We Fight "Together"!
entries.description:
## Update! :
I have updated the game and in that update I have fixxed a few major bugs. Now apparently the rules state that you can fix bugs after the deadline so since I only fixxed bugs I'm leaving the updated version as the jam one.

## Impressions:

Lol that's not a good way to start a description... well.. let's see. The theme was definetely tough this time! As soon as I heard something as morbid as "sacrifice" I thought I should make something funny to counter that and to make a nice contrast... and so I did! (hopefully). 

## Description:

We Fight "Together"! is a game about a battle between two castles. Each castle has a cannon that shoots missiles (because that's how it works). Unfortunately your base has run out of missiles! You need to replace them with some other ammunition... can you guess what it is? 

## Controls:
WASD -> to walk...

LShift -> to run...

E -> to do whatever is explained in game...


![ld1.png](///raw/c9e/c/z/1d089.png)![ld2.png](///raw/c9e/c/z/1d08b.png)![ld4.png](///raw/c9e/c/z/1d090.png)![ld5.png](///raw/c9e/c/z/1d092.png)![ld6.png](///raw/c9e/c/z/1d094.png)

## Tools Used :

-Unity 

-Blender

-Autodesk Sketchbook

-Audacity

-Ableton Live 10 Suite

-Substance Painter

entries.title: The Vault
entries.description:
![titlecard1.png](///raw/7b9/02/z/1cffd.png)

*"The task is, at its core, simple. All you have to do is leave this vault. Any means will do. Provided you abide by certain... conditions."*

___

This was my entry for the 43rd Ludum Dare Jam. It was produced within 72 hours. As the short blurb might imply, it's an escape-the-room type of game. The premise is simple, it's not all that difficult, and it's short. That said, I'm actually pretty satisfied with the results. 

Thank you for taking an interest in this short piece of interactive fiction! Any forms of suggestions and feedback are appreciated! This is my first time participating in something like this and it was a pretty fun experience!

___

## Screenshots
![1.png](///raw/7b9/02/z/1d015.png)

![2.png](///raw/7b9/02/z/1d016.png)

![3.png](///raw/7b9/02/z/1d018.png)

___

## Updates

* I'd made a major mistake in structuring my folders, causing certain images to just flat-out not show up. That should be fixed now, though!
* Apparently, if you're attempting to play in Firefox, you will need to enable third-party cookies. I am unsure as to why that is. Itch thing, perhaps? Either way, an alternative is to simply use another browser. Sorry for the inconvenience there!

entries.title: Your God Demands...
entries.description:
As a cultist who whorships the statue of the mighty Chicken God, Vib must offer monsters in sacrifice and throw it to the fire. But be careful! Chicken God is a capricious deity and it will only accept those sacrifices that it required from you!

Developed for Ludum Dare 43 Jam in 72 hours during 43rd Ludum Dare by @daruudaruu and @Sapphiris. Theme: Sacrifices must be made.

- Arrow keys or WASD: Move
- Z, K or SPACEBAR: Jump
- X, J or ALT/ALTGR: Grab/Throw
- The game also supports the use of XBox controller, or any controller that supports DirectInput, probably. You can use the 'A' button to jump and the 'X' button to grab and throw a monster.

We would have liked to port this to web, but we do not own GMS2's web export license, we're sorry! It's our first time participating in LD, and we had a great, but an exhausting time! We hope you like the result :smile:

entries.title: Tenoch's Turmoil
entries.description:
Tenoch is a loving husband who must collect fruit for his wife, Chantico. However, their livelihood is at the mercy of the god Netzahualcoyotl, who can only be appeased by offering the fruit that he desires. 

Netzahualcoyotl is picky eater and will have his **EYES** set on the fruit he is craving.


![screenshot.JPG](///raw/517/f1/z/1cd08.jpg)


## CONTROLS
* WASD/Arrow keys - Move
* Spacebar - Jump


## INSTRUCTIONS
* Give fruit to Netzahualcoyotl to avoid his wrath... temporarily
  * Only the fruit he's got his eye on will satisfy him
  * All other fruit generously offered to Netzahualcoyotl is lost
* Give fruit to Chantico to score points
  * Yellow fruit gives you a speed boost
  * Blue fruit gives you an extra jump
  * Power-ups are lost on your next delivery
  * Power-ups stack! Triple up on speed boosts and jumps!

## CREDITS
**Jacinta "jongjo" Joe** - Art  
**OnionKnight** - Programming  
**Evan "evbo" Andrews** - Design, Programming, Sound

"Firebrand", "Invariance"  
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com)  
Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0  
http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

"Game Sound Incorrect Organic Violin"  
Bertrof (https://freesound.org/people/Bertrof/)

## CHANGELOG
[2018-12-13] **Tenoch's movement speed is now independent of framerate.** This fixes a bug we introduced on the last day of the jam which rendered the game effectively unplayable for a subset of people.

*Our in-development post-jam version includes plenty of other bug fixes along with some new features, so stay tuned!*

entries.title: Toothless Speed Dating
entries.description:
![TSD-screenshot1.png](///raw/610/e1/z/1cf89.png)

**Toothless Speed Dating** is a game where you must get a girlfriend. On your way to your goal you have to overcome obstacles only surmountable by **sacrificing yourself** so your future incarnation can use you as a ladder or bridge.

#### Tools used:
* Unity
* Visual Studio
* Inkscape
* Audacity
* BoscaCeoil
* Lightroom

#### Additional info:
This was my first attempt at making something in Unity besides tutorial projects. And probably the last at making passable music in BoscaCeoil.

entries.title: To Die
entries.description:
![titlegraphic.png](///raw/e98/51/z/1e590.png)

Every one hundred years, a party of four is chosen. To make the sacred journey to save the village from destruction and death.
**You are the leader. Your party trusts you. A choice must be made. Their lives are in your hands.**

![itchgif.gif](///raw/e98/51/z/1e8b6.gif)

This is a narrative based game, it's a first for us because our other games are generally gameplay focused or arcade styled. So this is a very exciting project to work on. This game features a fully fleshed out storyline with multiple endings. Some might notice that we have hidden a secret ending in there with a special something at the end.

Here's a pretty nifty gameplay video! C:
https://youtu.be/FwpXaN09PLI

You will only need your mouse to play this game. Enjoy!

entries.title: **FREEZING IS THE MAIN PROBLEM **
entries.description:
![cover.jpg](///raw/a3a/2/z/1d02e.jpg)
# **Freezing is the main problem is a game about delivering packets and making sacrifices!**

You have packets to deliver! Your only enemy is the biting cold. Good that you have a crackling fire to keep you warm. But your only way to feed the flames is sacrificing some of the packets. The smaller the fire gets the slower you move, so hurry up! !

![pack.jpg](///raw/a3a/2/z/1d021.jpg)
### Deliver packages to houses nearby...

![hosp.jpg](///raw/a3a/2/z/1d023.jpg)
### ...or go further and try to make important deliveries to the local hospital.


![zoom.jpg](///raw/a3a/2/z/1d026.jpg)
##### Click right to zoom and get a better overview of the surroundings!

##### The number on the packages shows the number of the house to deliver to.
##### Click near the fire to feed it with picked up objects! The top left meter, shows the fire intensity!
##### New packages will be delivered every 30 seconds.
##### You move by clicking!

** Thanks a lot for playing and have fun! **

entries.title: Superesse sum sacrificium

You can offer some of your total stamina or health to an unknown god to make them help you stop some of the enemies reinforcements to reach your location.

entries.title: The Deep Ones
entries.description:
## The Deep Ones

A 2-player strategy game of cult vs cult. These Lovecraftian abominations conduct rituals and even martyr themselves to grow their influence.

![Promo1.png](///raw/b44/01/z/1cf53.png)

### Controls
Mouse only. Click a unit to see its current abilities. Select your action by clicking a convert or martyr symbol, or click a blue highlighted empty tile to move there. Click the unit again to cancel.

### Rules
Players get one action (move, convert, or martyr) per turn.  
Each unit can only interact with its neighbors in cardinal directions.  
Rank 0 units do not belong to either side and can only be recruited.  
Rank 1 units can spend 2 separate turns to convert Rank 0 units into Rank 1 recruits.  
Rank 1 units can martyr themselves to convert an enemy Rank 0 or Rank 1 unit into Rank 1 recruits.  
Rank 1 units can martyr themselves to demote an enemy Rank 2 unit to an enemy Rank 1 unit.  
Rank 2 units can spend 1 turn to convert Rank 0 units into Rank 1 recruits.  
Rank 2 units can spend 2 separate turns to convert an allied Rank 1 unit into a Rank 2 unit.  
Rank 2 units can martyr themselves to convert an enemy Rank 2 unit into a Rank 1 recruit.  
Rank 2 units can martyr themselves to convert an enemy Rank 1 unit into a Rank 2 recruit.  
Once a unit is partially converted, either cult may complete the conversion to claim the recruit.  

Design and Art: Tony Cain  
Programming: Paul Muren

Disclaimer: There is no win condition implemented yet.

entries.title: Bloodgold: Sunken Treasure
entries.description:
# Loot calls from the bottom of the sea

You're a viking ... looting and pilfering at the bottom of the sea! Why? Doesn't matter, just get cracking!

Ugly fishy monsters will try to stop you, but a good smack from your axe should solve that problem. Grab the gold and get out - leave nothing behind.

## How to Play

- Move with the WASD or arrow keys.
- Left-click to attack with your axe.
- Right-click to throw gold. This costs gold!


- Gather as much gold as you can. But beware: carrying all that gold makes you slow.
- Greed must be managed -- sacrifices must be made.
- Gold is your health, score, a weapon, and a burden. Manage it well - run out and you lose.
- There are four levels in total, each building upon the previous.

## Show me!

![Screen4.png](///raw/e68/3/z/1ce7d.png)

![Screen2.png](///raw/e68/3/z/1ce7f.png)

entries.title: Lonely Wanderer
entries.description:
Hi, i’m Andrea Di Bartolo, 3d Artist currently working for Shoppe Keep 2, this is my third Ludum Dare where i try, as an artist, to do a game all by myself (with a little exception this time), this time i joined the jam very late (monday morning), had a very sad and tragic week and wasn't sure i had the time to partecipate, in the end i decided to do a short, narrative-driven game for this event.

Lonely Wanderer is a simple first person narrative driven game set in an evil-looking palace in hell, standard fps controls plus left click to pick up the Skulls, there is nothing else to say here about the game because i want you to discover it by yourselves.

The game is based on a Short, intresting story/poem written by my friend Francesco Ramorino that joined me for this jam, first time for him!

entries.title: The Corridor of Locked Doors
entries.description:
## A card game of observation and trickery

**_The premise of the corridor of locked doors is simple. There is a treasure at the end of a corridor. In front of the treasure, there are four locked doors, one after another. In front of each door, there is also a key hanging on the wall. Each participant also gets a random key. The participants take turns to either try to get to the treasure or get a new key. Whoever gets to the treasure first is the winner!_**

The game is played with a standard 52-card deck. Each ace represents a locked door, and any other card of that suit represents a key to that door.

# Preparations
Starts by removing, shuffling and dealing the four aces in order, face up. The first ace down represents the last locked door, and the last ace down represents the first locked door. If you want, put the joker at the very bottom to represent the treasure. 

Now, insert a random card face down, on top of each ace. This is the key currently hanging on that door, but its type is not commonly known.

Each player is then dealt a random card, representing a key. It is advisable but optional to keep this card secret.

Put the remaining cards face down in a pile - this is the draw pile.

The youngest players is given the option to go first. If they decline, the next player (clockwise) has the choice, until the last player who has no choice but to go first.

# Gameplay
The player take turns, clockwise. Each turn, a player may do one of two things. 

- Option 1: Get a new key. Deal two cards face up from the draw pile. Pick one and discard the other plus their current key (without disclosing it) to a face down discard pile. Alternatively the player may choose to pick neither and keep their current key. If there are less than two cards left in the draw pile, shuffle the discard pile and add it to the bottom of the draw pile - and then, immediately, deal another card to each player: everyone can now hold one more key in their inventory! If the game has gone on long enough for the players to have four keys in their inventory, the game is deemed over and everyone loses.

- Option 2: Go for the treasure. The player picks up the key card in front of the first door, and looks at it either publicly or privately. In order to pass the first locked door, they need to prove that they have a key by playing it face up. (In this case, that would be either the key from their hand or the key they just picked up from in front of the first door). Repeat this process for the second door etc. If the player can't (or chooses not to) show the appropriate key, their quest for the treasure ends for this round. While leaving the corridor, they must place one key in front of each door so far opened, although it does not need to be the same key they picked up when entering. The player should be left with one key (again, does not need to be the one they entered with). If the player opens all four doors, they get the treasure and win the game!

If not - the turn then goes to the next clockwise player. 

# Summary
The game thus is about observing players gradually getting further into the corridor of locked doors, and making calculated guesses at which keys other players hold and which keys are hanging in the corridor. It is kind of collaborative, as the corridor will eventually (assuming no trolls) have the right keys in the right order, but also competitive, as each player will want to be the first one to the treasure. And as players gain more keys over time, the game will finish eventually...

# Game in action 
![corridor.png](///raw/71/z/1d921.png)

Comments and feedback much appreciated!

Cover photo by [Annie Spratt](https://unsplash.com/photos/xYP68VouUSY?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText) on [Unsplash](https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=unsplash&utm_medium=referral&utm_content=creditCopyText).

entries.title: Sidegrade
entries.description:
## Description
A shoot 'em up where you have to apply one upgrade after each wave of enemies. Each upgrade, however, also has a negative effect. You must sacrifice one stat to make another stronger.

This game was made for [Ludum Dare 43](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/43) where the theme was `Sacrifices must be made`.


## How to play
- Arrow keys to move
- Hold Z to shoot
- Destroy the enemies
- Upgrade your ship
- Survive the wave
- alt+F4 exits the game

## Post-mortem-ish
Not as feature complete as I'd like but I'm still quite happy with how it turned out. I really don't have the energy anymore to add any new features.

I didn't enjoy this LD as much as I hoped/expected. It's really demotivating to have to scrap an entire day of progress and start over. Hopefully the next one will be more fun. At least this has been a big learning experience for me in picking the right tools.


## Known bugs and issues
- Sometimes enemy projectiles don't collide with the player
- There's nothing after wave 11 (but you're not really supposed to survive wave 11 anyway)
- There's no main menu
- The game exits immediately upon game-over
- No clean way to exit the game, you have to use alt+F4

I guess some features had to be sacrificed :)


## Credits
All music and sound effects (modified) from: [ZapSplat](https://www.zapsplat.com/)

Everything else (well, apart from Unreal Engine 4) was made by me (ReiMari) during the jam.

entries.title: BrotherLight
entries.description:
You and your brother are stranded on a planet together. Your brother is suffering an illness that's not curable, which will potentially kill your brother as time passes. While stranded, black creatures spawns out of nowhere and approaches your brother. You as the older brother, have the power to absorb and transfer life energy. As cruel as it may seem, you have to take the lifeforces of these creatures and transfer them to your brother in order to keep him alive.

LeftMouseButton - Transfer energy
RightMouseButton - Absorb energy

entries.title: Pyrrhic Victory
entries.description:
Should you sacrifice your barracks to improve your barricades or the other way around?

There are two ways to win in Pyrrhic Victory: **attack** and **defense**.

If you chose to **attack** you'll have to build a lot of tough troops to annihilate your opponent's Citadel. **This means sacrificing your defense**.

If you choose to **defend** your Citadel, you'll have to build tough walls and powerful turrets. **This means sacrificing your attack**. You need to have less destroyed buildings than your opponent at the end of the counter.

https://youtu.be/qQfudIBPJmA

**POST-JAM UPDATED VERSION**

I finally had the time to work on [a little update](https://florian-chassaing.itch.io/pyrrhic-victory-updated)

What has changed:

- Added Difficulty selection.
- Added AI Behaviour selection.
![difficultySelection.png](///raw/22f/z/1f6f5.png)
- Improved AI.
- Tried to balance the game so you can really win in defense (but gosh! balancing is such a hard process)
- Added a restart button that you can use in game and at the end.

I made a specific [itch.io page](https://florian-chassaing.itch.io/pyrrhic-victory-updated) for this updated version and also [a specific Windows build](https://drive.google.com/open?id=1z1CBpRvwWJbt3Dj3JNfbsDdXVEGWUDE5). Also, rate the original game, I try to always rate back!

entries.title: Traffic Jams and Hand Grenades

entries.title: Pryes
entries.description:
Programmer: Fan Ling   
Artist: Sidan Fan    
Designer: Hao Tian

We are three students from Northeastern Game Science and Design graduate program and decide to team up and participate in Ludum Dare 43. Special shout out to Sonya who came up with the name! 

Description:
This is an RTS game base on a fantasy world similar to ancient Europe. The player is the general of the country called Goetilandia. The country was invaded by an unknown enemy at night and 5 cities were under attack. The remaining troops in each city are defending their cities and waiting for your reinforcement. Without your help, all cities will be lost.

Players need to retrieve all five cities from the enemy. The key elements of this game are:
-  Players can move their armies using right clicks.
-  During the battles in the city, players can choose an attack mode

There are 4 options for players:
- Heavy Attack: The heavy attack will speed up the battle causing both you and your enemy lose battle faster.
- Normal Attack: Default attack pace.
- Defense: Lose less amount of your armies and more likely to survive from a battle, but it will take a longer time to defeat the enemy.
- Retreat: Retreat from a city with your remaining army in the city with penalties and you will lose the city.

The goal is to retrieve as many cities and as you can and have as many kills as you can.


![p1.png](///raw/0c7/f1/z/1cf8a.png)

![p2.jpeg](///raw/0c7/f1/z/1cf88.jpg)

Play Environment Suggestion:
- Windows: 
   WIn10 64bits - resolution 1920*1080
- Mac:
   resolutuon 2048 * 1280

entries.title: Tower Builders
entries.description:
## Description

Hi!

Let's go straight to the point. We need to build the highest tower in the world, but we need to do it as fast as possible, so we must sacrifice quality for the speed. There is an indicator at the top, the more time is left on it, the more points you get for the block. Hit Space button to release block, but beware, it's a bit windy here. You can continue building until five blocks falls. Hold Z to observe the whole tower.

Good luck! (Press return to continue)

## Gameplay

![Screenshot 2018-12-03 18.30.58.png](///raw/6db/81/z/1cdc2.png)

Had only a few hours on monday, so made this simple game, almost in one shot.

entries.title: Aztec Defender
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare entry!

You are a fierce warrior of the ancient Aztecs, however, one of the sacred temples is being invaded by a rival tribe. You are tasked with defending the idol that rests within the temple.

As you fight more and more waves of enemies, the gods look kindly upon you and allow you the chance to make an offering of a human sacrifice in order to restore your health or upgrade your weapon.

The blessing of Xochiquetzal, the goddess of fertility allows you to restore what little health you have, where as the blessing of Mixcoatl, the god of the hunt, allows you to upgrade your spear and do more damage.  


Sound Credits!

entries.title: Soul Reaper
entries.description:
**How to play:**
You're a reaper harvesting souls.

Souls are what keeps you alive, it is your health but is also used to upgrade your weapon. So you have to **sacrifice** some of your souls to upgrade your weapon.

Upgrading the weapon will make it stronger, increase hit range, and attack faster.

The souls are blue orbs hovering around. Attack the souls to harvest them.

Oh almost forgot, look out for Soul Guardians they will hunt you and take back the souls you harvest. If they take away too many souls, well you're dead... again, I suppose :-P A reaper is undead right?

**Controls:**
- WASD = Move
- Left mouse button = Attack
- E = Interact
- Z = Skip wave timer

This is my 3rd LD Jam and I really enjoyed doing it again, this is my favorite theme so far :-)
Please rate and give me some feedback, and if you find any bugs then comment and then maybe I can fix it before the jam ends :-)

**Screenshots:**
![Main menu.png](///raw/bc8/31/z/1cdcb.png)

![Gameplay.PNG](///raw/bc8/31/z/1cdd9.png)

Made in around 10 hours due to work :( wish I had a bit more time to refine the player controller, but still quite happy with what I managed to produce. 

After accidentally opening a gateway to hell, you must face the threat of Demons invading ​the Earth. You bargain with Beelzebub himself, who demands sacrifices, in return, he agrees to close the gateway, however, if you don't sacrifice fast enough, he will unleash his demon army upon the planet. 
How to play -

Chase as many sheep as you can into the gateway before the time runs out. Each sacrifice buys you an additional 10 seconds to save the planet. Act fast and pray the demon will keep his word.

W/S - Walk
A/D - Turn
Mouse - Rotate camera
Escape - Pause

## Description

As a bodyguard you've got to put your body on the line day in and day out and being one isn't a easy job. Being the president's personal body guard makes the job even harder. You're bound to get shot a few times during your line of duty... 

Escort the president through danger *7* filled cities as you desperately try to protect him from deadly enemies, sacrificing yourself for his protection! Luckily you seem to be able to take a couple of hits...

**WASD to move, Spacebar to dive**

**Your progress is saved so you may close the page and continue where you left off another time**

entries.title: Pixel Fight
entries.description:
Hey,

Welcome to the game Pixel Fight! It is a very fun game made for the Lundum Dare 43 you can do on your own but also with two players (two players are more fun). The intention of the game is to kill the opponent. Every 10 seconds a coin falls from the sky and with that coin you can buy ammo at the ammo box. Make sure it does not 
break down otherwise you will not be able to reach the ammo anymore and then you will no longer be able to kill your opponent. You can also buy blocks and a turret for a coin. Good luck!

Player 1
Move = Keys
Shoot = Down key then M
Get ammo = Down key
Go into a turret = Down key

Player 2
Move = WASD
Shoot = S then E
Get ammo = S
Go into a turret = S

It may take a while to load the Flash. Wait a few seconds or a minute.!

[pizel fight gameplay.png](///raw/819/02/z/1cdd2.png)

Ice Runner
entries.description:
The Ice People need to fullfil their destiny of cooling off a warm fizzy beverage. They can only achieve this by sacrificing some of their kin in the pools of lava which, for some reason, lay between them and their goal.

When an ice person, which looks like an ice cube (I'm hopeless at animation) comes into contact with lava (or similar) it solidifies that lava into solid rock.  The next ice person will then be able to use that solid piece as a platform and thus progress further into the level.

Beware also of spike pits and air mines.

Controls are included in the game. Left and right cursor keys can be used if preferred.

There are currently 4 levels to play through.

Good luck, have fun and thanks for playing!

**There are four different types of characters:**
![c1.png](///raw/84c/2/z/1cdac.png)![c2.png](///raw/84c/2/z/1cdad.png)

**========================================================**

**CONTROLS**

**Movement** - ASDW 

**Aim** - Mouse

**Shoot** - Mouse Left Button

**Special Attack** - Space

**Pause** - P

**========================================================**

Every time you use your special attack your current character will be sacrificed​.
When a demon hits you, the last character of the row will die, and a shield will protect you from being damaged again.
You can keep pressed the Shoot button to shoot as fast as possible.
The GOD shot will follow your mouse, you only have to shoot the first time.

**========================================================**

Code/Art/Sfx by: [Àngel Navarro](https://twitter.com/EingelNavarro)

Music by: [Matt Winchell](https://soundcloud.com/matt-winchell/8-bit-get-along-from-the-slayers)

**========================================================**

**THANKS FOR PLAYING!!** I really hope you love the game!!

**Try your best! **

entries.title: Serial Dater
entries.description:
![thumbnail.jpg](///raw/a36/3/z/1cd4d.jpg)

In this game, just like in real life, dating is HELL.

You've sold your soul to the Devil for one last shot at love.  Armed with supernatural date-seeking powers and a ticket to the biggest speed-dating event of the year, you're BOUND to find love!

However, the Devil has his own plans, and purposefully flooded the dating pool with dozens of serial killers!  You must use your newfound powers to determine as quickly as possible whether or not your potential suitor wants to date you or stab you in the back.  However, the more you use your powers, the more difficult they will become to use, so don't rely on one for too long!


**Powers:**

**Mind-Reading:**  As your date speaks, listen to what they're REALLY saying in their thoughts.  If even one line of text sounds murder-y to you, hit that PASS button!

**Seduction:**  Type out flirt words to magically woo your suitor into confessing their deepest darkest secret.  Each date has one specific word that is their Achilles' heel.  Type away until you find it, and figure out if their secret is benign or ominous...

**X-Ray Vision:**  Click on the swirls that appear on the suitor's body.  Reveal all of the green tokens without clicking any of the red ones in order to discover what the suitor is currently carrying on them.  You may find anything ranging from a spare stick of deodorant to a list of future victims...


You should be able to find all the information you need by using any one power at a time.  The moment you think it's safe to say "yes", click DATE!  However, if you discover anything suspicious, hit PASS!  You'll lose points saying "no" to innocent suitors, but at least you'll still be alive!

![OpeningScene1.jpg](///raw/a36/3/z/1cd11.jpg)

![normal.png](///raw/a36/3/z/1cd8c.png)

![thoughts.png](///raw/a36/3/z/1cd8d.png)

![seduction.png](///raw/a36/3/z/1cd8e.png)

![vision.png](///raw/a36/3/z/1cd90.png)


**Programmer:**  Jared Slawski (ColeSlaughter)

**3D Environment Modeling:**  Stephen Rudd (ruddgasm)

**2D Character Artwork:**  Andrew Rudd (ruddiculous)

entries.title: Welcome President
entries.description:

You will have to choose your faction and you must get your factions approval rating to 60% to win.

Each month you will be given new proposals that you need to either approve or deny by swiping them left to deny or right to approve.

![econ.PNG](///raw/97e/2/z/1cd38.png)

Your advisors from each faction will periodically let you know how they feel about each proposal as approving or denying them will affect their factions approval.

At the end of each month, you will recieve a report detailing how your ratings have changed from the previous month.

If any of your ratings are below 0 by the end of the month, its game over.

![environ.PNG](///raw/97e/2/z/1cd3e.png)

Firefox is recommended for web build as chrome tends to lag.

entries.description:
Sacrifice Powers is a turn base attacking games where you must depleted your enemies hp to 0
You are given 1 attack and 3 powers in order to fight against your enemy. However while your powers may be necessary to beat the enemy they each provide a negative effect that you must always be mindful of. 

You have 3 power to use (all being 1 used only) 

1.Rocket (positive: you take damage, negative: You will lose a bit of your heath)

2.Healing (Increase your health, negative: you miss 1 round

3.Power returner( positive: return one power, negative: Enemy’s health increase)

Sacrifice Powers can be played both as a single player against an AI or 2 player against each other on the same computer.

sky_fighter - Programming

Shayan - Art, Music

entries.title: Gossip
entries.description:
Gossip is a game I made for Ludum Dare 43. It's a serious game about spreading rumors and sacrificing friendships to get to the one you love. 

Every play through is a little different because the text that appears is random. I developed my own semi-procedural narrative system with pronouns and different rumors every time.

I had this concept a while back vaguely based off the experimental game Gossip (1983) for the Atari. When I heard the theme for Ludum Dare 43 is Sacrifices Must Be Made, I thought I could mix these two concepts together to make this strange game.

For this project I used a custom editor tool that I created called the Story Graph. It's a visual scripting tool that allows me to easily make events, coroutines, and functions and be able to visually debug my code (instead of throwing a bunch of debug.logs everywhere). I plan to release it on the Unity Asset Store soon!!

For whatever reason I thought that I could animate everything with co-routines instead of the Timeline or Animation window, so it looks a little janky. While it did save me a lot of time in certain places, it definitely made it harder in others.

entries.title: Colobopsis Explodens
entries.description:
# Colobopsis Explodens

is a small clone of „Lemmings“. Due to overpopulation, some ants have to leave the ant hill and get a new one. But the road to the new anthill is dangerous there would be:
- Obstacles blocking the way
- natural enemies
- abysses
- and so on 

To sustain the existence of your own species, enough ants must survive. In order to protect and defend against the impending dangers, some ants can sacrifice themselves.

They can:
- sacrifice himself to block the way with her body
- blow up himself to destroy blocking obstacles
- blow up himself and secrete a toxic secretion to defeat enemies  

## Gameplay
- the ants run by themselves if they touch an obstacle the turn around
- Select a ant by clicking and then select one oft he commands: 
  - Kill -> sacrifice himself 
  - Exploded -> blow up himself 
  - Toxic -> blow up himself and secrete a toxic secretion 

a given command can not be undone and the ant can not be selected afterwards
- You have limited time

### Tools used:
- Music - bfxr
- ​Art – Aseprite, Piskel
- ​Engine - Godot 3.1 alpha
- ​Version control – Git/Github
- ​Editor – Visual Studio Code 
 

That was the first time I participated in the Ludum Dare. So unfortunately i only get this prototype finish but still I am satisfied that i made it and i learnd a lot by doing it.

Also please excuse my bad pixel art skills and my poor english ;) 

PS:

I dont know if the Versions for Linus and Mac OS will be work, i cant test them.
And in the HTML5 Version the "Exit-Button"s dosent work.

If i had more time id make some animations/alternate sprites for damaged parts as well as for hits with the laser. I would also have liked to give more options for what parts to sacrifice, areas to jump to as well as expand the combat system, but oh well, doesnt matter too much now.

Thank you all for checking out my first entry to Ludum Dare, I know the code base is a disaster and if I were to do this again id do it completely differently, but hindsight 20/20 and sometimes in the moment you just do something despite it being a stupid way to do it.

Suggestions and feedback is welcome!

entries.title: Not so Magic!
entries.description:
![jassImg02.PNG](///raw/d4a/6/z/1cc65.png)

Game made for LDJAM #43.

"Not so Magic!" Is a simple card game with medieval fantastic content. Beat Orcs with your Elfs earn gold and defeat our IA.

It was our first attempt to make a 3D game. We know that we're not so much in the LD's 43th theme but we wanted to make a fun game about an idea we had for months in mind.

We would be very pleased to improve the game with the following features in the next monts or so :

- Improved models and graphics
- Add some FX
- Sounds and music
- 1vs1
- 1vs1vs1vs1
- NetPlay

Be sure to tell us if you like the concept as much as we do so we can give a little more energy in the development of this creation. Any other feedback is also welcome!

Have fun guys!

------------------ RULES ----------------------

You have to play a card the same race your opponent played.
Exception : when you don't have any more card of the same race you can "cut" with a card with race from the current territory (and win) or any other card (and loose)
The highest attack rank card wins
You can "cut" at anytime with a card from the race on its on territory to take the turn and win but try to spare those cards wisely.

entries.title: Cult Village
entries.description:
### Story ###
You are the leader of a cult village.
Your cruel god often asks the villagers for sacrifices.
God will ask for different sacrifices every time, meet his requirements, or punishment will come.

### Gameplay ###
You must maintain your village as long as possible.
Your villagers need housing and food, otherwise they will lose health and die.
Your evil god will demand sacrifices from your villagers, or he will punish your village.
You must sacrifice the correct villager to avoid punishment.

### Control ###
-A,D to move
- left click on villagers to kidnap them
- right click to release villagers
- left click on altar to sacrifice villagers
- left click on buildings to build them
- left click on bell tower to rally villagers togather

entries.title: God given gifts, taken

The gods have chosen you to be their warrior! 

They have blessed you with artifacts of immense power!

But what if you had to go against their will?

You might have to sacrifice power to save a member of your family, Fluffy the puppy.

![Screenshot 2018-12-03 14.24.27.png](///raw/060/1/z/1cc5d.png)

## Controls

The game is a platformer.

Move with arrow keys.

Use powers with Z, X and C

Progress story screens with Spacebar

![Screenshot 2018-12-03 at 14.25.06.png](///raw/060/1/z/1cc5c.png)

## Tech

- Phaser 3, Typescript, ParcelJS, VSCode
- Graphics drawn on the iPad with Pixaki
- God portraits made with Pixel Art Cam on the iPad
- Sounds recorded with an iPhone, edited with Audacity. Made with swinging a USB-cable, strumming a ukulele, banging a marker on different office objects :smile: 
- Music made with Reason, Novation Impulse 25, Steinberg UR22mkII

If you get badly stuck (and want to see the end of the story), press N to skip a level.

One known issue: Sometimes the character is already walking to a direction when a level starts. It seems that phaser is retaining the state of gamescenes, even if they are recreated and it thinks that the button is still being pressed. Weird.

UPDATE: I updated Phaser to 3.15.1 and it fixed the above known issue. Fix is deployed to the same URL, you can see from the sources that nothing else was done.

entries.title: Sometimes you starve I guess...
entries.description:
![cover.png](///raw/3a2/e1/z/1cbe5.png)

A turn based "RPG"

You are lost in the woods, with your friend,
with no civilization in sight.
But still....
You know you have to survive!

Every day you will need food.
(equivalent to the amount of units you have)
How do you get food?
By hunting!

Beware of other starving people!
Each day has stronger foes with better gear,
for you to take!

Or if they survive you can recruit them.
I don't know...
You will be paying their food fee though.

While hunting, you will not always get enough food.
In that case, you have to chose, who will go to bed
on an empty stomach.
(units without food will not regain health, but lose it)
(you can pick your self, to avoid pissing of your friends)

That's right!
Non-player units will get angry with you, if you
do too much shady stuff and will even go as far as
killing you.

You can avoid this by befriending them or simply
avoiding inhumane actions.

Like in any cül rpg, there is magic!
You start of with 3 spells, but can get more
at the pentagram.
Explanation not needed >:3


CONTROLS: left click

entries.title: King's Guard
entries.description:
This is my first Ludum Dare! I hope you guys enjoy the game :D

Unfortunately, I didn't have much time to work in this game (around 12 hours). I recommend you to try to play the web version as you don't need to download it :)

-----------

Your heroes are ready to sacrifice their lives to protect their king! Defend your king against an army of monsters at all costs! Long live the King!

Instructions:
- Use mouse only
- Drag and drop your heroes by positioning them to use better strategies against enemies. 
- Each hero has specific skills


Wizard: long range magic. 
HP 100 / Dmg 2

Knight: short range fireballs. 
HP 100 / Dmg 3

Tank: more health to protect the other heroes. 
HP 300 / Dmg: -

Healer: shoot health globes to restore health from guardians and other heroes. 
HP: 80 / Dmg: -

Guardian: can be activated with projectiles from Wizard and Knight. Guardians are stationary and cannot be moved. 
HP: 500 / Dmg: 3

King: he is stationary and cannot be moved. Other heroes and guardians must protect him. 
HP: 200/ Dmg: -


![ezgif.com-crop.gif](///raw/be6/f1/z/1d488.gif)

*Update*: The spawn time of the enemies was updated based on some feedback that I received. I didn't change the game, only fixed the enemy spawn time as it was too hard to survive the waves of monsters. I hope it is better to play now :D

entries.title: Meat Spike
entries.description:
### Main Mechanic
The way I followed the theme was by creating a platformer where your deaths create your platforms. When you die on a spike your body will stay on the spike creating a red platform. The sacrifice is one of your lives so you have to be careful where you use them, if you make too many mistakes and run out of lives it will be game over.

### Story
Jeremy is a collective. He must sacrifice many of himself to get to The Cube. Along the way Jeremy will find lost chunks of himself which allow him to get further.

### Difficulties
Easy mode gives double lives and Hardcore disables checkpoints. Normal is the intended way to play. Can you get less deaths than my lowest of 54?

### Genres
Sidescroller/Platformer

An adorable apocalyptic dating sim! God has chosen you to save Earth from a fiery end, and your only hope for salvation is finding a sacrifice. The only problem: the sacrifice must be in love with you. You must seduce Goat: a budding writer who is also a goat. Will you and your relationship survive the end of the world?  
  
This game has five endings. Try to get the best ones! 

![MainMenu2_Sm.gif](///raw/089/d/z/1cb2a.gif)

![Dialogue_Sm2.gif](///raw/089/d/z/1cb2b.gif)


Hint: The minigames do matter! Your performance in them can unlock more dialogue options and other endings. We were too rushed to add a proper tutorial, but it's a simple "right choice, right place" game similar to the board game "Mastermind". You must perform the correct choices in the correct order to get maximum points. There CAN be duplicate choices though! 

# Our team:  
Project Lead/Lead Programmer: Saul Amster  
Programmer: Aidan Saltini  
Lead Writer: Julia LaCava  
Writers: Emma Herbst and Kristen Gregg  
  
  
## Thank you! And enjoy!
The "FIXED_POST" version is the updated version that fixes some of the game breaking bugs (depending on your playthrough). It was made after the Jam time was over, so if you want the original (possibly broken) experience play the non "FIXED_POST" game.

entries.title: Let's Play 'KILLGORE MURDERMASTER RPG'
entries.description:
A small twine game made during like a half dozen spare hours of finals week. It's about watching LPs and speedruns and how people make games their own.

![KMScreenshot.PNG](///raw/304/8/z/1cb2e.png)

entries.title: Overpopulation
entries.description:
# It is the year 2200 and overpopulation has become a real problem!

Overpopulation is a game, where you have to make decisions of whether to sacrifice, or spare people.
You need to look at data and decide, but watch out! You can easily make enemies.

## Screenshots:
![Overpopulation_1.png](///raw/756/91/z/1bc2b.png)
![Overpopulation_2.png](///raw/756/91/z/1bc2e.png)

### Tools used:
- Unity 3D
- Visual Studio
- Paint.net
- Audacity
- Blender

### Features: 
- Over 50 names
- Multiple greetings
- Multiple records/history
- 5 endings

### How to play:
- Press Q see record/crimes and E to see details and guidelines.
- When you have found whether you want to sacrifice or spare a person click the buttons below or press S or L
- There are 5 days in the game.
Thats it! Hope you enjoy

## We really recommend you download the game instead of playing the web version (Because we really had to turn the graphics down for it to be able to run on the web! And theres no audio)

entries.title: Don't Sloth
entries.description:
Play a hunter-gatherer and collect 10 items to sacrifice to the sloth god before dusk.

Controls:
WASD for movement. Hold Left Shift to run. E to pick up items or put them on the altar.
Your inventory limit is 5.  You need 10 items on the altar before dawn.

Credits:
Artwork: Aim Diab
Music: Michael Marney-Brusstar
Programming: Michael Marney-Brusstar and Aim Diab

![screen2.jpg](///raw/c18/61/z/1cb2c.jpg)

entries.title: Wizard Swarm
entries.description:
![Title.PNG](///raw/115/31/z/1cae8.png)


![Cre.PNG](///raw/115/31/z/1cae2.png)


![Capre.PNG](///raw/115/31/z/1cae4.png)

Controller Required, Xbox inputs by default.

Wizard Swarm is an intense twin-stick shooter with endless waves that increase in difficulty. Take control of rookie wizard, Herald, in his quest to save the streets of Endavar from evil red robots from the future. Herald isn't alone as he has his trusty machine gun wand that is powered by control stick magic. At the end of every wave has you sacrificing one of your stats for a better chance of survival.

This is our second Ludum Dare. Unfortunately, our artist couldn't participate this time so you'll have to deal with our beautiful programmer art. We decided to use Unity instead of Godot this time, which posed some challenges. Neither of us had used C# before, so it was definitely a learning experience. We hope you enjoy our game as much as we enjoyed making it.

entries.title: Vee's Village
entries.description:
![screenshot.png](///raw/177/a1/z/1cb23.png)

​This is a small tech demo for Ludum Dare 43 to test out my fantasy console project, Galapagos. I may return to it with a fleshed out design and production in the future. I'm mostly interested in technical feedback on the stability and performance of this build.

You are Vee, a vampire who thirsts for the blood of villagers. However, to get villagers to prey on, she has to build the village herself.

How to play: Press the arrow keys to move around the map. Press the "A" key to pick up rocks and gain material. Press the "S" key to turn the material into walls near you. When villagers appear, run into them to gain strength.

entries.title: Hazardous Cleanup
entries.description:
Hazardous Cleanup has players fulfilling the desires of a Duke. They must clean up the spikes that were left in his new castle from the previous occupant. The problem is that the spikes can't be removed. They can only be used. The player guides a collection of unassuming peasants to their demises so that the castle might be safe for the Duke and his family.

The peasants move with A-D and jump with space. To add new peasants (when available) press W or S to remove them again. The peasants work together as a unit. It's important because some spikes cannot be reached alone.
![PessimisticUnnaturalGadwall-size_restricted.gif](///raw/6a1/f1/z/1efd5.gif)

Peasants can leave their stack to work towards multiple goals. Sometimes the bodies of old friends can be used as a way to keep moving forward. The game is all about knowing when to sacrifice your friends to get to where you are going.
![Screenshot_120318_010938_AM.jpg](///raw/6a1/f1/z/1efda.jpg)

Luckily its not all bad for you and the peasants. For a job well done, the Duke's always enthusiastic and bright spirited nature points out the lighter side of things.
![Screenshot_120318_011204_AM.jpg](///raw/6a1/f1/z/1cb17.jpg)

This is my first Game Jam, and I've had an absolutely great time. Unfortunately work calls tomorrow so this is far as I take things. I look forward to getting feedback and playing all of your games as well! 

If this experience has taught me anything it's that designing compelling levels is hard and I'm not an artist.

entries.title: Upsystem
entries.description:
![UpSystemTitle.png](///raw/c57/z/1c316.png)

The mighty Bearlon fleet chase your fleet of refugees across the universe.  The only hope you have is to find your fabled home planet in hopes of finding safety.  Can you find your home before the Bearlon fleet finds and devours you?

Created in 48(ish) hours by:
- Terry Gruenewald
- Jack Campbell
- Branden Strochinsky
- Ryan Strochinsky
- Chandler Norris
- Brian Trotter
- Adam Williams
- Tamara Gruenewald
- Katherine Gruenewald

Latest game with bug fixes:  http://upsystem.ga/

entries.title: Imagination
entries.description: Hailey lives in a world with monsters, but with a sad twist.![vis8.png](///raw/2ca/21/z/1b980.png)

entries.title: Mind Your Minions
entries.description:
Mind Your Minions is a puzzle platformer where you are a king who must collect his minions and sacrifice them in order to to reach the end goal. The minions gather in a queue behind you as you pick them up, and you can only use the minion at the front of the queue at a time. They will protect you as they follow you, so they resemble your in-game lives. You must sacrifice them to progress, but if you take damage without any following you, it's game over!

This was our first Ludum Dare, and while we didn't participate in Compo, we did finish in 48 hours with one playable  sample level, with four different types of minions (fire, water, bomb, normal), obstacles, and a queue structure used to have them follow you. A full game would include levels that test the user on picking up the right minions, in the right order, and using them to navigate different obstacles. ![Screenshot.PNG](///raw/b26/d1/z/1e696.png)

entries.title: Vulcano
entries.description:
This is a game my wife, my son and myself have created in a couple of hours. We had alot of fun making it.

---

Your servants want to bring goods to the temple. Unfortunately the bridge was build over an active volcano and the only way to please the gods and calm the volcano is to sacrifice some of your goods (and people...).

Sacrifice the goods that are displayed at the bottom of the screen by clicking on your servants.

![game.PNG](///raw/a32/e/z/1bce2.png)

---

Edit (03.12.18)
- Fixed a bug where a servant could be clicked multiple times

entries.title: Bunny Cooking
entries.description:
1 to 5 local players. Supports keyboard and up to 4 controllers.

In this silly micro game, a frantic team of rabbits must feed their baby bunnies with carrot soup but when the carrots run out they can either sacrifice a baby bunny or try to farm more by pooping before the baby bunnies starve.  

Yeah very morbid...

entries.title: Dilemma
entries.description:
Super short "game" about leaving Earth.

First ludum dare.

Made using AGS.

Music - Me

Scuffed Art - Me

entries.title: Chompymon
entries.description:
![chompymon.gif](///raw/a2a/z/1caf3.gif)

Grow a collection of cute demons who love to eat old files from your hard drive! The files that you feed to the Chompymon ARE ACTUALLY DELETED FOREVER. There are plenty of warnings about this. 

**BIRTH/SUMMON** your Chompymon, procedurally generated from your specific computer data

**FEED** files to the Chompymon to fatten it up, the bigger and older, the better

**EVOLVE** your Chompymon by giving it a specific type of file of a certain size, to exponentially  boost your feeding ability

entries.description:

I was really tight on time for this one, so it's not my best work.

entries.title: Save the Wabbit (VR)
entries.description:
Created for the HTC Vive using VRTK, this Tower Defense game places you in a kingdom full of Slimes, Bats, and rabbits. Help the rabbits reach the City Gates by placing towers to Stun, Shield, and Shoot. Towers affect Slimes and Rabbits indiscriminately, so you might just have to sacrifice your tower to save the wabbits. 

Sadly we were ill this weekend and could only spend a day on the project, so we were not able to implement the game we envisioned. We had grand plans of levels, buttons to restart levels, and better feedback for the player when placing items. 

Hopefully, we can work on this post LD, and make the something we can be proud of.

entries.title: Snackrificial Chamber
entries.description:
Not sure how, but you managed to get yourself roped in with a cult led by the greatest snackers in history.  Please the Great Ones by preparing their favorite dish.  But be careful, if you don't meet their requirements you'll have to do it again.

Happy snacking!

entries.title: Save The Wood
entries.description:
This game was made by me and my sister. She did all of the art and images. The game engine I used is the Godot Game engine. The sound effects are all modified public domain sounds. The music is my arrangement of Bach's violin concerto in A minor (BWV 1041) for 5 synthesizers using LMMS. I created this arrangement before the game jam so do not rate the music. 

Controls:
Left click to shoot arrows, spacebar to stoke the fire. Don't let the Tree monster eat you. Shoot the water bees before they put out your fire. You need to choose between sacrificing wood to stoke the fire or to shoot arrows.

P.S. In order to play the game, you need to have the .pck file in the same directory as your OS's respective executable file. Also, I have not tested the Macintosh executable (I do not have a Mac).

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: take me up!
entries.description:
rabbit wants to go up, only you can save it. you need to grab it by holding the 'space' button and carry with arrows.

but be careful, you are not that strong!![take-me-up.png](///raw/761/e1/z/1cdd8.png)

entries.title: The Kingsmen's Sacrifice
entries.description:
**The Kingsmens' Sacrifice**

![screenshot1.jpg](///raw/7d7/1/z/1cac7.jpg)

The Kingdom's treasures have been stolen.

They are kept in the far reaches of the lands around the kingdom.

The only way to get the treasures back is for the kingsmen to make the ultimate sacrifice.

They will be deployed to the lands around the kingdom in search of the riches. They will need to choose one of 3 chests in each region, and then return to the king with the chest.

If you choose correctly, you will return the riches to the kingdom. If you choose poorly, your attempt will be held in the highest regard as the kingsman will be sacrificed.

Can you return with all the kingdom's riches?


**HOW TO PLAY:**

You must place a kingsman in one of the lands (not the castle, that's where they live).
Some kingsmen have better odds in certain lands.
Then you will select one of 3 chests in each land.
Your objective is to choose wisely, and have all 5 kingsmen find riches,
otherwise they will be sacrificed.

**CREATED BY:**

Ben (bugninja) and Jacob (JakMcPloofy)

entries.title: Penelope
entries.description:
[Click here to play (Web)](https://lukewale.com/LudumDare/43/jam/index.html)

A story of love and loss. Follow the stars to reconnect with Penelope.

**Basics:**
* Arrow keys to move, space to jump
* Takes about 10 minutes to finish the game
* HINT: When your faith is tested, you are *left* with few choices

![gameplay.gif](///raw/e1e/d1/z/1de2e.gif)

This is the first Ludum Dare my wife and I have participated in. It's also the first game we've made together. We hope you enjoy playing it; finishing the game is possible but if you sacrifice too much you will never see the ending.

entries.title: Joemister
entries.description:
![LD43 - Joemister_2018-12-02_21-41-10.jpg](///raw/47a/1/z/1ca67.jpg)

Play as Joemister on the quest to get to the last platform in this ACTION PACKED PLATFORMER. Try to make it to the end without Double Jumping!

The game is about 3-5 minutes long, depending on how fast you can platform.

# Features:

Spikes

Double Jumping

MOVING SPIKES

MOVING PLATFORMS!!!

Works in VR!! Best played seated.


# Controls:

## PC
WASD       - Move

Left Click - Yell at Joe to Jump.


## VR


Left ThumbStick - Move

Primary Hand - Index Paddle or X - Jump


## Controller

Left Thumbstick/Dpad - Move

X - Jump


---

Yeah we spent more time trying to get stuff working in VR than we wanted.


Credits:

Alex Bymoen 

Stephen Ma ( twitter.com/tehPHEN )

Bonus Points to Reiley and Calleb for helping us with the Inputs on VR, wouldn't of been possible without you two!

Also Ryan for telling helping us out for trying to move static physics objects.

entries.title: Fall and Fall
entries.description:
Good things happen to those who make sacrifices. Now's your chance to please the gods.

Press the space bar to make your sacrifice, then use WASD or the arrow keys to dodge obstacles.

![screenshot1.png](///raw/2fa/c/z/1ca94.png)

![screenshot2.png](///raw/2fa/c/z/1ca95.png)

entries.title: Rift Plugger
entries.description:
![RiftPlugger1.png](///raw/920/8/z/1d03a.png)

![RiftPlugger3.png](///raw/920/8/z/1d03d.png)

![RiftPlugger5.png](///raw/920/8/z/1d03f.png)

## Genre:

**Top-down action RPG**.


## Description:

In our game you play as a hero who defend village from demons.

Demons come from dimensional rifts and to save your friends you need to plug them.

But how to plug the rifts?

It is up to you what you will sacrifice to do it.


:exclamation: **1920x1080 resolution is highly recommended**

:exclamation: **Known bug: Sometimes if you throw objects in rifts from close range it may not work. Sorry for that.**


## Controls:

**W,A,S,D** - **Movement**

**Aim attack with mouse**

**Left Mouse Button** - **Attack**

**Space** - **Pick / Throw**

**P.S. We have a hard to find, but fun to use bug-o-feature. If you fastly hit an object after throw it will fly faster. It's physics! :)** 


## Team:

[**Mikeliosus**](https://ldjam.com/users/mikeliosus/) - Game design, level design

entries.title: Awkward Sacrifice
entries.description:
Sacrifice part of self to achieve something bigger. :v:

_Haven't done a lot of levels, but the ones that are implemented show the idea pretty well.
Hardest part for me in jams and gamedev in general is to come up with an interesting idea. This one turned out to be better than I anticipated._

Leave your opinions and let me know what you think.
