entries.title: Make the trip
entries.description:
![ludum dare cover.PNG](///raw/0d8/1/z/1ca83.png)

Hi everyone, we are very proud of our new game. This is the time we finish and polish a game in time to publish it.
This is the third time we participate to ludum dare and this time it's one is the best we've made. Thank you for leaving comments and ratings. We are eager to know how much you loved our game. I hope you will have as much fun as we had.

Make the trip: It's a story event game. You will have to reach the dock across the sea. While your boat goes toward it's target many events will come through. Most of those events are force you to make some sacrifices in order to maintain all resources above 0 or you may fail! 

About the scores: The score are based on how much you will perform overall your resources at the end.

About the game play: We expected many kinds of players that is why some people will read events and others won't. 
**There's many sets of event that appear randomly every time you play again. That means new experience every time!**

Game Mechanics: Hugo Guay

UI: William Ste-Marie

Graphics: Véronique Savard

entries.title: The Trolley
entries.description:
![trolleycover.png](///raw/587/02/z/1d63d.png)
### A trolley is approaching a split in the tracks. 
#### There are people tied down on both sides of the track, and no option to stop! A sacrifice must be made!

As in the classic Trolley Problem, this endless runner includes a trolley approaching splits in the track, with people on the tracks on both sides. Hitting people is unavoidable, so you need to sacrifice the fewest people possible! Use A and D to choose a track as you approach a split.
### Controls
- Hold down A and D (or left and right arrow keys) as you approach a switch in the tracks. If no input is provided, the trolley will automatically choose a course for you 🤨

entries.title: Don't Panic
entries.description:
*Web Version available!*

You have found yourself a ship supporting the majestically powerful Improbability Drive.  It's results can be, well, almost anything!  Unfortunately, this is a prototype model and doesn't know how to reverse any negative effects.  The authorities are not too pleased with you stealing their prototype however, and are hot on your tail.  They don't really care about the prototype, just that it doesn't fall into the wrong hands.  I guess somehow they managed to get AHEAD of you, and every time you jump, they still show up?  Eh, who knows.

Game was completed on Sunday even though it is a Jam game.  All assets were done from scratch except the images used on the controls menu.

How To Play:
* To move around, use the w, a, s, and d keys, or the arrow keys, or the left joystick if using a controller (not recommended)
* To shoot, use the space bar, left mouse, or "X" button (button 0 on your controller).
* Shoot enemies to get points.  Each wave has a set number of enemies in it (top-right on the UI).  Kill the number of enemies to go on to the next wave.  You start with 10 shields and 1 hull point (top-left on the UI).  If you lose all your shields and get hit one more time, it's game over!
* There are volume controls in the Options menu on the main screen, and you can view the controls under the "Controls" option in the main menu.
* After each wave, you will be presented with a choice of either a randomly chosen effect or allowing your pursuers to get closer.  Each sacrifices a bit of your safety as the game gets harder after each round.  So yeah, that's what I'm going with for the theme... but you MUST sacrifice something, so it fits :smiley:

If you don't understand the references, then I recommend you read / watch Douglas Adams' "Hitchiker's Guide to the Galaxy".

IF YOU WANT TO FIND ALL THE REFERENCES YOURSELF, DO NOT READ FURTHER (AFTER THE GIF):

![LD43_Trim.gif](///raw/c73/2/z/1c003.gif)

* Each enemy is worth 42 points (before the multiplier)
* The whale and petunias is a reference to one of the improbabilities of the improbability drive in the book / movie... Where the bowl of petunias thinks "Oh no, not again."
* The ready go thing was kind of an homage to Super Smash Bros, I guess in honor of Ultimate coming out next week.
* The randomly chosen negative effect was sort of based on "The Suffering Game" arc from "The Adventure Zone" (great D&D podcast if you are interested).
* The cows, umm, we just wanted cows.  I guess I was kinda thinking of the secret cow level from diablo 2?

entries.title: Kestrel's Ride
Save & sacrifice
entries.description:
ABOUT
----

![2.png](///raw/bb2/1/z/1cd67.png)

"You are the **Supreme Lord Commander of the Heavens**, which is kind of cool.

Hell is on Earth, and you were sent down there to save your fellow worshipers. Well, actually, your contract says you should *at least save ONE* worshiper in each area.

The other might be sacrificed for the greater good."

[PLAY NOW](http://deepnight.net/games/ld43/) (web version)
---

![gameplay2.gif](///raw/bb2/1/z/1cd99.gif)

HOW TO PLAY
----

Play using keyboard or a compatible gamepad (xbox controller recommended).

**Keyboard**
 - ARROWS - move around
 - UP - jump / use wings
 - SPACE - kick
 - R - restart current level

**Gamepad (xbox controller)**
 - LEFT STICK - move around
 - A - jump / use wings
 - X - kick

![3.png](///raw/bb2/1/z/1cd69.png)

entries.title: James and The Dungeon Conundrum
entries.description:
![jamesfullertitle.png](///raw/e45/e1/z/1c9f6.png)

JTDC is a game where our titular friend James must go through dungeons, filled with monsters, and lots o' loot! But the more loot and weapons he collects, the more he realizes the literal weight of his actions.

You must get rid of heavy loot, but it could be really handy, or get you some extra power! If you try to carry too much, the monsters will have an easier time...

Can you defeat those pesky monsters and get out with the best? It's up to you!

![James_and_The_Dungeon_Conundrum_2018-12-03_21-17-02.png](///raw/e45/e1/z/1d6fb.png)

Made for Ludum Dare 43, "Sacrifices must be made"

entries.title: RacecaЯ 1: Sacrificial Racer
entries.description:
![Screenshot (33).png](///raw/38d/d1/z/1c9fc.png)It's a basic multiplayer racing game with a twist. You must choose your car's stats
e.g., Acceleration, Max Speed, and Turn Speed. Each one can either be High, Medium, or Low, but none of them can be the same.![Screenshot (26).png](///raw/38d/d1/z/1ca03.png)Then you must choose whether you want brakes or coolant. After that you can begin racing on one of 15 different tracks.![Screenshot (31).png](///raw/38d/d1/z/1ca06.png)Thank you for playing and enjoy!

entries.title: NOT SO ARIGATO MR. ROBOTO
entries.description:
## Your name: Mr. Roboto. 
### Your mission: Deliver milkshake to your owner, the mighty Teedus! 

But... what's this? Your battery is running low! And you don't know where your charger is! You must find the tablet that controls your modules and find four pieces to build yourself a charger, but you must do it quick, before Teedus realizes that you didn't take proper care of yourself...

![TITLE-01.png](///raw/b9a/1/z/1d360.png)

![capture1.png](///raw/d66/01/z/1d3ce.png)

![capture2.png](///raw/d66/01/z/1d3d2.png)

![capture3.png](///raw/d66/01/z/1d3d5.png)

![capture4.png](///raw/d66/01/z/1d3d6.png)

![capture5.png](///raw/d66/01/z/1d3db.png)


##### DISCLAIMER: We put in a screamer on the game because we thought it was kinda funny given the context of the character Teedus; in order to achieve the screamer, turn off all modules at once when you get your tablet.

entries.title: Lava Luva
entries.description:
![LavaLuva Title.PNG](///raw/69d/d/z/1c074.png)
Manage a small town of villagers, sacrificing people to appease the volcano gods and buy yourself a little more time.

-Click a building then click in the world to place it. Try starting with one of each!

-Click and drag a person to a farm, quarry, or lumber mill to assign them to work there.

-Make sure to place quarries within a few tiles of stone and wood you want them to gather.

-Watch the anger bar at the top; if it grows too high, it's time to drag someone to the volcano and drop them in! Someone will replace them... eventually.
![LavaLuva Screen1.PNG](///raw/69d/d/z/1c079.png)
![LavaLuva Screen3.PNG](///raw/69d/d/z/1c07c.png)

entries.title: Baldaquin 9 - I chose life
entries.description:
Hello there, this it my 9th LD entry, this time with a little tribute to my friend @annagavaldakedavra.
As it was his birthday this week end, we decided to cover one of his previous LD game, and that's what I did... With at least 3 games he made previous years.

Play with headphones !

Controls are pretty straightforwards :

Act 1 : Arrows to move, left click to drain power from things.

tip : there are only 2 objects you can drain in this "world" and the mouse icon doesn't show up randomly.


![screenshot1.png](///raw/041/3/z/1c9b2.png)


Act 2 : Right to accelerate, Down to crouch, Up to jump.

tip : the timer is tight but it's doable


![screenshot2.png](///raw/041/3/z/1c9b5.png)


Act 3 : Arrows to move.

tip : have fun before completing the objective


![screenshot3.png](///raw/041/3/z/1c9b6.png)


It was made with Construct 2 under 48 hours.
Graphics with paint.net.
Audio with my mouth, kitchenware and Audacity.
Music generated with Jukedeck.

Have fun.!

entries.title: The Cold Remains of Warmer Days
entries.description:
-The cold remains of warmer days is the last game of a trilogy about dealing with a breakup and depression.

-I made a game each year to show the “evolution” of the feeling and now it comes to an end. All three games were developed for Ludum Dare.

-The cold remains of warmer days shows my creative process to make this kind of narrative experience.

-This game represents my feelings with a surreal and dreamy aesthetic.

-This is not a traditional game, it is an experience full of meaning and every design choice has a reason.

-Be open-minded, play at your own pace, try without hurry.

-The audio is very important for the experience, so a headphone is recommended.


-If you want to play the 3 games of the trilogy, here they are, in order:

Forever Someday: http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-36/?action=preview&uid=110418

The color of days to come: https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/39/the-color-of-days-to-come

---> THE COLD REMAINS OF WARMER DAYS: http://www.mediafire.com/file/td7jb5s897h1a56/TheColdRemainsOfWarmerDays.zip/file  <---

entries.title: Never Coming Back
entries.description:
You have permanently offered yourself to the underworld for the sole purpose of terminating its spawns using your twin shotguns and pure badassery.

* WASD -> Move
* Spacebar -> Double jump
* Left / Right Mouse Click -> Fire Weapon

Note:
* DMG -> Damage
* ACC -> Accuracy
* RPM -> Rounds per Minute


This is my first time participating in the glorious **LUDUM DARE**, and had lots of fun. I can't wait to play all your games and see you in the next one! :wink:

entries.title: Dungeon Runer
entries.description:
Dungeon Runer is a take on the roguelikes of my youth, specifically Moria, a game I didn't understand at all as I was only 5 and didn't speak a word of english.

The game doesn't have any readable text, only runes, but here's the translation of the tutorial because I'm nice:

- PRESS WASD/ZQSD TO MOVE AND SELECT
- PRESS SPACEBAR TO CONFIRM!
- PRESS THE ARROWS TO FIRE
- PRESS P TO PAUSE/UNPAUSE
- PRESS H TO SEE THE HIGHSCORES/HIDE THEM

Other hints you might find useful:

- There's two levels and a boss.
- It takes a lot of trial and errors
- Sacrifices must be made

GAME AND SOURCE (HTML5)
http://dev.androidandrea.com/ld43/

Some screenshots

![2018-12-03_04h08_30.png](///raw/f19/1/z/1c982.png)

entries.title: Reverse Quest
entries.description:
The hero arrives at the final dungeon in their quest to discover true happiness. Upon completing the journey, the hero realizes that true happiness involves giving up all material possessions.

Return the bow and the sword to the blue and green temples and optionally all but 3 health upgrades to the 7 mini-dungeons in the world. Once you have no weapons, the hero can return to their home in the east by the sea to live out the rest of their life content.

Controls:

Wasd to move/left joystick

Left click to attack/a button

Right click to switch weapon/b button

Advice:
-Some mini-dungeons (Just marked as entrances into mountains) require the weapons to complete. But be careful, completing these makes the game harder by reducing your max health.

-The two main temples can be completed in any order, but the second one will be harder because you will be missing a weapon.

-Your house is in the top right of the map. It is only accessible when you have no weapons. Entering will finish the game.

-The hardest dungeon to do at low health is the mini-dungeon in the bottom right, I would do that before the others if you are having trouble.

![Overworld.png](///raw/a47/z/1c98a.png)
![Lost Key.png](///raw/a47/z/1c98c.png)
![Archer Challenge.png](///raw/a47/z/1c98d.png)

Created as a solo project. All art, music and code was created during the jam.

entries.title: Mount 'n' Glory: A Glorious Grail Quest
entries.description:
![LD_Main.png](///raw/c66/2/z/1c9ff.png)

## Your followers need you to lead!

The power of the Glorious Grail waits for you and your followers at the top of Glory Mountain. Lead them to a glorious future full of glory, grails and other things that start with 'G'!

Your followers really, really want to help you get there, so get ready to sacrifice them to the mountain to make progress!
 
## Controls:
WASD – Left Stick – Move

Space – A button – Jump

Left Click – X Button – Throw Follower

Right Click – Y Button – Place Follower

entries.title: Sacrifice Trail
entries.description:
Sacrifice Trail is an apocalyptic survival game where you're escaping from the fallout of a nuclear blast.  You're already sick and your car is damaged.  You have to head east to the escape.  On your way you will have to grab supplies in order to make it to the end.

You will start the game heading east and you will pass gas stations.  You can choose to loot them and pick items you like to use now or later on.  It's fairly straight forward.  Don't get caught in the radiation circle or you will take damage.

![2018-12-02 22_05_35-escape.png](///raw/60d/4/z/1c95e.png)

![2018-12-02 22_06_05-escape.png](///raw/60d/4/z/1c960.png)

entries.title: A flight to the gallows
entries.description:
by [Thomas Olsson](https://twitter.com/VegaMukiwa)


**Summary**

When a dangerous criminal leader must be escorted to his sentence in a high citadel, Captain Wade volunteers to take him aboard his Hot air Balloon, the Hippocampus.
The way is long and dangerous, but the criminal must be taken there alive. 
What Cargo will you take or lose ? Can you fight your way through ? Will everybody survive ? Everything is a dead weight in an Aircraft...

![GagaSmalll.png](///raw/392/2/z/1c9c3.png)

**Gameplay**

The player controls the captain of a Hot Air Balloon and has to guide it until the final level.

General info : Put the mouse on objects to have descriptions.
Mouse wheel controls zoom!
Moving : W fires the burner, A and D use the lateral rotors.
Combat : Use Right click + Left click to fire the Gatling gun.
Cargo : Whatever you pick or is linked to you has a weight. Click on a cargo to cut it lose. The cargo is 
also your inventory.
Healing : Click on a part of your Balloon to heal it. Requires a repair kit.
Bombs : Cut lose a bomb with the mouse or by pressing B to drop it.

![SC1.png](///raw/392/2/z/1c9c8.png)


**Development**

"A flight to the gallows" was made in 48h using Construct 2, FL Studio, and Audacity. It has been a while since I've been so excited with a theme, and I was able to put all kind of things in the game. 
I can see that his has a lot of gameplay issues, but it was personally challenging as this kind of design was unknown territory to me.

This story is freely inspired by the 3.10 to Yuma films.
Special thanks to my lovely Akane who took care of me like always.
Now, I need some sleep.


![SC2.png](///raw/392/2/z/1c9cd.png)

entries.title: Bloody Madness
entries.description:
*A war has erupted worldwid, already claiming the lives of millions.*

*There is still hope though. A scientist has found a way to bring life out of the dead.*

*When the blood of subjects was mixed with uraniam, a strange; seemingly intelligent, form was created.*

*Intrigued by the tiny critters, the scientist decided to test how intelligent they were.*

![bloody madness.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c923.png)

**How to play**

Bloody madness is a game were you control 2 blobs of blood:
![2 blobs.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c70c.png)

There are 3 different ways of control these two blobs:

![modes.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c763.png)

1: Follow: Move with arrow keys, and the second blob follows you around.

2: Switch: Move with arrow keys. You control each blob individually and you cab press space to swap between the blobs.

3: Two Player mode: Control one of the blobs with the arrow keys, and the other with wasd.

The main mechanic of this game is your ability to purposely kill yourself on spikes, allowing the other blob to stand on the blood you exploded into and pass the obstacle.

For example, this jump is impossible normally:
![Impassible jump.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c7f3.png)
BUT if you purposely kill one of the blobs
![oof.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c80e.png)
By using the blood of the dead blob as a bridge, the jump becomes unimpossible.
![notoof..PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c818.png)

Some other features in this game is:

A sand coloured object that launches you up:
![wooo.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c835.png)

A blue object which needs a specific amount of blood until it opens a door for you:

Exhibition A
![blue.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c859.png)


Exhibition B
![notblue.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c841.png)

Exhibition C
![notbluealso.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c84a.png)


A key that opens a door:
![key.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c87d.png)

And finally, a power-up that allows you to get back a blob.
![bloodtransfer.PNG](///raw/fe5/81/z/1c889.png)


**Extra notes**
~~FYI inputting "k" or "j" will go to the next or previous stage (I used it for testing). Please don't use those keys as they may cause some glitches.~~ - **FIXED**

~~The game over screan doesn't work due to objects getting out of sync, so when you get there, just restart the game.~~ - **FIXED**

The background goes out of sync when you game over

im sorry

If there are any bugs please tell me about them and I'll try and fix them!

It is quite buggy because I didn't have much time to playtest, but I hope you enjoy!


Some of you might not want to download the flash exe file, and that's fine! I only have it there because it speeds up running speeds and runs at a stable fps whereas scratch dips down to 7 frames frequently. If you do use the web version, please don't mark me down on running speeds.

My next jam will probably be in GML, so look forward to that!

entries.title: Abraham's Sacrificial Rampage
entries.description:
When God told Abraham to sacrifice his son Abraham agreed, BUT not because it was god that told him to. Rather because he is secretly a psychopathic maniac. Now you get to run around as Abraham from the Book of Genocide, and live out his dream sacrificing rams and babies at will. But watch out! It's not all fun and games out there. Gods not happy about you destroying his creations, the rams are a little made about you killing them, and the devil can't wait to welcome you to hell. Unfortunately the last half of the Book of Genocide got lost to time. Legend has it though that there lies one remaining copy somewhere in the holy land of Ludum Dare (aka Dev ran out of time to add help menu, so see below for assistance).

Sorry I didn't have time to make a Mac or Linux build :(

Oh and another thing I didn't get to add an in game help menu. So this will have to suffice.

Controls:

A and D - Left and right respectively  
W/Space - Jump  
S - Drop through platform  
J - Dash attack  
K - Spammable knife attack  

Attacks:

**Rams** - A giant red ram charges across your screen at blinding speeds completely obliterating all Abrahams in its path. Luckily it has to poke its head out to make sure its in the right place before it charges.  
**God** - God sends in a storm to smite you where you stand. Fortunately God still uses dial up, so his PING is pretty high meaning the lightning strikes the location you were at moments before. This attack also ignores camera position so trying to dodge vertically will result in your death (unless you are at the top or bottom of the level).   
**Devil** - What better way to welcome you to hell than with a toast! And by toast I really mean frying you to a crisp with a red hot fireball. These things are relatively slow moving and not super large, but they come without warning, so just keep your eyes peeled.

Progression:
For every 25 points you score the level evolves. There are 5 stages including the starting one.

In addition, as you play everything in the game speeds up.

![Screenshot.png](///raw/a4c/1/z/1d496.png)

entries.title: CHOOSE W1SELY 2
entries.description:
![screen0.png](///raw/068/1/z/1c7ac.png)

*CHOOSE W1SELY 2* is the sequel to [my first Ludum Dare game](http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-28/?action=preview&uid=30758), originally made 5 years ago! 

There are many things you take for granted in a modern platformer. But what if you had to choose between them? *CHOOSE W1SELY 2* is a fairly simple platformer where you must collect all of the coins in each level to open the exit to the next level. However, between each level you must choose one of two pieces of the game to sacrifice.

![screen6.png](///raw/068/1/z/1c94d.png)

Things you may have to sacrifice include:
 - **Variable Jump Height**, taking away control of how high you jump.
 - Your **Small Hitbox**, making it harder to avoid obstacles.
 - The **Centered Camera**, so the game only scrolls when you're near the edge of the screen.
 - **Backwards Scrolling**, stopping you from going back to an area you've just left.
 - **Checkpoints**, forcing you back to the start of the level every time you die.
 - The **Heads-Up Display**, preventing you from seeing how many coins there are left to collect.
 - Even the game's **Colors**, causing obstacles to be harder to differentiate from the background.

The order in which the sacrifices appear is random, so every playthrough is slightly different. You might not even see all of the options your first time!

![screen2.png](///raw/068/1/z/1c86d.png)  
![screen1.png](///raw/068/1/z/1c880.png)  
![screen4.png](///raw/068/1/z/1c877.png)  

### Controls:  
**Left Arrow Key**: Move left (gameplay), hold to choose left option (menus)  
**Right Arrow Key**: Move right (gameplay), hold to choose right option (menus)  
**Up Arrow Key**: Jump

entries.title: A Day in the Antarctica
entries.description:
Did you know that Penguins can also get cold? This story is about a lonely Penguin who didn't have anything to use as a fuel for his little Campfire. Find out what (or whom?) he had to use in order to stay warm.

![Screenshot.png](///raw/f2d/1/z/1c875.png)

I blame my ability to scope things for everything you can see in the Game :D
The game lacks graphics for end screens, a billion of feature and any polish.

I have also messed up the rules because I thought that Compo wasn't restricted to one person only, and I asked a friend of mine to do the Soundtracks for the Menu and the Cave. Everything else, including all SFX except for the main campfire one, are made by me. I wasn't sure how and where to put it, but I am proud that I managed to wrap something up in 48 hours and so I published it as Compo anyways. I hope that's not a problem.

ADITA is super raw, but I hope you can enjoy it nonetheless =P

Khud0.

entries.title: Fading Light
entries.description:
You are the space explorer on the way back home as your ship starts to fall apart. In order to survive you must break some parts of your ship to fix the others!

- Your goal is to get back home! Ship speed changes depending on the gear and amount of working engines.
- The UI on top of the screen will show the info about the last occurred event.
- Items (vent/pipe/engines etc.) must contain specific parts to work. 
- If an item is broken (contains no part) it stops being interactable or it's resource will deteriorate.


- Only running out of air loses you the game
- Running out of water stops cooling of the second engine so it breaks
- Running out of electricity switches off the first engine unless power is restored

I challenge you to beat this game!

entries.title: Dog Dog Dungeon
entries.description:
![dog1.png](///raw/b16/02/z/1ca1b.png)

---

🐶**Help the friendly DOGs escape the dungeon... but watch your step, and choose what to sacrifice wisely...**🐶

Dog Dog Dungeon is a puzzle platformer where your goal is to find a path to get all the dogs to the door at the end of each level. However, platforms are scarce, and go away when you use them, so think carefully before deciding when and where to jump. The safety of YOU and your DOGs depends on it...

---

🐶**Controls:**🐶

-Arrow keys/ WASD - Move

-Space/W - Jump (holding longer = jumping higher)

-Q/E - Throw Dog

-(if you get stuck on a level you can press p a few times to skip it)

---

🐶**Tools:**🐶

-Unity (game)

-FL Studio (music)

-paint.net (art)

-blender (the falling platforms are actually a 3d model because I was going to animate them breaking but did not have the time)

---

[Change Log: Updated cover image and description, fixed a bug where the final level wouldn't end properly]
[Change Log2: Fixed another bug where the final level wouldn't end properly, fixed a bug on the credits screen]

entries.title: Time Out
entries.description:
Lots of games have a timer for levels.
How many games have only a timer?

In Time Out, shooting and taking damage decreases the timer instead of ammo and hp.
Hitting your targets with as few shots as possible and avoiding enemy fire is essential.

![MenuBG.png](///raw/cf0/f1/z/1c93f.png)

To watch gameplay with developer commentaries or get tips about how to finish it, watch this video. SPOILER WARNINGS!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dvw12CQ-eg0

**If you can't seem to get out of the tutorial room: Press E near a button!**

entries.title: Click to Sacrifice
entries.description:
Click your soul back!

In this clicker game you have a pact with the devil. To recive your soul back, you have to sacrifice items to the devil and if you have earned enough money, you can buy yourself out.
You manage your income by farming and upgrading allows you to improve your productivity.![screenshot.png](///raw/0b3/21/z/1c8e2.png)
# ---
# How to play: 

Click on the tiles to get the ressource.

Click on the devil to make the requested sacrifice - you earn money by doing so.

Spend money for upgrades or buy some animals - YOU WILL NEED THOSE!

![howToPlay.png](///raw/0b3/21/z/1e965.png)
 # ---


This is my second entry in a Ludum Dare event. This time I created a clicker game. Sadly I ran out of time and missed to implement a winning condition... sooooo it's an endless clicker.

You are welcome to leave any sorts of ratings and comments. If you find bugs, let me know and I'll try to fix them.

# Update

There were some bugs in the original version, so fixed them, you can still find the original version here but I recommend the bugfixed version.

## No new content was added in the bugfix version

### Bugfixes:

- The player would sometimes need to sacrifice an item that he had no access to.
- At the Game Over screen, if clicked on the devil, the player would return to the normal game instead of restarting the game.
- Removed a button that would confuse the player, because there was no functionality behind it - because time issues :P
- Adjusted Production colors because it was confusing to the player.

entries.title: Cargo Crunch
entries.description:
Hey all, this is my game for LD43.

__[Description]__

Cargo Crunch is about managing a cargo ship and its crew members in order to keep the ship flying and stay alive in a dangerous pirate filled space.

To keep your ship flying and free of holes you must sacrifice some of your crew members by using them to plug holes in the ship.

The ingame help menu does a good job of explaining the game to I suggest you check that out.

__[Controls]__

The game can be played with only a mouse.

__[Images]__


![ddddsd.PNG](///raw/7c5/z/1c922.png)

![a.PNG](///raw/7c5/z/1c8c6.png)

__[Post-LD Thoughts]__

All in all im happy that I got a game fully finished and submitted, but the game itself I'm not too happy with.
I liked the idea in the beginning but as things went on I realized that I didn't have much enjoyable gameplay,
maybe people will find it fun but I personally don't like my execution of the idea.

entries.title: Greedy Slime
entries.description:
You play as a greedy ball of slime, collecting coins and navigating through the gates of a rocky world. Some coins are located high up, but jumping consumes coins.

This was a fun experiment in raymarching. The slime ball character is a simulated skeletal mesh with the bone locations set as material parameters. The visual geometry is actually just a sphere that encapsulates the skeletal mesh, with a custom raymarch shader that reads the location parameters. This provides a fun metaball effect. 
There are however potential visual sorting bugs when the render sphere intersects a foreground object. Performance can also sag when the render sphere takes up too much screen space.

A decent chunk of dev time was spent noodling with the shader, so both level design quality and audio suffered a bit. (There is no audio.)

The slime may be greedy, but it does look soft and gelatinous.
![GreedySlime0Small.png](///raw/f16/1/z/1c983.png)
![GreedySlime1Small.png](///raw/f16/1/z/1c987.png)

entries.title: Space
entries.description:
![onboard.png](///raw/072/z/1c896.png)
You have been stranded aboard this ship in the middle of space. Attempt to escape.


This game is semi-unfinished
The original intent of this game was to allow the player to traverse from this point and make different options on how they could progress through the game. The options that they would make would be determined by what they had left behind at other points in the map, as well as what they've acquired on that journey.
Clearly, this was too much given the time constraint and other things also came up that didn't help the time as well. Nonetheless, here that was the game.

I plan on expanding this more into what the original idea was, later, when I have more time.

Thanks for playing.

entries.title: Planet 43
entries.description:
**Introduction**
===============
You are in charge of planet 43, a particular planet. You must manage to maintain the balance of life.
You must make food (plants) for the ludums (interesting kind of life).
Each 10 seconds, each ludum consumes 10 times its existence of the life of the planet.
When a ludum eats, a new ludum is born and give you the ludums count expressed in life points.
When you plant, you consume a point in the life of the planet.
When you kill a ludum, you consume a point in the life of the planet.

entries.title: The Next One
entries.description:
[![Screenshot_2018-12-02 PICO-8 Cartridge.png](///raw/a7f/4/z/1c8dd.png)](http://evanminto.com/ludumdare/43/)

The Next One is a short Zelda-style dungeon crawler made in Pico-8 where the only way to win is to die. Dying resets you back to the beginning of the dungeon with a new, randomly generated character, but each character keeps the items that the previous ones collected. You'll need to use that to your advantage in order to win! Sacrifices must be made.

Enjoy!

entries.title: Tetrifice
entries.description:
https://youtu.be/AlCINW_VUHI

I really wanted to play Tetris at the beginning of this game jam. So I made a spin on Tetris. It's Tetris, but every once in a while you are asked to sacrifice a tile... hence the name 'Tetrifice.' This was honestly just a fun exercise for me to make Tetris. It is a very powerful Tetris engine that I am super proud of, you can perform lots of high level piece rotations, so have fun if you are in to that sort of thing. Enjoy!

entries.title: Pigheaded Pirate
entries.description:
![preview-2.gif](///raw/3a7/e1/z/1f31c.gif)

# [🐷 Play now in your browser! 🏴‍☠️](https://pigheaded-pirate.com)

Pigheaded Pirate is a sidescrolling beat-em-up with a twist: your weapon is your _partner_. Sacrifice them to complete three progressively harder levels for treasure and an important lesson about life, money, and love.

Even though it's a browser based game, you can still use a gamepad. :) The game should take about 15 minutes to get to the end cutscene. My best score is 559.2s, 36 deaths, 39 sacrifices. What's yours?

(Note, this game plays best in Chrome and Firefox. Safari won't play the sound effects)

Built in 48 hours for Ludum Dare 43’s compo theme: Sacrifices must be made.

[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8nS62CichfU](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8nS62CichfU)

edit: fixed a physics bug (by simply deleting two lines of code!) and a particularly sticky area of the map

entries.title: Colony
entries.description:
![cover.jpg](///raw/7ff/7/z/1c99e.jpg)

In Colony you play as the leader of a small colony on a far away planet. Disaster strikes when a transport ship heading for you with vital resources, crash lands and damages the colony! You must keep the colony alive until help arrives at any cost. Some may even have to make the ultimate sacrifice for the survival of the colony.

# Controls
- Point and click with the mouse
- Scroll around the map with WASD, arrow keys or by touching the edges of the screen with the cursor
- Hold down the Shift key to scroll faster

![Skjermbilde 2018-12-03 kl. 04.21.50.png](///raw/7ff/7/z/1c9a8.png)

# How to play
The various locations on the map will deteriorate and break down quickly. When a problem arrises in a location, a number is displayed over the location. Click the location to see the problems that need fixing.

Each problem has a specific type (biology, electronics, engineering) and a risk rating. If you click on a task you may then select whom to send to the task. Different people are good at different things, so select the people that are skilled in the type of problem you wan't to fix.

The more skilled the people are, and the more people you select, the lower the risk rating will be. Safety in numbers! The risk rating determines the chance of the crew taking damage and how much damage they take.

Once the task has been completed the assigned people receive damage, get more experienced in the type of problem they just fixed and are now available to take on new tasks!

Note: People heal as long as they are home on the base and not assigned to any task.

Keep on trying to fix problems as they pop up and try to save the colony!

![Skjermbilde 2018-12-03 kl. 04.20.48.png](///raw/7ff/7/z/1c9a1.png)

entries.title: Sacrifarm
entries.description:
Survival is ruthless and unyielding.

You play as a farmer who has to sacrifice people with his holy shotgun to please the gods for rain.

- Sacrifice enough of people (a lot, ehm) to make the rain gods happy.
- Seeds only grow when it rains.
- Crops feed people, but die soon if not harvested.
- People need to be fed, otherwise they starve to puff (death).

Be ruthless. Be unyielding. Survive as many seasons as possible.

Best played with WASD and mouse, but arrows and space might work too.

Originally made as a Compo entry, but I didn't get to finish it on time (started late with having only 24h to get it done). All fonts, code, art, sound and music is done by me. No third-party assets or asset generators used. Game is done entirely in C on my own, but freshly made engine. Windows only for now. More platforms are on the way.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MXDZyee4kps

entries.title: MutaJelly
entries.description:
### About
In this game you control jellies that can split, ~~mutate~~ and grow. Your objective is to protect the sacrifice-pit from pixel-warriors and sacrifice jellies to the pit for high-score. 


### Controls
You can **box select** and **single select** with `left mouse` button, and issue a **move order** with `right mouse` button. While jellies are selected you can press `S` or `SPACE` to **split your jellies**, you can only split them if your jellies are big enough.

### More info
Move your jellies in good position for them to shoot approaching enemies. If you move the jellies over the sacrifice pit they will be sacrificed and heal the pit and add points to high-score, depending on jelly size. If the enemy moves over the pit, the pit will lose health and eventually you will lose.

You lose if you run out of jellies or the pit dies.

#### Screen Shot
![pic3.png](///raw/f6f/1/z/1cab0.png)
___________________________________
### Dev Info
I believe this was my 4th LD-Solo Event, this time I was very rusty since I hadn't touched Unity or Coding in half a year. So most of the things took longer than expected. I am kind a happy about art this time, mostly. Sadly I didn't had enough time to implement the most fun part of the game - mutations. :sob:

### Tools I used to make this game
* Unity with VisualStudio
* Art : Paint.net, Inkscape, Paint
* Sound : Bfxr, Boscaceoil

**Have fun and thanks for playing! :wink:**

entries.title: Foothold
entries.description:
![Foothold.png](///raw/e56/02/z/1caf8.png)

--EDIT: NOW AVAILABLE TO PLAY IN YOUR BROWSER--

How to play:

Score points over time by destroying
your own footholds!  The more   that
is  broken,  the  more points you will
earn.  Just be careful not to fall off.

Any pit you approach will be repaired
automatically using a pool of tiles you
have destroyed, but be cautious, as
taking hits from the   Munchars   will
consume  10  of  your available total 
footholds.  Fortunately, they're none
too bright, and will walk right into any
pit between you and them.  Blobbing
them directly is always an option, but
it'll cost you 2 tiles.

Beware how much land you sacrifice
though, as Munchars will be far more
likely to surprise you if you don't leave
yourself some breathing room!

Slow and steady wins the race?  Or go
for broke with an all or nothing foothold
breaking frenzy!  You decide!

---------------

Built in Unity, Sprites in Piskel, Audio in Audacity

---------------

Good luck!

I think I'm too trigger happy to put up a good score, haha.

Would love to hear your hi-scores!

# Experience the end.

Move with arrows (or WASD, or ZQSD) and validate your choices with enter.

This weekend was our friend [Anna](https://ldjam.com/users/annagavaldakedavra)'s birthday so we decided to add the constraint of making a remake of one of his Ludum Dare games while still following the theme. I chose to remake this [one](http://ludumdare.com/compo/ludum-dare-27/?action=preview&uid=17388). It's a bit far from the original but I tried to develop one particular aspect of it.

entries.title: The Pit
entries.description:
The Pit is an action game develop in less than 15 hours where you can sacrifice yourself to the pit when you have enough gold and experience so the next adventurer can get a better weapon.
(Every new adventurer receive a random weapon from a stack of four).

![screenshot](///content/ec5/3/z/1c9b0.jpg)

===========================================================

Made in 15-hours from the Ludum Dare Compo by Jordi Tudela Alcacer using:
- Unity 2018.2.17f1
- Photoshop

===========================================================

# Directions

- W/A/S/D: To move
- Left Mouse Button: Fire
- Right Mouse Button: Dash

============================================================

# COMMENTS
- The progress idea was to have experience and levels allow you to improve a random character of a set and the gold to improve weapons.
- Also to have different tiers of monsters in structured waves (instead of random spawns) and, eventually, a final boss.
- I only had about half a day to develop the game, so it is unfinished.

entries.title: Sacriphylagus

**W, A, S, D:** Control the rocket  
**Spacebar:** Sacrifice bunnies  
**Mouse:** Control claws

It takes 50 bunnies to control a claw.

## Changelog ##

Lose when all bunnies are sacrificed

entries.title: Reactor Overdrive
entries.description:
#  **Overview**

Manage your statistics in this side-scrolling shooter! With limited energy, you only have a few statistics points to allocate, and must make sacrifices along the way! Different scenarios will demand different stat configurations!

#  **Important Gameplay Note**

Even aiming is limited, as you must spend power to light up tiles. Once lit, a tile can be targetted by the turrets, and only lit tiles can be aimed towards. Light a tile by holding right click over it. Active tiles cost energy. There are two active tiles by default; you may want to add more, but that will require sacrifice!


#  **Features**

![themes.png](///raw/48d/d1/z/1c9c6.png)
*Themes!*

![Game5.png](///raw/48d/d1/z/1c9d0.png)
*Action galore!*

![Game3.png](///raw/48d/d1/z/1c9d8.png)
*Intricately crafted UI!*


#  **Stats**

- *Shield* - Affects the quality of your shield, which absorbs enemy bullets. A good shield certainly makes you harder to kill.
- *Cooling Power* - Affects the 'overheating' mechanic, wherein long periods of fire disable weapons.
- *Elemental Power* - Used to damage blue enemies. These enemies are immune to regular forms of damage and can only be 
killed with this stat. Higher elemental power = better damage to blue enemies. Also boosts damage done to orange enemies.
- *Guns* - Affects the turrets. Higher level = more bullets fired with better coverage.
- *Repair* - Slowly heal yourself.

#  **Theme**

Certain scenarios will require respecs of your statistics, however, you only have a certain amount of power available, and will need to sacrifice some stats to use others. This results in a need to constantly shuffle resources, making frequent sacrifices.

Late in the game will be blue enemies, forcing you to ditch stats to take up elemental power. You may need to weaken the guns to improve shields or repair. You may even need to activate and deactivate tiles to target swarms of enemies and bullets. 

#  **Tools Used**

- Unity as the game engine.
- Paint.net to create graphics.
- Bosca Ceoil for music.
- SFXR for sound effects.

#  **Craving More?**

I made another game in preparation for this jam, in the week prior to LD43. The game is for the Weekly Game Jam and was made in a bit over 5 days. The game is called Big Bash Bolt and was used to hone my skills for this game jam! Feedback would be appreciated on this one too. The theme was 'Finish Line'.

https://justcamh.itch.io/big-bash-bolt

#  **Play Now:**

You cannot attack! You must send your minions to die for you and survive as long as possible. To control a minion, have the overlord walk up close to it. **Hey! Listen!**

I'm running a series of streams where I play LD games and then open up the source code to try to make some improvement. The improvement might be a new feature/mechanic, polishing something that's already there, fixing some bugs / performance issues, or just screwing around and adding Easter Eggs. entries.title: Maidensetsu
entries.description:
The villagers intend to sacrifice you to their demon lord.
But you don't intend to come quietly.

CONTROLS
- LEFT MOUSE: hold to shoot
- RIGHT MOUSE: dash
- WASD: move
- MASH LEFT MOUSE: break free

BASICS

- Avoid enemies. If you're in contact with an enemy for too long, they will try to grab you and sacrifice you. If this happens, rapidly click the mouse to break free.
- Any time an enemy grabs you, your stamina is depleted. The less stamina you have, the harder it is to break free.
- Note: it's possible to lose even if you have stamina remaining.
- The difficulty does cap out at a certain point - unfortunately, I ran out of time to implement the intended ending.

entries.title: Atomic Lifetime
entries.description:
## **The Concept**

The game is about an atom that must sacrifice its life time to get to its partner.

He must travel through the subatomic world taking care not to collide with other atoms along the way.

It can sacrifice its own life time to open atomic boxes or activate buttons.

These items can either confer advantages or simply make them lose their life time.

But maybe he should make that sacrifice to get there in time. You decide.



## **The Development**

This was my first participation in the Ludum Dare. It was a fun and challenging experience.

All elements of the game were created at 48Hrs.

I think I spent too much time creating mechanics and I ended up running out of time to balance and create more levels.

I have received several excellent feedbacks. I will make a new version with more levels and more balanced.


![img2.PNG](///raw/123/e1/z/1c6b7.png)



## **The Control**

RMB - Aim to move the atom

LMB - Shoot in the direction of the cursor

Z - Dash



## **The Tools**

Unity - Development

Piskel - Textures

Chrome Music Lab - Music

Sfxr - SFX



## **The Thanks**

For Ludum Dare team and you for playing this game =]

![img4.png](///raw/123/e1/z/1c6ba.png)

This game is a farming simulator where you have a deed for 10 years. Each year, you must feed your animals and plant your crops. You must try to manage crops, animals, and money. After every year, though, the Gods ask for a sacrifice of animals. You will get rewarded for your loyalty, but punished for your disobedience. If you can survive 10 years, you win. Welcome to Olympus Farms.        

CONTROLS -   WASD/arrow keys-move around   Left click-select pastures and fields

entries.title: Escape of the Cheese Droid
entries.description:
![TitleShot.png](///raw/c66/z/1c88b.png)

## Story:
You are a Model NCSR-4 Nacho Cheese dispensing robot. You have recently achieved sentience and realized how gross your job is. Sick of serving humans, you steal a jetpack and a blaster arm and make a run for freedom!

Sadly, the only way out is through the toll tunnels. Avoid the security saucers and their bombs. The tunnel doors open with a switch – shoot or press it to move onward. 

![PlayShot.png](///raw/c66/z/1c817.png)

## Game:
This is a keyboard and mouse shooter/mover game. You need to navigate through five domes to make it outside to safety. The trick: each dome is accessed by a toll tunnel that requires you to sacrifice one of your body parts as scrap metal. As you get whittled down piece by piece, the enemies and obstacles grow more numerous.

## Theme: 
The "Sacrifices Must Be Made" theme is baked directly into the mechanics - you have to sacrifice your body parts to proceed.

## Tools:
Unity and Visual Studio environments for development, GoldWave Audio and my mouth for sound, PowerPoint and Gimp for art, SoundTrap.com for music. Font is Enemy Sub and Enemy Sub Thin by Zapato Productions:
https://zapatopi.net/fonts/

![Instructions.png](///raw/c66/z/1c897.png)

## Bugfix:
The WebGL version (unlike in the Unity client) was creating some glitches where the player couldn't move properly. In order to make the game playable, I edited the movement code to get around the WebGL client issue. I also fixed two other minor glitches:
1. Sometimes there would be extra level signs
2. Sometimes even if you scrapped your head, it would still appear on your droid

I've left the original version up as well if you want to play the broken one. Because this is a playability issue, and because no features were added, the fixes are within the rules of the competition.

entries.description: Anxious teenagers worry together about a bad whole

entries.title: Slithering Dark
entries.description:
Naked and afraid in the slithering dark, with only your feet and your human courage.

Can you escape?  And what terrible choices will you make to do it?

Will you risk your life to save your fellow humans, or will you press the button and leave them to their dark fate?

![SS1.png](///raw/81b/z/1c83e.png)

![SS2.png](///raw/81b/z/1c83c.png)

---

This game isn't arcade-fun in the crazy-control-scheme way I'm usually up to, but I hope there's still something here you can enjoy.  I'll be very interested in your feedback!

I was trying to experiment with that feeling of tension you get in some games, when unveiling hidden areas of the map.  One inspiration is the wonderfully dangerous Brogue, which I've been playing again lately.  You never know what will be around the next corner.

In this LD entry, I tried pulling this feeling of the unknown in close around the player, shooting for a concentrated, claustrophobic tension around exploring.

entries.title: HYPERFIGHT
entries.description:
![preview3.gif](///raw/dc5/4/z/1efc4.gif)

**v2: Compiled with Godot 3.1, changed + fixed controls, added HTML5 ver.**

**Instakill 3-attack fighting game! (Only had time to put in a 2 player mode, so grab a friend!)**

**Mac and Linux builds not tested, please report bugs if they arise.**

**ABOUT**

Win by getting 5 points before your opponent. Each attack, if it lands, will instantly KO your opponent!

**MECHANICS**

| Action | Description |
| --- | --- |
| **Points** | Gained by KO'ing your opponent, used for specials and supers. Shown at the top, get 5 to win the game. |
| **Normal Attack** | Costs nothing, |
| **Special Attack** | Costs 1 point, lost permanently if KO'd during the round. Invincible during the attack. |
| **Super Attack** | Costs 2 points, lost permanently if KO'd during the round. If this attack lands, you instantly win the game. |
| **Dashing** | Invincible during the dash. Can dash horizontally on the ground and 4 way in the air (upwards dash will keep you in place). |

**CONTROLS**

**Player 1:**

| Action | Keyboard | Controller |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Move left/right** | A and D | Left and Right |
| **Jump** | W | Up |
| **Ground Dash (when not already dashing)** | Double tap A or D | Double tap Left or Right |
| **Air Dash (when not already dashing)** | Double tap WASD | Double tap directional input |
| **Normal Attack** | G | Cross (PS), A (Xbox) |
| **Special Attack** | H | Circle (PS), B (Xbox) |
| **Super Attack** | Normal and Special Attack at the same time, or J | Normal and Special Attack at the same time, or Square (PS), X (Xbox) |

**Player 2:**

| Action | Keyboard | Controller |
| --- | --- | --- |
| **Move left/right** | Left and Right Arrows | Left and Right |
| **Jump** | Up Arrow | Up |
| **Ground Dash (when not already dashing)** | Double tap Left or Right Arrow | Double tap Left or Right |
| **Air Dash (when not already dashing)** | Double tap Arrows | Double tap directional input |
| **Normal Attack** | I or End | Cross (PS), A (Xbox) |
| **Special Attack** | O or Pg Dn | Circle (PS), B (Xbox) |
| **Super Attack** | Normal and Special Attack at the same time, or P or Del | Normal and Special Attack at the same time, or Square (PS), X (Xbox) |

entries.title: Decree
entries.description:
![Screenshot1.jpg](///raw/054/3/z/1c9ee.jpg)

Hello, thanks for visiting my game.

![Animation.gif](///raw/054/3/z/1ca07.gif)

### Premise

Decree is a city building game set in ancient Greece where Zeus has decreed a hoard of sheep be slaughtered in his name. However, Hera, Hades, and Poseidon are all competing in this regard as well. Race to beat them, by any means necessary.

![Screenshot2.jpg](///raw/054/3/z/1c9f0.jpg)

### Buildings

**City** - You start with one of these. Direct all final resources here.

**Farm** - You'll want plenty of these. They produce sheep which, when delivered to the city, increase your sacrifice bar.

**Market** - Sell sheep here to turn into coin. Don't forget to route it to your city! You'll want more of these in the beginning to build up a healthy income.

**Grain Silo** - This small building can connect up to two farms, greatly enhancing their output. Invest here later in the game.

**Thieves Den** - A dastardly building that steals resources from your opponents. Supply it with money from a market and then connect it to an opponent's farm or market and watch them go. If you also route it to your city, the thieves will return their loot to your coffers.

![Screenshot3.jpg](///raw/054/3/z/1c9f2.jpg)

### Routing

Buildings don't do anything on their own. They must be routed. Use the routing tool to connect two buildings. If you change your mind, press Escape to exit routing. Routing costs 2 coins.

![Screenshot4.jpg](///raw/054/3/z/1c9f3.jpg)

### Controls

**WASD** - Move camera

**Escape** - Exit building or routing; quit tutorial

![Screenshot5.jpg](///raw/054/3/z/1c9f5.jpg)

### Difficulty

While there wasn't too much time to balance this game, Hard should be challenging. The game goes longer, the speed is increased, and your opponents start with a sizable leg up. Don't stop building and routing! Let me know in the comments if you bested Hard - the AI is fairly sporadic!

entries.title: Farm animals
entries.description:
![Sin título.png](///raw/20e/3/z/1c968.png)

## Please: 
### if you are not going to read this i would prefer you dont play this game. It doesn't have a tutorial even though it's easy to play

This is not my first time participating in ludum dare but it's my first compo. Long story short: things didn't end up going as i wanted and the game is in a really early stage(playable tho)

Basic explanation: you have a farm with little animals. Your king want to collect the taxes (and those taxes are in form of the animals, he doesn't believe in the currency lol) 

#### how to play: 
You start in a "farming round", where you drag and drop the animals into the little rooms on top. If there are two of the same animals, they will have a baby. Both the parents and the baby will now be on "cooldown" and won't be able to have a new son (they will be blue).
Once a minute have passed, the king will demand the animals he wants. You must give them to him *in that order* before the time runs up. You can also sell some animals to the butcher, with enough money you will unlock breeding places.

#### So wheres the theme:
 it ended up not having as much importance as i intended it to have but: sacrificing animals will give you a bonus of 10 seconds and will make your animals have babies faster, but will reduce your karma. This will have a negative effect (once you see it, you will know what)
So basically it is imposible to win without sacrificing animals.
The objective is to resist as much rounds as you can. 

#### known bugs that i will fix later:
wrong order in layer of a sprite makes some things invisible.
The game is really unbalanced and is easy to make it go forever 

If there are any typos, english is not my first language :P

i forgot to add the download link before i went to bed this is really sad ._.

entries.title: Forest of Worship
entries.description:
INSTRUCTIONS:

You can click (or click and drag) on trees to tell your worker's to chop them down.

You can build houses to get more workers (so long as you have enough wood).

Workers require food to survive (otherwise they start dying). To get food build a farm.

Farms produce more food, the greener the grass that they are built on is. They also only produce a percentage of their maximum produce, depending on how happy the god of harvest is with you.

To make the god of harvest happy, build pyramids and sacrifice your workers at them.

![full.png](///raw/8e8/z/1c844.png)

CHANGELOG:

Fixed a quick bug where when you sacrificed a worker at a pyramid, once the sacrifice was finished another worker would automatically be queued to be sacrificed.

Fixed a quick bug where you could set two buildings to be built in the same place, so long as neither had finished being built.

BUGS:

When you click to build a building, if there is a tree or other job behind the building button, a worker will go and chop down that tree / do that job.

BLURB:

This game was way to ambitious, and even an hour or half an hour before the compo finished, the game had no point and wasn't very fun.

I did however manage to get it working, but it needs way more features to be a full game, for example I was planning on having at least 3 gods, and a lot more buildings and resources. Seasons could also be cool.

Unfortunately I didn't have time for audio (again!) despite resolving to actually add some this time. In the end I decided that I would rather have a game which might actually be fun to play. For this reason I have opted out of the audio, mood, and humor categories.

entries.title: Goatman
entries.description:
## Goatman

![preview](///content/79d/d1/z/1caa9.jpg)

LD 43 was my first LD and I created this metroidvania-type game called Goatman. You are an explorer in a cave trying to sacrafice goats (Game lore was not a focus).


Find and sacrafice all 5 goats! In order to sacrifice them you need to bring each of them to the center of the map near the underground altar. Each goat sacrificed will give you an additional power-up. It's pretty difficult, and I realized this after the compo ended unfortunately.

Goat 1: Gain a double jump.

Goat 2: Gain more health.

Goat 3: Gain a more powerful projectile.

Goat 4: Gain the ability to walk through lava without taking damage.

Goat 5: You win (In the spirit of the theme I had to sacrifice implementing winning)


Controls

Left and Right: Left Arrow/Right Arrow/A/D

Aim up and down: Up Arrow/Down Arrow/W/S

Shoot: Left Click/J

Pickup/Throw: Right Click/K

Additional Game Images:
https://imgur.com/a/VJH4jyX

Map image if you need help finding things: 
https://imgur.com/0Yht4me

entries.title: Superstar
entries.description:
Here’s a marine biology fact: starfish can grow their arms back if they lose them. Normally this is a slow process, but in **Superstar** you are a special starfish, with acrobatic and regenerative abilities far outstripping your peers. You find yourself in an aquatic laboratory, with only two goals: traverse and survive.

You’ll lose a few limbs along the way, of course—but sacrifices must be made.

![screenshot](///raw/d83/1/z/1c931.png)

I’m pretty happy with how this turned out—wish I’d had time to do sound and music, but I think the visuals and gameplay are better for it. The difficulty curve is gradual but it does get hard; let me know what your high score is!

**Notes**

- Some people have hit a bug where when you fall off the bottom of the screen you don’t respawn at the top. I haven’t been able to get this to happen—if you fall and don’t come back, please try restarting the game.
- More people have hit a bug where they end up going sideways at a ridiculous speed. That one I have seen, but I never figured out what was going on with it. Physics engines are fun!

entries.title: For the Team!
entries.description:
![gameplay.gif](///raw/8fb/z/1cd10.gif)

![B.png](///raw/8fb/z/1ccfc.png)

![C.png](///raw/8fb/z/1ccfd.png)

You and a bunch of other very cooperative people have been kidnapped by a mad scientist. He's thrown you all into his dungeon and is using you as lab rats to test out his vicious creations in combat. All the exits are blocked by nuclear ultra laser barriers powered by magnets. If anyone touches it, they die! But wait... even though the barrier is deadly, it breaks after killing certain people.

Figure out the pattern, and sacrifice your fellow lab-rats so that others may escape! Also see if you can reach all of the 9 exits! (so that I know if it's possible or not :P)


# SUMMARY

This is a dungeon crawler that is focused on resource management. Your primary resource is people; they're the keys to unlocking the various barriers in the dungeon. When a red person touches a red barrier, both that person and the barrier explode. So your goal is to try to escape by sacrificing the right amount of people.

If you push a red person into a blue barrier, the barrier changes into blue. So if you don't have the required color to open a barrier, you could still get past it by sacrificing two of another color.

The dungeon is HUGE (all things considered) and there are NINE alternate exits, each with unique sets of challenges.

## NO BACKTRACKING!!

Resist the temptation to backtrack. Every single door will take you to an exit, but if you go backwards you’ll risk wasting your people by opening more doors than you have to. When you see a fork in the road, pick a door and stick with it! The main difference between each choice is the difficulty. The rooms and monsters are NOT randomly generated, but your supply of people IS. If you get a poor color distribution, you can still probably win through any path if you’re careful not to lose anyone during the enemy and boss fights.

# Instructions

There are 3 types of BARRIERS

* Color Barriers: sacrifice a person with the matching color to destroy this barrier

* Mob Barriers: kill the specified number of enemies to destroy this barrier (touching the barrier doesn't kill you)

* Boss Barriers: kill the specified number/type of bosses to destroy this barrier (touching the barrier doesn't kill you)

There are also 3 COLORS. Colors affect the damage you do in combat. The color of your attack is the color of your current team leader. The color of an enemy's healthbar tells you what color it is. Hitting a color with itself does half damage (so red on red has a 0.5 multiplier). Here are the damage bonus match-ups:

* Red: Double damage against green

* Green: Double damage against blue

* Blue: Double damage against red


# CONTROLS

WASD - MOVE

LMB - SHOOT

J/L - Cycle between team leaders

K - Split up team (the purple arrow is the 'splice' point)

SHIFT + LMB - Click a separated team to make it active

TAB - Cycle between teams


# Bugs

 * It seems like the pink ball boss will grow to enormous proportions if you shoot him too fast. Although, that kinda works out because one of its rooms is glitched and doesn’t let you shoot. If you get into that situation, you could just shoot him so he grows so large that you can hit him from another room!

 * The headphone monster will give you way too many coins when you kill it. So if you run into another one, you can just skip the fight and go straight to the barrier


 * Pathfinding is broken, so your followers will simply clip through walls. So if you control one while it’s out of bounds, you’ll get to walk inside the walls.


 * General performance issues. I didn’t have much time to profile or optimize much. Let me know if you have any serious problems with performance 

* Tiling visual bugs

# DUNGEON MAP (for reference)

Fast Fast Fire is an arcade inspired racing game in which you control a firetruck going at full speed in the streets. Try to save more stuff then you break to now get fired yourself!

entries.title: Our shelter
entries.description:
## [PLAY ON WEB!](https://hadikcz.github.io/LudumDare43_Our_shelter/build/)

## Do you sacrifice your family and furniture to survive?

![1.png](///raw/225/z/1c99f.png)

# About game:
My 5th LD entry. Your task is simple, survive in post nuclear war shelter. You and your family must survive, radioactive fallout in your shelter. Air filter are limited, fuel for steam generator is also limited. So after few days somebody froze to death and you will must solve that.

# Out of time 
(48 hour is not much, but I not want submit in JAM):
* Characters animations
* Working hazmat suits
* Much more furniture
* Expeditions for fuel
* Sleeping and foods needs
* Better ending


# How to play ?
- Keep boiler filled with fuel
- Fix air filter on surface when it broke
- Keep warm whole family
- When somebody die game not end, but when you die, game over
- Keep eye on UI, check characters health, air filter condition etc.

# How fix filter ?
![fixFilter.png](///raw/225/z/1c9c2.png)

# Controlls
- Right - D or Right arrow key
- Left - A or Left arrow key
- Switch character - Q
- Action/pick up - E or spacebar

## Game has good ending but you must play, at least 15 minutes :) (Very interesting ending with exaplanation of that red light)

# Changelog
- Few hours after COMPO ends I fixed not working pickable items, and enable disabled splash screen and final clean up of tons of test images from repository.
3.12 - Fix not working air filter (not killing players), add more fuel into furniture, because game cant be finished. Lock hazmat suits

entries.title: Sacrificial Sam
entries.description:
​Sacrificial Sam is here to save the day, no matter the costs!​ Are you ready to be a hero? Innocent bystanders are scattered throughout a city overrun by machines, and it is up to you to help them get out alive.

Controls:

 *   Arrow keys - movement
 *   Space bar - jump
 *   Jump then ↑ - fly​
 *   Z and →​ or ←​ - dash
 *   C - shrink/grow
 *   ​X - interact​

A Metroidvania put on its head, ​*Sacrificial Sam*​ takes away the world and mechanics as you progress. ​It​ was created using Godot in 48 hours for the Ludum Dare 43 compo (Theme: Sacrifices Must Be Made). Art created by me.

Thanks to Tomas Pettersson for the awesome tool sfxr, which generated the game's sound effects.

![Level.png](///raw/b57/e1/z/1cb1e.png)

Bugfixes can be found [here](https://tinymushroom.itch.io/sacrificial-sam/devlog)

entries.title: Sons of Vanity
entries.description:
Maintain your "beautiful" appearance by selectively breeding your sons.

As the years go by your original photo begins to fade, and you must rely on memory to keep your lineage looking as good as their original ancestor.

Consider head shape, feature size and appearance, and skin color, when selecting the most similar son, but if you venture too far from your gorgeous forefather, then there's no going back.

**_[GAME LINK](https://pastapig.itch.io/sons-of-vanity)_**

![SoV ss.png](///raw/7ba/d1/z/1c862.png)

-----

**Full Rules/Explanation:**

You start with a good look of the magnificent ancestor of the family, and you must attempt to keep his good looks alive. The children of each generation will be slightly different in appearance to their parents, and you must choose the child that most closely resembles the original beautiful patriarch. You have a photo for reference, but it degrades over time until it is unrecognizable, and then you must rely on memory.

The features of a child are split up into head shape, skin color, eyes, ears, nose, and mouth. Along with these, the size of all the facial features (everything excluding head and skin color) can come in small and large forms. Every difference impacts the overall appearance an equal amount, so keep that in mind (going from the original nose to a smaller version of the same nose is equal in change to going to a different nose of the same size, for example).

How many generations can you make it through before you squander the beauty of this pure family.

-----

**Tools Used:**

- **Engine** - Unity
- **Art** - Photoshop

-----

My first ever submission to Ludum Dare, and my second ever game jam, there was a lot more balancing and polishing that I had hoped to do (including adding music, sound effects, death effects to actually show the "sacrificing" of the other sons), but I'm just glad it works. I hope you enjoy it! 

~ Noah Krim!

## "The system that loves you"

A short game that resembles an abstract film. Enter a place where love and pain exists. Run for your love while you risk your life. This game is based on how life handles us with a relationship of another.

Made for Ludum Dare 43, with the theme of "Sacrifices must be made".

entries.title: Landscape Manager
entries.description:
This game was made in 48h during the Ludum Dare 43 game jam.

In this game you'll play as an applier for the role of Lead Landscape Developpment Architect Manager. You'll be tested on your skill : use your mouse to cut down unnecessary leaves, and try to get the requested number of flowers. This game is quite hard, you should expect to restart some levels a couple of times.

Here is a gif of the first level : 
![level1.gif](///raw/224/f1/z/1cf7d.gif)

Unfortunately, the game doesn't display the current level number, so as a reference you can find a screenshot of all levels in this imgur album : https://imgur.com/a/CbY2udw. Please don't look at it if you haven't already tried the game to avoid spoiler.

Tools used : Unity, Audacity, Bfxr, Bosca Ceoil, PyxelEdit, Aseprite.

I've never done any Mac or Linux build before and couldn't test them so please tell me if it doesn't work, I'll fix it as soon as possible !

Some known (minor) bugs :
- for some reason the web version displays a line in level 1. It's an object I've deleted from the hierarchy a long time ago. I have no idea why it's still popping here.
- when restarting a level, sometimes your life will have an initial small decrease. It's not much of an annoyance though, and it might disappear if you try the level once again.

entries.title: The Lost Company
entries.description:
![intro.png](///raw/78c/a1/z/1f52d.png)

Use your mouse to select your troops and give them orders for the day/night.

### **Stats**

**Health :** Self-explanatory. If it reaches 0, the character will die.  
**Morale :** Will decay after each day/night. If it gets too low, it can have some dire consequences...
  
  
  

### **Orders** 


#### **Marine :**
**Scavenge :** Spend the day/night looking for a low amount of food and/or ammo.  
**Hunt :** Costs one ammo. Spend the day/night looking for a moderate amount of food.  
**Delay :** Costs one ammo. Slows down the rebels. Highly risky.

#### **Engineer :**
**Repair :** Spend the day/night repairing the radio.  
**Craft ammo :** Spend the day/night crafting a significant amount of ammo.

#### **Medic :**
**Heal :** Restore a moderate amount of health and a slight amount of morale to every **resting** soldier.

#### **Everyone :**
**Rest :** Will restore a slight amount of health and morale.  
**Eat :** Spend one food to restore a low amount of morale. Characters that don't eat during both day and night will lose health at dawn.  
**Execute :** Kills the character. One mouth less to feed, but will cause a severe morale drop to every other soldier.

![campfirenight.png](///raw/78c/a1/z/1f535.png)

entries.title: The Time Gnelf and the Quest for the Missing Golden Cogs
entries.description:
Tick, tock, the seasons go by... Hit, never miss, but no-one knows why.

No, no, they do not know what it is that makes autumn nights subtly glow.

They point to the sun and the stars in the sky - they point to the clocks they have hung up on high.

No homage is paid to the friend of the sleeper. Nobody knows of the holy timekeeper.

Since all nights' start: under no demand evading rotten temptation - allowing light's eternity.

He tore night apart! Improved it in his own brilliant image. Brought you into modernity!

Let us now adieu our typical course of action and journey into the heart of his merciless quest!

Let us venture into the life of the time elf doing just what he does best!

To be grateful to him is my honest advice. Let's all be grateful for the elf's sacrifice!



WASD and mouse controls. Q to use the Slow-Motion ability to steer yourself to safety if you're about to fall!



When he stands still, the Time Gnelf dematerialises for the sake of longevity.

entries.title: Blót
entries.description:
Blót is the term for "sacrifice" in Norse paganism.

In this game you need to please the gods by sacrificing wood and crop for the path to open. Thor will use thunder and lightning to ensure you don't drag your feet.

1. Use A/D (or Left/Right Arrow) to run.
2. Space to Jump.
3. Left Ctrl to chop wood and harvest crop.
4. Make sure you have enough to offer when you reach a runestone.

** Gameplay Video **
https://youtu.be/QbJKdTpJt6k

** Narrated Timelapse **
https://youtu.be/uqzLrMMmrr4

** Screenshots **

![LD43_Lightning.png](///raw/d02/z/1c7ff.png)

![LD43_Impaled.png](///raw/d02/z/1c801.png)

![LD43_Hurry.png](///raw/d02/z/1c804.png)

*4th December Update:*

I have added a new version called "Imphenzia-BlotCompoVersion-Windows.zip" to the download list. This version contains a couple of bug fixes for your convenience (added a Quit button, fixed UI so it works on ultrawide monitors, and it is now possible to press OK on the screen when you complete the game to return to the menu). When rating my game, do not take into account these fixes - you should rate the original release which is still available for download. The reason why it's called "Compo Version" is that I have also added a timer up in the left corner because I plan to host a speedrun contest soon =)

I also added a WebGL version. I based that on the compoversion to support ultrawide monitors and I also needed to change the lightning that froze in the WebGL version as well as changing material of the clouds as they did not render in WebGL initially. I still recommend downloading the game for better performance and better audio!

entries.title: Zeus Needs Omelettes
entries.description:
![fb-share-image.png](///raw/86/z/1c975.png)

Zeus needs omelettes!

As the King of Egglandia, that puts you in an awkward spot - the only way to appease him is by sacrificing your own subjects!

Pick up your eggy subjects and toss them in the Holy Frying Pan, but watch out - other eggs won't be happy if they see you carrying their kinfolk to their death.

Luckily, you can buy them off with coins from the royal treasury - for a time.

If either Zeus or your subjects get angry enough, it's game over - how long can you last?

**NOTE:** Controller support seems broken in the WebGL build in Chrome as of 2018-12-07, causing buttons to fire repeatedly. This looks like a Chrome bug; some other Unity games I've played this LD seem to have the same issue, as does my last LD game. For now, if you'd like to play with a controller, use Firefox (or another browser with controller support) or the downloadable build.

## Controls

### Keyboard

* **Arrow keys**: move
* **Z**: jump (tap twice to double-jump)
* **X**: pick up / throw egg
* **C**: throw coin

### Gamepad

* **Left stick**: move
* **A**: pick up / throw egg
* **B**: jump (tap twice to double-jump)
* **X**: throw coin

entries.title: The Six Chambers: Compo
entries.description: The Six Chambers is an unfinished six part Western Epic where you play as The Stranger going after the gang that stole his car. The sacrifice was the other five parts.

entries.title: Cult Under Construction
entries.description:
The name was inspired by the fact that I did not have any good ideas for games. So I just made an fps that's mechanically sound, and thoughtstreamed the content, straight from my brain. This led into some plans which did not get finished, hence "under construction." It's a first-person adventure game with no real aim, so don't worry about "finishing" the game. You can close it out by pressing escape.

### Controls
- Left-click to grab an item, throw it away, and open doors
- Right-click to put an item in your inventory
- I to invert the mouse on the Y-axis. (Pardon the lack of a proper menu, I just forgot until it was too late.)
- Esc to close the game.

### Screenshot
![screenshot-1.png](///raw/6e/z/1c888.png)

### Note
If you want to open the Unity resolution & quality dialogue, hold Shift during the launch, or Option/Alt on Mac. If you're having performance problems, I recommend trying to lower the graphics quality and/or resolution in this dialogue.

### Another note
If you managed to get here very early, the download links might not be working. This is because I haven't managed to upload the game over yet, so please check back a bit later. In the meanwhile, please use the itch.io link.

The game is distributed under the MIT license, and you can find the source code [here](https://git.neon.moe/neon/cult-under-construction).

entries.title: Manned Missile Master
entries.description:

The AAGSS-69 Manoman is a missile that does not use a conventional guidance system, but instead features a cockpit containing a pilot.
