entries.title: Hardcore Cave Painting
entries.description:
![screen1.png](///raw/099/2/z/1c809.png)

What would you do if you had to kill the very things you're trying to protect? Find out in Hardcore Cave Painting!

Hardcore Cave Painting is an infinite survival shooter. Your goal is to keep your townspeople alive for as long as possible against the waves of enemies bombarding your town. Unfortunately, your only method of protecting the town is by using your ink gun, which can only be loaded by sucking up your own inky friends for ammunition!

Prevent your town from dying out to the hideous beasts as they attempt to stomp you into oblivion!

Suck up your friends, shoot down your enemies, paint the ground and keep your town alive!

## The Player

![player_sprite-export.png](///raw/099/2/z/1f872.png)

This is you! You have a magical ink machine strapped to your back, guaranteed to turn 1 townsperson into 4 deadly shots!

Move with WASD, and aim using the mouse. You can shoot using the left mouse button, and vacuum up townsfolk to fill up your weapon using the right mouse button.

You can also drop through bridges by pressing 'S' while on top of them.

Shooting the walls or floor will leave ink blotches on them. You must use this ability to restore corrupted town areas so that more townsfolk will spawn. 

## The Townsfolk

![npc_sprite-export.png](///raw/099/2/z/1f873.png)

These are the townsfolk. You must protect them at all costs, including sucking them up and turning them into ammunition for your weapon!

## The Enemy

![enemy_sprite-export.png](///raw/099/2/z/1f874.png)

These are your enemy. They will run around and try to stomp on your villager friends. You cannot let this happen! As they move around and stomp they will also corrupt the ground around the towns, preventing new villagers from spawning. If you want to survive, you have to keep the towns healthy!

## Spawning New Townsfolk

![Sprite-0001.png](///raw/099/2/z/1f877.png)

The areas with houses are where new townsfolk will spawn, as long as the ground is a healthy, inky black! You must shoot the ground in these areas in order to restore them and allow new spawns. If the ground is orange, nothing will spawn.

## Controls

Movement: WASD

Aim: Mouse

Shoot: Left Click

Vacuum: Right Click

Mute the background music: M

entries.title: Blót
entries.description:
Appease the Gods through battle and self sacrifice! 

A simple beat'em'up with random modifies and tasks, based on the while of the Gods. Fight, pray, obtains boons and banes, and see how many of the pantheon you can honour in 60 seconds. 

-Boons and Banes-

The Gods are fickle and cryptic; not every sacrifice will result in a blessing. Some will, in fact, make your fights harder and your enemies tougher! But only a fool denies a God, so maybe it's better to just rough it out...


-Fighting-

Honour the Gods through battle! Each weapon has it's own properties, but sometimes the Gods demand you kill with a specific weapon.

Sword - Medium damage, medium reach

Axe - High damage, short reach

Spear - Low damage, long reach

-Praying-

Honour the Gods with your time! Prayers take between 2 and 5 seconds, and can only be done without a weapon in hand, but you'll always gain a blessing in return!


-Controls-

Left/Right - Move

Up - Jump

Down -Cycles Weapons

Z - Attack/Interact

entries.title: Asteroid Fall
entries.description:
Asteroids are falling towards a populated region of Earth.  Your job is to destroy them before they reach the towns.  But if you can't stop them all, who will you sacrifice?

Watch the area below your ship for a hint at the most densely populated areas.

Made with Phaser/Javascript, Paint.NET and Acid 7 Pro for Ludum Dare 43

This was my first LD entry and wow, I almost didn't make it.  I wish I could have added more, but, like many people, I ran out of time.

I hope you enjoy the game!

entries.title: Don't Get Attached
entries.description:
It's your job to raise sacrificial critters to please your overlord. Your job lasts only as long as the overlord stays pleased with you!


Take different actions and monitor your critters' situations carefully so that you can keep them from dying prematurely. When you feel the time is ripe, sacrifice them to please the overlord and keep everything going.


PLEASE READ THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW!

==Actions==

Feed : Costs 2 Coins, Raises Love and Fullness

Teach: Costs 4 Coins, Raises Intellect, Reduces Fullness

Clean: Costs 2 Coins per Poo. Removes Poo from the pen and cleans up the critter.

Play : Costs 1 Coin, Raises Love, Reduces Cleanliness and Fullness.

Work : *Important* This is how you gain money back. Regain coins based on the critter's Intellect at the cost of reduced Fullness, Love, and Cleanliness.

Extend Time: Costs 10 (+10 each time), increases the Sacrifice Countdown by 1 minute to prolong your time with the current critter.


==Tips==

-If your critter dies on its own, you get nothing.

-Your critter's worth is based on its Love for you and its Intellect.

-If you don't sacrifice the critter before the countdown runs out, it will be sacrificed for you.

-If the Overlord Happiness meter runs out, it's game over.

-The GREEN text box will offer you hints as to what your critter needs.

-Poo left sitting around will slowly degrade your critter's cleanliness over time.

entries.title: Metal Goat Sacrifice
entries.description:
This is a stealth game. 

The plot is simple:

You must sacrifice goats. The farmers who own the goats would rather you not. Don't let them catch you.

https://youtu.be/Ms6-9ilieRk


## Controls:

| Key                | Action                 |
| ---------------    | ---------------------- |
| WASD/Arrow keys    | Movement               |
| Space near a Goat  | Subdue/Knock Out Goat  |
| Space near object  | Pick up object         |
| Space with object  | Drop object            |
| Space with brick   | Throw brick            |

## Screenshots

![Roaming Screenshot 2018.12.02 - 21.20.19.55.png](///raw/66f/2/z/1c73b.png)
![Roaming Screenshot 2018.12.02 - 21.20.10.25.png](///raw/66f/2/z/1c74f.png)
![Roaming Screenshot 2018.12.02 - 21.30.37.47.png](///raw/66f/2/z/1c75d.png)

## Gameplay Tips

- When subduing a goat, you must rapidly press the Space bar.
- Throw bricks. They distract guards and knock out living things.
- If a goat sees you subduing another goat, it will give away your location to all nearby guards.
- Play to the end.


Here's to another awesome LD

entries.title: Goat Life
entries.description:
Your uncle has left you alone to tend after his goats - you'll need to look after them well! Hopefully everything goes smoothly.

(This game does not have any sound)

![ss+(2018-12-05+at+07.46.07).jpg](///raw/13e/2/z/1eff5.jpg)

![ss+(2018-12-05+at+07.45.27).png](///raw/13e/2/z/1eff6.png)

![ss+(2018-12-05+at+07.41.39).jpg](///raw/13e/2/z/1eff7.jpg)

Instructions
------------
Press the spacebar to begin the game. WASD to move.

Left click on your inventory to select an item.
Left click on the world to use seeds, otherwise left click on the 'use' button for other items.

Stand on the entrance and press 'E' to use it, or 'Q' for an alternative action.
Stand under an exit and press 'E' to use it.

Spells: Left click on a spell to equip it. Right click anywhere to deselect a spell.
Left click on the map to cast a spell. The spell will not cast if you do not have the required elements.

entries.title: SunkCost
entries.description:
Captain! We're surrounded and we're out of ammunition. The only weighty, ammo-worthy material left is the loot... Every shot will cost us. 

Land those shots precisely on the local fleet, and there may well be enough Booty left to cover student loans after this is all said and done...

Goal: Collect 500,000 Coins!

Controls:

To Move, use WASD.

To Fire, Click to begin charging a cannonball, release to launch the charged cannonball.

Welcome to my first Compo game. [Special thanks to Nokobot for the excellent boat art asset.] Cheers!

First time ever participating in a game jam though, so I'm actually pretty happy with how much I was able to get done.

​
I ended up kind of not directly referencing any countries specifically, both by choice (blue guys were originally grey), but also I ran out of time to even worry about that kind of polish. 

Overall, I feel like I at least got a pretty good starting point to turn it into a pretty good experience.

SPACE hold down to increase pan speed

SCROLL to zoom

MOUSE1 to tell unnits where to go

that's it!

entries.title: Sacrifly
entries.description:
# Sacrifly
Old-school space shooter where you sacrifice everything from movement speed to FPS to regain HP.

## About
Coming soon (after a few good hours of sleep)

## Controls
Recommended hand placement:
Left hand on WASD and right hand on arrow keys (no mouse).

* W/S: Scroll between your sacrifice options
* A/D: Sacrifice (red) or Unsacrifice(blue)
* Left/Right arrows: Rotate ship

## Screnshots
![gameplay_2.png](///raw/fe3/21/z/1c9a2.png)
![gameplay_1.png](///raw/fe3/21/z/1c9a3.png)
![sacrifice highscore.png](///raw/fe3/21/z/1c9a5.png)

## Development notes
### Lesson learned
For the love of god, keep your scope down! I always end up doing this. I get excited about an idea and try to make a full game in 48h. I should've focused on the one mechanic of sacrifing vital aspects of the game and make something simpler.

### Problems:
I didn't have much time for polishing at all, here are my major concerns:
* No audio! SFX is just sitting in a folder in the project, but I had no time to implement it. Didn't have time for music.
* No particle effects! I had a bunch of ideas for particle effects, especially for the rocket boosters and coming out from the edges of the game screen.
* The tutorial is really bad and confusing. Originally I wanted a walkthrough where I take you through all the UI of the game, but there was no time for this :(. Sorry!
* Bad balancing (too high chance for HP drops, enemies are too easy, some things are not worth sacrificing at all, etc). I literally added 6 waves the last 2 minutes.
* Graphics are mediocre at best and there are no scene transitions. Lots of other graphical inconsistencies I wanted to fix as well, for example the warped screen borders in the main menu and the game over menu.

### Other info
* I spent around 20 hours into making this game (streamed on https://www.twitch.tv/lemorrow/).

entries.title: Hurt-It
entries.description:
This is a strange alien place. Why are you here? Where is your partner? Oh no... You must find your friend and get out of here! Explore carefully, and if you see a bug - Hurt It!

Instructions in-game.
As of right now, if you die, you have to start all over. Sorry. I will probably fix this so that you can progress through the game and reset in the last room before you were killed.

The lower your health, the more powerful your weapon becomes. Some enemies have armor that requires you to sacrifice some of your health to get a weapon that will hurt them. Armored enemies that are too powerful for your gun will reflect the bullets back at you!

Version History:
* v0.6 - (**Post-Compo version**) Fixed broken Health Packs. Fixed broken blue enemy behavior. Enabled fullscreen!

* v0.5 - (**Post-Compo version**) Added an aim cursor. Enemies don't shoot when running away.

* v0.4 - (**Post-Compo version**) Player deaths no longer reset the game!

* v0.3 - Fixed Health and Weapon bars being movable with the mouse (it didn't affect anything, but it messed up the visuals)

* v0.2 - Fixed a couple of places where the doors would not open causing the player to get stuck

entries.title: Joyeux Julmas
entries.description:
A simple serious game intended to learn people some Christmas/Winter related words in: Swedish, French and Dutch

Tools used

- Unity3D
- Visual Studio
- Paint.net

How to play

After clicking start you will see a word you have to translate. The first time you get a translation, the correct answer will be show above it. If you don't know a translation, you can click on the sentence to be translated and the answer will be shown above.

On the right is a count down, when it reaches zero you lose. Increase it by getting correct answers. Getting answers wrong will decrease the timer. 
NOTE: accents are NOT required. Example: when asked to type Noël, noel will be fine. Capitals are also not required.

Every time you translate a word/sentence it will decrease the score you get from it the next time. For example: if you get 0.5 seconds from translating the word Snowman, the next time that particular translation comes up it will only grant you 0.4 seconds. That's where the elves come in. If you're running out of time you can choose to sacrifice an elf, giving you a full time bar. But beware, because the translations are also getting harder.


Last Note:
The game is absolutely not balanced in any way, so please keep that in mind.

entries.title: SQUARES
entries.description:
# Please Read This Description!


# Squares Squares Squares
## Everything is Square-y (No pun intended)

-Attack those squares and earn Points!

## Too bad it's not that simple....
# You have to sacrifice your points and guns!

-You use points as your ammunition (So be careful when using them)

-You can remove guns to get new guns (Might be better might be worse, it also uses up 20 points)

# Controls:

-WASD to move around (This is the only thing that doesn't use points)

-Left Click to shoot (Points are used up depending on the gun)

-Right Click to change gun (Remember, it uses up points!)

You can get hurt if one of the enemies run into you, but you also get points (So, your choice)

# Guns & Squares

## All the Guns

- Normal Gun (An okay gun. Pretty usable)
- Big Gun (Normal Gun with higher damage and lower reloading speed)
- Even Bigger Gun (Fires a bullet that penetrates through Enemies and deals a lot of damage. Very good late game)
- Fish Gun (Fires a bullet that deals decent damage)
- Fishy Gun (Trash)
- ATM Machine Gun (Good at destroying enemies with high health. It has higher chance to miss in long range)


- (Side note: Bullet that each gun shoot indicates the amount of damage it deals. Just look closely)

## All the Enemies (In the order they appear)
- Square (Leech mouth?)
- Big Square (Disgusting Lip)
- Times Square (Sorry, I ran out of ideas)
- Boss Square (Creepy smile that is not inspired by Joker)


# It's best NOT to use the full screen mode. It breaks the aspect ratio

## Screen Shots:

![Capture2.PNG](///raw/811/21/z/1c786.png)

![Capture1.PNG](///raw/811/21/z/1c78b.png)

## Please share your high scores in the comment section!

### Made in 48 hours. Although I have two tests coming up the very next day. I mean, you must sacrifice something, right?

entries.title: Demon Dominoes
entries.description:
Compete with the demon Val'ak at the ancient game of dominoes... with an infernal twist.

- Pick a tile to **sacrifice** to the Boneyard.  Whoever sacrifices the **lowest tile** wins 3 points and goes first.
- Match **skulls** to earn an extra 5 points.
- Be the first to play all of your tiles.  If you can't play a tile, draw from the Boneyard.
- If both players pass, whoever has the **fewest points** in their hand wins.
- The winner of the round wins the total of the **opponent's remaining tiles**.
- **Skulls count as 10 points.**  Don't be left with them in your hand!
- The first to **100 points** is the winner.

Note: I'm especially happy with the sounds, which were all recorded, instead of my usual 8-bit sfx. =)

Thanks!

![screen2.png](///raw/cf5/1/z/1ca14.png)

Try to survive in this dangerous place and maybe even come on top!

entries.title: Break the Internet
entries.description:
Break the Internet is a Google Chrome extension that turns the entire internet into your playground as you help a lost panda get home. You need to discover the identity of the panda, where it lives, and navigate to the associated web page before the internet becomes entirely unusable.

Be careful! Each time you click a link, perform a search, or enter a URL, you permanently sacrifice some letters or words, and they will disappear from any future pages you visit. Other than that, the internet is at your disposal!


# Install Instructions
This Chrome extension has not yet been officially blessed by Google, so to install and play this extension:

## Windows
1. Download `extension.zip` below and **unzip it** on your computer somewhere
2. Copy `chrome://extensions/` and paste it into the address bar (or go to Menu >> More Tools >> Extensions)
3. In the top right of the page, activate the "Developer Mode" slider
4. Click "Load unpacked" and select the `extension` folder you got from the zip file.

## Linux / Mac
1. Download `extension.crx` below
2. Copy `chrome://extensions/` and paste it into the address bar (or go to Menu >> More Tools >> Extensions)
3. In the top right of the page, activate the "Developer Mode" slider
4. Drag "extension.crx" from the downloads bar on the bottom of the screen onto the main area of the Extensions page

## Uninstalling
At any time, you can uninstall the extension by right clicking its "T" icon next to the address bar, removing the extension, then refreshing the page.

entries.title: Dot, The Wanderer
entries.description:
![logo.jpg](///raw/f07/z/1ccd0.jpg)


##### Story
(since I didn't have time to add menu or intro screen)

You are playing as a wandering Dot that found itself in a bit of pickle when he arrived to kingdom overrun with Evil. As any hero would do, he promised to save the Princess. However, to make the quest a bit easier, he made a deal with The Evil. Not the best deal, but a deal that gave him a chance to succeed.
The deal is to sacrifice sheep at the altar every day. As a reward, Dot will receive protection that helps him fight the evil minions. However, the contract stipulated that not delivering the sheep will cost him his life. You see, that's what The Evil actually wanted as sheep are scarce, but it's your task to help Dot complete this quest, save his life, and most of all piss off The Evil.

Good Luck!

PS: Princess is jailed in the castle, obviously.


#### How To Play
* Click on map to move. Dot will go wherever the target cursor is placed, however the path might not be the most optimal (Dot doesn't like to walk on grass too much)
* Time only moves when you move
* Hearts will increase your life
* Shields will protect you from the evil minion dots
* Collect sheep to sacrifice - you need to sacrifice sheep every day, one on the first, two on the second, etc...

#### Known Issues
Pathfinding is utterly broken, hope you can still enjoy the game.

##### Software Used
* Unity3D
* Visual Studio
* Krita
* Paint.NET

##### Post Compo
Game breaking bug in time keeping was fixed after the deadline, along with it small adjustments to game "constants" were made (shield strength, enemy distribution)

entries.title: Ludum Dare Simulator
entries.description:
Ludum Dare has arrived! You have 48 hours - how are you going to schedule your weekend to get a game done in time, while ensuring its quality?

In the game you place coloured blocks representing different aspects of a game -- assets, audio, code etc. -- onto a grid. Every cell in the grid is one hour of development time. Different aspects benefit you in different formations, so you'll have to balance your time between them (while also taking time to rest) to succeed. Once your game is complete, you'll get a rating and some feedback on what worked and what didn't.

![ld43_2.png](///raw/7ea/1/z/1c7ca.png)

![ld43_4.png](///raw/7ea/1/z/1c71b.png)

This game was made using Multimedia Fusion 2 by Clickteam.

The game uses plug-ins made by Lukas Meller, Justin Aquadro, Ross Picket and Sebastian Janisz.

The game uses a customized version of the Xlua plug-in by Lukas Meller (origin plug-in by Justin Aquadra) that fixes a crash. I'm hoping to get said plug-in available publicly as I'm not sure if it is so at the moment.

Collect three different resources (metal, carbon, and ice) and return them to the space station.

You have 5 lives. There's 5 guns and limited resources. You can only carry 1 gun and 1 type of potion at a time. Potions are gone forever when consumed, so be sure to portion out your supply carefully. Destroy all the mob spawners and enemies to win.

When you lose a life, you will be presented with one or more choices. For instance, you can choose to retain the gun and unused potions on your person...but you'll have to spend an extra life for it. Or you can choose to gain a life back by reviving a mob spawner...but it will come back at a much higher level. Sacrifices must be made....mwuhahahahahahahaah!!!!!!

There is no audio and no particle effects. Sorry, ran out of time!

a button - fire weapon
b button - use slot item
x button - pick up loadout weapon
lb/rb - toggle loadout items!

wasd - move
space - fire weapon
e - use slot item
enter - pick up loadout weapon
arrows - toggle loadout items

entries.title: Amethyst
entries.description:
![Main.png](///raw/d01/z/1c7b0.png)

# Amethyst

The god of purple gems, Amethyst, has commanded you, a gem loving wraith, to sacrifice your gems in his honor. 4 total sacrifices, each doubling the value of the last sacrifice, must be made to him within every 2 minutes. As an impatient deity, he will smite you if you fail to deliver the gems the allotted time.

The dungeon you mine is littered with stones of blue(ish) and red, perfect for the god of purple gems (for being of great knowledge he is aware that these colors combined make his beloved purple). The blue gems may be mined freely, but red gems are enchanted and emit a barrage of red stones every so often. Beware of these, they hurt!

Once collected Amethyst demands to you place the gems in his sacrificial cauldron at the center of the dungeon. The dungeon is vast and **you have no map** so don't get lost!

Once all 4 sacrifices have been made Amethyst will let you get back to your normal life!


## Controls

```
Move Left:       A
Move Right:      D
Drop:            S
Jump:            Space
Swing Hammer:    Enter
Continue:        Enter
Stuck fix:       F5     // if you get stuck in a wall will teleport you to entry point
```

## Gameplay

Every 2 minutes you must make a sacrifice of gems in the cauldron for a total of 4 sacrifices. Each sacrifice requires double the number of gems as the last sacrifice. Use your purple hammer to hit the red and blue gems embedded in the walls. Collect the gems they are replaced with. Once you have collected the requisite number of gems return to the cauldron to sacrifice them. When you sacrifice them only the required number of gems are removed and your HP is restored. Blue gems may be mined freely. Red gems emit a projectile you must avoid. 


### Winning

You win if you are able to complete all 4 required gem sacrifices in the time allotted.

### Losing

You will lose the game if:

You run out of HP
You do not submit a sacrifice within 2 minutes of the last sacrifice (or the start of the game)

## Tips

### Use the whole 2 minutes

When you make a gem sacrifice you only sacrifice the gems required. This means any gems collected in a session may be used for the next. However, once you place the gems in the caulron the timer resets and you are required to sacrifice double the last amount of gems in the same amount of time. That being said, if you are able to collect all the gems needed and have another 30 seconds go mine a few more.

### Dont get lost

There are 5 rooms types repeated through the dungeon and they all look the same after a while. It is easy to get lost, especially as you get into the final round and must travel further to collect more gems. Consider using some seqeunce or pattern to remember how to get back to the cauldron.

** I wanted to implement a map of sorts, but didn't have the time. Instead this adds the to the difficulty as you must remember how to get back to where you started.

## Other Info:

I developed this using MonoGame. I went into this jam wanting to keep things simple. I ended up building out an ECS engine, a level editor, and some basic proc-gen. I didn't end up keeping it simple :(.

entries.title: The Sacrificial Trail
entries.description:
![LD-Cover-v01-wide-aspect.jpg](///raw/648/1/z/1ce80.jpg)
***The Sacrificial
 Trail*** is a rogue-like survival game, inspired by The Oregon Trail and casts you in the role of a mysterious driver, who has to make it to a certain place without falling asleep on the wheel or running out of gasoline. And then there's this strange unicorn…

There are six different endings, for 3 of which you need to make it till the end.

Sadly, there are no graphics, and no sound.

### Controls
You play it in your browser and navigate it by clicking links and buttons with your mouse.


### Notes & Hints

**:bangbang::warning: Version 1.00 is has a game-breaking bug towards the end, please play version 1.01! :warning::bangbang:**

When you die, there's a Game Over screen which will have a couple of hints for you. The less said about the game, the better, but here's some more advice:
* Fatigue builds up the longer you're exposed to a strenuous situation. Sometimes it's better to go fast.
* When choosing roads, be aware of their condition and inclination. Steep inclines cost a lot of time and gas, steep declines allow you to save on both.
* When you aren't sure about how things are connected, take shorter roads and see how their condition affects your game.

### “Your source is just your game as .html. What's the deal with that?”
Since the game was written in Twine using the SugarCube 2 story format, you can drag the .html file and drop it into the Twine editor and it should open. :)

### Change Log
* 1.02
  * fixed brainfart-code for sacrifice handling. It should work now.
* 1.01 (2.5 hrs after deadline)
  * fixed game breaking bug towards the end
  * fixed incidents with the unicorn not appearing
  * minor other fixes
* 1.00
 * initial release (COMPO VERSION to rate)

entries.title: Goo Glow
entries.description:
![ld43screen2.png](///raw/760/e1/z/1c732.png)

A group of 20 slimes are attempting to navigate through a mysterious building. There's only one problem... they can't see a thing except for each other! In order to make your way to the exit, you'll need to explode some of your slimes, so the others can see where they're going. Don't explode them all, though- you'll need some slimes to actually complete the level!

I also provided the source for my fork of the HaxeFlixel library (and its addons), because I used some features that are currently only available in the development version of HaxeFlixel and haven't yet been added to the official release.

entries.title: Life Simulator
entries.description:
![Screenshot from 2018-12-03 04-22-48.png](///content/e17/z/1c6d6.png)While clicking the buttons, all the art and sound are running inside your brain-hardware with IOS(Imagination OS), although there are only buttons and texts in this game.

Money reaches a reasonable amount(300 for Gen.1) to unlock "XXX", if you are not too old.

You retire at the age of 60.

Learning is really useful, I hide how useful it is in numbers, just like in real-life.

When you have a child, you can teach him/her, which is also really useful. But you have to feel how the numbers work, just like in real-life.

When your child grows to 18+, you will be your next generation.

How many generations can you survive? Please reply to let me know =]

entries.title: Tracks of Valhalla
entries.description:
You're the commander of a tank battalion on the frontlines, and you've gotta clear the way for the big guns to come through. Unfortunately your battalion has endured heavy conflict and has run out of munitions. The only way to clear the minefield fast enough for the advancing big guns is with your comrades tanks.

Only through courageous sacrifice can this be done. Unwillingness to sacrifice a comrade means their tank will remain on the battlefield, forever seen as a failure, and impassable to even the heaviest of guns. A willing sacrifice will be rewarded with a cleared mine and clear battlefield.


## Instructions

Left-click: Move battalion
Right-click: Move camera

Direct your battalion towards the frontlines (GOAL).

The ATTACK button lets you select a member of your battalion (not yourself, the purple Commander) and then direct them to sacrifice themselves to clear a mine by clicking on a mine.

* Click ATTACK
* Select a gray tank
* Select a mine
* Witness the tanks act of valor as it sacrifices itself

The big gun tank is constantly advancing to the frontline. You can retreat, but it will not.


## Gameplay

A video is worth a thousand words, so please watch this video on how to play!

https://youtu.be/2L2wMZ7U1LY


# Enjoy!


![tanks-of-valhalla-v0.1.png](///raw/859/z/1cb0c.png)


### Bug fixes

- v0.2: The win-condition's trigger volume was missing a RigidBody component, so would never trigger. Oops! Fixed.
- v0.2: The Attack button would get stuck on. Fixed.
- v0.3: The Attack button would turn itself off after selecting a tank, requiring a second press to issue the actual attack order. Fixed.
- v0.3: If you selected another tank while a tank was currently doing an attack move, the destroyed tank would remain on the battlefield despite having been sacrificed. Fixed.

entries.title: Wildfire: Forest Containment
entries.description:
[![CoverPhoto.png](///raw/cf6/2/z/1c91c.png)](http://www.wyattcheng.com/games/Wildfire)
Wildfire: Forest Containment is a game about fighting forest fires.

This game is about using three tools to stop and contain forest fires.

![AllThreeTools.png](///raw/cf6/2/z/1c965.png)
* Tractors - Sacrifice a tree to prevent the spread of fires.
* Helicopters - Drop Water to douse flames
* Airplanes - Drop Fire Repellant to slow down the spread of fire.

[:fire: :fire: :fire: Play Now :fire: :fire: :fire: ](http://www.wyattcheng.com/games/Wildfire)

## Theme Interpretation
I chose this interpretation of the theme because:
* To fight a forest fire you create a firebreak by uprooting some trees, sacrificing healthy trees to stop the fire.
* When fighting a forest fire, sometimes firefighters make the tough decision to let one house burn to save many others
* Forest fires, though terrible, are necessary for ensuring healthy future vegetation.

## Post-Jam Changes
* Allowed clicking and dragging on minimap to look around
* Added the high score leaderboard as a meta-wrapper.
* Made it more clear when a tree is smoking that you can't uproot it
* Added the option to skip early years when you've proven you can beat it

## Tools used:
* Unity
* Photoshop

## Other
* Game jam was streamed on twitch.tv.
* You can follow me on twitter @candlesan
* Timelapse of the game jam! [https://youtu.be/8gNknlfvbtc](https://youtu.be/8gNknlfvbtc)

Forest fires in California have destroyed over 130,000 acres of land and claimed the lives of over 40 individuals. 

If you enjoyed this game, please consider a donation to 
http://www.cafirefoundation.org/support-us/

entries.title: Void Light
entries.description:
Void Light is a short experimental game around dreams and memories.

The game use only procedural geometries to create mysterious landscapes to wander. You may need a decent graphic cards or to lower the resolution if it's too heavy. Everything is made in shaders using raymarching.

To go to the next scene, you have to find and reach the white light that glow through walls. Or you can press "N" on the keyboard if you are too lost.

Controls:
Keyboard: arrow keys to rotate camera, space to go forward, shift to go backward, N to skip the level.
Gamepad: left stick to rotate camera, A to go forward, B to go backward

Tools: Unity, Sonic-Pi

Here is a walkthrough of the game:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5oPxxiRa_m4

entries.title: Nino's Servants ~ The Day We Die For Her ~
entries.description:
![title-compact.PNG](///raw/c06/2/z/1c5ff.png)

## Intro

This game is about a Nino's adventure on claiming THE CROWN. Dogs and weird creatures, desperate for any meat they could find, are waiting for Nino coming right into their mouths.

Fortunately, all human being can be Nino's servants, that they are willingly to do anything for this young beautiful cat, including giving up their own flesh & blood... Will Nino try to protect as many servants as she can? Or, the servants are just worthless that can be sacrificed for THE CROWN? **It's your choice**

![ld43.gif](///raw/c06/2/z/1c72f.gif)

## Gameplay

- Nino can 'collect' human as servants
- Nino can eliminate any foe with a cost of 1 hit point (5 points in total)
- Servants are in different weights, and every foe has a number of desirable weights of meat. *Yes, foes are not satisfied until they are fed with enough weights of human flesh* (I'm really sick...)
  To ask servants sacrifice themselves, click the `Go` button on servant's card
- Servants can feed Nino with tiny fish, which will recover Nino for 1 hit point. But not all servants have fish in his/her pocket.
  To feed Nino, click the `Feed` button on servant's card

## Tools

- Godot3
- Aseprite
- Photoshop
- sfxr

## Known Issues

- In HTML5 version, servants and foes will flash for seconds when they collide. I have no idea how it happens.
- I just learned Godot like 72 hours ago, so this game is not quite complete as I spent too much time on researching the engine...Sorry
- Mac & Linux port will be offered as soon as I got my energy back :(

entries.title: Save The Villagers
entries.description:
"Sacrifice the villagers in order to save the villagers!"

This is my first time participating in a game jam. I made a simple 2D side scrolling shooter where you must sacrifice villagers in order to fill up a sacrifice bar (which decays over time). Villagers will evacuate buildings as you approach and seek safety in other buildings. The world wraps around on itself so there are no boundaries.

I unfortunately had some plans this weekend and could not dedicate the entire 48 hours, so the scope and polish had to be cut back a bit, but it's playable!

The evil spirit was heavily inspired by my dog's favorite toy, "The Spook" :)

Enjoy!

![SaveTheVillagers.png](///raw/80a/d1/z/1c726.png)


Unity 2018.2.17f1

Photoshop CC

entries.title: Working Overtime
entries.description:
This game has you take the position of a company manager with three employees under your command. You can control their work speed, and you'll need to if you want to reach deadlines.

But this is a double edged sword, since they stress out more quickly when working at faster speeds. Be sure to manage their stress, though some workers benefit under pressure.

A few things I left out: Employees were originally going to be able to come in to work sick (and they'd have a .5 efficiency multiplier tacked on), and they'd have a possibility of getting other employees sick. This also gave the player the choice to send them home, though this severely cuts down on the amount of work that'd get done that day. In the end, I left it out due to time constraints.

Oh, yeah. Sacrificed two whole days to make this instead of working on finals. Smart decision? Probably not. But hey, I got it done.

entries.title: The Arena
entries.description:
# The Arena: A Ludum Dare 43 Compo Game

Our main hero, magenta box man, must fight off waves of enemies as he endures great sacrifices to continue to fight for his life. Each wave, some downgrade is applied that weakens the player or strengthens the enemies, culminating in 8 deadly waves that the player must beat.

![screenshot1.png](///raw/0c6/e1/z/1c9d9.png)

The development of this game was unfortunately shortened by real life distractions, so total development time is only around 15 hours, which mainly cut into the creation of art and music. The entire game framework was designed from scratch as well (besides base SFML libraries), so a majority of development went towards creating a functioning engine. Regardless, this was a lot of fun to create and a lot was learned.

## Tools used

-C++

-SFML 2.5.1

-Visual Studio 2017 Community Edition

-Paint.net

## Controls

-Arrow keys to move

-Space to attack

-R to restart

entries.title: Slime Laboratory
entries.description:
![cover_image.png](///raw/dd3/z/1c6da.png)

Brew potions, feed them to your pets, then utilize your pets to make more potions.  Fulfill 10 orders to win!

Links
* **HTML5(WebGL)**: [dashingstrike.com/LudumDare/LD43](http://www.dashingstrike.com/LudumDare/LD43/) **Phone/Touch-friendly!**
* **Source Code**: [Jimbly/LD43-slime-laboratory](https://github.com/Jimbly/LD43-slime-laboratory)

A take on the classic pipe-rotating game, combined with growing pets (well, just Slimes), and trying to fulfill specific orders.  You win after fulfilling an arbitrary 9 orders and a final super order, but can continue playing after that.  If you get stuck on orders with attributes like "Bloodlust" or "Golden", see the TIPS section and comments below.

Screenshots:
![help.png](///raw/dd3/z/1c62f.png)

![ss1.png](///raw/dd3/z/1c6e1.png)

![ss3.png](///raw/dd3/z/1c6e4.png)

![ss2.png](///raw/dd3/z/1c6e6.png)

**TIPS** and details:
* Some orders require a specific adjective like the *Beautiful Pet* having a "Beautiful" line in the screenshot immediately above. Though it's not entirely clear, there are 3 adjectives for the 3 primary attributes if that attribute is more than twice the next biggest, and another 3 adjectives for the pairs of attributes.
* Mouse over the "i" in the lower right, or hold Shift, to show all tooltips for all Potions and Pets.  Clicking the "i" will toggle this on or off, which can be useful as you start wrangling a bunch of potions and pets at once.
* There are diminishing returns when utilizing pets to feed your alchemical machinery - you get roughly log-base-2 back, however that is *after* splitting among how many outputs there are, so a Large creature with 6 strength will be split into 3 chunks of 2, each outputting 2, whereas a Small creature with 6 strength will just be one chunk, and only output 3.
* The Final Potion requires 15+ in all attributes, so you may want to start building that one early
* If the animations feel too slow to you, you can press and hold the mouse button or shift to speed them up.
* You can right click to rotate pipes counter-clockwise.

**Attributes Details**

Ignore this for now, go play the game! But if you get confused trying to make a "Ptn of Bloodlust" or "Golden Pet", come back here for the details.

The three attributes, shown by the colors Pink(ish), Green(ish) and Blue(ish) are supposed to represent **Strength**, **Beauty** and **Magic** (though you're free to call them whatever you want ;).

In this table, A **>>** B means that A is "much greater" than B, that is to say, at least twice B, or it is 3+ more than B.  A **==** B means neither A **>>** B nor B **>>** A (both are approximately the same).

| Adjective | Requirements | Color |
| --------- | ------------ | ----- |
| Strong or Strength | Strength **>>** others | Red |
| Beautiful or Charisma | Beauty **>>** others | Green |
| Magical or Sorcery | Magic **>>** others | Blue |
| Wicked or Bloodlust | Strength **==** Beauty, both **>>** Magic | Yellow |
| Ethereal or Charm | Beauty **==** Magic, both **>>** Strength | Cyan |
| Fey or Fire | Strength **==** Magic, both **>>** Beauty | Purple |
| Golden or Elixir | Strength **==** Magic **==** Beauty | Light Golden |

I regret having orders that require specific attributes entirely, as how to get them are not clear in-game, and confuse people, the attributes should just have been used for flavor text, but too late for that now =).


--

Tools Used
* Custom Engine: [GLOV.js](https://github.com/Jimbly/glovjs-playground)
* Mtn Dew
* Photoshop
* Audacity

I, of course, planned on making other kinds of pets besides Slimes. Of course, I never got around to it, instead spending a lot of time polishing the UI and feedback systems to make it clear what was going on.  Started on recording sounds about 30 minutes before the end of the Compo, as usual - glad I got some in, though they might be annoying, so I also added a Sound toggle to the menu =).

Also, if you're read this far, check out my other game [Splody on Steam and PS4](http://www.splody.com/)!

**Post-Compo Changes** (as permitted by rules)
* Port to Mobile web:
  * Automatically disable postprocessing if it's slowing things down (mobile and old GPUs)
  * Require tapping twice on some buttons, so the first tap just highlights it and gets all of the tooltip info
  * Make some buttons bigger so they're tappable on my tiny, tiny phone
* Fix keys getting stuck on window unfocus

entries.title: Sacrifices Must Be Maids
entries.description:
![placeholderart2.gif](///raw/e9b/1/z/1c6e7.gif)

Sacrifices Must Be Maids is a card game for 1-2 players inspired by the card game Famiglia.  The goal of the game is to acquire as many high-value Maid cards as possible by sacrificing other maids.  Every card is worth its level in points and the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

Each turn the player can play an action from their hand, and then can sacrifice two matching (same type and level) Maids to get a maid of one higher level from the middle of the board.

Card Types:

- Angel Maid - Can be sacrificed in the Action Phase to revive one or more maids with total level less than or equal to its own.
- Demon Maid - Can be used as a wildcard in the Sacrifice Phase with any other type.
- Elf Maid - Can be sacrificed in the Action Phase to temporarily add its level to another maid, for the next Sacrifice Phase.
- Witch Maid - Can be sacrificed in the Action Phase to take one or more maid cards from the board with total level less than or equal to its own.

At the end of each turn, the rightmost card on the board is discarded if it hasn't been taken, the cards move down, and the board is refilled to 5 cards.  If both the action and sacrifice phases are skipped, all cards on the board are discarded instead.  After the deck runs out, the discard pile is reshuffled into a new deck.  The next time this happens the game will end and the points will be tallied.

entries.title: Box City
entries.description:
Box City is a "point and click" game that revolves around creating a city with the money and resources you have. The city must be environmentally friendly but also have a booming economy. Having too much of either can lead to terrible consequences, Therefore, sacrifices must be made.

Mechanics:
The game is purely pointing your cursor upon different components of the video game world, and manipulating them as you see fit. In the upper right-hand corner, you will see different statistics, and information about your city such as your money, power, and pollution level. You can also upgrade the different components, and they all have different effects, not all positive. 

How it's related to the theme:
There are many aspects of this game that handicap the player into difficult circumstances that require sacrifice. The brilliant thing about it, however, is that it is all player driven. There is never a moment when the game arbitrarily forces you into a scenario that you yourself didn't get yourself into. From the limited number of spaces you can place bLS� ���

entries.title: Temple Business
entries.description:
# TEMPLE BUSINESS
Every season it happens again: time for the quarterly sacrifice! You as the Temple's handyman are responsible for gathering the ingredients for the rituals. However, you can't just walk over to the ingredients. How will the elders help you gather them?

![Cover.png](///raw/36e/1/z/1c6cf.png)

# DIFFICULTY NOTE 
The first stage (where you only have JUMP) can be perceived as _really hard_. However, every jump that you need to make for that stage is doable! So keep trying until you start feeling the controls :)

There's an escape hatch, however: press *2* to enable the LONG JUMP earlier on. This will make the first assignment a lot easier. With great power comes great responsibility!

If you genuinely think you found an edge case though, please do let me know!

# CONTROLS 
- Arrow keys for walking
- Space for jumping (when the elders deem you worthy to posess it)
- Shift for running (when the elders deem you responsible enough to use it)

![Scr1.png](///raw/36e/1/z/1c6d0.png)

# ABOUT THE GAME 
"Temple Business" was made in 48 hours by Bob Rubbens for LD43.

- @bobismijnfaam
- https://www.plusminos.nl
- bobrubbens [at] gmail [dot] com
- Source: https://github.com/bobismijnnaam/ld43

![Scr2.png](///raw/36e/1/z/1c6d4.png)

# CREDITS 
- Munro font from: http://www.tenbytwenty.com/
- Unity for their great engine and dev environment, also on Linux!
- SFXR for sound effects.
- Inkscape and GIMP for being approximately usable.

entries.title: Hours of the Day
entries.description:
Take over the life of an aspiring musician as they navigate the challenges of trying to lead a fulfilling life, while keeping everyone they know happy. 

![screenshot1.png](///raw/1a7/91/z/1c61b.png)

Click on the emails on your phone to see the events your friends and family have invited you to. By adding these events to the calendar, you can boost your relationships, by ignoring them, you let your relationships deteriorate. There's not enough hours in a day to do everything, so some sacrifices will have to be made. What will you choose to preserve, and what will you let slide? How long can you keep it all together?

![screenshot2.png](///raw/1a7/91/z/1c61a.png)

Everybody wants something different, so make sure to keep your eye on the bars at the bottom of the screen. If even one of them is empty, it's game over!

Edit: Released a bugfix to the "Chat with Bex" event so it schedules properly. Released a fix to the "Antonio Party" event so that the text renders properly.

--

Created using Unity / Visual Studio
Font: Conformity
Audio: sfxr, Bosca Ceoil
Visuals: paint.net, aseprite

Thanks for playing!

entries.title: The Exchange
entries.description:
![logoclr.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/1e7e7.png)
 

A short narrative game where you make choices by making sacrifices.

**WARNING:** THIS IS AN INCOMPLETE NARRATIVE GAME!

You are a student Exchanger, possessing the magical ability to sacrifice beloved possessions and release their innate properties and effects. For your final test, you've been sent to live in a humble farming town for a year. Use the Exchange to help the people there... and test the limits of your power.

I really bit off more than I could chew with this one, and ran out of time before I could finish anything close to a satisfying story. I'm really happy that I was able to finish the engine and scripting "language" in 48 hours, though. Hopefully you can get a sense of how it plays from the 10-20 minutes it takes to finish.

![ss2.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/1ee68.png)

![ss3.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/1ee69.png)

![ss.png](///raw/8d0/41/z/1ee6b.png)

Done in Unity/C#. Also used Photoshop, Illustrator, and Audacity. Fonts are Ghibli by Eyad Al-Samman and Colus by Stan Partalev. Card images were made by mashing some of my own photos and tons of open-license photography together... hopefully that's a good enough derivative. I was going for kind of a [DeepDream](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DeepDream)-meets-[Dixit](https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/39856/dixit) kind of look.

The enemies exist in three flavors: ones that rush you, ones that shoot you and ones that use shields to protect themselves from your bullets. Note that shields (theirs and yours) only protect against bullets, not people.

Levels are procedurally generated. There are 16 to get the end game message, but there is a custom level option in case you want more.

This is also the first time I've tried using webGL, so I made a mistake in regard to the resolution of the text. Therefore I made a small modification in the web-version post-release. It is just a change in standard resolution.

entries.title: Master Key
entries.description:
![banner_5.png](///raw/aba/3/z/1f504.png)

## The Premise

Keith the Raccoon has a hunger that can only be sated by material wealth. Help him explore the mazes of an abandoned temple in search of riches.

## The Game

Keith has a number of abilities:

- **Arrow keys:** Move
- **Z:** Hold this button while moving to dash across gaps
- **X:** Hold this button while moving to push blocks
- **C:** Hold this button while moving to jump onto ledges
- **Mouse:** Drag and drop key tiles onto altars when you're standing next to them

![sreenshot_1.jpg](///raw/aba/3/z/1ca25.jpg)

## The Link

You can download my game from Itch.io [here](https://plasmastarfish.itch.io/master-key).


## The Tools

- **Programming:** Python/Pygame, with a couple classes from my Pygame graphics toolkit, [pyracy](https://github.com/jeremycryan/pyracy).

- **Graphics:** Paint.NET

- **Sound Effects:** SFXR

- **Music:** Sibelius 7

Thanks to Pyinstaller and [this Pyinstaller tutorial](https://irwinkwan.com/2013/04/29/python-executables-pyinstaller-and-a-48-hour-game-design-compo/) for letting me magically get Python into an executable form.

entries.title: Mary had some lamb to spare
entries.description:
Mary is on a walk through the mountains with lambs. However, there's a small chance of the lambs surviving, because Mary came unarmed. Luckily, she has a bunch of sheep the throw at her enemies!

Avoid losing all of your sheep, as you can't fight enemies without them.

The levels are randomly generated.

Grab sheep with the left mouse button.Throw them by letting go.

Change what type of sheep you want to grab with the number keys, or the mousewheel.

### Multiple lambs were harmed in the making of this game

![MH_1.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/1c6f5.png)

![MH_2.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/1c6fc.png)

![MH_4.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/1c6ff.png)

![MH_5.PNG](///raw/b02/2/z/1c703.png)

![Mary_Walk.gif](///raw/b02/2/z/1de4e.gif)

## how to read the screen

It's pretty simple. on the left you have your money, health, and lamb meat. on the top, you have button representing the number keys on a keyboard. these buttons have a picture of a sheep on it, and the number of remaining sheep of this type below it. The desired type of sheep to pick up will be highlighted in green. This prevents picking up your more valuable sheep if you wish to not sacrifice them. Use the number keys or the mousewheel to switch the type of sheep you wish to pick up.


## This game is a bit difficult at first, heads up.

# Pro Tip: Don't question whether your morals are in the right place.

entries.title: Total Party Kill
entries.description:
![TPK-title2x.png](///raw/3c1/f1/z/1f77c.png)

Your party enters a deep and dark dungeon... but the only way forward is creative use of friendly fire. Sacrifices must be made...

Control 3 different heroes: a knight, a mage and a rogue, use their special abilities and sacrifice your teammates to reach the goal. As long as one hero survives, you complete the level.

- Arrow Keys = Move
- Z = Jump
- X = Use character's attack
- A and S = Cycle between heroes
- R = Restart a level
- M = Mute music
- N = Mute Sounds

Created for Ludum Dare 43 compo in under 48 hours. Theme: Sacrifices must be made.
Made with Stencyl: http://stencyl.com/

![Teamwork.gif](///raw/3c1/f1/z/1c764.gif)

![screen2.png](///raw/3c1/f1/z/1c772.png)![screen5.png](///raw/3c1/f1/z/1c774.png)![screen6.png](///raw/3c1/f1/z/1c776.png)

entries.title: Of Cows And Peasants
entries.description:
![CoverImage.jpg](///raw/f39/e/z/1d35b.jpg)

This is my entry for LD43. Please play using the Windows version for the best experience. If playing in browser, make sure to not click out of the window.



Left click - launch Peasants

Right click - launch Cows




Tips:

Peasants are shot in pieces which means a larger area of affect.

The fewer peasants you have, the slower you will reload.

Cows are not as effective against small goblins, but they are the only things which can defeat the large goblins.

Cows cost 2 food, but they also generate 0.5 food per day.

Peasants cost 0.5 food, but are bought in pairs.




Created using: Unity, Aseprite, Paint.net

entries.title: Judgement of a Priest
entries.description:
​You have always wanted to be a priest... little did you know how difficult it is! To please the gods, a sacrifice must be made every other day. By trial and error, you must determine which divine signs correspond to the desired sacrifice.

![2.jpg](///raw/0db/e1/z/1c666.jpg)

![3.jpg](///raw/0db/e1/z/1c667.jpg)

Game was developed in Unity.

entries.title: Explosive Sacrifice
entries.description:
Sacrifice yourself to the gods!

Land on the altar to ascend to a higher form of being (or something).

But you can't be sacrificed while you are still alive of course, so make sure to be dead when you get there!

### Dev

This was my second gamejam and my first solo jam! Overal it went pretty well. I really wanted to put some story stuff in as well, but when the deadline came it was too unfinished to make sense (and also quite bad in general) so I had to scrap it all last minute. This was also my first time making audio for a game so that went well :^). Anyway, I hope I can participate again next time!

entries.title: cube mob
entries.description:
This is a game where you control a mob of cubes. Use the movement keys/joystick to rotate cubes, causing them to roll unpredictably. (Cubes must be sacrificed so you can move through the level!)

Very minimal (and messy!!) code, the concept was mostly tweaking physics and level design.

I was only able to complete 2 levels, but they're pretty big. Enjoy clearing the unreasonably hard section at the back end!

![img.png](///raw/275/e1/z/1c83d.png)

tools : 
Unity, Paint.net

patch log : 
- I put a bandaid over a camera error that would lead to a failure state when trying to handle certain cube positions.

entries.title: Space Station Gamma-7
entries.description:
![Cover.PNG](///raw/3b1/2/z/1c6a9.png)
Background:

You are the commander of the space station Gamma-7 which is currently under attack by hostile forces. With the station's defenses sabotaged and no hope for backup anytime soon, your only hope for survival is to gather your crew and abandon the station, but there's one problem: There's not enough escape pods for everybody. Someone will have to be left behind...

Instructions:

Gather your crew and escort each one of them to one of the escape pods before the station is destroyed. Just get close to them and they will follow you.

Controls:

W,S,↑,↓: Move character

A,D,←,→: Rotate character

M: Toggles music on/off

Tools used:
- Unity 2018.2
- Visual Studio 2017
- LMMS
- BFXR
- wwwTyro's Space Skybox Generator

entries.title: Anno Luciferus
entries.description:
![ld43_volley_medium_02.gif](///raw/7d6/z/1ce94.gif)

**:imp::fire: Cultists yearn to die in lava in your name. Deny them.**

**:imp::fire: Twin-stick Arcade Melee, with a dash of Demon Pong.**

**:imp::fire: Collect the heads of Grand Viziers who have failed you.**

**:imp::fire: Rule Hell forever with your unspeakable name atop Dreamlo leaderboards.**



![ld43_melee_medium.gif](///raw/7d6/z/1ceaa.gif)



**Twin-stick Arcade Melee, with a dash of Demon Pong.** You're huge, the enemies are tiny, so have fun stomping around and knocking them all the hell over the map. Sacrifice the Grand Vizier of the house that has lost your favor, or just take the head of the winner because you're a demon that's what demons do.

**Cultists get progressively more devout** and come up with ever greater methods of trying to get past you and throw themselves into lava so that they can die for you. But don't let your guard down, if they expose you as a false idol then they will die but in a different way which somehow is less good. Or bad.

**Controls**

**Left Stick / WASD** : Move

**Right Stick / Arrows** : Aim/rotate

**Fire / Space,Z,X** : Hold to bring up your shield and charge your hammer.

When you release the fire button when the hammer is charged, you'll smash your hammer down knocking enemies back. If enemies touch your shield, you will drink their souls. Drink 5 souls and you can **throw** your hammer, killing enemies for points. Bounce your hammer back repeatedly to increase the score multiplier.

At the end of every wave, select one House for sacrifice. They will grow in their passion to jump in the lava, and you will get a reward.

entries.title: Jeorb's Folly
entries.description:
![title_screen.png](///raw/89a/e1/z/1c67d.png)

![game_screen.png](///raw/89a/e1/z/1c680.png)

![game_over_screen.png](///raw/89a/e1/z/1c686.png)


Move the player with the arrow keys. Deflect each mob before it escapes the screen to score a point. Lose a point if a mob escapes without being deflected.

Press Q to quit.

This game was written in Rust by following along with the Amethyst Book's Pong tutorial and creating the game by modifying that base.

I submitted this to the Jam rather than the compo for two reasons:

1. I'm not sure if basing the game code on a tutorial counts as "from scratch".
2. I couldn't think of a name for the game and used a suggestion from a friend.

My goal for Ludum Dare 43 was to create a start screen, a game screen with some sort of controllable action, and a game over screen and that's all there is here.  Advanced features like "fun" will have to wait for my second foray into Ludum Dare with Ludum Dare 44 in April.

Enjoy!

(Or more likely not :-P)

entries.title: Offshoot
entries.description:
![Screenshot.PNG](///raw/8c8/d1/z/1ce84.png)
Your limbs are made of guns. At the end of each level, you have to sacrifice one of your weapons.

Every playthrough has a different configuration of weapons!

The aim of the game:
Destroy all of the enemies

Reach the red flag in the level 

Controls:

A and D = Left and right movement

U = Shoot right arm weapon

I = Shoot left arm weapon

O = Shoot right leg weapon

P = Shoot left leg weapon

Space Bar = Jump (Held for higher jumps)

Twitter: https://twitter.com/OwenBenRees

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J7U0-Scln3M

Updates after submission: Fixed game breaking bug on the third map and reduce the music volume

Jump hold time has been increased so that all levels are completable.

entries.title: Terrifying Rocket Zest
entries.description:
# TERRIFYING ROCKET ZEST

![TRZ Thumbnail 01.png](///raw/b0e/11/z/1c64b.png)

In this game, Terrifying Rocket Zest, you control the rocketship being piloted by eight castaways who are stuck on a dying planetoid. Balance weight and momentum as you dodge asteroids and get the hell out of there. It is a roguelike of socially-reprehensible proportions.

Currently this is only Windows-compatible. I absolutely do want this to be on Mac OS but last time I tried achieving that, the entire game was stuck on a pause screen. For some reason.

ESCAPE QUITS THE GAME IMMEDIATELY - DO NOT TRY TO PAUSE!

entries.title: Fenik
entries.description:
# Fenik
### Made for Ludum Dare 43

## Description
A sidescroller psuedo-rpg following someone and their companion Phoenix.

Gain Different abilities and stat bonuses when with and without the Phoenix. To switch? Die with the Phoenix and you shall be alone. (Or, learn the proper abilities to change at will)

The goal is simple. Make it to Haven alive. With your Phoenix.

## Controls

Space - Jump
Up Key - Interact
Control - Basic Attack
A, S, D, F, R - Abilities

entries.title: Dungeon of Lost Items
entries.description:
### More on Rules:

There are lots of rules so here are some obvious ones that I didn't got time to put inside the game:

* Swords in your inventory gives ATK, and shields gives DEF.

* Keys open doors. It costs 1 key to open a door.

* Potions just occupies space, and are good candidates to sacrifice first.

* There is also a limit of 10 items in your Inventory. Any more and the first one will be removed.

* Killing a monster will also sacrifice your item in your first slot.

(Sorry about forgetting to write these things, it's my first compo and writing instructions is hard.)

![cover image here](///content/7e/z/1c691.png)

=============

### Short Story

You, the player, has somehow find yourself in the middle of a dungeon full of monsters and items.

Your goal is to leave the Dungeon alive through the stairs somewhere near the opposite corner.


### Keys and instructions

Your character :levitate: starts somewhere in the top left, and the exit is somewhere at the bottom right side of the dungeon. :door:

Use the cursor keys to move around, if you try to go to a place with a monster then you'll have a fight.

The keys X and C can be used to cycle through your inventory; this is important because the first item in your inventory will be lost after a fight with a monster!


### My first Compo game

This is my first Compo game, and I've done Ludum Dare for some time now. I have never managed to finish within 48 hours but somehow this time I managed to do it! :smile:

I thought Jam was hard, but here I have even less time to add anything that's not crucial to the game!

No time for levels, sounds, special effects, more graphics, animations, or even instructions (I'm not very good at those, so it will only costs even more time...)

My goal here was to just make something that is challenging even if it's randomly generated, simple looking but still challenging every time I play.  I have the feeling now that I can play a random level every day and not getting bored for at least a week.

Thanks for playing.

entries.title: A Walk In The Neighborhood

entries.title: Stupid Minions Battle Today and Tomorrow
entries.description:
Welcome to the Game!
To move: Use the WASD keys
To shoot: Use the arrow keys
To mine: Hold shift, and use the arrow keys. Find the randomly placed generator.
With enough gems (5), you can create a follower. Otherwise, just kill the baby enemies for a random chance of one spawning. If your health gets low, in the middle of the game is a well, hold E at any time to have your followers move towards it, and jump in. You will regain some of the health that they had remaining. Press ENTER to start the game, thanks for playing!
You can press F11 to go into fullscreen mode as well.

![ludum dare 43 ss.PNG](///raw/f71/91/z/1dd5b.png)

entries.title: Trolleys: A Moral Quandary
entries.description:
This game is loosely based on the Trolley Problem.  You are in control of some train switches which you can use to direct trains.  There are people (and dogs) crossing the train tracks and there are no signals or blockades so it's very dangerous for them.  See what you can do with it.

There is no win or loss condition, you just play for the allotted time.

Controls:

    Up/Down - Choose switch/menu entry
    Space   - Toggle switch, choose menu
    Enter   - Toggle pause, next stage

There is also an achievement system so you can try to get them all if you like.  It resets when the game closes unfortunately

entries.title: Lock-Tris
entries.description:
Lock-Tris is a simple Tetris clone where each time you rotate a piece it locks one of the blocks on the board. Clearing a row that contains one or more locked blocks will clear all blocks other than the locked ones, and will unlock all remaining blocks. Locked blocks are not affected by gravity so things can get messy quite fast if you aren't careful.

Have fun.

---

Controls:
- Left and Right arrow keys to move piece
- Up arrow key to rotate
- Control key to hold piece

---

Made in 8 hours (yes 8 hours) for Ludum Dare Compo 43 by Cameron Robinson (Durveg).

Tools:
- Unity 2018
- Photoshop
- [ChipTone](http://sfbgames.com/chiptone/)

---

***Postmortem:***

LD43 landed on a very inconvenient weekend for me this year. I was unable to do any planning let alone actual coding until Sunday morning, with about 8 - 8.5 hours left on the clock. After some brainstorming I came up with a great idea for the theme! It was going to be a strategy puzzler game with some good depth to the mechanics. On paper it even sounds, to me, like a good game to continue working on after the jam for an official release. But obviously that was FAR out of scope for the time I had remaining in the compo.

So putting that idea into storage, I fell back to advice I heard about what to do if you can't come up with an idea. I decided to just create a clone of something really simple, and add some kind of mechanic to tie into the theme to make it not a straight clone. I wanted to go with a break out clone but after some more failed brainstorming on that I landed on Tetris. I'm not super satisfied with the add-on mechanic I came up with, but I am happy with just the fact that I got a reasonably finished product done in 8 hours. 

The only things I really didn't have time to add were a simple theme tune and increasing difficulty, the game can get pretty challenging as it is so that might not be an issue.

Thanks to anyone who plays and rates the game, and thanks for reading!

---

entries.title: Desert island... or dessert island?
entries.description:
A plane crashes near a desert island. Luckily, 4 of the passengers survive. Unluckily for them, they're stranded on a desert island, with few resources, and help won't make it to them for 5 days. Will they work together and make the best use of their resources, or will they resort to cannabalism and murder? 

You'll control the 4 passengers and will have to try and survive the 4 days...

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

I kinda ran out of time on this one :( Didn't get to do as much as I'd like, mood/temperature didn't make it in properly so they're disabled.

Controls: 
Left mouse selects characters. You can click either on the character, or on their character infoon the left
Right mouse selects from a list of actions on a target. You'll need to have a character selected, but if you right click on say, a coconut tree, you'll get choices like Shake the tree, or chop it down. (Hint: Right click on the ground to sleep)
To use items, drag from the panel on the right to their character info on the left, not onto the actual character. I.e. Drag a water bottle onto a players name to use it on them.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

There's a bunch of weird graphical bugs that didn't happen in the editor.. I blame using unity 2019a/webgl!

All content made by badly by me! :D 

Tools used: 
Art: Blender, Affinity Photo
Audio: Bfxr, Audacity
Everything else: Unity, Visual Studio

It is possible to win btw.

entries.title: Mr. Fluffer's Big Day
entries.description:
Four years in a row, Douglas Dogsworth Sr. and his dog Mr. Fluffer have taken second place at the annual Sussex County dog show. This year, they put their hopes in "the awesome power of Satan" instead. Hijinks ensue.

 
I never got around to implementing most of what I had planned gameplay-wise, so be warned that this right now is the walkiest of walking simulators to ever simulate walking on earth. entries.title: Fire Swept
entries.description:
![FireSweptLogo.png](///raw/9d8/71/z/1f86e.png)

It's fire season!  A fire has started somewhere in your town.  Dispatch your fire fighting units to out the fire before it spreads!

![ScreenComposite_01.jpg](///raw/9d8/71/z/1f86c.jpg)

https://youtu.be/Jjw7kg_Ae1Q

**Controls:**
- 1 - 5 = Hotbar hotkey.
- Left Mouse Button = Select Unit / Place Unit / Move Unit.
- Scroll Wheel = Zoom in / Out.
- Scroll Wheel Click and Drag = Move Map.
- Spacebar = Cancel selection.
- Del = Send selected unit home.
- Backspace = Send ALL units home.
- BackQuote or H = Toggle HELP (Pause) panel.

** Hotbar and Units:**
Located at the bottom of the screen are the units you can deploy.  Click the button or press the corresponding number key to select a unit.  Then click the map where you want to deploy the unit.

Unit Types:
#1 - Response Company can remove foliage to create fire blocks.
#2 - Engine Company use hoses to dowse flames and prevent them from spreading.  Must have an Engine nearby.
#3 - Engine will provide the Engine Company with water.  Engines will fill with water when they are on road.
#4 - Fire Chief provides  a 25% effectiveness bonus to units within a 4 tile radius.  They can also evacuate structures.
#5 - Helitanker can drop water on a wide area to dowse flames and prevent fire spreading.  Must be sent home to reload with water.

**Game Play:**
When a fire breaks out, dispatch your available units to fight the blaze.  Every 3 (three) minutes, new reinforcements MAY arrive depending on the urgency and size of the fire.  Use the Fire Chief to give a bonus to units and to evacuate structures of people.  

To move units, click the action dot to select the unit and then click a destination to move to.  When the unit is selected, the action dot will grow large and flash.  You can press the SPACEBAR to cancel the action.

Moving units through fire have a chance of destroying the unit and they become a casualty.

Unit actions are indicated by the color of the action dot:
- White = The unit is idle; taking a break.
- Green = The unit is moving.
- Blue = The unit is working. (i.e. Chopping trees, spraying water, evacuating, etc.)

Enjoy!

entries.title: Volcano Rush!
entries.description:
![screenshot_1.png](///raw/c06/z/1c563.png)
![screenshot_2.png](///raw/c06/z/1c566.png)
![screenshot_3.png](///raw/c06/z/1c568.png)
![screenshot_4.png](///raw/c06/z/1c56a.png)

**VOLCANO RUSH**

Do you have what it takes to get the village's sacrifice to the mouth of the volcano before the angry volcano god destroys us all?  Can you avoid the lava and burning rocks that stand in your way?  Find out in Volcano Rush!

**Controls:**

**[A]** Moves Backward
**[D]** Moves Forward
**[Space]** Jumps.

**Tools Used:**

Visual Studio, Notepad++, ZBrush, Blender, Photoshop, Audacity, FontBuilder, FL Studio.

This was created using my [custom C++ game library](https://github.com/jharler/ZeroTolerance). All bugs are totally my fault.

**Feedback**

I hope you have fun and if you could, please leave me some feedback, even if it’s just “hey, this sucks” or “hey, that was fun.”

**Notes**

Be aware that jumping might feel a bit odd.  The way I implemented following the path around the mountain makes for some interesting jumps in some spots.  It shouldn't take long to get used to and you might not even notice it at all.  The hitboxes on the lava are a bit generous, so you can get pretty close before jumping.  Keep that in mind if you are having trouble making it over the lava.

**Known Bugs**

There is a bug that prevents the game from loading on some computers.  I've fixed at least one cause of this, which is v2 in the Itch downloads.  If you get a message in the original version that says "An exception has occurred", please try v2.

There is also a bug that leaves black pixels on the screen.  This seems to be on non-Nvidia cards.  I uploaded v3 which should fix this issue.

**Playthrough**

Below is a video playthrough of the game.  I highly recommend playing the game to experience it first hand, but this is here if you want it.

[Playthrough](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Czus8BG2Lz8)

entries.title: Faces
entries.description:
## Faces - Ludum Dare 43 - "Sacrifices must be made"

[Play "Faces" online with WebGL!](http://departuregames.com/ludumdare43/)

![FacesScreenshot.PNG](///raw/5ab/1/z/1c64d.png)

![FacesScreenshot_Win.PNG](///raw/5ab/1/z/1c648.png)

[Play "Faces" online with WebGL!](http://departuregames.com/ludumdare43/)

### Project
I finally had some time on a Ludum Dare weekend to participate! This project is based on an idea I've had for awhile, albeit greatly simplified. This is the first time I've tried out using PlayMaker for Unity, and I have to say it's a worthwhile investment just for it's implementation of finite state machines. I completed this game in around 8 hours.

### Premise
The premise is at it says at the bottom of the screen - to use the abilities given to you to Delight the faces (Delighted faces are green with a big smile). You'll need to delight at least 7 faces to win. What does "Delighting" them entail? Experiment a bit to find out!

### Tools I Used
- **Engine** - Unity 2018.1
- **Drawing and Image Editing** - Paint.NET
- **Sound Effects** - Bfxr
- **Programming IDE** - Visual Studio 2017

### Controls
- Mouse driven

entries.title: The Life of a Corporate Drone
entries.description:
So you've got a job. And a family. And you gotta eat, right? And you need some you time. And after all that, you do need your sleep.

![ld43_screen_1.png](///raw/414/7/z/1c6ab.png)

You don't actually have time for all of this. Something has to be sacrificed somewhere. But what? And how long can you last?

## Instructions
On the first screen, press a number to pick your character. I meant to have a much nicer selection mechanism, but I ran out of time.
In game, just use your arrow keys to move from room to room. Try to keep the bars for all your resources as high as possible - a bar goes up when you're in its room. Your mood affects how quickly your bars go up, and if any of your bars are in the red that'll really affect your mood.
On the final screen, just read what it says and press enter to quit (but not before you share your time!) If you want to play again, just run the game again (a friendly retry option is something else I ran out of time for.

### Things missing
- Your speakers aren't broken, I just ran out of time to do sound. 
- I haven't fully tested every single way of doing things, so it might be possible to cheese it, though I tried to brute force my around the brute forciest of cheeses, so feel free to take that as a challenge.
- As I said in the instructions, no friendly wrapping. Something else I ran out of time for.

Made in Python (3.whatever I had installed) and pygame. I've been able to make a Windows exe which I think works, I was having trouble - you'll know if I haven't fixed it because time will fly. For my friends running other OSes download the source code zip, extract it and run *CorporateDrone.py* (you'll need pygame installed, if you don't have that open a terminal and run *pip install pygame*).

(As well as adding the Windows exe, I slightly changed the source code zip - I forgot to set some variables I was using for testing back to what they should be)

entries.title: NES Quest
entries.description:
# Ludum Dare 43: Sacrifices Must be Made

In keeping with my "abuse of the theme" motif, I present *NES Quest*, because
programming for the NES is like sacrificing your sanity.

This is not a complete game: my ambition exceeded my preparedness and the
available time, but this is a playable demo.

## *NES Quest* Playable Demo

Quest through the land, searching out and collecting the components to repair
your NES:  Find the 6502 CPU, the PPU, the RAM chip and the 7404 Inverter.

Watch out for Spiders, Grumps and Skulls.  Grab a sword to defend yourself.

NES Quest draws a lot of inspration from *The Legend of Zelda* and *Gauntlet*.

## Unfinished Work

As an unfished game, the RAM and 7404 Inverter are not present in the game.
There is no win condition, nor goals. The player doesn't have a health system.

The movement and combat system need some fine tuning to feel more playable.


### Start Screen

![Start Screen](///content/d16/z/1c663.png)

entries.title: Tasty Blocks
entries.description:
Tasty Blocks is a game where you play as Blocky Bill, a blocky entity who eats blocky items. For each level, you have to choose carefully which items to eat to fill up Bills hunger, and which items to assist you through the course. If you make the wrong choices, Bill will either be trapped, or starve. Your goal is to make it to the end of the level with Bill safe and sound, and well-fed.

(you sacrafice items that would help you through the level to feed bill)

![Screenshot (50).png](///raw/b1a/e1/z/1c67a.png)

![Screenshot (51).png](///raw/b1a/e1/z/1c697.png)

![Screenshot (52).png](///raw/b1a/e1/z/1c69c.png)

CONTROLS:
- Arrow Keys to move/Place blocks & ladders
- E to enter Inventory
- Click on an inventory slot with an item to view its properties

KNOWN BUGS:
- rarely, for this and that reason, you glitch into a wall.
- Occasionally, when you climb to the top of a wall, you will suddenly move to the center of it.
- Animations and and physical movement are slightly offset on slow computers.

entries.title: Dungeon Clicker
entries.description:
![Dungeon01.gif](///raw/282/01/z/1f95c.gif)
  
Send adventurers inside a dungeon to gather some loot !  
You can't control them, but you can mark rooms to improve their efficiency.  
How rich can you become ?
  
This game is a kind of mix of cookie-clickers, mine-sweeper, and pachinko.  
It wasn't planned this way :D  
  
The game is built on my own little game engine, if you are curious it's available here :  
https://github.com/Legulysse/gugu-engine  

### Instructions
- Press spacebar like a mad man to send lots of adventurers (green stamps) explore the dungeon.
- They leave red stamps when dying, blue stamps when finding loot.
- Click on rooms to mark them as dangerous, or rich.
- Marked rooms greatly improves adventurers efficiency when visiting them.
- Gather loot, buy upgrades, and explore further and further !

______________

entries.title: Cartel hunt!
entries.description:
Cartel Hunt!

You are DEA (Drug Enforcement Administration) chief and your job is to kill **cartel boss** or all **cartel members**.

Over 100 unidentified people (mostly civilians) does not make it easy.
Some *sacrafices has to be made* - but be careful! Too many civilians or agents will die and its **GAME OVER**!

Your tools:
- Bomb planting [**Q** key]
- Sniper rifle [**W** key]
- Deployment of DEA agents that will do interrogations for you! [**E** key]
- Civil inspections [**R** key]

Time is ticking - try to find and kill *drug cartel boss* and not to kill everybody!

Good luck!

![LD43-CartelHunt-Cover.png](///raw/82b/d/z/1cb26.png)

entries.title: Contagion
entries.description:
![itchscreen3.gif](///raw/1e4/1/z/1c8f4.gif)
*Since the pestilence entered our lands, it has been official policy to remove any plaguebearers and place them within the secure walls of the Tower. Many have criticised this decision to leave the sufferers of the contagion to fend for themselves, and eventually die alone and unaided, but it is a small sacrifice for the benefit of our country, is it not?*

**Gameplay**

Should all be fairly self explanatory; the icons available are
move north / south / east / west on the left hand side of the controls
Look around / Attack / Eat / Take / Run away / Climb on the right hand side.

Things you can't currently do get greyed out and become inactive.

**Known Bugs**

Really went to the wire on time limits with this one, so there's some annoying bugs I didn't get to fix before my time limit was up;
* Restarting via menu button breaks things pretty badly on a second run through - if you want to play again, just refresh your browser
* sometimes all the doors in a room will open for no reason (they're only supposed to be open when you return to a room to help you navigate easier)
* some missing strings on things like "you were attacked by a "
* Lack of variety - I actually have code support for as many NPCs, rooms, decorations and chests as I want... but the time limits of a Compo entry meant I ended up only making one of each

**Tools Used**

* Unity for the big picture stuff
* Pyxel Edit for the visuals
* Bosca Coeil for the music
* BFXR for the sound effects
