# Welcome to the Teddy Bear Repair Clinic!
Damaged teddies are coming in and you need to repair them before all of their LOVE leaks and and they die! You'll have to choose your battles because you won't be able to repair all of them.

![Screenshot.png](///raw/5eb/51/z/1ca9a.png)

## Instructions
1. Click a teddy to start operating on it
2. Select the correct tool from the tool panel on the right
3. Click where you will need to use the tool (where the teddy is damaged)
4. Complete mini-game if necessary (click while the needle is in the green)
5. Repeat until operation is complete, then select another bear

## KNOWN BUGS
If you are operating on a teddy and another one appears next to it, do NOT click on the second one

entries.title: Perilous Passage
entries.description:
![Save the idiot drivers, and more importantly, the public servants](///raw/f05/1/z/1c63e.png)
*Save the idiot drivers, and more importantly, the public servants*
![You've been given a task by God to intervene and save civilians](///raw/f05/1/z/1c641.png)
*You've been given a task by God to intervene and save civilians*
![Drag bridges and manipulate drivers to help them across](///raw/f05/1/z/1c65f.png)
*Drag bridges and manipulate drivers to help them across*


# [Click to play in browser!](https://nostyleguy.itch.io/perilous-passage)

## Game Background

Perilous Passage gives you the omnipotent power to decide which lazy drivers live and die! Manipulate the bridges over the Rio Trio Bridgeo river to keep as many drivers alive as possible, without letting Police/Firefighters perish! 

The fate of the mundane motorists is in your hands. Sure, you want to save them all, but you will need to sacrifice a few (or a lot) to save America's finest. 

## How To Play

* Click and drag the bridges to move them in position to save careless drivers.

* Click a vehicle once to slam on its brakes. Click it again to get it going again.

* Don't let the Police/Firefighters die! If 5 of them die, you're done! You will have to give up on some civilians to save all the emergency vehicles. Live and let die!

## About Me:

This was my fifth Ludum Dare game and the first time I've ever finished a game with primarily 3D assets. I really struggled making even rudimentary low-poly meshes and especially texturing them. My hat's off to all the real 3D artists out there. I also really struggled with the theme this time. I didn't decide on my idea until about 15 hours into the Compo, and I'm still not sure the sacrifice thing really came through. I wanted to make the player feel like he was sacrificing the civilians, sometimes several, to keep one emergency vehicle alive. Time will tell if that comes across.    

## Tools:

* Unity
* Blender
* Inkscape
* Audacity

entries.title: Volcano Climber
entries.description:
A small exploration of what it might be like to play a 2D sprite-based platformer in VR.

The "game" is really just a tech demo for procedural 1D heightmaps that are generated on the fly as the character runs around. There's no loss, points, or victory conditions.

I did not make new character artwork, so I've had to opt out of graphics judgement.

https://youtu.be/vJA8xIlvZhw

All terrain visible in the view window gets regenerated each frame in about 0.2ms.

Controls (Oculus Rift, but similar should work on Vive):

Move character: Left thumbstick

Sprint: Left grip or right grip

Jump: Right A or B buttons

Move Volcano: Right thumbstick left/right

Grow/Shrink Volcano: Right thumbstick up/down

Place platform: Right/Left trigger

entries.title: Mortal Decisions
entries.description:
**!!!!BUG ALERT!!!! Repairing the ship when you are at 100% Hull and Engines will make the game unplayable. Besides there is no need to repair the ship if its at "full health" anyways.** :smile:





You have been a space trucker for many years. Everyday you haul shipments which can save the life of those who need it. Unfortunately, for every life you save there are others that die. You can't save them all, so you have to decide who to sacrifice.

Welcome to Mortal Decisions! A game of choices and sacrifice. Can you made the hard decisions when the time comes?

In this game you will be presented with your ships Log Screen and a View of your ship. A panel on the right will let you know how many credits you have, how much fuel you have and the health of your hull and engines. Your job is to earn 10000 credits so you can finally retire.

Below the Log Screen is the Contact Dispatch button. Use it to contact the dispatch where you can get a job, request a fuel ship or request a repair ship. When you request a job you will be presented with 2 options. The left option will be a job helping many people, the right option will be a job helping a single person. Choosing one job means the other job will not be completed and those people or that person will die.

Once you choose a job the Log Screen will let you know what stage you are at. There is a possibility you will encounter Space Pirates. If you do you have 2 options, you can try to outrun them or you can drop your cargo and flee. If you try to outrun them there is a chance the Space Pirates will damage your ship but if successful you will continue the delivery and will get paid. On the other hand if you drop the cargo, while you will get away unharmed you will lose the job and the payment.

If you run out of fuel, or your hull/engines get too damaged you will lose the game. Good Luck!

The escape key will bring up the pause menu which, pauses the game and allows you to change the volume of the music and sound.

NOTES from the Author
---------------------

This is a pretty chill game. I wanted to do something different this time around and I wanted to do something which use the Unity UI heavily. There isn't much action in the game but you do have decisions to make and you can lose. The game leans on some RNG which seems to favor the player. I tried to balance it but there is only so much you can do in 48 hours. 

Anyways, let me know what you think.

entries.title: Food Chainz
entries.description:
## Rhyming Roast 'em Up!
This is a game about challenging animals to rap battles for the right to roast and eat them, to summon and challenge the great God of Rap.

Progress through 3 Dance Dance Revolution style rap battles, to prove your fire burns the hottest!

![screenie.png](///raw/ee5/91/z/1c77e.png)

## Playtime 
About 5-10 minutes

## Features
* 3 radical rap battles
* 5 original beats
* You can quite literally roast a fish in a rap battle
* Unless you lose, the fish eats you then

## Controls

* WASD or arrow keys to move and rap
* Space to interact with characters, and progress dialogue
* Close the game to quit

## Content warnings
* **Implied cartoon violence** (screen jumps to black, an eating noise is heard, and when the screen returns an opponent is no longer there). This can happen to the human main character, a dog, a fish, or a cloaked figure.
* Game should be suitable for minors

Other than that, there is no physical aggression, bad language, or sensitive topics covered in the lyrics.

If you find anything in the game you would deem needing of a warning, please let me know and I'll add it!


## Accessibility
As a rhythm game, the challenge faced will vary greatly depending on the user. The game is designed to give a sense of challenge to all but experienced rhythm game players, but still be fully to most, without too many attempts.

Difficulty setting is on the roadmap for the post-jam version, but in the meantime if you find the game too challenging and want an easier version, please let me know and I'll send you a tailored build.

Please let me know if you have any thoughts, issues, or just nice things to say!
Mac and Linux builds not currently tested, please let me know if they worked for you.

entries.title: Sacrifice by Sword
entries.description:
### Lore
All time and purpose has ended, as you're stuck in an eternal swordfight to the death against the followers of various gods. Your god demands sacrifices in his honor, and promises to bestow you with ever-increasing power the more you sacrifice. But beware, such a promise has been given to all who suffer in this realm. Will you rise above the rest, or will you be destroyed by them? One way or the other, there is no salvation.

### Controls
* WASD or Arrow Keys to move
* Click to attack in the direction you're moving
* Space opens and closes the upgrade menu
* Shift and Ctrl also work in Spectator Mode

### Description
Basically, the game is a never-ending team deathmatch. The stakes are constantly escalating, as new people are being poured into the world. Each carries a soul, and the killer of each gets all those souls (even the used ones), meaning the amount of souls ever only goes up. The AI also knows how to purchase upgrades for themselves, so there's a possibility you will eventually face someone much exceeding your own level of strength.  
The game is played on a 1km² map, and there are also some unarmed characters serving as easy pray.

### Spectator Mode
If you get tired of that, you can go enjoy Spectator Mode, which is the same game, but you can fly around and see how everyone is squabbling. It's a lot of fun, and if you leave it running for long enough, you might just see some characters emerging as superior fighters, and thus the populations of those gods increasing.

entries.title: Humans Must Collide
entries.description:
In this game you play as a lonely ghost. You have the ability to possess living humans and drive them to their final destination.... death. 

**Keys**
- Move around the city with W,A,S,D
- Use "E" on your keyboard when you are behind a human to possess him.
- Use "Q" to unpossess humans.

Once in control of the human collide with ATMs, Sewer covers and other dangerous hazards to kill the humans.
Each SACRIFICE will give you points and extra seconds.

If the timer ends your hunting is done.
Have fun!

3D Assets and characters are from the Polygon City Pack

entries.title: Hero Souls

In Hero Souls, you are the of a kingdom that has been possessed by evil. Your final village is about to be destroyed when you decide to do the unthinkable – unlock the power of the legendary Soul Crucible, a relic of dark power. With it, you think you just may be able to save your kingdom from the forces of evil.

The Soul Crucible combines rare gems and a rarer resource still – souls, to create ultra power artifacts.

To conquer the evil of the 9 realms in your land, you will have to send many heroes. Will they go to their death, so you can gain their valuable soul, or will they be outfitted well enough to conquer what awaits?

------------

Simple clicky chill game. Manage resources, send guys on quests. Enchant gear.

Didn't have enough time to draw nearly as many enemies etc as I wanted, or backgrounds, or any of that stuff, but so it goes.

entries.title: LD43: Super Space Sacrifice
entries.description:
**Cross the galaxy, kill a lamb.**

![title_screen.jpg](///raw/61f/b/z/1f29c.jpg)


The Bork robot race is so powerful they can destroy the entire galaxy in a second. But they are not evil -- they just ask for a sacrifice once every century.

The last one was 99 years ago.

Your quest is to reach the Borks and to make the sacrifice and give humans one more century of existence. Legends say you may need to make other sacrifices on your way...

![dogfight.jpg](///raw/61f/b/z/1f29d.jpg)

**Instructions**

* This is basically a plain and simple shmup: avoid collisions with other things, shot everything that moves.
* You can equip your ship with different weapons and subsystems:
    * Armor protects against all kinds of damage. As armor is lost, you cannot fix it (but you can replace it with a new armor if you find one).
    * Shields protect against energy weapons (laser and plasma), but not against more physical damage (rockets and collisions). Shields regenerate over time.
    * Engines make your ship move faster.
    * You can find much better weapons than your initial Cheap Laser. You have a total of four weapon slots, but one of them (the bomb bay) is basically useless: bombs were forbidden by the Jupiter Convention and thus you'll not find any in the game. (Or do you think this is just an excuse for "sorry, I didn't have time to implement bombs"?!)
* If you have available crew members, you can use them to man weapons and subsystems. Manned things work better (faster fire rate, lower armor damage, faster movement, etc)
* To equip weapons and subsystems and to assign your crew to them, just enter in the pause/inventory menu.

![inventory.jpg](///raw/61f/b/z/1f29e.jpg)

* To find weapons, subsystems and crew members, just kill some enemies. Sometimes they drop the good stuff.
* Notice that to take things dropped by enemies you need at least one available cargo slot. You can destroy things in the pause/inventory screen.

![powerup.jpg](///raw/61f/b/z/1f2a0.jpg)

* Once you get some of this gear, the game should be really easy. In fact, the first few minutes are much harder than the boss fights (which are ridiculously easy). I guess this is a symptom of bad balancing :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye: 

![boss.jpg](///raw/61f/b/z/1f2a1.jpg)

* Speaking of bosses, you cannot fight with the last level boss. He might look like an ordinary giant saucer, but in fact he is a Bork. If you a lamb on your cargo bays, you'll automatically sacrifice it and win the game. Otherwise, you'll automatically lose.
* No biological lambs were harmed to make this game. The one you carry on your ship is a robotic one!

![toll.jpg](///raw/61f/b/z/1f2a2.jpg)

**Controls, in game**

* Move ship: Arrows, WASD, controller D-pad, controller left stick
* Fire: Space bar, alt, control, shift or the  main controller buttons; each one fires a different weapon
* Pause/inventory screen: F1, pause on keyboard, pause  or start button on the controller

**Controls, inventory screen**

* Select item: Arrows, controller D-pad, controller left stick
* For other actions there are on-screen instructions. Just be aware that, in order to swap one equipped item with an item in the cargo slots, you must have the equipped item selected.

**Tools**
* Engine: [Godot](http://godotengine.org) 3.0.6.
* Font: [Orbitron](https://www.theleagueofmoveabletype.com/orbitron), by [Matt McInerney](http://pixelspread.com), [SIL Open Font License 1.1](orbitron-font-license.md).
* Graphics made with [Krita](https://krita.org).
* Sound effects made with [sfxr](http://www.drpetter.se/project_sfxr.html).
* Music made with [Otomata](http://earslap.com/page/otomata.html).
* Used a bit of [Audacity](https://www.audacityteam.org/) for sound editing.

Also, this theme was on a shortlist of themes, I did NOT want to be chosen. I've spent 4 hours trying to figure out, what kind of game to create.

I hope you will enjoy it.

Some sacrifices had to be made alright. Like all my audio plans. :cat: 

Anyways, this is a small shmup where you have to spend your hard earned power ups to use the warp gates and navigate the world. There is a special game over screen if you can find it.

Update:
* Hopefully fixed getting stuck in walls.
* Controls more responsive.
* Extra tutorial line to teach about gates.

entries.title: The secret experiment
entries.description:
Hi guys,


Unfortunatelly I was running out of compo time. Let me explain you why...


#---Tale of my 8th Ludum Dare---

1. The theme: 

 -History: I had a lot of idea with this theme, but I found my ideas too hard for one man and 48 hours. What I think about sacrafice? It's a moral deal for the player. The player can use something with his cons, or not. It's all about the deal of the player. So my ideas were complex role play games. In those case I couldn't implement the whole role role playing system in 48 hours, so I dropped my ideas.

 -Implement: It's a sadly thing, but my game doesn't contain too much from this theme. If are you looking for game with hard theme, it won't be your game. The story is the following: You are the mouse, who sacraficed him for the science :) You can't choose from the deals, only you suffer the bad ideas of your professor. The professor has an experiment about how can load you with useless/useful things, and what will be the result of his decide.

2. Programing:

 -History: I would have liked to create a game with random dungeon generator (when you check my other games, you see I tried it, but those weren't too good). There are a lot of documentation about labirynth/dungeon generation on the Internet.
First off all, what is the difference between labyrinth and dungeon? The labyrinth contains only paths, but the dungeon contains rooms, too. The most algorithms are using some of binary tree algorithm ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_tree ). When you generate a labyrinth, the meaning of the Mase solving algorithm can be useful for you, too ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maze_solving_algorithm ). What about dungeons? The dungeon algorithms are different because of you have to generate a lot of room, and generate some paths to them. That's all. Isn't it? No, It's not, because you need to solve these maps, too.

 -Implementation: I was looking for a good algorithm for that, and I found a great one. It's called BSP alorithm ( https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Binary_space_partitioning http://www.roguebasin.com/index.php?title=Basic_BSP_Dungeon_generation ). I used to draw the whole map from a matrix before, so I tought I generate a binary matrix with BSP, and draw it. It sounds easily. You have to know if you use recursive algorithm, that you can be in infinity loop, so if you can avoid a recursive call, you do it. Why is it important? Because if you generate 10 random sized rectangle in a 20*20 sized rectangle, you can't avoid the infinity loop in 100%. My statistic is 400/32... After I finished the algorithm, I realized that there is an another important question in case of random levels: The balance...

3. Arts:
 -History: I had a "good" idea: if there are animations between the leveles, it will have more fun. I tought when those animations will have good pixel arts, and the levels have too, the game will be fine.

 -Implementation: I created 4 pictures (32x32) about a **** cheese and a mouse(100x200) in 5 hours (4819 pixels/hour)( No it's not the mouse of the cover image). The sadly truth is if I would like to create highly detailed pixel art animation for the videos(3-4 800*600 pictures * 3 video), the task is more than 1195 hours long (if there are the same arts, it will be success in 800 hours). The result looks good. I created 4 cheese, but I haven't time for backgrounds, especially for the game over screen... The "videos" are really static, and because of my poor english, I don't know that those are fine ore not.

4. Music:
 -History: I don't like to create musics.
 -Implementation: There is a good silence with sfx. :)

5. The Balance
 -History: The first idea is you can shop things from the professor, but all of the things have a price, because of that you suffer your decides. the As remember, I realized on Sunday, there is no chance to create an interactive system of decide. I tought, here is no goal, or barrier, so it's not a game. Can I balance a random generated map where the player can't decide? the answer is below. 

 -Implementation: No. I created some goals for the random maps. Because of the randomize, the level 7 can be easier than level 6. I didn't create tutorial screen, because the people don't read it, but I created 4 "tutorial level".

Enjoy it!

# ---Instructions---

w,a,s,d - direction

p - green action

k - red action

select - enter

# ---UPDATE---
03.12 I found some critical issues during the tests, those crashed the browser -> FIXED

entries.title: Body Smasher
entries.description:
In the puzzle platformer Body Smasher, sacrificing yourself to create zombie clones is the only way forward. Your undead helpers push buttons, create platforms, and open doors, but they also faithfully mirror your every move, so you'll have to think ahead to position everything correctly. Furthermore, opportunities for sacrifice are limited by the environment, and killing a zombie at a hazard means you can no longer die there. This is my first Ludum Dare submission, and my first time using the Wren programming language and TIC-80 fantasy console. I also attempted to compose some music for the first time, which probably took me way too much time.

The game has 8 levels and might take up to 30 minutes to complete, depending on how difficult you find each puzzle. Use the arrow keys to move and z to reset the level.

![cover.gif](///raw/876/02/z/1c58b.gif)

entries.title: Blood, Sweat and Taxes
entries.description:
# Blood, Sweat, and Taxes
## FalseIncarnate's Compo entry for LD43: "Sacrifices must be made"

![BST1.jpg](///raw/bd4/e/z/1c80f.jpg)

In life, sometimes you have to make some sacrifices. Especially when you are a farmer who tends a spiritually active plot of land!

Raise crops and animals, collect natural resources like wood, coal, and metal, craft finished goods, upgrade animal pens and workshops, buy and sell to markets, and pay your taxes before the Taxman closes down your farm.

Oh yea, and make sure you are regularly sacrificing goods to the farm spirits if you want to be successful and gain their favor.

### How to play:

Use `WASD` to move your farmer, and arrow keys to face a direction without moving.
`E` to interact with objects in the world (opens menus).
`Esc` to open the pause menu and close menus.
`1`-`6` to select menu options (options varies across menus).

Grow crops, raise animals, harvest resources, and craft products to sell and sacrifice to the spirits. Spirits will meddle with your farm if they feel ignored too long, stealing animal feed, wrecking their shrines, or influencing your efficiency. Appease the spirits with relevant sacrifices to earn their favor, increasing efficiency and earning bonus harvests.

![BST2.jpg](///raw/bd4/e/z/1c895.jpg)

The spirits aren't the only greedy and demanding force in your farm though, beware the Taxman! Pay his taxes regularly or he'll trigger a government seizure of your farm (and end your game!) if you miss his deadline. However, if you can manage to pay off his increasing taxes long enough, you'll earn a Tax Exempted status and no longer have to pay taxes on your farm (at least for the rest of your current play-through)!

### Experience features such as:
- Crop farming
- Beekeeping
- Animal Farming
- Fishing
- Mining
- Crafting
- Buying and Selling products
- Sacrificing products to appease the spirits
- Paying taxes

![BST3.jpg](///raw/bd4/e/z/1c89d.jpg)

### Additional Notes:

I unfortunately didn't have enough time to implement a title screen / main menu before the submission deadline. I plan on adding one later with further updating of this project, but that's obviously outside the confines of the Compo.

I am aware that you are able to walk past the edge of the grass tiles, so please watch your step. I focused on the mechanics of the game and forgot to bound the level properly. My bad.

Please report any notable bugs so I can fix them in future updates. You can post them here in comments, but a Github issue report would be fantastic if you are able!

## Thanks for checking out my game!

### Post-submission news:
- Fixed some bugs with shrines and shops, updated version available via links below.
- Released a Web (HTML5) version, added link below. (Web version includes bugfixes mentioned above)

entries.title: H E R D
entries.description:
# :sheep: Sacrifice the individual :sheep:
![Schermafbeelding 2018-12-03 om 09.10.08.png](///raw/cb5/z/1cb4b.png)
# :sheep: for the good of the - ***H E R D*** - :sheep: 
------
# :sheep: Desciption :sheep:

Get your :sheep: to the :house: without getting caught by the :wolf:.
To ensure the most :sheep: survive, you might have to sacrifice a few. Remember: the :wolf: is very lazy and will hunt helpless animals before he'll hunt other animals. If you hit one of your :sheep: with 'space', you could create a distraction.

Press 'e' to tell your :sheep: that they need to hurry up. This is a very draining action, so make sure to grab some :apple: along the way.

![Schermafbeelding 2018-12-03 om 09.10.54.png](///raw/cb5/z/1cb4c.png)

------

# :sheep: Tools used :sheep:

The following tools were used to create H E R D:
- Unity (game engine)
- MonoDevelop (IDE)
- Mulab (music)
- Keystation (MIDI hardware)
- Audacity (sound effects)
- Clip Studio Paint Pro (art)
- Wacom tablet (drawing hardware)
- Cheetah 3d (modeling, UV mapping, animating)

------

# :sheep: Process :sheep:

This is how the game was made:
1. I started brainstorming in the morning and came with the idea of sacrificing sheep to a wolf.
2. I developed the game in my head.
3. I started making 3d models, animations and textures.
4. I started programming controls and AI.
5. I made music and sound effects.
6. Even more programming.
7. Made a 3d model for the barn.
8. Tweaked some final variables.
9. Uploaded everything and updated my ld page.
10. Uploaded source code.
12. (Post jam) fixed broken UI proportions (no code added)

------

# :sheep: (Planned) Bug fixes and tweaks :sheep:

- Fixed broken UI proportions

------

# :sheep: Timelapse :sheep:
http://youtu.be/nnTZGNoYbV0

entries.title: God of Fingers (HTML5)
entries.description:
*Sacrifices 42 of Lambs your God desires...*  
*Keep your enemies at bay with frostbite, gale and fire!*  
*Every Spell demands you cut a finger from your hand...*  
*But God is Great, by force of blood regrowth He you will grant!*  

### So what do I do?

To obtain immortality, you must sacrifice 42 lambs to the God of Fingers.
The Lich Empress sends her minions to stop you.
Kill them (again?) with your spells, and recover spells by sacrificing lambs.

##### Spells:

- Fire 1: A single fireball
- Fire 2: Three fireballs
- Ice 1: A piercing shard of ice
- Ice 2: Freezing shards in all directions
- Storm 1: A lightning ball spirals outwards
- Storm 2: A strong wind blows all the lambs towards you.

Note: Some keyboards may not support pressing any three keys at once (such as mine). In that case just change your controls until you get a good combination. For me, ASDF and UHJK worked.

![GoF_goed_crop.png](///raw/1d8/z/1c614.png)

#### Tools
- Godot 3
- GIMP

#### Credits

Sounds for [zombies](https://opengameart.org/content/zombies-sound-pack), [bats](https://opengameart.org/content/mouse-imitation), [fireball](https://opengameart.org/content/spell-4-fire), [ice and lightning](https://opengameart.org/content/ice-electricity-magic), [wind by Lanea Zimmerman](https://opengameart.org/content/breeze), [ending 1](https://opengameart.org/content/11-male-human-paindeath-sounds), [ending 2](https://opengameart.org/content/evil-laugh)

entries.title: Poverty Farmer
entries.description:
You play as a family of four in a third world country. Naturally, your family is too poor to be able to sustain anything long-term. With minimal amounts of money, you will have to make sacrifices on both ends; your farm and your family, in order to survive and thrive. Can you do it? Or will you crumble under the pressure of the Poverty Farm?

Please run in Windowed Mode at a resolution of 1024x768. It'll look the best that way.

A few notes about the game before you start:
- The tiles in the top left are your menu for shops. You can buy plants, tools, or animals.
- The blue and pink cylinders are your family. You can click on them to interact with them. You'll want to, too.
- The top right has a Play button, which will simulate a year passing in the game.

entries.title: Sacrificial Showdown
entries.description:
![main_menu2.png](///raw/771/21/z/1c593.png)

![game1.png](///raw/771/21/z/1c596.png)

![game2.png](///raw/771/21/z/1c598.png)

BACKGROUND:

My solo/compo entry for Ludum Dare 43 ("Sacrifices Must Be Made").

I decided to break away from my usual 2D platformer style and do a rhythm based game, which I haven't done before. I was hoping to implement an online leaderboard for the game, but didn't have enough time (48 hours goes by too quickly). If I have time in the future I may revisit the game and add that in at a later date.  Ultimately I probably won't do another rhythm based game again since I don't feel like it gave me much freedom in the way of game mechanics, but it was still a fun project.

GAMEPLAY:

In the game, goats and people are randomly spawned to the beat of the music, and you have to either bless or sacrifice them based on the orientation of the cross (upright = bless humans/sacrifice goats, upside down = bless goats/sacrifice humans).

Hope you all like it!

CONTROLS:

F - Bless

J - Sacrifice

entries.title: The Spread
entries.description:
# Backstory:
The world is being overrun by some kind of zombie horde and its slowly eating its way through everything! Luckily for us they seem to be very stupid and are following the path of least resistance, flowing through the valleys like water. Once the valleys are full though, they'll come for us!

# Win Conditions:
Fight the horde back to the edges of the map and finish them off

# Lose Conditions:
You lose if your HQ is destroyed.

# Hints:
+ Press F2 in the game to see some help screens

+ Buildings with people inside cannot be destroyed. Your people will continuously repair the building until they are dead.
  You can **sacrifice** some of your population this way, slowing down the horde in the lower regions to buy more time up top.
+ The HQ replenishes metal slowly over time.
+ Buildings require people to operate them. If there are no people within, they are useless!
+ to get more people, cannot your HQ to a city
+ cities can only replenish people if they have a food supply.
+ all military nodes require metal to shoot bullets.

# Issues
Upon release there are some pretty game-breaking issues.
+ fixed camera cannot scroll to the lower-edge of the map.
+ fixed mines producing metals indefinitly
+ added R key to reset the map
+ added Space to center camera on the HQ
- if two or more 'Spread' nodes spawn on a map,  they will fight each other (so I currently limited it to 1 spread per map)
- mortars are still broken :(

![screen_shot_00.png](///raw/49/z/1f28e.png)

![screen_shot_01.png](///raw/49/z/1f28f.png)

entries.title: Santa's List
entries.description:
Resource management/sweatshop game where you have to oversee the production of next years Christmas presents.

* Keep an eye on productivity levels on the monitors (or belt speed) and above each elf, 100% is optimal.
* Punch the elves by clicking them to regain productivity.
* Punching also reduces elf health by 20%.
* Death results in a few seconds of cooldown with 0% productivity, before a new elf spawns.

Sacrifices must be made, but make sure they don't die too often as this hurts you overall productivity.
Reach your goal of 2 Billion presents before Christmas (time runs out).

Have a look at the screenshot below if you want to get familiar with the ui.

Good luck!!

![ld1.png](///raw/2ee/f1/z/1c505.png)
![ld2.png](///raw/2ee/f1/z/1c508.png)
![ld3.png](///raw/2ee/f1/z/1c509.png)

entries.title: Don't Take my Stuff!
entries.description:
Check out the itch.io page at https://oriondark7.itch.io/dtms

Don't Take my Stuff! is a game about a hoarder who needs to clean up his house. But, he needs to move out in just a couple of hours! He needs some help!

Run around the house to collect trash and junk using only trash bags and a cart and to throw them away into dumpsters. Keep an eye on your energy level and mood. Wait a while to part sentimental items, or else your mood will drop significantly! Clean up ALL the junk before the time runs out.

CONTROLS

Arrow Keys - Move Around

Left Click - Pick Up Junk

Right Click (on Dumpster) - Throw away Junk

Switch Tools - Click on the tool you want to use on the right side of the Toolbar under "Tools"

Buy Trash Bags and a Cart - Click on the Green Dollar Sign, that will take you to the shop, you can buy trash bags and a cart, or even upgrade your cart here.

OBJECTS

Boxes and random messes are junk you need to get rid of.

Dumpsters are bright green and have numbers on them indicating

entries.title: Jack of Select Trades
entries.description:
3 Guns:

Regular - can destroy walls or break ropes

Water - can destroy fire enemies

Fire - can destroy water enemies

You can only pick up 2 guns at a time

A and D - move left/right

W - jump

Q - aim gun in left hand

E - aim gun in right hand

Left Click - shoot with aimed gun

Right Click - pick up gun

Right Click while Q or E - replace gun in a had

entries.title: LudumCoin
entries.description:
This game is about Ludum-coin mining: you can build your mining farm.

This is a short clicker game with the needs to sell already buying chips.

Buy new chips, sell less effective ones, stay within limits, reach new teraflops!
But competitors do not sleep and the exchange rate is reduced all the time.

P.S. Chips can be overclocked, but they often break when overheated.

P.P.S. Power supply is limited by your current chip epoch. Reach new epochs and get new power limits.

![LudumCover.png](///raw/8ff/81/z/1c5ba.png)


## Post Compo bugfix:

>"bulkbuying breaks the powersupply limit"

Many thanks to @fnissalot.
Commit ebeebbbea4947b3896cad697373382f0555136a1.

entries.title: Helpless Haggis
entries.description:
![Logo.png](///raw/b0d/c/z/1c459.png)

> Fair fa' your honest, sonsie face,
 
> Great chieftain o the puddin'-race!

A simple puzzle game with Haggis. Issue commands by selecting buttons and clicking on the haggis.

To celebrate St Andrews day (last Friday) I’ve created a game based on the Scottish classic Lemmings.

Meet the Haggis, a non-too-bright creature from the Heeelands o' Scotland. A brave, if foolhardy creature. It needs your help to find its way home.

Can you guide the Haggis through the obstacles to reach safety?

Beware the is much programmer art and no sounds (ran out of time!)


The Haggis is not the most quick-witted creature in the world, but they can *build*, *block*, and *explode*. 
Controls: Keyboard and mouse.

Move Camera: WASD

The aim is to get as many Haggis as possible to the blue-glowing thing. Not all the Haggis will make it, some must be sacrificed that others will survive.

Issue Command: Click relevant button at bottom and the click on target haggis to issue orders!

**Bridges:** Build bridges across chasms.

**Block:** Set a haggis to block the progress of other haggis and reverse their direction.

**Bomb:** Remove certain obstacles (and haggis) by exploding a haggis near them. (works with red obstacles).

**Umbrella:** Doesn't work didn't have time to remove it.

entries.title: The Gifts of Gaios
entries.description:
![Banner.png](///raw/497/d1/z/1c65d.png)

You play as Gaios, the immensely powerful Champion of the Earth. The dark Championess Agona has broken free of her underworld prison and has begun to wreak havoc on your world. You are called upon to defeat her Soulspawn and save the humans. Your abilities are:

Flight (ultra-jumping)
Agility (side-teleport)
Reflex (slowing down time)
Strength (your ability to attack long-range)
Perception (ability to see far distances — the whole screen)

This game is a platformer shoot-em-up game, where you start with these abilities and use them to battle through enemies to reach an outpost of humans. Once you reach them you must **sacrifice** one of your powers to them so that they can escape and join the fight against Agona.

![ss1.gif](///raw/497/d1/z/1d27b.gif)

PATCH (12/4/2018 at 11:15AM CT): Fixed bug that prevented players from getting past the last enemy.

entries.title: Orb Defender
entries.description:
![orb-defender-01.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/1ca36.png)

![orb-defender-02.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/1ca37.png)

![orb-defender-03.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/1ca38.png)

![orb-defender-04.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/1ca39.png)

![orb-defender-05.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/1ca3a.png)

![orb-defender-06.png](///raw/ffc/2/z/1ca3b.png)


**_Orb Defender_** is a tower defense game with a difference: the source of the power you use to defeat the waves of spawned enemies is the very thing you are trying to protect: the Central Orb.

Drag individual orbs from the Central Orb onto a tower to power it up. You can attach multiple orbs to a tower, and doing so will increase the tower's attack strength and range.

You can then move orbs between towers, or indeed move them back to the Central Orb if need be. To move all orbs attached to a tower, left click and drag; to move a single orb, right click and drag.

Do you sacrifice the strength of your tower arsenal, or the power of the Central Orb, in order to survive the longest, defeat the most enemies, and ultimately attain the greatest score? The choice is yours, but one thing is certain: sacrifices must be made!


**_Important note:_** *I struggled to find enough time to dedicate to this project, so the game isn't as complete as I'd have liked it to be. Most notably, there's no audio, despite the fact that I actually did manage to create sprites for the sound button, which I then hid when I realised I wouldn't have time to implement any sounds. On Sunday afternoon, I was in two minds as to whether or not I was actually going to aim to submit, but in the end I wanted to share what I'd managed to create, even if it's not quite everything I'd envisaged!*

entries.title: Server Manager
entries.description:
![ld43screen3.png](///raw/6d2/z/1d771.png)
_Sort of a mashup of Breakout and Space Invaders, with a hint of Missile Command._

- Rotate servers = arrow keys
- Rotate shield1 = A and D
- Rotate shield2 = W and S
- Pause menu = SPACEBAR  _(you might have to tap twice, I think I forgot to initiate a bool somewhere)_

This year I wanted the mechanics to mirror the theme. Given the theme "Sacrifices must be made" I decided to have the player make sacrifices willingly as part of gameplay.

You play as a server admin, manually swapping servers around to process incoming data while protecting them from attacks. When a server crashes it will loose any data it recieves, and if you loose too much data you loose the game. In later levels, if you get overwhelmed, you can reject (block) incoming data, "sacrificing" the data to stay in the game.

_(In hindsight, "sacrifice" is too strong a word, since it's just data. But the thought was there!)_


Originally I wanted to let you pick upgrades after processing certain amounts of data. Due to time restrictions I made levels instead where I gradually introduce each new mechanic. I tried to set spawn rates, win and loss conditions and server arrangements to give you a challenge while learning the new mechanic.

There could be some balancing issues due to lack of playtesting, but I hope you find the game both challenging and fun!


_Made with Unity3D, Gimp and Bfxr._

_Fonts are "Atomic Clock Radio" by PizzaDude.dk and "Nine Pin" by Digital Graphic Labs._

entries.title: Expendabots
entries.description:
![titlecard.png](///raw/5d3/z/1c537.png)

Dungeon crawling is so dangerous, so why do it yourself?  Why not send robots that has no fear of being electrocuted, exploded, or deactivated so long as it means progressing?  With the expendabots, you can throw robot after robot to solve all your problems no matter the cost.

So this is a puzzle platformer involving robots that can deactivate to form blocks and platforms or explode to clear a path.  Sacrifice as many as are needed to progress through each room.

Controls (Keyboard)
-------------------
Left and Right Arrow Keys - Move
Space - Trigger your current robot to explode
Left Control - Deactivate your current robot
R - Reset level
Escape - Quit

Controls (Gamepad)
-------------------
Left and Right on digital pad - Move
X - Trigger your current robot to explode
A - Deactivate your current robot
Y - Reset level
Back button - Quit

You will need DirectX installed to play

Constructive criticism is always appreciated, and as always have fun.

entries.title: Blood Sacrifice
entries.description:
For Ludum Dare 43 I wanted to challenge myself with something I haven't tried before. And that is to make a multiplayer game involving networking.

While the rest of game is somewhat lacking, and it's janky with Unity's matchmaker service sometimes, I have at least learned a lot about the Unity Networking layers and how to utilize them, even if a bit improperly. I already know what I would do differently and plan on using the next few weeks as a chance to exercise refactoring bad code into nice code.

But enough of that, here's my compo entry. You can, of course, run two side by side if no one is able to join you for matchmaking. Also, if you don't seem to enter a match properly, you'll have to close and retry. I have not yet figured out how to have Unity properly dispose of matches other than the normal "wait a few seconds cleanup" that they do, but players can be quicker than that. 

![Capture.PNG](///raw/44c/1/z/1c5ca.png)
![Capture2.PNG](///raw/44c/1/z/1c5cc.png)

Take charge of a group of fruit astronauts that want to reach planet Fruit Loops, where all the other cool fruits live, of course.

Try to reach the highest altitude you can, and collect coins on the way to buy upgrades for your ship and crew!

If you find yourself low on fuel, don't worry! The rocket is powered by organic matter! In other words, fruit juice! Good thing you brought some of your fruit astronauts along huh?

**Controls:**
- Tap/click left and right sides of the screen to move the ship (if using a keyboard, A/D or Left/Right arrow also work)

I made the code, art and music of this game using Unity, Krita and LMMS respectively. I also used SFXR to generate sound effects.

This was my first time doing the Compo, and it was extremely fun (and exhausting). Will participate again in the future :D

entries.title: Typeless
entries.description:
### A visual novel typing game where you must selectively sacrifice your keyboard letters in your quest to pursue your date.



**​WebGL has problems that sometimes the Windows version does not (Might be fixed[?]).  Read Extra Notes for more details.**




![Capture2.PNG](///raw/437/f1/z/1c450.png)

First LD Game Jam!


# Got a date with the Cthulu Dating App
## Who knew it had drawbacks?


**Do you know what she wore for work that day?**


- Use Keyboards keys to type in the choices


- Esc key to Reset the game


- Enter or Return key to Accept


- Backspace key to Decline


- '\' or Backslash key to open your offering screen
 - ~~This is what you use to get your letters back~~


- Tab to toggle your sacrifice list


- Delete to skip the timer





**Extra Notes: You can only fix it by resetting the game or by downloading the game to avoid it completely!**

*This problem may come in the form of locked state in which the game's ending is supposed to trigger. I had to waste 6 hours trying to fix the problem on WebGL side of things whereas the WIN version had no problems whatsoever. I did my best to make the WebGL work but unfortunately I had to 'sacrifice' my time to develop other parts of the game.*

For those looking for the best game experience please download the game from the link below. I had made the WebGL for convenience sake and it was my first time too so it didn't really work out in the end.


Finally, Thank you so much for all the comments, they really made my day!

entries.title: Sacrifices must be made - Ludum Dare 43
entries.description:
![screen_640x512.png](///raw/61e/f/z/1d478.png)
Build a village while making sacrifices to ward off plagues.

Your goal is to generate enough resources to make enough sacrifices to prevent plagues.

The game is very much about sacrificing your population to appease the God. So the primary goal is to get a steady supply of humans to sacrifice, which makes it hard to keep your farms going. But, with such few resources, you will likely have to sacrifice many pigs before you can increase your population.



**About this Entry**

The game play is not well tweaked at the moment (never enough time).

None of the sound is mine, please download to view the sources.

~~I did not make the four clipart images at the top (people, pig head, pile of logs, corn).
~~All other graphics where made by me. Since this is officially a Jam Entry, I guess I can keep working on it...~~

**Edit: R2 released (Dec 3, 2018 4:55PM UTC-500)**

All graphics, for better or for worse, are mine. Sorry about that...
R2 also fixed a couple of bugs which I doubt anyone would have noticed.


**Edit: R3 released (Dec 3, 2018 6:25PM UTC-500)**

Corrected starting resources. I modified them for testing, and then forgot to unmodify them.



**How to play**

I forgot to add how to play the game in game, so it is here instead... :expressionless:

* Click on the little buildings in the center, to place them. Use them to generate resources.

* Farms do not generate resources unless they are managed by someone. Click the plus icon on the buildings to add people to attend them. The icon will then indicate how many people are assigned to the farm.

* Once a building has generated resources, a gold star will appear click it to gather the resources. **Important:** You can only gather as many pigs as you have corn for. So ensure you have enough corn when you click the Star

* Build a Church to make sacrifices, human sacrifices are the best, but enough pigs will suffice.

* Build Hovels to increase your population to sacrifice or tend your farms. **Note:** Your population is hungry, and with each event progression, those without pigs will die.

* Build Tree Farms to produce wood to build more farms, hovels, or church's.

* Build Corn Farms to support your pig production. Fortunately, pigs don't eat once they are "gathered".

* Build Pig Farms to sustain your population and make sacrifices.



**Play on Itch**
https://bobleny.itch.io/sacrifices-ludum-dare-43

entries.title: ShotLight
entries.description:
_You've been here before…_ Flying down an infinite corridor, shooting down aliens, or rogue AIs, or enemy fighter pilots. You know, the usual.

_But now it's black._ Pitch black. And you can only see in the glow of your own bullets.


**Charge your shots to see your surroundings.**

**Fire your shots to take down your enemies,** recovering health and boosting your charge.

**Balance the two to stay alive.**


### Controls:

Hold 🆉 or Ⓐ: Charge Shot

Release 🆉 or Ⓐ: Fire

[←↕→] or 🕹️: Move

![Screen Shot 2018-12-05 at 4.14.16 PM.png](///raw/b65/z/1f253.png)

![Screen Shot 2018-12-05 at 4.14.37 PM.png](///raw/b65/z/1f257.png)

![Screen Shot 2018-12-05 at 4.15.39 PM.png](///raw/b65/z/1f255.png)

entries.title: For The Greater Good
entries.description:
![cover](///content/ff5/1/z/1c55a.png)

**instructions**

* You are the blue side
* You have to defeat the red king
* To defeat the larger red side you'll have to sacrifice your
own men using the blue King's Drain ability. The friendly
unit will die but all the health will be transfered to the blue King,
* This should give him the health to survive the fight!

**more details**

* each formation is made up of a series of 'figures'
* each figure in the formation attacks a figure in the defending side
* figures have health that is damaged by combat
* during combat figures will go one at a time, starting with an attacking figure
* if a figure applies more damage than required to kill another figure, this damage is applied to another figure as a form of 'overkill'
* this is how the king is able to wipe out large units on its own as the overkill damage is spread through the formation
* good luck!

![screen1.png](///raw/ff5/1/z/1c778.png)

![screen2.png](///raw/ff5/1/z/1c781.png)

![screen4.png](///raw/ff5/1/z/1c7c1.png)

entries.title: Il Était Un Petit Navire (There was a little ship)
entries.description:
__Inspiration__

I took my inspiration from a traditional french song : [*Il était un petit navire (There was a little ship)*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Il_%C3%A9tait_un_petit_navire)

In this song, the sailors are running out of food and want to eat one of them to survive.

__The Game__

You play a little ship. You have to survive as many days as possible.

You loose if your sailors get too hungry, too sad if the the ship is in too bad shape, or if there is no one left on the ship.

You can have up to 3 sailors at the same times on your ship. Choose your sailors wisely as each of them is unique...and you will eventualy have to cook some of them, since it's the only way to eat.
You can find new sailors on islands. The little white arrow around the ship points toward the nearest island.

Note that time pauses while you don't move.

![IlEtaitUnPetitBateau_Gameplay4.gif](///raw/e78/9/z/1c605.gif)

__Controls__

Hold *right click* or *space* to move in the direction of your mouse cursor.
Drag&Drop characters with the left click. Drag them on the fire to cook them, or on your ship to add them to your crew (you have to be close enough from the island to be able to drag&drop the sailor).

__Skills__

__*Weight :*__ How much there is to eat on this sailor, the bigger the better.

__*Fun :*__ Being for days on a small ship can be pretty boring, you need a little bit of fun to not turn crazy. If your sailors are too boring, the mood will get worse and worse over time.

__*Woodworking :*__ The ship have to be kept in good shape, make sure some of your sailors know how to do that.

__*Sailing :*__ You can move much faster if yuo bring good sailors on your ship.

__*Appetite :*__ Some sailors eat more than others, be carefull.

entries.title: Sacrifice This Game
entries.description:
This is a platformer game where you need to sacrifice features to make progress.

## Set Up

Unfortunately, the game is a bit cumbersome to install.  You will need to have Python 3 on your computer with both Pyxel and NumPy.  [Click here for instructions on how to install Pyxel](https://github.com/kitao/pyxel/).  NumPy should be in any Python package manager (e.g. pip).

Here's how to install and run the game in a virtual env.  Thanks so much to @thomas-lacroix for that!

```bash
git clone git@github.com:xlambein/ldjam43.git
cd ldjam43
python3 -m venv ./venv
source ./venv/bin/activate
pip3 install pyxel
python3 main.py
```

## How To Play

Start the game with `python main.py`.  Play with the arrow keys.  Tab opens a menu when in-game.  Enter selects an item in menus.

Small advice: if you sacrifice the Rendering, press Tab, Down Arrow, and Enter, to open the menu and restart the level.

For some reason, Pyxel quits the game when you press Esc, so, don't do that :P

(spoiler: there are two "endings" to this game, depending on the choices of sacrifice you made)

entries.title: Winter Summer Land
entries.description:
=== PLAY IN BROWSER ===

https://dizelabs.itch.io/winter-summer-land

=== Yeah! ===



========= About the Game ========

In Winter Summer Land, you fight against invasion of shady foes to save your land. Oh, and you are a snowman. Throwing snowballs. You are the ammo. Have fun!

https://youtu.be/c2kbPivNRIc



========= How To Play ==========

A and D or Arrows for Movement Left and Right

Aim and click left mouse button to fire a snowball

There is also a (skippable) ingame tutorial teaching you how to snowman.

Pressing escape while ingame brings you back to the main menu. Danger: you lose your leveling progress!


![screen6.png](///raw/b94/1/z/1c685.png)

======== Music and Sound Effects ========

If you do not like the music and / or the sound effects, you can turn them off in the Options.


======== Feedback ========

If you have feedback or found a bug, please leave a comment here or on the itch.io page, or tweet me at @dievo.


![Sequenz 01_1.gif](///raw/b94/1/z/1cc58.gif)


======== Versions =======

Windows Versions are available via itch.io.

MacOSX version will be available tomorrow.

Sourcecode is available as Dropbox Download.


======== Bugs =========

There should not be any major bugs left, but if you find one, please let me know.


A Ludum Dare 43 Compo entry. The game was made by Thomas Diehl in 48 hours. If you like it (or don’t) please leave a comment

http://www.dievolution.com

entries.title: Crimson Chaos
entries.description:
WARNING: Please read Tutorial (There is an in game one as well as one on this page)


Crimson Chaos is a wave based brawler where your only weapon is your own blood. Not only do you have to deal with constant pursuit of demons all looking to steal the crimson Chaos, and your life. You also have to keep track of your blood loss due to the immense cost of wielding the crimson Chaos.

![Game.gif](///raw/9e9/3/z/1d028.gif)

Tutorial:
The top left red bar is your blood you use your blood as fuel for the Crimson Chaos. However if your blood runs out you die.

The top right blue bar is your summon meter Hold the left mouse button to summon your blood thirsty Crimson Chaos. But beware if the hell blade is held for to long you are likely to die.

Good Luck, Don't die ;)

![Game2.gif](///raw/9e9/3/z/1d05e.gif)

Tools Used:
Unity - code, UI, and design https://unity3d.com/

Blender - 3D models https://www.blender.org/

Jukedeck - music create your own at http://jukedeck.com

audacity and bfxr - sound effects https://www.audacityteam.org/ and https://www.bfxr.net/

entries.title: Tainted Blade: The Dungeon Escape
entries.description:
![2018-12-03_01-37-57.png](///raw/8c1/8/z/1c1a0.png)
## 📖 Lore
There once was a young wizard who discovered an ancient magic. It was a dark magic. He learned the spells that were supposed to be forgotten.  Blinded by the darkness he did the unthinkable - he sacrificed human lives to fuel his arcane powers. The kingdom captured this wizard and locked him in the deepest dungeon. 

But the wizard couldn't be contained for any longer. *You* cannot be contained. ESCAPE THE DUNGEON!

## 👓 Overview
There are 5 levels. You don't have to beat them in a sequential order, so you can try all of them easily. 

## 📒 RULES
**1. All doors are locked, break them using magic!**

**2. Magic requires charges, which are obtained by slaying enemies with a dagger.**

🎧 Headphones recommended, since you can hear enemies walking around the corner.

Please rate and leave a review. Appreciate it! 

## 🔗 Links
* Itch.io (**Download for Windows**): **https://lawrence-laz.itch.io/tainted-blade-the-dungeon-escape**
* Source: https://github.com/lawrence-laz/LD43

## 🖼️ Moments

You are a woman who is devoted to a dark lord, and you must sacrifice people to gain favour with him. You can then use that favour to cast spells to bring destruction to your (small and unfinished) town.

Had an idea for an actual game but then i thought of something a little more wacky so I went with that.
Was one of the funnest Ludum Dares I've done, even though it (obviously) didn't turn out how I wanted it to. I had some really good ideas and so I want to continue with it after LD, which I know I can do now, because I did it last LD.

entries.title: Can't Get No Sacrifaction
entries.description:
![title.png](///raw/0f4/z/1c4df.png)

I was perhaps a little too ambitious with this one.  I had plans for more enemy types and a more interesting level design, but spent a lot of time implementing the sacrifice system.

I'd forgotten how difficult it was to design 2D games that scaled well and remained pixel perfect, so this version of things is limited to 4:3 (1024x768).  I may work on fixing this in a post-compo release.

If you have problems with the web version, please download the standalone version.

# Tools
- Unity
- Inkscape
- sfxr
- Musagi

# Base Code
- The dialogue system is based on the one I developed for LD42, based on Brackey’s tutorial.  I'll put this into a separate repo for next time...

# Screenshots
![gameplay.png](///raw/0f4/z/1c4e2.png)

![sacrifice.png](///raw/0f4/z/1c4e1.png)

entries.title: Ascend
entries.description:
**There's only one rule : ascend.**

Please note that this is more an interactive journey than a game, a contemplative and abstract experience focused on flow and feel.

![LD43 wp.jpg](///raw/f78/41/z/1c7a6.jpg)

![SC2.jpg](///raw/f78/41/z/1c6fd.jpg)

![SC8.jpg](///raw/f78/41/z/1c717.jpg)

![SC9.jpg](///raw/f78/41/z/1c71a.jpg)

For once, I wanted to use the free improvisation technique, as musicians or painters often do, trying to emphasis how the theme made me felt without rationalizing anything.

After all, jams are the best places to experiment !

Sadly, I only had half of the week-end to work on it, but I did my best. I hope you'll like it ! 

**For this compo, I used :**
 - Unity
 - Magix Music Maker
 - Audacity

[**Listen to the OST on soundcloud.**](https://soundcloud.com/pastagal/ascend).

entries.title: Bird Vs Rat, A Retro Shoot-Em-Up
entries.description:
![screenshot1.PNG](///raw/908/d1/z/1c9e8.png)

This game was made in two days using Unity for Ludem Dare. Fight against a swarm of oncoming rats in this tough retro shoot-em-up!

# ------ FEATURES -------

![ezgif.com-optimize.gif](///raw/908/d1/z/1e863.gif)

### Thrilling Score (Including but not limited to) :

* FLStudio2.wav
* AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAA.wav
* and three_minutes_of_silence.wav (played at title screen)

### Immersive gameplay:
* Click the button to make the character in the game click a button!
* Birds!

### Next-Gen Graphics:
* I had to pixelate them to even let them run on an earth computer!

### More than none levels!

# -----------------------

![ezgif.com-optimize(1).gif](///raw/908/d1/z/1e85c.gif)

# Description 2:

_My ludem dare game is a retro shoot-em-up about the intricate power struggle between the rats and the birds. The expanded universe is sure to come soon. I'm sure that this will hit off, the new Star Wars anyone? Look, all I'm saying is, if you want in on the eventual Rat vs Bird hype train for it's 100 year anniversary in 2118 (which I will be alive for because all the revenue from this game allowed me to create an anti-aging machine and now Jonathan can't take my lunch money anymore because I'll be so powerful, buy your own lunch, jack*ss). Anyways, you'll surely find the 800 hours of thrilling GaymePlay(trademark pending) worth the price tag of 0.001 yes thats right I take one tenth of a cent from the poor every time someone downloads this game HAHAHAHHA. Well, I have school tomorrow, if this game isn't at E3 it's probably because Jonathan bullied me into suicide._

entries.title: King's Last Stand
entries.description:
### Astera Kingdom, home to explosive little creatures who are loyal to their king.

![Shot1.png](///raw/2b7/e1/z/1c4f0.png)

![Shot4.PNG](///raw/2b7/e1/z/1c57b.png)

![Shot2.PNG](///raw/2b7/e1/z/1c4f2.png)

**(Note : This game has no audio)**

## Summary

King of Astera, our resources have been depleted! Our weapons are useless against those invading monsters, but there is still hope! We found that the Astra have strange reactions when getting close to the dark creatures. It's a risky effort, but I'm afraid we've run out of options. This is our last chance to push them back!

Your loyal Astra have entrusted you with their lives to help you save the kingdom. You must work with your loyal Astra and save our home!

King's Last Stand is a game where you take the lead of the Astra creatures to repel the invading creatures. Take advantage of these explosive little cuties to take out groups of enemies and clear each wave till the end!

But how many of these cute Astra must be sacrificed to win this war?

## Tips

A lot of people seem to have trouble beating the game, mainly due to the difficulty of Wave 7!
Here are a few tips to be able to successfully complete it and save the Astera kingdom!
1. Astra self-destruct when contacting the enemy for too long! That means that your Astra will protect you from behind, so make sure to send them flying ahead of you to secure a safe path!
2. Running away and herding them into groups is the most efficient way to use the Astra!
3. There is no way to avoid being damaged in Wave 7 multiple times in the beginning as you are mobbed. Make sure to maintain enough Health Points from previous waves so that you can last through the initial mob!
4. Your enemies are always walking towards you. Your enemies also can't don't spawn near your castle in the south. Use that information to your advantage to group the enemies in the start of each wave in an advantageous spot! It's easier to get surrounded if you stay too close to the castle!

## Updates

12/03/2018
- Fixed the rest time that should happen between each wave.
- Fixed a bug where a few enemies were still visible after winning the game.
- Added Windows, Mac, and Linux Build

## Intro

You are one of the sacrificial victims of an ancient ritual to please an evil god. 
You get thrown in the middle of a volcano, and you have to survive by throwing everybody else under you. 
Only the last man standing will get to go home.

Master a skill-based fast-paced action game by collecting all power-ups and outclassing your enemies.
Bang your head to the sound of kick-ass heavy metal riffs and your opponent's screams of despair.

But be careful! The surface of the arena shrinks with every wave you complete! Don't slip and fall!

- Move with WASD
- Push enemies with Mouse1 (Left Click)
- Dash around the arena with Left Alt / Mouse2 (Right Click)

- Jump with Spacebar
- Mute the Background Music with N (but why would you? It's BANGER)

entries.title: The Final Seconds
entries.description:
For my 14th Ludum Dare, I went for more of a tense take on the theme. You are responsible for defusing all the bombs that rebel forces have planted in your city over the course of a week. You are able to defuse bombs yourself, but you can't get to all the bomb sites in time, so you must send out members of your team. To send them out is to risk their lives, however. And if you don't think they can diffuse the bomb before the timer ticks down to 0, you can choose to sacrifice them. They will immediately stop diffusing the bomb, and attempt to drive it out of the city, resulting in the fewest civilian casualties possible. This will of course sacrifice one of your officers.

Actually managed to get sound for this one! Even if it is just an annoying beep!

I hope you enjoy playing as much as I enjoyed making this one!

entries.title: Village of Sacrifice - LD43
entries.description:
![CoverImage.png](///raw/ae6/d1/z/1c49e.png)

# Village of Sacrifice - LD 43

You are the leader of a small village five thousand years ago.

You have to make sure your villagers have enough wood and food to survive, but you also have to keep your god happy with sacrifices. Human sacrifices.

How many days can your villagers survive?


## How to Play

Only a mouse is needed to play this game.

Click on the green plus to produce new villagers or houses.

Click on the red minus to sacrifice your villagers to the god.

Try to balance your god's happiness and your resources to survive as long as possible.


Statistics are shown at the end of the game. Feel free to share your results. :wink:

## Tools

- Game Engine - Unity 2018
- Code - Microsoft Visual Studio
- 2D Art - AutoDesk SketchBook
- Music - Abundant Music
- Sound Effects - ChipTone
- Music Editing - Audacity

## Credits

Sebastian Uitz (FireTotemGames)

## Changes
03.12.2018 Fixed a bug which prevented the kill time from decreasing -> no infinite play time possible anymore
03.12.2018 Add downloadable files for Android installation (I hope you have a smartphone with 16:9 ratio :D)

## Introduction Scene

![Introduction.PNG](///raw/ae6/d1/z/1c499.png)

## Gameplay Scene

![Gameplay.png](///raw/ae6/d1/z/1c49b.png)

## Game Over Scene

entries.title: Evil Shepherd
entries.description:
The Evil Shepherd is a fast pace strategy game, where your goal is to survive the most you can. Take care of your sheep and drain from their lives to survive.

How to play: 
A, W, S, D - Move the character
Left Click - Show Sheep status / Drain sheep power / Attract sheep

Drag the sheep to the desired location to fulfill their needs.
Hay - Hunger
Water - Thirsty
Salt - Joy

The life regeneration consumes food and water.
The sheep can only reproduce with joy over 50%.
Eating salt increases the thirsty.
Gain experience from killing sheep.

This is my first attempt in a Ludum Dare. I've tried my best in balancing the game and make it fun. I'm sorry if it's not as fun as I intended.

Thank you for playing. 

Make sure to feedback so I can reach your game and rate it too. :)

entries.title: Destination - Mars
entries.description:
My first Ludum Dare submission, not my first attempt though...

![Screenshot_6.png](///raw/5db/e1/z/1c3ac.png)

![Screenshot_7.png](///raw/5db/e1/z/1c3af.png)

![Screenshot_5.png](///raw/5db/e1/z/1c3b2.png)

In space, no one can hear you scream. Had problems with audio and not enough time to find a workaround, so no audio, sorry. 

To summarize the idea, basically you have to sacrifice your first missions to lay a track of abandoned ships that you can scavenge in order to reach Mars. More details:

Input:
* [Esc] - Main menu.
* [W, A, D] - Move.
* [Q] - Abandon Ship.

Goal:
* Reach Mars with a shuttle.

Start:
* Assign starting resources by dragging appropriate handles.
* Do not exceed your ships capacity

Resources:
* Fuel - only used when moving, but runs out fastest.
* Oxygen and food - low but constant usage.

​Scavenging:
* When close enough to a shipwreck - it turns red. 
* You can mouse-click on it and scavenge resources from the abandoned ship. 
* But be careful, hitting it will destroy both the shipwreck and your shuttle.
* Drag appropriate handles to offload the resources from the wreck to your ship.

Minimap:
* Arrow - direction to Mars
* Red beacon - abandoned ship location

![Screenshot_10.png](///raw/5db/e1/z/1c456.png)

EDIT - 04/12/2018
Some clarification about sound:
* Firstly I thought that there was a problem with sound on WebGL which was complimented by a warning message in the console and other people having problems with it. But, at the end I found that my browser tab was muted... 
* Secondly, when I was implementing simple audio ques in the editor, the thrust sound was working fine (that's the terrible placeholder sound you are hearing) but I could not figure out why explosion sounds would not work, neither with PlayOneShot() nor with normal Play(). The sound is not corrupted and would play in some specific cases.

Anyway, because of all of this I left the audio for the end and I only figured out the muted tab mistake minutes before deadline. And vualia, now it's even worse than no sound because it has a terrible thrust placeholder :D 

If you want to play it as it was intended, mute the tab and listen to a Synthwave mix. suggestion: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NXZUpO2t5WM

entries.title: Garden of Frogs
entries.description:
![cover.png](///raw/5ac/1/z/1c4b7.png)

# DOWNLOAD ON ITCH.IO

Made with Godot Engine 3

Follow me on Twitter: [@yafd](https://twitter.com/yafd)


# INSTRUCTIONS

Grow your colony of frogs by allowing them to eat fruits and leaves. Frogs create a clone when they eat.

Pop balloons by clicking them to stop your frogs from overeating. Frogs who don't eat will die. But sometimes, sacrifices must be made.

The tree will stop making fruit if it runs out of leaves.

The game ends if all of your frogs die or your tree runs out of leaves.

Try to make the biggest colony possible and survive the longest!


# NOTES

There's a lot of interaction here re: the growth rate of leaves, berries, and frogs. I haven't done the math so I wouldn't expect it to be super balanced. If you've got suggestions or tips I'd love to hear them!

entries.title: It Must Be Fed
entries.description:
![stabbing.gif](///raw/0d1/z/1c512.gif)

## Summary

In "It Must Be Fed" you play as an executioner tasked with sacrificing people to the god named ******. You must sacrifice one person per day. The story takes place through short dialogue snippets provided by the people being sacrificed, the executioner's family, and various members of the cult of ******.

![march.PNG](///raw/0d1/z/1c5fb.png)

## Controls

There is a tutorial in the game for keyboard controls. You can also use a gamepad. Here are the controls for an xbox controller:

space = a button

q/e = l1/r1

r = x button

WASD = left analog stick

![convo.PNG](///raw/0d1/z/1c828.png)

## Inspiration

When I saw the theme, I knew I wanted to make something about ethical choices involving the weighing of lives. In particular, I wanted to make a game that presented the player with a choice between the lives of strangers and the lives of their loved ones. Ultimately, the strangers are going to die, there is nothing the player can do about that. So, is it morally permissible for the executioner to kill the strangers, given that not doing so will result in the deaths of his family?

I intend to use the game when I teach students about theories of consequentialism next semester.

# Plug

If you're interested in philosophy in video games, check out the Philosophy Game Jam I'm hosting in January. https://itch.io/jam/philosophy-game-jam

![home.PNG](///raw/0d1/z/1c82d.png)

entries.title: Temple of the Blood God
entries.description:
A puzzle platformer.

Deep in some unexplored forest, a trio of adventurers discover an abandoned temple, supposedly once home to the blood god. No sooner than they enter are they forced in a series of puzzles and challenges, where dying is not only a hazard, but necessary to progress. Precisely what will they discover at the bottom?

Use WASD to move (all three move in sync), and standing on pressure plates will oftentimes trigger moving platforms or traps. Furthermore, the blood that comes out of your body upon your death can be used to hold plates down as well. Use the mouse on the main menu, ESC to exit to the menu, and R to restart from the last checkpoint. No save files.

Overall, I'm extremely pleased with the results of my first Ludum Dare. Have fun.

![9 progress.JPG](///raw/355/d1/z/1c4be.jpg)

entries.title: Fuite / Escape
entries.description:
# Fuite

A game where you have to escape... but will everybody make it? :rocket: 

**Controls**:
- LMB and RMB on hums to control them.
- R to restart the current level.

### Post-LD update
There is [a post-LD update](https://github.com/totorigolo/fuite-rs/releases/tag/0.2.0) available which tries to address all your comments :slight_smile: Here are the changes:
- Level 2, the comment is now: "LMB, RMB or R to restart".
- New level that showcases how to make a useful sacrifice.
- The last level is now more difficult.
- New game over message.
- Some other small improvements/tweaks to levels.
- For touchpad users, you can use Space+Click for right click. Post an Issue if you have a better idea! :grin: 
- Hide logs.

---

![nice-and-easy.png](///raw/251/f1/z/1c4b6.png)

---

![hard-core.png](///raw/251/f1/z/1c440.png)

---


*This is my first Ludum Dare, I started pretty late and I used a new library + a fairly new language... I tried my best, it's pretty playable but way too short.*

There were quite a few things I didn't know how to implement, so I decided to keep everything pretty simple in the end: no eyes, no borders, no jumping (only falling), no rocket explosion, no sleepy state,... But the result is still pretty close to what I had imagined, so I'm happy :slight_smile: 

---

Have fun!! :tada: 

Thomas Lacroix / totorigolo

entries.title: Quest for the West
entries.description:
![itch.png](///raw/9ed/11/z/1c49d.png)

## Howdy Partner'

Quest for the west is a unique fictional narrative adventure!
Travel across the countryside encountering tales of adventure, excitement and frogs.
During your travels you will decide your route using the mouse and clicking the circular points of interest along the map
Once engaged in an encounter enjoy the story and decide how it will progress
each decision has a pool of resolutions, each event is part of a larger generated list that is aggregated at run time
It (shouldn't ever) be the same game twice!  
There is 3,790 words of short fiction in the compo build

Quest for the West is my 5th ludum dare entry and second compo. It is open source and available for viewing here: https://github.com/TigerJ/LudumDare-43

if you run into any typo's or bugs please post them in the comments. Most of the game was developed on twitch, I stream regularly and would love to have some company. Give me a follow here: https://www.twitch.tv/tiger_j I giveaway development resources regularly and I would love to stream your jam game.

There will be a detailed post mortem soon about all the tools and how the game was made. If you have any specific questions please give me a comment and I will answer you promptly.

entries.title: Slime Dungeon
entries.description:
With some last minute complications with the tags... I have finished my first LUDUM DARE!

The game is on the short side, but there is a nice small adventure. At the start my idea was that you were a slime that would have to squeeze through passages smaller than yourself by shedding slime, or sacrificing it. Eventually that turned into putting your slime into pits to get across.

I know that this game is not fool proof, but it's short enough that exiting and restarting will not give you too much of a setback.

My favorite part of this jam would have been figuring out how to select a custom color via player input. I was probably a lot happier than I should have been, but I was determined to get my cyan slime and it was a satisfying conclusion!

My biggest regret is how much I slept, as I think I could have finished a lot more if I shaved 4-5 hours off my slumber. Though it may be the other way around if I did take the cut haha.

I look forward to checking out what everyone else has created!


Side note:
I had some troubles uploading to GitHub. I believe everything is there, but if anything is missing, I can see if I can get it uploaded, or I can dropbox the project if necessary. 

Known bug: if a single horizontal direction is held going through a door, occasionally the player will become unaligned with the regular path. This doens't break the game but it will stop progress.

entries.title: Orion Force
entries.description:
![orion force ss1.png](///raw/ec5/8/z/1c398.png)

Big Space Fleet Battles!  Devastating Ultimate Weapons!  Explosions!
Oversee your fleet as they fight off the invaders.  Guide them to take down targets, and choose when to sacrifice your ships to unleash the ultimate attack.  See how many waves of the ever increasing alien forces you can survive!

![orion force gameplay.gif](///raw/ec5/8/z/1c3b4.gif)

![orion force ss2.png](///raw/ec5/8/z/1c3b7.png)

![orion force ss3.png](///raw/ec5/8/z/1c3b8.png)

Ships fight automatically following their AI.

Click an enemy to mark it as a focus for a few seconds.  Your ships will try to switch to that as their target.

Click one of your ships to overload its power core and unleash an attack that destroys anything, sacrificing it in the process.

All surviving ships will join in the next wave along with reinforcements.  The more you save earlier, the more you'll have for when things get really tough!

Your ships are weaker in general than the alien ships, and they begin to outnumber you quickly.  Cunning use of the ultimate attacks can help you cut your losses.  Be sure to make use of a ship that is doomed before it gets destroyed.


This game was made in GameMaker 2, with Aseprite for all graphics and sfxr for all sound effects.

entries.title: Death and Taxes (you can't escape)
entries.description:
![Title.jpg](///raw/887/2/z/1c1ae.jpg)

## Death and Taxes (you can't escape)
The game was written using Gamemaker Studio 2. The music was made with Ableton Live. Sound effects were made with Audacity and sfxr. Drawings were done in paint.net and in the Gamemaker sprite editor.

## Instructions
Collect coins and other treasure. Avoid or kill zombies as you search for meaning, and coins.

**A:arrow_left:,S:arrow_down:,D:arrow_right:,Space:arrow_up:** to move around. **Mouse:mouse_three_button:** to aim and shoot :gun: if so equipped. Press **R** to restart the game and **Escape** to quit.

Once you finish the game, exactly what sacrifices were made?


Minor bugs might be fixed later, or they might not. Don't forget to press R if you for some reason get stuck in a death-loop in a poisonouos bog.

---

entries.title: Cafe of the Gods
entries.description:
![8ba3864fef9ef7f6a42ca8db83d3b187.png](///raw/345/1/z/1c6e8.png)
![2f2983a43c3652d9687ee906c722e97e.png](///raw/345/1/z/1be93.png)

You are the proprietor of a cafe that exclusively serves Gods. As they come in to order their meals, **sacrifice** animals to fulfill their meals. Beware, if the cafe fills up, they will not be happy!

**Gameplay:**

As the clock in the top right ticks over, more customers will enter the cafe. Here's how the game works:

1. Look at customer's order. **Each order needs to be fulfilled in order, from right to left.**
2. Take the ingredient from the bottom row and place it in the bonfire.
3. After it cooks, give it to the customer
4. If the clock ticks over but there are no seats left, you lose!

**Controls:**

Everything is done via mouse, except that you can press ESC to end the game early.

**Build Info:**

Currently there is only a Windows x64 build available. Anything else and you'll have to build it yourself. I will likely release a Linux x64 build at some point as well.

entries.title: Sacrifice - The Card Game
entries.description:
This is a custom card game I created for the Jam. Didn't check if similar card games exist, please let me know if you know any :smile:

# How to play
When it's your turn you can either **sacrifice** a card or **draw** one.  
You get 2 extra cards from the deck in exchange for your sacrifice.  
Both you and your opponent can only sacrifice one card per round, each.  
The player with the strongest card drawn wins the round.  
The winner gets all points from the sacrifice pile and both challenging cards.  
The game ends when there's no card left, the player with the highest score wins.

# Development
Made with Unity.  
Custom card faces by LoveTheLife (Moon, Sun, Star, Death, Strength, World, Magician).  
Other card faces were taken off the internet.  
Materials are from an Asset Store pack.  
3D models made with ProBuilder from within Unity.  
UI font is from an unknown source even to me. Seems like a rip-off the Overwatch font so...

entries.title: Cold Galaxy
entries.description:
When you were nine, your parents died at the hands of slavers.
You were fourteen when you killed a man in self defense.
At  eighteen, you led your crewmates in a mutiny and took command of a pirate vessel.

Life has taught you well:
This galaxy is not your friend.
Others must die for you to survive.
Sacrifices must be made.

Inspired by FTL. Lead your crew to certain doom and destruction while trying to avoid a mutiny. As you explore, your crew will level up and gain traits -- some good, some bad. Earn money, upgrade your crew capacity, and fight off psychic raiders as you navigate through a cold galaxy.

Didn't have time for audio/music unfortunately. Recommended listening: your favorite ambient space mix!

Fonts used: 
- Airborne by Charles Casimiro Design: https://www.fontspace.com/charles-casimiro-design/airborne
- HK Grotesk by Hanken Design Co: https://hanken.co/product/hk-grotesk/

Windows Download only
