entries.title: King Combat
entries.description:
![king_combat.png](///raw/7ad/z/1c401.png)

You lead a tribe of warriors. Gather troops to outnumber the enemy factions, or go completely rogue and flank. 

Sacrifices must be made: When given the upper hand, will you **slay** or **save**? [Choose wisely to win...!](
https://king-combat-ld43.herokuapp.com/)

Save means you convert the enemy faction into your team, whereas slay means you kill the faction leader, gaining more power through morale. 

Can you infiltrate the enemy base? What strategy will you take? 

Easy to learn, but difficult to master.

* **Game Engine:** Godot 3.0.6
* **Audio:** Audacity and hand-designed MIDI
* **Graphics:** Procedural, except crown

entries.title: Sacrifice cycle
entries.description:
A game where you sacrifice your peers in order to reach the goal by using their remains.

Controlls are non-intuitive.

Use Q,W,E,R,T to summon a peer and launch it by holding space (or left mouse button) and then releasing it. you can sacrifice the peer in motion by pressing the space bar again (or right mouse button) and then summon another peer. You can reset each level by pressing 'p' and zoom in/out by pressing 'm'.

Several buggs are expected to show up, as I am somewhat inexperienced with the physics system of Unity...

Tell me what you think and thank you for playing my game!

entries.title: Lava King
entries.description:
## The Windows download has sound and play best.  The WEBGL does not have sound and I think it is a bug in the newest version of Unity.
​
Controls:
- A & D keys for Move
- O key for Attack
- P key for Jump​

It is that time of the week ... SACRIFICE time. The Obojo tribe has their offering all together but they have learned from the past.

Just because you throw the offering into the volcano doesn't mean it gets to the lava. 

As the KING of the tribe, you must ensure the offering makes it to the lava. If the LAVA does not get its offering, it begins to rise up, ready to explode. Make sure to get the offering into the lava before it is too late.

You can not touch the offering without getting hurt by their spikes, so use your broom to hit them into slumber (retracting their spikes) then push them into the lava before they wake up. [They get exhausted when fighting you]

Source Code: https://github.com/JElbourne/LudumDare43

entries.title: Sunset Empire
entries.description:
![Cover](///content/eb7/z/1c640.png)
## Description

Assume the leadership of one of the Aztec city-states. Fight with the your neighbours
to prove your dominance and create prosperity for your state by pleasing the gods
with ritualistic sacrifices. But beware the arrival of a technologically advanced foe!

### Game Concepts
***Worker Management***
 - Manage what your people are doing
 - Ensure that there is enough food so that your state might grow
 - Observe that outfitting a warrior requires both food and gold

***Spiritual Powers***
 - Please the gods with human sacrifices (preferably prisoners)
 - Ask the gods to bless your state or curse your foes

***Combat***
 - Your warriors will defend your state agains attackers
 - Click on an enemy state to send your army to raid it for gold and prisoners


## Development
***Used Tools***
 - Unity 2018.2
 - Visual Studio
 - Paint.net
 - Gimp
 - Inkscape

***Bugfixes***
- Fixed time not unpausing when restarting

entries.title: What could go wrong..
entries.description:
..if we try and summon death?

Well, for one he is quite annoyed of being repeatedly summoned for assinine reasons.

This is my, albeit small & simple, submission for LD43!
I took it a bit more relaxed this time, went with unity and didn't push myself to work on it every second of the weekend.
All in all this is a glorified sheep hearding simulator, with horribly stupid sheep (totally not the fault of me for not making the AI good enough, nope, they're dumb. It's a feature!)

You get points for scaring all the humans into the volcano, and doing so quickly.

It will explode and spread the joy of death among other Bloops. Striking sick Bloops will provide healing Combos and will give the player additional Bloops and score multipliers! Good luck!

entries.title: Blood Adventure
entries.description:

![Godot_v3.0.6-stable_win64_86A5svslJL.png](///raw/ad0/b1/z/1c3d7.png)

Ignore the error console, I ran into some last minute issues.

**What to do**

Evil blood sucking monsters have invaded the planet, you went to their lair to end them.

Use your own life essence to destroy them, but don't get crazy, you may end up like them.

Complete the 10 levels to beat the game.

**Controls**

(Also explained in the first level of the game)

**Hold left click**: Shoot

**A/Left**: Move left

**D/Right**: Move right

**Space/W/Up**: Jump

**Right Click**: Dash

**R**: Die (If you somehow get stuck, use this)


**Developer notes**

I was pretty lazy making this and almost ran out of time. The movement didn't work out too well, I should have done more precise movement instead of the slippery-ground-feeling thing that came out. I also didn't have time to make an actual sprite for the main character (lol), music, and all the sound effects I wanted.

Didn't include sounds because I ran out of time and energy.
Started late because of earlier commitments.

entries.title: Tank Gauntlet: Control vs Power
entries.description:
![LD43-00007.gif](///raw/c4a/z/1c396.gif)

Fight off the red tanks with your own tank through the gauntlet for as long as possible, either by firing its cannon or piercing the metal with a giant knife. The red tanks can vary in strength, but for you it's two strikes and your out. You might find your tank isn't strong enough, so what you can do is sacrifice your tank's controls (weapons or movement) for a speed or attack boost.

![LD43-00006.gif](///raw/c4a/z/1c371.gif)

In the main mode, you need to survive five levels including a boss. Destroying 20 tanks will progress you to the next level. In endless mode, there is no boss, so you go on until you are destroyed.

**Controls** (Keyboard or Gamepad):
```
                        | Keyboard              | Gamepad	
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Run                     | A & D / Left & Right  | Left Stick / D-Pad	
Jump                    | W / Up                | Left Stick Up / D-Pad Up
Jump Down               | S / Down              | Left Stick Down / D-Pad Down
Gun                     | Z                     | X
Knife                   | X                     | A
Jump                    | C                     | B
Reset Level             | R                     | A
Start/Set Functions     | Return                | Start
Back to Title Menu      | Space                 | Back

```

**Credits**:

All Developed by Gamepopper. Programmed in C++ using SFML and my own engine, Vigilante. Graphics done with Piskell and Photoshop. Music created in cgMusic with additional editing in LMMS. Sound effects were generated in BFXR and mixed in Audacity.

Minor Update:
* The control options will now remain the same when you retry from the game, previously it would reset to all controls enabled.
* Linux build is added, but because it was built and tested through a VM it needs testing on proper hardware.

entries.title: El Juan's Takedown
entries.description:
** The inputs may not feel as accurate when the AI units replay your moves however this should not hinder your game play experience.. **

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

## General Information 

Your S.W.A.T team has breached through the main entrance of the El Juan Enterprise, the El Juan Enterprise is the biggest Cocaine Dealing Service in Mexico. They have made upwards of $500 million dollars in sales by selling their goods to their neighboring nation, USA. This has been going on too long, the USA have sent armed forces (70 units to be precise) to take down this enterprise. Today everything will come to an end.

![ShotGun.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/1cc7b.png)

## What is the main mechanic?

Replication of self. So you first start off as a one man army against the entire opposing enterprise, however whenever you die, something awesome happens. A new character will spawn, and he will do all the exact same actions you did before you died. Now you have an ally, and you can also control a new player. Now you can keep going in this cycle, building up an army till you can take down the El Juan Enterprise.

## How does this link to the theme?

This is related to the theme as you have to die (sacrifice yourself) in order to progress the game forward, sometimes the only option is to die in order to move forward... However you have to be careful, as you can only die a maximum amount of times.

![AllArmy.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/1cc7c.png)

## How to play?

All you have to do is use WASD to move, and point and click to shoot and everytime you die, a selection menu will open up, choose the Unit of your choice (if you have enough points to buy it), then continue playing and watch as the army expands! :O

## IMPORTANT :
If at any point, you need to die on purpose to move the game forward, there is a red button in the bottom left corner, if you hit that you will suicide and you can continue to select a new unit.

## Game Features :

Input Recording
Beautiful Environment & Models
Smooth and Optimized Gameplay
To see how we made this game, check out the time lapse that will come out on my channel very soon [https://www.youtube.com/user/batchprogrammer108] *

![Again.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/1cc80.png)

## Developers :

** Ajay Venkat **

16 years old, Lead Developer, Scene Management, Level Design & Project Manager -> Twitter and Website : ]
YouTube : [https://www.youtube.com/user/batchprogrammer108]
Advanced and Beginner Unity Tutorials!!

Twitter : @CodeWithAjay
Website : [www.codewithajay.com]



## Tools

Unity
Blender
FL Studio
Paint.Net + Photoshop
Visual Studio

![FirstLvl.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/1cc82.png)

## Please Remember :

Please leave feedback on what we can improve with the game
Please inform us if you spot any bugs
Leave a link to your game and we will check it out
:)

## Expected Improvements :

Larger Range of Enemies and Units to choose from
More accurate input calculations
More optimised code
More VFX
Addition of background music
More levels

![EstatePhoto.PNG](///raw/43f/8/z/1cc83.png)

Creating this game was so much fun and I would be very grateful if you checked it out :) Have a nice day.

## We fully play and rate all games that play our game :) Enjoy the rest of your day.

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

** The inputs may not feel as accurate when the AI units replay your moves however this should not hinder your game play experience.. **

______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

entries.title: No Robots Survives
entries.description: This game is about helping a group of robots find their friends, you'll have to pass 3 different challenges, they can't be overcome by just one robot so you'll have to use the robots that died previously.

entries.title: Evolve
entries.description:
**NOTE:** I have fixed the bugs people have mentioned. So hopefully it runs smoothly now. I have also added a skip tutorial button so you don't have to run it each and every time you start the game. The sacrifice button won't work if there are anymore than 2 cubes in the sacrifice area. 

This is my first ever ludum dare. I definitley overscoped and didn't touch on hardly anything I originally planned. Happy to get out a working game though.

The game will take ages if you don't sacrifice your evolved cubes/animals. The more evolved they are the more they are worth! Some colours are also worth much more than others.

You can select a cube by left clicking or clicking and draging to select more than one. You can also hold shift while clicking to select more than 1 cube at a time. To move a cube/cubes while selected click the right mouse button. 

Starting off with simple blue cubes, can you evolve it into 8 different species?
![MainScreen.png](///raw/61f/c1/z/1cc4f.png)

NOTE (Change Log): I have fixed the bug where 2 cubes being squished before the tutorial says so bugs out the game. The altar will not work in the initial press unless only 1 cube is on it. Also a minor fix with some of the cubes not evolving to the correct coloured animal.

There has been quite a few bugs with my horribly created tutorial! haha I will definitely be testing a lot more then next time I do something similar! I have added a check button at the top left of the screen just in case the tutorial bugs out. That way you can still at least continue the game.

I have rescaled the points system. Big thanks to @evogengames for pointing out if you added all the cost to evolve there really wasn't much benefit to sacrificing the more evolved animals. It's much more of a benefit now to squish those beautiful creatures :smile: 

Thanks for heads up :smile: I have updated the sourcecode as well so the change can be seen in Bitbucket.

**SPOILER (how to get all the different colours):**
- The easiest way to get all the colours is to mix every colour with blue.
- 2 blues make yellow.
- 1 blue 1 yellow make green.
- 1 blue 1 green makes purple.
- etc.

There are many other different ways to make all the colours as well if you prefer to try and figure them out :smile:

entries.title: Necromancer
entries.description:
How to play:
- use the basic attack to turn the attacking hero's into undead servants
- these undead servants can act as distractions or as shields for your protection.
- once enough undead servants have been made you can sacrifice them to cast more powerful magic
- 5 Souls, heal 25 points of damage
- 10 Souls, increase the damage done by basic attack
- 20 Souls, lightning Bolt Area of Effect

Brief Post-Mortem(ish):

I've been following LD for some time but have never competed before this event. Overall i wish i could have gotten more done, like a greater variety of enemies and adding in sound effects, but had to abandon these in order to submit before the deadline.

I got too stressed out about aesthetic and artwork, which are not my strong suit, and the amount of time spent coding suffered because of this. lesson learned for next time. Overall my first LD experience was enjoyable and i hope to participate again, learn from my mistakes, and hopefully do better.

Hopefully if anyone plays this they'll get some enjoyment out of it.

Thanks.

Controls:
- W,A,S,D: move around
- Arrow Keys: Directional Shooting
- 1: Sacrifice minions for health
- 2: Sacrifice minions for extra damage
- 3: Sacrifice minions for lightning area of effect attack

Tools Used:
- GameEngine: Unity3D version 2018.2.17f1
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017
- Graphics: GIMP 2.8.18

Change Log:
- 20:30 03/12 fixed issue where enemies would not change target once target died and another where enemies would spawned in unable to attack.

entries.title: Appease The Gods
entries.description:
Manage an early civilization and ensure their survival for as long as possible. Sacrifices must be made to appease the Gods and gain from their blessing or you might feel their wrath.

This game was made in about 24 hours in GameMaker. Other tools include Gimp, Audacity, WolframTones.

Controls:
- Drag cards to slots.
- More detailed tutorial page in game.

Some tips that are not explained in game:
- Kids age 4-10 will be taught if there is a teacher.
- Villagers over the age of 25 start losing their ability to work.
- Villagers over 30 start losing their health.

Tested on Chrome, Opera, Firefox;
Firefox sound was only in left ear!

![chrome_2018-12-02_17-48-27.png](///raw/b27/2/z/1da72.png)

entries.title: The Cure
entries.description:
![s1.png](///raw/7a7/d/z/1c370.png)
![s2.png](///raw/7a7/d/z/1c375.png)
![s3.png](///raw/7a7/d/z/1c377.png)
![s4.png](///raw/7a7/d/z/1c37a.png)
![s5.png](///raw/7a7/d/z/1c37b.png)
![ezgif.com-video-to-gif (1).gif](///raw/7a7/d/z/1c405.gif)

--------------------------------------------------------THE CURE--------------------------------------------------------

The cure is a puzzle-sorting game where you have to create a cure for a disease. Sacrifice test subjects to find traits that kill the disease. You then use these traits to create a cure and save people from dying. 

Each level contains "Rooms" each room has a number of traits. If a test subject can survive in a room, then one of the traits of the room killed of the disease. Using the process of elimination, you must find the trait which killed the disease. Use this trait to then create a cure.

Eventually the disease will gain more resistance to the cure and you must find ways of creating a more potent one. Using multiple traits in each cure is a requirement later on in the game.

Keep the world's population alive and make sure you don't kill too many test subjects...

Thanks for playing my second Ludum Dare game!

entries.title: 101 Ways to Die in Alpha Complex
entries.description:
![ac_ss001.gif](///raw/c1/z/1c2d4.gif)

Hello Citizens! This is The Computer. Welcome to Alpha Complex. Your home since 5,312 lifetimes ago. If you are experiencing memory loss that is just a side effect of the cloning process.

![banner03.png](///raw/c1/z/1f881.png)

### Instructions
Help your friend The Computer as he tries to keep Alpha Complex running smoothly. Use **Arrow Keys** to move, **Spacebar** to interact, and **0-9** to select equipment.

entries.title: The Cave of Doom
entries.description: The Cave of Doom is a procedurally generated puzzle platformer. You choose the obstacles in each level, and once there are too many you have to die in strategic places so that you can use your corpse as a platform next time. Even though you have infinite lives, you will soon clog up small passageways and be forced to restart.

entries.title: Life in the Trenches
entries.description:
# Welcome to Life in the trenches.
The goal of the game is to keep a balance between your stats
of your unit stationed in the trenches on the west front of
the First World War(ammo, energy, hunger and morale).

The challenge would be to take difficult decisions under pressure. Good luck, and have a honorable death!


## The controls are:
* Space: Shoot
* Up, Down, Enter: Select a solution to appearing problems

Good luck!

I can't believe I finished(ish) this game in such a short time while I was learning lua and Love2d(first time writing code in Love2d or lua) and also finally learning to do some audio(not so great but i'm proud)

## Tools:
* language - lua
* Framework - Love2d
* Graphics - Piskel
* Audio - Bosca Ceoil

## Disclaimer:
* There is a possible bug regarding the questions not to appear. If you got that please notice me, i still don't know why it happens. It only happened to 2 guys at work. (it may be related to some timers being dependent on frame rates, i'll investigate and try to do a build with this fixed).
* There are many spelling mistakes. Sorry for that.

entries.title: ICATUS and the Golden Ball of Yarn
entries.description:
Icatus is a homeless cat who wishes to catch the golden ball of yarn in the sky.
For his holy mission to catch the sun, he has to sacrifice a lot of birds to make wings.
Will he succeed?

2D Jumper platformer.

Construct 3
Photoshop(Piskel) for graphics
Adobe Audition/Premiere for music

This is my first time doing the compo! I am an artist and have always had programmers in my team to do the coding part. I am quite happy how much I was able to push myself to do. So the idea was to make something mechanically really simple, learning from tutorials and try to make it better with art. :) I hope you enjoy.

entries.title: Sacrificial Shot
entries.description:
Your ammo is your health. There are two weapon types, an assault rifle and a shotgun.

WASD or the arrow keys to move.
Space bar to switch weapons.

entries.title: Whatever It Takes
entries.description:
# Synopsis 

You have made a deal with an eldritch god and must meet his demands if you want to live. He requires you to make sacrifices at a local temple to sate his craving. If you don't, then you will die. You must gather your cult and convince them that everything is ok while trying to kill of as many people as possible.

# Gameplay
A strategy sim game

Control the activity's that your people participate in
* Manage resources 
* Last as long as possible
* Purchase Upgrades
* Get Rich
* Die

![Main.PNG](///raw/edb/31/z/1c348.png)
![Capture3.PNG](///raw/edb/31/z/1c347.png)

# How to Play
(If you need additional help, such as what individual buttons and buildings do, there is a in game help button)

* Your goal is to last as long as possible by supplying your people food and supplying your god people.
* You can move people to different buildings by selecting the up arrow on the corresponding building.
* Once a command has been issued, it cant be taken back. So be careful not to wait time in a day
* Each day is 30 seconds, people take their actions if they are in a building by the end of the day, if they are outside a building, their action is wasted.
* The game ends if you god gets too mad or your people have starved.


This is my first game for Ludam Dare and first game in general (outside of tutorials). Hopefully I did ok for my first attempt! The source code is available for download directly from my itch.io game page, just scroll to the bottom where the download link is.

Bug Fix #1: Fixed end screen scoring for when you displeased god from always displaying 0

entries.title: Occupational Hazard (HTML)
entries.description:
You are a secret service agent. A true professional who will do what is necessary to ensure that your leader is safe. No matter the cost and no matter the sacrifice, you will keep him safe. 

Ensure the VIP is not hit by any projectiles by blocking it with an agent and make sure bombs don't detonate near him! 

![ld43.gif](///raw/b6c/1/z/1ef5b.gif)

[12/04/18 - 9:57pm: Some were reporting that they could not move after the first agent died, which prevented them from playing further. This has now been fixed. Thank you for the feedback!

# Controls and tips:

## We recommend using the arrow buttons with your right hand for movement, while the left hand controls the other commands. Also, use "F" and "G" in order to quickly group up inactive agents towards the selected agent or VIP.

## ***[1, 2, 3]*** - Press 1,2,3 to swap between agent 1, 2, and 3 respectively. (Not working on numpad)

***F*** - Group up inactive agents onto the selected agent

***G*** - Group up inactive agents onto the VIP

***Left-shift*** - Run

***Spacebar*** - Pick up or drop bombs

Legav: Programmer

MyAlias: Programmer

entries.title: Can't Save Them All...

You have lived among humans for decades. But the ancient evil strikes once more. You take out your weapon. A Bloodthirsty Scythe. Will You save the people? Or slaughter them all...?

2D game, where you have to protect people from monsters. Yet, since You are a vampire, you need human blood to use Your full potential. How many will you sacrifice?

Use WSAD to move, and LMB to attack.

entries.title: My best friend

# My Best Friend

A short platformer with your best friend. Take care of him please.

Stack and sacrifice penguins to escape a killer whale in this endless runner


made by: Douglas Winegarden

entries.title: Blurry Fast
entries.description:

entries.title: Coinman
entries.description:
![Capture2.PNG](///raw/2c7/c/z/1c2b3.png)

💰 Overview 💰

The universe is in great danger! The evil Morpher will destroy the world if not stopped in time. In dire times like these, there is only one man the world can depend on. Coinman! Coinman has the "power" to have his health linked to the amount of money he has. Coinman must use well placed coins to distract enemies, light the path ahead, and defeat his foes. It may seem counter-productive for Coinman to be killing himself only to gain a ranged weapon, but sacrifices must be made.

💎 Playing The Game 💎

In Coinman, you can explore the dungeons that the Morpher is rumored to reside in. Along the way, you will fight 7 different types of enemies. In order to fight these enemies, you must use your sword and coins. The sword is a melee weapon, while the coins function as a ranged weapon. Don't be too hasty in using your coins though, because your wealth and your health are one and the same. In each room there is a chest which will spew healing coins when it is opened, however it won't budge until defeat all the enemies in its room. As you explore, the enemies will get harder, a sure sign you are getting closer to the Morpher.


🎮 Controls 🎮

WSAD - Movement

Left Click - Swing Sword/Navigate Menus

Right Click - Throw Coin

Mouse - Aim

F - Toggle fullscreen

PROTIP - Chests will only open after you have defeated all of the enemies in their room.

PROTIP 2 - Instead of hitting enemies with your coins, try missing! Enemies might go out of their way to get a coin instead of you.

📷 Screenshots 📷

# Four Deities
## About
This is a game about two gods and two goddesses watching over a village of people. The people will try to build up their village as best as they can, by planting crops, herding sheep, and building houses.
However, the gods are very needy and demand sacrifices regularly.
You are the one in charge to choose what to sacrifice. Learn the tastes of each deity to please them as much as possible.

## How to win
Play until the village has 15 inhabitants!

## How to play

entries.title: Rituals and stuff
entries.description:
Controls:  
 * WASD for movement
 * LMB for picking items up and opening doors
 * RMB for casting rituals

To cast a ritual, you have to select the correct item from your inventory

This is my first ever failed LD entry. I figured I'll still upload it, because why not.
Once you get into the mansion, there is nothing left to do.    

I usually make my games in Unity but as a challenge I decided to do use Godot this time instead. As it turns out, that meant spending most of my time reading the documentation and working on the smallest of details. Godot has some pretty cool features that don't come with Unity.  
Some things I really like about Godot are the built in 2D lighting system and Godot's shader language (It's properly documented unlike in Unity).  
But what I found difficult was keeping the scenes tidy and making different nodes communicate in a nice way. A lot of it is just because I'm used to doing everything the Unity way.    

So here are things that actually work and I think are half-decent:  
 * Glyph animations  
 * UI looks pretty OK  
 * a lot more sprites than usual  
 * you can cast spells sort of    

Everything else is broken :frowning2:

entries.title: It's under control
entries.description:
![under_control.gif](///raw/754/z/1c306.gif)

**"It's under control" is a physics-based game about dealing with life (and failing)**

**// INFO**

Decide what you want to do and place it on the bar. Careful, if you get greedy and place too much you'll end up with nothing.

You start the game with three options (eat, sleep and work) but you'll come across others later. Experimenting is part of the game.

Made for Ludum Dare 43  (Sacrifices must be made) by one person in about 24h

**// SHORTCUTS**

F is fullscreen, R is quickreset and M is mute.

(if you start the game and can't see any text press R or reload the game, this should be a rare issue)

**// BLURB**

I wanted to join this Ludum Dare but I wanted to take things easy, so I decided to something in about 24 hours. My take on the theme was how we can't just do everything in life, we must choose and sacrifice some options. I represented this struggle through a physics puzzle where you decide what you want to do.

There is no winning or losing, you can avoid ending your game by sticking to a simple life, that's your choice. Play the game, do whatever feels right and maybe think about this struggle.

Even though the concept wasn't super complex, testing ended up being way harder than I anticipated, so it's less polished than most of my games (plus I didn't have time to do some decent audio or art). Enjoy!

entries.title: Sacrival
entries.description:
# Images:
![1.JPG](///raw/412/e/z/1c34a.jpg)

# ​About:
Sacrival is a Compo game made for Ludum Dare 43.

Your task is to help the survivors to stay alive. At night zombies appear and they will hunt survivors. There is only one place that is safe - a shelter. However, because it can be closed only from the outside, at least one survivor must sacriface himself and spend the night outside. 

# How to play:
- Gather food and weapons at day.
- Survive the night by hiding in the shelter or fight the zombies.
- Do not let the zombies to get into the shelter.
- You can skip time if the shelter is closed and there is noone alive outside. 
- Every morning amount of food matching your survivors count is consumed.
- Every morning new cases and boxes with loot appear.
- If there is not enough food, survivors will die.
- Have fun!

# Default controls:
- Right Mouse Button (Hold) + Mouse Move - Rotate camera
- WASD - Move camera
- Left Mouse Button - Select survivor
- Left Mouse Button + Left Shift - Remove survivor from the selection
- Left Mouse Button + Left Control - Add survivor to the selection
- Left Mouse Button (Hold) - Select multiple survivors
- Left Mouse Button (Hold) + Left Shift - Remove multiple survivors from the selection
- Left Mouse Button (Hold) + Left Control - Add multiple survivors to the selection
- Ctrl + A - Select all survivors
- Escape - Cancel selection
- Q - Order survivors to attack
- X - Order survivors to move
- E - Order survivors to use or pick up an object
- C - Order survivors to drop their weapon
- K - Skip one hour
- O - Open the shelter
- P - Release survivors from the shelter

# Note:
- There are few bugs (Mostly in the WebGL version...). I will fix them soon.

# Have fun! :star::star::star::star::star:

entries.title: Space Virgins... In Space
entries.description:
![Unity_2018-12-02_19-07-25.png](///raw/03a/d/z/1c23d.png)

---

## Downloads and Links:
* WebGL: https://fussenkuh.itch.io/space-virgins-in-space
* Source: https://fussenkuh.itch.io/space-virgins-in-space ( Follow the **Download** link at the bottom of the page )
* Android: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.FussenKuh.SpaceVirgins

---

## Description:

The year's 2654. And your intergalactic space yacht is in desperate need of fuel: Virgins. Yep, you read that right. Those ancient civilizations knew that sacrificing virgins was a sure-fire way to fuel their empires. Why not fuel your space yacht?

Space Virgins marks my fourth entry into the Ludum Dare Competition! When making games, my goal tends to create something that works on both a PC and my Android phone. So, to that end, you need nothing more than your finger/mouse to play!

The goal is simple, sneak onto a ship and abscond with 10 Space Virgins without being caught. Do mind the holes though.

---

## How To Play
- Drag your mouse around the screen to move
- Ram yourself into not one, not two, but **TEN** space virgins
- Get yourself to Mars... err... the **EXTRACTION POINT**
- Sacrifice those Space Virgins in **YOUR SPACE YACHT** fuel system, not some other random schmo's ship

---

## Developer Notes:

For this Jam, I focused on taking a deeper dive into the Unity Physics2D Joint, TextMesh Pro and Sprite systems. I know I've only scratched the surface on those topics, but, over the course of these 48 hours, I've learned quite a bit. With such a short time frame, the game's scope is rather small, but, I'm proud of what I've been able to accomplish. That said, there's always room for more (and more) polish.

I'm happy that I was able to keep my requirements creep urges at bay and fought to stay focused on getting out a working game.

Overall, I'm happy with what I've accomplished and I'm looking forward to hear what everyone thinks about it!

**Thanks for playing :-)** 

---

## Tools:

* Unity 2018.2
* Inkscape
* Audacity
* 1998 Fender Toronado
* Some awesome voice talent

---

## Screen Shots:
![2018-12-02_14-00-35.png](///raw/03a/d/z/1c22f.png)
"Save" those virgins... for your own space yacht.

Context-Based. Just left-click a TOWN CENTRE to CONVERT. Click on a CAVE to HIDE (useful if you're being pursued).

Hi folks ! Thank you for stopping by and trying Panquetzalt ! I had real fun making this game and I expect you will find it challenging enough !

If you have any tips about game mechanics, arts making or anything that could be improved in Panquetzalt, feel free to leave me a comment or to ping me on twitter : [@OwlyCode](https://twitter.com/owlycode). I always like to learn and discuss about games.

Thank you again, good luck saving the world from an angry god !

entries.title: Blight Tower
entries.description:
Welcome to [Blight Tower](https://jeplmr.itch.io/blight-tower)! Your goal is to destroy the monstrous BLIGHT TOWER! Stand under OUTPOSTS to capture them and spawn an army of DEADLY CAPSULES! Be warned, the BLIGHT TOWER has a powerful BLAST ATTACK that does heavy damage and turns your DEADLY CAPSULES against you! Don’t die! 

So where's the incorporation of the 'Sacrifice' theme, you ask? Simple: If you find yourself running low on HEALTH, shoot rockets at a nearby DEADLY CAPSULE. There's a chance it will drop HEALTH for you upon death. Be advised, running out of DEADLY CAPSULES will lose you the game!

If you’ve played a shooter in the 20 [twenty] years, you’ll pick this up no problem. Otherwise, it’s W, A, S, and D to move, mouse to aim, and left click to shoot your shot.

Full disclosure: While the game is technically feature complete, I ran out of time to work on my wishlist of audio and visual deliverables (note: the DEADLY CAPSULES). Many assets are still placeholders. There are also several bugs, as of writing. I ran out of time before I could get them fixed. I have opted out of the Audio category, as the only sound in the game is for the rocket launcher. I have also opted out of the Humor category as it doesn’t fit the theme of the game. I did opt into graphics as the models are custom made and the level design is (mostly) done.


All this to say, I pushed myself more than any other Ludum Dare yet. My project scope was more than I could handle in the end, but I’m still incredibly proud of the results. Thank you for checking out Blight Tower and being an integral part of the Ludum Dare experience :)
 

Tools Used:

- Unity
- ProCore
- Blender
- GIMP
- VS Code
- SFXR

Gameplay: 
https://youtu.be/OzWjPV2dquQ

Making-of Timelapse: 
https://youtu.be/ExUrm2E2cN0

entries.title: The March Of The Blobs
entries.description:
**The March Of The Blobs** is a lemmings-like.

The main difference is the system of points, transformations will lessen the number of blobs available, so sacrifice points wisely. You can pop blobs whenever you wish, allowing downtimes or releasing all your hordes at once.

Source code is available on itch.io page below. The Game counts 12 levels, I will probably give it a bit more polish later.

Have fun!

entries.title: JUICY SACRIFICES
entries.description:
In Juicy Sacrifices you are a group of fruits who are trying to escape from the kitchen. After each level you must sacrifice a certain fruit. Each fruit has its own abilities and you must choose which fruits to sacrifice and consider which characters have the best traits. There is the apple which can stop momentum by turning into a regular apple. Or perhaps the banana that can fly. Make your choice wisely. I was unable to add music as I was short of time.

Controls and Traits:
APPLE:
1. Normal Speed
2. Can turn in to regular apple mid jump to slow down(Down arrow)

Orange:
1. Immune to mold
2. Has faster movement and jump speed

Banana:
1. Slower than the others
2. Can fly using a helicopter(Down arrow)
------------------------------------------------
If there are any bugs leave them in the comments.

Thank you for playing my game.
------------------------------------------------
LINKS:
1. ITCH.IO
https://duck-games.itch.io/juicy-sacrifices

2. Game Jolt
https://gamejolt.com/games/juicysacrifices/382944

entries.title: Purple Space
entries.description:
A cooperative shooter with lots of lasers!

Blue lasers defeat blue enemies. Red lasers defeat red enemies. Cross your streams to defeat purple enemies. Use your lasers to revive each other. The shield on your back can defend you from dangerous lasers. However, firing your laser will sacrifice your shield's size!

Best experienced with a friend!

Supports two controllers. Player 1 can use either a CONTROLLER or WASD with MOUSE. Player 2 can use either a CONTROLLER or ARROW KEYS and MOUSE.

Left Click (Player 1) / Right Click (Player 2) / Right Trigger (Player 1 or 2) - Fire Laser

WASD (Player 1) / ARROW KEYS (Player 2) / LEFT STICK (Player 1 or 2)  - Move

entries.title: Omnomelettes
entries.description:
Welcome to Omnomelettes, the egg-operated cook-to-order omelette restaurant. Our staff give their all to ensure you have a quality breakfast.

## How to play
You're the chef, but you need your egg helpers to prepare your ingredients.
- Assign new egg helpers to one of the four work stations.
- Then, assign eggs to prep one of the ingredients (peppers, tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, bacon, or cheese).
- To prep eggs, click and hold another egg until the meter fills up.
- Select a pan and add ingredients to fill orders.
- When an order is complete, select the pan and click "Serve" on the order.

Make sure you fill the order properly: missing or extra ingredients could lose you points!

## Credits
- Developed using Unity, GIMP, and Audacity
- Easing functions by C.J. Kimberlin: https://gist.github.com/cjddmut/d789b9eb78216998e95c
- Yoster Island font by codeman37: http://www.zone38.net/font/

## Post-Compo Bug Fixes
- 2018-12-04: Fixed a bug in animations.

## Gameplay Demo
https://youtu.be/88IHV8IoRcY

entries.title: Head Spin Builder - Sacrifice Edition!
entries.description:
The next entry in the famous Head Spin series brings you an epic adventure of building and sustaining a society: **Head Spin Builder - Sacrifice Edition!**

The problem? The Head Spinners believe in the Spinning God and it demands a daily spinning sacrifice! Because their heads are the only thing spinning in this world, they are sacrificing themselves. And they love it!

Your job is to keep the society of Head Spinners running, eventhough every two ingame days one Head Spinner must be sacrificed.

The games are short and have no end state - except losing. When you figure out how to keep the society running, there will no be additional challenge.

I'm looking forward to your feedback :-)

![2018-12-03-ld-screenshot2.png](///raw/2dd/z/1cb84.png)

## How To Play
- Move Camera: WASD, Arrow Keys or clicking middle or right mouse button.
- Camera Zoom: Mouse Wheel, or Q and E.
- Select and Build: Left Mouse Click. Unselect: Right Mouse Click.
- Build resource extraction buildings to automatically harvest wood, stone and food. But the resources are finite!
- Every Head Spinner consumes one food at the end of the day. Don't let them starve!
- Building *Reproduction Caves* will create a new Head Spinner. But they are expensive and take long.
- Build homes to accommodate more Head Spinners.
- Every two days the **Almighty Spinning God** demands sacrifice. And the Head Spinners love it! You select the chosen one. Keep in mind that you will lose a Head Spinner every two days.
- You lose when all your Head Spinners are dead or sacrificed. The goal is to keep going as long as possible.
- Harder Difficulty starts you with less resources.

## Technical Things

The game is built with **Monogame**, to run it you need to download and install the latest [.Net Framework Runtime](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/download/dotnet-framework-runtime).

You can play the game on linux. Simply download the windows build and execute the .exe with the [Mono Runtime](https://www.mono-project.com/download/stable/). The linux build contains a Mono Runtime and is therefore so much bigger.

The assets are created with **PyxelEdit**, **ChipTone**, **Bosca Ceoil**.

You can easily adjust the **resolution** and fullscreen settings in the Content/config.xml file.

 or download the linux build that contains the runtime. Start

entries.title: Morbid adventurer
entries.description:
You have found yourself on a quest to find a hidden treasure inside a dungeon! However, the dungeon seeks your sacrifice and so only one true hero make its way to the end.

This is a small roguelike, where you discover a dungeon as a community. Only one player is permitted to play the dungeon at a time and you will have to wait your turn.

 - Spacebar: Attack
 - M-key: Toggle map

Don't forget to write your message upon your death.
Also: A working network connection is required to play this game.

Mac users can download love2d from the website and use it to run the love file.
Linux users should do the same.

entries.title: An Adventure within a Deep Forest
entries.description:
Help Bob the Adventurer solve the mystery of the dark forest! Chop up bushes, jump over obstacles, swim through water and push boxes to collect all the glowing orbs in each level, but watch out! Getting each orb makes you sacrifice one of your abilities! Think carefully about when to pick which orbs, and make sure you will not need the ability for the rest of the level!

Play now in your browser (preferably Chrome, not tested in other browsers)

# [Play now!](https://boltkey.cz/aidf/)

## Comment how far you got! The level number is at the beginning of the message on the scroll

### Update 2018-12-06: So apparently not many people comment the level number, so I am anonymously logging all the levels completed, so try to get far in order to have bragging rights once I release the stats

![splash.png](///raw/194/z/1c16d.png)

Inspired by the Sokoban genre, and Smart Games series by Raf Peeters, who manages to hide intricate puzzles in grids as small as 4x4, I tried to make such puzzle game myself.

Also, I worked a bit more than usual on the graphics. I found pixel art very fun to do, and very satisfying too. I am quite proud of the result.

## Controls
 - **Arrow keys**: Move around
 - **R**: Restart level
 - **P**: Change perspective / rotate the level
 - **Left shift**: Hide blocking items
 - **M**: Mute

**The game autosaves after each completed level.** I hope it is not a huge issue that there is no autosave wipe feature. If you really need to, you can go to browser console (f12 or ctrl+shift+i on most browsers), input `localStorage.setItem("aidf-level", 0)` and refresh the page.

## Rules clarifications

### Jumping

Jump destination cannot be rock, hole, crate, bush or (if you already picked up the blue orb) water. 

Jump origin cannot be water.

You perform a jump whenever you make a movement which you cannot perform, you are not standing in water and there is possible jump destination behind it.

### Pushing crates

Crates cannot be pushed onto orbs. When you can either jump over the crate or push it, you always push it. This is not a bug.

entries.title: Cavern Clash
entries.description:
My submission for Ludum Dare 43.

A tower defense game where sacrificing towers unlocks progression. You start out with a few traps, then gain 2 every round. Traps can be placed to harm the enemies as they pass through them. But as the waves get more and more difficult, you may want to sacrifice some traps for greater towers and weapons. Or you can fill the entire map with traps, you decide the strategy!

Features:
- Four maps (1 easy, 2 medium, 1 hard)
- Five towers/weapons (including traps)
- Single enemy that gets stronger every wave
- Music and sound
- And more...

Controls:
LMB : Interact with HUD, place weapons, select buttons/options, etc.
RMB : Cancel weapon placement, exit shop.
Escape Key : Exit to menu.

Screenshots:
![javaw 2018-12-02 18-47-49-108.jpg](///raw/83d/z/1c237.jpg)
![javaw 2018-12-02 18-49-30-169.jpg](///raw/83d/z/1c238.jpg)

entries.title: Blocklings
entries.description:
​Blocklings​.

My entry for Ludum Dare 43.

A short game about morphing blocks escaping from a dungeon deep underground. However, not all of them will be able to make it to the top.


Features:

- Bouncy Animated Blocks with 3 shapes they can take

- Low poly art style

- 8bit inspired sound effects and soundtrack

- Puzzle focused game-play with repeatability to get the best score

- 4 Levels

Tips:

- The Blockling highlighted in Green is the current leader and is the one affected by the selected change. 

- Blocklings will stay in the air once they change.

- After getting one Blockling to the end you can fast forward the rest.

Tools Used:

Blender (Models, Texturing etc)

Beepboop (SoundTrack)

LapChirp (SoundEffects)​

Unity3D (Well.. The game itself I guess)

entries.title: Harmonious Development
entries.description:
*In our world we have to constantly sacrifice something, one for the other. Sometimes we can sacrifice health for our own pleasure, and sometimes - pleasure for the necessary skills.*

![ld43_cover.PNG](///raw/bd6/1/z/1c20c.png)

And now - you are a programmer who lives in the same world as us, with the same tasks and chores as we all do. You will have to sacrifice some states for improving others. Only you decide what to do - relax and eat cookies, or work and read a book. So, can you harmoniously develop yourself and achieve as high level of states as possible?

![ld43_screen_2.png](///raw/bd6/1/z/1cbcd.png)
![ld43_screen_3.png](///raw/bd6/1/z/1cbcf.png)
------------

# How to play

At the top left - panel of your states (health, pleasure, skills). Walking around the apartment, you can perform various actions with your mouse. These actions will change your states in some way, and, as a rule, an increase of one state causes a decrease of another. Do not sacrifice excessively one state for another. Develop harmoniously!
Reach high levels of all states to win!

-------

# Control
 * Mouse click on action over thing to perform it

entries.title: Farm to Table
entries.description:
**Farm To Table: the supramundane, numinous hamburger experience.**

The Steakholders are angry, and they expect results. They - along with the humble and hard-working citizens of *Farmtotabletown* - have invested their faith in **You**. Faith in you, as their transcendental social and economic linchpin.

It *sounds* easy, but the perfect burger business may require a few sacrifices.

[![hor.png](///raw/e95/3/z/1e862.png)](https://mrspeaker.github.io/ld43/)

## FAQ

* **Q.** Who are the Steakholders?
* **A.** Now you're asking the right questions.


* **Q.** What is the purpose of burger?
* **A.** That's like asking "What is time?". Do you know? Because I think I may have ran out of it.

entries.title: [ 66 DOWN ]
entries.description:
![ldjam_banner.png](///raw/1ce/z/1bee9.png)

# [ 66 DOWN ]
[ 66 DOWN ] is a game aimed at twitch streamers specifically. In [ 66 DOWN ], you (the streamer) have to sacrifice 66% percent of your chat. The chat is given a prompt / scenario that they use to defend themselves. Each chat message is picked up by the game, and inserted into an NPC for each chat member participating. It is your job as a streamer to judge the responses that each chat member gives. If they don't live up to your standards, then you sacrifice them!

### Do I need to be a twitch.tv streamer to play?
There's two ways of playing [ 66 DOWN ]. Either you stream the game to a chat audience of at least 3 people, or you participate in the chat of another twitch streamer playing the game.



### Tools Used:

- Unity
- [Grahnz's Unity TwitchIRC client](https://github.com/Grahnz/TwitchIRC-Unity)
- iTween
- Photoshop
- FL Studio
- Audacity
- Blender
- A Tascam Audio Recorder
- Self Motivation
- Trello!

entries.title: Cook
entries.description:
![Cook.png](///raw/9ea/91/z/1c0ea.png)
 
You just graduated from cooking school, and want to start a cooking business. Great! What's not great? In this world, the food is conscious! Cooking is strictly illegal and categorized with MURDER. But the pay was enticing, and the food, delicious! You sacrificed your morality to make meals requested by the rich, ravenous customers. But beware! The police definitely do not agree with you! Sacrifice too many vegetables, make too much money, get too popular, and they will catch you and stop your nefarious money-making scheme. How long can you survive as a cook in this alternate reality? Only time will tell!

**This game contains flashing images, loud noises, and imagery that more sensitive audiences may find disturbing. You have been warned.**

![Cover.png](///raw/9ea/91/z/1b4d2.png)

When giving feedback, please be honest. Don't hold back critical feedback or nit-picky details, as I need to know to improve the experience. But if you need to talk about a **SPOILER**, then please email me directly at koalasquadgames@gmail.com rather than posting it in the comments. Thank you!

I originally made this game as a compo entry, but then made some radical changes at the end of day 3 and decided to migrate it to a jam. Sorry!

**Controls:** wasd or arrow keys to move, click on the text box to respond to orders, enter to enter text and click to interact.

entries.title: Eldritchual
entries.description:
Sacrifices must be made!

Eldritchual allows you to step into the role of a cult leader who knows something that your new followers do not; you're going to sacrifice them to summon an ancient eldritch horror. As with any nascent and struggling cult, you must manage the happiness of your cultists while keeping the faith in your cult strong and out of the eyes of the local authorities. And when you are ready to begin the ritual, start tossing your cultists into the sacrificial pit. 

The game does not take long to play, and it is my first LD submission. My goal was to create a complete experience, a manageable project, have simple interactions, and be in a style that I enjoy. The visuals should lighten the dark theme of sacrificing your beloved followers, and nothing in the game ever takes itself too seriously. I tend to enjoy worker-placement board games which influence the basic mechanics of Eldritchual. Oddly, I'm not normally a fan of the Lovecraft horror genre, but this theme and other games and movies I've watched recently just led me there. 

While there are additional mechanics, polishing, and balancing that I would have liked to include, I made difficult cuts to try to stay on time. 

Please enjoy Eldritchual!

### How to Play
- Click and Drag to move cultists around. 
- ESC to pause the game and review the tutorial. 
- Sacrifice cultists to progress the ritual!

### Eldritual Game Window
![SS1.png](///raw/ada/e1/z/1c2c5.png)

### Sample Tutorial Screen
![SS2.png](///raw/ada/e1/z/1c2ca.png)

### Page Edits
- *Edit: Moved source to GitHub for future work. Zip file matches the initial master branch link.*
- *Edit 2: Minor formatting adjustments*

my very first ludum dare. in fact, my very first released game! I started learning Unity by using it this year and my girlfriend challenged me to take part in the LD43. While i did have some other things to do this weekend, i took up the challenge and participated. This is my game for the LD43 compo and jam: "The Blood Tower".

The blood tower is attacked by monsters on little wheels. You can defend by sacrificing 10 pesants to build a turret. If the monsters hit the tower they explode and do damage. Every round you receive some new pesants and every monster killed rewards you with one pesant.

entries.title: Sacrifice Management
entries.description:
![ss1.png](///raw/e13/8/z/1c19f.png)

You are a priest who has the talent of sacrificing anything. Objects, plants, animals and even humans. You should reach the sacredness limit to complete the ritual. However, it is hard to keep every sacrifice happy. And sad sacrifices mean less sacredness. 

Sacrifice Management is a mouse-only puzzle game. Just move sacrifices to the altar. Oppositely, you can remove sacrifices from the altar by moving them outside. Each sacrifice has a sacredness point (SP). You own a sacrifice’s SP when you place it on the altar. On the other hand, sacrifices may have a love and a hate list. If a sacrifice is placed adjacent to another one on its love list, its SP increases (not permanently, only for that positioning - base SP never changes). Similarly, hate decreases SP. You pass the level when you reach the level’s sacredness limit.

Since levels are generated by an algorithm, you may experience very easy or absurd levels. The first 4-5 levels were intentionally designed as easy. After level 13, it becomes more challenging.

![ss2.png](///raw/e13/8/z/1c1a5.png)

entries.title: Foreign Planet
entries.description:
[![Screenshot.PNG](///raw/751/z/1c1bd.png)](https://rialgar.github.io/LD43/index.xhtml)

[Play here](https://rialgar.github.io/LD43/index.xhtml)

[Source](https://github.com/Rialgar/LD43)

You have landed on a foreign planet. Your fuel is spent and your rations are limited.

To create new food or fuel you need to extract carbon from the planet and convert it. You can explore regions adjacent to already discovered regions or gather carbon from explored areas.

Gathering carbon in risky areas can result in casulties. If all crewmembers die, you lose.

Gathering carbon or exploring an area takes time. You need 1 food per 10 people to keep them alive each day.

If you manage to collect 1000 fuel, you can fly home.

entries.title: The Chickening
entries.description:
# ABOUT
Two kinds once again, apparently, trying to summon Satan by sacrificing neighbors John's chickens. Throw chickens in the bonfire while avoiding aggressive ones who try to attack you. All that for casually attempting to call dark forces to earth. Will you succeed? Or will the chickens prevail?

## DEV
This time I decided to participate in compo for the first time. A great way to test out my game developing skills. In the end I am really happy about the outcome, had few struggles modeling characters as I mostly do environmental stuff. Need to improve my coding skills for the next Ludum Dare.

### GAMEPLAY
You move around using **WASD** keys, pick up white or green chickens with **E** when in range, attack with **SPACE** and also throw picked up chickens. For each thrown chicken in the bonfire you score points, for killing grey one, few points are taken away. Win the game by raising sacrifice level to 100 and not dying. 😁

:keyboard: In short:
* WASD: Move around
* E: Pick up chicken / Drop chicken
* SPACE: Attack when not carrying chicken/ Throw chicken when carrying one

![1.png](///raw/d47/d/z/1c282.png)
![2.png](///raw/d47/d/z/1c284.png)
![3.png](///raw/d47/d/z/1c285.png)

entries.title: Elemental Storm
entries.description:
The natural world is in disarray... Grimmvich is using the four elements to wreak havoc unto the world!

Grimmvich is powerful, but not unbeatable. For an easier fight, you can harness the power of the elements for yourself... but do so at your own risk, for they are already unstable!

As you siphon the element of fire, you realize that all fire in the natural world is disappearing... but it weakens Grimmvich. You must succeed at any cost.... right?

---------

Elemental Storm is a boss-rush style game with "beautiful" hand-drawn graphics. Each element has a unique power, and a distinct fighting style. Then, there's Grimmvich, who has mastered the power associated with all the elements. You can either try and take him head on, or weaken him first. The choice is yours, but be careful - the natural world is in your hands.

-------

Built in 48 hours for Ludum Dare 43's compo
Theme: Sacrifices must be made

By Ben Burgh​
-----

![z3VM2F.png](///raw/e44/e/z/1d009.png)

![Nv4KB3.png](///raw/e44/e/z/1d00a.png)

![YrohFd.png](///raw/e44/e/z/1d00b.png)

-----

Cool ideas I had (If you don't want to play but are interested)

-Each of 4 elements is a unique fight

-For Grimmvich fight, he controls all four elements, all at once. Fighting him is really hectic.

-If you fight the element, you can weaken Grimmvich by removing his attacks.

-However, since the "elements are unstable", if you fight the elements, all their respective objects in the world (e.g. campfires or trees) lost their color.

-Also, the music consists of four sub-tracks, and each element has a track associated with it. If you defeat an element, its music stops playing.

-If you fight all four elements, there will be no sound and everything will be black and white. When you go to fight Grimmvich, he will have no attacks, and cannot hurt you.

-There are different endings depending on if fight any elements, or defeat Grimmvich at full power
------

V 1.1 (4/12): Fixed typos, increased player attack speed and boss health. Made instruction text more clear.

entries.title: Guardians of Lalaland
entries.description:
Lore
----
Your clan lives to protect the people of the floating Isle.
Lately the Moantain people starting "sacrificing" the people by sending them of to the hole in the middle of the Isle, or as they call it, sacred wholly-pooly. *angry face*.

Don't lose a soul!

Instructions
------------
The instructions can be found on the start screen as info "bubbles" on the icons and text. Be sure to read it as it disappears once you start playing the game.

Here is the general idea:
It's a tower defense game.
Mine stone to build towers "Rescue Centers". refer to the info "bubbles" in the start of the game for more information.

The idea was to restrict the build of the rescue centers to the grass areas only.

Still having troubles?
######################
Trouble placing rescue centers? Click on and hold the rescue center button and drag and drop the rescue center on a piece of grass where the sacrifices travel.


Theme Applicability
-------------------
The whole game is about sacrifices that "must be made". Not by the player, but by the the "enemy". This is accentuated by the *angry face* text in the lore. The DAYS info bubble (at the start of the game) further accentuate this with the 'at 5am' text. There must be a strong feeling of "MUST" to do this at 5am each morning...


Tools used:
-----------
* Unity
  * SuperTiles2Unity
* Tiles
* PyxelEdit

entries.title: An Offering
entries.description:
Take your offering to the shrine, and exchange it for words of wisdom!

Originally, the plan was to create a cozy game using Phaser 3 (the latest version of my favorite game engine). Though I certainly learned my way around the new engine, I was unable to make a game that felt cozy. Instead, the experience turned out a bit melancholy. Given more time and energy, I would have tweaked the atmosphere to match my original vision and further fleshed out the game experience. As I have run out of both, I am submitting the game as-is.

entries.title: I Am Free
entries.description:
**You are bound to your fellow Surions. (Survivor Minions)
You can't shoot your enemies. You can't even hurt your enemies. All you can do is be a nuisance to your enemies. Just run into them and just be in the way. 
Each contact with them will release one of your Surions from your bind with them.  They will then attempt to escape to their designated pods before the damage destroys them and leaves them stranded forever. Do everything you can to be a distraction and let your fellow Surions escape. Even if it means sacrificing yourself.
Beware as each contact with the enemy causes damage to you.
Take the punishment to sacrifice yourself for your loyal Surions.
Select from one to as many as twelve to escape the horror. If you are lucky you may still be able to even save yourself.**

The slider allows you to choose how many of your team you attempt to save. It defaults to one at the beginning. After each successful mission it increases by one. Try and work your way up to ultimate survivor with twelve  but you are free to choose what you want before each level.

BUG: Sometimes the level does not end when it should. I have to hit the RESTART BUTTON

entries.title: Human Meat Is Very Nourishing

entries.title: Grim Future - Rogue Merchant
entries.description:
My first game in java (as a newbie), and it didn't went well. It's not even playable, but I still wanted to upload my participation. I lost a tremendous amount of time making the "engine" (it's when you can't use something like Unity that you truely realize how useful it is, and how much it makes your life easier) and fighting my way through a working multithreading system, and in this actual state the main menu can't even be launched because I broke something without knowing why, and I can't manage to fix it... yet!

For the crazier ones, you can open the project in Eclipse, launch it, and see the combat system in action, running alone in the console.


The idea was to make a dungeon crawler where, in order to keep going deeper, you have to partake in dark rituals which give penalties to your character or give your most valuable pieces of equipment.


I don't give up on it through, I'm having fun and the idea isn't half bad if done properly. I'll update this page with news if I do something new.

entries.title: Brace For Impact
entries.description:

If one of your engines gets hit it will get misaligned, making it harder to dodge the missiles. Also if your engine gets hit 3 times it will explode and damage another engine.  
  
You can sacrifice your engine to prevent this. But will you make it in time?  
  
![screens.png](///raw/652/e1/z/1c17d.png)  

  
Created using Game Maker Studio 1.4, Leshy SFMaker for SFX and free Share Tech Mono font.  
I tried to create some music as well, but failed completely, I just don't have the talent for it. :) Maybe next time.  

Browser (HTML5) port created after the compo ended.

Made with Unity, Blender, and bosca ceoil.

entries.title: Le journal du Sagitta
entries.description:
/!\ game in french, on Linux and just at prototype state /!\ Vous êtes le capitaine du Sagitta, un vaisseau spatial qui s'est écrasé sur une planète reculée. Chaque jours vous rédigez dans le journal du vaisseau le récit de la survie de votre équipage en attendant que les secours arrivent.

entries.title: Please Him, Please

In this game you are the one the whole world relies on. As long as you keep sacrificing goods and your time to the almighty, the world is safe. If you can't keep it up, the whole world will be annihilated!

entries.title: Sacricent
entries.description:
It's a game about a centipede like creature that can eat his own legs to gain health(maybe also other things).
If you have less legs, you lose mobility.
However, you can pick up legs who fall from other enemies.

Arrow keys to walk/jump.
Left Ctrl to shoot.
Space bar to eat your leg to gain health.
Eating can be done once per second.

Wasn't able to make sound for the game.

entries.title: Can't save them all!

100 people are trying to get to safety, they won't all make it. You will have to sacrifice the few to save the many.

Move groups of people (yellow circles) one space at the time to get to safety (orange star). Avoid the kamikaze attackers (red circles). If two groups go on the same space, the will join as a new group.

entries.title: Sacrifices Must Be Made For Love
entries.description:
Story 
------
Little did Kuro know the trouble he was going to end up in when that chemistry experiment went wrong. Now everyone both male and female are obsessed with him and keep approaching him, but he only loves Miku can he last until the effect wears off?

luskily for him he has a nice group of friends that will sacrifice themselves for him, or to buy time at least. But will this be enough?

![screen1.png](///raw/edc/e1/z/1c138.png)


![screen2.png](///raw/edc/e1/z/1c13b.png)
Basic controls 
---------------
*Arrow keys/WASD move the player 
*click to progress through the tutorial

![screen3.png](///raw/edc/e1/z/1c13e.png)

The project
------------ 
This was my first attempt at a game Jam and this was my original post when I signed up:

"How hard can it be?

Hi folks i'm in this too. This may be my first game jam but that is still not stopping me from trying to solo it. Of course that does come with some restrictions. 

My game dev weapons of choice:
Engine - Unity
Coding- C#
Assets- Photoshop
Delivery platform-PC"

I decided to create a game that was night and upbeat as the theme could be taken in a dark way, so instead I made a nice fun game. The game will end if the player runs out of stamina or friends. 


![screen4.png](///raw/edc/e1/z/1c13f.png)

Credits: 
Assets used for power ups supplied by  GameDevMarket
Assets used for title screen supplied by wikepedia 
Assets used for sprites and floor tiles supplied by RPGMaker

Background music supplied by bensound 

Coded by Edwyn Mckie 
Story and game development by Edwyn Mckie 
Thanks for checking it out 

Bug Fixes:
Following feedback from "Fat cat": I have changed the default colour of the room screen to a darker shade of pink, I also changed the font in the tutorial section to one that is easier to read.

Following Feedback from "OfirMa85": I have set the game manager to delete itself on the win screen after having reset the player stats to the default values, thus allowing you to replay it properly.

twitter: twitter.com/JRDoomky

entries.title: Sorcerer Babies
entries.description:
# [Play In Browser HTML5](https://geeitsomelaldy.itch.io/sorcerer-babies)

The land of Shadowfen has been overrun by goblin hordes. They have razed cities, sacked farmlands and murdered countless people in their demented bloodlust. The town of Ostbury, sitting on the edge of the Shadowfen, has so far been spared their wrath. But as the approaching army makes its way east, it won't remain that way for long.

A mysterious well with strange magical properties has appeared in the village, causing the population to spawn Sorcerer Babies. They have no choice but to use them to fight the goblin horde.

entries.title: A Key Sacrifice
entries.description:
You have discovered an old arcade-style game on your grandpa's old computer. You are determined to get a high score, but the keyboard is very old with not much life left in it. You must sacrifice the keys to get a higher score, and will need to remap new keys for moving and shooting. How high of a score can you get before you either die or have no more keys to use?

![screenshot.png](///raw/755/02/z/1c46f.png)

Controls: WASD to move and arrow keys to shoot (initially). Spacebar to use a bomb.

Written in Java using libGDX (https://libgdx.badlogicgames.com/)

Note: some of the standalone executables are untested. If they don't work, just download and run the jar file (or play online).

Bugfixes:
- Fixed a bug in the web version where the speed was too high on some computers

entries.title: BomberFall
entries.description:
Ludum Dare #43: Sacrifices must be made.

The game is a tower defense where you can't interact with your units directly, so in orden to make them reach the enemy base you should sacrifice some of them to open path and guide the rest of your army through a labyrinthine battlefield.

This is an one person team. Probably it is not going to be ready just in time, so I link its github.

*UPDATE*
Well, it seems I managed to build a somewhat playable prototype of the concept yet the level design is not very inspired.

entries.title: Redshirt Air-Patrol
entries.description:
## Background:
Your island is under attack by alien forces! Scramble your fighters and take to the skies!

![actionshot.png](///raw/c5d/8/z/1c0e7.png)

## Mechanic:
Your factory will produce aircrafts that you need to assign to one of your airfields. Set waypoints for patrol and protect your shipping lanes, they will increase your production!
Against tougher enemies you may have to sacrifice your aircrafts to have a chance!

## Instructions:
- Spawn aircrafts with +
- Move waypoints by clicking
- Sacrifice your aircrafts by clicking the icon in the bottom of the screen, and select your target!

![waypoint.png](///raw/c5d/8/z/1c0e9.png)
![ships.png](///raw/c5d/8/z/1c0eb.png)
![sacrifice.png](///raw/c5d/8/z/1c0ed.png)
## Controls
- WASD = Camera
- Click on "+" = Add free aircraft to Patrol
- Click on icon then on UFO = Sacrifice
- Click on waypoint = Move waypoint

## Tips:
I haven't played test this enough for many tips but:
- Medium enemies are difficult to defeat, takes 1 sacrifice
- Boss enemies are almost immune to normal fire, takes 3 sacrifices if undamaged.

entries.title: Regain Power
entries.description:
First person adventure platforming game where you must collect missing batteries for your space ship. You are forced to sacrifice living things to gain gold and to gain more useful items.

The challenge of the game is the island itself, you must find creative ways to explore it further and master movement with platforming and grappling hooks.

How to play:

- Launch the executable (if Linux version fails to launch, try it with parameter -nooss )
- Change controls, audio or video settings in-game
- Use in-game Help in-game if you're confused
- YOU CAN DRAG AND DROP ITEMS FROM THE INVENTORY TO MAKE SACRIFICING THINGS FASTER

The game was made using:

- FTEQW Engine
- Blender (3D modeling and texture painting)
- GIMP (Textures)
- Trenchbroom Level Editor (The Island)
- Wally (Textures)
- Audacity (Sounds)
- SunVox (Music)

The source code is included in all downloads under MIT license, to compile you need to use FTEQCC, an advanced QuakeC compiler.


POST-COMPO BUG FIX PATCH 1.01:

- Fix annoying bug where sometimes clicking after leaving inventory strafes the player
- Fix rope physics so that hitting the ground while attached to something no longer glues you to the ground
(Fixed and original versions can both be found at the itchio page)

entries.title: Hello operator.
entries.description:
A game about phone calls, propaganda, resistance and sacrifices.  
Where you try to save lives without losing your job

## Story

You are an **operator** in a call center.  
Your job is to **establish communication** of incoming calls.

But **recent events** changed the country drastically...  
As an operator, you have a **strategic** position.

But to help the Resistance against the Militia, you must **not be suspected** and keep your job.  
And this, unfortunately, comes with **sacrifices**...

## Controls

Everything is controlled with the mouse.

entries.title: 43 days on the Sacrifice Ranch
entries.description:
![3.png](///raw/984/z/1cb53.png)

You are in a fantasy city overtaken by evil doers (and you are one of them) that ships in sacrifices to plant them and then harvest the organs and sell them. A f*cked up farming simulator!

Gather 12 000 gold coins by day 43 to win!

**Features: **
- A city ruled by evil doers
- Till the farmland
- Order new sacrifices
- Keep the crops well and growing
- Harvest the bodies and sell the organs

**Controls: **
- W,A,S,D - Movement
- E - Interact with environment
- Q - Open/Close inventory
- Left Mousebutton - Use selected tool/crop
- Right Mousebutton - (various)

**My own words after game release: **
I had fun making this game! It might not be the best i can do, but im happy for what it is! The biggest complain i have is that it's fairly easy. I do like the music i managed the put into the game. Thank you for playing and rating and good job to everybody else who made their game in Ludum Dare 43!

![2.png](///raw/984/z/1c197.png)

entries.title: Sacrifices mustn't be made
entries.description:
Create crystals using your cards and then power them up to stop the enemies from sacrificing themselves!

![screen2.png](///raw/f13/z/1c136.png)

The game is basically a real time tower defense with card game mechanics. Every 8 seconds the turn ends, restoring half of your mana and allowing you to draw 2 cards. You can have 9 cards maximum in your hand. Red, green and blue crystals are functionally the same. Black crystals deal less damage, but they hit all enemies on a tile. Good luck!

The scaling isn't harsh enough, so you can probably survive for a really long time. Share your highscores anyways :).

If you are playing using the WebGL build, I recommend using the full screen option.

![screen1.png](///raw/f13/z/1c099.png)

Created using Unity, a bit of Illustrator and a lot of code. Sadly I didn't have time to make any card art or music.

entries.title: The greatest sacrifice
entries.description:
![thumb01.png](///raw/0b9/1/z/1c07b.png)

# Important
__There is a compact mode toggle button that hides all descriptions use it after getting to know what is what.__

# Premise

You are the leader of a small village in this very hostile world you need to decide if you will pay tribute to the gods or stand on your own against plagues that visit this world every year.

Manage your villagers assign them to work so they can gather resources for sacrifices or village development.
Or leave them idle so they can multiply and sacrifice them to permanently weaken creatures disturbing this world.

![ludumdare_43_03.png](///raw/0b9/1/z/1bf4f.png)

## Technicalities

I was testing my dynamic soundtrack library in this entry multiple actions in short distance (15sek) in time will play an action version of the soundtrack while slow handling each step calm version.

Unfortunately didn't have enough time to finish images so I have only placeholders

### Tools
* __FLStudio__ and some paid VSTs from __Kontakt 5__ and __Massive__, __Reaktor 6 (Razor)__, __Absynth__ and __Ample Guitars__
* __Typescript__ + __React__ + __InverseJS__ + __Phaser__ - my own little framework with some additional libraries
* __PS CS5__ - just a little bit for thumb and background
* editor __MVCode__
* __yeoman__ for project scaffold generation

![ludumdare_43_05.png](///raw/0b9/1/z/1d8b0.png)

## Final note
I was mainly aiming at balancing gameplay so that each possible decision has its use in that process I may have not balanced sacrificing resources correctly but who knows maybe you guys wind better way to finish the game with the use of it.

entries.title: The Dark Sea
entries.description:
Disclaimer: Our group had to attend to school, so we only spent 48 hours on the game. If there are any issues, game-breaking or not, it would be nice if we were notified via the comments section

Theme: Sacrifices must be made.

Idea: Turn-Based Resource Management Game - Submarine, all abilities use energy, can SACRIFICE (trade) health for energy

Roles:
@Jickamangah - Game Designer, UI Designer/Producer, Audio Designer/Producer, Character Sprites | 
@NotLivingPool - Game Designer, Programmer, Producer/Compiler, Team carry | 
@Kintama45 - Game Designer, Character Designer, Mechanics Designer, Backdrop, Idea Origin| 
Solon - Tester

Instructions:
You are facing four soviet units: The scout, the heavy hitter, the tank and the final boss. You have these tools in your trusty submarine to help you survive:

EP=Energy Points 
HP=Health Points 
DMG=Damage

-Torpedo (-10EP, 7DMG) |
-Guns (-5EP, 3DMG) | 
-Flak (-2EP, 2DMG) | 
-Rest (+4HP) | 
-Sacrifice health for energy (
    -1HP, +2EP | 
    -3HP, +5EP | 
    -7HP, +10EP)

Good luck, be resourceful and HAVE FUN!


*IMPORTANT* LAUNCH INFORMATION:
We aren't software designers, so we did not create the proportions perfect for every setting. So, when launching the game you MUST set these settings:

- 1440x900 screen resolution | 
- Ultra graphics quality | 
- Windowed ON
