entries.title: God of Indecisiveness
entries.description:
My first ever complete game, and my first ever game jam. Hope you enjoy!

My twitter: https://twitter.com/JakobTheQuizGuy/

Edit: ported to web! In this version, if you don't have fullscreen, the screen fade will not reach the bottom. This is not intended.

![Screen Shot 2018-12-03 at 14.48.46.png](///raw/3e7/d1/z/1ccf7.png)

A long time ago, in a distant land, an ancient people worshipped the god known as Divine Seci.

The wrathful god craved sacrifice from the people, but never could decide on what he wanted as sacrifice until the last minute.

Thusly, a tradition was born: every animal and person in the village except for the priest would lie down, ready to become tribute for Divine Seci.

Despite the village elders all agreeing it did not roll of the tongue all too well, amongst the villagers their bloodthirsty god would come to be known as...

entries.title: Graveyard Manager
entries.description:
Hi guys, so I finally finish this in compo, I was already  thinking about this kind of game previous LD so now I m finally doing things. It is kind a Papers Please game, but totally different. The game needs lot of time to balance so maybe you will find some inbalanced moments but please, this entry is mainly about the idea. So please leave a comment at least about the idea, what are you think about it. Thanks 

This game has 2 possible endings it depends on your karma value. Try to have karma greater then 75%.
Please ignore some text bugs :)

It is year 2042 and your job is to manage fancy graveyard in our town. There is a lot of people on our planet, much more then was for example in 2018. We have to recycle graves, so new dead people are able to find their place for a rest. You have to decide which one is going in and out. 
I hope they will not increase the taxes.

!!CONTROLS!!
HOLD RIGHT LEFT MOUSE CLICK - Inspect grave stone
LEFT MOUSE CLICK - select grave or newcomer

I know it is a stressfull job, but you were a best candidate for it in our TOWN.
And I hope they will not increase the tax.

entries.title: Sirius Galactica
entries.description:
![Banner.png](///raw/50a/c/z/1c05f.png)
You find yourself in the middle of the galaxy travelling towards your home planet, Sirius. The engineers thought the invincibility module was complete. It mostly was, however impact with projectiles will cause the SS (Space Ship) Luft Maschine to lose oxygen. It's your goal to bring your invaluable Ship back home, if sacrifices must be made, make them.

![LD 43 Gif 7.gif](///raw/50a/c/z/1f495.gif)

This game has 6 rounds with increasing difficulty, 3 completely unique enemies and two different allied ships all in all summing up to around 10 minutes of play-time.

## Controls:

- LMB - Fire (can also hold)
- WASD - Move
- C - Eject Crew Member
- R - Reposition allies after round (if clipping)
- Q - Next Round
- Esc - Return to Main Menu 

You can find out more about the game in the "Instructions" tab on the Home Screen

## Known Issues:
- Ally ships will sometimes clip in the after round section (Workaround: Press "R" and they'll find a new position)
- Unity did an awful job at the audio compression and the music sounds off in some parts, this is NOT the fault of the music.

## Changelog:
### Version 1.1: December 12th 2018:
#### Additions:
- Added Version number to main menu

#### Improvements:
- Spelling mistakes sorted out
- Allied ships actually flicker now when shot in the after round screen
- Enemy projectiles now get cleared at the end of a round
- Made the enemy hit sounds louder (way too quiet last time)
- Made instructions slightly more concise
- Unity did a slightly better job at compressing the music this time round (still off in some sections, thanks Unity)
- Next round button is now on Q (Thanks @cute-dog-irl!)
- Screen shake is slightly more subtle (Thanks @manimal!)

#### Fixes:
- Player hit sound now plays
- Can no longer fail at trying to advance to the next stage at the end 
of a game
- Game doesn't grind to a halt when attempting to restart after a win
- Ricocheting Projectiles don't get stuck at the bottom of the screen
anymore if they didn't ricochet already

==============

This game was made with the amazing BitPotion font by Joeb Rogers. Find it here: https://joebrogers.itch.io/bitpotion

**Every and all feedback is wanted and appreciated. If you hated, despised or wanted this game to rot in the deepest, dankest depths of hell, please tell me why, so next time I can make something better. Thank You :)**

entries.title: Rocket of Souls
entries.description:
A giant asteroid is approaching Earth. Humanity is doomed. But people built a giant rocket to leave the planet and find a new home. The rocket engine is powered by the energy of the souls, it is fully charged. Will there be enough fuel to get to the new Earth?

Will everyone get to the new home or have to sacrifice someone?

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VW_qdAsd89c

**How to play:**
- Watch for soul-fuel in the tank.
- Aim with mouse to the target.
- Shoot the cannon asteroids.
- Repair ship damage.
- Click for throw away a capsule with humans if you want to add soul-fuel to the tank.
- Click for throw away a cargo container if you want to decrease a fuel consumption.

WARNING: Every shot spends soul-fuel. Think carefully before using the cannon frequently.

P.S. Many thanks my colleague Alexey Kuzmin who helped me with art-assets for this game!

![Screenshot_1.png](///raw/2e5/2/z/1c058.png)![Screenshot_2.png](///raw/2e5/2/z/1c059.png)![Screenshot_3.png](///raw/2e5/2/z/1c05a.png)![Screenshot_4.png](///raw/2e5/2/z/1c05b.png)

entries.title: Bottomless God
entries.description:
BOTOMLESS GOD

![BottomLessGod.png](///raw/c36/d/z/1c038.png)

Your god is always angry for a new sacrifice.  Your role is to do everything to understand and respond to all these needs, do not be fooled because you would make it even more angry, and it will bring down on you a rain of fire ...

The dev team reminds you that killing animals or even people to satisfy your god is prohibited by law. As for drinks, fruits or vegetables, we are not sure but we do not want to say something wrong. Do your best to satisfy your god.

![Capture.PNG](///raw/c36/d/z/1c01c.png)
![Capture2.png](///raw/c36/d/z/1c01d.png)
![Capture3.PNG](///raw/c36/d/z/1c01e.png)
![Capture4.png](///raw/c36/d/z/1c01f.png)

RULES

Bring something or someone to sacrifice in honor of your god before it makes a rain of fire come down on you. Whenever you bring something or someone to the priest, this one will give you a clue about what the god really wants. Reach three times in the allotted time to calm him down!

entries.title: Saving Oskar
entries.description:
![screenshot.png](///raw/03a/1/z/1ce6d.png)

The gods demand a sacrifice and so a lamb must die. But not Oskar, your dear friend.

So you need to sacrifice another lamb. Again and again. Until all lambs are sacrificed, except Oskar. Then, the gods will be pleased and you will win the game.

Use the cursor keys to walk and hit space to use your knife. Press ESC to skip the intro.

Made by Christian Braun and me. Christian made all the art.

entries.title: Heat Shield
entries.description:
This game is a simulation game, where you play the role of a space trader. The twist is that part of your ship is destroyed upon landing. 
## Gameplay
The Game has two possible stages:
1. Flight
2. Planetary stationing

Going from planetary to flying can be done for free, by pressing the launch button. Flight to planetary costs you dearly; one layer of your ship gets destroyed.


## Flying
When on the flight screen, you can click around your ship (the red dot in the middle of the screen) to set the direction of the next burn.

The slider on the side is used to set how quickly the ship should burn it's fuel. There's a button to set the burn speed to zero.

Use the 1-5 keys to set the simulation speed, and use the spacebar to set the simulation speed to zero.

If you're near enough to a planet, the landing button will appear. There's no penalty to speed differences nor position differences, the landing computer on your ship ensures a decent landing. Well, not really decent, but still.
## Landing
When landing, you have to choose which direction will enter the atmosphere first. Every part of your ship that's exposed from that side will burn, and you will lose those parts.
## Ship Control
Ship Control is used to enable and disable specific parts of the ship. It serves little purpose within this version of the game.

## Planetary
The planetary screen is a screen from which multiple other screens can be reached. It can also be used to launch the ship again.
You can reach the following screens from the planetary screen:
1. Edit Ship
2. Buy
3. Sell
4. Refuel

## Edit Ship
This screen is used to add parts to your ship.  There's no punishment to removing and re-adding parts.

## Buy
This screen is used to buy cargo. You click the cargo type you want, and then the cargo bay in which you want to place it.
Every time you buy something, the price goes up by fifty.
## Sell
This screen is used to sell cargo. You click the cargo bay you want to sell from. Look in the bottom-right to see what's in there.
A fee of sixty is subtracted from the buying price. Also, every time you sell something, the price goes down by fifty.
## Refuel
The refuelling button is used to instantly re-add fuel to your ship.

## Prices on all planets screen
This screen is used to see what which resource is worth where.

#What if I run out of fuel?
Then you have to hope you run into a planet. No other outcomes are possible..

entries.title: Cult Collective

entries.title: Time is Money
entries.description:
![screenshot1.png](///raw/80d/81/z/1c041.png)Time is Money as they say. Well in this game it's true-as well as time being everything else too, money, health and of course the time limit. Kill to get drops that give you more time. The further you get from spawn the higher the difficulty will be. Every 5 difficulty levels you unlock a cosmetic. Try to get to the highest difficulty!
# Controls
WASD or Arrow keys to move
Space or click to swing weapon. Weapon swings towards cursor
## Shop
![screenshot2.png](///raw/80d/81/z/1c320.png)
### Standing on the glowing square opens the shop and stops time
When on the shop you buy things with time. Power Up increases damage and knockback. Speed Up increases speed. Key gives you a key to unlock a door. POW gives you a POW, POWs kill all enemies on screen. Port-a-shop gives you a Port-a-shop, Port-a-shops pause time and open the shop for 10 seconds.

entries.title: Doggo's Inferno
entries.description:
https://youtu.be/S0mVoWDGCcc

## A Twitch-Chat Overlay Game

**_As Captain Catastrophe sacrifices puppies, who will survive?_**

Type **!doggo** to enter the game and then choose between four boxes by typing **!1, !2, !3 or !4**. Good luck!

## Setup Instructions for the streamer
Replace the **_[yourchannel]_** part of the URL with the name of your Twitch channel and then add the following URL as a Browser Source into OBS or XSplit:
`https://instafluff.github.io/DoggosInferno/public/doggo.html?channel=[yourchannel]&overlay=true`

The **_width_** and **_height_** of the Browser Source should be **_1920_** and **_1080_**

You can also play on a web browser by removing **_&overlay=true_**


## Instafluff ##

We built this Twitch-integrated Extension game live on Twitch for Ludum Dare 43!

> *Come and hang out with us at the Comfiest Corner on Twitch!*

entries.title: Save The Ginions
entries.description:
![banner.gif](///raw/ca2/7/z/1be09.gif)

![battery2.gif](///raw/ca2/7/z/1cfee.gif)

![gore2.gif](///raw/ca2/7/z/1cff0.gif)

![warm.gif](///raw/ca2/7/z/1d0fb.gif)

# Controls

- **WASD -** To Move

- **SpaceBar -** Pick Up / Put Down

- **R -** To Restart

# What Is This

- You are a research robot. In the middle of a day, these cute aliens (aka. ginions) crashes their spaceship. You can eighter wait for the storm to calm down and left them to their death. 

- Or you can help them by repairing and charging their ship. But the thing is you need to **sacrifice some of them for batteries and upgrades.**

- Get them into a warmer spot by plugging in a battery to the heater

# The Goal Is To
Save many of them as you can, don't let them die from the storm, repair the ship and send them back to their planet. 

I would love to see you high scores :smile: 

## Other Stuff

The music is generated with cgMusic. You can learn more about it [here](http://maciej.codeminion.com/2008/05/cgmusic-computers-create-music/)

And here is my [Twitter](twitter.com/ytkimirti)

entries.title: Dog Days
entries.description:
![2018-12-02 17_32_41-carlotz_rebrand_logo_only.ai_ @ 100% (CMYK_GPU Preview).png](///raw/a45/1/z/1c03d.png)

## It's the middle of summer and the people of the midwest need their hot dogs! However, they're unevenly distributed to each town, so it's your job to even it out. 

### 🎮 [Play on the Web (Flash)](http://ruthieswebsite.com/dogdays/)

#### 🌭🌭🌭 C O N T R O L S 🌭🌭🌭

Press SPACE to start

Press D to destroy a town as your truck passes it by

Press H to throw a hot dog at a town as your truck passes it by


#### 🌭🌭🌭🌭 G O A L 🌭🌭🌭🌭

Get points by giving hot dogs to towns who need it.

If you need more hot dogs, you can destroy a town, but you'll lose some points, so choose carefully.

Alternatively, you can do absolutely nothing and just enjoy the randomized town names. That's what I do.


#### 🌭🌭🌭 T O O L S  🌭🌭🌭
Framework: HaxeFlixel

IDE: SublimeText

Art: Aseprite

Music: WolframTones

SFX: BFXR

You're the mayor of a city with a very limited budget.

Feel free to share your score :)

## Controls
Left mouse click: Destroy hovered building

Right mouse click: Improve hovered building

Go to the left and right sides of the game window to move the camera

entries.title: How Many Days Left?
entries.description:
![banner.png](///raw/a21/d1/z/1bddf.png)

![ld_01.png](///raw/a21/d1/z/1bd45.png)

You manage a group of survivors in a post-apocalyptic world. Gather resources to feed your characters and keep them warm.
However, you must know when one of them is a burden. Perhaps precipitating their death is the best solution...

![ld_04.png](///raw/a21/d1/z/1bd4f.png)

I made this game in less than 48 hours but I started late and didn't have time to work on it 72 hours. A lot more was planned : social interactions, suicides, repairing parts of the house destroyed after a storm, disassembling furniture to get resources, etc. Some actual 3D assets would also have been nice. The 3 big igloos you will see are actually trees!

If you play in browser (HTML5), several visual effects will not be available.
Besides, you should play in fullscreen in the HTML5 version!

![screen01.png](///raw/a21/d1/z/1bd56.png)

Have fun!

entries.title: Ritual and invocation
entries.description:
Life is too short, so let's try to become immortal pay killing some animals.

It should work well in any recent browser (tested with chrome and firefox).

entries.title: A.I. Careers Advisory Service: Your Path To Success
entries.description:
Are you looking for careers advice? Why not talk to our A.I. Careers Advisory Service. It will set you on the path to glory in your chosen career, & it doesn't really care about who you sacrifice to get to the top.

An interactive retro style thingy made with Bitsy (by Adam Le Doux). Use the arrow keys to move & also to interact with sprites & objects.

1. Talk to the advisor.
2. Chose your career.
3. Get to the top rung of the career ladder.

![screen1.png](///raw/fa2/3/z/1c00e.png)

entries.title: Royal Archipelago
entries.description:
![Main Picture.png](///raw/763/02/z/1bf8c.png)

Welcome Captain! It's time to go on a flight on the "Royal Archipelago", the most advanced air balloon wooden exporer ship ever made!

----------- ABOUT -----------

Hello! This is my forth attempt at Ludum Dare, and I think it is by far the most funny theme yet :)

Royal Archipelago is a Steam punk inspired resource management game, made in Unity for the LD Compo. The graphics were made in Photoshop, music in FL Studio and the sounds by recordings / FL Studio effects.

----------- HOW TO PLAY -----------

The ship's balloon has a leak and you need to sacrifice stuff (or people) overboard so that you can survive.

While managing the altitude of the ship you also need to keep an eye on the work assignments of workers. 


Full tutorial in the game. But please tell if you find something hard to understand so I can explain.

entries.title: Sacrifice Carrier
entries.description:
You are a space carrier pilot fighting a war against a dangerous alien race. The stronger specimens seem to only die when a complex sacrificial ritual is performed inside them. If a creature is stunned, a fighter pilot can fly and sacrifice himself. Make them pay for all the lives lost!

*Shoot* with *Z*. *Holding* Z charges for more power. Rocks are easy to destroy with full charge. 
*Sacrifice* fighters with *X*. Use them to kill stunned enemies. 
*Rocks* leave IMPORTANT *resouces* behind. You should gather them. 
Your carrier automatically builds more fighters if it has resources.

![ld43_0.gif](///raw/da/z/1bfe7.gif)

## Known bugs
- Rocks are a bit hard to hit, shoot at the brown section
- It says "Level 3" just before "You win!" screen, there is no level 3 :(
- No autofire, it's a (bad?) feature. But there's a charge shot! Use it!
- If you have less ships than the wave requires, you'll get a game over before you run out of ships

entries.title: A Mage's New World
entries.description: This is a game created for Ludum Dare 43's Compo. You move with the AD keys, flip gravity with W, unflip it with S. Do a ranged attack with left click, melee attack with right click. You can cast spells but, beware that your health will decrease with each spell you cast (sacrificing health). With Z, you draw 25 health to all the enemies in the level. With X you make a ranged attack that kills an enemy instantly, and with C you dash. If you touch the portal,you win. I didn't create a death sequence nor a Win sequence but  it brings you back to level selection. I recommend playing the levels in order. I couldn't make a proper cover image because it was very late. Enjoy and please vote!

entries.title: The Gunslinger
entries.description:
Alone, armed with naught but a gun bound to your soul, you must fight your way through countless enemies in a final stand against their threat to civilization. Shooting your only weapon will eventually be your downfall, yet staying put and playing defense will get you nowhere. Death will not fall upon your enemies unless you command it, yet your command is limited. The only way forward is through in this lighting fast bullet hell shooter.

"Sacrifices Must Be Made"
---

The ammunition in your gun is your life, a concept which makes for some interesting game play decisions. My first idea for the game after the theme was announced was to have this be the only sacrifice you make in a play of the game, but while I was brainstorming and planning my schedule, I came up with several other ideas. None of them really would've stood on their own, but it seemed awfully ambitious to try and put them all neatly into one game in under 48 hours. 

Nonetheless, that's what I did. The game linked on this page is a boss rush shooter game with all the following concepts put - Not too shabbily, either, I'd say - in it:

-The ammo in your gun is your health.

-You can't kill all your enemies, you have to choose wisely which ones you do.

-One benefit can be traded for another. In this case, one opportunity to kill a boss (referred to as "Fatalities"), can be 
traded for two extra clips in you HP gun, and vice versa.

-Every boss you don't use a Fatality on will be put in a cage, where you can't fight it and it can't fight you. After every fifth round, all the caged enemies will be released and their HP restored. Now defeating them will kill them, no matter your number of remaining fatalities.

![Base Profile Screenshot 2018.12.02 - 11.46.12.54.png](///raw/d8f/51/z/1bd6d.png)

---
Credits:
---

All assets, game design, music/sound design, and programming was done by yours truly

Game assembled/programmed in GameMaker: Studio 2

(Assets were designed in the GM:S2 image editor)

Music made in Ableton Live 10 Intro

Sound FX made in BFXR

![Gameplay.PNG](///raw/e89/c/z/1ed80.png)

What I used:
- Unity 
- Pyxel Edit
- Audacity
- Bosca Ceiol
- Visual Studio

This time around, I actually got a fully working game! (Yay!). I'm a lot happier with the overall quality of this one!as well - it's got nicer quality pixel art, cleaner code, and less bugs, as well as actually having audio. Also, I'm surprised the music sounds as good as it does, with it being my first time using Bosca Ceiol for an actual project. 

Also, tried to get it running on WebGL, but Unity didn't like it. Oh well, maybe next time.

Anyway, hope you enjoy it.

entries.title: Little Red
entries.description:
# Little Red

It is a storytelling puzzle game, about magic and sacrifices.

## Introduction

Control *Little Red*, the main character, to go cross dangerous forest. Meet different characters, learn magic, and complete the story.

It is a story-driven game. There are two different endings, based on your choices.

There are about 10 puzzles. The difficulty is also influenced by your choices.

## Controls

This game requires keyboard and mouse.

* [SPACE] continue messages
* [1] [2] make choices
* arrow keys for map moving
* [Enter] stay on the same block (no moving)
* [R] restart current level
* mouse click for some skills

This HTML5 game requires WebGL support. Please play with latest Chrome or Firefox.

## Screenshots

![1.png](///raw/460/91/z/1bf62.png)

![3.png](///raw/460/91/z/1bf65.png)

## Tools Used in this Game

Tools:

* Inkscape (image creation)
* LMMS (audio creation)
* Atom (programing)
* Rust, emscripten, and nodejs toolchain

This game is mostly written in Rust and my half-done framework [glayout](https://github.com/LastLeaf/glayout).

## Updates after Compo

The "HTML5" link below contains minor bug fixes:

* fixed a dialog text error
* added a keyboard control limitation in one ending presentation

The itch.io page contains the original compo entry (also HTML5 version). It is better to judge this one, but most cases you won't notice differences.

entries.title: Hermenegildo
entries.description:
HERMENEGILDO is a top down 2D dungeon crawler created for the Ludum Dare 43 game jam. The theme of the jam was “Sacrifices must be made.” The game works in the opposite of traditional games where upgrades occur as the game progresses. In HERMENEGILDO, the player starts out fully upgraded and must sacrifice one upgrade at each step of game progression.

Team

John Gale - Programmer, Narrative

Michael Morrell - Music, Initial Idea

John Hellrung - Level Designer

Tools

RPG Maker MV - main game engine and art assets

entries.title: This is fine
entries.description:
Description:

Your place is on fire and you have a limited amount of time to gather a maximum of your stuff.
Normally, it is impossible to gather everything.

How to play:
Nothing can hurt you except time.
You have to gather as many items as possible. Every time you will pick one item it will decrease the timer.
At the end of the timer it will display what you managed to get and what you did not, with a little funny description (i hope) of the item lost.
Everything that touches the ground contains items.

Controls:
* Right Arrow and Left arrow to go right and left 
* Space to collect items
* R restart only available when you lose

There is no bug in this game, only features :
* The player can escape the area cause I did want people to feel free.
* No music cause this would probably have ruined the immersive graphism I spend so much time on.
* Soapy control the dog is old, c'mon give him a break!
* Graphics are bad, yes, but they are all equally bad and that's a beautiful thing.
* It is hard to pick the items from the TV cause I need you to lose time.
* And the list goes on ...

Excuses for not doing better:
No inspiration, first time drawing with a tablet, motivation going down cause of bad art, unity being unity... and the final boss TIME 

Things I want to share:
I really struggled with the theme and in the end i managed to come out with ideas when i decided to make a theme from the current theme I went with "You can't save everyone" and from there a lot of ideas started to come.

entries.title: Apollo
entries.description:
### About Apollo

Apollo is an retro-style arcade game, inspired by the challenges of space travel. Resources are precious and limited; so using them up is quite the sacrifice!

This is my first ever game jam entry, so I'm very pleased with my result! I'll definitely be coming back to compete in the next jam!

To run the game, download the executable from GitHub and extract from the ZIP archive. Run the file 'Apollo.exe' and all should hopefully work :smile:

### Gameplay

In Apollo you pilot a rocket ship through a field of debris, meteors and alien ships. You need to dodge these obstacles, however moving the rocket sacrifices your limited fuel supply! The goal is to last as long as possible.

Meteors can crash into your ship, while alien ships will shoot lasers at you. Once you have taken damage, you will start to leak oxygen.

The ship is in space, so there it has inertia of course. There's no friction to slow it down automatically!

The game is over when the ship explodes, you suffocate to death or run out of fuel. Good luck!

### Controls

Using A/D or LEFT/RIGHT arrows to control the ship. Sounds simple, right? :wink: 

### Screenshots

![thumbnail.png](///raw/6a6/e1/z/1bdbe.png)
![screenshot1.png](///raw/6a6/e1/z/1bdb6.png)

### What I Used To Make It

Programmed with Python & Pygame

Art drawn in GIMP

Music composed in LMMS

SFXR and Audacity for SFX

Play it: >>>> https://elingranath.itch.io/goatwrath <<<<
----------------------------

IMPORTANT!!! In the WebGL version, clicking can cause your character to freeze up because it will select text outside the game. To avoid this, please HOLD your mouse buttons to attack instead of clicking.

HERE IS AN UPDATED VERSION OF THE GAME! Includes music and is easier to beat for those who want a more chill experience :) If you choose to play the UPDATED version, please either skip voting on the audio altogether or vote solely based off the SFX. The soundtrack was not in the original game so it is unfair to vote on it. This alternate version is only here so more people can enjoy it, regardless of skill level, and to show off the awesome soundtrack my friend made for this game :D
----------------------------
>>>> https://elingranath.itch.io/goatwrath-updated-version <<<<
----------------------------

My first ever Ludum Dare entry! :D I wasn't even sure I was going to get this done in 72 hours, but it wasn't as difficult as I thought. I was able to take it easy on the second day :) The game takes less than 7 minutes to beat if you're fast enough.

How the theme applies: You are able to play through the game normally if you wish, but you will find that it may be very difficult. If you make certain sacrifices, the game becomes easier to beat. Do you want to do it the ethical way or the easy way?

entries.title: Dark Sacrifice
entries.description:
Kill your enemies but spare your HP!

My first ever Game jam and I wasnt home on the 1st day but I still managed to create something!Its not very good, only a prototype but I'll continue working on it!The code us mess uncommented and all the usual stuff because I was in a hurry.

Now the actual game is a top down shooter where you sacrifice HP for shooting and have to coolect 2 goldstars to win while avoiding or killing enemies.So you could just shoot as little as possible but the problem is that you only have limited vision due to a lack of light in that dungeon so your shooting also illuminates the area around you and you can see if any enemies are approaching.So you have to balance HP, visibility and shooting! The idea in my opinion isnt that bad but the execution is horrendous because its a totally unfinished prototype without playtesting!

entries.title: Transit Terror
entries.description:
![Logo.png](///raw/847/7/z/1cc7e.png)
**Transit terror, my Oregon Trail inspired, post-apocalyptic, rng-based cannibal simulator is as finished as it'll probably ever be!** 

Really had fun working on this one. Once again it was nice to go a bit more art focused (still crappy programmer art though lol) instead of working myself up over code. My 4th Ludum Dare submission and definitely not my last! Would love to get some feed back and would be great if you guys tried it out and told me what you think.


**What is the game?**

The game is about driving your bus as far as you can by managing resources and making decisions based on events that will determine the survival of your 20 passengers. Do you stay and fight the hordes of zombies and bandits to perhaps loot some more resources like food or fuel for the road, or do you speed off in an attempt to not risk losing what little you have.
Currently there are about 10 different possible random events, 5 of witch have multiple outcomes. A bit less than I'd hoped but I really just ran out of event ideas :/ Hopefully there's still enough flavour for at least a few runs :) Its a proof of concept if anything. 

![Screenie4.PNG](///raw/847/7/z/1cc84.png)

**Resources, the name of the game**

Managing resources effectively is key. The player will be required to keep tabs on supplies, food, fuel and morale to keep the party going. Running out of fuel? Trade some supplies with a nearby stronghold or camp. Morale running low? Get your guys an extra ration each to keep their spirits up. Haven't found food in a while? That's what the 'Cannibalise' button is for.

![Screenie5.png](///raw/847/7/z/1ccb7.png)

**Upgrade your Post-Apocalyptic Death Chariot**

By spending supplies gathered in the wastelands from random events like winning hostile encounters and scavenging, you can upgrade your bus to not only make it look cool as hell, with the final upgrade sporting an M1 Abrams cannon on the roof, but also increase your combat effectiveness. Combat effectiveness is calculated based on how many passengers you have that can fight, how well supplied you are, and the upgrade level of your Bus.

![BusLevel1.png](///raw/847/7/z/1cc8a.png)
![BusLevel2.png](///raw/847/7/z/1cc87.png)
![BusLevel3.png](///raw/847/7/z/1cc86.png)
![BusLevel4.png](///raw/847/7/z/1cc85.png)

**Tools Used**
Art: Photoshop
Engine: Unity
Scripting: Visual Studio
Music/Ambience: FL Studio 12
Sound: Audacity **Almost all sound effects across all 4 of my Ludum Dare entries have been edited recordings of my mouth**

**Special Thanks**

Big thanks to Papa Porg (https://www.facebook.com/porggod/?ref=br_rs) for shouting out the game in his facebook group.
I never asked him too, he offered it. Thanks fam.

**Final Notes**

Been looking through some of the entries this Ludum and they just keep getting better. I know I say this every time but I'm genuinely so impressed at what some people can do in just a couple of days. Keep it up guys. I'll see you in a few months. 

**IMPORTANT**
Okay, so it's come to my attention that there is a bug where sometimes the road just ends. This is because the the mile count increases based on a collision that occurs when the car translates into a trigger. The car translates on an Update() function and because of this it updates more frequently at higher fps counts. This means that faster computers have more frequent events and a faster bus that will sometimes travel straight through the trigger and into the eternal nothingness. 
The only way I know to fix this is to limit the fps somehow or play on higher resolutions to decrease the fps. I've tried using a FixedUpdate() function but that breaks other stuff. Apologies. I should have noticed this in playtesting and generally just made the game better. It was a very silly way of going about it.

**Hope you enjoy the game.**

entries.title: Z-Trail
entries.description:
![z-trail-cover.png](///raw/86a/3/z/1be07.png)

Hi, my name is Oxrock and thank you for visiting the Z-Trail game page. Z-Trail is a turn based strategy game reminiscent of Oregon Trail but the setting is during a zombie apocalypse. Your party must hazard over 4 thousand miles to Jeuno Alaska, where there's whispers of a safe zone.

![ss-3.png](///raw/86a/3/z/1bdf3.png)




## Gameplay:
Assign your party members tasks to undertake at night. Events will happen occasionally while you're traveling during the day. Do everything you can to keep your party alive long enough to reach your destination!

## Tips:
* You only get one action per night, so make sure none of your party members are idle!
* You sacrifice some health if you take actions while exhausted
* Every turn while over the hunger threshold will cost health
* Sacrificing a night's sleep for guard duty is WORTH IT!
* The vehicle gets slower as it's damaged.
* Actions usually have a corresponding skill. Use the right party member for the task.


## Tools Used:
* Unity
* Gimp
* bfxr
* http://www.fakemusicgenerator.com/ 
* Audacity

## Screenshots:
![ss-1.png](///raw/86a/3/z/1bdee.png)

![ss-2.png](///raw/86a/3/z/1bdf0.png)

entries.title: The Cold Equations
entries.description:
![180402-010438.png](///raw/297/z/1bf36.png)

You play as pilot 8383 on an emergency mission to Woden, where six scientists desperately need the fever serum you're carrying in your cargo. Unfortunately for everyone involved, there's something else in your cargo, and the calculations that filled your tiny ship with fuel didn't take the extra weight into account. 

### The Cold Equations
This is an adaptation of ["The Cold Equations" a 1954 short story by Tom Godwin](http://www.lightspeedmagazine.com/fiction/the-cold-equations/). "The Cold Equations" is an excellent science fiction short story that really evokes a strong emotional response. It's probably my favorite sci-fi short story, but I admittedly haven't read very many. Although I have adapted the story, every line of text in this game was written by me, by hand, during the compo. There might be some exchanges in dialogue that are very close because they left a strong impression upon me, but I strove to make this an original adaptation. For those who have read the short story, you may notice that the character names have been changed. It was an accident at first, but I decided to stick with my misremembered names. 

### Controls
The Cold Equations is controlled entirely by clicking with the mouse. It works very similar to a visual novel. If you're stuck at all, try investigating your cargo. If you're on the desktop version, you can hit 'c' to take a screenshot if you need to show me something. It gets saved in your data path, wherever that is (on Windows that's \LocalLow\Cobalt Sky\The Cold Equations\ for me, but your experience may vary).

### Tools
**Engine** Unity 2018.1.0f2 

**Art** Paint.NET and Blender 

**Sound** Audacity and Bfxr


### Media

https://youtu.be/nxJFlYb1ZnI

Scrap Shot
is a game about battling with your space ship as munition.

![screenshot.png](///raw/62/z/1bf10.png)

Left click to move.

Right click to get options and click an option or press the corresponding number key.

To fire a shot you have to salvage the floor pick it up and then drop it in the hole in the lower right corner.

![medbay.png](///raw/62/z/1bf04.png)

If a floor tile takes enough damage then it will leak oxygen repair it with scrap to stop the leak.

[Brokem.png](///raw/62/z/1bf02.png)

If you stand in a room with not enough oxygen you take damage stand in the med-bay at the lower left corner to heal.

![medbay2.png](///raw/62/z/1bf0a.png)

If the enemy shoots you stand in the top left room to pilot and increase dodge chances.

![deck.png](///raw/62/z/1bf0c.png)

If you get hit a room may be broken and flash with yellow stripes you can't use these rooms when broken, repair a floor tile in the room to fix the room.

![Brokem.png](///raw/62/z/1bf0d.png)

mute and unmute audio with the "M" key or by clicking the icon.


The rest is up to you.!

entries.title: Shooting Chickens
entries.description:
![main.gif](///raw/1c1/f1/z/1be49.gif)

In this game, you're a chicken that shoot little chickens to defeat dogs! The more dogs you shoot a chicken, the faster they'll come to you.

## How to play?

Your objective is to defeat the highest number of dogs that you can! Don't let them touch you or it's game over.

+ **Left arrow** / **Touching the left side of the screen** - Shoot to the left
+ **Right arrow** / **Touching the right side of the screen** - Shoot to the right
+ **Enter** / **Touching anywhere** - Start the game

## Maps and songs

We're talking about **5 maps** and **5 songs**, one for each map! Take a look:

![mapas.gif](///raw/1c1/f1/z/1be60.gif)

### Maps :cityscape:

+ Default
+ Snow :santa:
+ Desert
+ Beach
+ City

### Songs :musical_note:

+ Little Farm
+ Dogs, Chickens and Snowflakes :snowflake:
+ Sunny Day
+ Chickens Rocks
+ Exploding Chickens

## Tools

For making this game, I had to use softwares that I can run on my potato-powered device that is my old computer (as mine isn't working), so here is the list:

+ **Construct 2**: A HTML5 engine for making 2D games
+ **Piskel**: Free sprite editor and animator
+ **Photoshop**: Adobe's image editor
+ **Audacity**: Open source audio editor
+ **Amper Music**: Music composer based on AI

entries.title: Samhein Souls
entries.description:
Samhein Souls:tm:  is a 1vs1 in a mystical, esoterical univers, where each players embodies a witch. The main goal of the game is to bring Satan the Darklord back to life by collecting innocent and pure souls from the living. Games are short, an average of 2-min-game. Graphics are flat and simple(pixel art from very very far). The scene takes place during the night, 3 days before the Samhein. 
The player with the greatest amount of collected souls wins the games and becomes Satan's wife (no regards of the player's gender), and the other one is burned alive.

We've treated the theme "Sacrifices must be made" as a sacred and wicked thing, with an analogy to the Samhein ritual (Halloween nowadays). By sacrificing untouched souls, witches are sacrificing themselves to anger, pride and jealousy. 

We had a lot of fun doing this game, and, as it is our first Ludum Dare (but not first gamejam tho), we are quite proud of the results, even if it is not perfect and some work has to be done. We are planning on working on it again later, to add some functionalities such as familiars which would help you collecting more souls, or changing light atmosphere or animations. 

We are pretty satisfied of this final result, and we hope you will enjoy playing it ;) Also, if you have any piece of advice or any question, please, feel free to ask in the comment section ! :)




NEEDS: 2 X-Box (one) remotes and 2 pure and innocent humans




ROLES:
Unity Developper: Baptiste Guérin

DA/Graphist: Sarah GERGAUD
Graphist: Slevin Vloëbergh

UX and Level Designer: Quentin Renoux 

Yacine El Makhzoumi and Quentin Thomas, two amazing sound designers.




All Game Design Students at School of Design nantes Atlantiques.





Lots of love, 

Sarah, Baptiste, Quentins, Slévin, Yacine

entries.title: Darkest Gods
entries.description:
Darkest Gods is a cookie clicker style game where you play as the brainwashed leader of an evil eldritch cult. Resurrect your god before the portal that heralds his awakening collapses. The game features:

![Screen Shot 2018-12-01 at 2.14.11 PM.png](///raw/d33/f1/z/1bea0.png)

* Four different resources; money, cultists, blood, and mana. Use money to buy the ingredients to brainwash other townspeople, use their bodies in order to make more money, or sacrifice them to feed the growing hunger of your god. Use that blood to worship your god and obtain mana.
* Three different difficulties.
* Use mana to research new technologies.
* Get punished by an evil god as its hunger slowly makes it less and less patient with you. Enjoy all sorts of consequences as you fail to feed the growing infinite hunger.
* Experience random events and a chaos system that increases the amount of badness your cult experiences.
* Eldritch god names randomly generated every playthrough!

![Screen Shot 2018-12-02 at 4.01.37 PM.png](///raw/d33/f1/z/1bebf.png)

entries.title: Diaball
entries.description:
![diaball-banner-916.png](///raw/1e4/3/z/1bce9.png)

In the end, it was a mortal heart that ruined two worlds from salvation, and unleashed the Prime Evil forever.​ A new day breaks for both Demons and Balls. For Ballkind's greatest champion, the **Diaball**, rose to confront the purity that we, in our pride, would not face.​

Play with mouse, everything should be "explained" in game... but since people seem to be missing it, pay attention on third level, there is an apparently missable nugget of information there that makes the game a whole lotta easier.

---

### 🎮🕹️ [Download or play online on itch.io](https://anttihaavikko.itch.io/diaball) 🕹️🎮

---

![diaball-cover.gif](///raw/1e4/3/z/1bcea.gif)

---

### 🛠️ Tools used
- Unity 2018 (with Post Processing and Anima2D)
- Adobe Illustrator & Photoshop
- Bfxr
- Garage Band
- SunVox

---

### :bug: Known bugs

- One of the hearts one the 12th level isn't required
- Holding down the mouse button before a diaball spawns will trigger the slowdown but not show the lines or slow down the music
- Sometimes music slowdown remains even after releasing the mouse button (will fix itself on the next click)

entries.title: The Awful adventures of Awful Dave in Awful 3D World
entries.description:
This is a top down view beat them all, when you fight ennemies in a castle for some reasons.
You capacities used to fight your ennemies are your strength, your resistance and your life amount. Choose to increase one of them, and it will cost the other capacities to decrease, so chose wisely which ones to sacrify !
And you will also have to choose a special power, that you can use once in a room. But using this power will have side effects so be careful !

Oh and the 3D is really awful by the way.. :/

First, you have to choose your speciality (Attack, Resistance or life amount) and a power which have a side effect. You cannot start the game until you chose both if it.

Then, the Inputs :

KEYBOARD : 
- W/Z = UP
- S = DOWN
- A/Q = LEFT
- D = RIGHT
- Left Click = Close Combat
- Right Click = Using your power (usable once in a room, reusable in the next room)

Xbox COntroller :
- Left Stick : Mooves
- X Button : Close Combat
- Y Button = Using your power (usable once in a room, reusable in the next room)

entries.title: Pixel Rot
entries.description:
![1.png](///raw/933/f1/z/1be1a.png)

We set out to create this LD entry using a minimal number of existing tools and frameworks as usual.
The actual game was made using only C++ and SFML, and the graphics were all made using GIMP.

Our take on the theme was to have the backstory incorporate the theme, along with a core gameplay element.
The idea was that the protagonist of the game sets out to save her sibling who has been kidnapped.
This journey is a huge sacrifice on the protagonist's part, her body decaying for every step.
Only by sacrificing enemies and claiming their life force can she combat the decay.

As her body decays, her body mass slowly diminishes, and this allows her to jump higher and reach places that she could usually not.
She has to be careful though, as she also becomes more vulnerable the more her body decays, and as the increased agility is not always a positive thing.

While we started out with a lot of optimism and ambitions, it mostly waned when we realized the core gameplay was not all that fun.
In the end we did not really have the motivation to properly complete the game to our usual level of polish.
We did however make sure there was some kind of end game by adding one of the early design phase sprites (hint: you will realize which one that is once you see it, it's ugly) and having that sprite act as a goal post.
By reaching that point on the map you will be shown a "Congratulations" screen proving that you have completed the game.

Sources are available on GitHub, licensed GPLv3.

### Controls
- Move left on A
- Move right on D
- Jump on space bar
- Shoot on left shift **or** left mouse button

**UPDATE:** After a good night's sleep and a day at work we gathered enough motivation to push ourselves to fix some of the most critical problems with the gameplay, resulting in a much more entertaining game.
As a bonus, we also added gamepad support. The ugly goal sprite is now replaced with something slightly less ugly, but the end game is still only a simple congratulations screen.

We hope you enjoy playing this updated version of the game :)

entries.title: Sacrifice Yourself!

Help). Now his plan has trapped our Hero (I've forgotten his name so he's called whatever you can think of) in a castle, where he will watch our Hero (TM) die in combat with some purple aliens, because thats what evil people do right? Anyway, in the castle the aliens gain speed with time, but our astute Hero can sacrifice his power, to slow down the ever quickening aliens. Nightlight is my first Ludum Dare game ever. You play as a little black orb wandering through a pitch black game environment. You can project your light into the level to see through the blackness but be careful! Projecting your light drains your life force, once you've used up all your life, you're dead. Sacrifice your health to see the level and make it through this platformer.

W - Jump
Space - Project Light

entries.title: Neon Tank Warrior
entries.description:
![Screenshot 2018-12-02 at 21.09.20 (3).png](///raw/835/z/1bdf2.png)

![s2.png](///raw/835/z/1be71.png)

![Screenshot 2018-12-02 at 21.09.46 (3).png](///raw/835/z/1bdf7.png)

![s4.png](///raw/835/z/1be69.png)

## Story:
In 2018 the bitcoin crisis has escalated and eventually led to the society's downfall. States descended into chaos and their remains are ran by the corporations and private armies controller by warlords. The world has become a hunting ground where only one rule applies - survival of the fittest. But there is still hope, legendary City of the lights. Legend says, it's hard to reach the city and the journey requires many sacrifices. But legendary neon tank warriors are not scared of sacrifice and to reach the end of their journey they are able to sacrifice even components from their tanks.

**You are one of the legendary neon tank warriors**

**And this is your journey**

## Controls: 
**WASD / Arrow Keys** Move tank around

**Mouse** Aim

**Left Mouse Button** Primary Weapon

**Right Mouse Button** Secondary Weapon

**CTRL / CMD + Q** Quit game any time

## Team:
[Martin Novák](http://www.twitter.com/wolaroj) - Coding, 2D Graphics, Bitching Around

**Ondřej Dovec** - 3D Models, Enemy Design, Food Delivery

**Lukáš Tůma** - Level Design, Drinking Coffee

**Adam Lysák** - Coding

**Wolar Games** (Our company) -  [Web](http://www.wolargames.com) | [Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/wolargames) | [Facebook](http://www.facebook.com/wolargames)

## Tools:
Unity, Photoshop, Blender, Audacity, DoTween (Unity Plugin) 

## Notes:
This time we worked for around 24 hours in total (12 hours per day, 2 days)

There is a known bug in the game that causes "give up" text to disappear on the button. If this happens, the red button means -> Double Click to Give Up. Another know bug is that under some circumstances some enemies might be able to push you out of level. We also had some performance problems with runtime nav mesh regeneration but that is hopefully fixed / improved.

Source code is stripped of all the paid Unity plugins (editor extensions) and pro version of DoTween was replaced with free version. But the game is still fully functional. Requires Unity 2018.3.x (uses nested prefabs)

**We did not create all the Audio (we have downloaded music and some sound effects) so we opt-out Audio category. Music was downloaded from [https://freemusicarchive.org/](https://freemusicarchive.org/) by Bio UniMetre**

entries.title: Escape from the Prison Camp
entries.description:
Escape from the Prison Camp started as an idea I had a while ago, and then this came around and it seemed like an interesting idea to combine. 

So I went with it, got my freshly updated (self written) game engine and gave it a go.

Ran into plenty of issues, with both the engine and just general bugginess of things I was trying; so didn't get anywhere close to the original idea. 
But we got it working anyway! And it's done within the time.

Hopefully we'll get more done the next time, when we flesh out some of these bugs with the engine.

Thanks for playing and all the support I received on the stream.

entries.title: CatBot
entries.description:
![cover.png](///raw/a82/e/z/1bdf4.png)

![CatBot.png](///raw/a82/e/z/1be21.png)

![DogBotBoss.png](///raw/a82/e/z/1be22.png)



You are CatBot, the guardian of Night City. Your mission is to fend off the attack of the DogBots long enough to allow for the evacuation of the city. They will try to overwhelm you, but you can give up a bit of energy to access a new area and get some space. DogBots forces are based on close quarter warriors, so don't let them get close. They also developped a technology to make some of their bots explode when they're close from you, be extra careful when you see a red blinking DogBot. All of them are led by battle hardened bosses. If you see the spikes on their backs or hear the deep sound of their weaponry, find cover or prepare to dodge their high caliber bullets. 

You can play the game in your browser in medium quality, or you can download it for Windows on itch.io, that way you can adjust the quality settings according to your hardware. You can also download the source code on Google Drive. Thanks for playing! Feel free to comment your high score!

Known bug:

* Enemy bosses don't change material when behind an obstacle

Tools used:

* Engine: Unity 2017.3
* Editor: Microsoft Visual Studio 2015
* 3D Graphics: Blender, Substance Painter and AssetForge
* 2D Graphics: GIMP
* SFX: My mouth (and Audacity)
* Music: SoundTrap

entries.title: Itza Panic
entries.description:
This game is a tower defense game where you need to sacrifice people and animals to generate power in order to build towers. Leave a comment and I'll make sure to try out your game too. Let me know how long you lasted, my best is 44 years.

Aim of the game: Try and survive for as long as possible against waves of mysterious invaders

How to play: Sacrifice animals and prisoners to generate 'Nature' and 'Revenge' power to build towers to repel the invaders. In desperate times you can also sacrifice your youngsters to gain 'Vitality' and Elders to gain 'Elder'. These two towers are more powerful but more expensive.

Notes: 
Farms generate 2 animals per year
Prisons allow room for 5 additional prisoners
Houses allow 8 citizens to live
Youngsters and Adults generate children if there is population space.
As the years pass these citizens age
Elders generate passive power (except 'Revenge')
Prisoners have a chance to be captured when a tower hits an enemy
Prisoners can be sacrificed for power or ransomed for gold
Towers can't be built in the firing range of other towers (The extra range of vitality towers can restrict future tower placement)

Towers:
Nature - Average Fire Rate, Average Health, Average Capture Chance
Vitality - Average Fire Rate, High Health, Low Capture Chance, High Range
Elder - Very Fast Fire Rate, Low Health, High Capture Chance
Revenge - Fast Fire Rate, Average Health, Very High Capture Chance

Tips:
At the start of the game sacrifice all your animals and build a Nature Tower
Either Sacrifice your prisoners to get a Revenge tower as soon as possible or ransom them to build farms for more animals
Build a house with your initial money as you start close to the pop cap
The spawn rate gets faster over time and starts to really ramp up after 25 years
![Game.png](///raw/50c/8/z/1bdab.png)

entries.title: Bomba Ball
entries.description:
Bomba ball is a brand-spanking-new sport that combines physical excellence and high explosives.

As coach, assign your players roles to play and let them do the work. But remember: The one who makes a goal blows up with the bomb, so you'll have to plan ahead to manage your team well!

Play against Ai or another person!

![SS_1.gif](///raw/e0c/z/1bcd2.gif)
![SS_3.gif](///raw/e0c/z/1bcd3.gif)

[Gameplay]

Using the mouse, you can assign 3 players to a game. you must have 1 designated to make the score, but the other two can get assigned to chase the ball, defend the goal, or defend the midfield.

the player stats can help you dictate who might be good in what position. for instance, a high speed player might be good as a chaser.

after that, you watch the game play out! if it goes on for long enough, you can call a time out (if you or nobody controls the ball) and give new instructions to your men.

Created in Gamemaker 1.4 in about 24 hours.

- 1.0.0 - The actual submission - Web + Windows

- 1.1.0 - Added U.I. to make everything more clear and changed up fonts - Web + Windows

- 1.2.0 - Fixed a game-breaking bug where the food could collide with the player, not-allowing it to throw it some times - Web + Windows

**Gameplay:**

Gorth is a fast-paced game where you must sacrifice different food items that spawn randomly around the map to a big hole in the middle named "Gorth".
Gorth's minion will tell you what Gorth wants to eat. whether is sugar, meat or vegetable. 




We were a team of 3, a Sound Designer + Graphic, graphic+animations and a Programmer+Game Designer.
Please note this is our first Ludum dare so we do not expect something amazing out of the results...

left + right arrows = movement

up arrow = jump

F = pickup item

space = throw item

**Tools:**

Engine: Unity 2018

Sound Design: Audacity + GXSCC

IDE: Visual Studio 2017 Community

Graphic design: Aseprite + Photoshop

OS: Windows



Good luck to everyone else!

entries.title: Duof
entries.description:
# Duof

![Gameplay screenshot](///content/ecc/f/z/1bdec.png)

## About

The world of magicians is suffering a zombies apocalypse!

Help the great magician Duof (*) to survive as long as you can by fighting back hordes of zombies trying to drain your life (red magicians) or your time (green ones).

Use your spells book to defend yourself, but be aware: spells will cost you your life / time as well! 

One last note: healing powerups will randomly appear on the map,  so keep moving and look for them!

(*) From "Du oferoj" ("Two sacrifices", in Esperanto)

## Controls

* W, A, S, D: move

* Mouse left button: shoot
* Spacebar: swap ammo type (life / time)

entries.title: Flock of Salvation
entries.description:

It is now your job, as the tribe's medicine man, to calm them down.

Grab object: Left mouse button  
Throw object: Right mouse button  

Hitting crows with stones builds up your Mojo. Sacrificing crows in the Pit soothes the gods. Your Mojo increases the effectiveness of the offerings. Getting hit hurts your Mojo.

Soothe the gods before they wipe out your whole tribe.

entries.title: Aztec: One Nation Under Lord Eldorado
entries.description:
Story: You are the high priest in charge of the Aztec nation. You have made a pact with the deity Lord Eldorado to sacrifice as many citizens as you can in his honor. In exchange Lord Eldorado has granted you with golden skin and bladed arms, to carry out your task more efficiently. The citizens are not happy about these developments, they have decided to rebel.

![Aztec_screenshot.gif](///raw/444/02/z/1bdd8.gif)

Gameplay: You will be provided with sacrificial citizens, sacrifice them to sustain yourself. The rebel citizens will climb up the temple stairs to stop you, defeat them to break their will. If you fail in your task, Lord Eldorado will cast you into damnation.

Controls: Left/Right arrow keys or A/D keys for movement, left mouse click for attack.

Installation & launching:
1. Download .zip from the provided Google Drive link (download arrow icon on the top right in Google Drive)
2. Extract the "OneNationUnderLordEldorado" folder from the .zip
3. Run the Unity Build from "Aztec - One Nation Under Lord Eldorado.exe"
4. Pick 1600x900 resolution from the Unity Launcher if available
5. Alt+F4 to close the game and to relaunch if you want to play again

Notes: Unity 2D game for Windows. Development time somewhere around 14 hours. Numerous bugs and wonky physics for maximal player enjoyment. Minimum semi-viable gameplay loop & functionality. Unity Build best played on 1600x900 resolution full screen, other resolutions will break UI element placements. No menus, use alt+f4 to close the game.

Software used: Unity, Visual Studio, Blender, Audacity, GIMP.

Credits: Sound assets by Henri. Game design, code and art assets by rakholl & Jaawa.

entries.title: Omelettes
entries.description:
A puzzle game about breaking a few eggs

-----------------------------------------------------------------

Platforms have height

You can move up or down one level at a time

You can push objects on the same level as you

![g4.gif](///raw/39/z/1bdb1.gif)

Eggs will break if they fall two or more levels

Eggs will always break if they land in a pan

Make an omelette in each pan to complete a level

![g1.gif](///raw/39/z/1bd98.gif)

WASD / Arrow Keys : Move

Z / Backspace : Undo

R : Reset            P : Skip Level
![g2.gif](///raw/39/z/1bd94.gif)

entries.title: Cats vs Drones
entries.description:
LD43 - Sacrifices must be made.

We're running out of money fast.  My cats and I are going to starve.

There sure are a lot of those delivery drones flying around with boxes of goodies.  If there were only a way to go them.  I have an old circus cannon, but nothing to launch, unless ... hmm, here kitty, kitty ...

Aim your "kitty" cannon at the drones by using your mouse.  Press any key or the left mouse button to launch your kitty at the drone.  If you hit the drone, your kitty will weigh down the drone enough to safely land with the goods.  If you miss, your kitty will fall to ground a little too fast even if it does land on it's feet :( .  If you run out of money or cats, the game is over.  The game will restart in a few seconds.  

The goal is to stay alive for as long as you can, but the drones just fly faster and faster...

entries.title: SATIATE!
entries.description:
![scram.gif](///raw/ffd/z/1be2c.gif)

![Screen Shot 2018-12-02 at 10.33.06 PM.png](///raw/ffd/z/1bdba.png)An alien with an insatiable appetite has attacked your camp. Satiate its cravings using any means necessary... even if it means sacrificing your own people.

Wasn't able to add everything I wanted to. Namely, onboarding/tutorials could be a lot better, plus I originally envisioned an endgame where the goal would be to 'craft' a radar beacon to 'call in the cavalry' and kill the alien.

The basic gist of it is you need to have 'Food' equal or more than the 'Need' demand shown in the bottom right. Otherwise the alien will eat you. You can get 'Food' by farming, or throwing people to the dispenser (Blue factor).

Move around with the arrow keys, pressing space will make people near you 'follow' you. Pressing 'Z' near a building will assign one follower to that building.

if You now don't have enough energy to fly to next station,

entries.title: Spaceships Must Explode
entries.description:
![ld43-3.gif](///raw/9ca/31/z/1ce66.gif)

This game is turn based. You control a spaceship which consists of modules. 
## Modules
Any flying module that hits the ship will be attached to it.
Only if module is reachable from **Main Module** it can be attach to the ship. A module can't be reached through a **Block Module**.

There are few types of modules:
- **Main module**. If this module is destroyed you lose
![main_module.png](///raw/9ca/31/z/1bd18.png)
- **Empty module**
![module.png](///raw/9ca/31/z/1bd19.png)
- **Engine module**. Allow you to move.
![engine_hor.png](///raw/9ca/31/z/1bd1c.png)   ![engine_ver.png](///raw/9ca/31/z/1bd1d.png)
- **Block module**. Other modules can't be reached from it.
![block_module.png](///raw/9ca/31/z/1bd4b.png)
- **Swap module**. Allows you to swap 2 modules at the en of a level
![swap_module.png](///raw/9ca/31/z/1bd1e.png)


## Movements
You move by turns with burs fires from engines. You can only move in a direction if you have an engine facing opposite direction. E.g. if you only have 2 engines facing left, you can only move right 1 or 2 spaces.
## Enemies
Your enemies are orange asteroids that fly around. If they hit any of your modules, they will be destroyed along with module.
## Engine blast
You can destroy enemies (or flying modules) with blasts from your engines. Those explosions will also destroy any module underneath an engine, so be careful.
## Sacrifice
You can sacrifice any of your modules in order to overload your engines. This will last one turn and each engine will be able to move the ship 2 spaces instead of 1. Click on any module to sacrifice it.
## Swapping
For each **Swap Module** at the end of a level, you can swap two modules. Simply click modules to swap them. You can swap a module with an empty space to just move it.

entries.title: Sacrifice Party

**[TW : cartoon violence against animals]** This game has for theme occult ceremonies and does picture animal sacrifice. The author does not condone satanism or violence against animals. 

This is a game where you need to invoke Satan, by invoking lesser demons first. You can see it as a mix between cooking mama and Keep talking and nobody explodes.

My body decided that the ludum dare weekend was a great time to be ill. I managed the most I could but I did prioritize my health. This is why stuff that I wanted in (sound, for example) is absent.

I hope you will enjoy it nonetheless. The interface and goals are a bit obscure and that's part of the gameplay (partly).

The game is only played with mouse or touch (i recommend the android version)

Made with HaxeFlixel on ArchLinux using vscode as an editor.
Graphics made with Gimp.

**Known bug:** if you get the same recipe for two demons/Satan, you won't be able to win, just restart the game.

entries.description:
![logo.png](///raw/744/8/z/1bd3b.png)

VOID_SHOT is a manic, fast-paced shooter where you will need to sacrifice your health to attack your enemies.

![2.png](///raw/744/8/z/1bd3c.png)

# And here the rules!

-Move with ([WASD/Arrow keys] + [spacebar]) or (the mouse).

-You need both health and ammo to shoot.

-You get ammo when you get hurt by enemies.

-Enemies drop health and ammo pickups.

-Try to get the best score possible!

![4.png](///raw/744/8/z/1bd3d.png)

# Dev's comment

Finally, I made something that I'm fully proud of. Bug-less (I think 😝), full of polish, and, most of all, fun. I think I might get at least 200th for this one. High hopes! 😃

Devlog 1: Post-jam version 1.1 has been uploaded, with a few minor tweaks: smooth turning with keyboard controls, slower death animation.

# Gameplay video:

https://youtu.be/nSbgzBOfiJ8

# Credits

Practically everything I made was by myself, except for:

**Fonts:**

- Orbitron

- Menu hover sound by Gamba Studio

entries.title: Eradicator
entries.description:
The **ERADICATOR** is the latest weapon created by the army. An incredible machine built to kill efficiently.
But it needs a driver, and you are the one they picked. They hand you a list of targets.

![screen_18.png](///raw/8ef/z/1bcdc.png)

Unfortunately, they are all located inside a huge city filled with innocent people.
Your orders? Kill your targets while limiting collateral damage.

With that in mind, you are now looking at the city from the sky... Ready to shoot for the next 2 minutes.

![screen_13.png](///raw/8ef/z/1bcec.png)

Bear in mind your bullets won't only kill the ones you're supposed to kill...

**Controls:**
* Use the **mouse** for everything! Move the crosshair towards the side of the screen to move the drone.
* Click the **left mouse button** to shoot!

And that's all you have to know. You are, after all, a soldier who's following the orders.

Good luck.

![screen_17.png](///raw/8ef/z/1bcfa.png)

_Programs used:_
* _GameMaker Studio 1.4_

* _Bxfr / cGMusic / GXSCC_

entries.title: Accult (Don't judge by the cover)
entries.description:
You manage a cult which must recruit members, (The Chosen), keep hidden from the police, have income, and most importantly, keep the Gods happy. To do this, you must sacrifice a Chosen once in a while. Over time, people become more and more suspicious, and might call the police. If you can't bribe them, it's over. If the Gods become angry, it's over. If you can't feed your Chosen, it's over. So. How long can you last?

Made with Unity, Visual Studio, Gimp, SFXR, Audacity, and The World Wide Web (mostly for procrastination).
By BS Studios (@kerbaman & @bendoair-(couldn't participate))
This was also my first game jam, so I think it turned out pretty nicely.

# Gods are fighting each other
## and the only way to save the world is via some sacrifices...
![ezgif-2-8c8f4c9b3988.gif](///raw/806/c/z/1bcc1.gif)

## Gather resources in order to survive the day...
![ezgif-2-b9a34ae41c51.gif](///raw/806/c/z/1bcda.gif)

![8d4565e222f81bca8489663a95715455.png](///raw/806/c/z/1bcd1.png)

![ezgif-2-bc395d4d4075.gif](///raw/806/c/z/1bcee.gif)

# GAMEPLAY:
 Gather ** resources ** to stay alive. ** White ** boxes give you more while ** grey ** ones take some away.
You can ** sacrifice ** resource to gods by selecting it and then pressing ** [ SACRIFICE ] **

While you are staying alive, you also need to keep ** gods ** in balance. By sacrificing resource with ** blue-outline ** you give power to ** blue god **, ** red-outline ** for ** red god **

If either of the ** gods ** wins the war or you ** run out ** of one of your ** resources **  , it's ** game over **.

(Don't worry, this all is explained in the game <3)

entries.title: Unenergetic
entries.description: ​This game is about a man who is running on the street, looking for food. And like the real human body, if it doesn't get energy from external sources (e.g. food), it starts consuming itself. If you run out of energy, you have to choose a limb to be sacrificed for food. Your goal is to survive as long as possible ​with as many limbs left as possible.

entries.title: Santa frowns to town
entries.description:
![ld43-binocle-cover.png](///raw/d26/z/1bbb2.png)

# About the game

Santa has been kidnapped and kept away in a tower by the evil witch of Halloween. She's jealous of Santa and wants to take all the gifts to children herself.
But she still needs Santa to get them ready. It's your mission, as Santa, to get the toys, put them in the packages and wrap them up and deliver to the elves who will take care of filling the sled. You have to wrap up enough gifts or the witch will come and sacrifice a Christmas elf to punish you!

## How to play

Use the arrow keys to move, UP to jump and SPACE to interact with the toys, boxes, wraps and elves. Pick up the toy, bring it to the box and put it in there.
Then wrap up the box and bring it to an elf. The elf will take care of delivering it to the sled. Hurry up!

## Important information

The web version might hang or just be unresponsive. In that case please try the Windows of macOS version.

entries.title: Sacrificial Fruit
entries.description:
![Photo.png](///raw/98e/91/z/1bc28.png)

You and your fellow orange friends need to escape the Blender before you're eviscerated by the blades at the bottom. You all know that to get to the top you must sacrifice a few fellow oranges.

The whole concept of the game is to reach the top of the blender by using your past oranges as platforms and walls to bounce off of.

Jumping is done by holding, or pressing W and moving left and right with A and D. You can sacrifice yourself manually if you press SPACE and are adjacent to another orange. Aim to collect all of the coins and make it to the top!

Upon reflection, I feel that more time should have been spent in development stages and coming up with a definitive idea since this one was changed a number of times. Furthermore, I would have preferred some more polish if given the time which I don't have.

You take damage whenever you fire but can regenerate that by sacrificing the score that you gained from destroying enemy ships.

WASD for movement. 
QE for rotation. 
R to sacrifice points to regain health. 
Space to fire.

entries.title: Third
entries.description:
## My second LD attendance - yet the game is called the Third

### This time with title screen, cats and monsters!

### The story
I guess this game does not need much words, you are welcomed to try playing it: and you are necessarily going to immediately fail few times and soon you will get an idea what you are supposed to do for successful survival.
#### but anyway... ####
Monsters are trying to get to your house, place your cats on entrances to scare them off. But cats don't stay on one place where you put them for a long, right? And when the situation gets out of control, sacrifice a kitten on your home altar. Don't worry, it respowns, but after a short moment, so use sacrifices wisely.


![ld43-02_item-carry.gif](///raw/b56/31/z/1bba8.gif)


### Known Issues
Unity3d WebGL build is playable but lacks smoothness of desktop one - the game is too unoptimized to work 100% fine in browser as it is and overall feeling laggy with unreliable collision detections. Especially after scene load when player busy, leading to buggy behavior allowing the player to escape boundaries. Taking a note myself for next time to test, if you are more seriously interested please download binaries :)


### Tools and resources used
- Unity 2017 on Linux 🐧
- Gimp, FL Studio + Audacity, BFXR
- Homespun Font by Brian Kent (https://www.1001freefonts.com/homespun.font)

### Thanks to [Herni Laborator](https://www.facebook.com/Labassistent/) for organizing the site

entries.title: Overtime

A hand-drawn story game which forces the player to decide between working long hours to pay off their debt or spending time with their family.

## About
This is my first Ludum Dare attempt.

There's a lot more story than gameplay. The theme lead me to an idea which ended up being more narrative than interactive.

Press Spacebar to advance text when you see "[Space]" in the bottom-right.

Minigames have instructions before they start, but are usually controlled by moving the mouse up and down, or using the arrow keys.

entries.title: The War of the Four Races
entries.description:
## **Story**

> Welcome to hell on earth, as four warring races attempt to kill each other for domination of the world. As the benevolent god that you are, you don't want this to happen. Although you are too lazy to fix their disputes. 

## **Controls**

- Snap half a specific race to create a Holy being

## **How to play**

- Reds kills Blue
- Blues kills Green
- Greens kills Yellow
- Yellows kills Red

- Evil [Purple] spawns when you have overpopulation and kills all of the colored races above.
- Holy [White] spawns when you snap a race in half and kills Evil.
- The more individuals alive are the higher your score is.
![rules.PNG](///raw/6eb/z/1bb89.png)

## **Screenshots**

![Screenshot1.PNG](///raw/6eb/z/1bb7b.png)

![Screenshot3.PNG](///raw/6eb/z/1bb7c.png)

![Screenshot4.PNG](///raw/6eb/z/1bb7d.png)

![Screenshot2.PNG](///raw/6eb/z/1bb8e.png)

## **Notes**

> Please vote in all tabs, and I love comments, both positive and negative and I encourage anonymous comments if you're shy. Please take a minute to let me know what you think.!

> I wasn't planning on doing anything for this jam, but I've managed to slap something quick in a few hours and called it a game!

entries.title: Ludum Dare 43 Submission: SPLIT_SHOT
entries.description:
SPLIT_SHOT is a 2D bullet-hell coliseum game where the player is stuck within a single area and must survive endless rounds of enemies. These enemies range from various types and the player must be able to beat as much of them as possible. Using the player's weapon will inflict self-damage to the player's lifepoint. Having a lifepoint of 0 will result in a game-over. However, the player is able to slowly regenerate it's lifepoint over time. The player is able to carry one weapon and one special ability. Over time, some drops will appear that will grant the player a new weapon or ability. This however, replaces the current weapon or ability of the player. The player must decide what is worth keeping and what is not. Enemies will spawn at different angles and will surround the player. After a set of rounds, the game will become harder and harder where enemies will hit harder, harder to be destroyed, or that the player will inflict less damage.

The tools I used is the post-processing stack from Unity and an open-sourced code about sprite glow, (https://github.com/Elringus/SpriteGlow). I also used a downloaded font from an open-sourced website (daFont.com)

WASD for movement,
Spacebar for shooting/ using your weapon
E for using your ability
Esc to open pause menu

entries.title: Maze of Death
entries.description:
**Maze of Death** is my second C64 game for Ludum Dare. You have to find your way through a dangerous maze where all walls are poisoned. To reach the exit you have to die - a lot! Luckily you can collect your dead bodies to get back your lost live and continue your search for the right way to the exit.

Attention: You need a real C64 or an emulator like WinVICE to play this game. ~~I'll add more options to play later in the evening.~~

Unfortunaly I'm not able to provide you with a HTML5 version, as I can't get VICE.js to work with gamepad or keyboard. Nonetheless you can download a proper C64 emulator for your system here: http://vice-emu.sourceforge.net/. 

## Running on Windows ##
Download WinVICE from above site and unpack the files in a folder of your choise. Copy everything from the Commodore 64-zip (mazeofdeath.zip) into the WinVICE folder. Run *start.bat* to automatically run **Maze of Death** in the emulator. Use numpad to play the game. If you prefer a gamepad go to *Settings > Joystick settings > Joystick settings...* and select your gamepad from the select box of Joystick #2. In this dialog you can also create your personal control scheme.

## Running on other systems ##
Unfortunaly I can't provide any help to make **Maze of Death** work on OSX or Linux. But steps should be similar.

## Compiling the source ##
To compile the source code you need **CBM prg Studio** (http://www.ajordison.co.uk/). Beware: The game is much slower, if compiled from sources. Maze generation takes over a minute, also moving the player is slower. 

You'll need a BASIC compiler for C64 to make the game faster. For **Maze of Death** I used Austrospeed. Other compilers like Basic-Boss or BASIC 64 might also work, but need some compiler directives to run properly. Speed improvements are subtle with other compilers. 

![mod_ingame_2.gif](///raw/7e5/a1/z/1bb04.gif)

So, go and challenge the Bad Gods, what are you waiting for?:)

**Development Tools:**

- Unity 3D

- Visual Studio
 
- Photoshop

- Wolfram Tones Music Generator

**Little Tutorial:**
- Drag people from house to the Totem to decrease Gods Rage (but you also decrease the people happiness then)

entries.title: Wizard Malikens spell failed
entries.description:
You are on your way to the tower of a powerful wizard, your village needs protection from an orc army on the march. But when you arrive the castle is empty. Something went wrong. What do you do now? How to find out what happened? And how can you bring Maliken back to save your village? What will be the sacrifice?

This is a Gothic / Risen style game. Unlike Oblivion / Skyrim you don't have quest markers guiding you from A to B. You actualy have to read, listen and think to find the next place to go to. Where would you place a building with an important function? Near the center or far out? Would you prefer to carry buckets of water up hill or downhill? Would you raise smelly animals near the living rooms of people or far away?

Thou art the god of an elder tribe. It falls on thy hands to lead thy people to honor and prosperity!

We made the game in one day (it's all the time we could spare), so it is mostly incomplete.
But at least we got something working!

How to play:
The game is turn based. To end your turn, click on the clock in the upper right corner.
Every few days, you will get a prompt from your Chieftain, and you get some options.
That's... all pretty much. You can't lose or win, but you can go up to 7 days of dialogue!

You can click on buildings to produce more people.
People generate resources (and eat food) every day.
Have fun!

entries.title: The Altar of Sacrifice
entries.description:
![ld43_12.gif](///raw/e40/3/z/1ba7e.gif)

## Description

**Objective**
- Comply with 20 sacrifices to win.
- Don't lower to 0 the "popularity" meter (nor your health, of course)

**Gameplay**
- Grab villagers from the outsides of the houses or buy pigs at the shop to sacrifice at the altar.  
- Two hits are needed to grab a villager. The first hit will leave the villager running for help. If it manages to collide with another villager, it will get "upset" and it will lower your popularity meter.  
- If you're carrying a villager you must avoid touching other villagers, as they will became "upset" too and lower your popularity meter as well.
- To increase your popularity meter you have to spend money at the shop.
- The god of raining boulders is angry. Boulders will rain from the sky constantly. One hit drains half of your life bar, two hits and you're dead. Don't forget to buy potions at the shop.
- A reptilian thief will run from left to right every once in a while. If you manage to kill him you'll earn 50 gold coins to spend at the shop. Be aware that reptilian thiefs are fast bastards, so they may run away from your range if you don't manage to land 5 hits on them prior to reaching your village's limits.


**Potions**
- Potions can be bought at the shop and they will be consumed automatically when the player gets hurt.


## Notes

I've used my previous entry as a "game engine" and that allowed me to have the Sunday off and also to spend a little bit more time with the music than in my previous jams (I have loops longer than 16 beats... ooooohhhh xD).  
Borrowed gameplay ideas from my LD40 entry **"Billy the giant hates dancing paragliders on a boat"**. You could say that this entry is the sequel to that game, and that game's prequel was **"7th Day"**. So overall I have a trilogy going on here (lol).  
  
If you beat the game you'll be rewarded with the best piece of music of the game IMO. That monotone rhythmic tune will be burned in your brain if you listen to it long enough.  

I was going to ditch Pico-8 for LD43 due to being a little bit tired of it's token limit, but I couldn't finish my Löve2D based engine **sff-love** (https://github.com/SuperFastFramework/sff-love) so I had to use **sff-p8** (https://github.com/SuperFastFramework/sff-p8) that is very reliable, specially the html5 export.  

That's it, hope you enjoy the game!  



![upsetted_villager.png](///raw/e40/3/z/1ba79.png)  
![reptilian_thief.png](///raw/e40/3/z/1ba78.png)
