entries.title: SEVER
entries.description:
## Introduction
**SEVER** is a short but difficult game, based around the player sacrificing their own limbs in order to gain power. The player must destroy all of the abominations in order to complete the game, difficult as this may be.

The game's controls and instructions can be found in the **MANUAL** section of the main menu.

If you enjoy the game (or even if you don't), please give it a rating, and if you want to keep an eye on my future work head over to [@lazinix on Twitter](https://www.twitter.com/lazinix).
## About
**SEVER** is a game made in under 48 hours for **Ludum Dare 43**, for which the theme was 'Sacrifices must be made'. This is the second Ludum Dare project I have worked on, and my fourth game jam project overall. My previous Ludum Dare project, [Mail Room](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/42/mail-room), received an average rating of **3.75** out of **5**, and was made for Ludum Dare 42. If you like **SEVER**, check it out.
The source files for **SEVER** are all included; scripts, sprites, and animations can all be viewed and edited, so if you feel like fixing some of my bugs feel free to go poking around. If you do, please let me know, as I'd love to see what you do!

entries.title: Alain's Sacrifice
entries.description:
Alain's Sacrifice is a 5 to 10 minutes game that I have made for LudumDare 43, being the theme: "Sacrifices must be made". This is my first LD and I am quite happy with the result.

Years ago, the kingdom of Ralidon was conquered by the Erradi - dark, cruel creatures coming from the underworld. Now you - Alain Grayrock - were years studying wizardry to become a mage and defeat the Erradi.
After all these years, you discovered that only one thing can both destroy the Erradi and save Ralidon, the Gems of Life. Hence you went to look for the Gems and found five of them
But when you found the gems, something terrible happened. You developed a link with them. If you give them up you will lose your life
Nevertheless, you decide to sacrifice yourself, give up your life in order to save the kingdom of Ralidon

Move with W and D, jump with space and use left click to shoot. Enjoy!![2018-12-02 (4).png](///raw/cc5/d1/z/1ba89.png)

entries.title: Lazors
entries.description:
## Instructions
Capture flags by holding E when you're near it (there's an in-game hint).
You will die when you capture the flag (theme incorporation)
Whoever owns the most amount of flags will deplete the enemy team's tickets.
When you cancel a capture, you have to wait half a second for your character to recover.

## Important
This game has an update bug with monitors that have a higher refresh rate than 60Hz.
If the game is running more than 60fps, try disabling G-sync, or run the game in windowed.
Thanks.

## Controls 
- WASD or Arrow Keys - Movement
- Left Click - Shoot

- E (hold) - Capture flag
- B - Toggle Bloom (toggle this if your game is running slow)
- M - Toggle Sounds
- F1 - Toggle Fullscreen
- F12 - Take a screenshot (located %localappdata%\Lazors)

## Credits
- Everything made from @BingdomOriginal (twitter)

(sorry for the dot points. I'm not sure how to work newlines)

entries.title: Serpent's Souls
entries.description:
Unfortunately it's not really finished.

The base gameplay is working and it's playable and kinda enjoyable for a while.
I hopefully will spend some time expanding it out and making the late game and combat more interesting.

Please read the instructions below since they're not really explained in the game:

Instructions
------------

Goal: Sacrifice 100 souls to the Serpent Totem in your starting town to summon the Serpent God before you are overrun by invading colonists (represented by the red at the top of the world map).

Gameplay
--------

![overview.png](///raw/980/1/z/1ba2c.png)

Each turn you get 3 actions per town (upgraded towns get 4 or 5 depending on the size), and 1 per army.

Spend your actions by activating "Site abilities", click on a site, then click on the ability on the right panel to activate it (you must meet the requirements, usually a number of followers (blue figures)).

Undo a move by right clicking.

Most Site's can only use one ability per turn, unless the ability is marked as "multi-use" in which case you can use it as many times as you like, provided you meet the requirements.

You can build new Buildings on empty sites with 3 followers, or 2 followers worked to death.

If you're out of space, you can Expand your town from the Serpent Totem or Village Square with 10 Followers and 3 actions, this will also grant an increase in Action income.

Activate Relocate to pick up and move units between any number of sites (or place on the world map adjacent to your town to make an army). You can hold down the button to suck up lots of units or drop lots of units. Once you're done, click the Relocate button again to finish. (This whole process only uses 1 action point, but use it wisely)

You can also use Shamans (purple figure) directly, click on one and it'll show a list of Shaman abilities, these work much the same as Site abilities, but they can also require a number of souls, a Shaman can gather souls by killing followers and the like, granting them more powers. If you have a Shaman gain many souls from killing, they can be later sacrificed to the Serpent God by sacrificing the Shaman at the Serpent Totem.

However, sacrificing increases Rebellion in the town, for every Rebellion over 5, a new Rebel (red figure) is spawned in the town, and rebellion will go down slightly. But each turn that ends with a Rebel in the town, the rebellion will increase by 1 per Rebel.
You can deal with Rebels by building a Temple and Re-educating them, or building a Barracks and training Soldiers (green figures), if a Soldier ends their turn on the same site as a Rebel, they will kill each other. Temples and Watchtowers can also help reduce Rebellion before Rebels are spawned.

Once you're out of useful actions, End the Turn in the bottom right.
However, the Serpent God requires at least one sacrifice per turn, if you fail to provide this, she will make your followers Sick (black figure) and you'll need to heal them.

entries.title: Shamanigans
entries.description:
![header5226.png](///raw/be2/e/z/1d4e2.png)

Small game about a tiny shaman trying to juggle various actions to please multiple gods at once to keep his tiny world alive as long as possible. Fear the wrath of gods!

Use ARROWS or WASD to control the main character, pick up, use and combine various objects to see what sort of [sacrificial] combinations this game offers. 

**LEFT/RIGHT:** move around the world
**UP:** pick an object up OR use it on a nearby object
**DOWN:** put an object down

**Some guidelines:**
* Gods Kratos (blood), Loki (pranks) & Pyro (fire) like different actions and town has an opinion on its own
* Generally, it's best to slaughter, drown or burn bunnies to please gods, but there are other actions available too
* Angry gods will start bringing up curses to the world, which won't be liked by town either
* Game ends after town gets fed up by this situation.


Let me know what you think!

entries.title: Flying Slime
entries.description:
# 게임 소개(Game Introduction)

> 슬라임이 악당을 물리치는 슈팅 게임입니다. 나의 첫 LDJAM 게임입니다. 아직 이 게임은 완성하지 못했습니다. 이게임은 프로토타입입니다.현재 일부 기능만 구현하였습니다. 슬라임은 자신을 희생해서 마을 과 동료를 지켜야 합니다.

> It's a shooting game where Slime defeats the villain. This is my first LDJAM game. I haven't finished this game yet. This is a prototype. We've only implemented some of the features at this time. Slime must sacrifice himself to protect the village and its associates.

> 
## 게임 설명(Game description)
> 슬라임 이동  방향키

> 게임시작 스페이스바

> 게임 다시 시작 Y 키

> 물풍선 발사 Z 키

> Slime movement = arrow keys

> Game Start = Spacebar

> Restart the game = Y key

> Water balloon launch = Z key

## 아이템 설명(Item Description)

> 물약 = 물풍선을 얻음, 물풍선은 Z키를 사용하면 발사

> Potion = obtain a water balloon, water balloon is launched using Z key.


## 패배조건(a losing condition)

> 슬라임이 하얀유령에 닿았을때  

> When Slime touched the white ghost

## 업데이트 와 버그 수정

> v1.0 게임 다시 시작만듬

> v2.0 게임 다시 시작시 스프라이트 복사 오류 수정.

## Update and bug fixes

 > 1.0 Restart game

 > 2.0 Fix sprite copy errors when restarting the game.



![플라잉슬라임.jpg](///raw/292/02/z/1ce4a.jpg)

entries.title: God Servant
Jultomten 2
entries.description:
![ld43_2.gif](///raw/092/02/z/1b98f.gif)

The kids have been waiting all night for jultomten to appear on the roofs!
Well he's finally here, but he needs to deliver his last batch of presents before his shift is over.
Jultomten quickly realizes that these kids are getting too intrusive. His only choice is to sacrifice some of the presents and stall the kids in order to escape into the night!

Use ```arrowkeys``` to move and jump

```Z``` - Sacrifice present

```X``` - Switch present type (big or small). Small sacrifices 1 preset, big sacrifices 3.

Get to the end without the kids catching you! Try to sacrifice as few presents as possible!

Tips:
You can jump, the kids cannot. Use this to your advantage.
You can also climb just like the kids. Just move into a wall and keep holding a direction and up.

entries.title: COOLTits
entries.description:
Welcome to COOLTits, where you personate an ancient god. You need to instruct your following, your dear worshipers so they can summon you before the Inquisition tracks them down.

Gods don't speak directly to some weak mortal souls. Instead, they give them signs, and leave interpretation to them. At least it's that what you do. You have 5 rudimentary signs that you can embrace: Conflict, Diplomacy, Enthusiasm, Ruse and Apathy. Consider carefully what your cult leader has to say. Then decide what's your will. Outcome of your actions may vary though. You may lose your precious cultists, their devotion, or other resources.

![jam_screenshot.jpg](///raw/3d0/3/z/1cb1f.jpg)

We are only sure of Windows build. If you have any issues with other builds, please leave a comment.

entries.title: I Demand Blood!
entries.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Nm_GVHEzyuw

Taking the theme to the literal conclusion, you are a god who needs blood sacrifice to survive! LOTS of blood. Take matters into your own hands and drag your victims onto the altar before your time runs out.

**Controls**
- Click and Drag 
- M to mute/unmute music


**Your Sacrificial Lambs**

![sm_basic_walk01.png](///raw/71c/z/1b929.png) Just an average person. There's loads of these. Does not refill your time, but is worth at least a few points.


![sm_child_walk02.png](///raw/71c/z/1b92a.png) A child. Rarer and a more valuable sacrifice. Worth more points and adds some time to the clock

![sm_baby_walk01.png](///raw/71c/z/1b92b.png) A toddler. A very valuable sacrifice. Worth several points and adds more time to the clock than an older child does.

**Assets**
* All voice effects by me and pitched up in Audacity
* Other sound effects created in Sfxr
* Music created in BeepBox
* Sprites drawn by hand and cleaned up in Paint NET
* Background made mostly in Krita
* Game Created in Game Maker Studio 2

Game is available for both Web and Windows. Personally, I recommend the Windows version, but only because it runs a little smoother.

entries.title: Re:Call
entries.description:
///// THIS GAME IS GAMEPAD ONLY ///// HEAVY USE OF WHITE NOISE AND SOME VIBRATION /////

Re:Call is a minimalist puzzle platformer with a key focus on learning from your past, as well as thinking outside the box. The simple graphics hide a complex puzzle game, with easy to control and versatile movement, as well as interactive puzzle elements.

![2018-12-02 (2).png](///raw/2a1/z/1b90a.png)

Yeah I'm over selling it. I enjoyed making this game, it challenged me and I got to play around with stuff I don't usually explore in a LD. It was hard finding an aesthetic that worked well with the gameplay and concept, so I just went simple. Unfortunately due to the nature of the controls, (which should be explained in game but there is an attached cheatsheat), it is gamepad only. I might make a future mouse and keyboard one if I have time. The game is a bit shorter than I would have liked, and sparse in terms of audio, but that just comes down to time.

![2018-12-02 (1).png](///raw/2a1/z/1b90b.png)

Have fun!

entries.title: Murdertrain
entries.description:
**Genre:** arcade, puzzle, road rage

Choo-choo! Murdertrain a comin' for ya! To grab you by the invisible hand, put you in a cart and use you for it's unknown evil purposes! :smiling_imp:

Player's main objective is to get as far as possible. The game is infinite - see how far do you get.
The fuel is limited and the only source of it is actually the passengers. Pick them up with the mouse and put them in cart to use later. See a cart staying alone in the field? Don't hesitate - take it and attach to your (murder)train!
Low on fuel? Take one dude and throw it in train's furnace - it will heat it up a little.
Watch out for dangerous traps that blocks your way! Roadblocks can be opened with a little bit of human sacrifice - just throw one of the dudes on spikes! Mines... Well, should I still tell you how to disarm them? :wink: 

![Murdertrain acoming.png](///raw/1af/d1/z/1d61a.png)

A little sweet project will show you that any problem can be solved when **enough manpower is thrown at it**. Literally!!

## Gameplay video:
https://youtu.be/YLNo_HohK5Y

entries.title: God n' food
entries.description:
This is my first game jam ever, so Im proud of what I made in the time I had. Its not much, Ill tell ya that right now.

The game:

You have resources on all sides, the point is to make sure both sides have more then 0 of every sort and to make sure gods opinion of you stays above 0, every time you sacrifice, gods opinion raises by 50. 

You can shift recources between sides to make sure dyou have sufficient amounts of resources to sacrifice or to supply to feed amother side.

Consumption is every 15 seconds and will deplete random amounts of all resources.

Collecting happens consistently depending on the sources (I mever finished that part, theres a static amount of sources now)
Try beating this score:

![Highscore.png](///raw/708/e1/z/1b89a.png)

I run the game in 1920 x 1080 here, try 1280 x 720 if you want a better result like this:
![720.png](///raw/708/e1/z/1b89f.png)

I couldn't find found the optimal resolution. Also Im not sure If it works on all platforms, if it doesnt leave a comment please.
I hope you enjoy it. Otherwise, thanks for taking time to check out my game, even if you think its an awful game (what it probably is :P)

entries.title: Like Father, Like Son
entries.description:
![ezgif-5-98df45d30be2.gif](///raw/c70/31/z/1c813.gif)![ezgif-5-9323716355dd.gif](///raw/c70/31/z/1c819.gif)
THESIS : 

Like Father, Like Son is a game about the responsibilities of parenthood and its effect on people. It is about the sacrifice that parents make for the sake of their children. The game lasts exactly 5 minutes - You have to live your life and make your choices within that time. You are a butterfly who has the choice to explore the world, woo a mate and make babies.

This game is my perspective as an almost 30 year old single male looking at my father’s sacrifices and what is expected of me in the future. The viewpoint of the game from my perspective is an inherently cynical one. I’m not fond of the loss of freedom that comes from having kids. This may be offensive to some but that is my personal viewpoint at this point in my life. 

The game is gender neutral. There is no explicit gender coding of the main playable character and the NPCs.

Inspiration: I’m a huge fan of the mechanics as metaphor movement. This game is my love letter to Jason Rohrer’s seminal work - Passage. Other inspirations are: Loneliness, One Hour One Life and Everything.

Here is a list of intentional mechanics in the game and their corresponding meanings:
1. Strict time limit - inspired by “Passage” -the time we have on this earth is finite
2. Being bound in the nest for the first 18 years - sheltered life
Choice in mating - You can choose to explore the world instead of settling
3. Earning points is slower once you leave the nest because it gets a lot harder to work in the real world.
4. Providing for the family deducts score from self.

Here are a list of mechanics I couldn’t implement because of a lack of time :
1. If you choose to explore the world, you’ll find different flowers and the music will change based on how far you travel away from the center.
2. There will be a visual feedback on the butterfly’s wings signifying the energy of the butterfly - higher the self/family ratio - more brighter the colors
3. There should be something to say about the joy of raising a family too. I don’t understand yet how I’ll express that.
4. As the character grows older, moving about should be harder and there should be a visual feedback in the world. 
5. Sometimes you can have siblings that you have to compete with.
6. You can be born with a single parent or no parents at all.
7. You can choose to leave behind your family after marrying - signifying a betrayal.
8. You can choose to have multiple children or even remarry.
9. Probabilities of above features could be pulled from real world divorce, single parenthood and children birth rates.
10. Need to add music
11. Could be a io type game

I’m always learning new things of this amazing art form. Follow me on twitter for more of my experiments. https://twitter.com/OmeySalvi

Maya,

Substance Painter,
Photoshop,

For this Ludum Dare we had a team of five of us from Ohio University, 2 artists, 2 devs and a producer. entries.title: Cappies vs Commies
entries.description:
Pixel-art 8-bit sound remake of the classic Chinese Game of Go on a 5x5 grid.

## How to play

1. Build a base in an empty place.
1. Pass the computer to the other player.
1. To score, surround the biggest territory.
1. To destroy, surround the enemy base.
1. More detailed [rules of Go.](https://senseis.xmp.net/?BasicRulesOfGo)
1. There is no AI to the scoring, so if you want the score to be accurate, capture all the dead pieces before ending.

## Credits

- Art: Toby Hefflin
- Music: Cole Masaitis
- Sound Effects: Jason Denney                                                                                     
- Engineering: Ethan Kennerly
- Host: GluPlay, creator of Cooking Dash
- Playtesters: Jerome Byrne, Shine Garg

### Tools

- [GoSharp](https://github.com/paviad/GoSharp) by Aviad Pineles

entries.title: In a Land of Behemoths
entries.description:
This is an RPG game, developed using RPG maker VX Ace, with story elements involving sacrifice and (literal) growth. The core goal of the game is to defeat the evil behemoth king. This is done by absorbing enemies, collecting and using their life energy to increase in size until you are large enough to fight the king directly. Once you increase in size smaller enemies won't supply further life essence; you can effortlessly overpower and absorb them to heal yourself but you will need to fight behemoths of your own size to continue growing. Naturally you aren't immune to the laws of nature either; you stand no chance against behemoths larger than you, who are more than happy to absorb you for sustinance.

Battles are turn-based in traditional RPG style, with an on-attack quick-time event allowing the 0layer to dull an enemy blow or bolster their own attacks and spells. Enemies are absorbed as they fall mod-battle, meaning against tougher groups of enemies the player can harvest life essence and treasures off an enemy before swiftly retreating from the fight. On the other hand, defeating all enemies will reward the player additional life essence, with the amount increasing based on the number of enemies faced.

The game is aimed to be story-focused and driven, with game mechanics supplimenting the narrative. Without spoilers, the gams starts with a necessary sacrifice that plays a persisting role in how this story plays out.

entries.title: Jumpman Skill Builder
entries.description:
*** Build your skills as a Jumpman ***

The game is multiplayer "obby" (what the kids call an obstacle course). Plenty of sacrifices will be made if you hope to make it to the end of the course!


This game is built using roblox, and requires the roblox app (and creating a roblox account) to play. I used this jam to learn more about roblox so I can help my daughter make things. Roblox is super easy to get going with, it really eliminates the barrier to entry to making multiplayer games. 

My plan was to create multiple courses to complete, and have players on one course falling to their deaths to help players on the other course... but ran out of time.
